coronation soueraigne lord king iames lord baron sherland earle montgomery knight noble order garter c philosopher zeno right honourable worthily esteemed lord demaunded time meanes man might attaine happinesse made answere resorting dead hauing familiar conuersation intimating thereby reading ancient moderne history endeauouring learne good instruction haue bene obserued predecessor question also mooued great king ptolomy one learned wise interpreter occasion king exercise himselfe whereto thus hee replyed know thing formerly haue bin done read bookes matter offer themselues dayly fittest instant affaire lastly seeking thing whatsoeuer make kingdomes preseruation correction euill manner example vpon good warrantable ground noble lord beside many nature omit auoide prolixity dare boldly affirme exercised reading history although seeme yong yeares slenderly instructed worldly matter yet grauity grayheaded age speaketh maturely meane admiration common vulgar iudgement contrariwise ignorant thing done past themselues continue still estate child able speake behaue themselues otherwise euen within bound natiue country respect knowledge manly capacity wellseeming dumbe image due consideration precedent allegation vppon command also noble encouragement honour time time volume singular exquisite history varied many exact nature appeareth world view vnder noble patronage defence safely sheelded foule mouthed slander detraction easily throwne vpon best deseruing labour know worthy lord many haue long since bene published stolne first originall author yet beautified sweete stile elocution phrase neither sauouring singular morall application full scope ayme discouering vice vgly deformity make mortall enemy sacred vertues shine clearer set downe compared euery true vpright iudgement obseruing course wellcarried nouels shall plainly perceiue spare made reproofe degree whatsoeuer sin embraced grace neglected iust deseruing shame punishment thereon inflticted others may warned example imitation witty aesope reciteth fable graceth iudicious morall application many worthy writer haue done like instance let heere insert one poore man hauing pike staffe shoulder trauailing thorow countrey village great mastiue curre ran mainly hardly could defend himselfe length chance kill dogge owner immediately apprehending bringing iudge alledged slaine seruant defended life house good therefore challenged satisfaction iudge leaning fauour plaintiffe friend neighbor familiar iustice equity cause reprooued poore fellow somwhat sharpely peremptorily commanded make satisfaction el would commit prison iniustice replyed poore man kilde dogge defence mine owne life deserueth much better respect million curres sirra sirra saide iudge haue turned end staffe pike dogges life beene saued owne danger true sir quoth fellow dog would haue turnd taile bit mee teeth parted quietly know honor truly iudicious selfe make morall allusion defence poore paine acceptation protection humble submission selfe vttermost endeauours bee alwayes ready seruice author prologue lord lady gentlewoman matter humanity take compassion afflicted although fitting towards generall yet tied bond duty hauing already stood neede comfort therfore needfully deserue enioy among euer necessity found precious therby receiued small contentment one verie yongest yeeres euen vntill instant mine affection becam extraordinarily enflamed place high noble perhaps beseemed humble condition albeit way distasted iudgement discreete came truly knowledge vnderstanding yet indeed painfull endure regard cruelty deerely loued want better gouernment mine owne carriage altogether swayed rash peeuish passion made affliction offensiue mee either wisedome allowed suited priuate particular counsell misery meane comfort good aduice worthy friend many sound singular perswasions wrought deliberate alteration onely preserued life extreame perill also gaue conclusion ro inconsiderate loue precedent refractarie carriage deliberation counsell euident shame whatsoeuer perill ensue thereon could manner contradict beganne asswage selfe time bestowing onely former freedome deliuering likewise infinite perplexity acknowledgement good turnes courtesy receiued poore opinion vertue among highly bee commended contrary also condemned shewe selfe ingratefull determined soone saw selfe absolute liberty exchange great benefit bestowne mee minister mitigation say releeued owne better vnderstanding blessednesse fortune may defend necessity rather truly stand need although comfort may way auaile common needie yet methinkes greefe greatest calamity insulteth ought paine soundly imployed grauest instruction aduise wholly administred deny much conuenient commisserate distresse lady gentlewoman able vnto owne house nouell three yong gentleman brother hauing spent landes possession vainly became poore nephew falling almost desperate condition became acquainted abbot hee afterward found king england daughter made husband marriage recompencing vnckles loss seating good estate nouell landolpho ruffolo falling pouerty became pirate sea beeing taken genewayes hardly escaped drowning yet neuerthelesse vpon little chest coffer full rich iewels beeing carried thereon corfu well entertained good woman afterward returned richly home owne house nouell andrea de piero trauelling perouse vnto naples buy horse space one night surprized three admirable accident fortunately escaped rich ring returned home owne house nouell madame beritola caracalla found island two goates hauing lost two son thence trauailed lunigiana one sonnes became seruant lord therof ound somewhat ouerfamiliar maisters daughter therefore caused imprisoned afterward country sicily rebelled king charles aforesaid sonne chanced known mother married master daughter brother found likewise returned great estate credite nouell soldane babylon sent one daughter ioyned marriage king cholcos diuers accident space foure yeares happened custodie nine men sundry place length restored backe father went said king cholcos maide first intended wife nouell count dangiers falsely accused banished france left two child england diuers place returning afterward vnknowne thorough scotland hee found aduanced vnto great dignity repairing habit seruitor king fraunce army innocency made publikely knowen reseated former honorable degree nouell bernardo merchant geneway deceiued another merchant named ambrosio lost great part good commanding innocent wife murthered escaped habit man became seruant soldan deceiuer found last copassed mean husband bernardo came alexandria due punishment inflicted false deceiuer resumed garment againe woman returned home husband geneway nouell pagamino da monaco rouing pyrate feas caried away faire wife signieur ricciardo di chi zica vnderstanding shee went th ther falling friendship pagamino demanded wife wherto yeelded prouided would willingly go away shee denied part thence husband ricciardo dying shee became wife pagamino third day gouerned madame neiphila nouell massetto di lamporechio counterfetting himselfe dumbe became gardiner monastery nun familiar conuersation nouell querry stable belonging agilulffo k lombard found meanes accesse queenes bedde without knowledge consent beeing secretly discouered king party knowne hee gaue marke shearing haire meere conceite sorow nouell beautifull yong virgin named andreana became enamored young gentleman called gabriello conference together shee declared dreame another vnto whereupon gabriello fell sodainly dead chambermaid apprehended officer ging vnto seigneury carrying gabriello lay owne doore potestate offering violence virgin resisting vertuously came vnderstanding father approued innocence daughter compassed deliuerance afterward wearie worldly felicity entred religion became nun nouell faire simonida affecting pasquino walking pleasant garden fortuned pasquino rubbed teeth leafe sage immediately fell downe dead simonida brought bench iustice charged death pasquino rubbed teeth likewise one leaues sage declaring saw thereon dyed also manner nouell ieronimo affecting yong mayden named syluestra constrained earnest importunity mother take iourney paris returne home thence againe found loue siluestra maried secret meanes got entrance house dyed vpon bed lying afterward body caried vnto church receiue buriall shee likewise died instantly vpon coarse nouell messer guiglielmo rossiglione hauing slaine messer guiglielmo guardastagno imagined loue wife gaue hart eat knowing himselfe end table decameron containing hundred pleasant novelles wherein demonstration made author vpon occasion hapned person shall speake heereafter thus meete together make queint narration nouels hee declareth vnto first begin deuise conferre vnder gouernment madam pampinea matter may pleasing induction author following discourse gracious lady often consider selfe obserue respectiuely vniuersally hurtfull beheld otherwise came knowledge desire may dreadfull hinder proceeding reading none looke thereon sighes teares could rather fearefull beginning seeme high steepy hil appeares attempt trauell farre foote ascending difficulty come afterward walk vpon goodly euen plaine causeth contentment attaining thereto hard painfull euen pleasure cut griefe anguish sorrowes cease ioyes sweete happie arriuing breefe mollestation briefe say contained within small compasse writing immediately followeth sweete pleasant taste pleasure whereof made promise peraduenture could bee expected beginning promise stoode thereunto engaged indeed could wel haue conueyed center desire way rude rocky passage would gladly haue done without narration could demonstrate occasion wherefore matter hapned shall reade ensuing discourse must set downe euen constrained thereto meere necessity writing manner yeare blessed sauiours incarnation memorable mortality happened excellent city farre beyond rest italy plague operation superiour body rather enormous iniquity iust anger god sent vpon v mortal yeeres tooke beginning easterne partes sweeping thence innumerable quantity liuing soules extending selfe afterward place place westward vntill seized said city neither humane skill prouidence could vse preuention notwithstanding cleansed many annoyance diligent officer thereto deputed besides prohibition sickly person enterance possible prouision dayly vsed conseruation health incessant prayer supplication deuoute people asswaging dangerous sicknesse beginning yeare also began strange manner appeared diuers admirable effect yet done east country lord lady touched therewith manifest signes incuitable death followed thereon bleeding nose began yong child male female either vnder armpit groine certaine swelling bignesse apple others like egge diuers greater lesser vulgar language termed botch byle short time two infected part grown mortiferous would disperse abroad indifferently part body whereupon qualitie disease shew selfe blacke blew spottes would appeare armes many others thighes euerie part else body great others small thicke byle beginning assured signe neere approaching death prooued spot likewise curing sicknesse seemed physitians counsell vertue medicine application else could yeeld remedy rather plainely appeared either nature disease would endure ignorance physitians could comprehend whence cause prooceeded consequent resolution determined moreouer beside number skilfull art many woman men without euer hauing knowledge physicke became physitians onely healed wellneere dyed within three dayes saide signes seene sooner others later commonly without either feauer accident pestilence yet farre greater power violence onely healthfull person speaking sicke comming see ayring cloathes kindnesse comfort occasion ensuing death touching garment foode whereon sicke person fed thing else vsed seruice seemed transferre disease sicke sound rare miraculous manner among matter maruell let tell one thing eye many well mine owne seene hardly could perswaded write much lesse beleeue albeit man good credit report say quality contagious pestilence onely efficacy taking catching one another either men woman extended euen apparant view many cloathes thing else wherein one died disease toucht lyen beast farre kind quality man onely contaminate infect said beast dogge cat also died soone mine owne eye formerly haue said among diuers one day euident experience hereof poore ragged cloathes linnen wollen torne wretched body dead disease hurled open streete two swine going according naturall inclination seeking foode euery dunghill tossed tumbled cloathes snout rubbing head likewise vppon immediately turning twice thrice fell downe dead saide cloathes fully infected contagion accident like far greater begat diuers feares imagination beheld tending inhumane vncharitable end namely flie thence sicke touching thing meanes thought health safely warranted considered themselues liuing soberly abstinence superfluity would sufficient resistance hurtfull accident combining themselues sociable manner liued separatist company shut vp house sicke body neere security vsed delicate viand excellent wine auoiding luxurie refusing speech one another looking forth windowes heare cry dying people see coarses carried buriall hauing musicall instrument liued possible pleasure others contrary opinion auouched physicke certaine disease desperate drinke hard merry among themselues singing continually walking euery satisfying appetite whatsoeuer desired laughing mocking euery mournefull accident vowed spend day night would goe one tauerne another liuing without rule measure might easilie doe euery one liue longer world euen forsaken thing meanes whereof part house become common stranger might doe like pleased aduenture euen boldly lord owner without let contradiction yet beastly behauiour wise enough shun much might weake sickly misery affliction city venerable authority lawes well diuine humane euen destroyed want awefull minister dead lying sicke rest else liued solitary great necessity seruants attendant could execute office whereby lawfull euery one doe listed betweene two rehearsed extremity life moderate temper daintily dieted first drinking dissolutely second vsed thing sufficient appetite without shutting vp themselues walked abroade carrying sweete nosegayes flower hand others odoriferous herbes others diuers kind spicery holding nose thinking comfortable braine ayre seemed much infected many men woman forsooke city owne house parent kindred friend good flying men dwelling elsewhere wrath god punishing sinnes men plague would fall heauily vpon none enclosed within city wals else perswading themselues one left aliue finall ending thing come albeit person diuersity opinion died vndoubtedly escape many among becomming sicke making generall example flight folly among could stirre bed languished perplexedly let v omit one citizen fled another one neighbour care another parent kinred neuer visiting vtterly forsaken side tribulation pierced heart men dreadfull terrour one brother forsooke another vnkle nephew sister brother wife husband nay matter much greater almost incredible father mother fled away owne child euen way appertained regard whereof could otherwise countlesse multitude men woman fell sicke finding charity among friend except subiected auarice seruants attended constrainedly great vnreasonable wage yet attendant found men woman base condition also groser vnderstanding neuer serued necessity indeed way else imployed giue sicke person thing called awaite houre death performance seruices oftentimes gaine lost owne liues extreame calamity sicke thus forsaken neighbor kinred friend standing also need seruants custome came vp among neuer heard woman noble young faire soeuer shee falling sicke shee must necessity haue man attend young otherwise respect shame modesty way preuailing part body must discouered like vrgency seene woman whereon ensued afterward vpon party healing recouery occasion dishonesty many modestly curious refused disgracefull attending chusing rather die helpe healed regard whereof well want conuenient remedy sicke meanes could attain vnto also violence contagion multitude died night day great dreadfull sight behold much heare spoken meere necessity among remained liuing begat new behauiours quite contrary beene former time frequently vsed among city inhabitant custome precedent dayes againe woman kinred neighbour friend would meete together deceased party house neerest alliance expresse heart sorrow friend losse thus would assemble doore many best cittizens kindred according quality deceased clergy met likewise dead body carried comely manner men shoulder funerall pompe torchlight singing church appointed deceased seemely order fury pestilence began encrease like manner altogether ceased new customes came place onely people died without hauing woman infinite also past life hauing witnesse manner departed none deliuer outward shew sorrow grieuing insteed thereof diuers declared idle ioy reioycing vse soone learned immodest woman hauing put al feminine compassion yea regard owne welfare also would accompany body graue neighbour although beene honourable cittizen onely meanest kinde people grauemakers coffinbearers like seruices onely money beere mounted shoulder haste would runne away perhaps church appointed dead neerest hand hauing foure sixe poore priest following light light silliest short seruice said buriall body vnreuerently throwne first open graue found pittifull misery poore people diuers better condition lamentable behold greater number vnder hope healing compelled pouerty kept still within house weake faint thousand falling sick daily hauing helpe succoured way foode physicke died none escaping great store died streetes day night many beside although died house yet first made knowne neighbour liues perished rather noysome smell dead putrified body violence disease themselues rest dying manner euery neighbour obserued one course behauiour moued thereto lesse feare smell corruption dead body harme charitable respect dead themselues could assisted bearer coarses wer able procure wold hale body alreadie dead house laying doores passed especially morning might see lying meane number afterward bieres brought thither might haue helpe bieres glad lay table bieres haue bin obserued onely charged two three dead body many time seene also wife husband two three brother together yea father mother haue thus beene carried along graue vpon one biere moreouer oftentimes hath bene seene two priest went one crosse fetch body would follow behind three foure bearer bieres priest intended buriall one bodie sixe eight haue made vp aduantage yet none attended seemly company light teares least decencie plainly appeared verie like account made men woman bene dogges swine wherein might manifestly bee noted naturall course thing could shewe wise rare little losse wit patient support misery misfortune euen greatest height onely wise might learne also th verie simplest people sort alwaies prepared infelicity whatsoeuer hallowed ground could suffice great multitude dead body daily brought euery church city euery houre day neither could body haue proper place buriall according ancient custome wherfore church churchyard filled constrained make vse great deepe ditch wherein buried hundred ranking dead body along graues merchandizes laide along ship couering small quantity earth filled last vp whole ditch brim would wander euerie particularity concerning misery happening citie tell extremity running manner haue heard little lesse spare made village round wherein setting aside enclosed castle filled like small city poore labourer husbandman whole family dyed miserably outhouse yea open fieldes also without assistance physicke helpe seruants likewise highwayes ploughed landes day night indifferently yet men like brute beast meanes whereof became lazie slothfull daily endeuours euen like citizen minding medling wonted affaire awaiting death euery houre imployed paine caring way themselues cattle gathering fruit earth accustomed labour rather wasted consumed euen instant sustenance whereupon fell ox ass sheepe goates swine pullen yea verie dogges truest faithfullest seruants men beaten banished house went wildly wandring abroad field corne grew still ground without gathering much reapt cut many foresaid beast endued reason pastured themselues day time would returne full fed night home house without gouernment heardsmen many faire palace many goodly house many noble habitation filled family lord lady seene emptie without one dwelling except silly seruant many kindred worthy memory many great inheritance plenty rich left without true successours many good men many woorthy woman many valiant comely yong men none galen h ppocrates aesculapius liuing could haue bene reputed way vnhealthfull seene dine morning parent friend familiar confederate went sup another world predecessor meane breach braine make repetition many misery wherefore willing part easily may say citie case voide inhabitant came passe afterward vnderstoode good credite venerable church marie la neufue tuesday morning person hearing diuine seruice mourning habit season required returned thence seuen discreet yong gentlewoman allyed together either friendship neighborhood parentage among entred yeares exceeded eight twenty yongest lesse eighteene noble descent faire forme adorned exquisite behauiour gracious modesty name could report iust occasion forbid regard occasion following related time heereafter shall taxe reproofe lawes pleasure straited adayes matter reucaled time onely yeares many much riper neither likewise minister matter rash heades ouerreadie censuring commendable life way impaire honestie lady idle detracting speech therefore end saith may comprehended without confusion purpose stile name wholly agreeing part conformable quality first aged name pampinea second fiametta third philamena fourth aemilia fift lauretta sixt neiphila last terme without occasion elissa eliza assembled corner church deliberation formerly appointed meerely accident sitting round ring diuers sigh seuerally deliuered conferred sundry matter answerable sad qualitie time vvithin madam pampinea began manner faire lady may doubt well haue often heard iniury offered one make vse owne right thing naturall euerie one borne world aide conserue defend life long shee right hath bene powerfully permitted although hath sometimes happened defend themselues men haue beene slaine without offence yet lawes haue allowed whose solicitude lieth best liuing mortal much honest iust v euery welldisposed person seeke without wronging practise remedy wee conseruation liues well consider haue heere done morning many already past remembring withall likewise proper conuenient v conceiue may like euerie one v hath due respect selfe meruaile rather much amazed knowing none v depriued woman best iudgement wee seeke remedy selues euery one among v ought reason feare heere meete remaine seemeth mee manner would witness dead body rest graues else listen religious sister dwelling whose number wellneere come none sing seruice houres ought else acquaint commers hither mourning habites quality quantitie heart misery part hence meete none dead body sicke person transported one place another else see running thorow city offensiue fury authoritie publike lawes banished hence onely bad bru sh behauiour contempt lawes know executor dead sicke lamentable spectacle present themselues v base rascality citie fatted blood tearme themselues grauemakers meere contemptible mockerie v mounted horsebacke gallopping euerie reproaching v loss misfortune lewd dishonest song hear nothing el dead lie dying heere hand wringing euerie pittifull complaining returne home house know whether case bee answerable mine finde none family onely poore waiting chambermaide great feares verie haire head declareth amazement wheresoeuer go sit downe thinkes see ghostes shadowes deceased friend louely lookes wont behold horrid dreadfull regard newly stolne vpon know respect heere elsewhere home house methinkes alwaies ill much mine owne opinion bodie hauing meanes place retirement haue none remaine heere onely moreouer haue often heard said tarrying departing distinction made thing honest dishonest onely appetite serued alone company day night whatsoeuer appetite desireth secular person onely recluse shut vp within monastery breaking lawes obedience addicted pleasure flesh become lasciuious dissolute making world beleeue whatsoeuer conuenient woman way vnbeseeming thinking manner escape manifestlie maketh shew selfe stay whereon dreame respectlesse health rest citizen repute selues lesse precious beleeue life linked body stronger chaines others therefore feare thing hath power offend v wee erre therein deceiued brutishnesse v wee vrge beleefe often wee call minde many gallant yong men woman haue beene deuoured cruell pestilence wee may euidently obserue contrary argument wherefore end ouerscrupulous carelesse fall danger whence would perhaps canot recouer selues meanes thinke meete iudgement therein shall iumpe mine v least doe diuers v haue done yet daily endeauour doe shunning death honest example make retreate countrey house wherewith v sufficiently furnished thereto delight selues best may yet without transgressing act limit reason shall heare pretty bird sweetly singing see hilles plaines verdantly flourishing corne twaning field like billowes sea infinite store goodly tree heauens fairely open v behold although iustly displeased yet denie v better beauty gaze walles city emptied inhabitant offoord v moreouer ayre much fresh cleere generally farre greater abundance thing whatsoeuer needefull time preseruation health lesse offence mollestation wee find although countrey people die well heere citizen doe griefe notwithstanding much lesse house dweller rare comparison city beside well obserue wee forsake particular person rather wee may tearme selues forsaken regard husband kinred friend either dying flying dead haue left v alone great affliction euen way belonging vnto therefore following counsell wee cannot fall reprehension whereas neglect refuse danger distresse death perhaps may ensue thereon wherefore thinke good would allow well done take waiting woman thing needfull v day betake selues one place morrow another taking pleasure recreation sweete season liberally bestoweth v manner may remaine till see death otherwise preuent v ende gracious heauens haue reserued v would haue also consider lesse seemely v part hence honestly great number woman remaine immodestly lady gentlewoman hauing heard madam pampinea onely commended counsell desiring also put execution already particularly consulted themselues mean might instantly depart thence neuerthelesse madam philomena wise spake thus albeit faire lady case propounded madam pampinea hath beene wel deliuered yet reason v rush ouerready doe remember woman one among v childish may consider wee shall assembled together without prouidence conduct man hardly gouerne selues fraile offensiue suspicious weake spirited fearefull regard imperfection greatly doubt haue better direction owne society sooner dissolue selfe perchance lesse honour v neuer begunne therefore shall expedient v prouide wee proceede madam elissa hereon thus replied true men chiefe head woman without order sildome time doe matter sort commendable ende meanes shal make men know well enough part friend dead liuing dispearsed others diuers place company haue knowledge accept stranger would seeme inconuenient wherefore haue care health wee respectiue withall ordering intention wheresoeuer wee aime pleasure contentment reproofe scandall may meanes pursue v discourse thus held among lady three young gentleman came forth church yet young youngest attained fiue twenty yeeres neither malice time losse friend kinred fearefull conceit themselues power quench affection perhaps might little coole regard queazy season one called himselfe pamphilus second philostratus last dioneus affable well conditioned walked abroade greater comfort time tribulation trie could meete faire friend happily might three among seauen rest kinne vnto one degree sooner lady espyed met also aduantage whereupon madam pampinea amiably smiling saide see graciously fortune fauourable beginning presenting eye three wise worthy young gentleman gladly guide seruants doe disdaine office madam neiphila beganne immediatly blush one loue company saide good madam pampinea take heed say mine owne knowledge nothing spoken good thinke absolutely sufficient farre greater employment intended well worthy keepe company onely v faire precious esteeme appeareth plainely enough beare affection among v feare wee make motion dishonour reproofe may ensue thereby yet without blame either v nothing answered madam philomena let mee liue honestly conscience checke crime speake contrary god truth shal enter armes wish willing come wee bid welcome truly madam pampinea saide wee may well hope fortune bee furtherous purposed iourney lady hearing speake manner onely silent themselues one accord consent saide well done call acquaint intention entreating company pleasant voyage whereupon without word madam pampinea mounting feete one three kinsman went towards stood respectiuely obseruing pleasing countenance giuing gracious salutation declared deliberation desiring behalfe rest brotherly modest minde would vouchsafe beare company gentleman imagined first apprehension spoken mockage better perceiued word tended solemne earnest made answer heartily ready doe seruice without delaying parted thence tooke order aptest furnishing withall conuenient necessary sent word place first appointment morrow wednesday breake day lady certaine attending gentlewoman three gentleman hauing three seruants waite left city beginne iourney hauing trauelled league distance arriued place first purpose stay seated little hill distant side high way plentifully stored faire spreading tree affoording meane delight eye top stood stately pallace hauing large spacious court middest round engirt gallery hals chamber euery one separate alone themselues beautified picture admirable cunning want garden meadowes pleasant walkes welles spring faire running water encompassed branching vine fitter curious quaffing bibbers woman sober singularly modest pallace company found fully fitted prepared beddes chamber made daintily ordered thickly strewed variety flowres could giue greater contentment dioneus aboue pleasant young gallant full infinite witty conceit saide wit faire lady hath better guided v hither prouidence know haue determined dispose care mine owne left city gate came thence therefore let resolution spend time smile singing meane may fittest agree dignity else giue leaue goe seeke sorrowes againe remaine discontented desolate city madam pampinea hauing like manner shaken sorrowes deliuering modest bashfull smile replied manner dioneus well haue spoken fit liue merrily occasion made v forsake sicke sad citie thing without meane measure subiect long continuance began motion whereby society thus assembled ayme long lasting thereof doe hold conuenient wee agree haue one chiefe commaunder among v care prouidence consist direction merriment performing honour obedience party patrone sole gouernour euery one may feele burthen sollicitude also pleasure commaunding consequently haue sensible taste whereby enuie may arise side could wish one v day onely feele burthen honour person aduanced shall receiue election v succeede hath dayes dominion party thought fit succession must named soone night approacheth eminencie according shall please hee may order dispose long time rule shall last also place manner best may continue delight word highly pleasing generall voyce madame pampinea chosen queene first day whereupon madame philomena ranne presently baytree often heard honour belonged branch worthy honour rightfully crowned plucking diuers branch made apparant honourable chaplet placing generall consent vpon head long company continued manifested rest signall dominion royall greatnesse madame pampinea thus made queene commanded publique silence causing gentleman three seruants waiting woman also foure number brought thus shee began giue first example whereby proceeding good better company may liue order pleasure acceptable without shame create parmeno seruant dioneus maister houshold hee taking care charge ayne whatsoeuer appertaineth hall seruice appoint also silisco seruant pamphilus shall dispencer treasurer performing parmeno shall commaund tindaro serue groome chamber philostratus maister two fellowes impeached office cannot present misia chambermaid licisca belonging philomena shall serue continually kitchin diligently make ready vyands shall deliuered parmeno chimera waytingwoman lauretta stratilia appertaining fiammetta shall haue charge gouernement lady chamber preparing place shall present moreouer commaund euery one desire deserue grace wheresoeuer goe come whatsoeuer heare see especially respect bring v tydings shee summarily deliuered order much commended euery one shee arose fearefully saying heere wee haue garden orchard meadowes place sufficient pleasure euery one may sport recreate themselues soone ninth houre striketh meete againe dine coole shade iocund company hauing receiued licence queene disport themselues gentleman walked lady goodly garden making chaplet nosegayes diuers flower singing silently themselues spent time limitted queene returned house found parmeno effectually executed office entred hall saw table couered delicate white naperie glass looking like siluer transparantly cleare roome beside streamed flame iuniper queene rest washed according parmeno gaue order euery one seated table vyands delicately drest serued excellent wine plentifully deliuered none attending three seruants little loud tabletalke passing among dinner ended table withdrawne lady gentleman likewise skilfull singing dauncing playing instrument artificially queene commaunded diuers instrument brought gaue charge dioneus tooke lute fiammetta violl de gamba began play excellent daunce whereupon queene rest lady two young gentleman hauing sent attending seruants dinner paced foorth daunce maiestically daunce ended sung sundry excellent canzonets outwearing time vntill queene commaunded rest houre necessarily require gentleman hauing chamber farre seuered lady curiously strewed flower bed adorned exquisite manner lady iote inferiour silence night bestowed sweet rest morning queene rest risen accounting ouermuch sleepe hurtfull walked abroade goodly meadowe grasse grew verdantly beames sunne heated ouerviolently shade faire spreading tree gaue temperate calmenesse coole gentle wind fanning sweet breath pleasingly among set downe round ring queene middest appointed place eminencie spake manner see faire company sunne highly mounted heate elsewhere extreme v therfore fittest refuge aire coole delicate acceptable folly well worthie reprehension walke speede worse heere table card chesse disposition may addicted mine aduice might passe currant would admit none exercise troublesome play looke could rather wish quaint discourse might passe among v tale fable related one vrge attention rest wearing warmth day one prety nouell wil draw another vntil sun lower declined heates extremity diminished solace selues place mind shal seeme conuenient therefore haue sayde acceptable purposing follow course pleasure let appeare immediate answer til euening think deuise exercise commodious v lady gentleman allowed motion spend time telling pleasant tale whereupon queene saide seeing haue approoued mine aduice grant free permission first day euery one shall relate best pleasing turning selfe pamphilus seated right hand gaue fauour one nouels begin recreation daring deny perceiuing generall attention prepared thus began messire chappelet du prat making false confession beguyled holy religious man dyed hauing life time bene verie bad man death reputed saint called chappelet first nouell wherein contained hard thing distinguish goodnesse hypocrisie vnder shadow holinesse wickednes one man may deceiue many matter conuenient deare lady man ought begin whatsoeuer doth great glorious name creator thinges wherefore seeing man appointed begin inuention discoursing nouelties intend begin also one wonderfull workes end beeing heard hope may remaine thing onely permanent name euer praised v nothing certaine euen temporall thing mortall transitory themselues full sorrow paine anguish subiected infinite danger manner liue mingled among seeming part cannot without error continue defend selues god especiall grace fauour giue v strength good vnderstanding power may beleeue either descendeth v liueth v merites owne onely gracious benignity mooued neuerthelesse entreated intercession mortal hauing diligently obserued commandements eternall blessednes aduocates procurator informed experience frailty wee present prayer presence great iudge himselfe obtaining thing wisedome knoweth expedient v well may credit goodnesse fully enclined towards v continuall bounty liberality subtilty mortal eye reach secret diuine thought sometimes therefore may beguiled opinion electing intercessor high maiesty perhaps farre driuen perpetuall exile vnworthy appeare glorious presence nothing hidden regardeth sincerity prayeth ignorant deuotion committed trust heedlesse intercessor prayer haue alwaies gracious acceptation sight manifestly appeare nouell intend relate manifestly say iudgement god according ahprehension men one named musciatto francesi beeing rich great merchant france become knight preparing go tuscany monsieur charles without land brother king france vvas desired incited come thither pope boniface foud affaire greatly intricated oftentimes matter merchant fall bee hardly hee sodainly vnintangle without referring charge diuers person tooke indifferent good order onely remained doubtfull might sufficiently leaue recouer debt among many burgundians rather care herein knew burgundians people badde nature rioter brablers full calumny without faithfulnesse could bethinke himselfe man wicked soeuer might repose trust meete lewdnesse hauing long examined thought vpon point last hee remembred one master chappelet du prat ofttimes resorted house paris man little stature yet handsom enough french knowing word chappelet might mean esteeming called rather tongue chappell imagined regard small stature termed chappelet chappell name chappelet euery known none acknowledged chappel master chappelet good commendable life notarie held high disdaine contractes although made found without falshoode looke many soeuer hee dealt withall would vrged required thereto offering paine trauaile nothing requited otherwise money prooued bee much larger recompencing returned farre greater benefit hee tooke onely pleasure world beare false witnesse hee thereto entreated oftentimes hee requested likewise time great trust beleefe giuen oath making care conscience periured greatly aduantaged himselfe law suite regard many matter relyed vpon oath deliuering truth according knowledge delighted beyond measure addicted best study cause enmity scandal kindred friend person agreeing well together mischiefe could procure kind much pleasure delight tooke therein called kil one villanous deede neuer would make deniall go willingly diuers time wel knowen many cruelly beaten ye slainc hand hee horrible blasphemer god saint vpon least occasion addicted choller man could neuer would frequent church basely contemned sacrament religious rite therein administred accounting vile vnprofitable thing voluntarily would visit tauernes place dishonest accesse continually pleasing vnto satisfie lust inordinate lubricitie hee would steale publike priuate euen conscience giuen nature great glutton drunkarde euen till able take also continuall gamester carrier false dice cheate verie best friendes waste time extent word may suffice say neuer worse man borne whose wickednesse long time supported fauour power authoritie monsieur musciatto whose ke many wrong iniuries patiently endured well priuate person hee would abuse notoriously others court beeweene made difference vile dealing master chappelet thus remembred musciatto well knew life behauiour perfectly perswaded himselfe man apt respect meete treachery burgundians whereupon hauing sent thus beganne chappelet thou knowest wholly retreate selfe hence hauing affaire among burgundians men full wickednesse deceite bethinke selfe meeter man chappelet recouer debt due among falleth well thou art hindered businesse thou wilt vndergoe office procure thee fauourable letter court giue thee reasonable portion thou recouerest master chappelet seeing himselfe idle greedy worldly good considering mounsieur musciatto beene alwayes best buckler depart thence without dreaming matter constrained thereto necessity set downe resolution answered hee would gladly doe hauing made agreement together receiued musciatto expresse procuration also king gracious letter musciatto gone iourneyto borgogna saith italian master chappelet went dijon vnknowne well neere quite naturall disposition beganne benignely graciously recouering debt due course tooke rather haue feeling ende lodged house two florentine brother liued monies vsance mounsieur musciattoes sake vsing honour respect fortuned fell sicke two brother sent physicions attend allowing seruants diligent making spare thing gaue best likelyhood restoring health paine proued purpose honest man growne aged hauing liued life time disordredly fell day day according physicions iudgement bad worse way appeared death whereat brother greatly greeued vpon day neere chamber sicke man lay entred communication shall doe quoth one man much hindered send away sicke shall greatly blamed thereby manifest note weake wisedome people knowing first gaue entertainement haue allowed honest physical attendance hauing way iniuried offended v let suddenly expulsed house sicke death way credit side consider also hath bin badde man make confession thereof neither receiue blessed sacrament church dying without confession church wil accept body must buried prophane ground like dogge yet would confesse himselfe sinnes many monstrous like case also may happen priest religious person absolue absolued must cast ditch pit people towne well regard account carry heere appeareth little pleasing daily pursued worst word also coueting spoile ouerthrow vpon accident cry mutiny v beholde lombard dog receiued church suffer liue heere among v furious madnesse wil come vpon v house peraduenture contented robbing v good liues remaine mercy danger sort soeuer happen man dying heere must need banefull v master chappelet haue formerly saide lodged neere place thus conferred hauing subtle attention oftentimes see sicke person bee possessed withall heard speech spoken causing called vnto thus hee spake would haue way doubtfull neither shold receiue least damage haue heard haue said certaine happen according word matter fall conceite minded deale otherwise haue committed many offence lord god vvhole current life intend one action hour death trust make amends procure therefore pray holy religious man found bee one may come vnto referre case deale sort selfe shall well way discontented two brother although great hope speech went yet monastery grayfriars requested one holy learned man might come heare confession lombard lay verie weake sicke house one granted vnto beeing aged religious frier great read master sacred scripture venerable person beeing good sanctified life citizen held great respect esteem went house come vp chamber wher master chappelet lay seated downe beganne first comfort louingly demanding also howe many time bin confession whereto master chappelet neuer bin shriuen life time thus replied holy father alwayes vsed common custome bee confessed least euery weeke albeit sometimes much often true faln sicknesse eight dayes since haue bene confest violent hath bene extremity weaknesse sonne answered good old man thou hast done well keep thee still hereafter minde plainly perceiue seeing thou hast often confessed thy selfe shall take lesse labour vrging question thee master chappelet replied say good father albeit haue bene oftentimes confessed yet willing make generall confession euen sinnes comming remembrance day birth vntil instant houre shrift therefore intreate holy father make particular demand euery thing euen neuer bene confessed al make respect sicknesse rather offensiue mine owne flesh fauoring allowing ease hazard perdition soule redeemer bought precious price word highly pleasing holy frier seemed argument good conscience wherefore hee much commended forwardnesse began demand neuer offended woman whereunto master chappelet breathing foorth great sigh answered holy father halfe ashamed tell truth case fearing least sinne vaineglory whereto confessor replyed speake boldly sonne feare telling truth confession otherwise man neuer sinne sayde maister chappelet father seeing giue good assurance wil resolue faithfully heerein true virginman matter euen issued forth mother wombe sonne quoth frier happie blessed god art thou well hast thou liued therein hast meanly merited hauing hadde much libertie doo contrary thou wouldst wherein v answer selues afterward demanded much displeasing god hee beene sinne gluttony sighing againe greatly answered much often good father ouer beside fast lent season euerie yeare ought bee dulie obserued deuout people brought selfe customarie vse could fast three dayes euery weeke bread water indeede holy father confesse haue drunke water pleasing appetite delight especially praying walking pilgrimage euen greedy drunkard drinking good wine many time haue desired sallades small hearbes woman gather abroad open field feeding onely vpon without coueting kinde sustenance hath seemed much pleasing thought agree nature fasting especially swerueth deuotion done ought bee sonne sonne replied confessour sinnes naturall light therefore would haue thee charge thy conscience needfull happeneth euery man holy soeuer hath fasted ouerlong feeding welcome drinking good drinke trauaile sir said maister chappelet neuer tell comfort well know ignorant therein thing done seruice god ought performed purely without blemish minde otherwise done sauoureth sinne friar well contented word said amisse thou vnderstandest manner thy conscience thus purely cleared little comfort tell concerning auarice hast thou sinned therein desiring reasonable withholding others thing thou oughtst detaine whereto maister chappelet answered good father would haue imagine see lodged house two vsurers therefore disposition truly sir came hither end onely chastise admonish friendly manner cleanse mindes abhominable profit assuredly haue preuailed therein violently sicknesse hindered mine intention vnderstand holy father parent left rich man immediatly father death greater part good gaue away god sake sustaine mine ownelife helpe poore member iesus christ betooke selfe meane estate merchandise desiring none honest gaine thereby euermore whatsoeuer benefit came imparted halfe thereof poore conuerting mine owne small portion necessary affaire part would scarsely serue supply yet alwayes god gaue thereto mercifull blessing businesse dayly thriued arising still good better well hast thou done therein good sonne said confessour often time hast thou beene angry oh sir said maister chappelet therein assure yee haue often transgressed man able forbeare beholding dayly action men dishonest care keeping god commaundements feare dreadfull iudgements many time day haue rather wished selfe dead liuing beholding youth pursuing idle vanity sweare forsweare themselues tipling tauernes neuer haunting church rather affecting world folly duty owe god ala sonne quoth friar good holy anger impose penance thee tell hath rage furie time ouerruled thee commit murther manslaughter speake euill man doe kinde iniurie oh father answered maister chappelet seeme man god dare vse vile word least thought doe act speake doe thinke god would haue suffered liue deedes darknesse fit villaines wicked liuers hellish crue time haue happened meete one haue said goe god conuert thee worthy charitable word replied friar tell sonne didst thou euer beare false witnesse man hast spoken falsly taken ought one contrary owner yes indeede father said maister chappelet haue spoken ill another haue sometime seene one neighbour meane shame world would doe nothing else beate wife complained poore man parent saying neuer ouercome drinke ill word quoth friar remember said merchant euer deceiue merchant vse doe truly father answered maister chappelet thinke except one man one day brought money owed certaine piece cloath solde put purse without accounting moneth afterward found foure small penny due neuer happening meete man againe kept space whole yeare gaue away foure poore people god sake small matter said friar truly payed back owner bestowing vpon poore many question hee demaunded whereto still answered manner proceeded absolution maister chappelet spake thus haue yet one sinne haue reuealed vrged friar confesse said remember afford one day weeke cleanse house soule better entertainement lord sauiour yet haue done reuerence sunday sabaoth ought haue done small fault sonne replied friar quoth maister chappelet doe terme small fault sunday holy day highly reuerenced day blessed lord arose death life quoth confessour hast thou done nothing else day yes said forgetfull selfe spet god church friar smiling said ala sonne matter moment wee religious person doe vse spet euery day shame answered maister chappelet place ought kept pure cleane sacred temple wherein dayly sacrifice offered vp god manner held houre vttering like transgression last began sigh passionately shed teares one skilfull enough dissembling prankes whereat confessour much mooued said ala sonne aylest thou oh father quoth chappelet remaineth yet one sinne vpon conscience whereof neuer time made confession shamefull appeareth disclose partly perswaded god neuer pardon sinne sonne said friar neuer say sinnes euer committed men shall committed long world endureth onely one man repenting contrite see thou art grace mercy god great vpon penitent confession freely pardon therefore spare speak boldly ala father said chappelet still pretended weeping sinne mine great hardly beleeue earnest prayer doe assist euer shall obtaine remission speake sonne said friar feare promise pray god thee master chappelet still wept sighed continued silent notwithstanding confessor comfortable perswasions hee helde long suspence breathing forth sighe euen heart would haue broken saide holy father seeing promise pray god reueale know little boy curse mother sooner spoken wrung hand greeued extraordinarily oh good son saide friar doth seeme great sinne thee men doe daily blaspheme lord god yet neuerthelesse vpon hearty repentance alwayes ready forgiue wilt thou beleeue obtaine remission sinne ignorantly committed weepe deare sonne comfort thy selfe rest resolued thou wert one nayled blessed sauiour crosse yet truly repentant see thou art would freely forgiue thee say father quoth chappelet mine owne deare mother bare wombe nine moneths day night afterwards fed breast thousand time pardoned cursing oh haynous sinne except pray god instantly forgiue religious man perceiued nothing confessed master chappelet gaue absolution owne benediction beside reputing holy man verily beleeuing said would haue done like hearing man speake manner vpon point death afterward saide vnto master chappelet god grace may soone restored health come passe god doe take blessed well disposed soule mercy please haue body buried conuent whereto master chappelet answered thanke father good motion sorry friend bury else haue promised pray god beside haue alwayes carried religious deuotion order wherefore beseech soone come home conuent preuaile much good meanes holy eucharist consecrated morning high altar may brought vnto although confesse selfe vtterly vnworthy yet purpose reuerend permission receiue also holy latest vnction ende hauing liued greeuous sinner may yet last die christian word pleasing good olde man caused euery thing performed according master chappelet requested two brother much doubted dissembling chappelet small partition sundered sicke man chamber heard vnderstood passage betweene ghostly father many time scarcely able refrain laughter fraudulent course confession often said within themselues manner man neither age sicknesse terror death neere approaching sensible owne soule much god whose iudgement knowes soone shall appeare else sent fearefull place none alter wicked disposition needes die according hath liued notwithstanding seeing ordered matter burial freely allowed cared chappelet receiued communion ceremony appointed weaknesse encreasing day goodly confession died long towards euening whereupon two brother tooke order needefull thing readinesse haue buried honourably sending acquaint father conuent therewith might come say nigilles according precedent custome morrow fetch body honest friar confessed hearing dead went prior conuent sound house bell caused brother assemble together giuing credibly vnderstand master chappelet holy man appeared part confession made doubt many miracle would wrought sanctified body perswading fetch thither deuoute solemnity reuerence whereto prior credulous brother presently condiscended gladly night come went visit dead body master chappelet vsed especiall solemne nigill morrow apparrelled richest coapes vestiments book hand crosse borne singing forme deuoute procession brought body pompeously church accompanied people towne men woman father confessor ascending vp pulpit preached wonderfull thing rare holinesse life fastes virginity simplicity innocency true sanctity recounting also among especiall obseruations chappelet confessed great greeuous sinne hardly could perswaded god would grant pardon wherby tooke occasion reproue people present saying accursed god verie least trifling matter hapning spare blaspheme god blessed mother whole court heauenly paradise oh take example singular man saintlike man nay verie saint indeede many addition made concerning faithfulnesse truth integrity vehement asseueration word wherto people present gaue credible beleefe prouoked vnto zeale earnest deuotion sermon sooner ended mighty crowd throng pressed biere kissing hand feete garment torne peeces precious reliques holy person happy thought themselues could get smallest peece shred anie thing came neere body thus continued day body lying still open visited manner night come buried goodly marble tombe erected faire chappell purposely many dayes following strange see people country came thither heapes holy candle offering image waxe fastened tombe signe sacred solemne vowes new created saint farre spread fame renowne sanctity deuotion integrity life maintained constantly father conuent one fell sicke neede distresse aduersity would make vowes saint naming yet day saint chappelet affirming vpon oathes infinite miracle daily performed especially came deuotion visit shrine manner liued died master chappelet du prat became saint haue heard deny impossible may rest among blessed body although liued lewdly wickedly yet might contrition latest extreamity questionlesse might finde mercie thing remaine vnknowne v speaking outwarde appearance vulgar iudgement censure otherwise thinke rather perdition blessed place paradice referring omnipotent appointment whose clemencie hath alwayes beene great v regard error integrity faith making meanes continuall mediator open enemy conuerted sonne seruant began name conclude desiring may euermore due reuerence referre selues thereto necessity setled assurance alwayes readie heare v ceased abraham iew admonished aduised friend named iehannot de cheuigny trauailed paris vnto rome beholding wicked behauiour men church returned backe paris yet neuerthelesse became christian second nouell wherein contained expressed liberality goodnesse god extended christian faith nouell recited pamphilus highly pleasing company much commended lady beene diligently obserued among queen commanded madam neiphila seated neerest pamphilus relating another follow pastime thus begun lesse gracious countenance merrily disposed made answer shee would obey charge began manner pamphilus hath declared v tale goodnesse god regardeth error proceede thing vvee cannot discerne intend approoue mine argument infallible truth benignity deliuereth selfe enduring patiently fault word worke declare vnfaigned testimony gracious goodnesse liue dissolutely doe end others illumined light life may beleeue stronger constancy minde haue heeretofore heard gracious lady liued wealthy marchant paris mercer seller silkes named iehannot de cheuigny man faithful honest vpright dealing held great affection friendship rich iew named abraham merchant also man direct conuersation iehannot vvell noting honesty loyall dealing iew began haue religious kind compassion soule much pittying man good behauiour wise discreete action danger perdition thorow want faith regard louingly began entreate would leaue error iewish beleefe follow truth christianity euidently saw good holy daily prosper enlarge selfe whereas contrary profession decreased grew nothing iew made answer beleeued nothing good holy iewish religion hauing beene borne therein therein also purposed liue dye matter whatsoeuer able remoue resolution stiffe deniall iehannot would giue ouer pursued still day day reitterating continually former speech deliuering infinite excellent pregnant reason merchant themselues ignorant farre christian faith excelled iewish falshoods albeit iew learned man owne law yet notwithstanding intire amity hee bare iehannot perhaps word fortified blessed spirit preualent iew felt pleasing apprehension though obstinacie stood yet farre conuersion hee thus continued strong opinion iehannot left hourely labour much iew conquered earnest continuall importunity one day spake iehannot thus worthy friend iehannot thou art extremely desirous conuert christianity well contended doe onely vpon condition first iourney rome see thou sayest god generall vicar earth consider course life manner likewise colledge cardinal doe appeare men thy speech affirmes thereby may comprehend thy faith religion better mine meane paine thou endeuourest perswade become christian thou art finde otherwise continue iew iehannot heard word became exceeding sorrowfull within himselfe haue lost paine thinke well imployed hoping haue man conuerted goe court rome behold wickednes priest liues farewell hope euer seeing become christian rather already christian without question would turne iew going neerer abraham said ala louing friend shouldst thou vndertake tedious trauell great charge thy iourney hence rome cost thee consider rich man thou art trauaile land sea full infinite danger doest thou thinke religious men enow gladly bestowe baptisme vpon thee therefore plainely appeareth voyage purpose thou standest vpon doubt scruple concerning faith whereto wish thee canst thou desire conference greater doctours men learned respect famous citie doth affoord thee resolue thee questionable case thou must thinke prelate thou seest yet must needes much better condition rome neere principall pastour therefore thou wilt credit counsell reserue iourney time conuenient iubilee generall pardon happeneth perchance beare thee company goe along thee vowed pilgrimage whereto iew replied beleeue iehannot thou hast said may make short thee fully determined thou wouldst haue christian thou instantly vrgest goe thither otherwise continue iehannot perceiuing setled purpose said goe god name perswaded himselfe hee would neuer become christian hee seene court rome neuerthelesse counted labour altogether lost regard bestowed good end honest intention commended iew mounted horsebacke made lingering iourney rome arriued honourably entertained iewes dwelling rome time abiding without reuealing one reason comming thither heedfully obserued manner pope life cardinal prelate courtier man discreete iudicious apparantly perceiued owne eye information friend highest lowest without restraint remorse conscience shame feare punishment sinned abhominable luxurie naturally onely foule sodomie credit strumpet boyes small yet might easily obtained moreouer drunkard bellygods seruants paunch thing else euen like brutish beast luxurie euery met withall vpon obseruation hee saw men couetous greedy coyne euery thing bought solde ready money onely blood men plaine termes faith christian yea matter diuinest quality whomsoeuer appertaining sacrifice benefice whereof made meane merchandize broker found paris attending vpon trade manifest symonie vnder nice name negotiation gluttony sustentation euen god knowne signification vocable intention wicked heart would suffer himselfe deceiued outward name thing wretched men commonly vse doe thing many fitter silence publication deepely displeasing iew sober modest man soone seene enough resoluing returne paris speedily performed iehannot heard arriuall crediting much rather newes euer see conuerted christian went welcome kindly feasted one another fewe dayes resting iehannot demaunded thought holy father pope cardinal generally courtier whereto iew readily answered strange iehannot god giue much doth truly tell thee beene able consider thing haue heard seene could haue resolued selfe neuer haue found priest either sanctity deuotion good worke example honest life good thing else beside man desire see luxury auarice gluttony wicked thing yea worse worse may held generall estimation men let goe rome thinke rather forge damnable action way leaning grace goodnesse ought could perceiue thinkes chiefe pastour consequently rest dependant doe striue much may engine arte endeuour bring nothing else banish quite world christian religion whereof support foundation perceiue wicked intent neuer come passe contrariwise faith enlargeth selfe shining euery day much cleare splendant gather thereby euidently blessed spirit true ground defence thereof true holy respect whereas stood stiffe obstinate good admonition neuer minded become christian freely open heart vnto thee nothing world shall hinder christian thou art let v therefore presently goe church according true custome holy faith helpe baptized iehannot expected farre contrary conclusion hearing speake constancy gladdest man world went church nostre dame paris requested priest abiding bestow baptisme abraham ioyfully hearing earnestly desire iehannot godfather named iobn afterward learned diuines fully instructed ground faith wherein grew greatly vnderstanding led vertuous life melchisedech iew recounting tale three ring great soldam named saladine preuented great danger prepared third nouell whereby author approuing christian faith sheweth beneficiall sodaine ingenious answer may fall bee especially man find himselfe euident danger madame neiphila hauing ended discourse well allowed company pleased queene madam philomena next succeede order thus began tale deliuered neiphila maketh mee remember doubtfull case sometime hapned another iew god truth holy faith hath bene already wel discoursed shall seeme vnfitting poore opinion descend accident men wherefore relate matter vnto attentiuely heard considered may make much circumspect answering diuers question demand perhaps otherwise would consider woorthy assembly like folly dulnesse many time hath ouerthrowne men place eminencie great greeuous misery euen discrect sense good vnderstanding hath deliuered many irksome peril seated safest security proue true folly hath made many fall high authority poore despised calamity may auouched infinite example needelesse remember good sense able vnderstanding may prooue occasion great desolation without happy preuention declare vnto word make good according promise saladine man powerfull valiant onely valour made soldan babylon also gaue many signall victory ouer king sarrazens christian likewise hauing diuers warres magnificent employment owne wasted treasure reason sodaine accident happening standing neede vse great summe money yet readily knowing procure remembred rich iew named melchisedech lent money vse interest city alexandria man imagined best able furnish could willingly knowne gripple miserable hardly meanes would drawe end constrained necessity labouring wit apt deuice whereby might haue concluded though hee might compell yet practise shadowed good reason ensnare hauing sent entertained familiarly court sitting downe thus began honest man haue often heard reported many thou art skilfull case concerning god thou goest beyond time wherefore would gladly informed thee vvhich three lawes religion thou takest truest iew sarazen christian iew wise man plainly perceiued saladine sought entrap answer raise quarrell commended one lawes aboue knew saladine aymed wherefore bethinking himselfe shape answer might way trouble entangle summoning sences together considering dallying soldane might redound meane danger thus replied lord question propounded faire worthy answer mine opinion truly threof doth necessarily require time consideration might stand liking allow let first make entrance reply pretty tale well worth hearing haue oftentimes heard reported long since wealthy man among precious iewels owne goodly ring great valew beauty estimation whereof made earnestly desirous leaue perpetuall memory honour successor whereupon willed ordained among male child ring left father found custody death hee none bee reputed heire honoured reuerenced rest prime worthiest person sonne ring left kept course posterity dealing respect predecessor done short time ring hand hand many owner legacie length came hand one three sonnes goodly vertuous person verie obedient father regard affected equally without difference partiall respect custome ring knowne one coueting beare esteeme aboue desired hee could best make meanes father regard grown old would leaue ring whereby bee acknowledged heire good man loued one knew make choise leaue ring yet hauing past promise seuerally studied meanes satisfie three wherfore secretly hauing conferred curious excellent goldsmith hee caused two ring bee made really resembling first made ring hand could distinguish right one lying vpon deathbed sonnes plying best opportunity gaue ring death presuming seuerally vpon right inheritance honor grew great contradiction square man producing ring truly alike resemblance one could know right ring therefore suite law distinguish true heire father continued long time dooth yet day like manner good lord concerning three lawes giuen god father three people haue propounded imagine haue heritage god true law also duely performe commandements indeede question three ringes yet remaining saladine well perceyuing iew cunning caught snare answered well doe violence would redound vnto perpetuall dishonour reueale neede extremity try would therein friendly sted hauing disclosed matter purposed haue dealt returned wise answer iew lent great sum money hee demanded saladine repayed againe iustly giuing great gift beside respecting especiall frend maintaining honourable condition neere vnto owne person monke hauing committed offence deseruing grieuously punished freede himselfe paine inflicted wittily reprehending abbot fault fourth nouell wherein may noted men reproue error others remaine themselues commonly author owne reprehension ceased madam philomena conclusion tale dioneus sitting next vnto without tarrying command queene knowing order formerly begunne follow course spake manner gracious lady faile vnderstanding generall intention purposely assembled tell tale especially may please selues whith respect nothing done disorderly hold lawfull euery one queene decreed dignity relate nouelty owne iudgement may cause contentment wherefore hauing heard good admonition iehannot de cheuigny abraham iew aduised saluation soule melchisedech witty vnderstanding defended rich traines saladine purpose tell plaine word without feare receiuing reprehension cunningly monke compassed deliuerance punishment intended towards country lunigiana farre distant owne monastery sometime better furnished holinesse religion adayes wherein liued among diuers young nouice monke whose hot lusty disposition vigour yeeres neither fastes prayer great power ouer chanced fasting day high noone monkes asleepe dormitaries dorters frolicke friar walking alone church stood solitary place ruminating many matter himselfe hee espied pretty hansome wench husbandman daughter countrey beene gathering rootes hearbes field vppon knee altar sooner seene immediately hee felt effeminate temptation ill fitted profession lasciuious desire religious deuotion made draw neere whether vnder shift onely cloake compasse carnall affection close conference pernicious vile purpose know farre preuailed vpon frailety bargaine passed betweene church wonne chamber person could perceiue yong lusty monke transported ouerfond affection carelesse dalliance haue beene lord abbot newly arisen sleepe walking softly cloyster came monkes daughter doore hearing noyse made feminine voyce strange hee wont heare layed eare close chamber doore plainly perceiued woman within wherewith much moued intended suddenly make open doore vpon better consideration hee conceiued farre fitting returne backe owne chamber tary vntill monke come forth monke though delight damosel extraordinary yet feare suspition followed vpon height wantonnesse heard soft treading doore prying thorow small creuice doore perceiued apparantly abbot himselfe stood listening could ignorant maide chamber pleasure ensueth paine veniall monke knew well enough though wanton heate would let heede greeuous punishment must inflicted made sad beyond measure neuerthelesse without disclosing dismay young maiden began consider himselfe many meanes whereby find one might best fit turne suddenly conceited apt stratagem sorted effect would haue whereupon seeming satisfied season hee tolde damosell carefull credit brought vnseen would free thence desiring tarrie without making noyse vntil time returned going forth chamber locking fast key went directly lord abbot lodging deliuering saide key euery monke vsed doe like went abroade conuent setting good countenance matter boldly saide lord haue yet brought par wood lieth ready cut downe forrest hauing conuenient time doe please giue leaue goe fetch abbot perswading himselfe beene discouered monke resolued assuredly offence committed little iocund happy accident gladly tooke key gaue leaue fetch wood sooner gone abbot beganne consider himselfe best doe case either presence monkes open chamber doore offence knowne might haue occasion murmuring proceeded monkes punishment rather first vnderstand damosell selfe manner shee brought thither furthermore considered shee might woman respect man daughter would take well haue disgraced monkes wherefore concluded first see himselfe shee afterward resolue vpon rest going softly chamber entring locked doore fast key poore damosell thinking beene gallant young monke finding lord abbot shee fell knee weeping fearing receiue publike shame betrayed vnkinde manner lord abbot looking demurely maide perceiuing faire feate louely felt immediately although olde lesse spurring fleshly desire young monke done whereupon beganne conferre thus priuately himselfe take pleasure may freely haue care molestation endure euery day sildome find delight prepared delicate sweete young damosell eye discouer enduce doe would haue know reason gainesay man know tongue blaze abroade sinne concealed halfe pardoned faire fortune perhaps hereafter neuer befall therefore hold wisedome take benefit man may enioy vpon immodest meditation purpose quite altered came went neerer kindly began comfort desiring forbeare weeping insinuating speech acquainted amorous intention maide made neither yron diamond seeking preuent one shame another easily wonne abbot caused embrace kisse often lusty young nouice monke abbot imagined gone wood hid himselfe aloft vpon roofe dorter saw abbot enter alone chamber hee lost great part former feare promising himselfe kinde perswasion somewhat would ensue better comfort beheld lockt chamber hope grew vndoubted certainty little chincke creuice fauoured whereat could heare see whatsoeuer done spoken abbot thought hee staide long enough damosell leauing still locking doore fast againe hee returned thence owne chamber within short abbot knowing monke conuent supposing lately returned wood determined reproue sharpely haue closely imprisoned damosell might remaine solie himselfe causing called presently stearne angry countenance giuing many harsh bitter speech commanded clapt prison monke readily answered saying good lord haue yet beene long order saint benedict learne particularity thereto belonging beside sir neuer shewed mee brother manner young monkes ought vse woman haue otherwise done custome prayer fasting seeing haue lately therein instructed mee owne example doe heere solemnely promise please pardon one error neuer faile therein againe dayly follow haue seene doe abbot man quicke apprehension perceiued instantly answere monke onely knew much also seene intended hee wherefore finding himselfe faulty monke hee could shame worthily deserued much himselfe pardoning imposing silence eithers offence conuayed poore abused damosell forth doores purposing neuer transgresse like manner lady marquesse montferrat banquet hennes diuers gracious speech beside repressed fond loue little ioy wee vnderstand well discourse already past power consisteth deliuery wise ready answeres great part sence iudgement men affect woman great birth quality themselues also admirable foresight woman keepe surprized loue lord going beyond degree matter offereth selfe memory well deseruing speech attention gentlewoman word deede defend honour kind importunity laboureth betray marquesse contained equall couple mariage marquesse lady among knight marquesse could hardly paraleld armes honour euen wife comparison lady scarcely matchable beauty vertue word waighty apprehension king philip suddainly hauing yet neuer seene began affect earnestly concluding embarque himselfe gennes genoua set forward intended voyage iourneying thither land hee would shape honest excuse see lady marquesse whose lord home opinion perswaded ouerfondly easily obtaine issue amorous desire hee come within dayes iourney lady marquesse lay sent word expect company morrow dinner lady singularly wise iudicious answered messenger reputed king comming extraordinary grace fauour hee heartily welcome afterward entring consideration selfe king might meane priuate visitation knowing husband home meane barre apter entertainement last discreetly conceited therein deceiued babling report beauty perfection might thus occasion king coming thither iourny lying else quite contrary way notwithstanding princely lady loyall wife euer liued shee intended giue best entertainement summoning chiefest gentleman country together take due order aduise giuing king gracious welcome concerning dinner diet seruice table remained onely owne disposing sending presently abroade buying hennes country afforded shee commaunded cooke onely without prouision beside prepare seruices could deuise morrow king came according promise honourable welcommed lady seemed eye farre beyond knight speech fairest creature euer seene whereat meruailed little extolling perfection peerelesse much enflamed affection almost made desire impatient king withdrawne chamber orderly prepared beseemed great prince houre dinner drawing king lady marquesse seated one table attendant placed table answerable degree honour plenty dish serued rarest wine countrey yeelded king minde faire lady marquesse meate stood table neuerthelesse obseruing seruice viand though variously cooked diuers kindes nothing else hennes onely began wonder much rather knew countrey quality affoorded plenty fowles venyson beside time comming heard respite enough hawking hunting therefore encreased maruell nothing prouided hennes onely wherein better resolued turning merry countenance lady thus spake madam hennes onely bred countrey cockes lady marquesse well vnderstanding demand fitted apt opportunity thwart idle hope defend owne honour boldly returned king answere lord woman wiues howsoeuer differ garment grace one another yet notwithstanding heere place king heard reply knew well enough occasion henne dinner also vertue lay couched vnder answer perceiuing apparantly wanton word would proue vaine woman easily seduced wherefore hee grew enamored inconsiderately found best fitting honour quench heate wisedome discreetely without faith although laboured greatly seeme sanctified man earnest affecter christian religion appeare outward shew yet much better inquisitor purse plenteously stored money slenderly grounded faith misbeliefe man reformation seeke man comming demanded accusation intimated true whereto honest man answered could denie speaking word declared manner vttered presently inquisitor deuoutly addicted saint iohn golden beard saide doest thou make lord drinker curious quaffer wine glutton bellygod tauerne haunter thou drunkard hypocrite thou art thou thinkest light matter may seeme thine owne opinion tell thee plainly deserueth fire faggor proceede iustice inflict thee like threatning word also stearn angry countenance made man belieue himselfe epicure hee denied eternity soule whereby fell trembling feare doubting indeed least burned mercifully dealt withall rounded care secret mean annointed hand saint iohns golden grease singular remedy disease pestilentiall couetous priest especially friar minor dare touch money case became quickly altered soueraigne vnction vertue though galen speakes word thereof among chiefest medicine farre preuailed terrible threatening word fire fagot became meerely frozen vp gracious language blew gentle calmer ayre inquisitor deliuering hallowed crucifixe creating souldier crosse payred cross good store euen trauell vnder standard holy land hee appoint homepaying pennance namely visit thrice euery weeke chamber annoint hand selfesame yellow vnguent afterward heare masse holy crosse visiting also dinner time ended doe nothing rest day according directed simple man yet simple seeing weekely greasing inquisitor hand would time graspe away gold grew weary annointing beganne consider himselfe stay course chargeable penance comming one morning according iniunction heare masse gospell obserued wordes shall receiue hundred one possesse eternall life saying kept perfectly memory hee commanded dinner time came inquisitor finding among fellowes seated table inquisitor presently demanded whether heard masse morning yes sir replied man readily hast thou heard thing therein quoth inquisitor whereof thou art doubtfull desirest informed surely sir answered plaine meaning man make doubt thing haue heard doe beleeue constantly onely one thing troubleth much maketh compassionate holy father brother perceiuing wofull wretched estate shall come another world word quoth inquisitor art thou moued compassion v good sir saide man doe remember word gospell morning shall receiue hundred one true replied inquisitor moueth thee vrge word tell sir answered plaine fellow might please offended since time resorting hither haue daily seene many poore people doore abundance brother haue fed sufficiently euery one hath good messe pottage sir euery dishfull giuen sure receiue hundred againe meerely drowned pottage although though rest sitting table inquisitor laughed heartily iest yet found himselfe toucht another nature hauing
