hypocritically receiued one poore offence aboue three hundred peeces gold mite restored againe fearing disclosed yet threatning another processe law abusing word gospell content dismisse altogether without golden greasing hand bergamino telling tale skilfull man named primasso abbot clugni honestly checked new kinde couetousnesse master de la scala seauenth nouell approuing much vnfitting prince great person couetous rather liberall men curteous demeanor madam aemilia quaintnesse discourse caused queene rest company commend inuention carrying crosse golden oyntment appointed pennance afterward philostratus order speake next began manner commendable thing faire lady hit neuer stirreth place matter much admirable see thing suddenly appearing sildome neuer frequented suddenly hit ordinary archer vicious polluted liues priest yeeldeth matter selfe many thing deseruing speech reprehension true wickednesse well worthy sharply shot therefore though honest meaning man wisely touching master inquisitor quicke hypocriticall charity monkes friar giuing thing poore meete swine worse throwne away yet hold commended occasion former tale purpose relate pleasantly reproued master de la scala magnifico mightie lord sudden vnaccustomed couetousnesse appearing figuring men intended say manner following master de la scala fame ranne abroade place beyond infinite fauours fortune towards one notable magnificent lord euer liued italy since dayes fredericke second emperour determining procure solemne assembly verona many people met diuers place especially gentleman degree suddenly vpon occasion know minde altered hee would goe forward intention hee partly recompenced come thither dismissed depart pleasure one onely man remained vnrespected kinde sort sent away whose name bergamino man pleasantly disposed wittily ready speaking answering none could easily credit heard although recompence seemed ouer long delayed yet hee made doubt beneficiall ending enemy master de la scala incensed whatsoeuer gaue bestowed ill imployed vtterly lost throwne fire therefore neither spake thing fewe dayes passed ouer bergamino perceiuing hee neither called account made notwithstanding many manly good part obseruing beside hee found shrewd consumption purse inne horse seruants chargeable beg n grow extremely melancholly yet hee attended expectation day day thinking farre vnfitting depart bidden farewell hauing brought thither three goodly rich garment beene giuen sundry lord sightly appearance great meeting importunate host greedy payment first deliuered one yet halfe score wiped second must needes follow beside except meant leaue lodging hee must liue vpon third long would last till hee saw end hope would sort fortuned time liuing thus vpon latest refuge met maister one day dinner presented himselfe discontented countenance maister well obseruing distaste take delight thing could come said bergamino chearest thou thou art melancholly pray thee tell v bergamino suddenly without premeditation yet seeming long considered thereon reported tale sir haue heard certaine man named primasso one skilfully learned grammar beyond witty ready versifier regard whereof much admired farre renowned neuer saw onely heard could easily say primasso came passe paris poore estate commonly hee could light better fortune vertue slenderly rewarded haue greatest possession heard much fame abbot clugni man reputed next pope richest prelate church heard wonderfull magnificent matter alwayes kept open hospitable court neuer made refusall whence euer hee came went eate drinke freely prouided came abbot set table primasso hearing earnest desirer see magnificent vertuous men resolued goe see rare bounty abbot demaunding far dwelt paris answered three league thence primasso made account went betimes morning easily reach thither houre dinner instructed way finding walke along fearing went without furnishment stay long dinner might perhaps complaine hunger therefore caried three loaues bread knowing could meete water euery albeit vsed drinke little hauing aptly conuayed bread went iourney arriued lord abbot court indifferent dinner time wherfore entring great hall place place beholding great multitude table bountifull preparation kitchin admirable prouision dinner said himselfe truly man magnificent fame hath made shee speakes sparingly thus went considering thing saw maister abbot houshold houre dinner commaund water brought washing hand euery one sitting downe table fell lot primasso sit directly doore whereat abbot must enter hall custome court foode serued table vntill lord abbot himselfe first sette whereupon euery thing fitte readie maister houshold went tell lord nothing wanted presence onely abbot comming chamber enter hall looking hee wont doe first man hee saw primasso homely habite hauing seene remembrance present bad conceite possessed braine neuer saw vnworthier person saying within himselfe see giue good away deuoured returning backe chamber againe commaunded doore made fast demaunding euery man neere knew base knaue sate entrance hall seruants answered primasso extreamely hungry trauailing foote farre neuer vsed fast long expecting still meate would serued abbot came drew one loaues hee brought heartily fell feeding lord abbot stayed within indifferent sent forth one men see poore fellow gone seruant told still stayed fed vpon dry bread seemed brought thither let feede owne replyed abbot shall taste none mine day gladly wold abbot primasso haue gone thence himselfe yet held scarsely honest lordship dismisse owne command primasso hauing eaten one loaues yet abbot come began feede vpon second abbot still sending expect absence answered length abbot comming primasso hauing eaten vp second loafe hunger compeld begin third newes carried abbot sodainly brake forth saide new kinde needy tricke hath braine begotte day grow disdainfull man whatsoeuer haue long time allowed meate eaten commers please visit without exception person gentleman yeoman poore rich marchant minstrill honest man knaue neuer refraining presence hall basely contemning one poore man beleeue couetousnesse one man meate doth ill agree mine estate calling though appeareth wretched fellow mee may greater merit imagine deserue honor able giue hauing thus discoursed himselfe would need vnderstande whence finding primasso come onely see magnificence reported knowing also generall fame noysed euery whereof reputed bee learned honest ingenious man grew greatly ashamed folly desirous make amends stroue many way honor dinner ended abbot bestowed honorable garment beseemed degree merit putting good store money purse also giuing good horsse ride left owne free election whether hee would stay still depart pleasure wherewith primasso highly contented yeelding heartiest thankes could deuise doe returned paris horseback albeit came poorly thether foot master de la scala man good vnderstanding perceyued immediately without interpretation bergamino meant morall smiling saide bergamino thou hast honestly expressed thy vertue necessity iustly reprooued mine auarice niggardnesse base folly trust bergamino neuer felt fit couetousnesse come vpon haue dishonestly declared thee banish correction thou hast taught mee hauing payed host charge redeeming also robe garment mounting good gelding putting plenty crownes purse hee referd owne choise depart dwell still guillaume boursier quaint familiar word checkt miserable couetousnesse signior herminio de grimaldi eight nouell plainly declareth couetous gentleman worthy honor respect madam lauretta sitting next philostratus heard witty conceite bergamino knowing shee say somewhat without iniunction command pleasantly thus began last discourse faire vertuous company induceth mee tell honest courtier reprehended like manner nothing vnprofitably base couetousnesse merchant extraordinary wealth tale although effect may seeme resemble former yet perhaps proue lesse pleasing regard sorted good end long time since liued gene geneway gentleman named signior herminio de grimaldi euery one wel knew rich inheritance ready summes currant mony knowne citizen italy hee surpassed men wealth likewise excell wretched auarice miserably greedy couetous man world could wicked way onely kept purse lockt vp pleasuring denied needful thing enduring many misery distress onely auoide expences contrary genewayes generall custome alwayes delighted decently cloathed haue dyet best reason miserable basenesse tooke sirname grimaldi whereof hee right descended called master herminio couetous mizer nickname notably agreeing gripple nature came passe time spending nothing multiplying daily infinite meanes ciuill honest gentleman courtier ready wit discoursiue language came geneway named guillaume boursier man farre differing diuers courtier dayes soothing shamefull gracelesse maners allow maintenance called reputed bee gentleman yea especiall fauourites whereas much worthily accounted knaues villaines borne bred filthinesse skilfull euery kinde basest behauiour fit come prince court whereas passed time spent dayes paine making peace gentleman warre dissention treating honest marriage betweene friend familiar louing speech would recreate disturbed mindes desiring none commendable exercise court sharpely reproouing like father disordred life ill action albeit recompence little none vpstarts adayes employ paine detraction sowing question quarrel betweene one another making spare lye falshoods nay worse presence man vpbraiding iniuries shame scandal true true vpon least occasion false deceitfull flattery villanies inuenting make gentleman become vile themselues detestable quality better beloued respected theyr misdemeanord lord recompenced bountiful manner men vertuous carriage desert argument sufficient goodnesse gone vp heauen hath quite forsaken loathed lower region men drowned mud abhominable vice returning left led way iust religious anger deformity gentleman master guillaume boursier willingly seene gladly welcommed best men geneway hauing remayned dayes city among matter heard much talke miserable couetousnes master herminio grew verie desirous haue sight master herminio already vnderstood gentleman master guillaume boursier vertuously disposed couetously soeuer inclined hauing sparkes noble nature gaue good word gracious entertainement discoursing diuers occasion company genewayes h brought new erected house building great cost beauty shewen variable rarity beganne thus master guillaume doubt haue heard seene many thing instruct quaint conceit deuise fairely figured painting entrance great hall house master guillaume hearing speake simply returned answere sir cannot aduise thing rare vnseen talke sneeze new manner vpon full ouercloyed stomacke auoide base humour stupifie braine matter like quality would taught good one indeede disposition see fairely effected could instruct excellent embleme wherwith yet neuer came acquainted master herminio hearing say expecting answere saide good master guillaume tell faith haue fairely painted whereto master guillaume suddenly replied doe nothing sir paint ouer portall halle entrance liuely picture liberality bid friend better welcome hitherto haue beene master herminio heard word became possessed sudden shame complexion changed former palenesse answered thus master guillaume haue aduice truly figured ouer gate shee shall giue good welcome guest gentleman shall say haue seene become reasonably acquainted time forward word master guillaume effectuall signior herminio became bountifull best housekeeper liued time geneway man honouring friendly welcoming stranger citizen continually vsed doe king cyprus wittily reprehended word gentlewoman gascoignie became vertuously altered vicious disposition ninth nouell giuing men vnderstand iustice necessary king aboue thing else whatsoeuer last command queene remained vpon madam elissa eliza without delaying thus beganne young lady hath often beene seene much paine hath beene bestowed many reprehension spent vaine till word happening aduenture perhaps purposely determined hath effectually done deede appeareth tale madam lauretta another mine owne wherewith intend briefly acquaint approuing good word discreetly obserued soueraigne power vertue dayes first king cyprus conquest made holy land godfrey bullen fortuned gentlewoman gascoignie trauelling pilgrimage visit sacred sepulcher ierusalem returning home againe arriued cyprus shee villanously abused certaine base wretch complaining thereof without comfort redresse shee intended make moane king countrey whereupon tolde therein shee loose labour hee womanish fainthearted onely refused punish iustice offence others also suffered shamefull iniuries done himselfe therefore displeased negligence might easily discharge spleene doe dishonour would gentlewoman heard despairing consolation reuenge wrong shee resolued checke king deniall iustice comming weeping spake manner sir presume presence hoping haue redresse diuers dishonourable iniuries done vnto full satisfaction doe teach suffer vile abuse daily offered selfe ende therein instructed may patiently beare mine owne god knoweth would bestow gladly know well endure king till beene bad dull slothfull euen sleeping time gouernement beganne reuenge wrong done gentlewoman seuerely thence forward became sharpe iusticer least offence offered honour crowne subiects beside master albert bullen honestly made lady blush thought haue done much shee perceiued amorously affected towards tenth nouell wherein declared honest loue agreeth people age madam eliza sate silent last charge labour like employment remained queene selfe whereupon shee beganne thus speake honest vertuous young lady like sta re ayre faire cleere adorning beauty heauen flowres spring time lasteth doe graciously embellish meadowes euen sweete speech pleasing conference passe time commendable discourse best habit minde outward beauty body ornament word appeare short sweete much seemely woman men long tedious talking may done lesser time greater blemish woman men among v woman day thinke none haue therein offended readily haue vnderstood short pithy speech haue beene quicke quaintly deliuered answering suteth vnderstanding generally shame v liue moderne time haue conuerted vertue within liued v garment bodie shew whose habites noted bee gaudie fullest imbroyderies fantastick fashion reputed haue matter therefore honoured esteemed neuer considering whosoeuer loadeth backe asse put vpon richest brauerie becommeth thereby iote wiser merriteth honour asse haue ashamed speake detecting may perhaps iustly taxe selfe imbroydered body tricked trimmed boasting brauery thing else marble statue dumbe dull vtterly insensible perchaunce make answere question demaunded much better silent defence honest deuise conference among men woman would haue world thinke proceedeth simplicity precise opinion couering owne folly name honesty honest woman shee conferres onely chambermaide laundresse kitchinwoman nature allowed owne idle conceite kinde talking true respect vsed action thing time place necessarily considered also conuerse withall sometimes happeneth man woman intending word iest merriment make another body blush ashamed knowing strength wit remaineth opposite doe conuert disgrace vpon themselues therefore may aduisedly stand vpon owne guard preuent common prouerbe woman thing make choyse woorst desire dayes last tale come selfe may make v wise end gentlenesse minde conferre excellency good manner may shew selues inferiour many yeares since worthy assembly bulloigne dwelt learned physitian man famous skill farre renowned whose name master albert growne aged estimate threescore tenne yeares hee yet sprightly disposition though naturall heate vigour quite shaken hand yet amorous flame desire wholly forsaken hauing seene banquet beautifull woman estate widdowhood named say madame margaret de chisolieri shee appeared pleasing eye sences became lesse disturbed beene farre younger temper night could quietnesse possesse soule except day seene sweet countenance louely widdow regard whereof dayly passage doore one horsebacke againe foote best might declare plaine purpose see shee gentlewoman perceiuing occasion passing repassing would priuately iest thereat together see man yeares discretion amorously addicted ouerswayed effeminate passion partly perswaded wanton ague fit loue fit none youthfull apprehension best agreeing chearefull complexion master albert continuing dayly walkes widdowes lodging chaunced vpon feastiuall day shee accompanied diuers woman great account sitting doore espied master albert farre comming thitherward resolued determination among themselues set downe allow fauourable entertainement iest merry manner louing folly afterward indeede sooner come neere arose courteously inuited enter conducting goodly garden readily prepared choyse delicate wine banquetting length among pleasant delightfull discourse demanded possible amorously affected towards beautifull woman knowing seeing earnestly sollicited many gracious gallant youthfull spirit ap ly suting yeares desire master albert perceiuing drawne among onely scoffe make mockery set merry countenance matter honestly thus answered beleeue mee gentlewoman speaking widdowe selfe appeare strange wisedome discretion amorously enclined especially well worthy although power naturally appertaine exercise loue bereft gone aged people yet good thereto cannot taken neither iudgement know deserue affected much exceede youth knowledge experience much hath nature made meet respect reuerence hope incited aged loue affected many youthfull gallant grew thus haue often chaunced diuers place haue seene lady gentlewoman disposed collation rerebanquet dinner feede lupine young onion leekes although may little goodnesse yet head least hurtfull pleasing mouth gentlewoman generally guided vnreasonable appetite hold head hand feede vpon blade stalkes onely good thing also bad sauour know lady whether among choise friend may fit fancy doe like fault mine chosen thereby rest suters sooner answered widdowed gentlewoman rest company bashfully ashamed owne folly presently said master albert haue well worthily chastised ouerbold presumption beleeue mee sir repute loue kindnesse meane merrit comming man wise vertuous therefore mine honour reserued commaund vttermost alwayes ready honest seruice master albert arising seat thanking faire widdow gentle offer tooke leaue company blushing rest therein much behinde thinking checke became chidden selfe whereby wee wise let v take warning sunne somewhat farre declined heates extremity well worne away tale seauen lady three gentleman thus finished whereupon queene pleasantly said day faire company remaineth nothing done vnder regiment onely bestow new queene vpon according iudgement must take turne dispose next done continuing time honest pleasure although day endure till darke night regard time taken better preparation may made occasion follow end also whatsoeuer new queene shall please appoint may better fitted morrow opinion houre cease following dayes shall seuerally begin therefore reuerence giueth life thing hope comfort second day madame philomena wise young lady shall gouerne queene kingdome soone thus spoken arising seate dignity taking lawrell crowne owne head reuerently placed vpon madame philomenaes first humbly saluting rest openly confessing queene made gracious offer obey whatsoeuer commaunded philomena cheekes deliuering scarlet tincture see selfe thus honoured queene well remembring word lately vttered madame pampinea dulnesse neglect might noted tooke cheerefull courage first confirmed officer pampinea appointed day shee ordained morrowes prouision also supper neere approaching departed away thence thus began louely companion although madam pampinea owne courtesie matter merit remaining mee hath made queene determined alter forme intended life guided mine owne iudgement associate assistance may know intend consequently adde diminish pleasure verie word shall plainly vnderstand meaning haue well considered course day hath bene kept madam pampinea thinkes hath bene pleasing commendable regard vntill ouertedious continuation occasion irkesome offence shall seeme iniurious minde alter holding order haue begun depart hence recreate selues awhile sun groweth towards setting sup fresh open ayre afterward canzonets pastime outweare houres till bed time morrow morning fresh gentle breath thereof rise walke place euery one shall finde fittest euen already day haue done vntill due time shall summon v hither againe continue discoursiue tale wherein thinkes consisteth pleasure profit especially discreete obseruation true thing madam pampinea coulde accomplish reason small time authority beginne vndergo wit restraining matter whereon speake better premeditation may passe vpon respite little leysure goeth discourse sauour formality might please thus would direct order since beginning world men haue bene guided fortune thorow diuers accident occasion beyond hope expectation issue successe hath bin good succesfull accordingly euery one argument chosen lady yong gentleman likewise commended aduice promised imitate onely dioneus excepted euery one silent spake thus madam say rest haue done order appointed pleasing worthy bee allowed intreate one speciall fauour selfe haue confirmed long company continueth namely may constrained law direction tell tale liberty mine owne minde according freedome first instituted one shall imagine vrge grace vnfurnished discourse kinde well contented last euery dayes exercise queene knowing man full mirth matter began consider aduisedly would haue mooued request onely end company grew wearied tale recounted hee would shut vppe dayes disport mirthfull accident wherefore willingly consent al rest suite granted arising walked christall riuer descending downe little hill vally graciously shaded goodly tree washing hand feete much pretty pleasure passed among till supper time drawing nere made returne home palace supper ended bookes instrument laide queene commanded dance madam aemilia assisted madam lauretta dioneus shold sing sweet ditty command lauretta vndertooke dance led aemilia singing song ensuing song much delight beauty yeelds mee loue wish proue neuer sute selfe desire therein see vpon good obseruation sweete content due vnderstanding lends olde new thought cannot fashion rob mine owne soule commends obiect mongst infinite men euer finde dipossesse minde plant therein another new desire much delight c blisse would chuse continuall sight comfort rare presence neuer refuse mortall tongue thought ere must still conceale able reueale sacred sweete none meete heart enflamed desire much delight c song ended chorus whereof aunswered passed generall applause daunces night well run queene gaue ending first dayes recreation light brought departed seuerall lodging take rest till next morning end first day second day wherein discourse vnder gouernment madam philomena concerning men woman diuers accident haue beene much mollested fortune yet afterward contrary hope expectation haue happy successefull deliuerance already bright sunne renewed day euery splendant beames bird sate merrily singing blooming branch yeelding testimony thereof eares hearer seuen lady three gentleman risen entered garden spent time walking also making nosegayes chaplet flower euen done day follow course dined coole pleasing aire fell dancing went sleepe awhile awaked tooke place according pleased queene appoint faire meadow goodly creature highly pleasing beholde hauing put crowne laurell giuing gracious countenance whole company commanding madam neiphila tale begin day delight whereupon without returning excuse deniall began manner martellino counterfetting lame member caused himselfe set body saint arriguo made shew sudden recouery dissimulation discouered well beaten afterward taken prisoner great danger hanged strangled necke yet escaped ende first nouell wherein signified easie thing wicked men deceiue world vnder shadow colour miracle trechery oftentimes redoundeth harme deuiser faire lady hath happened many time hee striueth scorne floute men especially occasion deseruing respected proueth mocke himselfe selfesame matter yea meane danger beside shall perceiue tale intend tell obeying therein command queene according subiect enioyned discourse may first obserue great mischance happened one citizen yet afterward beyond hope happily escaped long since liued city treuers arrigo almaine germaine named arriguo poore man serued porter burdenbearer money man pleased employ yet notwithstanding poore meane condition generally reputed good sanctified life regard whether true know happened died least men treuers themselues affirmed instant houre departing belle great church treuers pulled helpe hand beganne ring accounted miracle euery one saide arriguo saint presently people city ran house dead body lay carried sanctified body great church people halt lame blinde troubled disease brought euen euery one forthwith holpen onely touching bodie came passe great concourse people resorted thither part three cittizens went treuers one named stechio second martellino third marquiso men condition frequented prince court giue delight pleasant counterfeited quality none men hauing euer beene treuers seeing people crowded thorow streetes wondred greatly thereat knew reason throng ranne heapes sort together grew desirous see shrine rest hauing ordered affaire lodging marquiso saide fit v see saint know shall attaine thereto haue heard place guarded germane souldiers warlike men commanded thither gouernours city least outrage committed beside church full people wee shall neuer compasse get neere martellino also forward desire see presently replied difficulty cannot dismay goe body saint selfe quoth marquiso tell thee answered martellino purpose goe disguise impotent lame person supported one side thy selfe stechio able walke selfe two thus sustaining desiring come neere saint cure euery one make way freely giue leaue goe deuise pleasing marquiso stechio without delaying three left lodging resorting secret corner aside martellino writhed mishaped hand finger armes legges mouth eye whole countenance dreadfull sight looke vpon whosoeuer beheld would verily haue imagined hee vtterly lame limbes greatly deformed body marquiso stechio seeing sorted well could wish tooke led towards church making pitious moane humbly desiring god sake euery one met grant free passage whereto charitably condiscended thus leading cry still beware giue way god sake arriued body saint arriguo helpe might healed eye diligently obseruing miracle would wrought martellino hee hauing sitten small space vpon saint bodie sufficiently skilfull counterfeiting beganne first extend one finger next hand arme degree rest body people saw made wonderfull noyse praise saint arriguo euen thundered chu ch chanced ill fortune stood florentine neere body knew martellino perfectly appearing monstrously mishapen brought church hee could take knowledge saw stand vp walke hee knew man indeede whereupon saide commeth passe fellow miraculously cured neuer truly way impotent certaine men city hearing word entred questioning demanding knew man imperfection well enough answered florentine know direct limbes body v indeede knowes better dissemble counterfet trickes man else euer saw heard discoursed florentine pressed mainely place martellino stood cry aloude lay holde traytor mocker god holy saint lamenesse limbes make mocke saint v came hither false counterfet manner laying hand vppon threw ground haling haire head tearing garment backe spurning vvith feete beating fist many much ashamed see poore martellino pittifull case cry mercy man would heare cried stil beat meaning leaue life stechio marquiso seeing considered themselues likewise desperate case therfore fearing much misvsed cryed among rest kill counterfet knaue lay loade spare neuerthelesse tooke care get people handes doubting least would kill indeede extreame violence sodainly marquiso bethought proceeded thus sergeant iustice standing church doore hee ran possible speede potestates lieutenant said vnto good lord iustice helpe hard case yonder villaine hath cut purse desire may bee brought may haue money againe hearing sent dozen sergeant went apprehend vnhappy martellino recouer people fury leading palace meane crowd thronging heard accused bee cutpurse durst meddle assisted officer charging like manner cut theyr purse also vpon clamour complaint potestates lieutenant man rude quality tooke sodainly aside examined crime wherewith charged martellino making account accusation laughed returned scoffing answeres whereat iudge waxing much displeased deliuered ouer strappado stood himselfe haue confesse crime imposed hang afterward beeing let downe ground iudge still demaunded whether accusation true affirming nothing auayled deny whereupon hee thus spake iudge lord heere ready confesse truth pray demaund accuse cut purse wil tell yet haue done otherwise purpose make answer well quoth iudge thou requirest reason calling diuers accuser one saide lost purse eight dayes another saide six another foure saide day martellino hearing replyed lord al lie throat plainly proue would god neuer set foote within city many houres since first entrance presently mine arriuall went euill houre may say see saint body thus beaten may beholde true say vnto seigneury officer keep booke presentation testifie also host lodged wherefore good lord finde otherwise haue said humbly entreate vpon bad men reportes false information may thus tormented put perill life matter proceeded manner marquiso stechio vnderstanding roughly potestates lieutenant dealt martellino already giuen strappado heauy perplexity saying themselues haue carried businesse badly redeeming fryingpan flinging fire whereupon trudging place place meeting length host told truly happened whereat hee could refraine laughing afterward went one master alexander agolante dwelt treuers great credite city cheefe magistrate hee related whole discourse three earnestly entreating commisserate case poore martellino master alexander laughed heartily hotte peece seruice went lord treuers preuailing vvell sent haue martellino brought messenger went found standing shirt iudge shrewdly shaken strappado trembling quaking pittifully iudge would heare thing excuse hating perhaps hee florentine flatly determined haue hangde necke would deliuer lorde vntill meere despight compeld lord treuers martellino came acquainted truly euery particular master alexander requested might dispatched thence florence thought halter necke helpe hanging lord smiling long accident causing martellino handsomely apparrelled deliuering also passe escaped danger tarried till came vnto florence rinaldo de este robbed theeues arriued chastea guillaume friendly lodged faire widdow recompenced likewise loss returning afterward safe well home vnto owne house second nouell whereby wee may learne thing sometime seeme hurtfull v may turne benefit commodity mvch merriment among lady hearing tale martellinos misfortune familiarly reported madam neiphila men best respected philostratus sitting neerest vnto neiphila queene commanded tale next presently began speake thus gracious lady speake vniuersall occasion mingled misfortune part partly matter leaning loue many time may happen people trace dangerous pathes amorous desire haue learned perfectly say iulians pater noster hauing good bed owne yet casually meete worser lodging time azzo marquesse ferrara marchant named rinaldo de este one day bologna especiall businesse owne occasion ended riding thence towards verona fell company horseman seeming merchant like himselfe indeede theeues men badde life conuersation yet hauing mistrust rode conferring familiarly perceiuing merchant likely haue store money concluded betweene themselues rob soone found apt place opportunity conceiue suspition rode like modest men talking honestly friendly good part disposition appearing offering humble gracious seruice accounting themselues happy companie hee returned courtesie alone one seruant falling one discourse another began talke prayer men iourney vse salute god withall one theeues three number spake thus rinaldo sir let offence desire know prayer vse thus trauell way whereto rinaldo replyed manner tell true sir man grosse enough diuine matter medling marchandize bookes neuerthelesse time thus iourney morning depart chamber say pater noster aue maria soul father mother saint iulian pray god iulian send good lodging night let tell sir oftentimes heeretofore haue met many great danger vpon way still escaped euermore night drewe came exceeding good lodging make mee firmely beleeue saint iulian honour speake hath begd god great grace mee thinkes day faile prayer morning cannot trauaile securely come good lodging doubt sir quoth haue saide prayer morning would sory else saide rinaldo especiall matter neglected rest already determined handle parted saide within themselues looke thou hast said thy praier haue thy money saint iulian thou shift thy lodging afterward man thus againe conferd sir haue ridden many iournies yet neuer vsed praier although haue heard much commended lodging hath prooued neuer worser perhaps verie night therein resolue v whether v two shall best lodged haue sayde prayer neuer vsde must deny sted thereof haue made vse verse dirupisti iutemerata deprofundis grandmother hath often told mee great vertue efficacy continuing thus talke diuers thing winning way beguiling time still waiting purpose sort effect fortuned theeues seeing come neere towne called casteau guillaume foord riuer houre somewhat late place solitarie thickely shaded tree made assault hauing robd left foote stript shirt saying goe see whether thy saint iulian allow thee night good lodging owne sufficiently prouided passing riuer away rode rinaldoes seruant seeing master sharply assayled like wicked villaine would assist sort giuing horse spurres neuer left gallowping vntill hee came chasteau guillaume hee entred vpon point night prouiding himselfe lodging caring became master rinaldo remaining shirt barefoote barelegged weather extremely colde snowing incessantly knowing doe darke night drawing looking round place abide night end might dye colde found helpe regard long late warre burnt wasted much least cottage left compelled coldes violence teeth quaking body trembling hee trotted towards chasteau guillaume knowing whether man gone thither place else perswaded himselfe could get entrance feare finding succour came within halfe mile towne night grew extreamely darke arriuing late hee found gate fast lockt bridge drawne vp entrance might admitted grieuing greatly hereat much discomforted rufully went spying wall place wherein shrowd himselfe least keepe snow falling vpon good hap hee espied house vpon wall towne terrace iutting penthouse vnder purposed stand night get gone morning length hee found doore wall fast shut small store strawe lying gathered together sitting downe thereon pensiuely made many sad complaint saint iulian saying according trust reposed saint iulian taking compassion vpon without ouerlong tarying prouided good lodging shall heare towne chasteau guillaume liued young lady widdow beautifull comely person sildome seene louely creature marquesse azzo dearely affected choysest iewell delight gaue house liue vnder terrace whereof poore rinaldo made shelter chaunced day marquesse come thither according frequent custome weare away night company hauing secretly prepared bath costly supper beside thing ready nothing wanting marquesse presence suddenly post brought letter commanded instantly horsebacke word hee sent lady spare night vrgent occasion called thence hee rode away immediately much discontented lady vnexpected accident knowing spend time resolued vse bath hee made marquesse supper betake selfe rest entred bath close doore poore rinaldo sate stoode bath meanes shee therein heard quiuering moanes complaint seeming swanne singing death whereupon shee called chambermaide saying goe vp aboue looke ouer terrace wall downe doore see hee doth chambermaide went vp aloft little glimmering ayre saw man sitting shirt bare feete legges trembling manner rehearsed shee demaunding whence hee rinaldoes teeth trembled head hardly could hee forme word well could tolde hee hee came thither pittifully entreating shee could affoord helpe suffer starue death colde chambermaide much moued compassion returned lady tolde likewise pittying distresse remembring shee key doore whereby marquesse entred returned intended seene said maide goe open doore softly haue good supper none helpe eate man likely allow one night lodging chambermaide commending lady charitable kindnesse opened doore seeing hee appeared halfe frozen shee said vnto make hast good man get thee bath yet good warme lady selfe came newly whereto gladly condiscended tarrying bidden twise finding himselfe singularly comforted heare thereof euen hee beene restored death life lady sent garment lately deceased husband fitted aptly respect purposely beene made attending expectation know else lady would commaund hee began remember god saint iulian hartily thanking deliuering bad night threatned towards bringing good entertainement lady causing faire fire made neerest chamber beneath went sate selfe demaunding honest man fared madame answered chambermaide deceased lord garment appeareth goodly gentleman questionlesse respectiue birth breeding well deseruing gracious fauour haue afforded goe quoth lady conduct hither sit fire sup mee feare hath sorrie supper rinaldo entred chamber beheld beautifull lady accounting fortune exceede comparison hee humble reuerence expressing much thankefulnesse possibly hee could extraordinary grace fauour lady fixing stedfast eye vpon well liking gentle language behauiour perceiuing also fitly deceased husband apparell formed person resembling familiar respect appeared iudgement farre beyond chambermaides commendation praying sit downe fire shee questioned concerning vnhappy night accident befalne wherein fully resolued shee perswaded reason seruants comming towne night assuring found early morning supper serued table hee seated according lady commanded shee began obserue considerately goodly man compleate perfection person delicate pleasing countenance quicke alluring eye fixed constant wantonly gadding iouiall youthfulnesse time truest temper amorous apprehension battering ensignes bulwarke strong resistance wrought strangely vpon flexible affection though hee fed heartily occasion constrained yet thought entertained new kinde diet digested onely eye yet cunningly concealed motiue immodesty could discerned mercy thus extended misery drew table discourse birth education parent friend alies wealthy possession merchandize aud sound stability estate aboue best single sole condition batch ler apt easie steele strike fire especially vpon quicke taking tinder time fauoured fortune imbarment remained remembrance marquesse summond aduised consideration youth beauty stood vp conscious accuser blemishing honour faire repute lewd luxurious life farre vnfit lady degree well worthy generall condemnation say vpon short conference chambermaide repentance sinne past solemne promise constant conuersion thus shee deliuered minde rinaldo sir haue related fortune casuall happening hither like motion well shee make deceased lord husband liuing perfectly person house mine widow become wife except vnmanly denie rinaldo hearing word proceeding lady absolute perfection presuming vpon proud offer condemning himselfe folly refuse thus replied madam considering stand bound euer hereafter confesse gracious preseruer life way able returne requitall please shadow mine insufficiency accept fairest fortune doe seruice let die thought deniall way yeeld least discontentment wanted priest ioyne hand mutuall affection already done heart sealed infinite kiss chambermaide called vp friar roger confessor wedding bedding effected bright morning briefe marquesse hauing heard marriage mislike confirmed great honourable gift hauing sent dishonest seruant dispatched sound reprehension ferrara letter rinaldoes father friend accident befalne moreouer morning three theeues robbed ill entreated rinaldo another facte night committed taken brought towne chasteau guillaume hanged offence rinaldo wife rode ferrara three young gentleman brother hauing spent land possession vainely became poore nephew falling almost desperate condition became acquainted abbot afterward found king england daughter made husband marriage recompencing vncles loss seating againe good estate third nouell wherein declared danger prodigalitie manifold mutability fortune fortune rinaldo de este heard lady gentleman admired happinesse commended deuotion saint lian extreame necessity sent good succour lady blamed leauing base liberty conuerting chaste embrace marriage bed dignity woman honour eternall disgrace liuing otherwise thus descanted happy night betweene rinaldo madam pampinea sitting next philostratus considering discourse must follow order thinking shee say queene sooner sent command shee lesse faire forward beganne manner lady great respect conferre accident fortune much remaineth consider mutability wherein need wonder discreetly obserue thing fondly tearme owne power consequently change one another without stay arrest according concealed iudgement setled order least bee knowne v although thing appeare thus daily v euen apparantly occasion hath beene discerned precedent discourse yet notwithstanding seeing pleaseth queene argument ayme end adde former tale another owne perhaps vnprofitable hearer vnpleasing obseruation sometime heeretofore dwelt citie knight named signior thebaldo according report issued family lamberti others deriue agolanti guiding perhaps opinion heerein traine child belonging saide thebaldo euermore equall agolanti matter else setting aside two house came say time welthy knight three sonnes first named lamberto second thebaldo third agolanto goodly gracefull youth howbeit eldest compleated eighteene yeares signior thebaldo father deceased left good inheritance seeing selues rich read e monies reuennewes without gouernment owne voluntary disposition kept restraint vpon expences maintained many seruants store vnvalewable horse beside hawkes hound open house commers onely delight else fit gentleman vanity beside best agreed wanton youthfull appetite long run race treasure lefte father began greatly diminish reuennewes suffised support lauish expences begun fell engaging pawning inheritance selling one day another morrow saw themselues quickly come nothing pouerty opened eye prodigality closed vp heereupon lamberto day calling brother shewed honor father beene height wealth amounted ebbe pouerty falne onely thorow inordinate expences wherefore hee counselled best could misery insulted ouer make sale small remainder left betake themselues vnto abiding fairer fortune might chance shine vppon aduice preuailed without taking leaue body solemnity closest secrecy departed florence tarrying place vntill arriued england comming city london taking small house vpon yearly rent liuing little charge possible might began lend money vse wherein fortune fauourable yeares gathered great summe mony mean whereof came passe one one afterward another returned backe againe florence summes great part inheritance redeemed many bought beside linking themselues marriage yet continuing vsances england sent nephew thither named alessandro yong man faire demeanor maintaine stocke employment three remained still florence growing forgetful former misery fell againe vnreasonable expences euer neuer respecting houshold charge good credite among merchant monies still sent alessandro supported expences diuers yeares dealing alessandro england grew great hee lent much money many gentleman lord baron land vpon engagement manours castle reuennues whence deriued immeasurable benefite three brother held lauish expences borrowing money wanted vntill supplyes came england whereon indeede onely dependance fortuned contrary opinion al men warre happened betweene king england one sonnes occasioned much trouble whole countrey taking part either side sonne father regard whereof castle place pawned alessandro sodainely seized nothing remaining returned profit liuing hope day day peace would concluded betweene father sonne neuer doubted thing restored principall interest therfore would depart country three brother florence bounding within limites disordered spending borrowed daily yeares creditor seeing effect hope com credit lost repayment promised due imprisoned landes suffising pay moity debt body remained prison rest theyr wiues yong child sent thence one village another nothing expected pouerty misery life euer honest alessandro awaited long time peace england perceyuing likelyhood considering also beside tarrying vaine recouer due danger life without deferring hee set away italy came passe issued foorth bruges hee saw yong abbot also iourneying thence cloathed white accompanied diuers monkes great traine conducting needefull carriage two ancient knight kinsman king followed alessandro acquainted himselfe hauing formerly known kindly accepted company alessandro riding along courteously requested know monk rode traine attending whereto one knight thus answered rideth yong gentleman kinsman newly elected abbot one best abbeyes england yong yeares decree dignity doe allow trauaile rome entreat holy father youth may dispensed withall confirmed sayd dignity hee speake word person rode new abbot sometimes traine while see great lord vse ride vpon highwayes chanced day alessandro rode somewhat neere abbot stedfastly beholding perceiued verie comely young man affable louely gracious euen first encounter hadde neuer seene man better pleased calling little closer began conferre familiarly demanding whence came whether trauelled alessandro imparted freely affaire euery thing satisfying demand offering although power small doe seruice could abbot heard gentle answer wisely discreetly deliuered considering also particularly commendable cariage tooke least wellborne gentleman far differing owne loggerheaded traine wherfore taking compassion great misfortune comforted kindly wishing liue alwayes good hope hee vertuous honest surely attaine seate whence fortune throwne rather much higher entreating also seeing iournied towards tuscany himselfe like continue stil pleased company alessandro humbly thanked gracious comfort protesting would alwaies ready doe whatsoeuer commanded abbot riding newer crochet braine hee sight alessandro fortuned diuers dayes trauaile came small countrey village affoorded little store lodging yet abbot would need lye alessandro well acquainted host house willed prouide abbot people lodge hee thought meetest abbot comming thither harbinger marshalled matter prouided traine village one place others elsewhere best maner towne could yeelde abbot supt great part night spent euery one else rest alessandro demaunded host prouision made hee lodged night good sadnesse sir quoth host see house full guest people must gladly sleepe table bench neuerthelesse next adioyning lord abbot chamber certaine cornlofts whether closely bring making shift slender palletbed may serue one night insted better mine host quoth alessandro passe thorow lord chamber little would allowe lodging monkes remembred much said host curtaines drawne could haue lodgd monkes cornlofts might haue slept feare lord curtaines close drawne hee sleepeth doubt soundly conueigh thither quietly enough without least disturbance palletbed shal fitted alessandro perceyuing might bee easilie done disease offered abbot accepted willingly went thither without noyse lord abbot whose thoughtes busied amorous desire sleepe could enter eye heard talke betweene host alessandro also hee appointed lodge wherefore sayd himselfe seeing fortune hath fitted propitious time compasse happines heart desire know reason refuse perhaps shall neuer haue like offer againe euer enabled opportunity fully determined prosecute intention perswading himselfe also silence night bestowed sleepe rest lowe trembling voyce called alessandro aduising come lye downe faint excuse putting cloaths lay downe abbot little prowde gracious fauour abbot laying arme ouer others body began imbrace hugge euen amorous friend prouoked earnest affection vse whereat alessandro much maruayling italian himselfe fearing least folly abbot would conuert foule dishonest action shrunk modestly abbot perceiuing doubting least alessandro would depart leaue pleasantly smiling bashfull behauiour baring stomack tooke alessandroes hand laying thereon saide alessandro let bad thought bestiall abuse farre thee feele resolue thee feare alessandro feeling abbot brest found two pretty little mountainets round plumpe smooth appearing beene polished iuory whereby perceiued abbot woman setting edge youthfull desire made fall embracing immediately offered kisse shee somewhat rudely repulsing halfe offended saide alessandro forbeare boldnesse vpon thy liues perill thou presume touch vnderstand shall tell thee thou perceiuest man woman departing virgin father house trauelling towards pope holinesse end bestow mariage day first beheld thee whether proceeded thy happinesse fortune fatall houre owne infelicity euer know conceiued effectuall kinde liking towards thee neuer woman loue man truly doe thee hauing sworne within soule make thee husband thou wilt accept mee thy wife set locke vpon thy lippes concerning thou hast heard depart hence thine owne bed againe doubt strange newes alessandro seemed meerely miracle shee knew regard traine company hee reputed noble rich also shee wonderfull faire beautifull owne fortune stood future expectation kinsman ouerthrow great loss england wherefore vpon opportunity fairely offered hee held wisedome returne refusall accepted gracious motion referred disposing shee arising bed called little table standing hung faire crucifix vpon wall calling witnesse suffered bitter cruell torment crosse putting ring vpon finger faithfully espoused refusing world onely either side confirmed solemnely holy vow chaste kiss shee commanded backe chamber shee returned bed againe sufficiently satisfied loues acceptation iournied till came rome rested themselues dayes supposed abbot two knight none else company alessandro went pope hauing done reuerence beseemed abbot began speake manner holy father know much better euery one desireth liue well vertuously ought shunne farre lieth occasion may induce contrary ende therefore desire nothing liue within compasse vertuous conuersation may perfect hope behalfe haue fled father court come hither habite see craue therein holy fatherly furtherance daughter king england haue sufficiently furnished selfe treasure holinesse may bestow marriage mine vnkind father neuer regarding youth beauty inferior natiue country would marry king northwales aged impotent sickly man yet let tell sanctity age weakenesse hath much occasioned flight feare mine owne youth frailety married instead loyall vnstained life lewd dishonest desire might make wander breaking diuine lawes wedlocke abusing royall blood father trauailed hither vertuous intention lord onely knoweth perfectly best fitting creature presented mine eye doubt meere mercy goodnesse man meete husband pointing alessandro young gentleman standing whose honest vertuous ciuill demeanour deserueth lady farre greater worth although perhaps nobility blood denied may make seeme excellent one deriued royall discent holy religious vowes haue past betweene v ring finger firme pledge faith constancie neuer accept man marriage onely although father else doe dislike wherefore holy father principall cause comming hither already effectually concluded desire compleat rest pilgrimage visiting sanctified place city whereof great plenty also sacred marriage contracted presence god onely betweene alessandro selfe may publiquely confirmed open congregation seeing god hath appointed soules haue solemnely vowed disaster whatsoeuer alter god vicar earth hope gainesay confirme fatherly benediction wee may liue god feare dye fauour perswade selues faire lady alessandro meane admiration hee heard wife daughter king england vnspeakeable ioy questionlesse wholly ouercame two knight little troubled offended strange vnexpected accident yea violent passion beene else pope presence alessandro felt fury perhaps princesse selfe side pope much amazed habite went disguised likewise election husband perceiuing resistance made hee yeelded willingly satisfie desire therefore hauing first comforted two knight made peace betweene princesse alessandro gaue order rest done appointed day solemnity come hee caused princesse cloathed rich royall garment appeare cardinal many great person presence come worthy feast hee caused purposely prepared seemed faire goodly lady euery eye highly delighted behold commending mean admiration like manner alessandro greatly honored two knight sumptuous appearance like man lent money vsury rather royall quality pope himselfe celebrating marriage betweene finished magnificent pompe could deuised hee gaue benediction licenced departure thence alessandro princesse traine thus leauing rome would needes visite florence newes accident long noysed receiued citizen royall manner shee deliuer three brother prison hauing first payed debt reseated againe wiues former inheritance possession afterward departing florence agolanto one vncles trauailing paris also honourably entertained king france whence two knight went england preuailed succesfully king hee receiued daughter grace fauour also sonne law husband hee gaue order knighthoode greater dignitie created earle cornewall noble spirit alessandro pacified trouble betweene king sonne whereon ensued great comfort kingdome winning loue fauour people agolanto meanes alessandro recouered due brother england returning richly home florence counte alessandro kinsman hauing first dubd knight long time hee liued peace tranquility faire princesse wife prouing absolute wisedome famous souldier report assistance father law hee conquered realme ireland crowned king thereof landolpho ruffolo falling pouerty became pirate sea taken genewayes hardly escaped drowning yet neuerthelesse vpon little chest coffer full rich iewels caried thereon corfu well entertained good woman afterward returned richly home owne house fourth nouell whereby may discerned many danger man may fall couetous desire enrich himselfe madame lauretta sitting next madame pampinea seeing triumphantly shee finished discourse without attending thing else spake thus gracious lady wee shall neuer behold mine opinion great act fortune see man suddainly exalted euen lowest death pouerty royall estate dignity discourse madame pampinea hath made good happy aduancement alessandro appeareth necessary whosoeuer discourseth subiect proposed way varie termes shall shame tell tale though containe farre greater mishap former may sort happy issue albeit noble magnificent respect may perhaps merit lesse attention howsoeuer fault shall found meane discharge mine owne duty opinion hath made famous long time seacoast rhegium gaieta onely delectable part italy wherein somewhat neere salerno shore looking vpon sea inhabitant dwelling doe call coast malfy full small townes garden spring wealthy men trading many kindes merchandizes people know among townes one named rauello wherein yet day rich people long since wealthy man named landolpho ruffolo contented rich coueting multiply double trebble fell danger loose himselfe wealth together man merchant wont doe hee considered affaire bought goodly ship ading diuers sort merchandizes belonging himselfe onely making voyage isle cyprus found ouer beside merchandizes brought thither many ship arriued laden selfe commodity regard whereof needefull onely make good mart good also constrained hee meant vent commodity sell away almost nothing endangering vtter destruction ouerthrow whereupon grieuing exceedingly great losse knowing doe seeing abundant wealth hee likely fall low pouerty hee resolued dye recompence loss vpon others would returne home poore hauing departed thence rich meeting merchant bought great ship money made thereof also merchandizes hee purchased another lighter vessell apt proper vse pirate arming furnishing ample manner rouing robbing vpon sea thus hee began make men good owne especially turkes tooke much wealth fortune alwayes therein fauourable hee could neuer compasse like trading within space one yeare hee robd taken many gallies turke found himselfe well recouered onely loss merchandize likewise wealth wholly redoubled finding loss liberally required hauing sufficient folly hazard second fall wherefore conferring owne thought finding enough needed couer fully concluded returne home owne house againe liue vpon good thus gotten continuing still feare loss sustained traffique minding neuer imploy mony way keep light vessel holpen wealth commanded men put forth oares shape course owne dwelling aloft higher sea darke night ouertaking mighty winde suddainly comming vpon onely contrary course held impetuous violence small vessell vnable endure made landward speedily expectation friendly wind entred litle port sea directing vp small island safely sheltred selfe port landolpho thus taken refuge entred soone two great carrackes genewayes lately come constantinople men espied small barke lockt vppe passage getting foorth vnderstanding owner name report famed rich determined men euermore addicted naturally couet money spoile make owne prize sea landing store men well armed crossebowes weapon tooke possession place none durst issue forth small barke endangered life dart arrowes entering aboord barke making owne full possession men threw ouerboord without sparing landolpho himselfe mounted one carrackes leauing nothing poore shirt maile backe hauing rifled barke rich sunke bottome sea day following rough windes calmed carrackes set saile agame hauing prosperous passage day long vppon entrance darke night windes blew tempestuously sweld sea rude stormes two carrack sundered violence tempest came passe carracke wherein lay poore miserable landolpho beneath isle cephalonia ran rocke euen glasse wall split carracke peeces good merchandizes floating sea chest coffer bed like thing often hapneth lamentable accident notwithstanding night obscurity impetuous violence billowes could swimme made shift saue liues swimming others caught hold thing fortune fauour floated neerest among distressed landolpho desirous saue life possibly might espied chest coffer ordained doubt meanes safety drowning although day wished death infinite time rather returne home wretched pouerty yet seeing men stroue safety liues helpe neuer little tooke aduantage fauor offred rather necessitie vrgent keeping fast vpon coffer well could driuen wind waues one way anon quite contrarie made shift himselfe till day appeared looking euery way seeing nothing cloud sea coffer one shrunke vnder another supported according windes billowes carried day night thus floated vp downe drinking willingly hee would almost hungerstarued thorow want foode next morning either appointment heauen power windes landolpho wellneere become spundge holding armes strongly chest wee haue doe dreading drowning take hold smallest helpe drew neere vnto shore iland corfu good fortune poore woman scowring dish salt water sand make housewife like neate cleane shee saw chest drawing neere discerning shape man shee grew fearefull retyring cried aloude power speaking neither sight doe smallest seruice euen waues windes pleased chest driuen still neerer land woman perceiued forme cofer looking aduisedly beheld two armes extended ouer afterward shee espied face man able iudge whether aliue moued charitable womanly compassion shee stept among billowes getting fast holde haire head drew chest land calling forth daughter helpe much adoe shee vnfolded armes chest setting vp daughter head betweene landolpho led towne conueyed warme stoue quickly recouered pain strength benummed extreame cold good wine comfortable broathes shee cherished withall sences indifferently restored hee knew place manner brought thither till good woman shewed cofer kept floating vpon waues next vnder god saued life chest seemed slender weight nothing value could expected either recompence woman great paine kindnesse bestowne matter owne benefit neuerthelesse woman absent opened chest found innumerable precious stone therein costly curiously set gold others fixed mettall hauing knowledge great worth value merchant skild matter became much comforted praysing god good successe admirable meanes deliuerance danger considering himselfe short time hee beene twice well buffeted beaten fortune fearing least third mishap might follow like manner hee consulted thought might safest order businesse bring rich booty without perill owne home wherefore wrapping vp iewels vnsightly cloutes suspition conceiued hee saide good woman chest would doe seruice shee pleased lende small sacke bagge shee might keepe cofer house would diuers way stead woman gladly desired landolpho returning infinite thankes louing kindnesse shee affoorded throwing sacke necke passed barke brundusiam thence tranium merchant city bestowed good garment hee acquainting disasterous fortune word concerning last good successe come home safety rauello hee fell knee thanked god mercy towards opening sacke viewing iewels leysure formerly done found great estimation selling ordinary reasonable rate three time richer hee departed first house hauing vented sent great sum money good woman corfu rescued sea saued life danger dreadfull like hee tranium merchant newly cloathed liuing richly vpon remainder neuer aduenturing sea ended dayes wealth honour andrea de piero trauelling perouse naples buy horse space one night surprised three admirable accident hee fortunately escaped rich ring returned home owne house fift nouell comprehending needfull thing man trauelleth affaire world prouident well aduised carefully keepe himselfe crafty deceitfull allurement strumpet precious stone iewels found landolpho maketh mee remember said madam fiammetta next deliuer discourse tale containing lesse peril reported madam lauretta somewhat different one happened sundry yeeres longer time compasse one poore night instantly relate vnto haue heard reported many sometime liued perouse erugia young man named andrea de piero whose profession trade horse nature horsecourser horsemaster hearing good faire market purpose naples put fiue hundred crownes gold purse iourneyed thither company horsecoursers arriuing sunday euening according instruction giuen host went next day horsema ket saw many horse liked cheapening price went vp downe could fall agreement yet manifest came purposely buy cheapener onely oftentimes like shalow brainde trader world shewed purse gold passenger neuer respecting obserued follie came passe young sicillian wench beautifull commaund whosoeuer would small hire passing without perceiuing seeing store gold purse presently said selfe crownes mine foole owes keepe closer went young wanton time olde woman commonly stuffe alwayes attended seeming sicillian also soone shee saw andrea knew leauing youthfull commodity ranne embraced kindly younger lasse perceiued without proceeding stayed see would ensue thereon andrea conferring olde bawde knowing creature declared himselfe affable making promise shee would come drinke lodging breaking speech time shee returned young cammerado andrea went buying horse still cheapning good store buy morning punke taken notice adreaes purse vpon olde woman comming backe hauing formerly studied shee might get gold greater part thereof cunningly questioned man whence hee came occasion businesse wherein fully informed particularly ample manner himselfe could haue done shee long time dwelt sicily father afterward perouse recounting also time came thence cause drawne naples witty young housewife thorowly instructed concerning parent kindred andrea name quality circumstance thereto leading began frame foundation purpose thereupon setting resolution downe constantly purse gold already halfe owne come home owne house away shee sent olde pandresse businesse might hold time long enough employment hinder returning andrea according promise purposing trust serious piece seruice calling young crafty girle well tutoured like ambassages euening drew sent andreas lodging good fortune found sitting alone dore demanding knew honest gentleman lodging whose name signior andrea de piero made answere himselfe man taking aside shee said sir worthy gentlewoman citie would gladly speake pleased vouchsafe much fauour andrea hearing kinde salutation gentlewoman named worth began grow proud owne imagination make meane estimation himselfe vndoubtedly hansome proper man cariage perfection attracted amorous eye gentlewoman induced like loue beyond naples contayning man better merit whereupon answered mayde ready attend mistresse desiring know gentlewoman would speake soone please sir replied damosell tarieth comming owne house instantly andrea without leauing direction departure lodging intended returne againe said girle goe follow little chambercommodity conducted mistress dwelling streete named naupertuis title manifesting sufficiently streetes honesty hee hauing knowledge thereof neither suspecting harme went honest house gentlewoman good respect entred boldly mayde going guiding vp faire payre stayres hauing halfe ascended cunning young queane gaue call mistresse saying signtor andrea come already whereupon appeared stayreshead stayed purposely entertaine young beautifull comely person rich adornements andrea well obseruing seeing descend two three step open armes embrace catching fast hold neck stood man confounded admiration contained cunning kinde silence euen vnable vtter one word seeming hindered extremity ioy presence make effectually admire extraordinary kindnesse hauing teares plenteously commaund intermixed sighes broken speech last thus spake signior andrea welcom friend world sealing salutation infinite sweet kiss embrace whereat wonderfull amazement strangely transported replied madame honour beyond compasse merit taking hand shee guided thorow goodly hall owne chamber delicately embalmed rose orengeflowres pleasing smelles costly bed middest curtained round artificiall picture beautifying walles many embellishment country liberally stored withall meerely nouice kind wanton carriage world free base degenerate conceit firmely perswaded himselfe questionlesse shee lady meane esteeme happy thus respected honoured seated curious chest bed feete teares cunningly trickling downe cheekes sighes intermedled inward sobbing breathed forth sad seemely manner thus shee beganne sure andrea greatly maruell gracing solemne kinde entertainment melt selfe sighes teares man hath knowledge perhaps sildome neuer heard speech shall instantly receiue mee matter augment greater maruell meeting heere owne sister beyond hope expectation either v seeing heauen hath beene gracious let mee see one brother die though gladly would haue seene addition comfort happily thou hast neuer heard plaine truest manner reueale vnto thee piero father thine dwelt long time thou canst chuse haue vnderstood palermo bounty gracious good part remaining much renowned day doubt remembred many louing friend wellwillers among intimately affected piero mother gentlewoman time widow dearest loue forgetting feare father brother yea owne honour became priuately acquainted begotten thou seest afterward occasion befalling father abandon palermo returne perouse left mother little daughter neuer ought could learne remembring either beene father could haue much condemned regard ingratitude mother loue hee ought haue shewne childe borne chambermaide neither city sinner albeit must needes say shee blameworthy without knowledge moued onely thereto loyal affection commit selfe wealth shee hand thing ill done long time since easily controled amended left young palermo growing well neere stature see mother wealthy gaue mee marriage one gergentes family gentleman great reuenewes loue mother went dwelt palermo falling guelphes faction making one enterprize charles king came passe discouered fredericke king arragon intent could put execution whereupon enforced flie sicilie euen hope stood fairely haue beene greatest lady iland packing vp thing wee could take v may well call regard wealthy possession pallaces house land constrained forgoe made recourse city wee found king charles benigne gracious v recompencing greater part loss bestowed land house v beside continuall large pension husband brother law hereafter himselfe shall better acquaint withall thus came hither thus remaine able welcome brother andrea thankes fortune friendlinesse word embraced kissed many time sighing weeping shee andrea hearing fable artificially deliuered composed point point likely protestation without faltring failing one word vtteranee remembring perfectly truth father formerly dwelt palermo knowing also sensible feeling himselfe custome young people easily conquered affection youthfull heate seeing beside teares trembling speech earnest embracing cunning commodity tooke faithfully true thus spoken vpon silence thus replied lady let seeme strange word haue raised maruell indeede knowledge euen neuer seene neuer also hauing heard father speake either mother consideration best knowne himselfe time vsed language either youth defectiue memory since hath vtterly lost truly little ioy comfort finde sister hope expectation also selfe meere stranger speake mind freely perfection gracefully appearing know man great repute quality soeuer may well beseeme acceptance much rather mine meane merchant faire sister desire resolued one thing wit meanes vnderstanding city whereto readily shee returned answer brother poore woman city employ sometimes houshold occasion came morning hauing seene tolde shee dwelt long father palermo perouse held much better beseeming condition haue visit mine owne dwelling come see common inne made bolder send hither word orderly manner shee enquired chiefest kindred friend calling readily proper name according former instruction whereto andrea still made answer confirming thereby beliefe strongly crediting whatsoeuer shee saide farre better conference hauing long time continued heate day somewhat extraordinary shee called greeke wine banquetting stuffe drinking andrea pledging contentedly would haue returned lodging drew neere supper time meanes shee would permit seeming halfe displeased shee saide plainely perceiue brother little account make considering owne sister say neuer saw owne house whether alwayes resort come city would refuse goe sup common inne beleeue brother shall sup although husband home little discontentment yet shall find brother wife bid welcome make good cheere beside andrea confounded extremity courtesie knew say onely thus replied loue sister ought loued accept exceeding kindnesse returne lodging shall wrong mine host guest much sup vntill come quoth shee haue present remedy one seruants shal goe giue warning whereby shall tarry comming albeit might doe great kindnesse send friend sup v assure ye shall finde sister sake bid welcome supper may walke together inne andrea answered friend burthenous seeing shee vrged farre would stay sup referred himselfe solely disposition ceremonious shew made sending seruant inne expecting andreas presence supper though matter performed diuers discoursings table couered variety costly viand placed thereon downe sate feeding plenty curious wine liberally walking darke night arose table andrea offring take leaue would meanes suffer tolde naples citie strict lawes ordinance admitted nightwalker although natiues much lesse stranger punished great seuerity therefore formerly sent word inne expect comming supper like done concerning bed intending giue brother andrea one night lodging easily could affoord hadde done supper newcaught woodcocke verily crediting company owne sister fiordeliza cunningly stile selfe beleefe hee meerely deluded accepted gladly gentle offer concluded stay night supper conference lasted long purposely dilated length great part night might therein wasted leauing andrea chamber lad attend shold lacke nothing woman went lodging thus brother supposed sister parted season somewhat hot soultry andrea put hose doublet beeing shirt alone layed vnderneath bed boulster seeming carefull money finding prouocation house office demanded lad hee might find shewed little doore corner chamber appointing enter safely enough went chanced tread vpon board fastened neither ende ioynts whereon lay pitfall made purpose entrap coxecombe would trained base place lodging board fell downe together draught yet good fortune receiue harme fall although extraordinary height onely filth place ouer full fowly myred better vnderstanding quality place ensued thereupon vnnecessary describe according common vse obserued part narrow passage entrie often see reserued betweene two house eithers benefit needfull place board loosely lay vpon ioynts acquainted withall could easily auoide perill passing stoole newly created brother dreaming find queane sister receiuing foule fall vaulte knowing helpe himselfe sorrowfull beyond measure cryed boy light aide intended giue crafty wag meete attendant honest mistresse sooner heard fallen presently ranne enforme thereof shee speedily returned chamber finding cloathes vnder bed head shee needed instruction search pocket hauing found gold andrea indiscreetely carried alwayes thinking could else safe shee aymed shee ensnared faigning selfe palermo daughter piero perouse regarding longer making fast house office doore shee left miserable taking poore andrea perceiuing calles could get answer lad cryed louder purpose seeing owne simplicity vnderstanding error though somewhat late hee made meanes constrainedly got ouer wall seuered foule sinke world eye open streete went doore house knew well cost making loude exclaimes rapping knocking fruitlesse sorrowing exceedingly manifestly beholding misfortune ala quoth soone haue lost sister fiue hundred crownes besides many word loude calles beating vpon doore without intermission neighbour finding themselues diseased vnable endure ceaselesse vexation rose bed called desiring gone let rest maide also house looking forth window seeming newly raised sleepe called saying noyse beneath virgin answered andrea know andrea de piero brother mistresse fiordeliza thou art drunken knaue replied maide full drinke wit goe sleepe goe sleepe come againe morrow know andrea de piero neither hath mistresse brother get thee gone good man suffer v sleepe pray thee quoth andrea doest thou vnderstand say thou knowest supt thy mistresse night sicilian kindred soone forgot pray thee giue cloathes left chamber gladly get mee gone hereat maide laughing aloude saide surely man mad walketh streetes dreame clasping fast window away shee went left could andrea assure himselfe gold cloathes past recouery mouing impatience former intercession became conuerted fury hee could compasse faire entreats entended winne outrage violence taking vp great stone hand hee layed vpon doore powerfull stroke neighbour hearing molestation still admitting least respite rest reputing troublesome fellow vsed counterfet word onely disturbe mistresse house dwelled neere looking againe windowes altogether began rate reproue euen like many bawling curres barking strange dog passing thorow streete shamefull villany quoth one suffered honest woman thus molested house foolish idle word vnseasonable time night god sake good man gone let v sleepe thou haue thing say gentlewoman house come morrow day time doubt shee make thee sufficient answer andrea somewhat pacified speech shaghairde swashbuckler grimvisagde ruffian sildome bawdy house without swaggering champion seene heard andrea house rapping two three terrible oathes opened casement stearne dreadfull voyce demaunded durst keepe noyse beneath andrea fearefully looking vp little glimmering moone seeing rough fellow blacke beard strowting like quilles porcupine patch face hurt receiued honest quarels yawning also stretching angry haue sleepe disturbed trembling quaking answered gentlewoman brother house ruffian interrupting speaking fiercely sealing word horrible oathes said sirra rascall know whence thou art come downe thee bombast thy prating coxcombe thou neuer better beaten thy life like drunken slaue beast thou art night wilt let v sleepe hee clapt window againe neighbour well acquainted ruffian rude condition speaking gentle manner andrea said shift thy selfe good man time tarrie comming downe thee except thou art wearie thy life gone therefore say thou hast friendly warning word dismaying andrea much stearne oathes vgly sight ruffian incited also neighbour counsell imagined aduise charitable manner caused depart thence taking way homeward inne meane affliction torment minde monstrous abuse offered losse money well remembred passage whereby day young girle guided loathsome smell extreamely offensiue himselfe desiring wash sea side strayed farre wide contrary hand wandring vp streete called ruga gatellana proceeding still euen highest part citie hee espied lanthorne light also man carrying another man company comming towards suspected two watch person would apprehend slept aside shunne entred olde house hard hand men intention place going without knowledge andreaes one layd downe diuers instrument yron brought thither backe much talke fellow concerning engine last one said smell abhominable stinke euer felt life lifting vp lanthorne espied poore pittifull andrea closely couched behinde wall sight somewhat affrighting yet boldly demaunded hee whereto andrea aunswered nothing lay still held peace neerer drew towards light demaunding hee came thither filthy manner constraint hauing euasion necessity must hee related whole aduenture sort befalne greatly pittying misfortune one said questionlesse villanie done house scarabone buttafuoco turning andrea proceeded thus good faith poore man albeit thou hast lost thy money yet art thou highly beholding fortune falling though foule place yet succesfull manner entring backe house beleeue mee friend thou hadst falne quietly gone sleepe house sleepe beene thy last world thy money thou hadst lost thy life likewise teares lamentation helplesse easily mayest thou plucke starres firmament get gaine least doyt thy losse shaghaird slaue house thy deathsman vnderstand thou makest enquiry thy money thus admonished began also manner comfort honest fellow cannot pitty thy present condition wherfore thou wilt friendly associate v businesse wee instantly going effect thy losse hath beene great word wee warrant thee thine immediate gaine shall farre exceede man desperate extremity well like allow especially carrieth apparance present comfort fared andrea hee perswaded himselfe worse already happened could befall therefore would gladly aduenture selfe day preceding disastrous night andrea chiefe church citie beene buried archbishop naples named signior philippo minutulo richest pontificall roabes ornament ruby finger valued worth fiue hundred duckets gold dead body purposed rob rifle acquainting andrea whole intent whose necessity coupled couetous desire made forward well aduised ioyne sacriligious enterprise went towards great church andreaes vnsauourie perfume much displeasing wherevpon one said fellow deuise ease foule noysome inconuenience
