smell meanes betray v wellpit hard answered pulley bucket descending downe may wash filthinesse wellpit came found rope pulley hanging ready bucket safety taken away whereon concluded fasten rope let downe wellpit washed himselfe hee wagge rope would draw vp againe accordingly forthwith performed came passe hee thus washing himselfe wellpit watch citie walking round finding hote sweltring night grew dry thirsty therefore went well drinke two men perceiuing watch neere vpon left andrea pit shift himselfe running away shelter themselues flight discouered watch comming wellpit andrea remained still bottome hauing cleansed himselfe well hee could sate wagging rope expecting hee haled vp dumbe signe watch discerned sitting downe well side layde downe billes weapon tugging draw vp rope thinking bucket fastened thereto full water andrea haled vp pit brim left holding rope longer catching fast hold hand better safety watch sight heereof greatly affrighted thinking dragd vp spirit daring speake one word ranne away hast could make andrea hereat little amazed taken good hold brim might haue falne bottome doubtlesse life perished come forth well treading billes halbards well knew companion brought thither meruaile much encreased ignorance feare still seizing silent bemoaning many misfortune away thence wandred hee wist whither went met two fellowes purposely returned drag well seeing intent already performed desired know done wherein andrea could resolue rehearsing hee could weapon hee found lying well whereat smiled knowing watch haled vp feare left declared reason returne leauing talke midnight went great church finding entrance easie approached neere tombe great marble couerstone weighty yet crowes yron help raised high man might without perill passe began question one another three enter tombe said first said second answered andrea two heard caught fast hold saying wilt thou goe tombe aduised thou sayest thou wilt goe beat thee one yron crowes thou shalt neuer goe church aliue thus poore andrea still made property fortune fatall night haue foole delighting hourly disaster feare fury make obedient graue go within thus consults himselfe cunning companion suppose simple make enter tombe hauing absolute intention deceiue haue giuen rich finde ready come forth mine equall portion away runne owne safety leauing onely shall loose right among must remaine danger may follow hauing thus meditated resolued make sure owne share first remembring rich ring whereof tolde forthwith hee tooke archbishop finger finding indifferently fitte owne afterward hee tooke crosse miter rich garment gloues leauing nothing shirt giuing seuerall parcel protesting nothing else stil pressed vpon affirming ring beside vrging search diligently yet still answered hee could finde longer tarying seemed serched carefully appeared purpose two fellowes cunning craft third could still willed search watching aptest opportunity tooke away prop supported tombestone running thence got booty left poore andrea mewed vp graue perceiued saw misery exceede rest farre easier guesse greefe way able expresse head shoulder yea vtmost strength employeth remoue ouerheauy hinderer liberty labour beeing spent vaine sorrow threw swoond vpon byshoppes dead body might instant haue bene obserued archbyshops dead body andrea greefe dying hardly bene distinguished sens regaining former office among silent complaint consideration presented choyse two vnauoydable extremity dye staruing must tombe putrifaction dead body man came open graue must apprehended sacrilegious theefe hanged according lawes case prouided continued strange affliction minde sodainely hee heard noise church diuers men imagined came like businesse hee fellowes vndertaken wherein iot deceiued albeit feare augmented hauing opened tombe supported stone varied also among themselues entrance indiffrent contended length priest one company boldly said whiteliuerd rascal affraid thinke eate dead men cannot bite therefore selfe go hauing thus spoken prepared entrance tombe order thrust feete easier descending downe andrea sitting vpright tombe desiring make vse happy opportunity caught priest fast one legges making shew meant dragge downe priest felt cryed aloud getting hast could make companion well neere frighted wit ranne away amaine bene followed thousand diuels andrea little dreaming fortunate successe made meanes get graue afterward forth church place entred began daylight appeare hee hauing rich ring finger wandred hee knew whether till comming seaside found way directing inne company host bene carefull hauing related manifold mischance hoste friendly aduised speede get naples instantly returning home perouse hauing aduentured fiue hundred crownes ring wherewith hee purposed haue bought horse according intent iourney thither madame beritola caracalla found island two goates hauing lost two sonnes thence trauailed lunigiana one sonnes became seruant lord thereof found somewhat ouerfamiliar master daughter therefore caused bee imprisoned afterward country sicily rebelled k charles aforesaid sonne chanced knowne mother married master daughter brother found likewise returned great estate credit sixt nouell heerein men admonished neuer distrust powerfull hand heauen fortune seemeth aduerse lady gentleman also hauing smiled sufficiently seuerall accident befall poore traueller andrea reported large madame fiametta lady aemillia seeing tale fully concluded began commandement queene speake manner diuersitie change alteration fortune great must need greeuous often take occasion talk often awake quicken vnderstandings auouching easie matter depend vpon flattery opinion heare recounted ought way offend v men wretched fortunate instrust one good aduise animate comfort therefore although great occasion haue beene already related yet purpose tell tale lesse true lamentable albeit sorted successefull ending yet notwithstanding many bitter thwarting hardly beleeue euer sorrow ioyfully sweetened must vnderstand gracious lady death fredericke second emperour one named manfred crowned king sicilie liued great account authority neapolitane gentleman called henriet capece wife beautifull gentlewoman neapolitane also named madam beritola caracalla henriet held gouernment kingdome sicilie vnderstanding king charles first wonne battle beneuentum slaine king maufred whole kingdome reuolting also deuotion little trust reposed sicillians willing subiect himselfe lord enemy prouided secret flight thence discouered sicillians many beene loyall seruants king manfred suddenly taken imprisoned king charles sole possession iland confirmed madam beritola knowing sudden strange alteration state affaire become husband fearing also greatly inconueniences afterward followed ouercome many passionate consideration hauing left forsaken good going aboard small barke sonne aged eight yeeres named geoffrey growne great childe another shee fled thence lipary shee brought bed another sonne shee named answerable hard fortune poore expelled hauing prouided selfe nurse altogether went aboard againe setting sayle naples visit parent chanced quite contrary expectation stormie windes weather vessell bound naples hurried ile ponzo entring small port sea concluded make aboade till time furtherous fauour voyage rest madam boritola goe shore iland hauing found separate solitary place fit silent sad meditation secretly selfe shee sorrowed absence husband resorting daily sad exercise continuing complaint vnseene marriners whosoeuer else arriued suddenly galley pyrates seazing small barke carried rest away beritola finished wofull complaint daily shee accustomed doe shee returned backe child againe finding person remaining whereat wondered little immediately suspecting happened indeede lent lookes sea saw galley yet gone farre drawing smaller vessell heereby plainly perceyued lost child formerly shee done husband left poore forsaken miserable knowing finde againe calling husband child shee fell downe swound vppon shore body neere coole water remedy helpe recouery lost power wherefore spirites might freely wander pleasure returned backe againe wonted office body drowned teares wringing hand shee nothing call child husband straying hope finde seeking caues dennes euery else presented verie least glimpse comfort saw paine sort purpose darke night drawing swiftly hope dismay raising infinit perturbation made yet somewhat respectiue selfe therefore departing seashore returned solitary place vsed sigh mourne alone selfe night ouerpast infinite feares affright bright day saluting world againe expence nine hour fell former fruitlesse trauailes somewhat sharply bitten hunger former day night shee hadde tasted food made therefore benefit necessity fed green hea be well could notwithout many piercing affliction become extraordinary misery shee walked pensiue meditation saw goate enter caue within come forth againe wandering along thorow wood whereupon stayed entred saw beast issue forth found two yong kid yeaned seemed selfesame day sight pleasing nothing distresse could content yet milke freshly running brest reason late deliuery childbed wherefore shee lay downe vnto two yong kid taking tenderly armes suffered sucke teate whereof made refusall tooke louingly dammes time forward made distinguishing betweene damme thus vnfortunate lady hauing found company solitary desert fed hearbes root drinking faire running water weeping silently selfe often remembred husband child former dayes past much better maner shee resolued liue dye last depriued damme yonger kid also theyr wandering neere adioyning wood according naturall inclination whereby poore distressed lady became sauage wilde daily condition otherwise shee would haue bene many monthes ouerpassed place tooke landing chance arriued another small vessell certaine pisans remained diuers dayes bark gentleman named conrado de marchesi malespini holy vertuous wife returned backe pilgrimage hauing visited sanctified place kingdome apulia bound homeward owne abiding gentleman expelling melancholy perturbation one especiall day amongst wife seruants waiting hound wandered vp iland far place madam beritolaes desert dwelling hound questing game last happened two kiddes feeding time attained indifferent growth finding themselues thus pursued hound fled part wood caue beritola remained seeming sought rescued sodainly caught vp staffe forced hound thence flight time conrado wife followed closely hound come thither seeing hapned looking lady become blacke swarthy meager hairy wondered little great deale vpon req est conrado checkt back hound preuailed much earnest intreaties know reason liuing intirely related quality vnfortunate accident strange determination liuing gentleman heard well knew husband compassion forced teares eye earnestly laboured kinde perswasions alter cruel deliberation making honourable offer conducting home owne dwelling shee remaine noble respect owne sister without parting till fortune smile fairely euer done gentle offer could preuaile gentleman left wife company saying would go fetch foode garment rent torne hee woulde bring wiues doubting winne thence wife abode beritola much bemoaning great disaster viand garment brought extremity intercession caused put also feede albeit protested shee would part thence place knowledge taken end perswaded go lunigiana carrying also two yong goat damme caue altogether prettily playing beritola great admiration conrado wife also seruants attending windes weather grew fauourable madam beritola went aboard conrado wife followed two young goates damme name bee knowne none conrado wife onely shee would stiled otherwise goatherdesse merrily yet gently blew gale brought enter riuer macra going shore owne castell beritola kept company wife conrado mourning habite wayting gentlewoman honest humble dutifull goates alwayes familiarly keeping company returne wee pyrates ponzo seized small barke wherein madam beritola brought thither carried thence away without sight knowledge spoiles taken shaped course geneway consent patrones galley made diuision booty came passe among thing nurse attended beritola two child fell share one messer gasparino doria sent together owne house employed seruice seruants nurse weeping beyond measure losse lady bemoaning owne miserable fortune whereinto shee fallen two young laddes long lamenting shee found vtterly fruitlesse none effect though vsed seruant poore woman yet shee wise discreetly aduised wherefore comforting selfe well could considering depth disaster shee conceited thus child knowne might redounde greater danger shee way aduantaged thereby hereupon hoping fortune early late would alter stearne malice might liued regaine former condition shee would disclose one whatsoeuer till shee see time aptly disposed thus determined questioned concerning answered owne childrenor grannotto da prochyta naming eldest geoffrey iehannot de procida youngest shee cared greatly changing name therefore wisely enformed geoffrey vpon reason shee altered name danger might fall otherwise discouered satisfied thus telling remembring thereof often gentle youth well instructed wise carefull nurse warily obserue two young laddes poorely garmented much worse hosed shodde continued thus house gasparino nurse long time imployed base drudging office yet endured admirable patience iehannot aged already sixteene yeeres hauing loftier spirit belonged slauish seruant despising basenesse seruile condition departed drudgery messer gasparino going aboard gallies bound alexandria fortuned many place yet none affoording aduancement ende three foure houres departure gasparino braue young man goodly forme vnderstood father supposed dead yet liuing captiuity prisoner king charles wherefore despairing successefull fortune hee wandred till came lunigiana strange accident became seruant messer conrado malespina seruice proued well liking sildome time hee sight mother shee alwayes kept company conradoes wife yet came within view shee knew much yeeres altered wont saw last iehannot thus seruice messer conrado fortuned daughter named spina widdow one messer nicolas grignan returned home father house beautifull amiable shee young likewise aged little aboue sixteene growing wonderously amorous iehannot extraordinary feruent manner loue long without full effect continuing many mo eths person could perceiue making build assurance began carrie meanes lesse discretion required nice case cannot prouidently managed vpon day shee walking goodly wood plentifully furnished spreading tree hauing outgone rest company made choise pleasant place daintily shaded beautified sort floures spent sometime amorous discourse beside sweete embrace though seemed ouershort yet vnaduisedly prolonged sudden surprized first mother next messer conrado himselfe greeuing beyond measure thus trecherously dealt withall caused apprehended three seruants without telling reason ledde bound another castle fretting extremity rage concluded minde shamefully put death mother regardlesse daughter hauing heard angry word husband hee would reuenged faultie could endure seuere wherefore although shee likewise much afflicted minde reputed daughter worthy great offence cruell punishment yet shee hasted displeased husband began entreate would runne furious spleene aged yeares murtherer owne childe soile hand blood seruant rather might finde milde course satisfaction anger committing close imprisonment remaine mourne follie committed vertuous religious lady alledged many commendable example vsed plenty moouing perswasions quite altred minde putting death commanded onely separately bee imprisoned little store foode lodging vneasiest vntill hee otherwise determine done life captiuity continuall teares stricter abstinence needefull must commit consideration iehannot spina remaining comfortlesse condition whole yeere outworne yet conrado keeping thus still imprisoned came passe pedro king arragon meanes messer iohn de procida caused isle sicily reuolt tooke away king charles whereat conrado ghibbiline faction little reioyced iehannot hauing intelligence therof custody breathing foorth vehement sigh spake manner ala poore miserable wretch haue already gone begging world aboue fourteene yeares expectation nothing else opportunity come must prison end neuer hope future happinesse get forth prison except death onely replied officer guard doth businesse great king concerne thee affaire hast thou sicily iehannot sighed extreamly returned answer thinkes heart quoth hee doth cleaue sunder call minde charge father although little boy fled thence yet well remember sawe gouernour time king manfred liued guard pursuing still purpose demanded father father replyed iehannot may securely speake perill neerely concerned beene discouered named still liuing henriet capece name geoffrey iehannot make doubt vvere free hence might returned home sicily sake placed authority honest man guard without seeking information soone could compasse leysure reported messer conrado hauing heard newes albeit made shew therof reuealer went madam beritola graciously demaunding sonne husband called geoffrey lady replyed teares eldest sonne yet liuing hee named aged two twenty yeares conrado hearing imagined man considering withall fell proue might haue better meanes mercie closely concealing daughter shame ioyfully ioyne marriage together hereupon secretly caused iehannot brought examining particularly passed life finding manifest argument name truly geoffrey eldest son henriet capece spake alone manner iehannot thou knowest great iniuries thou hast done deare daughter gently entreating thee became good honest seruant thou shouldest alwayes haue bin respectiue mine honor appertain vnto many noble gentlewoman sustaining wrog thou hast offred would haue procured thy shameful death pitty compassion wil suffer wherfore seeing thou informest thou art honorably deriued father mother giue end thine anguish euen thy self art pleased releasing thee misery captiuity wherein haue long time kept thee one instant reduce thine honor mine compleat perfection thou knowest daughter spina thou hast embraced kindnesse friend although farre vnfitting thee widow mariage great good manner condition thou indifferently knowest art ignorant father mother concerning thine owne estate purpose speake thing therefore thou wilt determined whereas thou hast immodestly affected shall become thy honest wife accepting thee son remain long please imprisonment somewhat mishapen iehannot outward forme impaired iot noble spirit really deriued famous progenitor much lesse true loue bare faire friend although earnestly desired conrado franckly offered power onely bestow yet could cloude part greatnesse resolued iudgement thus replied lord affectation rule desire wealthy possession matter whatsoeuer could neuer make traytor haue loued loue euer shal loue beautious daughter treason freely cofesse wil die thousand death else shal enforce denie hold highly worthy loue haue bin vnmanerly became according opinion vulgar iudgment haue committed error euermore attendant vpon youth denie denie youth also reuerend age would remember young measure others offence would thought great greeuous many account mine comitted friend enemy make offer willingly haue alwayes desired thought would haue bin granted long since humbly requested much acceptable would haue bin much stood hope forward word doe witnesse feede mee fruitlesse expectation rather send backe prison lay many affliction mee please endeared loue daughter spina maketh mee loue sake hardly soeuer entreate bindeth greater reuerence father fairest friend messer conrado hearing word stood one confounded admiration reputing man lofty spirit affection feruent daughter little liking wherefore embracing kissing cheeke without longer dallying hee sent like manner daughter restraint prison made lookes ager pale wanne weake shee also person farre differing woman shee wont affection iehannot presence father free consent either contracted man wife espousal agreed according custome dayes without one knowledge done hauing furnished thing fit purpose time aptly seruing mother partaker ioy called wife madam beritola first spake manner say madam cause see eldest son long since married one daughter whereunto beritola thus replied lord say nothing else vnto shall much obliged already much rather let see thing dearer mine owne life rendring vnto mee manner speake recall backe part former lost hope word teares streamed aboundantly eye turning wife saide deare loue shew sonne law thinke sir quoth shee pleaseth must shall satisfie gentleman beggar well said madam answered messer conrado hope within dayes make ioyfull amorous couple recouered former feature honourable garment prepared priuately thus said geoffrey beyond ioy already thou art inriched withall would please thee meet thine owne mother cannot beleeue sir replied geoffrey greeuous misfortune haue suffered liue long yet notwithstanding heauen hath beene merciful ioyes incomparable gracious counsell might well hope recouer meane happinesse sicilie within mother sent transported vnspeakable ioyes beheld lately maried couple also much amazed could guesse inspiration guided conrado extraordinary benignity ioyning iehannot mariage spina hereupon madam beritola remembring speech conrado began obserue aduisedly hidden vertue long silently slept ioy spirit awaked calling minde lineatures sonnes infancy without awaiting demonstration shee folded armes earnest affection motherly ioy pitty contended violently together shee able vtter one word sensitiue vertues closely combined euen dead shee fell downe armes sonne wondering greatly thereat making better recollection thought well remember often seene castell without knowledge neuerthelesse meere instinct nature whose power action declares selfe highly predominant soule assured shee mother blaming vnderstanding beene better aduised threw armes wept exceedingly afterward louing paine conradoes wife also daughter spina madam beritola recouered passionate trance vitall spirit executing office againe fell embracing sonne kissing infinite time teares speech motherly kindnesse likewise expressing dutifull humanity ceremonious courtesy passed ouer ouer little ioy beholder beside repetition seuerall misfortune messer conrado made knowne friend glad new alliance made honoured many solemn magnificent feasting concluded geoffrey hauing found fit place opportunity conference new created father without sinister opposition began followeth honourable father haue raised contentment highest degree haue heaped also many gracious fauours noble mother finall conclusion nothing may remaine vneffected consisteth power performe would humbly entreate honour mother company feast making would gladly also haue brother present messer gasparino oria haue heretofore told questing common pyrate sea tooke v sent v home house slaues yet detaineth would haue likewise send one sicilie informing himselfe amply state country may vnderstand become henriet father whether liuing remaine aliue know condition secretly instructed thing returne backe againe motion made geoffrey pleasing conrado without reference leysure hee dispatched thence two discreete person one geneway sicilie went geneway hauing met gasparino earnestly entreated behalfe conrado send poore expelled nurse recounting euery thing order conrado tolde concerning geoffrey mother gasparino heard whole discourse maruelled greatly thereat saide true doe thing messer conrado may loue liking prouided lie power performe foureteene yeeres since brought lad seeke mother home house gladly send vnto may tell aduise ouerrash crediting fable iehannot tearmes himselfe name geoffrey hee wicked boy taketh find hauing thus spoken giuing kinde welcome messenger secretly called nurse vnto heedfully examined concerning case shee hauing heard rebellion kingdome sicilie vnderstanding withall henriet yet liuing ioyfully threw former feare relating euery thing orderly reason mouing conceale whole businesse manner shee done gasparino well perceiuing report nurse message receiued conrado varied one circumstance beganne better credit wordes man ingenious making inquisition businesse possible meanes could deuise finding euery thing yeeld vndoubted assurance ashamed vile base vsage wherein hee long time kept ladde desiring best meanes make amends faire daughter aged thirteene yeeres knowing manner man father henriet also yet liuing gaue marriage bountifull honourable dowry iouiall dayes feasting past went aboard galley poore expelled daughter ambassadour nurse departing thence lericy nobly welcommed messer conrado castle farre thence honourable traine conducted thither entertained possible kindnesse concerning comfort mother meeting happily sonnes ioy brother mother together hauing also found faithfull nurse gasparino daughter company conrado wife friend familiar generally iubilee reioycing exceedeth capacity expresse therefore referre able imagination time mutuall contentment ende nothing might wanting compleat perfect vniuersall ioy lord aboundant bestower beginneth added long wished tydings concerning life good estate henriet capece euen feasting concourse great worthy guest lord lady first seruice scarcely set table ambassador sent sicilie arriued among many important matter spake henriet long time detained prison king charles commotion arose city king people grudging henriets long imprisonment slew guard set liberty capitall enemy king charles created captaine generall following chase killing french meanes whereof grew great grace king pedro replanted good honour high eminent authority hereunto ambassadour added entertained extraordinary grace deliuery publike ioy exaltation wife sonne knowne liuing tydings time beene heard since houre surprizall moreouer swift winged barke sent thither vpon happy hearing newes well furnished noble gentleman attend till returning backe neede make doubt concerning tydings brought ambassadour gentleman welcome thus sent madam beritola geoffrey would sit downe table saluted messer conrado kinde lady behalfe henriet great grace extended sonne promise thing lying power henriet rest continually command like signior gasparino whose liberall fauours came vnlooked certaine assurance henriet vnderstand hee done sonne poore expelled would defailance riciprocall courtesy longest ioyes haue perpetuity lasting gracefull ceremony conclusion many sighes teares parting ioyes abounded first encountring imagine see aboard haue longer abiding madam beritola geoffrey rest poore expelled late married wiues faithfull nurse bearing company prosperous windes arriued sicilie wife sonnes daughter ioyfully met henriet palermo honourable pompe case important equally deserued history make mention liued long much felicity thankfull heart doubt heauen acknowledgement many great mercy receiued soldan babylon sent one daughter ioyned marriage king cholcos diuers accident space foure yeeres happened custody nine men sundry place length restored backe father shee went saide king cholcos maide first shee intended wife seauenth nouell aliuely demonstration beauty woman oftentimes hurtfull selfe occasion many euils yea death diuers men peraduenture nouell related madam aemilia extend selfe farre length moued compassion lady mindes hearing hard fortune beritola child incited weeping pleased queene vpon tale conclusion command pamphilus follow next order discourse hee thereto obedient beganne manner matter meane difficulty vertuous lady v take intire knowledge euery thing doe oftentimes hath beene obserued many men imagining rich liue securely without care therefore onely haue prayer intercession aimed end also study daily endeauours without refusall paine peril haue meanely expressed hourely solicitude although hath happened accordingly couetous desire fully accomplished yet length haue met kinde people likewise thirsting wealthy possession haue bereft life kinde intimate friend attained rich low base condition aduenturing many skirmish foughten battels trampling bloud brother friend haue beene mounted soueraigne dignity kingdomes beleeuing therein consisted truest happinesse bought dearest price liues beside infinite care feares wherewith greatnesse continually attended royall table haue drunke poyson golden pot many like manner earnest appetite haue coueted beauty bodily strength foreseeing iudgement wish without perill endued either haue beene occasion death lingering lamentable estate life death thousand time welcome would speake particularly fraile humane affection dare assure ye one desire elected among v mortal entire foresight prouidence warrantable ominous issue wherefore would walke directly wee dispose willes affection ordered guided onely best knoweth needfull v bestow good pleasure let lay blamefull imputation vpon men onely offending many thing ouer lauish desire selues gracious lady sinne highly one namely coueting beautifull sufficient enioy beauty bestowne nature practise encrease rarity art wherefore let offend tell hard fortune faire sarrazines happened strange aduentures within compasse foure yeares nine seuerall time maried onely beauty long time since liued soldane babylon named beminidab liued many thing happened answerable owne desire among diuers child male female daughter called alathiella shee according common voyce euery one saw fayrest lady liuing world king cholcos wonderfully assisted valiant foughten battaile mighty armie arabes suddaine assailed hee demaunded faire daughter marriage likewise badly granted goodly well armed ship prepared full furnishment necessary prouision accompanied honourable traine lord lady also costly sumptuous accoustrements commending mercy heauen manner shee sent away time propitious parting thence mariner hoised sayles leauing part alexandria sayling prosperously many dayes together past country sardignia imagined well neere iourneyes end suddainly arose boisterous contrary windes impetuous beyond measure tormented ship wherein lady mariner seeing signe comfort gaue ouer hope escaping life neuerthelesse men expert implacable danger laboured vttermost power contended infinite blustring tempest space two dayes night together hoping third day would proue fauourable therein saw themselues deceiued violence continued still encreasing night time way able comprehend either course tooke neither mariuall iudgement apprehension else whatsoeuer heauens clouded night darknesse ext eame vnknowne neere isle maiorica felt ship split bottome meanes whereof perceiuing hope escaping euery one caring himselfe threw forth squiffe troubled waues reposing confidence safety way abiding longer broken ship howbeit first descended downe made stout resistance follower drawne weapon safety life farre preuailed tempest violence ouerlading squiffe sunke bottome perished therein ship thus split halfe full water tossed tormented blustring windes first one way another last driuen strand isle maiorica person remaining therein onely lady woman rude tempest owne conceiued feare lying still halfe dead within stone cast neighbouring shore ship rough surging billowes fixed fast sand continued rest night without molestation windes day appeared violent stormes mildly appeased lady seemed well neere dead lifted vp head began weake call first one another called vaine named farre enough wherefore hearing answere seeing one wondered greatly feares encreasing raysing selfe well shee could beheld lady company woman lying still without stirring whereupon first iogging one another calling seuerally name shee found bereft vnderstanding euen dead heart quailed feare ouerruling meane dismay poore lady selfe neuerthelesse necessity best counsailour seeing selfe thus alone knowing place vsed meanes liuing last came better knowledge themselues vnable guesse become men mariner seeing ship also driuen sand filled water began lament grieuously houre midday could descry person shore else pitty vrgent necessity length noone past gentlewoman named baiazeth attended diuers follower horseback returning country house belonging chanced ride sand vpon sight ship lying case imagined truely happened commanded one men enter aboord difficulty hee resolue lord remayned therein hee found faire young lady small store company left fearefully hidden vnder prow ship soone saw held vp hand wofully desiring mercy perceiuing lamentable condition hee vnderstoode said affliction grew greater labouring signes gesture giue knowledge misfortune seruaut gathering could outward behauiour declared lord hee seene ship caused woman brought shore precious thing remaining conducting place farre foode warmth gaue comfort rich garment lady cloathed withall hee reputed gentlewoman well deriued great reuerence done rest gaue good reason conceiue although lookes pale wan also person mightily altered tempestuous violence sea yet notwithstanding appeared faire louely eye baiazeth whereupon forthwith determined maried would enioy owne mariage could winne wife yet least shee friend shee remained power baiazeth man sterne lookes rough harsh speech behauiour yet causing lady honourably vsed diuers dayes together became thereby well comforted recouered seeing beauty exceede comparison afflicted beyond measure could vnderstand whereby hee could know whence amorous flame encreasing kinde courteous affable action hee laboured compasse aymed endeauour proued purpose shee refused familiar priuacie much kindled fury fire well obserued lady hauing remayned moneth collecting customes countrey among turkes place although knowne yet would little aduantage beside long protraction time vvould prouoke baiazeth faire meanes force obtaine vvill propounded selfe magnanimity spirit tread misfortune vnder feete commaunding vvomen vvhereof three remaining aliue disclose vvhat vvas except vvere place manifest signes might yeeld hope regaining liberty moreouer shee admonished stoutly defend honour chastity affirming shee absolutely resolued selfe neuer enioy intended husband vvherein vvomen much commend promising preserue reputation according commanded day day vvere torment baiazeth vvonderfully augmented yet still kinde offer scornefully refused farre compassing desire vvhen hee first began mooue matter wherefore perceiuing faire course serued effect hee resolued compasse purpose craft subtilty reseruing rigorous extremity finall conclusion hauing obserued vvine pleasing lady neuer vsed drinke country law forbidden meane store hauing beene lately brought baiazeth barke geneway hee resolued surprize meanes thereof chiefe minister venus heate coolest blood seeming outward behauiour giuen ouer amorous pursuite stroue best endeauours withstand one night maiestick solemne manner prepared delicate sumptuous supper whereto lady inuited hee giuen order hee attended cup serue many wine compounded mingled together hee accordingly performed cunning enough occasion alothiella instructing trecherie intended liking wine pleasing taste extraordinarily dranke stoode precedent modest resolution forgetting passed aduersities became frollick merry seeing woman daunce manner obserued therein maiorica also fell dauncing according alexandrian custome baiazeth beheld imagined victory halfe wone heart desire neere obtaining plying still wine vpon wine continuing reuelling part night length inuited guest gone lady retired chamber attended none baiazeth himselfe familiarly hee beene one woman shee way contradicting bold intrusion faire wine ouergone sences preuailed modest bashfulnesse wanton embracing strange neuer tasted yet pleasing beyond measure reason trecherous aduantage afterward drew many like carowsing meeting without much thought passed misery honourable chaste respect euer ought attend lady fortune enuying stolne pleasure purposed wife potent king thus become wanton friend much meaner man whose onely glory shame altered course common pastime preparing farre greater infelicity baiazeth brother aged fiue twenty yeares compleate person beauty time fresh sweetest smelling rose named amurath seene lady whose faire feature pleased beyond woman else seemed suddaine apprehension outward behauiour ciuill apparancie highly deserue best opinion meanely entred fauour found nothing hinderance obtayning height heart desire onely strict custody guard wherein brother baiazeth kept raised cruell conceit minde whereon followed long cruell effect came passe time port citie called caffa lay ship laden merchandize bound thence sm r ship two geneway merchant brother patrones owner giuen direction hoysing sayles depart thence winde serue two genewayes amarath couenanted himselfe goe abord ship night ensuing lady company night come hauing resolued himselfe done disguised habite hee went house baiazeth stood way doubtfull certaine faithfull confederate sworne intended action hid themselues closely house part night ouerpast hee knowing seuerall lodging baiazeth alathiella slew brother soundly sleeping seizing lady hee found awake weeping threatned kill also shee made noyse well furnished greater part costly iewels belonging baiazeth vnheard vndescried body went presently port without delay amurath lady receiued ship companion returned backe againe mariner hauing sayles ready set winde aptly fitting launched forth merrily maine may well imagine lady extraordinarily afflicted griefe first misfortune second chancing suddainly must needes offend greater manner amurath kindly comfort milde modest manly perswasions remembrance baiazeth quickly forgotten shee became conuerted louely demeanour euen fortune prepared fresh misery satisfied whereof shee tasted already lady enriched vnequalled beauty wee haue often related behauiour also exquisite commendable kinde expressed two brother owner ship became deepely enamoured forgetting serious affaire studied possible meanes pleasing gracious eye yet carefull cariage amurath neither see suspect brother imparted loues extremity plainely perceiued though equally fiery torment yet desire vtterly contrary began seuerally consider gaine gotten merchandize admitted equall honest diuision purchase different quality pleading title sole possession without partner intruder fearefull iealous least either ayme others intention yet willing enough shake hand ridding amurath way onely hinderer hope whereupon concluded together day ship sayled swiftly amurath sitting vpon deck studiously obseruing billowes combatted suspecting treason towards stealing softly behinde suddainly threw sea ship fleeting aboue halfe league distance perceiued fall sea lady heard thereof saw likely meanes recouering againe fell wonted teares lamentation two louers came quickly comfort vsing kinde word pithie perswasions albeit vnderstood little appease violence passion speake vprightly shee much bemoane losse amurath multiplying owne misfortune still one succeeding necke another diuers long well deliuered oration also faire courteous behauiour indifferently pacified complaynings began discourse commune themselues right title alathiella consequently ought enioy amurath gone pleaded priuiledge good others ship good aduantages else whatsoeuer happening elder brother absolutely denied alleadging first propriety birth reason sufficient whereby younger ought giue place likewise right interest ship good others heire father therefore iustice highest preferred last strength onely threw amurath sea therefore gaue full possession prize right remaining brother temperate calme speech fell frownes ruder language heated blood violent manner forgetting brotherly affection respect parent friend drew forth poniard stabbing often desperately shippe power meanes part dangerously wounded younger brother fell downe dead elder little better case receiuing many perilous hurt remained neuerthelesse liuing vnhappy accident displeased lady highly seeing selfe thus left alone without help counsell body fearing greatly least anger two brethren parent friend laide charge thereon follow seueriry punishment earnest entreaty wounded suruiuer arriuall smirna soone deliuered danger death gaue ease sorrow shee went shore remaining common inne continued chirurgians cure fame singular much admired beauty soone spread abroade throughout city amongst rest hearing prince ionia lately vrgent occasion come smirna rare rumour made desirous see seene shee seemed farre fairer eye common report noysed suddenly grew enamored shee onely idea best desire afterward vnderstanding manner shee brought thither deuised make owne practising possible meanes accomplish wounded brother parent heard onely made tender willingnesse therein also immediately sent matter highly pleasing prince likewise lady selfe shee thought freed meane perill otherwise wounded merchant friend might haue inflicted prince perceiuing beside matchlesse beauty shee true character royall behauiour greeued could informed countrey shee opinion stedfastly grounded lesse noble shee could motiue set keener edge affection towards yet enioy honourable louing complement onely espoused lady wife appearing apparant demonstration though entercourse speech wanted confirme remembrance many sad disaster noble respected condition comfort enlarged selfe setled hope feares grew free molestation beauty became onely theame argument priuate publike conference natolia welneere discourse assembly whatsoeuer hereupon duke athens young goodly valiant person also neere kinsman prince desire see vnder colour visiting noble kinsman oftentimes done attended honourable traine smirna came royally welcommed bounteously feasted within dayes conference passed betweene concerning rare beauty lady duke questioning prince whether shee wonder fame acquainted world withall whereto prince replied much noble kinsman spoken owne eye shall witnesse without crediting word mine duke solliciting duke thereto earnestly went together see shee hauing heard comming adorned selfe maiestically entertaining ceremonious demeanor country custome gaue gracious vnspeakable acceptation prince affable motion shee sate downe betweene delight beyond expression behold abridged much felicity vnderstood part language could haue conference lookes outward signes onely beheld maruelled rare perfection especially duke hardly credited shee mortall creature thus perceiuing deepe carowses amorous poyson eye dranke downe meere sight yet thinking thereby onely satisfied lost himselfe best sences growing loue beyond measure prince parted hee owne priuate amorous meditation chamber reputed prince far happier man else whatsoeuer enioying peerelesse beauty many intricate distracted cogitation molested braines incessantly regarding loues wanton heate reason kindred honourable hospitality resolutely determined whatsoeuer ensued thereupon bereaue prince faire felicity none himselfe might possesse treasure esteemed height happinesse courage conformable bad intent hast must put execution equity iustice honesty quite abandoned nothing subtill stratagem meditation day according fore compacted treachery ordered gentleman prince chamber named churiacy prepared horse readinesse dispatched affaire else sudden departure night following secretly conueyed said churiacy friend armed prince chamber lady soundly sleeping stood gazing window towards sea naked shirt take coole ayre season exceeding hot hauing formerly enstructed friend done verie softly stept prince running weapon quite thorow body immediately threw forth window obserue pallace seated sea shore high window whereat prince stood looking foorth directly ouer diuers house long continuance time incessant beating surge sea defaced ruined sildome visited person whereof duke hauing knowledge easier perswaded falling prince body vaste place could neither heard descried duke companion hauing thus executed came proceeded yet cunning little casting strangling coard necke churiacy seeming hugged embraced drew maine strength neuer spake one word threw downe prince done plainely perceiuing heard seene either lady duke tooke light hand going bed lady lay sweetely sleeping beheld admired commended garment shee appeared pleasing shee bed state maiesty way daunted late committed sinne swimming rather surfet ioy hand bloody soule much vglie laide downe bed bestowing infinite kiss embrace supposing prince opening eye otherwise resolued delight aimed neither thinke safe delay time longer tarying wherefore hauing agent hand fit conuenient purpose surprized sort could make noise outcry carrying thorough false posterne whereat themselues entred laying princely litter away went possible speede tarrying place vntill arriued neere athens thither hee would bring himselfe married man rather goodly castle owne distant farre city caused kept secretly little greefe sorrow yet attended serued honourable manner gentleman vsually attending prince hauing waited next morning till noone expectation rising hearing stirring chamber thrust doore onely closed together finding body presently imagined priuately gone place lady deerely affected hee might remaine dayes contentment rested verily perswaded within fewe dayes following doubt came question prince foole entering chance among ruined house lay dead body prince churicy tooke hold corde churiacyes necke went along dragging bodye knowne many meane meruaile hee bee murthered vile manner giftes faire perswasions wonne bring place hee found little greefe cittie found prince body also caused bee interred maiesticke pomp might bee vpon inquisition commit horrid deed perceyuing likewise duke athens found closely gone iudged according truth hand bloody businesse carried away lady immediately elected prince brother bee lord soueraigne inciting reuenge horrid wrong promising assist vtmost power new chosen prince assured afterward apparant remarkeable proofes people informed nothing truth sodainly according concluded helpe neighbor kindred frends collected diuers place mustred goodly powerful army marching towards athens make war duke sooner heard warlike preparation made likewise leuied force owne defence succour came many great state among emperor constantinople sent sonne constantine attended nephew emanuell troopes faire towardly horse honourably welcommed entertained duke much dutchesse sister law military prouision thus proceeding daily dutch making choise fit conuenient houre took two prince withdrawing chamber flouds teares flowing eye wringing hand sighing incessantly shee recounted whole history occasion warre dishonourably duke dealt strange woman purposed keepe despight thinking knew nothing therof complaining earnestly vnto entreated duke honour comfort would giue best assistance case two young lord knew matter shee thus reported therefore without staying listen longer comforting wel could promise best employed paine informed place lady closely kept tooke leaue parted often heard lady much commended incomparable beauty highly extolled yea euen duke himselfe made desirous see wherefore earnestly solicited let haue sight forgetting happened prince shewing vnaduisedly made promise grant request causing magnificent dinner prepared goodly garden castle lady kept morrow morning attended smal train away rode dine constantine seated table began one confounded admiration obserue iudiciously affirming secretly soule neuer seene compleat woman allowing iustice duke whosoeuer enioy rare beauty committed treason mischiefe else beside yet reason ought held excused bestow many lookes vpon prayses infinitely surpassed thinking could sufficiently commend following duke step step affection growne amorous remembrance intended warre vtterly abandoned thought could come neerer bereaue duke yet concealing loue imparting one fancy thus amorously set fire time came must make head prince already marching within duke dominion wherfore duke constantine rest according counsell held among went defend certaine frontier end prince might passe remaining diuers dayes together constantine could thinke nothing else beautiful lady considered himselfe duke far easie matter compasse intent hereupon better colour present returne athens seemed surprized sudden extreame sicknesse regard whereof duke free lisence leauing power cousen emanuel forthwith iourneyed backe athens conference bad sister concerning dishonorable wrong endured hand lady solemnly protested shee pleased would aide powerfully matter taking place neuer afterward seene countrey dutchesse faithfully perswaded would doe onely sake affection bare lady made answer highly pleased alwayes prouided might performed sort duke husband neuer vnderstand euer shee gaue consent thereto constantine sware vnto many deep oathes whereby referred owne disposition constanstine hereupon secretly prepared readinesse subtill barke sending euening neere garden lady resorted hauing first informed people fully businesse done afterward accompanied attendant hee went palace lady gladly entertained waited also lady selfe leading along arme towards garden attended two seruants two owne seeming sent duke conferre walked alone port opening sea standing ready open vpon signe giuen one complices barke brought close shore lady suddenly seized immediately conueyed returning backe people sword drawne hand saide let man stir e speake word except willing loose life intend rob duke faire friend expel shame dishonour hath offered sister one hardy returne answer aboard went constantine consort sitting neer lady wrung hand wept bitterly commanded marriners launch forth flying away wing wind till breake day following arriued melasso tooke landing reposed shore dayes constantine labouring comfort lady euen shee owne sister shee hauing good cause curse infortunate beauty going aboard barke againe within dayes came setalia fearing reprehension father least ladie taken pleased constantine make stay place meane security much kinde behauiour vsed towards lady without meanes selfe redresse least great extremity shee became milde affable discontentment iot quaile occurrence passed manner fortuned osbech king turky continuall war emperour came accident laiazzo hearing lasciuiously constantine spent time setalia lady stolne weake slenderly guarded night certaine well prouided ship men entred towne surprized many people bed knew enemy coming killing stood vpon defence among constantine burning whole towne brought booty prisoner aboard ship wherewith returned backe laiazzo thus come laiazzo osbech braue gallant young man vpon reuiew pillage found faire lady hee knew beloued constantine shee found lying bed without delay made choyse wife causing nuptials honourably sollemnized many moneths hee liued great ioy occasion grew effect emperour made confederacy bassano king cappadocia hee descend force one way vpon osbech hee would assault power could conueniently bring passe emperour would yeeld bassano vnreasonable matter demanded neuerthelesse vnderstood happened son griefe beyond measure granted king cappadociaes request solliciting withall instancy speedy assailing osbech long hee heard coniuration made therefore speedily mustered vp force ere would encompassed two potent king marched meete king cappadocia leauing lady wife safety laiazzo custodie true loyall seruant within short drew neere campe belonging king cappadocia boldly gaue battell chancing therein slaine army broken discomfited meanes whereof king cappadocia remaining conquerour marched towards laiazzo euery one yeelding obeysance way went meane space seruant osbech named antiochus faire lady left guard although hee aged yet seeing shee extraordinarily beautifull fell loue forgetting sollemne vowes made master one happinesse hee case helpe namely vnderstood could speake language matter meane comfort constrainedly liued diuers yeeres together state deafe dumbe woman euery else vnderstood shee shewes signes benefit familiar conference beganne embolden hope eleuate courage make seeme youthfull owne opinion ability body could speake vnto promise possession farre beyond vnequall enioyed yet aduance hope great deale higher newes came osbech vanquished slaine bassano made euerie hauocke whereon concluded together tarrie longer storing themselues good osbech secretly departed thence rhodes seated indifferent abiding came passe antiochus fell deadly sicknesse came cyprian merchant one much esteemed intimate friend kinde acquaintance hee reposed small confidence feeling sicknesse encrease vpon dayly hee determined onely leaue wealth hee merchant faire lady likewise calling bed side brake minde vnto manner deare loue worthily respected friend perceiue plainly infallibly drawing neere vnto end much discontenteth hope haue liued longer world enioying kinde esteemed company yet one thing maketh death pleasing welcome namely lying thus bed latest comfort life shall expire finish course armes two person affected world euer dearest friend faire lady since first sight loued honoured soule irksome grieuous dye shall leaue stranger without counsaile helpe body yet much offensiue would become friend present faithfully perswaded haue like care respect euen sake selfe time allotted longer tarying therefore worthy friend earnestly desire dye mine affaire may remaine trusty care selfe absolutely commended prouidence dispose one may best agree comfort soule choise beauty humbly entreate death would forget mee end may make vaunt another world affected onely fairest lady euer nature framed two thing giue assurance shall depart meane comfort friendly merchant likewise lady hearing word wept bitterly hee giuen ouer speaking kindly comforted promise solemne vowes hee dyed performed requested within short departed life gaue honourable buriall according country custome done merchant dispatching affaire rhodes desirous returne home cyprus carrack catelans mouing lady matter vnderstand shee stood enclined vrgent occasion called thence cyprus lady made answere willing passe thither hoping loue hee bare deceased antiochus would respect sister merchant willing giue contentment yet resolued vnder title sister would warrant security wherefore hee rather aduised stile husband hee would terme wife hee sure defend iniuries whatsoeuer abord carrack cabine small bed conueniently allowed slept together might better reputed man wife passe otherwise would haue beene dangerous questionlesse faithfull promise made rhodes antiochus sicknesse sea mutuall respect others credit constant restraint wanton desire motiue rather incite chastity otherwise hope perswaded howsoeuer windes blewe merily carrack sayled lustily time arriued baffa cyprian merchant dwelt shee continued long one knowing otherwise shee wife indeede fortuned arriued also baffa especiall occasion gentleman whose name antigonus well stept yeares better stored wisedome wealth medling many matter hee followed seruice king cyprus fortune beene aduerse ancient gentleman passing day house lady lay merchant gone businesse armenia hee chanced see lady window house shee beautifull obserued aduisedly recollecting sences together doubtlesse seene place hee could remember lady selfe likewise long time beene fortune tennis ball terme many misery drawing neere ending began conceiue vpon first sight antigonus formerly seene alexandria seruing father place great degree hereupon suddaine hope perswaded aduice furtherance gentleman recouer wonted royall condition opportunity aptly fitting absence pretended merchant husband sent requesting haue word come house bashfully demanded named antigonus famagosta shee knew one like called hee answered named saying moreouer madame thinkes know cannot remember haue seene wherefore would entreate might stand good liking memory might quickned better knowledge lady perceiuing man indeede weeping incessantly threw armes necke soone asked antigonus stood one confounded meruaile hee neuer seene alexandria vpon word antigonus knew immediately alathiella daughter great soldane supposed long since drowned sea offering doe reuerence became would permit desired would assistant willed also sit downe goodly chaire brought humble manner demanded become long time verily beleeued throughout egypt shee drowned sea would bin answered lady rather leade life haue done thinke father himselfe would wish euer come knowledge thereof word teares rained downe faire cheekes wherefore antigonus thus spake vnto madame discomfort selfe haue occasion pleased relate passed accident mee course life hath bene perhaps shall giue friendly aduice may stand sted way iniurious fetching sigh euen heart would haue split sunder thus replyed ah antigonus thinkes looke thee seeme behold royall father therefore mooued like religious zeale charitable loue duty owe vnto make knowne thee rather ought conceale hide person liuing know thee bee honourable discreete truely wise though fraile simple weake woman therefore dare discouer thee rather know straunge vnexpected misfortune haue liued long obscurely world thy great graue iudgement hearing many misery thou canst way restore former estate pray thee thou perceiue impossible bee done earnestly likewise entreate thee neuer reueale liuing person either thou hast seene heard speech word teares still streaming faire eye shee recounted whole passage rare mishap euen shipwracke sea maiorica vntil instant houre speaking harsh manner hapned sparing iot antigonus mooued much compassion declared hee pitied teares hauing bene silent indifferent considering case best done thus began madam seeing haue past multitude misfortune yet vndiscouered render blamelesse father estate fairely loue hour parted afterward make wife king cholcos demanding meanes possibly could accomplished breefely made knowne manner hee would performe cut futther tedious circumstance forthwith returned famagosta going king country thus spake sir may pleased instant exceeding honor haue bene impouerished seruice also deed great renowne selfe without much matter expence cost king demanding antigonus thus answered fayre daughter soldane generally reported drowned arriued baffa preserue honour blemishing hath suffered many cross calamity instant poore estate yet desirous revisite father please send home vnder conduct great honour meane benefite mee kindnesse euer thankfully remembred soldan king royall magnificence replied sodainly highly pleased good tydings hauing sent honourably baffa great pompe conducted famagosta graciously welcommed king queene solemne triumphes bankets reuelling performed maiesticke manner questioned king queene concerning large time strange misfortune according antigonus formerly enstructed shape forme answer satisfied honor demand within dayes vpon earnest instant request honourable traine lord lady shee sent thence conducted way antigonus vntill came vnto soldans court dayes reposing soldan desirous vnderstand could possibly liue long kingdome prouince whatsoeuer yet knowledge bee taken lady perfectly retained heart lesson finger end warie instruction antigonus giuen answered father manner sir twentith day departure verie terrible dreadfull tempest ouertooke v dead time night ship split sunder vpon sand neere place called varna became men aboord neither know euer heard onely remember death appeared recouered death life certaine pezants countrey comming get could finde ship wrackt first two woman brought set safely shore sooner certaine rude shaggehaird villaines set vpon v carrying away woman haling along haire head neither teares intercession could draw pitty thus dragd spacious woodd foure horseman sodaine came riding seeing dishonourably villaines vsed rescued forced flight foure horseman seeming iudgement bee person power authority letting go came mee vrging sundry question neither vnderstood mine answer many deliberation held among themselues setting vpon one horse brought monastery religious woman according custome law whatsoeuer sayde know benignely welcommed thither honoured extraordinarily deuotion dedicated selfe goddesse chastity highly reuerenced regarded among woman countrey religious seruice wholly addicted continued time among learned little language asked whence reason gaue much vnderstanding fearfull telling trueth feare expulsion among enemy law religion wherefore answered according necessity vrged daughter gentleman cyprus sent bee married candie fortune meaning charge mee fell quite contrary expectation loss shipwracke mischance adding many matter beside onely regard feare yeelding obediently obserue customes length cheefest preheminence among woman termed name lady abbesse demaunded whither willing abide condition life returne home againe cyprus answerd desired nothing carefull mine honour would neuer repose confidence came cyprus till two honest gentleman france hapned thither two moneths since accompanied wiues one neere kinswoman lady abbesse well knowing trauelled pilgrimage ierusalem visit holy sepulcher beleeue held god buried iewes put death recommended louing trust especial charge deliuering father cyprus honourable loue respect found company gentleman wiues voyage backe cyprus history would ouertedious reporting neither much materiall purpose demand another end sayling prosperously ship long wee arriued baffa landed knowing person neither say gentleman onely carefull deliuering father according charged reuerend abbesse heauen doubtlesse pitty compassion passed disaster sooner come shore baffa haply meete antigonus whome called vnto countrey language would vnderstood gentleman wiues requesting acknowledge daughter quickly apprehended mine intention accomplishing requested according poore power bounteously feasted gentleman wiues conducting k cyprus receiued royally sent home much honour way able relate else remaineth said antigonus hath oft heard whole story fortune better leisure wil report antigonus turning soldan said lord shee hath often told relation gentleman wiues hath deliuered nothing trueth onely shee hath forgotten somewhat worth speaking thinking fit vtter indeede conuenient namely much gentleman wiues came commended rare honesty integrity life also vnspotted vertue wherein liued among chaste religious woman constantly teares solemne protestation auouched kindly resigned charge mee matter many beside make discourse excellencie whole day night ensuing next dayes full extendure sufficient acquaint withall let suffice haue said much report mine owne vnderstanding may giue faithfull assurance make royall vaunt hauing fayrest vertuous honest lady daughter king prince whatsoeuer soldane ioyfull beyond measure welcomming rest stately manner oftentimes entreating god heartily might liue requite equall recompence graciously honoured daughter aboue rest king cyprus sent home maiestically hauing bestowne great gift antigonus within dayes hee gaue leaue returne cyprus thankfull fauours king well letter also ambassadours expresly sent himselfe daughter businesse fully finished soldane desiring accomplish formerly intended begun namely shee might wife king cholcos gaue intelligence happened writing moreouer pleased hee would yet send royall manner king cholcos exceeding ioyfull glad tydings dispatching worthy trayne fetch conuayed thither pompously beene embraced many receiued honest virgine liuing long time much ioy felicity therefore hath beene said common prouerbe mouth well kist come short good fortune still renewed like moone count dangiers falsly accused banished france left two child england diuers place returning afterward vnknowne thorow scotland hee found aduanced vnto great dignity repayring habite seruitour king france armie innocencie made publiquely knowne hee reseated former honourable degree eight nouell whereby men may plainely vnderstand loyal faithfully kept prince peril euer doe ensue doth ye neuerthelesse renowne man bring farre greater honour lady sighed often hearing variety wofull misery happening alathiella knoweth occasion moued sighes perhaps among rather sighed could often married rather compassion disaster leauing owne construction smiled merrily last speech pamphilus queene perceiuing nouell ended shee fixed eye vpon madame eliza signifying thereby next succeede order shee ioyfully embracing spake followeth field large spacious wherein day haue walked one wearied running former race nimbly would aduenture many copious alteration fortune sad repetition wonderfull change among infinity various course must make addition another trust way discontent romaine empire translated french germains mighty dissentions grew nation insomuch drew dismall lingring warre respect well safety owne kingdome annoy disturbe enemy king france one sonnes hauing congregated force owne dominion also friend confederate resolued manfully encounter enemy would aduenture rash proceeding held chiefest part pollicie royall prouidence leaue state without chiefe gouernour hauing good experience gualtier counte dangiers wise worthy trusty lord singularly expert militarie discipline faithfull affaire kingdome yet fitter ease pleasure laborious toyle trauaile hee elected lieutenant gouernour sted ouer whole kingdome france went enterprize began counte execute office committed trust orderly proceeding great discretion yet entring businesse without consent queene faire daughter law although left vnder care custodie yet notwithstanding honoured superiours dignity quality required heere obserue concerning counte gualtier himselfe compleat person aged little aboue forty yeares affable singularly conditioned noble man possibly could time afford gentleman equalled respect fortuned king sonne busie aforenamed warre wife lady counte gualtier died meane leauing onely sonne daughter young tender yeares made owne home lesse welcome hauing lost deare loue second selfe hereupon hee resorted court said lady frequently often conferring waighty affaire kingdome time serious interparlance king sonnes wife threw many affectionate regard vpon conuaying conspiring passion heart regard person vertues loue exceeded capacity gouernement desire stepping compasse modesty dignity princely condition throwes regard ciuill sober thought guide labyrinth wanton imagination regard eminencie high authority grauity yeares part true conduct honour lookes vpon owne loose lasciuious appetite young gallant ouerready yeelding nature comparing want wife likely hope thereby sooner preuailing supposing nothing could hinderance onely bashfull shamefacednesse rather chose vtterly forsake set aside faile hote enflamed affection therefore shee would needes discouerer owne disgrace vpon day alone selfe time seeming suteable intention shee sent counte vnder colour important conference counte dangiers whose thought quite contrary immediately went sitting downe together bed side chamber according formerly shee plotted purpose twice hee demaunded vpon occasion thus sent sitting long silent answere make pressed violence amorous passion vermillion tincture leaping vp face yet shame enforcing teares eye word broken halfe confused last began deliuer minde manner honourable lord dearely respected friend wise man difficult matter know fraile condition imposed men woman yet diuers occasion much vpon one wherefore desertfully censure iust vpright iudge fault diuers condition respect person ought censured one punishment beside say man woman poore meane estate hauing helpe maintainance laborious trauaile body worthily receiue sharpe reprehension yeelding amorous desire passion incited loue wealthy lady whose liuing relieth paine care neither wanteth thing wish haue dare presume selfe allow equall iust respect minde forenamed allegation ought serue sufficient excuse yea aduantage possessed passion loue ouerreach alwayes prouided shee pleade owne defence choise wise vertuous friend answerable owne condition quality way taxed seruile vile election two especiall obseruations allowable iudgement liuing seazing youthfull blood yeares haue found mean inducement loue regard husband far distance medling rude vnciuill action warre rather home sweet imployment see sir orator aduance themselues presence acquaint extremity ouercommanding agony power hath dominion discretion questionlesse cannot voide let entreate aduise may rather helpe hinder hope beleeue trueth sir long absence husband solitary condition wherein left ill agreeing hot blood running veines temper earnest desire haue preuailed strongest resistance onely weake woman man much potent might liuing ease idlenesse doe cannot withstand continuall assault hauing helpe flesh blood ignorant publique knowledge error would reputed shrewd taxation honesty whereas side secret carriage heedfull managing amorous affaire may passe currant without reproach let tell noble counte repute loue highly fauourable mee guiding iudgement moderation make election wise worthy honourable friend fit enioy grace farre greater lady first letter name count dangiers error haue misled mine eye loue lady easily deceiued person perfection part commended man whole realme france containeth equall obserue beside forward fortune sheweth selfe v case destitute wife husband count dead denies duty belonging wife wherefore regard vnfaigned affection beare compassion ought haue royall princesse euen almost sicke death sake earnestly entreate denie louing society pittying youth fiery affliction neuer quenched kindnesse may enioy heart desire shee vttered word teares streamed aboundantly downe faire cheekes preuenting speech deiecting head bosome ouercome predominance passion shee fell vpon countes knee whereas else shee falne vpon ground hee like loyall honourable man sharply reprehended fonde idle loue shee would haue embraced necke hee repulsed roughly protesting vpon honourable reputation rather hee would wrong lord maister would endure thousand deathes lady seeing desire disappointed fond expectation vtterly frustrated grewe instantly forgetfull intemperate loue falling extremity rage conuerted former gentle speech harsh ruder language villaine quoth shee shall longing comfort life abridged thy base scornefull deniall shall destruction bee wrought thy currish vnkindnesse hoped ioyes defeated moment know slaue earnestly desire thy sweet embracement deadly hate despise either thy death banishment shall dearely pay sooner shee thus spoken tearing haire renting garment piece shee ranne like distracted woman cry aloude helpe helpe count dangiers forcibly dishonour mee lustfull count violence mine honour dangiers seeing fearing malice ouercredulous court either owne conscience dishonourable act committed beleeuing likewise slanderous accusation would bee credited aboue true spotlesse innocency closely conueyed himselfe court making hast hee could home owne house weake warranting safety vpon pursuite would vsed without aduice counsell seated two child horsebacke himselfe also meanly mounted thus away thence hee went calice vpon clamour noise lady courtier quickly flocked thither lie soone winne beleefe hasty opinion vpon silly shallow surmise accusation passe currant count aduancement enuied many made honest carriage case suspected hast madding fury ran count house arrest person carry prison could finde raced goodly building downe ground vsed shamefull violence il newes sildome want speedy messenger lesse space imagine king dolphin heard thereof camp therewith highly offended count sodaine seuere condemnation progeny sentenced perpetuall exile promise great bountifull reward could bring body aliue dead thus innocent count ouerhasty sodaine flight made himselfe guilty foule imputation arriuing callice child poore homely habites hid knowne thence crossed ouer england staying vntill hee came london would enter city gaue diuers good aduertisements child especially two precept aboue rest first patient soules support poore condition whereto fortune without offence thus deiected next haue heedfull care time disclose whence came whose child extended perill liues sonne named lewes nine yeares old daughter called violenta aged seauen yeares obserue father direction afterward sufficiently appeare might liue safer securitie hee thought best change name calling sonne perotto daughter gianetta thus might best escape vnknowne entred citty poore estate beggers craued euery body mercy almes came passe standing one morning cathedral churchdoore great lady england wife lord high marshall coming forth church espied count child begging demanded countreyman whether child owne count replyed borne picardy vnhappy fact committed eldest sonne stripling hopefull expectation proued hee enforced two child forsake country lady nature pittiful looking aduisedly yong girle beganne grow good liking indeede amiable gentle beautifull whereupon shee saide honest man thy daughter hath pleasing countenance perhaps inward disposition may prooue answerable hir outward good part therefore thou canst bee content leaue giue entertainment vpon dutifull carriage behauiour liue yeares may require wil haue honestly bestowne marriage motion verie pleasing count readily declared willing consent thereto teares trickling downe cheekes thankfull manner deliuered prettie daughter lady shee thus happily bestowne hee minded tarry longer london wonted begging manner trauailing thorough country sonne perotto length hee came wale without much weary paine trauell neuer vsed iourney far foote dwelt another lord office marshalship king england whose power extended ouer partes man great authority keeping noble bountifull house termed president wale court whereto count son oftentimes resorted finding good releefe comfort day one president son accompanied diuers gentleman child performing certaine youthfull sport pastime running leaping like wherein perotto presumed make one among excelling rest commendable manner none ca e thing nere diuers time president taken notice thereof vvell pleased lad behauiour enquired whence answer vvas made hee vvas poore man son euery day came almes gate president desirous make boy count whose dayly prayer purpose frankly gaue son nobleman albeit naturall fatherly affection vrged vnwillingnesse part yet necessity discretion found bee benefit thus eased care son daughter though different place yet vnder good woorthie gouernment count would continue longer england best could procure meanes passed ouer ireland arriued place called stanford became seruant earle country gentleman professing armes attended seruing man liued long estate painfully daughter violenta clouded vnder borrowed name gianetta dwelling lady london grew yeares beauty comlinesse person gracefull fauour lord lady yea euery one house beside wonderfull behold obserued vsuall carriage modesty shined clearely eye reputed vvell vvorthy honourable preferment regard lady receiued father knowing whence shee himselfe made report intended match honourable mariage according vertues worthily deserued god iust rewarder good endeauours knowing noble birth causelesse suffer sinnes another disposed otherwise worthy virgin might mate man ill condition doubt ordained done according owne good pleasure noble lady poore gianetta dwelt one onely sonne husband deerely affected well regard hee heire also vertues commendable quality wherein excelled many young gentleman endued heroycal valour compleate perfection person mind euery way answerable outward behauiour exceeding gianetta sixe yeeres age hee perceiuing faire comely maiden grew affect entirely thing else held contemptible nothing pleasing eye shee regard parentage reputed poore hee kept loue conceal parent daring desire marriage hee loose fauour disclosing vehemency affliction proued greater torment beene openly knowne came passe loue ouerawed sort fell violent sicknesse store physicions sent saue death possibly might iudgements obseruing course sicknesse yet reaching cause disease made doubtfull question recouery displeasing parent griefe sorrow grew beyond measure many earnest entreaty moued know occasion sicknesse whereto returned answer heartbreaking sighes incessant teares drew weakenesse body chanced day physicion brought vnto young yeeres well experienced practise hee made triall pulse gianetta mother command attended diligently vpon especial occasion entred chamber young gentleman perceiued shee neither spake word much looked towards heart grew great amorous desire pulse beate beyond compasse ordinary custome whereof physicion made good obseruation note long fit would continue sooner gianetta gone forth chamber pulse immediately gaue ouer beating perswaded physicion part disease discouered selfe apparantly within pretending haue speech gianetta holding gentleman still arme physicion caused sent immediately shee came vpon entrance chamber pulse began beate againe extreamely shee departed presently ceased thorowly perswaded hee found true effect sicknesse taking father mother aside thus spake desirous son health consisteth either physicion physicke mercy faire maide gianetta manifest signes haue made knowne loueth damosell dearely yet ought perceiue maide doth know haue respect life know case done nobleman wife hearing became somewhat satisfied remained remedy preserue life yet meane griefe succeede feared namely marriage betweene sonne gianetta physicion gone repairing sicke sonne mother began manner sonne alwayes perswaded thou wouldest conceale secret least part thy desire especially without enioying thou must remaine danger death full well art thou assured reason oughtest thing thy contentment quality soeuer haue beene prouided thee ample manner mine owne selfe though thou hast wandred farre duty hazarded thy life commeth passe heauen hath mercifull thee thou wouldest thy selfe v preuent thy dying disease dreame night hath acquainted principall occasion thy sickenesse wit extraordinary affection young maiden place thou hast seene tell thee sonne matter disgrace loue shouldst thou shame manifest much apt conuenient thy youth perswaded thou couldst loue make lesse esteeme thee therefore deare sonne dismayed freely discouer thine affection expel disastrous drouping thought haue indangered thy life long lingering sicknesse let thy soule faithfully assured thou canst require thing done remaining within compasse power performe loue thee dearely mine owne life set therefore aside nice conceit shame feare reuealing truth boldly may stead thee thy loue resoluing thy selfe vnfaignedly care stretch compasse thy content account cruell mother liuing vtterly vnworthy sonne young gentleman hauing heard protestation made mother little ashamed owne follie recollecting better thought together knowing soule one could better hope shee forgetting former feare returned answere madam dearely affected mother nothing hath occasioned loues strict concealement especiall errour finde daily proofe many growne yeeres graue discretion doe neuer remember themselues haue bin yong heerein find discreet wise onely affirme haue seen true also confesse vpon condition effect promise may follow according power remaining whereby onely may secure life mother desirous bee resolued whether confession would agree physitians word reseruing another intention selfe bad feare nothing freely discouer whole desire forthwith doubted effect madame quoth hee matchlesse beauty commendable quality maid gianetta yet haue made motion commisserate languishing extremity acquainted liuing creature loue concealing affliction selfe hath brought mee desperate condition meane bee wrought according constant promise full enioying longing desire assure selfe noble mother date life short lady well knowing time rather required kindest comfort seuere sharpe reprehension smiling saide ala deere sonne wast thou sicke good cheare thy strength better restored referre matter young gentleman put good hope mother promise began short time shew apparant signes wellforwarded amendment mother great ioy comfort disposing selfe daily prooue honor might keepe promise son within short calling gianetta priuately gentle manner
