way pleasant discourse demanded whither prouided louer gianetta neuer acquainted question scarlet dye couering modest countenance thus replied madam haue neede louer vnseemly poore damosell haue much thought louers banished friend kinsfolke remaining seruice haue none answered lady wee bestowe one shall content minde bring pleasing kinde life farre vnfit faire maid remaine destitute louer madam sayde gianetta considering selfe since receiued poore father haue vsed rather like daughter seruant becommeth mee doe pleaseth notwithstanding trust regard mine good honour neuer vse complaint case please bestow husband purpose loue honour onely inheritance left progenitor nothing remaineth honourable honesty shall bee legacie long liue word quite contrary complexion lady expected effecting promise made vnto hir sonne howbeit like wise noble lady much shee inwardly commended maid answer saide vnto tell gianetta lord king gallant youthfull prince bright beauty take pleasure loue would ye denie sodainly maide returned answer madam king perhaps might enforce free consent hee shall neuer haue thing honest lady mislike maides courage resolution breaking conference intended shortly put proiect proofe saying son fully recouered haue priuate accesse gianetta shee doubted would tractable enough held meane blemish honour mooue maide matter let compasse could farre yong gentleman humour answer mother aimed dishonourable end true faithfull honest loue sole scope intention foule loathsome lust vtterly defied whereupon fell sickenesse againe rather violently lady perceiuing reuealed whole intent gianetta finding constancie beyond common comparison acquainted lord done consented though much mindes let enioy honourable marriage accounting better preseruation onely son life match farre inferiour degree denying desire let pine away die loue great consultation kindred friendes match agreed vpon little ioy gianetta deuoutly returned infinite thankes heauen mercifully respecting deiected poore estate bitter passage many misery neuer tearming selfe otherwise daughter poore piccard soone yong gentleman recouered married man aliue well contented setting downe absolute determination lead louing life gianetta let v conuert lookes wale perotto lefte lord marshall president countrey grew yeares choisely respected lord hee vvas comely person addicted valiant attempt tourneyes iustes action armes like bee found island named onely perotto valiant piccard famed farre neere god forgotten sister mercy became mindefull contagious mortalitie hapning country greater part people perished thereby rest flying thence partes land whereby whole prouince became dispeopled desolate time plague dreadful visitation lord president lady sonnes daughter brother nephewes kindred dyed none remaining aliue one onely daughter marriageable houshold seruants beside perotto sicknesse mildly asswaged counsaile consent country people young lady accepted husband hee man worthy valiant inheritance left deceased father made lord sole commaunder within long king england vnderstanding president wale dead fame liberally relating vertues valour good part perotto piccard hee created president supply place deceased lord faire fortune within compasse short time fell two innocent child count dangiers left lost forlorne eighteene yeares fully ouerpast since count dangiers fled paris hauing suffered miserable many hard lamentable aduersities seeing himselfe growne aged hee desirous leaue ireland know hee might become child hereupon perceiuing wonted forme altered formerly conuersed could take knowledge feeling body long labour exercise endured seruice lusty idle youthfull yeares especially left court france hee purposed proceede determination poore simple apparell hee departed irish eare maister hee continued long seruice aduantage aduancement crossing ouer england trauailed place wale left perotto hee found lord marshall president country lusty good health man goodly feature honourably respected reuerenced people well may imagine small comfort poore aged countes heart yet would make himselfe knowne referred ioy enlarging diminishing sight limme life dearely affected daughter gianetta denying rest body place vntill time came london making secret enquiry concerning lady left daughter hee vnderstoode young gentlewoman named gianetta married lady onely son made second addition ioy soule accounting passed aduersities value child liuing high honour hauing found dwelling like kinde father earnestly desirous see dayly resorted neere house sir roger mandauill gianettaes husband named chauncing see moued compassion poore aged commaunded one men take house giue foode god sake accordingly seruant performed gianetta diuers child husband eldest eight yeares olde yet faire comely could olde count sate eating meate hall child came embracing hugging making much euen nature truly instructed aged though poore graundfather hee louingly receiuing kinde relation wisely silently kept himselfe sighes teares ioyes entermixed together child would part though tutour maister called often tolde mother shee came foorth neere adioyning parlour threatned beate would doe maister commanded child began cry saying would tarie still good olde man loued better maister whereat lady count began smile count like poore beggar father great lady arose humble reuerence shee noble woman conceiuing wonderfull ioy soule see faire goodly creature yet could take knowledge age want misery mightily altred head white beard without comely forme garment poore face wrinkled leane meager hee seemed rather carter count gianetta perceiuing child fetcht away returned againe olde man would leaue desired maister let alone thus child continued making much good olde man lord andrew mandeuile father sir roger came hall willed doe childrens schoolemaister hastie minded man one euer despised gianetta much since mariage sonne angerly said let alone mischiefe befall best company ought beggers bred borne mother side therefore meruaile like like beggers brat keepe company beggers count hearing contemptible word little greeued thereat although courage greater poore condition would permit expresse yet clouding iniuries noble patience hanging downe head shedding many salt teare endured reproach hee done many honourable sir roger perceiuing delight child tooke poore man company albeit offended father harsh word holding wife base respect yet fauoured poore count much seeing weepe greatly compassionate case saying poore man hee would accept seruice willingly would entertaine whereto count replied gladly would embrace kinde offer hee capable seruice saue onely horsekeeper wherein imployed part time heereupon pleasure pitty necessity seruice appointed keeping one horse onely daughter saddle daily done diligence horse nothing else play child fortune pleased thus dally poore count dangiers child came passe king france diuers league truce passed germaines died next son dolphin crowned king wife wrongfully caused count banishment expiration last league germains warres began grow much fierce sharpe king england vpon request made new brother france sent honourable supply people vnder conduct perotto lately elected president wale sir roger mandeuile son lord high marshall also poore count went continued long campe common souldier yet like valiant gentleman indeed lesse aduice action accomplished many notable matter expected come fell continuance warre queen france fell grieuous sicknes perceiuing selfe point death shee became penitently sorrowfull sinnes earnestly desiring shee might confessed archbishop roane reputed holy vertuous man repetition offence reuealed great wrong done count dangiers resting satisfied disclosing whole matter alone also confessed many worthy person great honour entreating worke king count yet liuing child might restored former honour againe long queene left life royally enterred confession disclosed king much sorrow iniuriously wronging man great valour honour proclamation made throughout camp many part france beside whosoeuer could produce count dangiers child richly rewarded one regard innocent foule imputation queenes owne confession wrongfull exile long exalted former honour farre greater fauours king franckely would bestow vpon count walked vp downe habite common seruitor heard proclamation forthwith went master sir roger mandeuile requesting speedy repaire lord perotto assembled together would acquaint serious matter concerning late proclamation published king themselues alone tent count spake maner perotto sir roger madeuile equal competitor military seruice husband naturall sister hauings yet neuer receiued dowry inherent vnblemishable vertue honor may stil remain destitute competent dowry desire sir roger none may enioy royall reward promised king lord perotto whose true name lewes manifest selfe nobly borne sonne wrongfull banished count dangiers auouch moreouer violenta shadowed vnder borrowed name gianetta owne sister deliuer vp father long exiled count dangiers perotto hearing beheld aduisedly began know tear flowing abundantly eye fell feete often embracing saide deere noble father thousand time deerely welcome sonne lewes sir roger mandeuile hearing first count said seeing perotto afterward performed became surprized extraordinary ioy admiration knew carry himselfe case neuerthelesse giuing credite word somewhat ashamed vsed count respectiue manner remembring beside vnkinde language furious father kneeled downe humbly crauing pardon father rudenes owne courteously granted count embracing louingly armes discoursed seuerall fortune sometime teares againe ioy perotto sir roger would haue count garmented better manner wise would suffer onely desire sir roger assured promised reward presenting king presence homely habit weare touch sensible shame rash beleefe iniurious proceeding sir roger mandeuile guiding count hand perotto following came king offering present count child reward promised proclamation might performed king immediately commanded reward inestimable valew produced desiring sir roger vppon sight thereof make good offer forthwith presenting count child hee made longer delay turning himselfe deliuered aged count title seruant presenting perotto next said sir heere deliuer father son daughter wife cannot conueniently heere shortly permission heauen maiesty shall haue sight king heard stedfastly looked count notwithstanding wonderfull alteration wonted feature forme yet seriously viewed knew perfectly teares trickling downe cheekes partly remorsefull shame ioy also happy recouery tooke vp count kneeling kissing embracing kindely welcomming perotto selfesame manner immediately also gaue commaund count restored honor apparrell seruants horse furniture answerable high estate calling speedily performed moreouer king greatly honoured sir roger mandeuile desiring made acquainted passed fortune sir roger receiued royall reward thus surrendring count sonne count calling saide take princely remuneration soueraigne lord king commending vnkinde father tell child beggar brat neither basely borne mother side sir roger returning home bountifull reward soone brought wife mother paris perotto wife great ioy triumph continued long noble count good honour restored far e greater measure euer sonnes law returning home wiues england left count king paris spent rest dayes great honour felicity bernardo merchant geneway deceiued another merchant named ambrosio lost great part good commanding innocent wife murthered shee escaped habite man became seruant soldane deceiuer found last shee compassed meanes husband bernardo came alexandria due punishment inflicted false deceiuer shee resumed garment againe woman returned home husband geneway ninth nouell wherein declared ouerliberall commending chastity woman falleth oftentimes dangerous especially meanes treacherers yet ende iustly punished treachery madam eliza hauing ended compassionate discourse indeede moued rest sighing queene faire comely stature carrying maiesticall countenance smiling familiarly spake thus necessary promise made dioneus carefully kept remaineth none report nouels onely selfe must first deliuer mine take honour last relating name last let owne deliuerance pausing little thus shee began againe many time among vulgar people hath passed common prouerbe deceiuer often trampled hath deceiued cannot shew selfe reason true except accident awaite treachery doe really make iust discouery thereof therefore according course day obserued woman must make good haue saide approbation prouerbe way hope distastfull hearing aduantageable preserue beguiling faire good inne paris much frequented many great italian merchant according variety occasion businesse vrged often resorting thither one night among many hauing merry supper together began discourse diuers matter falling one relation another communed friendly manner concerning wiues lefte home house quoth first cannot well imagine wife able say selfe pretty female fall company could easily forget loue wife make vse aduantage offered second replyed trust lesse perswaded wife willing wander law owne hand farre enough home dumbe walles blab tale offence vnknowne sildome neuer called question thirde man vnapt censure former fellowes iury plainly appeared al rest opinion condemning wiues ouerrashly alledging husband strayed far home wiues wit enough make vse time onely one man among named bernardo lomellino dwelling geneway maintained contrary boldly auouching especiall fauour fortune wife perfectly compleat al grace vertues lady world possibly could italy scarsely contained equall goodly person yet young quicke quaint milde courteous thing appertaining office wife either domesticke affayres imployment whatsoeuer womanhoode shee went beyond lord knight esquire gentleman could bee better serued table himselfe dayly wisedome modesty discretion hee praised riding hawking hunting fishing fowling reading writing enditing absolute keeping bookes account neither himselfe merchant could therein excell infinite commendation came former point argument concerning easie falling woman wantonnesse maintaining solemne oath woman possibly could chaste honest respect verily perswaded stayed ten yeares space yea life time house yet neuer would shee falsifie faith lewdly allured man among merchant thus communing together young proper man named ambroginolo placentia began laugh last praise bernardo vsed wife seeming make mockerie thereat demaunded emperour giuen priuiledge aboue married men bernardo somewhat offended answered emperour bath done especiall blessing heauen exceeding emperours earth grace thereby haue receiued fauour whereto ambroginolo presently thus replied bernardo without question contrary beleeue thou hast said true ought perceiue thou hast slender iudgement nature thing thou didst obserue well thou couldst grosse vnderstanding comprehending matter true kinde nature thou wouldst speake correctly thou doest end thou mayest imagine wee haue spoken wiues doe thinke otherwise well honestly thou canst thine thing else vrge speech falling kinde discourse onely naturall instinct admonition proceede familiarly little thee vpon matter already propounded haue euermore vnderstood man noble creature formed god liue world woman next degree man generally beleeued discerned apparant effect perfect hauing perfection without doubt must much firme constant like manner hath beene vniuersally graunted woman various mutable reason thereof may approued many naturall circumstance needlesse make mention man possessed greater stability yet cannot containe himselfe condiscending say one entreates desire may please beside couet enioying owne pleasing contentment thing chancing moneth infinite time dayes space conceiue fraile woman subiect nature entreaty flattery gift perswasions thousand enticing meanes man affected vse doest thou think shee hath power containe assuredly though thou shouldst rest resolued yet cannot opinion sure thou beleeuest must needes confesse thy wife woman made flesh blood woman shee cannot without desire weakenesse strength woman haue resist naturall appetite owne regard whereof meerely impossible although shee honest must need woman nothing else possible either denied affirmed contrary thou vnaduisedly hast done bernardo answered manner merchant philosopher like merchant meane answere thee learne accident thee related may happen fooles void vnderstanding shame wise endued vertue haue alwayes precious esteeme honour containe principle constancie men meerely carelesse iustifie wife one beleeue bernardo replied ambroginolo often thy wiues minde addicted wanton folly badge scorne arise thy forehead render testimonie female frailty beleeue number would willingly would wish among married men euery degree note secret wiues imperfection sharpest sight able discerne wiser sort men willing know shame losse honour neuer imposed case euident apparant perswade thy selfe bernardo woman may accomplish secret rarely faile doe abstaine feare folly wherefore hold certaine rule woman onely chaste neuer solicited personally endured sute either shee answered yea albeit know true many infallible naturall reason yet could speake exactly doe tried experimentally humour affection diuers woman yea let tell thee bernardo priuate company thy wife howsoeuer pure precise thou presumest account matter impossibility finde selfe frailty bernardoes blood began boile patience little put downe choller thus hee replied combat word requires ouerlong continuance maintaine matter thou deniest sort nothing end seeing thou presumest woman apt tractable thy selfe confident thine owne power willingly yeeld better assurance wife constant loyalty haue head smitten thou canst winne dishonest act meanes whatsoeuer thou canst vse vnto thou canst doe thou shalt onely loose thousand duckets gold began ambroginolo heated word answering thus bernardo wager know doe thy head thou willing stand vpon proofe pawne downe fiue thousand duckets gold matter much lesse value thy head thousand duckets mine granting lawfull limitted time require space three moneths day departiug hence stand bound goe geneway winne kinde consent thy wife shall mine owne consent witnesse whereof bring backe priuate especiall token thou thy selfe shalt confesse haue failed prouided thou doe first promise vpon thy faith absent thy selfe thence limitted time hinderance thy letter concerning attempt vndertaken bernardo saide bargaine man make good fiue thousand duckets albeit merchant present earnestly laboured breake wager knowing great harme must need ensue thereon yet party hot fiery men spake effect writing made sealed deliuered vnder either hand bernardo remaining paris ambroginolo departing geneway remained dayes learne streetes name bernardo dwelt also condition quality wife scarcely pleased heard farre beyond husband relation shee reputed onely wonder woman whereby plainely perceiued vndertaken idle enterprise yet would giue ouer proceeded therein little wrought meanes came acquainted poore woman often frequented bernardoes house greatly fauour wife vpon whose pouerty preuailed earnest perswasions much large gift money manner following faire artificiall chest caused purposely made wherein himselfe might aptly contained conueyed house bernardoes wife vnder colour formall excuse poore woman absent city two three dayes shee must keepe safe till returne gentlewoman suspecting guile chest receptacle woman wealth would trust roome owne bedchamber place ambroginolo desired bee thus conueyed chamber night going apace gentlewoman fast asleepe bed lighted taper stood burning table husband absence shee euer vsed haue ambroginolo softly opened chest according cunningly hee contriued stepping forth sockes made cloath obserued scituation chamber painting picture beautifull hanging thing else remarkable perfectly committed memory going neere bed saw lie sweetly sleeping young daughter like manner shee seeming compleate pleasing creature shee attired best brauery especiall note marke could hee descrie whereof might make credible report onely small wart vpon left pappe haires growing thereon appearing yellow gold sufficient seene durst presume taking one ring lay vpon table purse hanging wall light wearing robe silke girdle put chest himselfe closed fast continuing chamber two seuerall night gentlewoman neither mistrusting missing thing third day come poore woman according formerly concluded came haue home chest againe brought safely owne house ambroginolo comming forth satisfied poore woman liking returning forenamed thing fast conueniently could paris arriued long limitted time called merchant together present passed word wager auouching bernardo fiue thousand duckets performed taske vndertooke make good protestation first described forme chamber curious picture hanging manner bed stood euery circumstance else beside next shewed seuerall thing brought away thence affirming receiued selfe bernardo confessed description chamber true acknowledged moreouer thing belong wife quoth may gotten corrupting seruant mine intelligence chamber also ring purse else beside suffice win wager without apparant pregnant token troth answered ambroginolo think serue sufficient proofes seeing thou art desirous know plainely tell thee faire geneura thy wife hath small round wart vpon left pappe little golden haires growing thereon bernardo heard word many stab heart yea beyond compasse patient sufferance changing colour noted manifestly vnable vtter one word ambroginolo spoken nothing truth within saide gentleman ambroginolo hath saide true wherefore let come shall paide accordingly performed next day euen vtmost penny departing paris towards geneway malicious intention wife come neere city would enter rode countrey house standing tenne mile distant thence arriued called seruant hee reposed especiall trust sending geneway two horse writing wife returned shee come thither see secretly charged seruant soone brought conuenient place kill without pitty compassion returne againe seruant come geneway deliuered letter message geneura gaue ioyfull welcome morrow morning mounting horsebacke seruant rode merrily towards countrey house diuers thing shee discoursed way til descended deepe solitary valey thickly beset high huge spreading tree seruant supposed meete place execution master command suddenly drawing forth sword holding geneura fast arme saide mistresse quickly commend soule god must die passe geneura seeing naked sword hearing word peremptorily deliuered fearefully answered ala deare friend mercy god sake thou kill tell wherein haue offended thee thou must kill ala good mistresse replied serua haue way offended occasion haue displeased husband vtterly vnknowne hath strictly commanded without respect pitty compassion kill way bring doe hath sworne hang necke know good mistresse much stand obliged impossible contradict thing commandeth god witnesse truly compassionate yet meanes may let liue geneura kneeling weeping wringing hand thus replied wilt thou turne monster murtherer neuer wronged thee please another man bare command god truly knoweth thing faithfull witnesse neuer committed offence whereby deserue dislike husband much lesse harsh recompence flying mine owne iustification appealing thy manly mercy thou mayest wert thou well pleased moment satisfie thy master manner make plaine apparant thee take thou garment spare onely thy doublet bonnet fitting man returne habite thy master assuring deede done sweare thee life enioy thy mercy strangely disguise selfe wander farre country neither thou person belonging part shall euer heare tydings seruant great good kill easily grew pittifull tooke vpper garment gaue poore ragged doublet sillie chapperone small store money desiring forsake countrey left walke foote vally came maister deliuered garment assured onely accomplished commaund also secure discouery sooner done deede foure fiue rauenous wolfe came presently running dead body gaue buriall belly bernardo soone returning geneway much blamed vnkinde cruelty wife constant auouching treason according country custome cleare pursuite law poore geneura left thus alone disconsolate night stealing fast vpon shee went silly village neere adioyning meanes good olde woman got prouision place afforded making doublet fit body conuerting petticote paire breech according mariner fashion cutting haire queintly disguised like sayler shee went sea coast good fortune met gentleman cathalogna whose name signior enchararcho came land ship lay hulling albagia refresh himselfe pleasant spring enchararcho taking man shee appeared otherwise habite vpon conference passing betweene shee entertained seruice brought aboord ship went vnder name sicurano da finale shee better apparell bestowne gentleman seruice proued pleasing acceptable hee liked care diligence beyond comparison came passe within short gentleman cathalogna sayled charge alexandria carying thither c rtaine peregrine faulcons hee presented soldane oftentimes welcommed gentleman table hee obserued behauiour sicurano attending maisters tre cher therewith highly pleased requested haue gentleman aduancement willingly parted lately entertained seruant sicurano ready discreete dayly seruices grew great grace soldane done enchararcho certaine season yeare customarie order obserued formerly beene citie acre vnder soldanes subiection yearely met great assembly merchant christian moore iewes sarrazines many nation beside common mart fayre end merchant better sale good might safer assurance soldane vsed send thither ordinarie officer strong guard souldiers beside defend iniuries molestation reaped thereby meane benefit sent businesse new elected fauourite sicurano skilfull perfect language sicurano come acre lord captaine guard merchant safety merchandizes discharged office commendably walking traine euery part fayre shee obserued worthy company merchant sicilian pisanes genewayes venetian italian willingly shee noted remembrance natiue countrey one especiall time among chancing shop boothe belonging venetian espied hanging vp costly ware purse girdle suddainly shee remembred sometime owne whereat little abashed mind without making outward shew courteously requested know whose whether sold ambroginolo placentia likewise come thither great store merchandizes hee brought carrack appertaining venetian hee hearing captaine guard demaund whose stepped foorth smiling answered w solde yet hee liked gladly hee would bestowe sicurano seeing smile suspected least himselfe vnfitting behauiour beene occasion thereof therefore setled countenance hee said perhaps thou smilest man professing armes question womanish toyes ambroginolo replied lord pardon ismile demaund manner came thing sicurano vpon answere ten time desirous said fortune fauoured thee friendly manner obtaining thing may spoken tell thou hadst lord answered ambroginolo thing many beside giuen gentlewoman geneway named madame geneura wife one bernardo lomellino recompence one night lodging desired keepe sake maine reason smiling remembrance husband folly waging fiue thousand duckets golde one thousand mine obtaine wife thereby wone wager hee better deserued punished folly shee sicke woman disease returning paris geneway caused slaine afterward reported himselfe sicurano heard horrible lye immediatly shee conceiued occasion husband hatred hard hap since suffered whereupon shee reputed mortall sinne villaine passe without due punishment sicurano seemed like well report grew familiarity ambroginolo perswasions fayre ended tooke higher alexandria ware along furnishing fit conuenient shop made great benefit merchandizes trusting monies captaines custody safest course continued meane contentment much shee pitty husband perplexity deuising good warrantable meanes might make knowne innocency wherein place authority greatly sted shee wrought diuers gallant merchant geneway remained alexandria vertue soldans friendly letter beside bring thither vpon especiall occasion come albeit poore meane order soone better altered appointment honourably though priuate entertained diuers worthy friend till time fauour shee intended expectation bernardoes arriuall shee preuailed ambroginolo tale formerly tolde deliuered againe presence soldane seemed well pleased shee seene husband shee thought vpon serious businesse prouiding selfe apt opportunity shee entreated fauour soldane men might brought ambroginolo would confesse without constraint made vaunt concerning bernardoes wife might compelled thereto perforce sicuranoes word law soldane ambroginolo bernardo brought face face soldane sterne angry countenance presence princely assembly commanded ambroginolo declare truth yea vpon peril life mean wager fiue thousand golden duckets receiued bernardo ambroginolo seeing sicurano present vpon whose fauour wholly relied yet perceiuing lookes likewise dreadfull soldanes hearing threaten greeuous torment except reuealed truth indeede may easily guesse faire company condition stood instant frownes fury beheld either side bernardo standing world famous witness heare lie confounded owne confession tongue denie constantly auouched yet dreaming paine penalty restoring backe fiue thousand duckets gold thing purloyned truly reuealed whole forme falshood sicurano according soldane formerly commanded turning bernardo saide thou vpon suggestion foule lie didst thou thy wife quoth bernardo ouercome rage losse money dishonour supposed receiue wife caused seruant mine kill credibly auouched body deuoured rauenous wolues moment thing thus spoken heard presence soldane reason yet made knowne case seriously vrged end would succeede sicurano spake manner soldane gracious lord may plainely perceiue degree poore gentlewoman might make vaunt well prouided louing friend husband friend loue instant wicked lye hee robbed renowne honour bereft also husband husband rather crediting anothers falshood inuincible trueth whereof faithfull knowledge long honourable experience caused slaine made foode deuouring wolues beside good affection borne woman friend husband longest continuer company make alike knowledge great wisedome knoweth perfectly haue worthily deserued please euer knowne gracious benignity permit punishment deceiuer pardon party deceiued procure meanes shall appeare presence soldane desirous giue sicurano manner satisfaction hauing followed course industriously bad produce woman hee well contented whereat bernardo stoode much amazed verily beleeued dead ambroginolo foreseeing already preparation punishment feared repayment money would serue turne knowing also hope suspect woman selfe personally appeare hee imagined would miracle sicurano hauing thus obtayned soldanes permission teares humbling selfe feete moment shee lost manly voyce demeanour knowing longer vse must truely witnesse indeede therefore thus spake great soldane miserable vnfortunate geneura space sixe whole yeares haue wandered world habite man falsly maliciously slaundered villainous traytour ambroginolo vnkinde cruell husband betrayed seruant slaine left deuoured sauage beast afterward desiring garment better fitted shewing brest made apparant soldane assistant woman indeede turning selfe ambroginolo manly courage demaunded lay villainously ashamed make vaunt hee hauing alreadie acknowledged contrarie stricken dumbe shamefull disgrace able vtter one word soldane alwayes reputed sicurano man hauing heard seene admirable accident amazed minde many time doubtfull whether dreame absolute relation trueth hee seriously considered thereon found reall infallible extraordinary gracious praise commended life constancie condition vertues geneura till time alwayes called sicurano committing company honourable lady changed manly habite pardoned bernardo husband according request formerly made although hee iustly deserued death likewise himselfe confessed falling feete geneura desired teares forgiue rash transgression louingly kissing embracing thousand time soldane strictly commaunded high eminent place citie ambroginolo bound impaled stake hauing naked body anointed ouer honey neuer taken vntill selfe fell piece according sentence presently performed next gaue expresse charge mony good giuen geneura valued aboue ten thousand double duckets forthwith solemne feast prepared wherein much honour done bernardo husband geneura worthy woman matchlesse wife gaue costly iewels also vessel gold siluer plate much amounted aboue ten thousand double duckets feasting finished caused ship furnished graunting licence depart geneway pleased whither returned rich ioyfully welcommed home great honour especially madame geneura euery one supposed dead alwayes long shee liued shee famous manifold vertues ambroginolo day impaled stake annointed honey fixed place appointed meane torment onely died likewise deuoured bare bone flyes waspes hornet whereof countrey notoriously aboundeth bone full forme fashion remained strangely blacke long knit together sinewes witnesse many thousand people afterward beheld carkasse wickednesse good vertuous woman much thought euill towards thus prouerbe truly verified shame succeedeth vgly sinne deceiuer trampled trod himselfe hath deceiued pagammo da monaco rouing pirate sea caried away faire wife signior ricciardo di chinzica vnderstanding shee went thither falling friendship pagamino demaunded wife whereto yeelded prouided shee would willingly goe away denied part thence husband signior ricciardo dying became wife pagamino tenth nouell wherein olde men wittily reprehended match themselues younger woman fit yeares insufficiencie neuer considering afterward may happen every one honest gracious assembly highly commended nouell recounted queene especially dioneus remained finish dayes pleasure owne discourse many praise former tale past thus began faire lady part queenes nouell hath made alteration minde intended proceede next withall therefore report another cannot forget vnmanly indiscretion bernardo much base arrogancie ambroginolo iustly deserued shame fell vpon well may happen vile owne opinion apparantly approued himselfe men wander abroade world according occasion diuersity country obseruation people behauiour humour variously transported finde woman wantonly disposed abroade like iudgement giue wiues home neuer knowne birth breeding made proofe loyall carriage towards wherefore tale purpose relate likewise condemne like kinde men especially suppose themselues endued strength nature euer meant bestow vpon foolishly beleeuing couer satisfie owne defect fabulous demonstration wife marriage quality much rather haue auoyded could haue ministred good counsell others resorting aduice vpon amorous diligent inquisition came passe worthy gentleman called bertolomea one fairest choysest young maides pisa whose youth hardly agree age mucke motiue mariage expectation mutuall contentment iudge maried bride brought solemnly home house need make question braue cheare banqueting lacke answer yet wanted neither good wine drugges restauratiues comfort heart encrease good blood auayled case well fare good courage performance faileth could liberally commend passed iouiall dayes make promise faire felicity yet come youth would renew selfe like eagle vigour full force beside idle allegation would need instruct wife almanack calender long bought rauenna wherein plainely shewed thousand holy dayes fridayes saturdayes sundayes honor lord rest sacred time lent also certaine obseruations moone infinite exception beside thinking perhaps conuenient men refraine wiues conuersation often time sitting court daily document young wife wherewith poore soule became tired nothing could irksome careful lest shold teach belo ged working day wold haue herknow none holiday afterwa came passe season waxing extremely hot signior ricciardo would goe recreate himselfe house countrey neere vnto black mountaine faire wiues contentment continued diuers dayes together recreation gaue order haue day fishing going aboard small pinnace among fisher shee another consorted diuers gentlewoman whose company shee shewed selfe well pleased delight made launch sea either iudge willing haue done agreed respect owne safety suddenly galliot came vpon wherein one pagamino pyrate famous dayes espying two pinnace made presently seized wherein woman beheld faire young woman coueted purchase mounting galliot sight signior ricciardo time fearefully landed caried away signior iudge seene theft iealous wife scarcely would let ayre breathe needlesse demand know whether offended made complaint pisa many place beside iniury sustained pryrates carying wife thus away vaine neither yet knew man whether conueyed pagamino perceiuing beautifull woman made precious esteeme purchase himselfe report acquainted ricciardo iudge wife kept whereupon determined send one rather go himselfe person redeem pyrate sum mony demand sea passed monaco saw wife shee soone shee made known pagamino morrow following signior ricciardo meeting pagamino made mean acquainted within lesse houres space grew familiar priuate conference pagamino yet pretending know expected issue talke would sort time serued iudge discoursed occasion comming thither desiring demand ransome pleased might haue wife home whereto pagamino thus answered lord iudge welcome hither answer breefely true haue yong gentlewoman house whome neither know wife man else whatsoeuer ignorant albeit hath remained bee husband seeme auouch bring appeare worthy gentleman questionles cannot chuse know perfectly confirme haue said willing depart hence shall rest well satisfied haue recompence ransome regard graue reuerent yeares selfe shall please giue fall otherwise proue haue affirmed shall offer great wrong seeking get young man well maintaine faire wife man else know beleeue certainly replied iudge wife please bring shall soone perceiue presently cast armes neck durst aduenture vtter losse shee denie doe presence come said pagamino let v delay time longer entred pagaminoes house sate downe hall caused called shee readily prepared purpose came forth chamber friendly sate conuersing together neuer vttering one word signior ricciardo knowing stranger pagamino might bring house lord iudge beheld expected finde farre gracious welcome stoode man amazed saying himselfe perhaps extraordinary griefe mellancholly suffered since time losse hath altred wonted complexion shee able take knowledge wherefore going neerer hee said faire loue dearely haue bought going fishing neuer man felt like affliction haue done since day lost vnciuill silence seeme know dearest loue seest thou thy husband ricciardo come pay ransome gentleman shall demaund euen house conuay thee home againe vpon kinde promise thy deliuerance payment thy ransome bertolomea turning towards seeming shee smiled selfe thus answered sir speake aduise selfe well least mistake concerning selfe doe remember euer see till quoth ricciardo consider better say looke circumspectly remember louing husband name ricciardo di cinzica must pardon sir replied bertolomea know fitting modest woman though perhaps perswaded stand gazing face men let mee looke vpon neuer often certaine till instant haue seene lord iudge coceiued mind thus denied knowledg standing feare pagamino would confesse presence wherefore hee entreated pagamino affoord much fauour might speake alone chamber pagamino answered well contented therewith prouided kisse requested bartolomea goe alone chamber heare could say answere shee found occasion come chamber none present shee signior ricciardo began manner heart heart life life sweetest hope haue world wilt thou know thine owne ricciardo loueth thee doth himselfe art thou strange disfigured thou knowest behold pleasing eye pray thee bertolomea smiled selfe without suffering proceed speech returned answere would haue vnderstand sir memory obliuious know signior ricciardo di cinzica husband name title time place sutable mind youth referring feast vigil fasting dayes mature stayed time age body better able endure mind may prepared ghostly meditation depart therefore owne pleasure make much calender without enioying company mine heare resolued determination iudge hearing word ouercome exceeding griefe silent thus began ala deare loue answer hast thou regard thine owne honor thy parent friend canst thou rather affect abide pleasure man sin capitally liue pisa state wife consider deare heart man shall waxe weary thee thy shame owne disgrace reiect thee must shall loue thee euer dye leaue thee lady commandresse mine inordinate appetite cause thee carelesse thine honour loues thee owne life ala fairest hope say returne home acquainted thy inclination endeauour heereafter giue thee better contentment wherefore deare heart doe denie change thy minde goe neuer saw merry day since lost thee sir quoth desire body haue care mine honor beside selfe cannot abused parent respect made wife could carelesse mee reason haue regard whereas taxe cannot liue without capitall sin farre thought thereof regarded wife pagamino pisa reputed worthy society point moone quadrature geomatrie planet held coniunction betweene whereas subiect constellation say beside hereafter striue giue better contentment haue done surely mine opinion way possible complexion farre different ice fire gold drosse allegation gentleman reiecting humour satisfied proue least part feare fortune soeuer shall betide neuer make meanes misery misaduentures may happen world affoord one resting place contentment high mounted walles whereinto entred found beautiful garden stored variety possibly could deuised therefore obserued respectiuley walkes allyes long spacious yet directly straite arrow enuironed hardly kept place woorthy lady wantes store men woman simple credit certainty soon yong virgin hath veile pnt hir head shorn filletted blacke cowle giuen couer withall shee longer woman sensible feminine affection turning nun shee became conuerted stone perchance heard matter contrary former setled perswasion growe furiously offended one committed foul enormous sinne directly course nature torrent opinion hurry violently admit least leisure consider full scope liberty haue power list yea beyonde meanes sufficient satisfying neuer ramembring withall potent priuiledge idlenesse especially backt solitude like manner people verily belieue spade pickaxe grosse feeding labour quench sensuall fleshly concupiscence yea till husband ground making dull blockish almost meere senslesse vnderstanding approue according queene hath commanded within compasse direction make apparant al short pleasant tale greatly abused error build vpon weake foundation far alexandria yet great goodly monastery belonging lord part termed admiral therein vnder care trust one woman diuers virgin kept recluse nunnes vowed chastity life whose number soldan babylon vnder liued subiection euery three yeares end vsually three virgin sent time wherof speak remained monastery eight religious sister beside gouernesse lady abbesse honest poore man gardiner kept garden commendable order wage small well contented therewith would serue longer making account euen factotum bayliffe belonging house returned thence village lamporechio nature place among many gaue welcom home yong hebrew pezant country sturdy strong yet comely person named masset born farre lamporechio bin brought vp yonger dayes name masset according vulgar speech turned massetto therefore vsually called knowne name massetto lamporechio massetto falling talke honest poore man whose name lurco demanded seruices hee done monasterie hauing continued long time quoth lurco laboured garden faire great went forest fetch home wood cleft chamber fuell drawing vppe water beside many toilesom seruices else allowance wage little would pay shooes wore worst yong woman thinke deuill dwels among man cannot doe thing please haue bene busie worke garden one would come say put heere put others would take dibble hand telling performe thing well making weary continuall trifling haue lefte businesse gaue ouer garden one mollestation also many intended tarry longer came away thou seest yet factotum desired departing knew one would vndertake aforesaid labour send thither indeed promised let mee fall sicke dye helpe send massetto heard word lurco hee desirous dwell among nunnes nothing else hammered head meant subtilly poore lurco made doubt please sufficiently considering himselfe best might bring intent effect appeared easily done could question therein lurco onely demanded matter among said introth thou didst well lurco come away tedious dwelling need man liue woman better dwell among many diuels vnderstand tenth part woman wily wit diue conference ended massetto began beat braines might compasse dwell among knowing could well enough performe labour whereof lurco made mention cared losse sustaine thereby onely stoode doubt entertainment yong sprightly hauing pondered many imagination saide himselfe place farre enough distant hence none take knowledge mee haue wit sufficient cleanely make beleeue dumbe questionlesse shall receiued resoluing prosecute determination tooke spade shoulder without reuealing body whether went disguise poore laboring countryman trauelled monastery arriued found great gate open entering boldly good hap espy factotum court according lurco giuen description making signes dumbe deafe manifested craued almes god sake making shewes beside need required could cleaue wood reasonable kinde seruice factotum gladly gaue food afterward shewed diuers knotty log wood weake strength lurco left vnclouen fellow actiue lusty quickly rent piece fell factotum must need go forrest tooke massetto along thither causing fell diuers tree signes bad lade two ass therewith commonly carried home wood driue monasterie massetto knew well enough performed effectually many seruile office bee done caused factotum make vse paine diuers dayes beside time lady abbesse chancing see demanded factotum madam quoth hee poore labouring man deafe dumbe hither came craue almes day charity could lesse giue hee hath done many honest seruices house seemes beside hee hath pretty skill gardening perswade continue make question able seruices old silly man gone haue neede stout fellow businesse belonging vnto monastery one fitter turne come sildome hither moreouer regard double imperfection sister sustaine impeachment whereto abbesse answered saying faith body speake truth vnderstand hee haue knowledge gardening whether hee dwell heere compasse kindly let haue new paire shoe fill belly daily full meate flatter make much wee shall finde worke enough factotum promised fulfill sufficiently massetto farre seemed seriously busied sweeping making cleane court hearde speech little ioyfull saide himselfe come worke garden let proofe yeelde praise skill knowledge factotum perceiued knew perfectly vndergo businesse questioned signes concerning willingnesse serue still receiued like answer also dutifull readinesse thereto gaue order worke garden season require leaue affayres monastery attending onely garden preparation massetto thus garden emploiment nunnes began resort thither thinking man bee dumbe deafe indeede lauish language mocking flowting immodestly perswaded heard lady abbesse thinking might well eunuch depriued hearing speaking stood lesse feare sister wal referred owne care prouidence day massetto hauing laboured somewhat extraordinarily lay downe rest himselfe awhile vnder tree two delicate yong nunnes walking take aire drew neere place dissembled sleeping obseruing comelinesse person began pity pouerty condition much misery great defectes one little liuelier spirit thinking massetto fast asleepe began manner sister quoth faithfully assured thy secrecieexample least excuse formed intent preuaileth much kind religious woman would tell thee thing haue often thought may perhaps redound thy profit sister replyed nun speake minde boldly beleeue maidenhead neuer reueale creature liuing encoraged solemne answer first nun thus prosecuted former purpose saying know sister whether hath entred thine vnderstanding strictly kept attended neuer man daring aduenture among v except good honest factotum aged dumbe fellow maimed made imperfect nature therefore woorthy title man ah sister hath tentimes bin told gentlewoman comming hither visite v sweetes world meere mockery incomparable pleasure man woman barred vnkind parent binding v perpetuall chastity neuer able obserue themselues sister house told turne came sent soldane fell frailty man lame blinde discouering ghostly father confession absolued sinne affirming transgressed man wanted rationall vnderstanding part behold sister heere lye creature almost formed selfesame mold dumb deafe two rational vnderstanding part belong man therefore man wanting folly frailty committed many time since hee came hither hath run minde hee nature sworne secrecie cannot would blabbe thereof beside lavves constitution religion doth teach v sinne assuredly concealed halfe absolued aue maria sister said nunne kinde word vtter doe know wee haue promised virginity god oh sister answered many thing promised euery day one thousand kept performed wee haue made promise weaker witted sister performe v doubt accept part payment yea sister replied second nunne againe another danger lying way wee proue childe shall doe sister quoth couragious wench thou art afraid harme happen come passe let v consider thou art nouice matter moment wee prouided thousand meanes whereby preuent conception faile wee surely fitted world shall neuer know let suffice liues must much suspected monasterie questioned religion rashly scandalized thus shee schooled younger sister wit albeit forward longed desirously know kinde creature man question intention might safely brought full effect sprightly nunne wit thus answered see sister quoth houre midday rest sisterhood quiet chamber allowed sleepe earlier rising morning mattins none garden selues awake watch afterward follow fortune valiantly leade way massetto imitating dogges sleepe hea conspiracie intended longed earnestly till shee came awake done seeming simply sottish chearing flattering behauiour close arbour went sunnes bright eye could pierce leaue nunnes owne approbation whether massetto man rationall ill deedes require longer time contriue act nunnes hauing beene massetto new forme confession enioyned easie silent penance brought oftner shrift made prooue perfect confessour desire obtained fully satisfied doe commonly vrge frequent accesse wisdome thinkes expedient continue without discouerie two iouiall nunnes little proud priuate stolne pleasure long resorted close arbour till sister often obserued haunt thither meanes little hole window shee began suspect massetto imparted two sister three concluding accuse lady abbesse vpon conference offender changed opinion tooke oath forewoman done would free taxation reuealed aduentures three ignorants fell eight one formall confederacie good warie obseruation least abbesse selfe descry finding poore massetto plenty gardenworke made doubtfull pleasing came passe end lady abbesse imagined matter walking alone garden day found massetto sleeping vnder almond tree hauing little businesse doe wrought hard night shee obserued hansome man young lusty well limbde proportioned hauing mercifull commisseration dumbnesse deafenesse perswaded also like manner eunuch deserued thousand time pittied season exceeding hot lay downe carelesly sleepe something noted wherein shee intended better resolued almost falling sicke nunnes disease hauing awaked commanded signes follow chamber kep close long nunnes grew offended gardener came dayly labour well may imagine massetto misseproud man thus aduanced garden chamber worse woman lady abbesse selfe signes shewes language speaks able expresse onely appeard behauiour pleased well procured daily repairing thither acquainted familiar conuersation shee would haue condemned nun daughter wise enough keepe began massetto consider himselfe vndertaken taske belonging great hercules giuing content ment many continuing dumbe manner would redound meane detriment whereupon hee one night sitting abbesse string restrained tongue speech brake sodaine thus spake madam haue often heard said one cocke may doe seruice ten seuerall hennes ten men hardly euen best endeauour giue full satisfaction euery way one woman yet tied content mine farre beyond compasse power doe already haue performed much garden chamberworke confesse selfe starke tired trauaile therefore let entreate lysence departure hence finde meanes better ease abbesse hearing speake long serued dumbe stricken admiration accounting almost miracle saide commeth passe verily beleeued thee dumbe madam quoth massetto indeed nature onely long lingering sicknesse bereft speech haue onely recouered againe night shall euer remaine thankfull abbesse verily credited answer demanding meant saying seruice nine madam quoth dangerous question easily answered eight sister vpon reply abbesse plainely perceiued onely shee fallen folly nunnes likewise cried guilty wherefore woman sound discretion would grant massetto depart keepe still nunnes businesse monastery scandalized factotum dead little strange recouery speech reuealed thing else neerely concerning generall consent vvith good liking massetto created factotum monasterie neighbouring people dwelling thereabout knew masetto dumbe fetching home wood daily forrest diuers employment place made beleeue nunnes deuoute prayer discipline also merit saint whose honour monastery built erected massetto long restrained speech restored become sole factotum hauing power employ others drudgery ease himselfe labour albeit make nunnes fruitfull encreasing store yonger sister yet matter close cleanly carried neuer talkt till death ladie abbesse massetto beganne grow good yeares desired returne home natiue abiding within granted thus massetto rich old returned home like wealthy father taking care nursing child bequeathed place bred born hauing wit ingenious apprehension made benefit youthfull year merrily tooke ease age querry stable belonging agilulffo king lombard found meanes accesse queenes bed without knowledge consent secretly discouered king party knowne gau marke shearing haire head whereupon shorne sheared likewise head fellowes lodging escaped punishment intended towards second nouell wherein signified prouidence wise man shall haue reason vse reuenge cunning meanes another hee compasseth meanes defend himselfe perill nouell philostratus concluded made lady blush rest smile pleased queene madam pampinea follow next second gone smiling whole assembly began thus men shallow capacity neuerthelesse make shew knowing vnderstanding thing neither able doe appertaine whereby sometimes reprehend men errours fault haue vnwillingly committed thinking thereby hide owne shame make much apparant manifest proofe whereof faire company contrary kinde shew subtill cunning one perhaps might reputed lesse reckoning massetto yet hee went beyond king thought himselfe much wiser man agilalffo king lombardie according predecessours done made principall seate kingdome citie pauia hauing embraced mariage tendelinga late left widdow vetario likewise beene king lombard beautifull wise vertuous lady made vnfortunate mischance occurrence estate whole realme honourable quiet well setled condition discreete care prouidence king querrie appertaining queenes stable horse man meane lowe quality though comely person equall stature king became immeasurably amorous queene base seruile condition endued much vnderstanding know infallibly affection mounted beyond compasse conueniencie wisely hee concealed himselfe acquainting one therewith daring much discouer either lookes affectionate behauiour although hee liued vtterly hopelesse euer attaining heart desire yet notwithstanding hee proudly gloried loue soared high pitch enamoured queene dayly fury flame encreased cariage farre aboue fellowes companion performing seruiceable duty way imagined might content queene whereon ensued whensoeuer shee roade abroad take ayre shee vsed oftner mount horse querrie brought shee made choise led fellowes esteeme meane happinesse order stirrope mounting therefore gaue dayly due attendance touch stirrop much put foote touch part garment thought onely heauen earth see oftentimes come passe much lower hope declineth much higher loue ascendeth euen fel poore querry irkesome endure heauy waight continuall oppression hauing hope least mitigation vtterly vnable relinquish loue diuers time resolued desperate conclusion might yet giue world euident testimony dyed loue bare queene vpon determination hee grounded successe future fortune dye compassing part desire without either speaking queene sending missiue loue speake write meerely vaine drew worser consequence death could bestow himselfe easily listed course beleagers braines onely secret accesse queenes bed might get entrance chamber vnder colour king knew well slept manie night together queene wherefore see manner vsuall habit king came keepe companie vvith queene hid himselfe diuers night gallery betweene lodging chamber length saw king come forth chamber himselfe alone faire nightmantle wrapt carrying lighted taper one hand small white wand went queenes lodging knocking doore twice wand vsing word doore opened light left without entered chamber stayed long returning backe againe likewise diligently obserued familiar wardrobe often fetching returning king queenes furniture fellowe mantle king wore went queene secretly conueighed away thence prouided light verie like wand bestowes costly bathing body least sent stable might felt finding time sutable desire knew king rest owne lodging else sleeping bed closely steal gallery alighting taper tinder purposely brought thither mantle folded wand hand valiantly aduentures vpon liues perill twice hee knockt softly doore wayting woman immediately opened receyuing light went forth gallery supposed king conuersing vvith queene ala good queene heere sinne committed without guiltie thought thee within plainely appeared querry hauing compassed couered fearing forfeite life delay amorous desire indifferently satisfied returned backe came sleepy waiting woman much looking rather glad might get rest againe scarcely querrie stept bed vnheard discerned fellowes diuers lodging next chamber pleased king visite queene according wonted manner little meruaile drowsie wayting woman neuer twice troubled night king bed whereas alwayes till resort queene altogether sadnesse melancholly comming departing without speaking one word maiestie become pleasantly disposed whereat queene began little meruaile trust mee sir quoth shee hath long wished welcome alteration vouchsafing twice night visite within compasse one houre cannot much since comming againe king hearing word sodainly presumed counterfeit person queene night beguiled wherefore aduisedly hee considered regard party vnknowne woman make outward appearance knowing rather concealed himselfe farre indiscretion harebraind men presently would haue answered sworne came hither night till whereupon many danger might ensue dishonor preiudice queene beside hir error discouered hir might afterward occasion vrge wandring appetite couet change againe silence shame redounded whereas prating must needes publisher open infamie yet hee much vexed minde neither lookes word hee would discouer pleasantly said queene madame although heere night hope mislike second seeing please come againe truely sir quoth onely desire haue care health well said king follow counsaile returne mine owne lodging againe committing queene good rest blood boyling rage distemper monstrous iniurie offered wrapt nightmantle leauing chamber imagining whatsoeuer needes must one owne house tooke light hand conuayed little lanthorne purposing resolued suspition guest stranger court onely belonged houshold lodged altogether escurie stable appointed diuers bed conceite whosoeuer beene lately familiar queene heart pulse could yet hardly rest rather would troubled apparant agitation discouering guilt great offender many chamber hee passed thorow soundly sleeping yet felt brest pulse last came lodging man indeede impudently vsurped place could yet sleepe ioy atchieued aduenture espied king come knowing well occasion search began waxe doubtfull heart pulse beating extremely felt addition feare confidently perswaded way death especially king discouered agony although many consideration braine yet saw king vnarmed best refuge make shew sleepe expectation king intended doe among sought yet could find likelihood wherby gather grounded probability vntill came querry whose heart pulse laboured sternely said himselfe yea mary man deede neuerthelesse purposing make apparance intention nothing else drawing foorth paire sheares purposely brought thither clipped away part locke time vsed weare long end might better know next morning returned backe lodging againe querry partly saw felt done perceiued plainely subtill ingenious fellow intent thus marked wherefore without longer dallying vp rose taking paire sheares wherewith vsed trim horse softly went bed bed lay yet soundly sleeping clipt away man locke right eare selfe manner king done perceiued one quietly laide downe againe morning king risen gaue command pallace gate opened whole family come instantly fulfilled standing vncouered presence began consider himselfe man marked seeing part haue locke cut one selfe manner maruailing greatly saide himselfe man seeke though meane base condition yet plainely appeareth deiect common vnderstanding seeing without clamour noyse could find party looked concluded win eternall shame compassing poore reuenge rather way admonition let offender know word noted obserued turning saide hath done let silent doe depart businesse turbulent spirited man imprisonment torture examination interrogatory could haue serued turne course proceeding make shame publikely knowne reason requireth keepe concealed admit condigne vengeance taken diminisheth one title shame neither qualifieth people bad affection lash liberally scandall vpon least babling rumor therefore heard king word though yet truly wise maruelled much long examination among themselues questioned came far short meaning man onely excepted indeede concerned neuer discouered long king liued neither dare time hazard life like action vnder frownes fauour fortune vnder colour confession pure conscience faire young gentlewoman amourously affected honest man induced deuoute solemne religious friar aduise meanes without suspition perceiuing enioy benefit friend bring desire full effect third nouell declaring leude naughty quality person doe oftentimes misguide good people great greeuous error madam pampinea sate silent querries boldnesse equalled crafty cunning great wisedome king passed among generall applause queene selfe madam philomena appointed follow next order hold rancke discourse rest done whereupon philomena graciously began manner purpose acquaint notable mockery performed iest earnest faire gentlewoman graue deuoute religious friar yeelde much pleasure recreation euery secular vnderstander diligently shee doe obserue commonly religious person least part like notorious fooles inuenters new course customes thinking themselues wise skilful thing yet proue worth validity addicting best deuises expresse owne vilenesse minde fatten themselues sty like pampered swine assure selues worthy lady doe tell tale onely follow order enioyned also informe saintlike holy sir opinatiue credulous may yea diuers time cunningly met withall craftinesse onely men likewise owne sexe shall make apparant owne city full craft deceit loue faithfull dealing liued many yeeres since gentlewoman good spirit highly minded endued beauty commendable quality woman nature could name others concerned nouell meane make manifest albeit know yet liuing thereby may scandalized therefore shall suffice passe ouer smile gentlewoman seeing selfe descended great parentage chance married artezen clothier drapier liued making selling cloth shee could tradesman take downe height minde conceiuing man meane condition rich soeuer worthy enioy gentlewoman marriage obseruing moreouer wealth treasure vnderstood nothing better open skeines yarne fill shuttle lay webbes loomes dispute spinster businesse thus ouerswayed proud opinion shee would longer embraced regarded manner onely could refuse would find better satisfaction might seeme worthy respect drapier husband hereupon shee fell deepe loue honest man city also indifferent yeeres day shee saw shee could take rest night ensuing man himselfe knew nothing hereof therefore neglect carelesse curious nice yet wisely considerate durst let vnderstand neither woman close conueyed message yet letter fearing peril happen case eye obseruing daily walkes resort gaue notice often conuersing religious friar albeit fat corpulent man yet notwithstanding seemed leade sanctimonious life reported honest man perswaded selfe might best meanes betweene friend hauing considered selfe course best obserued case vpon day apt conuenient shee went conuent kept hauing caused called shee told leysure serued gladly shee would confessed onely made choyce holy man seeing reputing gentlewoman indeede shee lesse willingly heard shee confessed shee could shee yet another matter acquaint withall thereupon thus began holy father conuenient haue recourse assisted help councell matter impart vnto know ignorant parent husband affected dearely life proofe whereof thing desire immediatly haue rich man may sufficiently affoord regard whereof loue equally selfe setting aside best endeauours must tell one thing quite contrary liking honor wherein woman worthily deserue death selfe vnderstand good father man whose name know hee seemeth honest good worth moreouer deceiued hee resorteth oftentimes faire comely person going alwayes blacke garment good price value man imagining perhaps minde truely hath often attempted mee neuer doore window hee alwayes present sight little displeasing watcheth walkes much meruaile let tell holy sir behauiours doe many time lay bad imputation vpon honest woman yet without offence hath often run minde let haue knowledge thereof brother afterward considered men many time deliuer message sort draw vngentle answeres whereon grow word word beget action respect harme scandall ensue thought best silent determining acquaint rather therewith well seeme friend also regard office priuiledgeth correct abuse onely friend also stranger enowe woman pitty perhaps better disposed suite like allowe courting otherwise doe willing embrace offer happily loath yeeld deniall wherefore humbly entreat good father euen blessed lady sake would giue friendly reprehension aduise vse vnmanly meanes hereafter word shee hung downe head bosome cunningly dissembling shee wept wiping eye handkerchife teare fell indeed dry enough holy religious man soone heard description man presently knew shee meant highly commending gentlewoman good vertuous seeming disposition beleeued faithfully shee said promising order matter well discreetly shee offended knowing woman great wealth vsuall manner cast forth fishing net gaine liberally commended almesdeedes dayly workes charity recounting beside owne perticular necessity giuing two piece gold said pray good father mindfull chance make deniall tell boldly spake selfe way sad complaint confession ended penance easie enough enioyned shee promised make parent bountifull benefactours conuent put money hand desiring mass remember soules deceased friend returned home house within short departure gentleman made counterfeit complaint came thither vsuall manner hauing done duty holy father sate downe together priuately falling one discourse another length frier louing friendly sort mildly reproued amorous glaunces pursuites thought hee dayly vsed gentlewoman according owne speech gentleman meruailed greatly thereat one neuer seene sildome passed way dwelt made bolder answeres wherein confessour interrupting said neuer make admiration matter neither waste word stout denial cannot serue thy turne tell thee plainely heard neighbour euen owne selfe sorrowfull sad complaint though perhaps hereafter thou canst hardly refraine folly yet let mee tell thee much vnder seale absolute assurance onely woman world true iudgement doth hate abhorre base behauiour wherefore regard thine owne honor also vexe preiudice vertuous gentlewoman pray thee refrain idlenes henceforward suffer hir liue peace gentleman little wiser ghostly father perceiued immediatly without meditating matter notable polli ie woman whereupon making somewhat bashfull appearance error already committed hee said hee would afterward better aduised departing frier went directly passe house gentlewoman dwelt stood alwayes ready watch little window obserue hee walke way seeing comming shewed selfe ioyfull gracious easily vnderstood whereto substance holy father chiding tended time forward hee vsed dayly though couert manner little liking gentlewoman himselfe make passage streete vnder colour important occasion concerning soone plainely discerned either side one well contented walkes could shee desired enflame little liberall illustration affection towards time place affoorded conuenient opportunity holy father againe shee went shee long shrift kneeling downe feete intended begin confession teares friar perceiuing sorrowfully demanded new accident happened holy father quoth shee nouell accident onely wicked vngracious friend since yea longer agoe yesterday haue beene wronged verily beleeue hee borne mortall enemie make doe something vtter disgrace euer whereby shall dare seene deare father answered friar hath refrained afflicting abusiuely pausing breathing foorth many dissembled sigh thus shee replyed truly holy father likelyhood abstaining since made complaint belike taking euill part contraried wanton humour hath meerely despight walked seauen time day doore whereas formerly neuer vsed aboue twice well good father could contented walkes gazing glaunces hee dartes growne bolde shamelesse euen yesterday tolde sent woman one pandoraes appeared wanted either purse girdle sent purse girdle whereat grew grieuously offended beene due respect feare god next sacred reuerence beare ghostly father doubtlesse done wicked deede neuerthelesse happily withstood neither say doe thing case till first haue made knowne called minde hauing redeliuered purse girdle shee messenger brought lookes sufficient declare discontentment called backe againe fearing least shee would keepe selfe make beleeue receiued haue heard kind woman vse doe sometimes anger snatcht haue brought hither end may giue againe tell haue neede thing thankes heauen husband woman better stored wherefore good father purposely come beseech accept iust excuse wil abstaine thus molesting disclose husband father brother whatsoeuer shall ensue thereon rather receiue iniury need must come causelesly blamed wherein good father tell doe well many counterfet sobbes sighes teares wordes deliuered drawing foorth vnder gowne faire rich purse also girdle great worth shee threw frier lap verily beleeuing false report beeing troubled minde thereat beyond measure tooke gentlewoman hand saying daughter thou offended impudent folly assuredly cannot blame thee wise man reprooue thee commend thee following counsell let alone schooling gentleman ill hath kept promise made mee wherefore regard former offence also lately committed hope set heate shall make leaue iniurying thee god name suffer thy selfe conquered choler disclosing thy kindred husband much harme may ensue thereon feare wrong thy selfe god men true witnesse thine honesty vertue began appeare somewhat better comforted forbearing play string longer wel knowing couetousnes equal said holy father night past thought sleepe diuers spirit kindred appeared vision thought great paine desired nothing el almes especially godmother seemed bee afflicted extreme pouerty pittifull behold half perswaded torment greater seeing mee troubled enemy goodnesse wherefore good father deliuer soule others fearfull flame among infinit deuout prayer would haue say fortie mass gregory meanes happy deliuerance put ten ducates hand holy man accepted thankfully good word also many singular example confirmed bountifull deuotion giuen benediction home departed gentlewoman gone hee sent friend much seemed troubled withall come hee beholding holy father looke discontentedly thought heare newes mistresse therefore expected would say frier falling course former reprehension yet rough impatient manner sharpely checkt immodest behauiour towards gentlewoman sending purse girdle gentleman yet could guesse whereto speech tended somewhat coldly temperately denied sending token end would vtterly discredited good man bee gentlewoman shewne thing frier waxing much angry sternly said bad man thou art canst thou deny manifest trueth see sir none amorous token sure doe know euer saw till gentleman seeming much ashamed saide truely father know confesse haue done ill greatly offended sweare vnto seeing vnderstande firmely affected shall neuer heare complaint vowes protestation end ghostly father gaue purse girdle preached seuerely coniured neuer vexe gift binding himselfe thereto solemne promise gaue license depart grew gentleman iocond surely certifyed mistress loue token worthy esteeme wherefore sooner hee gone frier hee went secret place could let behold window precious token receyued whereof extraordinarily ioyfull deuices grew still better b ter nothing wanting husband absence vpon iourney city full effecting desire within dayes occasion hapned husband necessity must iourney geneway sooner hee mounted horsebacke taking leaue friend sure hee gone went hast ghostly father faigned outward shewes thus spake must plainly tell holy father longer endure wicked friend promised day would thing counsell therein come tell iust reason anger full purpose auoid mollestation friend cannot terme questionles diuel hell morning breake day hauing heard know husband ridden geneway got ouer wall garden climbing vp tree standeth close chamber window fast asleepe opened casement would haue entred window great good fortune awaked made shew open outcry entreated mee god sake pardon error neuer would presume offend saw sake silent closed fast window againe departed came since neuer saw heard tidings iudge holy father whether honest course endured ciuil gentlewoman neither would patiently haue suffered onely dutifull reuerence ghostly father hearing became sorrowfullest man world knowing make answer demanded diuers time whether knew perfectly mistake quoth would know ala deere daughter replied frier sayd case ouermuch boldnesse il done thou shewedst thy selfe worthy wise woman sending away mercifully thou didst would entreat thee deare vertuous daughter seeing grace hath hitherto kept thee dishonor twice already thou hast credited counsell let aduise thee last time spare speech complaining thy friend leaue try ouercome vnchained diuel tooke much holy man recall sensuall appetite shall account labour well employed cannot henceforward blessed benediction giue thee leaue euen thy heart best tutor thee see sir said shee manner man yet would haue troubled disobeyed desire liue without disturbance work beseech best may promise good father neuer solicite vppon occasion pretended rage shee returned backe ghostly father scarsely gone forth church commeth man supposedly much transgressed fryer taking aside gaue iniurious word could vsed man calling disloyall periured traitor hee formerly twice perceiued high holy man anger mounted nothing expect wold say like man extreamly perplexed stroue get saying holy father come heinously offended haue done incense strangely heare mee dishonest wretch answered frier listen shall say vnto thee thou answerest yeare two past since foule abuse thee committed almost quite thy remembrance tell wicked man wast thou morning breake day wheresoeuer replyed gentleman mee thinkes tidings come quickly true said frier speedily come indeed vpon vrgent necessity little curbing wrath somewhat milder strain thus proceeded gentlewoman husband iourneyed geneway proues ladder hope embrace armes must climbe ouer garden wall like treacherous robber night season mount vp tree chamber window open casement hoping compasse importunity spotlesse chastity neuer permit nothing world possibly hate yet loue whether many demonstration selfe hath made retrograde good conceit louing admonishment might haue better successe yet shewe outward apparance one thing must tell silent sufferance iniuries hath bin respect earnest entreaty sake shee patient longer haue giuen free license euer heereafter offer attempt make complaint brother wil redound meane danger gentleman hauing wisely collected louelesson holy father angry word pacified good old man wel could solemne promise protestation heare misbehauiour gone followed instruction giuen complaint climbing ouer garden wall ascending tree entering casement standing ready open welcome thus frier simplicity wrought ingenuous subtiltie made way obtaine longing desire yong scholler named felice enstructed puccio di rinieri become rich short time puccio made experience instruction taught felice obtained fauour daughter fourth nouell wherein declared craft subtilty wily wit deuise deceiue simple compasse owne desire philomena finished tale sate still dioneus faire pleasing language commended gentlewoman quaint cunning smiled confessor witlesse simplicity queen turning chearefull look towards pamphilus commaunded continue delight gladly yeelded thus began madame many men striue climbe good estate seeming better doe become much worse condition happened neighbour long time since accident better acquaint withall according haue heard reported neere saint brancazio dwelt honest man somewhat rich called puccio di rinieri addicted paine endeuours alchimy wherefore kept family onely widdowed daughter seruant art exercise hee vsed often frequent market place regard weake witted man gourmand grosse feeder language harsh rude like common porter loutish men carriage also absurd boorelike clownish daughter named monna isabetta aged aboue eight twenty thirty yeers fresh indifferent faire plumpe round woman cherry cheekt like queeneapple please father fed sparingly otherwise wold haue done communed iested body would talke nothing onely concerning great vertue alchimy extolling aboue art much season yeare returned young scholler paris named felice faire complexion comely person ingeniously witted skilfully learned soone grew familiarity puccio could resolue many doubt depending profession alchimy himselfe hauing onely practise great learning vsed many question shewed especiall matter secrecy entertaining often dinner supper whensoeuer pleased come conuerse daughter likewise perceiuing fauour father respected became familiar allowing good regard reuerence young man continuing resort house puccio obseruing widow faire fresh prettily formall began consider himselfe thing might wherein shee wanting could saue anothers labour supply best endeauours thus alwayes carrying eye vsing many backe circumspect regard proceeded farre wylie apprehension sparkes close kept together kindled part fire began flame apparantly wittily obseruing occasion first smiled allowed fauourable opportunity hee impart intention albeit found plyant enough gaine physick owne griefe soone yet meanes manner yet quite apprehension shee part world would trust selfe young man company onely father house place possibility puccio long continued custome vsed watch well neere night commonly night neuer stirring foorth roomes much abated edge young man appetite infinite intricate reuoluings wheeling busied braine thought altogether herculian taske enioy
