happinesse house without suspition albeit puccio kept still within doores watched hee wont doe vpon day sate familiar conference puccio began speake vnto manner haue many time noted kinde friend puccio thy desire endeauour meanes thou mayest become rich wherein thinkes thou takest wide course much neere shorter way mighell scotus associate diligently obserued followed yet neuer willing instruct men therein whereby misterie might drowned obliuion prosecuted none onely great lord able vndergoe thou art mine especiall friend haue receiued thee infinite kind fauours whereas neuer intended man acquainted rare secret thou wilt imitate course shall shew thee purpose teach thee full perfection puccio earnestly desirous vnderstand speediest way singular mysterie first began entreat meane instance acquaint rule rich science afterward sware vnto neuer disclose person except hee gaue consent thereto affirming beside rarity easie comprehended apprehensiue iudgements well quoth felice seeing thou hast made sound solemne promise make knowne vnto thee know friend puccio philosopher hold couet become rich indeed must vnderstand make stone tell thee marke manner heedfully say stone obtained thou shalt euen rich thou art thou shalt plainly perceiue grosest substance hitherto thou hast seene shalbe made pure golde afterward thou makest shall certaine go come aqua fortis expedient therefore man go diligently businesse purposeth prosecute singular labour must continue space night must giue carefull attendance wholly abstaining sleepe slumbering much nodding moreouer apt conuenient place thy house must forge furnace erected framed decent formall fashion neere large table placed ordered sort standing vpright thy feete leaning reines thy backe thou must stande stedfastly maner euery night without least motion stirring vntill breake day appeareth thine eye still vppon furnace fixed keepe euer memory true order haue prescribed soone morning seene thou mayst thou wilt walke rest little vpon thy bed afterward go thy businesse thou haue go dinner attending readily till euenings approch preparing thing readily set thee downe writing vvithout thing bee done returne taske againe varying iot course directed time fully expired thou shalt perceiue many apparant signes stone still absolute forwardnesse bee vtterly lost thou fayle least obseruances experience hath crowned thy labour thou art sure haue philosopher stone thereby shalt able enrich worke wonder beside puccio instantly replied trust sir great difficultie labour neither doth require extraordinary length time may easily followed performed friendly fauour helping direct furnace table according imagine conuenient sunday night next begin task scholler gone went daughter tolde matter determined shee immediately vnderstood sufficiently would ensue nightly watching manner returning answer whatsoeuer liked allowed became way mislike thus continued kinde concordance till sunday night came puccio begin experience felice set forward vpon aduenture concluded euery night scholler must come supper partly bee witnesse constant performance especially owne aduantage place puccio chosen hopefull attaining philosopher stone close chamber daughter lay hauing separation diuision old ruinous tottring wall scholler playing prize puccio heard vnwonted noise house neuer obserued neither knew wall haue motion wherefore daring stirre standing least marrd beginning called daughter demanding busie labour widdow much addicted frumping according question demanded perhaps forgetting spake pleasantly replied whoop sir spirit alchimy walking house cannot lye quietly bed puccio meruailing answer knowing neuer gaue like demanded againe subtle wench remembring answered became said pardon mee father wit mine owne demanded sodaine question haue heard say hundred time folke go supperles bed either walke sleepe awake talke idely doubt haue discernde nay daughter quoth may waking dreame thought heard olde wall totter see deceiued quiet still enough talke good father saide least stirre place hinder labour take care mee able enough haue care selfe preuent mighty disturbance went lodge another part house continued time puccioes paine equall contentment made diuers time say felice teach father cheefe ground alchimy helpe waste away treasure thus scholler poore yet well forwarded learning made vse puccioes folly found benefit thereby keepe want bane ouerthrow numberlesse good wit puccio dying date limitted time hee failed philosopher stone isabetta ioyned marriage felice make amends enstructing father meanes came husband ricciardo surnamed magnifico gaue horse signior francesco vergellisi vpon condition leaue lisence might speake wife presence shee returning answere made answer himselfe behalfe according answer effect followed fifth nouell wherein described frailety woman folly husband leaue alone owne disposition pamphilus hauing ended nouell puccio alchimist queene fixing eye madam eliza gaue order shee succeede next shee asking somewhat austerely rest spleen vsuall manner thus began world containeth particular people doe beleeue themselues know something others ignorant thing part intend make scorne men vpon proofe doe find themselues carry away scorne therefore account meane follie vpon occasion tempt power another man wit experience men woman perhaps mine opinion meane shall perceiue apparantly accident happening knight pistoia shall heare related towne pistoia bordering vpon florence liued long since knight named signior francesco descended linage family vergellisi man rich wise many thing prouident gripple couetous close handed without respect vvorth reputation called office podesta city millaine furnished himselfe thing honourable manner beseeming charge comely horse owne saddle excepted vvhich knew meanes compasse loath vvas lay money albeit credit much depended thereon time liued pistoya likewise young man named ricciardo deriued meane birth wealthy quicke witted commendable person alwayes going neate fine formall apparrell generally tearmed magnifico long time affected yea closely courted though without aduantage successe lady wife signior francesco beautifull vertuous chaste chanced magnifico choysest goodliest ambling gelding tuscanie loued dearely faire forme good part vpon flying rumor throughout pistoria daily made loue foresaid lady busie body put head signior francesco pleased request gelding magnifico would frankly giue regard loue bare wife base minded knight coueting haue horse yet part money sent magnifico desiring buy faire gelding hoped haue free gift magnifico hearing request little ioyfull hereof thus answered sir would giue wealth possesse world sell horse rather bestow gentlemanly gift yet vpon condition haue deliuered may lisence presence speake word vertuous ladie farre distance may heard onely selfe signior francesco wholly conducted base auaricious desire meaning make scorne magnifico made answere well contented let speake would leauing great hall house went wiues chamber told easily might enioy house commanding forthwith come heare could say onely shee abstaine returne answer lady modest blush much condemned folly couetousnesse serue cloake couer vnfitting speech chaste eares could neuer endure heare neuerthelesse obey husband shee promised doe followed downe house heare magnifico would say againe confirmed bargaine made husband sitting downe corner hall farre enough one hearing taking curteously hand thus spake worthy lady appeareth certainty truly wise haue doubt long since perceiued vnfained affection beauty farre excelling woman know hath compelled beare setting aside commendable quality singular vertues gloriously shining powerfull enough make conquest stoutest courage held vtterly needlesse let vnderstand word faithfull loue beare much feruent constant euer man expresse woman condition shall still continue without least blemish impaire long enioy life motion yea dare assure future world affection may containe powerfull dominion doth man borne loue perpetually whereby may rest confidently perswaded enioy thing poore precious soeuer solemnely account owne truest title right may selfe haue euer shall mine confirme opinion case argument greater power let tell repute fairest gracious fortune would command seruice consisteth mine ability performe courteous fauour accept yea trauaile thorow whole world right willing obedient regard faire madame much heare may boldly aduenture without good reason acquaint chaste eares earnest desire onely dependeth happinesse life absolute comfort humble seruant beseech dearest good sole hope soule rigour may dwell longer gentle brest ladylike pitty compassion whereby shal say diuine beauty enflamed mine affection euen extended mercifull qualification exceeded hope halfe part pitty admit miracle lady die distresse ala death would dishonour cannot termed mine owne murtherer dart came eye must remaine witnesse rigour cannot chuse call minde say within owne soule ala sinne haue committed vnmercifull magnifico repentance serues purpose must answere vnkinde cruelty wherefore preuent blacke scandall bright beauty beside ceaselesse acclamation dogge walkes day time breake quiet sleepes night season fearefull sight gastly apparition houering haunting bed let milde mercy spill life may saue magnifico ceasing teares streaming eye si he breaking heart sate still exspectation lady answere made neither long short matter neither tilt tourneying many lost morning euenings infinite like office magnifico sake time time spent vaine without least shew acceptation hope winne loue moued houre solemne protestation rather preuailing asseuerations began finde neuer felt namely loue although keepe promise made husband shee spake word yet heart heauing soule throbbing sighes intermixing complexion altering could hide intended answere magnifico promise beene hinderance magnifico sate mute seeing would giue answere could chuse wonder thereat yet length perceiued thus cunningly contriued husband notwithstanding obseruing well countenance quite contrary temper another kinde fire sparkling eye humour flowing pulse strongly beating stomack rising sighes swelling argument change motiues aduance hope taking courage tickling perswasion instructing minde new kinde counsell would needes answere himselfe behalfe vttered word spake manner magnifico friend surely long time since first noted thine affection towards great perfect much certaine thereof thine owne honest gentle speech content ought doe neuerthelesse heretofore haue seemed cruell vnkinde thee would haue thee thinke heart way guilty outward seuerity euermore loue thee held thee dearer man liuing yet became doe well feare others renowne mine owne reputation time hand let thee know clearely whether doe affect thee iust guerdon thy constant loue long thou hast still doest beare wherefore comfort thy selfe dwell vpon vndoubted hope signior francesco husband absent hence many dayes chosen podesta millaine thou canst chuse heare common country know sake thou hast giuen thy goodly ambling gelding soone hee gone promise thee vpon word faithfull loue beare thee haue conference thee let thee vnderstand somewhat minde neither fitting time place discourse matter serious moment obserue heereafter signall thou seest crimson skarfe hanging window chamber vpon garden side euening soone night come garden gate wary respect eye doe discouer thee thou shalt finde walking ready acquaint thee matter according shall finde occasion magnifico person lady spoken thus hee returned answere vertuous lady spirit transported extraordinary ioy gracious welcome answere sences fayle mee faculty quite forsake cannot giue thankes would could speake equally desire yet season sutes therewith neither conuenient troublesome let therefore humbly beseech desire haue accomplish word auaile expresse may remaine kinde consideration haue commaunded faile performe accordingly thankfull manner yet able let know resteth nothing else doe vnder protection gracious pardon giue ouer speech attend worthy husband notwithstanding hee spoken yet shee replied one word wherefore magnifico arose returned knight went meete saying loude laughter man haue kept promise thee sir answered magnifico promised speake wife haue made mee talke marble statue answere greatly pleasing knight although hee vndoubted opinion wife yet much strengthen beliefe hee said thou confessest thy gelding bee mine doe replied magnifico thought better successe would haue ensued bargaine without motion horse would haue giuen sorie haue bought horse yet haue sold knight laughed heartily answere thus prouided faire beast rode iourney millaine entred authory podesta lady remained liberty home considering magnifico word likewise gelding sake giuen husband oftentimes shee saw passe fro windowe still looking flagge defiance hanged forth hee might fight valiantly vnder colour story saith among many much better meditation heard talke thus idely selfe doe meane wherefore youth olde miserable man gone millaine god knoweth hee come backe againe euer neuer dignity preferred wedlockes holy duty pleasure abroade comfort home ill age pay youth arrerages time spent hope sparde action omitted often time repented done due season sildome sorrowed vpon vnladylike priuate consultation whether window shewed signall matter belonging charge say husband vnwise graunt ill aduantages wiues much worse take hold onely iudge best tale ended ricciardo minutolo fell loue wife philippello fighinolfi knowing iealous husband gaue vnderstand greatly enamoured wife appointed meete priuately bathing house next day following hoping take tardie close compacted mistresse found selfe deceiued said ricciardo sixth nouell declaring much perseuerance couragious spirit auaileable loue remained spoken madame eliza cunning magnifico much commended company queene commanded madame fiammetta succeede next order one nouels smilingly made answere would began thus gracious lady thinkes wee haue spoken enough already concerning owne citie aboundeth copiously commodity example also euery conuenient purpose madam eliza hath done recounting occasion happening another world must leape little euen farre naples see one saintlike dame nicely seemes shun loues allurings guided good spirit friend tasted fruite shee knew flower sufficient warning apprehend hand may follow let see beside errour committed discreete keeping publike knowledge city naples great antiquity perhaps pleasantly scituated city italie dwelt sometime young gentleman noble parentage well knowne wealthy named ricciardo minutolo although hee gentlewoman excellent beauty worthy kindest affecting wife yet gadding eye gazed elsewhere became enamoured another generall opinion surpassed neapolitane woman else feature fauour choysest perfection shee named madam catulla wife gallant young gentleman called philippello fighinolfi dearely loued beyond vertue admired chastity ricciardo louing madam catulla vsing meanes whereby grace liking lady might obtained found yet matter beyond possibility compasse height desire many desperate dangerous resolution beleagred braine seeming intricate vnlikely affoord hopefull issue wished nothing death death yet deafe earnest imprecation delayed lingering affliction continuing still extreame condition aduised best friend vtterly abstaine fond pursuite hope meerely vaine madam catulla prized nothing precious world vnstayned loyaltie husband yet shee liued extreme iealousie fearing least bird flying ayre snatch ricciardo vnacquainted iealous humour well credible hearing thereof also daily obseruation began consider himselfe best dissemble amorous affection place henceforward set aside hope euer enioying loue madam catulla become seruant another gentlewoman pretending honour performe many worthy action armes iousts tournament like noble exercise wont doe madam catulla almost people naples especially madam catulla became verily perswaded former fruitlesse loue quite changed new elected lady glory best endeauours perseuering long opinion passed absolutely currant thus seemed meere stranger whose house familiarly frequented yet neighbour gaue dayes salutation according chanced see meete came passe delightfull summer season gentleman gentlewoman vsed meete together according custome long obserued countrey sporting along sea coast dining supping often ricciardo minutolo happened heare madam catulla company friend intended also present among time consorted seemely traine confederate resorted thither graciously welcommed madam catulla pretended willing long time tarrying catulla lady faine entreate discoursing loue new elected mistresse minutolo graced solemne countenance ministred much matter conference coueting know shee farre walked held kinde discoursing euery lady gentlewoman waxing weary long continued argument began separate selfe associate shee best liked walking woman wont doe madam catulla hauing female left stayed behind minutolo suddenly shot foorth word concerning husband philippello louing another woman beside selfe ouermuch iealous became suddenly set fire know shee minutolo spake shee sate silent long till able containe longer shee entreated ricciardo euen lady sake whose loue deuoutly embraced resolue certainely strange alteration husband whereunto thus answered madam haue straitly coniured vrging remembrance whose sake able denie thing demand ready therein pleasure first must promise neither person shall time disclose husband vntill haue seene effect haue tolde proueth true please instruct selfe shall see lady little ioyfull thus satisfied husband follie constantly crediting word true shee sware solemne oath one aliue euer know stepping little aside listening eare heare thus beganne lady loue effectually heretofore haue done circumspect vttering thing imagined might distaste know whether husband philippello time offended affected beleeued receiued kindnesse whether could neuer discerne outward apparance awaiting opportunity time conceiued affoord least suspition seekes compasse doubt feares would haue done plaine termes madam haue pleasure wife carriage haue obserued within dayes past hath solicited pursued purpose secretly many ambassages meanes indeede haue learned selfe alwayes shee hath returned answer shee receiued direction longer agoe madam morning comming hither found woman messenger house close conference wife growing doubtfull true indeede called wife enquiring woman would haue shee tolde another pursuite philippello fighinolfi quoth shee vpon answer haue caused send time time perhaps doth gather hope preuailing ende maketh still importune doth aduentureth farre vnderstand finall intention hauing thus ordered complot please must meete secretly house city hath prepared bath ready hopeth enioy ende desire earnestly hath solicited thereto commanded hold suspence many friuolous answer would long ere haue sent message haue beene little liking patience madam endured thinkes proceedeth farre way suffered therefore intended let know whereby may perceiue well rewarded faithfull loyall loue beare euen doore death may surer speech lie fable may pleased approue trueth owne experience caused wife send word shee would meete morrow bathinghouse appointed houre nooneday people repose themselues regard heates violence answere woman returned iocondly let tell lady hope haue better opinion wit meaning send wife thither rather ende hauing acquainted treacherous intent supply wiues place sauing reputation owne frustrating vnkind purpose moreouer vpon view owne delusion wrought wife meere loue shall see foule shame noble care keepe rite marriage betweene still vnstained madame catulla hauing heard long vnpleasing report without consideration either tolde tale treason intended immediately iealous person vse doe gaue faith forgerie began discourse many thing imagination often misguided honest minded husband enflamed rage suddenly replied shee would doe according aduised matter difficulty came would shame dishonour woman whatsoeuer better schoole ricciardo highly pleased herewith perswaded purpose would take full effect confirmed lady determination many word yet putting memory keepe faithfull promise made without reuealing matter liuing person shee sworne vpon faith morrow morning ricciardo went auncient woman acquaintance mistresse bathinghouse appointed madame catulla bath prepared giuing vnderstand whole businesse desiring fauourable therein woman beene much beholding matter promised willingly fulfill request concluding done said house darke chamber without window affoord least light chamber shee made ready according ricciardoes direction rich bed therein soft delicate possible could wherein entred soone dined attend arriuall madame catulla day heard speech ricciardo gaue credit became shee returned home house wonderfull impatience philippello husband came home discontentedly whose head busied worldly affaire perhaps looked pleasantly neither vsed kindly wont doe catulla perceiuing shee ten time suspicious saying selfe apparant trueth doth disclose selfe husband head troubled nothing else ricciardoes wife morrow purposeth meeting wherein shall disappointed liue taking rest whole night thinking handle husband shall say morrow houre midday accompanied onely chambermayde without alteration opinion shee went house bath promised meeting olde woman demaunded philippello come thither yet woman well instructed ricciardo answered shee meete heere yes replied catulla goe quoth woman farre madame catulla went seeke would finde brought vailed darke chamber ricciardo entred bath hoping finde none husband custome countrey neuer disallowed meeting men wiues held good commendable counterfeit voyce bad welcome seeming indeed entertained embracing louing manner yet daring speake least know suffered proceede owne errour let passe wanton folly passing betweene come madame catulla finding fit conuenient time vent forth tempest spleene began manner ala mighty misfortune woman ill requited loyall loue many wiues husband poore miserable lady space eight yeares fully compleated haue loued thee dearely mine owne life finde heart endlesse griefe thou wastest consumest thy desire delight strange woman like vile wicked man thou art doest thou imagine thy selfe thou art thou hast long time deluded false blandishment feigning affect thou doatest thy desire elsewhere thine owne catulla wife ricciardo trayterous vnfaithfull man thou art sure thou knowest voyce thinke thousand yeares vntill wee may see light doe thee dishonour thou iustly deseruest dogged disdainefull villainous wretch conceiuing haue another woman wanton embrace thou hast declared iouiall disposition demonstration farre greater kindnesse domesticke familiarity home thou lookest sower sullen surly often froward sildome well pleased best whereas thou intendest husbandrie another man ground thou hast thy bestowed thine owne water hath runne contrary course quite current thou meantst answere canst thou make deuill man haue word smitten thee dumbe thou mayest shame enough hold thy peace face man loue husband wife thou art able make answere ricciardo durst speake one word still expressed affable behauiour towards bestowing infinite embrace kiss much augmented rage anger continuing chiding thus flattery idle folly thou hopest comfort pacifie thou runnest quite thy reckoning shall neuer imagine selfe halfe satisfied vntill presence parent friend neighbour haue reuealed thy base behauiour tell mee treacherous man faire wife ricciardo good gentlewoman borne shee canst thou respect mee villaine monster doest thou answere mee send ricciardo loueth mee beyond woman naples yet could neuer vaunt gaue much friendly looke shall know dishonour thou hadst intended towards friend reuenge soundly vpon thee exclamation lady tedious irksome ricciardo perceiuing continued longer complaint worse would ensue thereon could easily remedied resolued make himselfe knowne reclaime violent extasie holding somewhat strictly preuent escaping said madam afflict selfe could obtaine simply louing subtilty hath better taught ricciardo hearing perfectly knowing voyce shee would haue leapt bath shee could auoyde cry layde hand mouth saying lady done cannot vndone albeit cried life time exclaime make knowne openly meanes two vnauoydable danger must needes ensue thereon one ought carefully respect wounding good renowne honour shall say treacherie drew hither boldly maintaine contrary auouching hauing corrupted gold giuing much couetously desired grew offended thereon made outcry learne world easily induced beleeue worst goodnesse neuer manifest next vnto mortall hatred must arise betweene husband perhaps shall soone kill mee whereby hardly liue true contentment wherefore ioy life doe one moment shame selfe cause perill betweene husband first neither last shall deceiued haue beguiled take honour onely declared faithfull affection beare shall doe euer bounden obedient seruant long time agoe since dedicated selfe mine seruice henceforth must remaine euer wise enough know thing shew selfe silly simple ricciardo vttered word teares streaming aboundantly downe cheekes madame catulla likewise showred forth sorrowes equally although exceedingly troubled minde saw owne iealous folly brought shame beyond whatsoeuer midst tormenting passion considered word ricciardo found good reason regard vnauoydable euils whereupon shee thus spake ricciardo know beare horrible iniurie notorious treason vsed thee grace goodnesse hauing forsaken let fall foule manner becommeth make noyse outcry heere whereto simplicity rather deuillish iealousie conduct certaine one thing shall neuer see one ioyfull day till one meanes reuenged thee thou hast glutted thy desire disgrace let therefore goe thee neuer looke vpon wronged husband let honest woman euer see face ricciardo perceiuing extremity perplexed minde vsed manly milde perswasions possibly could deuise doe turne torrent high tide calmer course outward shew shee made apparance vntill frightfull feares shunning euery one shee met withall argument guiltinesse shee recouered owne house remorse tortured distressed soule shee fell fierce melancholy neuer left till shee died vpon report whereof ricciardo becomming likewise widdower grieuing extraordinarily haynous transgression penitently betooke himselfe liue wildernesse long ended dayes thebaldo elisei hauing receiued vnkinde repulse beloued departed florence returning thither againe long habite pilgrime spake made wrong knowne vnto deliuered husband danger death proued slaine thebaldo made peace brother ende wisely enioyed heart desire seauenth nouell wherein signified power loue diuersity danger whereinto men may daily fall ceased fiametta discourse generally commended queene preuent losse time commanded aemillia follow next thus began liketh best gracious lady returne home againe owne city pleased former two discoursers part shew citizen recouered kindnesse loue lost sometime dwelt florence young gentleman named thebaldo elisci descended noble house became earnestly enamored widdow called hermelina daughter aldobrandino palermini well deseruing vertues commendable quality enioy whatsoeuer could desire secretly espoused together fortune enemy louers felicity opposed malice depriuing thebaldo deare delight sometime held free possession making stranger gracious fauours grew shee contemptibly despise onely denying heare message sent scorning also vouchsafe much sight causing extreme griefe melancholy yet concealing vnkindnesse wisely himselfe one could vnderstand reason sadnesse laboured hopefull course obtaine fauour formerly lost without offence innocent soule truly witnessed saw endeauours fruitlesse vaine concluded retreate himselfe world longer irkesome eye onely occasion vnhappinesse hereupon storing himselfe summes money suddenly could collect together secretly departed florence without speaking word friend kindred except one kind companion acquainted secret trauelled ancona termed himselfe name sandolescio repairing wealthy merchant placed himselfe seruant went ship cyprus action behauiour proued pleasing merchant onely allowed sufficient wage also grew association gaue affaire hand guided honest discreete care himselfe yeeres compasse proued rich merchant famous report matter went successefull manner although could chuse still remembred cruell mistresse desperately transported loue coueting aboue thing e se see yet powerfull constancy whole yeers together vanquished fierce conflict day chanced heard song sung cyprus himselfe formerly made honour loue bare mistresse delight conceiued daily presence whereby gathered impossible forget proceeded desirously could liue except sight therefore determined returne florence hauing set affaire due order accompanied seruant onely passed ancona arriued sent merchandise florence name merchant ancona especiall friend partner trauayling himselfe alone seruant habite pilgrime beene newly returned ierusalem come florence went inne kept two bretheren neere neighbour dwelling mistresse first thing passing doore get sight happie found windowes doores part house fast shut vp whereby suspected dead else changed dwelling wherefore much perplexed minde went two brother inne finding foure person standing gate attired mourning whereat maruelled little knowing himselfe transfigured body habite farre manner common vse parting thence difficult matter know stept boldly shooemakers shop neere adioyning demanded reason wearning mourning shoomaker made answer thus sir men clad mourning brother named thebaldo hath beene absent hence long fifteene dayes since slaine hauing heard proofe made court instice one aldobrandino palermini kept close prisoner murtherer came disguised habite daughter affectionately enamoured cannot chuse let world know outward habites inward affliction heart deede dishonourably committed thebaldo wondered greatly hereat imagining man belike resembling shape might slaine manner aldobr andino whose misfortune grieued maruellously concerning mistresse vnderstood shee liuing good health night drawing apace went lodging infinite molestation minde supper lodged corneloft man reason many disturbing imagination incessantly wheeled braine bed also none best supper perhaps somewhat coursest great part night spent yet could close eye together lying still broade awake dead time night heard treading diuers person ouer head discended downe paire stayres chamber lower part house carrying light discerned chinkes cranny wall stepping softly bed see meaning hereof might espied faire young woman carried light hand three men company descending downe stayres together one speaking thus young woman may boldly warrant safety haue heard assuredly death thebaldo elisei hath beene sufficiently approued brother aldobrandino palermini hath confessed fact whereupon sentence already set downe writing yet behoueth v notwithstanding conceale secretly euer hereafter knowne murthered shall danger aldobrandino thebaldo heard word hee began consider himselfe many great danger wherewith men mind may daily molested first thought owne brother sorrow buried stranger steed accusing afterward false opinion vpon testimony false witness man innocent making ready stroke death next made strict obseruation soule concerning blinded seuerity law minister thereto belonging pretending diligent carefull inquisition trueth doe oftentimes torture torment heare lie auouched onely ase paine place true confession yet thinking themselues minister god iustice whereas indeede diuels executioner wickednesse lastly conuerting thought aldobrandino imagined murtherer man yet liuing infinite care beleagured soule deuising might best done deliuerance soone risen morning leauing seruant behinde lodging went thought fit time alone toward house mistresse finding good fortune gate open entred small parlour beneath saw mistresse sitting ground wringing hand wofully weeping meere compassion moued weepe likewise going somewhat neere saide madam torment selfe peace farre gentlewoman hearing say lifted vp head teares spake thus good man thou seemest pilgrim stranger doest thou know either concerning peace mine affliction madam replied pilgrime constantinople doubtlesse conducted hither hand heauen conuert teares reioycing deliuer father death answered shee thou constantinople art arriued doest thou know either father pilgrime discoursed euen one end history husband sad disaster telling many yeeres since shee espoused many important matter wel shee knew greatly amazed thereat thinking verily prophet kneeling feete entreated earnestly hee come deliuer father aldobrandino death doe speedily time short pilgrime appearing man great holinesse saide rise vp madam refraine weeping obserue attentiuely shall say yet caution neuer reueale person whatsoeuer tribulation whereinto falne reuelation faithfully informed grieuous sinne heretofore committed whereof diuine mercy willing purge make perfect amends sensible feeling affliction seeking sound absolute recouery least fall farre greater danger good man quoth shee burthened many sinnes doe know amends made one sooner another wherefore haue intelligence thereof charity sake tell doe much lieth make full satisfaction madam answered pilgrime know well enough demand winne knowledge thereof haue already reuealing selfe may touch true compunction soule let v goe point indeede tell doe remember time married husband hearing word shee breathed foorth vehement sigh stricken admiration question beleeuing one knowledge thereof howbeit since day supposed thebaldoes buriall rumour ran abroade meanes speech rashly dispersed friend thebaldoes indeede knew whereupon shee returned answere appeareth good man diuine ordinatiuation hath reuealed vnto secret men therefore determined conceale mine true younger yeeres left widow entirely affected vnfortunate young gentleman secret husband whose death imposed father death haue bemoaned reason neerely concerne shewing selfe sauage rigorous departure neuerthelesse let assure sir neither parting long absence vntimely death neuer power bereaue heart remembrance madame saide pilgrime vnfortunate young gentleman slaine neuer loue sure thebaldo elisei loued dearely tell occasion whereby conceiued hatred time offend trulie sir quoth shee reason anger towards wordes threatnings religious father reuealed vnder confession faithfully affected priuate familiarity passed betweene v instantly vsed dreadfull threatnings euen yet doe afflict soule abstaine vtterly refuse diuell would fetch quicke hell cast bottome quenchlesse euerlasting fire menace preuailing refused conuersation thebaldo regard would receiue neither letter message howbeit perswaded continued still departed hence desperate manner seeing melt consume daily away euen snowe power sunnebeames austere deliberation beene long agoe quite altered time since life hath allowed one merry day neither euer loue man like vnto wordes pilgrime sighed proceeded againe thus surely madam one onely sin may iustly torment know certainty thebaldo neuer offered iniury since day first became enamoured grace fauour affoorded owne voluntary gift tooke modesty might well become louing first beene cruell vnkinde haue requited like affection continued iust loyall mine owne knowledge able say moue repulse rudely matter ought well considered hand imagine repeate action ill done yet could doe became likewise onely might dispose pleasure truely obliged none could withdraw selfe onely commit manifest theft farre vnfitting thing doe except gone consent madam let giue vnderstand religious person pilgrime therefore well acquainted course dealing therefore speake somewhat amply good cannot vnseeming doe would appeare vgly another respect speake freely ende may take better knowledge seemeth hitherto haue done former passed time professed religion learned holy person religious professours adayes coue esteemed haue matter religion onely outward shew habite yet true badge religion neither ordained religious institution garment made narrow plaine coursest spun cloth make publike manifestation world meere deuotion religious disposition wrapping body base clothing condemned despised temporall occasion adayes make large deepe glistering finest cloth stuffes gotten reducing habites proude pontificall forme walke peacocklike rustling strouting church yea open publike place ordinary secular person haue pride notoriously obserued angler bestoweth best cunning one line baite catch many fish one strike euen counterfeted habitemongers dissembling crafty dealing beguile many credulous widowes simple woman yea men weake capacity credit whatsoeuer doe say herein doe excercise themselues end speech may sauour vntruth men speake haue habite religious men onely colour garment whereas time past desired nothing saluation men soules fresher witted fellowes couet woman wealth employ paine whispering confession figure painted feareful example affright terrifie vnsetled weake conscience horrible blasphemous speech yet adding perswasion withall sinnes may purged almesdeedes mass end credit dayly course guided apparance deuotion true compunction heart escape seuere penance enioyned may bring bread others wine others coyne matter commoditie benefit simply say gift soules good friend deceased make doubt almesdeedes prayer mighty preuailing meanes appease heauens anger sinnes committed bestow either see know giue would warily keepe else cast swine regard altogether vnworthy come case ghostly father cry eare secret mariage greeuous sinne breach thereof farre greater familiar conuersation betweene man woman concession meerely naturall rob kill banish one proceedeth mindes malignity rob thebaldo selfe hath already sufficiently witnessed taking free consent mariage gaue next must say power remaining kild would permit remaine declaring selfe height cruelty hee might destroy life owne hand case law requireth whosoeuer occasion ill act committed hee deepe fault party concerning banishment wandring seauen yeares exile thorow world cannot denie onely occasion thereof three seuerall action farre capitally haue offended contracting mariage clandestine manner let v see whether thebaldo deserued seuerall castigation trueth selfe haue confessed beside know hee loued dearely himselfe nothing could honoured magnified exalted dayly aboue woman whatsoeuer hee came place honestly without suspition hee might speake honour liberty lay wholly committed power noble young gentleman hee among part adorne man appertaine choycest respect inferiour one best merit citie know cannot make deniall demand could perswasion beast foole villaine yea vagabond enuying happinesse enter cruell minde know error misguideth woman scorning despising husband entred better consideration vnderstanding truly nobility nature god hath endued man withall farre aboue creature would bee highest title glory preciously esteemed dearely affected gladly embraced best ability great sinne diuine iustice equal ballance bringeth operation full effect purpose leaue vnpunished enforced reason take away thebaldo selfe euen father aldobrandino without occasion giuen thebaldo perill life partaker tribulation desire deliuered conuenient promise one thing shall tell may much better performed namely thebaldo doe time returne long banishment shall restore loue grace good acceptation accounting selfe degree fauour priuate entertainement first wicked ghostly father hellishly incensed pilgrime finished speech gentlewoman listened attentiuely caged reason appeared plainely true became verily perswaded affliction falne father ingratefull offence committed therefore thus replied worthy man friend goodnesse know vndoubtedly word haue spoken true also vnderstand demonstration manner people religious person heretofore haue reputed saint find far otherwise speake truly perceiue fault great grieuous wherein haue offended thebaldo would could willingly make amends euen manner haue aduised possible done thebaldo dead recalled life therefore know promise make matter performed whereto pilgrime without longer pausing thus answered madam reuelations haue beene shewne know certainety thebaldo dead liuing health good estate fruition grace fauour take heede say sir quoth gentlewoman saw lie slaine doore body hauing receiued many wound folded mine armes washed face brinish teares whereby perhaps scandall arose flew abroade disgrace beleeue madam replied pilgrime say dare assure thebaldo liuing dare make promise concerning hath beene formerly requested keepe inuiolably make doubt selfe shall shortly see promise quoth shee binde selfe thereto sacred oath keepe faithfully neuer could thing happen yeeld like contentment see father free danger thebaldo liuing instant thebaldo thought apt conuenient time disclose himselfe comfort lady assured signall hope deliuerance father wherefore saide lady ende may comfort infallibly dangerous perill father life make knowne especiall secret keepe carefully tender owne life euer reuealed world place sufficient priuacy alone themselues shee reposed great confidence pilgrimes sanctity life thinking none seemed thebaldo tooke purse ring shee gaue last night conuersing together kept meane care shewing saide doe know ring madam soone shee saw immediately shee knew answered yes sir know ring confesse heretofore gaue vnto thebaldo hereupon pilgrime stood vp suddenly putting poore linnen frocke also hood head vsing florentine tongue saide tell madam doe know shee aduisedly beheld knew indeede thebaldo stricken wonderfull astonishment fearefull shee dead body shee saw lying streete dare assure shee durst goe neere respect thebaldo lately come cyprus terror fled away thebaldo beene newly risen graue came thither purposely affright wherefore saide afraide madam thebaldo health aliue neuer yet died neither haue receiued wound kill mee brother haue formerly imagined better assurance getting possession soule knowing perfectly voyce looking stedfastly face constantly auouched thebaldo teares trickling amaine downe faire cheekes shee ran embrace casting armes necke kissing thousand time saying theboldo true faithful husband nothing world welcome thebaldo hauing kindly kissed embraced said sweete wife time allow v ceremonious curtesies indeede long separation doe iustly challenge must weightie businesse haue father safe soundly deliuered hope doe morrow night shall heare tydings better contentment questionlesse speede worse good hope perswadeth wil see againe night acquaint better leysure thing cannot doe present putting pilgrimes habite againe kissing comforting future good successe departed going prison aldobrandino lay found pensiue hourely expectation death hope freed brought neerer prisoner fauour seeming man come onely comfort sitting downe thus began aldobrandino friend thine heauen hath sent doe thee good meere pitty compassion thine innocency therefore thou wil grant one small request earnestly craue thy hand thou shalt heare without failing morrow night sentence thy free absolution whereas thou expectest nothing death whereunto aldobrandino thus answered friendly man seeing thou art carefull safety although know thee neither doe remember euer saw thee till thou must need appeareth lesse especiall kind friend mine tell thee trueth neuer committed sinfull deede condemned death true haue heynous grieuous sinnes vndoubtedly haue throwne heauy iudgement vpon therefore willing vndergoe neuerthelesse let thus farre assure thee would gladly onely promise something might glory god pleased case take mercy also would willingly performe accomplish wherefore demand whatsoeuer thou pleasest vnfainedly escape life truly keepe promise thee sir replied pilgrime desire demand thing wold pardon foure brother thebaldo haue brought hard extremity thinking guilty brother death would also accept brother friend vpon crauing pardon haue done sir answered aldobrandino man knoweth sweete reuenge heate desired onely man hath wronged notwithstanding hinder hope onely aymeth heauen freelie forgiue henceforth pardon euer intending moreouer mercy giue life cleere bloody imputation loue respect long shall liue answer pleasing pilgrime without multiplication speech entreated good comfort feared time prefixed heare certaine tydings deliuerance departing went directly signoria preuailed farre spake priuately knight one state chiefest lord saide sir man ought bestow best paine diligence truth thing apparantly knowne especially men hold place office doe ende person haue committed foule offence punished onely guilty haynous transgressor meane honor lay blame worthily deserueth come hither purposely informe case weighty importance vnknowne rigour state hath proceeded aldobrandino palermini thinke verily man hath slaine thebaldo elisei wherevpon law hath condemned dye dare assure sir vniust course hath beene taken case aldobrandino falsly accused selfe confesse midnight deliuered power murderer man honest knight sorrowfull aldobrandino gladly gaue attention pilgrime hauing conferred many matter appertaining fact committed two brother thebaldoes hostesse chambermayd vpon good aduise giuen apprehended first sleepe without resistance made defence torture sent vnderstand truely case went would endure paine aside himselfe altogether confessed openly deede yet knowing bee thebaldo elisei demanded vpon occasion foule act answered hatefull man life would luxuriously haue abused one wiues absent owne home pilgrime heard voluntary confession hee tooke leaue knight returning secretly house madame hermelina people bed carefull awaited returne heare glad tydings father make reconciliation betweene thebaldo sitting downe hee said deare loue good cheare vpon word morrow shall haue father home safe well deliuered danger confirme confidently word hee declared large whole cariage businesse hermelina wondrously ioyfull two suddaine succesfull accident enioy husband aliue health also haue father freed great danger kissed embraced affectionately welcomming louingly bed whereto long time beene stranger sooner bright day appeare thebaldo arose hauing acquainted matter done earnestly desiring conceale yet occurrence selfe pilgrimes habite departed house awaite conuenient opportunity attending businesse belonging aldobrandino vsuall houre appointed lord set signioria receiued full information concerning offence imputed aldobrandino setting liberty publique consent sentencing malefactor death within fewe dayes beheaded place murther committed thus aldobrandino released exceeding comfort small ioy daughter kindred friend knowing perfectly happened pilgrimes meanes conducted home aldobrandinoes house desired continue long himselfe pleased vsing honourable gracious respect especially hermelina knew better rest shee bestowed liberall fauours yet concealing closely selfe two three dayes ouerpast complementall entercoursings kindnesse thebaldo began consider high time reconciliation solemnely past betweene brother aldobrandino little amazed strange deliuerance went likewise continually armed standing feare aldobrandino friend made earnest accomplishment promise formerly made vnto aldobrandino louingly replied ready make good word whereupon pilgrime prouided goodly banquet whereat purposed haue present aldobrandino daughter kindred wiues first himselfe would goe person inuite peace banquet performe desired pacification conferred brother vsing many pregnant forcible argument requisite like discordant case end reason wise preuailing willingly condiscended thought disparagement recouerie aldobrandinoes kindnesse againe craue pardon great error committed morrow following houre dinner time foure brother thebaldo attired mourning garment wiues friend came first house aldobrandino purposely attended hauing layd downe weapon ground presence aldobrandino inuited witness offered themselues mercy humbly required pardon matter wherein offended aldobrandino shedding teares louingly embraced bee briefe pardon whatsoeuer iniuries receiued sister wiues clad mourning courteously submitted themselues graciously welcommed madame hermelina also diuers gentlewoman present seated table furnished rarity could wished thing else deserued due commendation onely sad silence occasioned fresh remembrance sorrow appearing habites thebaldoes friend kindred pilgrime himselfe plainely perceiued onely disgrace feast wherefore hee resolued time serued purge away melancholly hee arose table yet scarce begun eate thus spake gracious company defect banquet debarres honour might else haue onely presence thebaldo hauing beene continually company seemes willing take knowledge therefore meane selfe shew vncasing himselfe pilgrimes clothes standing hose doublet little admiration knew yet doubted good whether hee perceiuing hee repeated bretherens absent kindred name occurrence happened betweene time time beside relation owne passed fortune inciting teares eye brother else present euery one hugging embracing yea many beside kin hemelina onely excepted aldobrandino saw said vnto hermelina doest thou welcome home thebaldo kindely else haue done making modest courtesie father answering loude euery one might heare said assembly willingly would giue expression ioyfull welcom home thankfull gratitude especiall fauours receiued heart could afford regard infamous speech noysed day wee wept supposed thebaldo slander great discredit goe boldly replied aldobrandino doest thou thinke regard prater procuring deliuerance hee hath approued manifest liers albeit selfe neuer credit goe command thee let see thee kisse embrace dedesired nothing shewed selfe slothfull obeying father duty husband wherefore risen rest done yet farre effectual manner declared vnfeigned loue thebaldo bountifull fauours aldobrandino ioyfully accepted thebaldoes brother also euery one else present company former rancour hatred caused heauy variance betweene conuerted mutuall kindnesse solemne friendship euery side feasting dayes finished garment sad mourning quite layde aside becomming generall ioy put make heart habites suteable concerning man slaine supposed thebaldo hee one part body truenesse complexion neerely resembled thebaldoes owne brother could distinguish one hee lunigiana named fatinolo thebaldo two brother innekeepers maliced idle suspition conceiued hauing slaine lay de body doore aldobrandino reason thebaldoes absence generally reputed aldobrandino charged doe deede vehement perswasion brother knowing loue passed betweene daughter hermelina happy pilgrimes returne first heare word inne meanes bring murther light discreete cariage pilgrime vntill hee plainely approued himselfe truly thebaldo ferando drinking certaine kinde powder buried dead abbot enamoured wife taken graue put darke prison made beleeue hee purgatorie afterward time came hee bee raised life againe hee made keepe childe abbot got wife eight nouell wherein displayed apparant folly iealousie subtilty religious carnall minded men beguile silly simple maried men long discourse madame aemilia ended displeasing regard length rather held short exception could taken comparing raritie accident change together queene turned madame lauretto giuing manifest signe knew turne follow next therefore shee tooke occasion begin thus faire lady intend tell tale trueth perhaps opinion seeme sound like lye yet heard last relation dead man wept mournd sted another aliue respect let know liuing man buried dead raised againe yet liuing himselfe diuers beside beleeue came forth graue adored saint occasion thereof bad man deserued iustly condemned tuscanie sometime abby seated see commonly place much frequented people thereof monke abbot holy curious thing else saue onely wanton appetite woman yet hee kept cleanly himselfe though suspect yet knowne came passe rich country franklin named ferando dwelt neere neighbour said abby hee man materiall simple grosse vnderstanding yet fell great familiarity abbot made vse friendly conuersation end diuers time recreation delighted smile silly sottish behauiour vpon priuate frequentation abbot last obserued ferando beautifull woman wife grew deepely loue hee meditation either day night become acceptable fauour neuerthelesse concealed amorous passion priuately himselfe could plainely perceiue although ferando thing else meerely simple fellow like idiot sensible apprehension yet wise enough louing wife keeping carefully company one indeede iealous least kisse onely himselfe droue abbot despaire euer attaining issue desire yet subtill crafty cautelous wrought flexible nature ferando hee brought wife diuers dayes monasterie walked goodly garden discoursing beatitude eternall life also holy deedes men woman long since departed life meruailous ciuill modest manner yet traines intention abbot must needes bee ghostly father shee come confessed foole ferando tooke especiall fauour therefore gaue consent sooner appointed time woman came confession abbot knee small contentment would say thing else thus began sacred father god giuen husband haue else bestowed none might haue beene happy meanes holy doctrine easily haue entred way wherof spake day leadeth eternall life consider selfe manner man ferando thinke vpon folly withall may well terme selfe widdow although maried wife liueth cannot haue husband yet sottish see without occasion giuen extreamely iealous able liue onely continuall tribulation heart griefe respect enter confession humbly beseech would vouchsafe distresse assist fatherly aduise counsell thereby cannot attaine pleasing kinde happinesse neither confession thing else able doe good word little welcome lord abbot thereby halfe assured himselfe fortune laid open path hoped pleasure whereupon said deare daughter make question contrary must needes exceeding infelicity faire goodly young woman plagued sottish husband brainsick without vse common vnderstanding yet subiect bellish affliction namely iealousie therfore wofull manner tormented tribulation much credited also amply grieued pittied heauy irksom perturbation see meanes remedy onely one kinde physicke beyond cure foolish iealousie medicine familiar know best compound alwayes prouided strong capacity secret shall say vnto good father answered woman neuer make doubt thereof would rather endure death selfe disclose thing enioyne keepe secret wherefore beseech sir tell meanes may done quoth abbot desire haue perfectly cured disease dangerous offensiue necessity must sent purgatory may done saide woman aliue must need die answered abbot speedy passage thither hath endured much punishment may expiate quality iealousie haue certaine deuoute zealous prayer whereby bring backe againe life able manner euer replyed woman must remaine state widdow true saide abbot certaine time space may meanes marrie againe heauens therewith highly offended ferando returned life againe must repossesse husband neuer iealous ala sir quoth woman may cured wicked iealousie longer liue hellish imprisonment doe please abbot well neere highest step hope making constant promise accomplish quoth shall recompence haue done father saide shee whatsoeuer please aske remaine within compasse power vertuous sanctified man woman meane worth merit sufficient recompence able make whereunto abbot thus replyed faire woman able doe much doe dispose selfe performe matter comfort consolation euen ought mindfull action concerning life welfare matter sir quoth shee depending benefit strictly may safely presume command must saide abbot grant loue kinde embracing person violent mine affection pine consume away daily till enioy fruition desire none help therein woman heard word one confounded much amazement shee replied ala holy father strange motion haue made beleeued faithfully lesse saint conuenient silly woman come aske counsell sanctified men returne vnfitting answeres amazed good woman saide abbot motion haue made vnto holinesse thereby impaired iot inhabitant soule imperfection attending body whatsoeuer beauty hath powerfully preuailed entire loue hath compelled let know may boast beauty euer beheld considering pleasing sanctified man draw diuine contemplation regard matter humble equalitie let tell moreouer woorthy woman see reuerenced lord abbot yet men regard neither aged mishapen thinkes motion haue made lesse offensiue therefore sooner granted ferando remaineth purgatory doe imagine present perswasion absolutely confirmed man shall priuy close meeting carrie holy opinion among men selfe conceiued none dare saucie call question whatsoeuer doe say wordes oracle mine action halfe miracle doe refuse gracious offer enow would gladly enioy francke freely presented wise woman meerely impossible refuse richly possessed gold iewels shall please fauour mine wherein gainesaide except selfe doe denie woman hauing eye fixed ground knew wel shee denie yet plaine word say shee consented shee held ouerbase immodest ill agreeing former reputation abbot well noted attention silent shee stood without returning answer accounted conquest halfe owne continuing formall perswasions hee neuer ceased allured still beleeue whatsoeuer saide shee much ashamed importunity owne flexible yeelding weakenesse made answer shee would willingly accomplish request yet shee absolutelie grant vntill ferando first sent purgatory till quoth abbot vrge purpose speedy sending thither yet farre lend assistance either morrow else next day may hither conuerse putting faire gold ring finger parted till next meeting little ioyfull woman rich gift hoping enioy great many returning home neighbour acquainted wonderfull matter concerning sanctimonious life abbot meere miracle men worthy truely termed saint within two dayes ferando went abbye againe soone abbot espyed hee presently prepared sending purgatorie neuer without certaine kinde drugge beaten powder would worke powerfully vpon braine vitall sences entrance deadly sleepe depriue motion either pulse part else euen body dead indeede operation would hold continue according quantity giuen drunke pleased abbot order matter powder drugge sent great prince east therewith wrought wonder vpon nouices sending purgatory pleased punishment inflicted made like credulous ass beleeue whatsoeuer himselfe listed much powder abbot prouided suffice three dayes entrauncing hauing compounded pleasant wine calling ferando chamber gaue drinke afterward walked cloyster friendly conference together silly sot neuer dreaming treachery intended many monkes beside recreating themselues cloyster delighting behold folly ferando potion beganne worke slept walking nodding reeling hee went till last hee fell downe beene dead abbot pretending great admiration accident called monkes labouring rubbing temple throwing cold water vinegar face reuiue againe alleaging fume vapour stomacke thus ouerawed vnderstanding faculty quite depriued life indeede length tasting pulse best employed paine saw labour spent vaine abbot vsed perswasions monkes beleeued dead whereupon sent wife friend crediting much rest sad sorrowfull abbot cloathed laide hollow vault vnder tombe vsed stead graues wife returning home againe house young sonne shee husband protesting keepe still within house neuer seene company onely attend young sonne carefull wealth husband left vnto city bologna instant day well staide gouerned monke arriued neere kinsman abbot one might securely trust dead time night abbot monke arose taking ferando vault carried darge dungeon prison termed name purgatory hee vsed discipline monkes committed notorious offence deseruing punished purgatory tooke vsuall wearing garment cloathed habite monke euen beene one house laying bundle straw left vntill sences restored againe day following late euening abbot accompanied trusty monke way visitation went see comfort supposed widow finding attired blacke sad pensiue wonted perswasions indifferently appeased challenging benefit promise shee thus alone hindered husband iealousie espying another goodly gold ring finger frailety folly ouerruled know shee weake woman diuellish deluding man strongest holdes ouerlong battery besieging must needes yeeld last feare shee often afterward abbot vsed manner visit simple ignorant countrey people carrying ill opinion holy abbot hauing seene ferando lying dead vault also habite monke verily perswaded saw abbot passe fro commonly night season ghost ferando walked manner death iust pennance iealousie ferandoes sences recouered againe found himselfe darkesome place knowing beganne crie make noyse presently monke bologna according abbot tutured stept dungeon carrying little waxe candle one hand smarting whip going ferando stript cloathes began lash soundly ferando roaring cry could say nothing else monke dreadfull voyce replyed thou art purgatory saide ferando dead thou art dead quoth monke began lash lustily againe poore ferando cry wife little sonne demanded number idle question whereto monke still fitted fantasticke answer within set foode wine ferando sawe saide doe dead men eate drinke yes replyed monke foode thou seest thy wife brought hither church morning haue mass deuoutly sung thy soule must set thee command patrone place ferando hauing lyen entranced three dayes three night felt stomacke well prepared eate feeding heartily still saide good wife louing wife long mayest thou liue extraordinary kindnesse promise thee sweete heart aliue cannot remember euer foode wine halfe pleasing deare wife hony wife canst thou quoth monke prayse commend vsing villainously thy life time whip fiercely ferando holding vp hand crauing mercy demanded wherefore seuerely punished commanded quoth monke supreme power twice euery day must thou thus disciplinde vpon occasion replyed ferando quoth monke thou wast notoriously iealous thy wife shee kindest woman thee countrey containeth equall true answered ferando ouermuch iealous indeede knowne iealousie hatefull sinne heauen neuer would haue offended therein quoth monke thou canst confesse thine owne wilfull follie haue beene thought whilest thou wast liuing world fate vouchsafe fauour thee much hereafter send thee world remember thy punishment purgatory sinne foule sinne iealousie pray sir tell replyed ferando men dead put purgatory hope euer visiting world yes saide monke fury fate appeased knew quoth ferando meanes would appeased let visite world againe would best husband euer liued neuer iealous neuer wrong good wife euer vse one vnkind word meane till anger may qualified next wife doth send oode pray worke much candle may sent also liue vncomfortable darknesse doe foode haue light shee sends light enow answered monke burnt altar massetime thou canst haue none must bring selfe neither allowed onely time thy feeding correcting ferando breathing foorth vehement sigh desired know thus appointed punish purgatory quoth monke dead man thou art borne sardignia serued iealous master soothed iealousie pennance imposed serue thee purgatory meate drinke twice euery day discipline thy body vntill fate haue otherwise determined thee saide ferando person beside many thousand replyed monke thou canst neither heare see able doe like v farre saide ferando purgatory distant natiue country fifty thousand league answered monke yet passable moment whensoeuer offended fate pleased many mass daily saide thy soule earnest entreaty thy wife hope thy conuersion becomming new man hating iealous hereafter like speech thus beguiled time obserue dayly course sometime discipling while eating drinking space ten whole moneths together time abbot sildome failed visite ferandoes wife without least suspition neighbour reason setled opinion concerning nightly walking ferandoes ghost pleasure cannot bee exempted following paine came passe ferandoes wife proued conceiued childe time drawing deliuerance began abbot consider ferandoes folly sufficiently chastised hee beene long enough purgatory wherefore better countenance passed inconueniences thought high time ferando sent world againe set free paine purgatory hauing payed iealousie dearely teach better wisedome hereafter late dead time night abbot himselfe entred darke dungeon hollow counterfeited voyce called ferando saying comfort thy selfe ferando fate pleased thou shalt bee released purgatory sent liue world againe thou didst leaue thy wife newly conceiued childe morning deliuered goodly sonne thou shalt cause named bennet incessant prayer holy abbot thine owne louing wife sweet saint bennet sake grace fauour afforded thee ferando hearing exceeding ioyfull returned answere euer honoured fate holy lord abbot blessed saint bennet dearely beloued wife faithfully loue euer neuer offend iealousie next foode sent ferando much powder mingled wine would serue onely foure houres entrauncing time clothed owne wearing apparell againe abbot himselfe person honest trusty monke bologna conueying laying vault vnder tombe first gaue buriall next morning following breake day ferando recouered sences thorow diuers chinkes cranny tombe descried daylight hee seene tenne moneths space perceiuing plainely aliue cried aloude saying open open let mee forth purgatory haue beene heere long enough conscience thrusting vp head couer tombe great strength neither well closed together hee put quite tombe got forth vpon feete instant time monk hauing ended morning mattins hearing noyse ran hast thither knowing voyce ferando saw come forth monument ancient signior house yet meere nouices rest cunning politique stratagem lord abbot hee intended punish one purgatory therefore affrighted amazed rare accident fled away running abbot making shew new come forth oratory kinde pacifying speech saide peace deare sonnes bee affraide fetch crosse holywater hither follow shew miracle fate haue pleased shew conuent therefore silent make noise performed according command ferando looking leane pale one long time hadde seene light heauen endured strict discipline twice euerie day stood gastly amazement tombes side daring aduenture knowing perfectly whether yet truly aliue saw monkes abbot comming lighted torch singing solemne manner procession humbled himselfe abbot feere saying holy father zealous prayer hath bin miraculously reuealed prayer blessed bennet also honest deare louing wife haue bin deliuered paine purgatory brought againe liue world vnspeakable grace fauor humbly thank wellpleased fate bennet fatherhood kinde wife remember loues euer blessed fate answered abbot working great wonder heere monastery go good son seeing fate haue bin gracious thee go say home thine owne house comfort thy kind wife euer since thy departure life hath liued continual mourning loue cherish make much neuer afflicting henceforth causlesse iealousie warrant good father replyed ferando haue bin well whipt purgatory folly therefore might called starke foole way offend either louing wife abbot causing miserere deuoutly sung sprinkling ferando well holywater placing lighted taper hand sent home owne dwelling village neighbour beheld people halfe frighted wit fledde away scared terrified seene dreadfull sight gastly apparition wife fearfull rest called kindly seuerall name telling hee newly risen graue man bin began touch feele growing certaine assurance perceiuing liuing man indeede whereupon demanded many question become farre wiser tolde tydings long deceased kindred friend met purgatory reporting thousand lye fable neuerthelesse beleeued told miraculous voice said vnto concerning birth another young sonne according commanded caused named bennet ferando thus returne life againe daily wonder reported caused meane admiration people much commendation abbot holynesse ferandoes happy curing iealousie iuliet narbona cured king france daungerous fistula recompence whereof requested enioy husband marriage bertrand count roussilion hee hauing married vtterly despising went florence made loue young gentle woman iuliet queint cunning policy compassed meanes insted chosen new friend lye owne husband shee conceiued two sonnes afterward made knowne vnto count bertrand accepted fauour loued loyall honourable wife ninth nouell commending good iudgement vnderstanding lady gentlewoman quicke apprehensiue spirit remained preserue priuiledge granted dioneus vninfringed queene onely declare nouell wherefore discourse madam lauretta ended without attending motion bee made next succeeding gracious pleasing disposition thus began speake shall tell tale heereafter carry hope expectation king hauing heard rare wittie discourse madame lauretta beleeue verie aduantageable v dayes first beginner none would haue courage follow therefore rest yet remaining feared suspected neuerthelesse auoid breach order claime priuiledge place performing ought proue may tale must haue thus proceed liued sometime kingdom france gentleman named isnarde count roussillion hee continually weake crazie sickly kept physitian daily house called master gerard narbona count isnarde one onely sonne young yeares yet towardly hope faire comely pleasing person named bertrand many child age education among daughter forenamed physitian called iuliet euen tender yeares fixed affection vpon yong bertrand earnest intimate resolution admirable yong maiden many time noted yeares greater discretion old count isnard dying yong bertrand fell ward king sent paris remained vnder royall custodie protection little discomfort yong iuliet became greeuously afflicted minde shee lost company bertrand within yeeres physitian father also dyed desire grew wholly addicted visite paris selfe person onely would see yong count awaiting time opportunitie fit stolne iourney thither kindred friend whose care trust committed regard rich dowrie left fatherlesse orphane circumspect walk daily behauiour could compasse meanes scaping yeeres made almost fit marriage much encreased loue count making refusall many woorthie husband laboured motion friend kindred yet denyed knowing reason refusalles time count become gallant goodly gentleman able make election wife wherby affection violently enfl med fearing least preferred hope vtterly disappointed noysed abroad common report king france dangerous condition reason strange swelling stomacke failing apt conuenient curing became fistula afflicting daily extraordinary paine anguish chirurgeon physitian found could minister hope healing rather encreased greefe droue vehement extreamitie compelling king dispairing vtterly helpe giue ouer counsell aduice heereof faire iuliet wondrously ioyful hoping accident would proue meanes hir iourney paris disease shee imagined shee could easily cure thereby compasse count bertrand husband heereupon quickning vp wit remembrance rule art long practise experience learned skilfull father shee compounded certaine hearbes together knew fitting kinde infirmity hauing reduced hit compound powder away rode forthwith paris arriued serious matter set aside first shee must need haue sight count bertrand onely saint caused pilgrimage next made meanes accesse king humbly entreating maiesty vouchsafe sight fistula king saw modest lookes plainly deliuer faire comely discreete young gentlewoman wherefore hee would longer hide layed open view shee seene felt presently put king comfort affirming knew selfe able cure fistula saying sir highnesse referre matter without perill life least paine person hope helpe heauen make whole sound within eight dayes space king hearing word beganne merrily smile saying possible thee yong maiden best physitians europe able performe commend thy kindnesse remaine vnthankefull thy forward willingnesse fully determined vse counsell make triall physicke chirurgery wherto faire iuliet thus replied great king let skill experience despised young maiden profession physicke neither vndertake ministering thereof depending mine owne knowledge gracious assistance heauen rule skilfull obseruation learned reuerend gerard narbona worthy father physitian meane fame liued hearing word king began somewhat admire gracious carriage saide within himselfe know whether virgin sent direction heauen disdaine make proofe skill promise cure mee small time compasse without paine affliction shall come farre returne againe losse labour resolued try cunning thereon saide faire virgin cause breake setled determination faile curing mee expect follow thereon whatsoeuer great king quoth shall please let bee strongly guarded yet hindred prosecute businesse doe perfectly heale vvithin eight day let good fire made therein consume bodie vnto ash accomplish cure set highnesse free greeuance recompence shal remaine much king commend confident perswasion owne power presently replyed faire beauty quoth regard thou art maide vnmarried thou keepe promise finde selfe fully cured wil match thee gentleman marriage shal honourable worthy reputation sufficient dowry beside gracious soueraigne saide willing heartily thankful withall highnesse shal bestow marriage desire haue husband shal desire demand gracious fauour without presuming craue sonnes kindred alliance appertaining vnto royall blood whereto king gladly granted young iuliet began minister physicke within fewer dayes limited time king sound perfectly cured perceyued hee sayd vnto trust vertuous mayde woorthily hast thou wonne husband name thou shalt haue royall king quoth haue count bertrand roussillion haue entirely loued mine infancy cannot soule affect loath king grant young count regard solemne passed promise royal word engaged would meanes breake commanded count sent spake thus noble count vnknowne v gentleman great honour royall pleasure discharge wardship may repaire home owne house settle affaire order may readier enioy wife intend bestow vpon count returned highnesse humble thankes desiring know whence shee gentlewoman answered king helpe heauen hath beene meanes saue life well count know hauing often seene although shee faire amiable yet regard meane birth held disparagement nobility bloud made scorne spake thus king would highnesse giue quacksaluer wife one deales drugges physicarie hope able bestow selfe much better quoth king wouldst thou haue v breake faith recouery health wee haue giuen vertuous virgin shee haue reward onely count bertrand husband sir replied count may dispossesse mine ward subiect else may bestow pardon tell marriage cannot made liking allowance mine neither euer giue consent thereto sir saide king shall vertuous faire wise loueth thee affectionately mayest thou leade noble life greatest lady kingdome silent discontented stoode count king commaunded preparation marriage appointed time come count albeit receiued wife king hand louing deerely owne life done count requested king else remained solemnization marriage might performed owne countrey reseruing himselfe else intended mounted horseback humbly taking leaue king count would ride home owne dwelling tuscany heard warre betweene florentine senesi purposing take part florentine willingly honourably welcommed created captain worthy company continuing long seruice poore forsaken new married countesse could scarsely pleased dishonourable vnkindnes yet gouerning impatience meane discretion hoping vertuous carriage compasse meanes recall home rode roussillion people receiued louingly reason count long absence thing farre order mutiny quarrel ciuill dissentions hauing procured many dissolute irruption expence much blood many place shee like iolly stirring lady wise prouident disturbance reduced occasion ciuility againe people admired rare behauiour condemned count vnkindnesse towards whole countrey roussillion policy wisedome worthy lady fully reestablished ancient liberty made choise two discreet knight sent count husband let vnderstand displeasure hee thus become stranger owne countrey vpon return answer giue contentment shee would depart thence meanes disturbe roughly churlishly replied let doe list haue determination dwel neere tell shall haue ring behold heere finger sonne armes begotten come liue loue ring made precious deere account neuer tooke finger regard especial vertue property well knew remaining two knight hearing impossibility two strict condition fauour else deriued sorrowfully returned backe ladie acquainted vnkinde answer also vnalterable determination wel may conceiue must need verie vnwelcome indifferent considered selfe resolution became vndauntable would aduenture practise meanes whereby compasse two apparant impossibility enioy loue husband hauing absolutely concluded done assembled cheefest men country reuealing vnto mournfull manner attempt made already hope recouering husband fauour rude answer thereon returned end told sute vnworthinesse make count liue exile owne inheritance vpon inducement regard wherefore determined betweene heauen soule spend remainder dayes pilgrimage prayer preseruation count soule owne earnestly desiring vndertake charge gouernment countrey signifying vnto count forsaken house purposed wander far thence neuer would visite roussillion deliuerie word lord gentleman wept sighed extraordinarily vsing many earnest imprecation alter resolue vaine hauing taken sad sorrowfull farewell accompanied onely maide one kinsman away went attired pilgrim habite yet well furnished money precious iewels auoide want might befall trauaile acquainting one whether went place stayed vntill arriued florence happening poore widdowes house like poore pilgrim seemed well contented therewith desiring heare tydings count next day saw passe house horsebacke company albeit shee knew well enough yet demanded good old widdow gentleman made answer stranger yet nobleman called count bertrand roussillion verie courteous knight beloued much respected city moreouer farre loue neighbour yong gentlewoman verie poore meane substance yet honest life vertuous neuer taxed euill report onely pouertie maine imbarment marriage dwelling house mother wise honest worthy lady countesse hauing wel obserued word considered theron point point debated soberly owne thought doubtfull case best done vnderstood house ancient lady name likewise daughter husband affectionately deuoted made choise fit conuenient time pilgrim habit secretly went house found mother daughter poore condition poore family ceremoniously saluted told old lady shee requested little conference ladie arose giuing courteous entertainment went together withdrawing chamber set downe countesse began manner madame poore opinion free frownes fortune selfe well pleased one comfort calamity manner able beleeue answered lady nothing world bee welcome mee honest comfort countesse proceeding former speech said haue need good madame trust fidelity whereon rely faile owne vndooing well mine speake boldly replied olde ladie remaine constantly assured shall way deceiued heereupon countesse declared whole course loue verie originall instant reuealing also occasion comming thither relating euery thing perfectly ladie verily beleeued report formerly heard mooued compassion circumstance full discouered thus spake countesse among misery misfortune hath halfe broken heart meere repetition beside sad afflicting sufferance two thing cannot compasse haue hope quite frustrate euer gaining grace lord husband yet two thing may obtaine helpe true haue heard therein best resolue mee since comming city hath credibly bene told count husband deeply loue daughter count quoth ladie loue daughter haue wife owne must thinke shall surely finde greatnesse priuiledge whereby worke dishonour vpon pouerty indeed apparances matter speake may presumed yet farre thought entertaining whatsoeuer able yeeld comfort content shall find therein willing ready prize daughter spotles pouerty high rate pride honor madam quoth countesse heartily thanke presume kindnesse let first tell faithfully intend bring purpose effect see daughter beautifull sufficient yeares mariage debarred thereof haue heard onely lack competent dowry wherefore madame recompence fauour expect enrich much ready money shall thinke sufficient match degree honor pouerty made poore lady well like bountifull offer hauing noble heart said great countesse
