say wherein able seruice deserue gracious offer action bee honest without blame scandall poore yet vndetected reputation gladly accomplished let requitall rest owne noble nature obserue madam replyed countesse conuenient purpose trusty faithfull messenger aduertise count husband daughter shall command may remain absolutely assured loue constant aboue shee must entreate send testimony thereof ring weareth vpon little finger albeit hath heard loueth dearly send ring shal giue afterward send word daughter readie accomplish pleasure safety secrecie must repaire hither house bed insted daughter faire fortune may fauour mee vnknowne may conceiue childe vppon good successe time shall serue hauing ring finger child armes begotten loue liking may bee recouered meanes continue husband euerie vertuous wife ought doe good old ladie imagined matter somewhat difficult might lay blamefull imputation daughter neuerthelesse considering honest office bee meanes whereby worthy countesse recouer vnkinde husband led altogether lust iot cordiall loue knew intent honest countesse vertuous promise religious therefore vndertooke effect within dayes verie ingeniously according instructed order ring obtayned albeit much count countesse sted lady vertuous daughter embraced bed houre prouing auspicious iuno lady ascendent conioyned witty mercury conceiued two goodly sonnes deliuerance agreed correspondently iust time thus old lady time many meeting beside gaue countesse free possession husband pleasure yet alwayes darke concealed secrecie neuer suspected knowne themselues count lying owne wife disappointed deerely loued alwayes vprising morning vsually breake day preuenting least scruple suspition many familiar conference passed betweene gift diuers faire costly iewels countesse carefully kept perceiuing assuredly shee conceiued childe would longer bee troublesome good old lady calling aside spake thus madam must need giue thankes heauen desire amply accomplished time desert doe iustly challenge accordingly quite departure remaineth nowe owne power make demand please yet giue way reward would seeme bee base mercenary onely whatsoeuer shall receiue honourable recompence faire vertuous deseruings honest wellminded lady like distresse may good credit allow yet preiudice reputation although pouerty might well haue tutored lady tongue demand liberall recompence paine yet requested pound friendly helpe towards daughter marriage bashfull blushing vttered yet countesse gaue hir fiue hundred pound beside many rich costly iewels amounted farre greater summe returned wonted lodging aged widdowes house first entertained comming florence good old lady auoide count repairing house departed thence sodainly daughter diuers friend dwelt country whereat count much discontented albeit afterward neuer heare tidings hir daughter worthily married mother great comfort long count bertrand recalled home people hauing heard wiues absence went roussillion much willingly countesse knowing husband departure florence also safe arriuall owne dwelling remained still florence vntill time deliuerance two goodly sonnes liuely resembling lookes father perfect lineament body perswade selues little carefull nursing saw time answerable determination tooke iourney vnknowne arriued montpellier shee rested selfe diuers dayes long wearisome iourney vpon day saint count kept solemne festiuall assembly lord knight lady gentlewoman vppon iouiall day generall reioycing countesse attired wonted pilgrimes weed repaired thither entering great hall table readily couered dinner preassing thorough throng people two child armes presumed vnto place count sate falling knee teares trickling abundantly downe checkes thus spake worthy lord thy poor despised vnfortunate wife thou mightst returne home bee exile thine owne abiding haue thus long gone begging world yet length hope thou wilt honourablyminded performe thine strict imposed condition made two knight sent vnto thee thy command enioyned behold mine armes onely one sonne thee begotten two twin thy ring beside high time men honor respect promise long redious trauell last bee welcommed thy true wife counte hearing strange kinde carriage princesse daughter hee apparently perceiued excelling beauty serictha good commendable customes ornament daughter mind could neuer attaine height perfection yet would found men wittily accute ingenious conuert humor maid according make mockery high esteeme beside among great troope lord daily made tender amorous seruice one would proue happy last mistresse therefore forbearing otherwhise intended finall conclusion folly calling daughter alone himsel e chamber standing cleere attention hee vsed like language know faire daughter reason may moue shew selfe disdainfull towards many noble worthy men come visite honour court presence offering loue loyall seruice vnder onely pretence perceiue obtaining compassing happinesse appeareth plaine strife among one day winne prize maine issue hope bashfull modesty indeede ought attend virgin yeares veyles eye honour cannot looke thing owne may iustly vouchsafe see commed maidenly continencie yet neuerthelesse would haue bee seuere length youth falling mislike thereof may occasion great misfortune either else v together considering rape ordinarily committed quarter lady equall euery way selfe happening would presently cause death regard vow haue consecrated virginity one god seeke therein hinder disseignes neither bereaue celestiall power whatsoeuer appertaineth albeit could wish bee kept place straited separate resort men end bright beauty cause discord among amorous suters neither court proue campe destinied vnto conclusion quarrel occasion ruining many whose seruice would beseeme much needfull place dye heere fond foolish opinion enioying vaine pleasure yet remaining power another bodie grant therefore shall perceiue behauiours proceede pride contempt endeuour honor seruice sted granting gracious looke arrogancie keepe making enemy folly sufferance sweare greatest god take due order shall make feele hand offended father teach hencefoorth bee much affable wherefore deere daughter shall singular pleasure freely acquaint minde reason stricte seuerity promising vpon word faith king nay louing kinde father finde cause bee iust reasonable desist farre hindering intent shal rather perceiue fatherly furtherance rest truly resolued help fauour wherefore faire daughter neither blush dismay feare let vnderstand euidently see meere virgin shame hath made rapture soule beeing nothing else true splendor vertue deriued auncestors shining gloriously gracing much richer embellishing beauty bestowed nature speake therefore boldly father law prohibit speech commandeth ought bee obeyed promising vppon mine oath againe reason ought faile accommodate fancy wise vertuous princesse hearing king alledge gracious reason lay kinde command making lowe humble reuerence signe dutifull accepting fauour thus answered royall lord father seeing princely court haue gathered whatsoeuer may termed vertuous principall instructer life haue learned lesson maides age ought gouerne maintaine court meere look serictha sufficient yeeld assurance effectually desire victory nothing royall lord father induceth mee kinde behauiour onely due respect honour mine owne end may thought belye selfe acceptance suters kindnesse much looke much lesse word vntill highnesse shall nominate man meete husband serictha onely lord beares true lifeblood ancestor vntainted life queene mother set chaste king worthie father serictha mediate counsell effect best shall beseeme desseignes daughter vertue child yea eternall glory renowne illustrate liues memory parent consisteth either grant honest license lord desire oppose discreete condition selfe may sit free afflicting rest defeated dangerous dissentions according foresee may ensue yet neuerthelesse hold matter impossible discord grounded sole apprehension soules onely preuention therof yeeld signe glance eie much word one man another setled disposition daughter soule shee humbly entreateth may still suffered many meanes whereby winne grace greatest king employing paine worthy occasion answerable vnto yeeres vertue sparkes honour doe shine soules rather gaining heere matter meane moment endeauouring shake simplicity bashfull maide let cleare king highwayes theeues make passage difficult let expell pirate sea make danish coast euery way inaccessible noble meanes merit may throw deserued recompence vppon much worthily making idol lady lookes gazing baby wanton eye may bestowe owne granting serictha behold none shall please giue otherwise know absolute resolue neuer looke liuing man face onely gracious lord father king hearing wise modest answer daughter could choose commend heart smiling counsell gaue returned answer vnderstand wel faire daughter neither minded breake determination wholly yet gouerne selfe according fancie stand indifferently contented vntill haue otherwise purposed shall continue nature ancient custome yet conditionally command alteration carriage faile therin declare obedience else remaineth beside silly thing woman priuate pleasing many great prince lord endanger liues parent friend sensible loss may seeke reuenge perhaps owne ruine following scourge indiscretion consider daughter haue neighbour scarsely loue time may right selfe hauing receiued meanes great wrong iniuries also make doubt manage louesute discretion set pleasing proceednig betweene neyther shall beget hatred towards yet offend affection pursuite till fortune may smile fauourably vpon one man reach height wished desire siwalde thus determinately resolued let daughter liue owne discretion without alteration continued seueritie perceiuing day day many came still request mariage could giue make choise one least rest become enemy fall quarrell one another onely therefore ordination among number amorous suters onely weare lawrell wreath victory could obtaine fauour serictha looke face condition seemed bee meane difficulty yea impossible many gaue ouer amorous enterprize whereof serictha wondrouslie ioyfull seeing selfe eased tedious importunitie dulling eares proffered seruices foppish allegation fantasticke seruitude ydleheaded louers vse protest mistress wherein may beleeue list among thus forward heate affection young danish lord named ocharus sonne pirate called hebonius man hauing stolne sister vnto king hunguinus sister siwalde affiancing himselfe slaine king haldune thus killing enioyed lady kingdome gothes also inheritance ocharus relying much comelinesse person wealth power valour aboue rest excellent eloquent speaking bestowed best endeauour obtaine serictha notwithstanding contemptible carriage rest towards whereupon preuailing accesse princesse admitted speake reasoned manner whence may proceede madam fairest wisest princesse liuing day northerne part make smal account selfe denie honour yeeld seeke doe humble seruice forgetting rank hold doe refuse deigne recompence manner whatsoeuer seeking onely enioy honourable marriage perhaps opinion god become slaues beauty respect men vtterly vnworthy craue acquaintance confesse selfe conquered god seeke association woman since forsooke world left legacy v men thinke couet none extracted blood may make vaunt neere kindred alliance know many haue wished doe desire know also many haue requested king father choyce remaineth power ordained iudge distinguish merit sutors thinkes doe wrong office iudge regarding party suite sentence dese best brauest delay lingering cannot thinke madam farre selfe chill cold affection desire occasion equall vertue singular beauty doe sometime touch feelingly make wish man answerable greatnesse excellency otherwise imagine impossible yet ought breake obstinate designe onely satisfie king father desire nothing haue sonne law reuenge tyrant swetia well know sometime murtherer grandfather hunguinus also father please vouchsafe much grace fauour make man heart hath chosen husband sweare vnto honour souldier vndergoe seruice king shall reuenged royally satisfied selfe aduanced meane happinesse onely fortunate man world gentle princesse beautifull daughter king open indurate heart soften sweete impression loue may engrauen therein see loyall pursuite ocharus saue life cannot much winne one looke diuine mistresse nicenesse almost meerely barbarous wishing aduenture life prodigally seruice cruell deigne recompence duty mine least signe kindnesse imagined faire serictha desire death friendly seruant ocharus many meanes whereby performe without consuming small fire suffering languish without answere looke vpon face vnworthy one beame bright sunnes may shine vpon word mouth precious make signe hand either happinesse disaster hand enuious mine ease let one woman shee pronounce sentence life death life hatefull hand mine may satisfie sacrifice rigour disdaine rather perswaded ruine seruants mercifull wish deale may perceiue expresse compassion haue ocharus coueteth nothing daily heart ease contentment priuiledge honour aboue lady discourse heard serictha little shee moued therewith shee farre enough returning answer neither gentlewoman attending euer heare vse least word amorous sollicitors shee know one speech onely droue vtter despaire perceiuing possible meanes whereby conquer history northe ne de time rape woman much pursued lady gentlewoman loue perswaded neuer made sufficient proofe passion vndertooke cunning parent friend notice thereof meanes rape followed bloody warre betweene gothes dane recompence iniury sibdagerus king norway chosen chiefe commander swetians gothes entred powerfully denmarke first violated sister king gramo led away daughter like manner made spouse dane done daughter sigtruge prince gothes induce briefe narration onely shew ocharus made honest affable meanes win respect serictha vsed honourable seruices daughter great prince worthily deserued halfe conscientious especially one amourous sutors weary strange carriage serictha dissembling prosecute purpose preuailed farre corrupted one gouernesses secretly training place rauisher lie ambush carry away enioy pollicy seeing meanes failed compasse desire behold kind foolish rage giddy headed dullard doe terme naturall passion led guided sensuality reason discretion follow brainesicke motion rash apprehension pursueth protesteth loue lady gentillity vertue knoweth measure loue neither seeth conceiueth farre permission owne endeauour extendeth moreouer may obserue neuer age grosse men simple euen almost beginning auarice hoodwinke heart men gold strongest fortification world hath beene broken yea best bard gate laide wide open serictha shunned sight men neuer distrusted kept shee neuer knew except naturall sparke gaue light vnderstanding belonged embracement men must without dreaming thereon fall foode insatiable appetite wretch compassed surprisall glory owne lewdnesse make mocke princess setled constancy shee good lady following councell trayterous guide went abroade walking weakely accompanied one admitted men attend shee might haue repented dearely heauen succoured innocency helpe wished well rauisher though desire quite contrary one enioy violence affecting rather die doe least act might displease sooner serictha ar iued destined place false gouernesse deliuer behold second paris came seized hurrying haste away helpe could possibly rescue place farre dwelling rauisher durst conuey owne abiding enioy benefit purchase haled small thicket tree although shee knew euident perill whereinto seuere continency throwne yet notwithstanding shee would lift vp eye see thus stolne firmely shee dwelt vpon grounded deliberation vigor chaste resolue albeit shee knew wickednesse worse death preparing glory vertue desire liue contentedly yet shee astouned thereat hee led palace king father perswading herselfe violence done body preiudice honour mind free cleere consent thus robber beauty preparing massacre modesty faire princesse shee resisted power yea defended selfe worthily could get one looke eye one kisse cheeke aduantage whatsoeuer cry shrilly strugling strongly outcryes heard one little imagined shee neere loued dearely owne life namely ocharus walking accidentally alone wood deuising meanes hee might winne grace sterne mistresse sooner tooke knowledge saw armes another rauished cryed thiefe saying hand villaine let slaue thou prophane vnreuerend touch sacred honour chaste princesse deserueth royally respected thus rudely hurried hand say else sweare diuine perfection esteeme aboue creature world make thee die miserably euer man yet whosoeuer seene lyon ounce rouse himselfe chafing one aduentureth rob prey fierce eye mounted creasts writhed tayles sharpened pawes make durst mollest like manner rauisher shew himselfe one snarling another bristling darted disdainefull lookes ocharus spake manner vile base seathiefe thou art welcome thy deserued wage iust repayment thy proud presuming glad heart little meete thee thou shalt soone perceiue good beare thee whether thou worthy enioy honour lady mine owne absolute possession also encrease ample perswasion worth pleade merit effectually fauour shee shall see powerfull arme haue punish proud insolence pirate harsh language distastfull ocharus like bull made angry teeth mastiue dogge pricked point weapon ran vpon enemy roughly welcommed could easily iudged better aduantage end fortune fauoured honest man ocharus hauing ouerthrowne robber hee smote head quite shoulder presented deliuered great perill thus spake may behold madam whether ocharus true louer sericthaes vertues knowledge fully resolued end affection aimeth also farre honest desert extendeth loue recompence loyall respect hath vsed towards neuer looke villaines face stroue shame king father court violation theeuery chasest princesse earth regard ocharus readie sacrifice himselfe take much pleasure ruine thinketh hee hath giuen contentment deliuering traytor doth appeare vnto madam haue yet done enough whereby thought worthy husband royall daughter denmarke haue satisfied king owne ordinance deliuering daughter already haue done serictha constant cruelty turne eye towards exposed life meane perill daunger onely defence chastity plainely perceiue wage deuoire ranked amongest precedent seruices haue performed hurtfull beautie yet gentle princesse let tell carriage hath bin importance others merit way compared least pleased make account vnfeigned louer modesty deuoutly honoureth vertuous behauiour yet madame shall haue none answere perpetuall silence continue obstinate opinion making selfe still strange ocharus rest haue affection onely bare outside beauty royall ladie seeing instant time labour lost heart seemeth much hardned acknowledging honest seruices least yet let bee happy conduct backe palace restore sacred safetie soules best comfort behold outward signe kinde acceptation way expresse selfe rather fearing lest commodiousnesse place shold incite young lord forget honest respect imitate like basenesse rather wished thousand deathes way displease mistresse hee halfe doubtfull suspition made offer guiding backe place whence shee bene stolne found company still staying daring stirre thence let king know daughter ill fortune saw returne company worthie knight grew resolued violence bene done vnto princesse sharpely rebuking woman leauing basely done gaue charge one would seeme altogether negligent discourteous gon thence faile thanke ocharus honest faithfull seruice done vnto would continually remember recompence lay power neuerthelesse shee aduised withall hope aduantage thereby reason require god wife neither could let hinder destiny reserued another seruices would auaile purpose rather make rigorous towards gracious answer thus giuen gentlewoman althogh gaue small contentment poore languishing louer yet hee saw assured signe whereon settle resolue hope vanished away smoake fast opinion bred braine gladly would haue giuen ouer amorous solicitings priuate perswasions message sent time might aduance seruices done sake would deriue far greater fauours whereupon omitted time place occasion gaue gracious permission still plied memorie manly rescuing rauisher sufficient pleade merite father equity ought bee wife right honour armes man able deserue done long pursued maner speech seemed hatefull deuising free daily importunity length habite poore chambermaide secretly departed court wandering solitary part country entered seruice charge keeping sheepe may seeme strange king onely daughter stray sort despising courtly life betake selfe paine seruility resolution woman delighting altogether extreme spare attempt compasse owne wils court vprore lady losse father meane affliction louers wellnere beside wit euery one else greeuously tormented lady worth sodainly gone pursuit made gaine knowledge high tide sorrow disaster shall say gentle lord ocharus iudgement sound depth wofull extreamity fearing least theefe made second stealth diuine goddesse must need follow againe seeking quite throughout world neuer rerurning backe court place owne abiding vntill hee heard tidings mistresse ended dayes search village town cottage caste place else note name hee leaue vnsought diligently searched serictha striuing get knowledge vnder habit liued thus concealed labour effect made leaue place much frequented visite solitary desert shade entering caues rusticke habitation whereon hee could fasten eye seeke lost treasure soule day hee wandred along spacious valley seated betweene two pleasant hilles taking delight heare gentle murmure riuers running side two neighbouring rockes planted kinde tree thickely spred mosse hee espied flocke sheepe feeding grasse farre sate maide spinning distaffe hauing got sight presently couered face veile loue sate sentinell heart eye gentle norwegian lord quickly discouered subtilty faire shephearddesse enstructing soule ocharus thus hid face coueting knowne whereupon gathered doubtlesse shee hadde sought tedious trauaile therefore going directly vnto thus hee spake gentle princesse wherefore thus hide selfe mee haunt retreat desolate abode hauing power commaund ouer infinite men cannot liue presence hath moued madame flye company dwel among desert rockes serue slaue way worthy seruice forsake potent king whose onely daughter hope leauing countrey royall traine lady farre abasing selfe liue deiected state seruant rusticke clowne peazant reason haue despise many worthy lord dearely loue honor aboue poore slaue ocharus hath spare owne life safety also defence honor royal maid man deliuered villaine would haue violated faire chastity since haue spared payne trauell search whose losse king siwalde extreme anguish dane mourning habites ocharus euen doore death way able endure absence minde worthy madame haue hitherto deserued much one good looke glance eye recompence many good loyall seruices ala neither rauisher demander vniust request else inciuill motion may merit one regard mistresse require onely silly fauour eye may pay wage haue hitherto done seruice would madam importunate solicitor requested farre greater matter iust recompence labour desire embrace bold request kisse sericthaes immortall lip doe couet otherwise entreate mee seuerity beseemeth great princesse aske onely eleuate chaste eye grace one little looke man vertue loyall affection hath deserued fauour yea much greater excellent recompence cruell denie small thing without regarde maine debt wherein stand engaged ocharus princesse perceiuing auailed nothing conceale hir selfe apparantly discouered began speake neuer done either amorous suters answering manner lord orharus might suffice importunity made forsake father court causeth liue abased condition purpose prosecute life time long least pursue fondly haue presumed resolued neuer fauour otherwise hitherto haue done desiring therfore serictha wanting interpreter tell wil would receiue owne mouth determining sooner dye alter iot intended purpose ocharus hearing vnwelcome answer euen vpon point haue slaine himselfe yet lose name valiant man thought effeminate cowardly spirite woman force acte farre vnfitting man ranke hee tooke leaue solemnly promising forget pursuite time obey long liued although commaund hard endure hee departed thence vnto court power enioyne presence home owne house sooner arriued began waxe wearie former folly accusing himselfe great indiscretion spending much time vaine seruice vtterly despised endeuours vndertooke began accuse great ingratitude laying ouermuch respect vppon vertue haue feeling loyall suffering meerely made mockery martyrdome heereupon concluded giue ouer affection languish longer sake hated action continued melancholly passion princesse persisted strict seuerity astonished courage stoutest seruants considering deliberately sincere affection ocharus vertue onely made friend modesty wanton lasciuious appetite felt willing readinesse soule gratifie worthy manner recompence part trauailes effect resolued follow counterfeite habite euen place abiding try easily could take knowledge lately saw garment shephearddesse thus minded shee went mistresse serued likewise seen lord ocharus perfect knowledge hee conferred shephearddesse enquiring cause hee resorted manner serictha returned answer mistresse make doubt somewhat amazed perhaps hardly credit heare serueth poore degree shephearddesse onely daughter siwalde king dane whose loue many great lord haue continually laboured onely attracted hither ocharus noble sonne valiant hebonius wander solitary desert finde fled helde high disdaine rest fellow riuals word may heerein sufficiently assure would aduise send ocharus dwelleth make enquiry end may imagine lyar speech otherwise preuaile remain assured noble neighbour deerely affecteth albeit neuer made account earnestly intreat much stand friend prouide conuenient mean whereby may passe vnknowne castle ocharus reuenge selfe ciuill honesty smile hereafter proue cleerely sighted know neere vaunteth loue aboue woman else good countreywoman hearing wordes perceyuing princesse house whose speech made doubt regard stout countenance grauity faire demeanor began rellish something minde farre differing matter common vnderstanding therfore roundly replied kind language madam seruant may longer call make question contrary deriued high birth hauing obserued behauiour womanly carriage much remaine assured thereof hauing seene great honor done vnto noble lord worthy warriour ocharus wherefore lieth power impeach desseignes much lesse talke longer seruice princesse serictha performe humble dutie vnto one meanest subiects although shee yet would presume way offend regarde true vertuous loue good knight ocharus seemeth beare company bee needefull beseech accept take whatsoeuer mine may way sted make passe vnknowne prouide sufficiently euen contentment strange manner ocharus neuer cleerely sighted shalbe deceiued attired fashion garment heere part vsually worne serictha wonderously ioyfull answer suffred hir paint rather soile faire face iuice diuers hearbes rootes cloathed habite woman vse weare liue mountaines norway vpon seacoast fronting greatbritain thus disguised confidently went tobeguile eie dearest friend returne backe againe hauing affoorded secret fauour requitall honourable seruices deliuering great danger comming visite solitarie life would haue woman company till came within sight ocharus castle arriued absent mother vnto noble gentleman gaue courteous welcom notwithstanding grosse homely outward appearance yet collected countenance matter much worth bee woman base breeding ocharus returned home receiued aduertisement mother concerning arriuall stranger sodainely soule halfe perswaded kinde courtesie proceede sweet rebell pretending feigned excuse recompence trauailes passed honest office obseruing action gesture wonted rigour neuer bending one iot gaue way eye looke vpon man grew better assured daughter king siwalde yet feigning take knowledge thereof bethought himselfe queint policy whereby make triall whether secret kindnesse conducted lady thither conclude torment giue final end greeuous affliction vpon watchword giuen mother pretended caused noised house marry honorable lady constant chaste maide verily beleeued therefore gaue diligent attendance newcome seruant see thing due decency one could expresse selfe ready esteemed aboue men yet obstinate opinion conceiued owne precisenesse would rather suffer flame loue expresse least shew desire man liuing neuerthelesse inwardly offended haue honour make vaunt enioying ocharus indeed coueted thought worthy heart son law king denmarke mother seriously busied preparing castle receiuing pretended bride shee employed new mayde serictha meane busily rest meanewhile ocharus laid vpon bed well noting carriage behauiour shee hauing lighted candle hand without candlesticke hold seruants men maid running hastily fro place place cary occasion commanded candle consumed neere sericthaes finger burned hir hand faile iote height mind declare corage inuincible farre casting away small snuffe offended rather graspt strongly euen enflaming owne flesh gaue light rest businesse matter almost maruellous acte noble romane gaue hand burned presence tuscane king besiedged rome thus lady would need make apparantly knowne generous acte heart could enflamed conquered fire concupiscence suffering stoutly couragiously burning materiall fire ocharus haue already saide obserued euery thing serictha perceiuing spake one worde albeit hand burned fierce maner much astonished sprightly mind aduise hurle away fire much offending cu iositie meerely naturall vnto woman made ladie lift vppe eye see stealth whether friend noted inuincible constancy heereby ocharus honour long expected victory leaping bed hee ranne embrace feare formerly vsed daring much touch boldly clasping armes said instant madam king father decree fully accomplished first man euer lookt face onely mine without making longer resistance princely lady wife constantly loued desired haue followed painefull trauels exposing life infinite peril seruice haue seene lookt neuer craued thing onely fauour whereof cannot bereaue againe god themselues time least expected haue bestowne deserued recompence worthy reward deliuery word kissed embraced thousand time shee vsing great resistance onely somewhat offended selfe either rash looking else delaying due merit long rather good shee falne transgression shee declared violent contending motion loath continue long me rather euident signes hearty contentment yet bashfull modest manner willing enough accept louing kindnesse yet wandring wonted chaste carriage fauourably excused outward expression amourous behauiour certified withall since time freeing wretch sought violating chastity shee entirely respected albeit shun suspition lightnesse win assurance shee credited sufficiently already shee continued stiffe opinion yet alwayes resolution set downe soule neuer haue husband ocharus aboue best deserued generosity vertue manly courage valiancy whereof might better assure himselfe owne vo untary disposition shee followed find occasion reuenge selfe honest office done vndertaken winne grace loue king denmarkes daughter presented dutifull seruice ocharus would loose happinesse made king northerne ilands thankfull heart accepted gracious excuse desirous waste longer time vaine lest fortune raise new stragatem dispossesse faire felicity left counterfet intended marriage effected good earnest wedded esteemed serictha long louers liued lawfull sacred rite marriage king siwalde aduertised daughter giuen consent ocharus receiued noble husband party iot displeasing hee thought worthy son law condition sufficiently excuse match onely herein lay errour offence marriage sollemnized without knowledge consent called thereto much acquainting therewith made condemne ocharus ouerbold arrogancy great powerfull king lightly respected subiect especially marriage daughter serictha metamorphosed maide wife lyen night side soldiour become much valiant aduenturous took matter hand went father welcommed louingly pleasing speech carried wit womanly discretion nothing wanted approue done matter neuer knowne much heard openly reuealed ocharus deliuered rauisher worthie respect vsed towards honour extended desert tended flocke shephearddesse manie honourable action beside king anger became mildely qualified farre entred affection would thing thenceforward without counsell aduise sonne law highly esteemed liked respectiuely race queene dying hee married sister ocharus going hand hand gentle modest princesse serictha nouell dioneus commended company much rather free folly obscoennesse queene perceiuing tale ended dignitie must expired tooke crowne laurell head graciously placed head philostratus saying worthy discourse dioncus wonted wanton element causeth mee resignation mine authority make choise next commander best able order enstruct v yeeld place honour philostratus hope good liking assistant plainly appeareth instant carriage towards heartiest loue sufferages whereupon philostratus beginning consider charge committed care called maister houshold knowe estate matter defect appeared euerie thing might sooner remedied better satisfaction company time authority returning backe assembly thus began louely lady would haue knowe since time ability distinguish betweene good euill haue alwayes bene subiect perhaps meanes beautie heere among v proud imperious dominion loue expression duty humility intimate desire please yet hath prooued purpose still haue bin reiected wherby condition hath falne ill worse still likely euen houre death respect best pleaseth conference morrow shal extend argument casesas conformable calamity namely whose loue hath vnhappy ending await issue mine willingly would called name onely miserable vnfortunate louer hauing thus spoken arose againe granting leaue rest recreate themselues till supper time garden faire spacious affoording large limit seuerall walkes sun already low descended could offensiue one connies kid young hindes skipping euery meane pleasure contentment dioneus fiammetta sate singi g together messire guiglielmo lady vertue philomena pamphilus playing chesse sporting themselues best pleased houre supper come table couered faire fountaine sate downe supt louing manner philostratus swerue course beene obserued queenes soone table taken away gaue command madam lauretta beginne dance likewise sing song gracious lord quoth shee skill song onely peece mine owne haue already learned heart may well beseeme faire assembly please allow ready performe obedience lady replyed king selfe faire louely need must whatsoeuer commeth therefore let v heare haue madam lauretta giuing enstruction chorus prepared began manner song soule comfortlesse hath cause expresse like woe heauinesse poore amorous maide forme heauens euery starre made best pleased louely gracious element iarre else gentle breast mooue sterne warre haue strife appeased beauty eye make deepest scarre yet thing confest neuer soule distrest like mine poore amorous maide soule comfortlesse c time helde deare blest happy dayes numberlesse louesuites whispred mine eare faire hope none desperate feare sung beauty praise blacke clowdes obscure bright cleare others swimme ioy heart drowned annoy like mine poore amorous maide soule comfortlesse c well may curse sad dismall soule comfortlesse c come kinde death finish woe thy helpe best come louely nymphes lend hand mine eye close let wander wheresoere go vaunting mine vnrest beguiling others treacherous showes graue monument true loue worse spent mine poore amorous maide soule comfortlesse c madam lauretta finish song beeing well obserued vnderstood diuers kind alluding one way others according apprehension consenting excellent ditty well deuised sweetly sung afterward lighted torch brought star already richly spangled heauens fit houre rest approaching king commanded chamber wee meane leaue vntill next morning end third day fourth day wherein seuerall discourse vnder gouernment honourable philostratus concerning person whose loues haue successelesse ending induction vnto ensuing nouelles worthy lady haue alwayes heard well saying iudicious also mine owne obseruation reading impetuous violent windes enuy sildome blow turbulently highest tower top tree eminently aduanced yet mine opinion haue found selfe much deceiued striuing vttermost endeauour shunne outrage implacable wind haue laboured go onely plaine euen pathes likewise deepest vallies easily may seene obserued reading small nouels haue written vulgar florentine prose without ambitious title also humble stile low gentle possibly could although haue bene rudely shaken yea almost halfe vnrooted extreame agitation blustering wind torne peeces base backbiter enuy yet haue discontinued broken part mine intended enterprize wherefore sufficiently witnesse mine owne comprehension saying much obserued wise bee true nothing without enuy world misery onely among variety opinion faire lady seeing nouelties spared say haue bene ouerpleasing wandered farre mine respect imbasing credit repute delighting selfe curiously fitting honour haue extolled worth much addition worse speech meane vtter others seeming expresse maturity iudgment haue likewise said vnsuteable yeares meddle woman wanton pleasure contend delight verie least labor many making shew affecting good fame esteeme say done much wisely haue kept mee mus parnassus confound study effeminate folly beside speaking despightfully discreetly saide declared humanity seeking mean mine owne maintenance wherewith support continual necessity glut worlde gulleries feede hope nothing winde others calumniate trauailes would make beleeue matter haue spoken meerly disguised figured quite contrary nature quite course related whereby may perceiue vertuous lady labour seruice agitated mollested blusterings bitten euen bare bone sharpe venomous teeth enuy heauen best knoweth gladly endure good courage albeit belongeth onely defend desperate extremity yet notwithstanding vtmost malice make spare best ability without answering otherwise fitting quickely keepe slander mine eares sleight reply yet deseruing dreamt apparantly perceiue hauing already attained third part pain growne great number presume farre vppon patience may encrease except repul ed beginning infinitie reach end verie least paine taking sinke bottomlesse depth sacred force great indeede may serue resistance come answer one relate tale mine owne fauour yet whole tale shall appeare purpose mingle mine among proceed company commendable onely report parcell thereof end remaineth vntold may sufficiently expresse numbred among rest come way familiar discourse speaking malicious detractor say long since liued city citizen named philippo balduccio man meane condition yet verie wealthy well qualified expert many thing appertaining vnto calling wife loued intirely leading together sweet peaceable life studying nothing please mutually came passe flesh must good woman left wretched life better leauing one onely sonne husband age two yeares husband remained disconsolate losse kinde wife man possibly could sorrowfull lost onely iewell ioy thus diuided company esteemed determined also separate himselfe world addicting al endeuours seruice god applying yong sonne likewise holy exercise hauing giuen away good god sake departed mountaine asinaio made small cell liued little sonne onely vpon charitable almes abstinence prayer forbearing speak worldly occasion letting lad see vaine sight conferred continually glory eternall life god saint teaching nothing else deuout prayer leading kinde life many yeares together permitting euer goe forth cell shewing himselfe good old man vsed diuers time go florence hauing receiued according opportunity almes diuers well disposed people returned backe againe hermitage fortuned boy eighteene yeeres olde father growne aged demanded one day whether hee went wherein old man truly resolued whereuppon youth thus spake vnto father growne aged hardly endure painfull trauell let go florence making knowne well disposed friend deuoutly addicted god young better able endure trauaile may go thither supply necessity take ease mean aged man perceiuing great growth sonne thinking well instructed god seruice wordly vanity could easily allure dislike lad honest motion went next florence tooke thither along seene goodly palace house church sight seene populous cittie hee began greatly wonder one neuer seene least within compasse remembrance demanding many thing father named wherein old man still resolued answer seemed content highly caused proceede questioning according still found fresh occasion till last met troope beautifull woman going seemely manner together returning backe wedding sooner youth behold demanded father thing wherto olde man replyed thus sonne cast downe thy lookes vnto ground seeme see bad thing behold bad thing father answered lad call good olde man quicken concupiscible appetite young boy inclinable desire ought goodnesse would terme proper name woman tolde called young gozlings heere grew matter meane meruaile hee neuer seene woman appeared respect faire church palace goodly horse golde siluer thing else seene fixing affection onely vpon sight sodainly said old man good father much let haue one gozlings ala sonne replyed father holde thy peace pray thee desire naughty thing way demand thus proceeded saying father naughty thing made themselues yes sonne answered old man know father quoth lad meane naughtinesse goodly thing badly termed iudgement haue seene thing faire pleasing mine eye excell painted angel heere church haue shewn therefore father either loue haue care let mee haue one thse gozlings home cell make mean sufficient feeding said father much thine enemy neither thou rightly skill feeding perceiuing presently nature farre greater power sonnes capacity vnderstanding made repent fondly bringing sonne florence hauing gone farre fragment tale content pause heere returne againe spake meane enuious deprauers haue saide faire lady double blameworthy seeking please also ouerpleasing freely confesse world singularly pleasing haue strouen please effectually would demand seeme much amazed heereat considering neuer knew belonged trueloue kiss amorous embrace delectable fruition often receiued grace onely haue seene yet daily behold commendable condition admired beauty noble adornment nature aboue rest womenly honest conuersation hee nourished bred educated sauage solitary mountain within confines poore small cell hauing company father one say vppon first sight sexe could constantly confesse woman onely worthy affection obiect aboue thing else desired contumelious spirit murmure teare credite teeth wound reputation death vertues pleasing mee endeauour likewise please vtmost paine neuer auspitious heauens allowed life onely loue infancie mine intention haue alwaies bene way bent feeling vertue flowed faire eies vnderstanding mellifluous accent speech whereto enkindled flame sighes gaue meane grace remembring especially nothing could please hermite diuine perfection vnnurtured lad without vnderstanding little differing meere brutish beast vndoubtedly whosoeuer loueth woman desireth affected againe may well ranked among womenhaters speaking cankred spleene vtterly ignorant sacred power also vertue naturall affection whereof seeming carelesse like deprauing concerning touch mine age know although leek haue white head yet blade alwaies greene referring flouts taunt answer shal neuer hold disparagement mee long life endureth delight selfe exercise guido caualconti dante alighieri already aged also messer cino de pistoia older either held chiefest honour wandering farre present argument would alledge history approoue word full ancient famous men ripest maturity time carefully studious contenting woman albeit cockbraines neither know way wise learne dwelling parnassus mus confesse counsell good wee cannot alwayes continue v yet neuerthelesse man departeth delighting themselues see thing may bee thought like therein deserue blamed wee finde recorded mus woman albeit woman cannot equall performance mus yet prime aspect haue liuely resemblance mus woman pleasing nothing else yet ought generally pleasing respect beside woman haue bin occasion composing thousand verse whereas mus neuer caused make much one verie true gaue good assistance taught shold compose yea directed writing nouels basely soeuer iudge study yet haue mus neuer scorned dwell perhaps respectiue seruice honourable resemblance lady themselues whose vertues haue spared commend wherefore composition variety haue strayed farre parnassus mus silly coniectures imagine shall say take great compassion pouertie aduise get something whereon make liuing assuredly know say case except due consideration made selfe would answer mee necessitie driue craue kindnesse questionles would say goe seeke comfort among thy fable folly yet would haue know poore poet haue alwayes found among fable fiction many rich men euer could ransacking bag treasure beside many might spoken made age time flourish meerely inuentions fable whereas contrary great number busier braines seeking gaine would serue liue haue vtterly runne vppon owne ruine ouerthrowne themselues euer say men either suspitious owne charitie necessity whensoeuer shall happen answere thanke god apostle know abou abate yea endure prosperity want therefore let man carefull selfe inquisitiue discourse haue construction agrees meaning good manner taxing writing one thing intending another could wish wisedom would extend farre compare original finde iot discordant writing would freely confesse reason reprehend endeuour make amends vntill touch thing else word onely must let wander owne giddy opinion followe course proiected selfe saying thus holding sufficiently answered time say worthy lady heauens assistance whereto onely leane proceede armed patience turning backe impetuous windes let breath till burst see nothing happen harme onely venting malice roughest blastes raise smallest dust ground driuing one place another carrying vp aire many time falleth downe againe men head yea vpon crownes emperor king sometimes highest palace top tower whence chance descend contrarie blast light lower whence came first therefore euer stroue please vttermost ability thing surely must contend expresse euer know right well man say reason except selfe loue honour otherwise nature hath commanded v resist lawes requires greater powerfull strength contender supreame priuiledges haue either laboured meerely vaine else incurred owne bane strength freely confesse selfe haue neither couet possessed case wold rather lend way vse mine behalfe wherefore would aduise thus checke controule mee giue ouer silent cold humor cannot learne loue let liue still frostie complexion delighting theselues corrupted appetite suffering enioy mine owne litle haue liue kindnesse require time bright beauty returne whence parted follow former order begun may seeme haue wandered farre time sun chased starrelight heauens shadie moisture ground philostratus king risen company arose likewise come goodly garden spent time varietie sport dining supt night sun highest salerne caused amorous friend daughter slaine sent heart cup gold afterward steeped impoysoned water drinking dyed first nouell wherein declared power loue cruelty iustly reprehended imagine make vigour thereof cease abusing killing one louers ovr king noble vertuous lady hath day giuen v subiect rough stearne discourse much rather consider come hither merry pleasant sad tragicall report way suteable especially reuiuing teares others bedew owne checkes withall argument spoken without mouing compassion reporter hearer perhaps highnesse pleasure moderate delight haue already whatsoeuer else hath prouoked thereto seeing lawfull mee alter contradict appointment recount accident pittifull rather vnfortunate well worthy bee graced teares tancrede prince salerne city consulles rome held dominion part italy stoode free thence perchance tooke moderne title principality humane lord ingenious nature elder yeares soiled hand blood louers especially one neere deere vnto fortuned whole life time prince one onely daughter albeit bene much better none choisely loued esteemed neuer childe deerely affected father farre extended ouercurious respect would sildome admit foorth sight neither would suffer marry although outstept diuers yeares age meete marriage neuerthelesse length matched sonne duke capua liued long left widdowed estate shee returned home father againe lady absolute perfection fauour feature could wished woman yong queintly disposed admirable vnderstanding perhappes requisite weake bodie continuing thus court king father loued beyond future hope like lady great glorious magnificence liued delight pleasure well perceiuing father thus exceeding affection mind remarrying holding immodest solicite suite concluded mindes priuate consultation make choise one especiall friend fauorite fortune would proue furtherous might acquaint secretly sober honest familiar purpose father court beeing much frequented plentifull accesse braue gentleman others inferiour quality commonly court king prince whose carriage demeanor heedfully obserued yong gentleman among rest seruant father named guiscardo man deriued great descent bloode yet much noble vertue commendable behauiour appeared none pleased opinion like often noting part perfection affection glowing sparke first grewe like bauin take flame yet kept closely possibly could lady warie enough loue yong gentleman though poore neither blocke dullard perceiued made outward shew vnderstood himselfe sufficiently holding meane happinesse bee affected thought base cowardly expresse like againe louing mutually yet secretly maner shee coueting nothing haue priuate conference yet daring trust one important matter length deuised new cunning stratageme compasse longing desire acquaint priuate purpose proued bee manner shee wrote letter concerning next day done secret meeting together conueying within ioynt hollow cane iesting maner threw guiscardo saying let man make vse insted paire bellowes meaneth make fire chamber guiscardo taking vp cane considering himselfe neither giuen wordes thus spoken doubtlesse important occasion went vnto lodging cane viewing respectiuely found cleft opening knife found written letter enclosed reade well considered seruice therein concerned ioyfull man world began contriue aptest meanes meeting gracious mistresse according giuen direction corner king palace seated rising hill caue long beene made body hill receiued light small spiracle ventloope made ingeniously hils side hadde long time bene frequented accesse body ventlight ouergrowne briar bush almost engirt round one could descend caue vault secret paire staires answering lower chamber palace neere princess lodging beeing altogether command meanes strong barred defensible doore whereby mount descend pleasure caue selfe also degree conducting downe quite worne memory regard bene visited one long time man remembred thing loue whose bright discerning eies nothing closely concealed length commeth light made amorous lady mindefull thereof would bee discouered intention many dayes together soule became perplexed meanes strong doore might best opened shee could compasse performe found way gone downe selfe alone caue obseruing loopelight made commodious purpose shee gaue knowledge thereof guiscardo haue deuise apt course descent acquainting truly height farre distant ground within found souspirall hils side giuen larger entrance safer passage prouided ladder cord steppe sufficient descending ascending also wearing sute made leather keepe skinne vnscratched thornes auoide suspition resorting thither manner went saide loopehole night following hauing fastened one end corded ladder strong stumpe tree closely meanes saide ladder descended downe caue attended comming lady morrow morning pretending waiting woman scarsly well therefore would diseased part day commanded leaue alone chamber returne vntill called locking doore selfe better security opened doore caue going downe staires found amorous friend guiscardo saluting chaste modest kisse caused ascend vp stayres chamber long desired obtained meeting caused two deerely affecting louers kinde discourse amorous argument without inciuill rude demeanor spend part day heart ioy mutuall contentment hauing concluded often meeting cunning concealed sort guiscardo went downe caue againe princesse making doore fast went forth among woman night season guiscardo ascended vppe againe ladder cord couering loopehole bramble bush returned vnseene owne lodging caue afterward guilty often meeting manner fortune hath alwayes bin fatall enemy louers stolne felicity became enuious thus secret meeting ouerthrew instant poore happinesse accident spightfull malicious king vsed diuers dayes dinner time resort alone daughter chamber conuersing louing manner one vnhappy day amongst rest princesse named ghismonda sporting priuat garden among lady king wonted time went daughter chamber neither heard seene would haue daughter called pleasure finding windowes fast shut curtaines close drawne bed sate downe chaire behind leaning head vpon bed body couered curtaine hid himselfe purposely hee mused many matter vntill last sell fast asleepe hath bin obserued ancient adage disaster ordained one commonly proue ineuitable poore ghismonda could witnesse well king thus slept shee hauing vnluckily appointed another meeting guiscardo left hir gentlewoman garden stealing softly chamber hauing made fast sure descried person opened doore guiscardo stood ready stairehead awaiting entrance sitting downe bed side according wont began vsuall kinde conference againe sighes louing kiss mingled among chanced king awaked hearing seeing familiarity guiscardo daughter became extreamly confounded greefe therat intended cry helpe haue apprehended helde part greater wisedome sit silent still hee could keepe himselfe closely concealed end might secretly far lesse disgrace himselfe performe hee rashly intended poore discouered louers hauing ended amorous interparlance without suspition king neer person el betray ouerconfident trust guiscardo descended againe caue leauing chamber returned woman garden tancrede well obserued rapture fury departed vnseene owne lodging night houre men first sleepe according giuen order guiscardo apprehended euen comming forth loopehole homely leather habite closely brought king whose heart swolne great greefe hardly hee able speake notwithstanding last began thus guiscardo loue respect haue vsed towards thee hath deserued shameful wrong thou hast requited withall haue seene mine owne eye day whereto guiscardo could answer nothing else onely ala lord loue able much either whereupon tancrede commanded bee secretly well guarded neere adioyning chamber next day ghismonda hauing yet heard nothing heereof king braine infinitely busied troubled dinner often vsed went daughter chamber calling shutting doores closely teares trickling downe aged white beard thus spake ghismonda grounded setled perswasion truely knew thy vertue honest integrity life beleefe could neuer haue bene altred mee sinister report whatsoeuer mine eye seene mine eares heard contrary much conceiue thought either thine affection priuate conuersing man onely thy husband selfe able auouch thy folly imagine heartbreake long life remaineth poore weak aged body yet need thou must haue yeelded wanton weakenesse would thou hadst made choise man answerable thy birth nobility whereas contrary among many worthy spirit resort court thou likest best conuerse silly yong man guiscardo one meane base descent mee euen god sake youngest yeares brought vppe instant court wherein thou hast giuen much affliction minde ouerthrowne sens cannot wel imagine deale thee haue night caused surprized euen came forth close contriued conueyance detaine prisoner haue resolued proceed concerning thy selfe mine oppression many violent know say thee one way thou hast meerly murthered vnfeigned affection bare thee neuer father could expresse child againe thou hast kindled iust indignation thine immodest wilfull folly whereas nature pleadeth pardon one yet iustice standeth vp vrgeth cruell seuerity thee neuerthelesse determine vpon resolution come purposely first heare thee speake thou canst say thy selfe bad case desperate dangerous hauing thus spoken hung downe head bosome weeping abundantly beene childe seuerely disciplinde side ghismonda hearing speech father perceiuing withall onely secret loue discouered also guiscardo close prison matter torment shee fell strange kinde extasie scorning teares entreating tearmes feminine frailety alwayes aptest vnto rather height courage controling feare seruile basenesse declaring inuincible fortitude lookes shee concluded selfe rather vrge humble perswasions shee would lay life downe stake plainely shee perceiued guiscardo already dead man law death likewise welcome rather depriuation loue therefore like weeping woman checkt offence committed carelesse harme happening stoutly couragiously teare appearing eye soule way perturbed thus shee spake father tancrede denie haue done entreate fauour part disposition one little auaile shall way aduantage moreouer couet extend clemency kindnesse voluntary confession truth doe intend first defend mine honour reason sound good substantiall vertuously pursue full effect greatnesse minde constant resolution true haue loued still doe honourable guiscardo purposing like long shall liue small bee possible continue affection death euer vowed onely mine owne womanish weaknesse much thereto induce matchlesse vertues shining cleerely guiscardo little respect marrying againe royall father cannot ignorant composed flesh blood haue begotten daughter selfe composition made stone yron moreouer ought remember although farre stept yeeres lawes youth difficulty contradicted considering withall albeit vigour best time euermore exercised armes yet likewise vnderstand negligence idle delight haue mighty power onely yong people also greatest yeeres made flesh blood deriued selfe hauing also little benefit life yet spring blooming time blood either reason must need subiect naturall desire wherein knowledge haue already estate marriage perhaps might moue intelligence like delight according better ability strength exceeding capacity resistance induced second motiue affection answerable time youthful desire like yong woman became amorous againe yet striue euen vtmost might best vertuous faculty abiding way disgrace either selfe equall censure yet haue done nature aboue humane power loue commanded nature hath preuailed loue ioyning fortune meere pitty commiseration extreme wrong found benigne gracious teaching way secret enough whereby might reach height desire howsoeuer became instructed perhaps found accident denie make election guiscardo chance rashly many woman doe deliberate counsell soule mature aduise chose aboue hauing honest harmelesse conuersation mutually enioyed heart contentment appeareth hauing offended loue imitation vulgar opinion rather truth seeke reproue bitterly alleaging maine argument anger onely choosing gentleman one worthy wherein euident doe much checke fault ordination fortune many time aduanceth men meanest esteeme abaseth greater merit leauing discourse let v looke orignall thing wherein wee first obserue one masse lumpe flesh receiued flesh one creator hath created thing yea creature equally force faculty equall likewise vertue vertue first made distinction birth equality regard liberall portion thereof performed action thereto answerable thereby termed noble rest remaining vnnoble although contrary vse afterward hide conceale law yet therefore banished nature good manner respect whosoeuer execute action vertue declared himselfe openly noble tearmed otherwise errour miscaller person wrongfully called priuiledge yet full force among v day cast heedfull eye good father vpon gentleman aduisedly examine vertues condition manner behauiour side obserue part remaining guiscardo iudge truly without affection confesse noble gentleman respect base groomes villaines vertues excelling perfection neuer credited report iudgement person onely speech mine owne eye true wirnesses euer commend guiscardo extolling singularity requisite honest vertuous man selfe haue done neede sorry ashamed good opinion concerning mine eye haue deceiued iudgement neuer gaue least part praise haue knowne much euer word able expresse wherefore haue beene way deceiued truly deceit proceeded onely maintaine haue throwne liking man base condition troth sir cannot perhaps alleadge meane poore confesse surely shame haue bestowne place preferment man honest well deseruing hauing beene long time seruant neuerthelesse pouerty impaireth part noble nature wealth hurry horrible confusion many king great prince haue heretofore beene poore diuers haue delued earth kept flockes feld haue beene aduanced rich exceeded wealth concerning last doubt afflicteth namely shall deale boldly rid braine disturbance haue resolued extremity yeeres doe younger dayes euermore despised meane become cruell vse vtmost cruelty neuer entreate contrary sole occasion offence doe deserue name offence dare assure deale haue done already intend guiscardo mine owne hand shall act much therefore giue ouer teares woman purpose cruel let death drinke one cup least imagine haue deserued king knew well enough high spirit daughter yet neuerthelesse beleeue word would proue action shee doe shee saide therefore parting without intent vsing cruelty concluded quenching heate another coole fiery rage distemper commanding two follower custody guiscardo without rumour noyse strangle night ensuing taking heart forth body bring performed according charge next day king called goodly standing cup gold wherein put heart guiscardo sending one familiar seruants daughter command also vse word thy father hath sent thee present comfort thee thing thou affectest euen thou hast comforted hated ghismonda nothing altered cruell deliberation father departed caused certaine poysonous rootes hearbs brought shee distillation made water drinke suddenly whensoeuer crosse accident come father whereupon messenger father deliuered present vttered word commanded shee tooke cup looking setled countenance sight heart effect message shee knew certainly heart guiscardo looking stearnely seruant thus spake vnto honest friend right iustice worthy heart haue worser graue gold wherein father hath dealt wisely lifting heart vp mouth sweetly kissing shee proceeded thus thing euen till instant vtmost period life haue euermore found father loue effectuall appeareth farre greater time heretofore therefore mouth thou must deliuer latest thankes euer shall giue sending honourable present word ended holding cup fast hand looking seriously vpon heart shee began againe manner thou sweete entertainer dearest delight accursed cruelty causeth thus see thee corporall eye sufficient enough alwayes behold thee sight soule thou hast runne thy race fortune ordained thy dayes finished flesh hath ending hast thou concluded albeit soone thy due time trauailes misery world haue meddle thee thy heauiest enemy hath bestowed graue thee thy greatnesse vertue worthily deserueth nothing else wanting wherewith beautifie thy funerall onely sighes teares deare vnto thee thy life time thou mightest freely enioy see mercilesse father owne meere motion hath sent thee truly bestow frankly thee though resolued die drie eye shedding one teare dreadlesse vtmost malice towards haue giuen thee due oblation teares soule sometime thou hast kept carefully shall come make sweete coniunction thine company else trauaile contentedly vnfrequented silent shade onely thine yet sure present cup sent father hauing prouident respect place possession equall mutuall pleasure thy soule affecting mine truely cannot walke alone without deare companion hauing thus finished complaint euen head conuerted wellspring water teares abundantly flow faire eye kissing heart guiscardo infinite time woman standing neither knew heart effect speech tended moued compassionate teares often demanded albeit vaine occasion sad complaining comforting vtmost power shee able weepe longer wiping eye lifting vp head without signe least dismay thus shee spake heart deare heart duty performed thee nothing remaineth vneffected onely breathing last let ghost accompany thine calling glasse water shee readily prepared day powring vpon heart lying cup couragiously aduancing mouth shee dranke vp euery drop done shee lay downe vpon bed holding louers heart fast hand laying neere owne could although woman knew water yet seene quaffe manner sent word king much suspecting happened went haste daughter chamber entring instant shee laide vpon bed beholding passionate pang teares streaming downe reuerend beard vsed many kinde word comfort boldly thus shee spake vnto father quoth well may spare teares vnfitting way desired selfe hath seene man mourne owne wilfull offence neuerthelesse least iot loue doe yet abide whereof haue made liberall profession let obtaine last request wit seeing might priuately enioy benefit guiscardoes loue liued let yet death one publike graue containe body death may affoord v cruelly life denied v extremity griefe sorrow withheld tongue returning answer shee perceiuing end approaching held heart still closed owne bare brest saying fortune receiue two true heart latest oblation manner comming thee closing eye sense forsooke life leauing body breathlesse thus ended haplesse loue guiscardo ghismonda whose sad disaster king mourned sufficiently repented fruitlesly caused body honourably embalmed buried royall monument without generall sorrow subiects salerne fryar albert made young venetian gentlewoman beleeue god cupid falne loue resorted oftentimes vnto disguise god afterward frighted gentlewoman kindred friend cast himselfe chamber window hidden poore man house day following shape wilde sauage man brought vpon rialto saint marke publikely knowne brother order committed prison second nouell reprehending lewd liues dissembling hypocrite checking arrogant pride vaineheaded woman nouell recounted madam fiammetta caused teares many time eye company finished king shewing stearne countenance saide much haue commended kindnesse fortune whole course life tasted least moity delight guiscardo receiued conuersing faire ghismonda neede wonder thereat otherwise hourely feele thousand dying torment without enioying hope ease pleasure referring fortune owne poore condition madam pampinea proceed next argument successelesse loue according madam fiammetta hath already begun let fall dewdrop fire mine affliction madam pampinea perceiuing taske imposed knew well owne disposition inclination company whereof shee respectiue king command wherefore chusing rather recreate spirit satisfie king melancholy humour shee determined relate tale mirthfull matter yet keepe within compasse purposed argument hath continually vsed common prouerbe bad man taken reputed honest good may commit many euils yet neither credited suspected prouerbe giueth mee ample matter speake yet varying intention concerning hypocrisie religious person hauing garment long large face made artificially pale language meeke humble get men good yet fower harsh stearne enough checking controuling men errours also vrging others giue themselues take without hope meanes saluation doe endeauour like men worke soules health feare trembling euen sole owner lord possessor paradice appoint euery dying person place greater lesser excellency according thinke good legacy left quantity whereby onely deceiue themselues giue credit subtile perswasions lawfull make knowne meerely necessary could quickly disclose simple credulous people craft lieth concealed vnder holy habites would wish lie deluding speed franciscane friar none younger nouices one greatest reputation belonging one best monastery venice rather desirous report recreate spirit teares death faire ghismonda sometime honourable lady liued city imola man lewd wicked life named bertho de la massa whose shamelesse deedes well knowne citizen respect among lie could compasse beleefe deliuered matter sound truth wherefore perceiuing lewdnesse allowed longer dwelling like desperate aduenturer transported himselfe thence venice receptacle foule sinne abhomination intending exercise wonted bad behauiour liue wickedly euer done came passe remorse conscience tooke hold former passage dissolute life pretended surprized great deuotion becomming much catholike man taking profession franciscane cordelier calling himselfe fryar albert imola habite outward appearance hee seemed leade austere sanctimonious life highly commending penance abstinence neuer eating flesh drinking wine hee prouided close corner person could take notice thereof hee became theefe ruffian forswearer murtherer formerly beene great preacher yet abandoning forenamed vice secretly could put execution moreouer made priest celebrating masse altar saw himselfe obserued would mournefully reade passion sauiour one whose teares cost little whensoeuer hee pleased vse short preaching teares fed humour venetian pleasingly made executour well neere testament yea many chose depositary guardion monies confessour councellor almost men woman well seeming outside sanctity wolfe became shepheard renown holinesse famous part saint france himselfe hardly fortuned young gentlewoman somewhat foolish wanton proud minded named madam lisetta de caquirino wife wealthy merchant went certaine gallies flanders lay lieger long time company gentlewoman went confessed ghostly father kneeling feete although heart high enough like proud minded woman venetian presumptuous vaineglorious witted much like skittish gondoloes made short rehearsall sinnes length fryar albert demanded whether shee amorous friend louer patience exceedingly prouoked stearne anger appeared lookes caused returne answer sir domine haue eye head distinguish mine common beauty could haue louers enow pleased perfection remaining affected man many beauty haue beheld way answerable mine fit god mortal many idle speech shee vttered proud opinion beauty whereby friar albert presently perceiued gentlewoman hollow braine fit game folly flye made instantly enamoured beyond capacity resisting yet referred commodious time neuerthelesse shew himselfe holy religious man began reprehend told plainely vainglorious ouercome infinite folly hereupon called logger headed beast knew difference ordinary complexion beauty highest merit respect friar albert loth offend confession fully ended let passe away among gentlewoman giuing diuers disdainfull lookes within dayes taking one trusty brother company went house madam lisetta requiring haue conference alone selfe shee tooke priuate parlor seene body fell knee speaking manner madam charity sake regard gracious nature beseech pardon harsh speech vsed day confession night ensuing thereon chastised cruell manner neuer able stirre forth bed vntill instant morning whereto weake witted gentlewoman thus replyed pray quoth chastise seuerely tell madam said friar albert matter admirable secrecie alone selfe night dorter serious deuotion according vsuall manner suddenly saw bright splendour could sooner arise discerne might whence came espied goodly young lad standing holding golden bow hand rich quiuer arrowes hanging back catching fast hold hood ground threw rudely trampling feete beating many cruell blowes thought body broken peeces desired know rigorous correction quoth thou didst saucily presume day reproue celestiall beauty madam lisetta next mother venus loue dearely whereupon perceiued great commanding god cupid therefore craued humbly pardon pardon thee quoth vpon condition thou goe soone conueniently thou canst lowly humility preuaile obtaine free pardon vouchsafe grant thee shall stearne anger returne againe lay many torturing affliction thee thy whole life time shall hateful thee displeased god saide else beside dare disclose except please first pardon mistresse shallow braine swolne big wind like empty bladder conceiued small pride hearing word constantly crediting true therefore thus answered tel father albert beauty celestiall sweare beauty notwithstanding idle passed arrogancy heartily sorry seuere correction may inflicted doe freely pardon yet prouiso tell god else saide vnto whereto fryar albert thus replyed madam seeing haue graciously vouchsafed pardon thankfully tell must carefull respectiue whatsoeuer shall reueale vnto must closely concealed liuing creature world may know onely happy lady liuing happinesse relieth silence secrecie solemne vowes protestation shee sealed vp many promise fryar thus proceeded madam charge imposed god cupid tell himselfe extremely enamoured beauty become gracious affection many night hath come see chamber sitting pillow slept sweetly desiring often awake onely fearing affright wherefore sends word one night intendeth come visite spend time conuersing regard god meerely spirit forme whereby neither else haue capacity beholding much lesse touch feele saith sake come shape man giuing charge also know shall please haue come whose similitude would haue come whereof faile respect may iustly thinke selfe onely happy woman liuing farre beyond good fortune mistris wantwit presently answered shee well contented god cupid loue would returne like loue againe protesting withall wheresoeuer shee see maiesticall picture would set hallowed burning taper moreouer time welcome whensoeuer hee would vouchsafe visite alwayes finde alone priuate chamber condition olde loue psyche beauty else whatsoeuer must set aside none selfe best mistresse referring personall forme appearance shape himselfe best pleased assume might frightfull offensiue madam quoth friar albert wisely haue answered leaue matter take order sufficiently contentment may great grace without preiudice selfe granting one poore request namely vouchsafe god appearance bodily shape person perfect forme man behold may safely giue entertainment without taxation world ill apprehension curious inquisition beside greater happinesse neuer befall assumeth soule body walketh earth humane figure shall wandering ioyes louers paradise feeling fruition felicity mortality capeable much imagination wise gentlewoman replied well contented regard seuere punishment inflicted god cupid reproachfull speech giuen allow poore kinde consolation requested grant whereuppon fryar albert saide ready madam giue welcome morrow euening entering house comming humane body cannot enter doore whereas powerfull manner made vse wing would flye window could able see vpon conclusion albert departed leauing lisetta meane pride imagination god cupid bee enamored beauty therefore thought houre yeare till might see mortall shape friar albert braine wonderfully busied visite common humane manner therefore made sute close body white taffata poudred ouer starres spangle gold bow quiuer arrowes wing also fastened backe behinde cunningly couered friar habit must sole meanes safe passage hauing obtained licence superiour accompanyed holy brother leaues companion awaite returning backe visited foolish lisetta according expectation readily attending god arriuall albert come house knocked doore maid admitting entrance according mistresse appointed shee conducted mistress chamber laying aside friar habite seeing shine glorious splendour adding action also assumed dissimulation maiesticke motion body wing bow bene god cupid indeede hee told truly madam answered albert successe vvith hath beene way able comprehend assure soone acquainted answer felt sodaine rapture made soule visibly apprehension saw carried elues fairy floury field elisium vvhere louers departed life vvalk among bed lillie rose world seene neither imagined humane capacity superabounding pleasure ioy solace long continued meanes vvas transported hither againe morning beyond ability mee expresse assumed body againe great god hadde made vse thereof seruice well friar albert quoth shee may see happinesse hath befalne grosse opinion perfection felicity enioy still like pardoning error granting god accesse shape enuy wish heereafter wiser taking vpon iudge beautie much idle folly proceeded hir still soothed contentment occasion serued many meeting former manner fortuned within dayes madam lisetta company one gossip conference commonly falleth concerning woman city beautie behauiour amorous suters seruants generall opinion conceiued worth merit wherein lisetta ouermuch conceyted selfe admitting equall among speech sauouring vnseasoned braine gossip quoth knew account made beauty holdes meane estimation would freely confesse deserue bee preferred woman ambitious owne opinion commonly couetous one anothers secret especially matter emulation whereupon gossip thus replyed beleeue madam make doubt speech may bee true regard admired hath eminent peculiar fauour none reach vnto made famous generall notion woman else admire honor glory kinde miracle nature perceiue gossip said lisetta wherat ayme loue lose longing case constantly mortall creature may well imagine gossip beauty superiour happy fortune friend lisetta whose perfection great cupid awefull commanding god loue himselfe conceiued extraordinary liking hath abandoned
