gossip answered lisetta certainly true sacred kiss sweet embrace pleasing speech proffer continuall deuotion towards hath giuen good cause confirme say thinke felicity farre beyond woman honoured often nightly visitation gossip inwardly smiling idle speech neuertheles auouched vehement asseuerations fell instantly sicke woman naturall disease thinking euery minute tedious month till company gossip breake obligation vertuous promise others well selfe might laugh folly shallowwitted woman next day following hap wedding among great number woman quickly acquainted strange wonder like husband passing hand hand lesse space two day venice fully possessed among rest brother foolish woman heard admirable newes concerning sister discreetly concealing themselues closely concluded watch walk pretended god soared lofty flight would clip wing come better acquainted fortuned friar hearing cupidicall visitation ouerpublikely discouered purposed check reproue lisetta indiscretion habited according former manner friarly cowle couering al former brauery left companion vsed stay closely walked along vnto house sooner entred brother ambushed neer doore went ascending staires time vncased himselfe appeared like god cupid spangled wing displayed rushed chamber hauing refuge opened large casement standing directly ouer great gulfe riuer presently leapt water deepe hee skilfull swimming harme fall albeit sodain affright much perplex recouering side riuer espied light doore house open wherein dwelt poore man earnestly intreated saue life reputation telling many lie tale meanes thus disguised throwne nightwalking villaines water poore man moued compassionate distressed estate laid owne bed ministring comfort time pouerty permit day drawing went businesse aduising take rest long till returned locking doore leauing counterfe god bed away go poore man daily labor brother lisetta perceiuing god cupid bee fled gone shee melancholly sadnesse sitting tooke vp reliques left behind meane friar hood cowle shewing sister sharply reprouing vnwomanly behauiour lefte meane discomfort returning home owne house conquered spoiles forlorne friar time occurrence broad day speeding poore man returning homeward rialto visit guest lefte bed beheld diuers crouds people generall rumor noysed among god cupid beene night madame lisetta ouerclosely pursued brother fear surprized leapt window gulfe one could tell become heereupon poore man beganne imagine guest entertained night time must need bee supposed god cupid wing embellishment appeared wherefore come home sitting downe bed side speech passing knew friar albert promised giue fifty ducates hee would betray lisettaes brother vpon acceptation offer money sent paied downe wanted nothing apt conuenient meanes whereby albert might safely conueyed monasterie wholly referred poore man care trust thus hee spake sir see likelyhoode cleare escaping home except manner aduise obserue day merry festiuall lawfull one disguise man skin beare shape sauage man forme better deuice done brought vpon mark market place hunted dog vpon hunting conclusion feast ended man leades monster whether pleaseth accept shape bee seene heere poore abiding safely afterward bring would bee otherwise see possible meanes may escape hence vnknown without question contrary gentlewoman brother knowing concealment one place wil set spy watch throughout city must need taken although seemed seuere imposition albert passe disguise yet exceeding feare lisettaes brother friend made gladly yeelde vndergo shape poore man pleased thus ordered annointing naked body hony couered ouer downy small feather fastning chaine necke strange vgly vizard face hee gaue great staffe one hand two huge mastiue dog chained together borrowed butchery afterward sent man rialto proclaimed sound trumpet desired see god cupid last night descended downe sky fell ill hap venetian gulfe let repaire publike market place marke would appeare owne likenesse done soone left house leading thus disguised along chaine hee followed great crowd people euery one questioning whence manner brought market place infinite number people gathered together well follower heard proclamation made choise pillar stood place somewhat highly exalted wherto chained sauage man making shew meant awaite till hunting shold begin time fly waspes hornet terribly sting naked body annointed hony endured therby vnspeakable anguish poore man saw needed concourse people pretending purposed let loose saluage man tooke maske vizard albert face spake aloud manner gentleman others seeing wilde boare commeth hunting imagine cannot easily found meane end may lose labour comming hither shew great god loue called cupid poet feigned long since little boy growne manly stature see maner hath left high dwelling onely comfort venetian beauty belike nightfogs ouerflagging wing fell gulfe come ow present seruice sooner taken vizard euery one knew friar albert sodainly arose shoutes outcry bitter word breathed forth hurling also stone durt filth face best acquaintance could take knowledge one pittying abusing long continued offended people fury newes therof carried conuent six religious brother came casting habite releasing chain led monastery without much mollestation trouble people imprisoning house seueritie inflicted punishment rather conceite open shame shortned dayes dyed thus see faire lady licentious life must clouded cloake sanctity euill action dayly committed yet escaping vncredited come time length iust discouering good may shine true luster glory bad sinke owne deserued shame three yong gentleman affecting three sister fledde candie eldest iealousie becommeth death louer second consenting duke candy request meanes sauing life afterward owne friend killeth thence flyeth away elder sister third couple man woman charged death committed prisoner confesse facte fearing death corruption money preuaile keeper escaping thence rhodes died great pouerty third nouell heerein declared dangerous occasion ensuing anger despight entirely loue especially iniuried offended loue king perceiued madame pampinea ended discourse sat sadly prety without vttering one word afterward spake thus little goodnesse appeared beginning nouell ministred occasion mirth yet ending proued better could wish worse infliction falne venerious friar turning towards madam lauretta said lady tell v better tale possible may smiling thus answered king sir ouercruelly bent poore louers desisiring amourous procession haue harsh sinister concludings neuerthelesse obedience seuere command among three person amourously perplexed relate vnhappy ending whereas may saide speede vnfortunately equally alike enioying issue desire thus purpose proceede euery vice choise lady well know redoundeth great disgrace preiudice practised oftentimes others among common hurtfull enemy sinne vice carrieth v full carrere draweth v vnauoidable peril danger mine opinion seemeth choller anger nothing else sudden inconsiderate mouing prouoked receiued iniury hauing excluded respect reason dimde darke vapour bright discerning sight vnderstanding enflameth minde violent furie albeit inconuenience happeneth men others yet notwithstanding hath noted woman haue felt selfe infirmity extreme manner much sooner kindled burneth brighter flame regard haue lesser consideration therefore wondred aduisedly obserue shall plainely perceiue fire euen owne nature taketh hold thing light tender much sooner hard weighty substance v woman let men take offence word farre soft delicate therefore fraile regard seeing naturally enclined hereto considering also much affability gentlenesse doe shew themselues pleasing full content men liue likewise anger fury compacted extraordinary peril purpose may valiant courage outstand fierce assault wrath rage shew mine ensuing nouel loues three young gentleman many gentlewoman came fatall vnfortunate successe tempestuous anger one among according haue formerly related vnto marseille learne prouence seated sea also ancient noble city hath beene heretofore inhabited farre richer wealthy merchant instant time among one named narnaldo ciuada man meane condition yet cleare faith reputation land good ready monies immeasurably rich many child wife among three daughter exceeded sonnes yeeres two twinnes borne one body counted fifteene yeares old third foureteene nothing hindered marriage parent owne expectation returne home narnaldo abroade spaine merchandise eldest sister named ninetta second magdalena third bertella gentleman albeit poore fortune called restagnone extraordinarily enamoured ninetta man possibly could shee likewise earnest affection towards yet carrying loues proceeding secresie long time enioyed heart sweete contentment yet vndiscouered eye came passe two young gallant one named folco hugnetto attained incredible wealth decease father also farre loue one magdalena bertella restagnone intelligence thereof meanes faire friend ninetta purposed releeue pouerty friendly furthering loue owne growing familiarity one would walke abroade folco againe hugnetto oftner together visite mistress continue worthy friendship day hee saw time sutable intent hee inuited two gentleman home house hee fell like conference kind friend quoth honest familiarity hath past betweene v may render certaine assurance constant loue beare willing worke meanes may tend good desire compasse mine owne truth mine affection cannot conceale selfe meane acquaint intention wherewith braine hath long trauelled may soone deliuered may passe liking approbation let tell except speech sauour vntruth action carry double vnderstanding common behauiour night day appeare pine consume away cordiall loue beare two sister suffer affliction third reciprocall requitall dearest affection v qualifie heate tormenting flame condescend course shall aduise remedy yeeld equall ease may safely enioy benefit contentment wealth aboundeth doth want extremely tyrannize ouer one banke might made rich substance embraced therein third partaker quarter world dissigned v liue heart ease vpon possession durst engage credite sister meanly stored father treasure shall beare v company place soeuer please man freely enioying owne dearest loue may liue like three brerhren without hinderance mutuall contentment remaineth gentleman accept comfortable offer refuse two brother whose passion exceeded best meanes support perceiuing hope enioy loues desired long time deliberation greatly disputed thought best done readily replyed let happen danger whatsoeuer would ioyne determination aud partake wealthiest fortune restagnone heard answer within dayes following went conferre ninetta easie matter compasse neuerthelesse opportunity proued fauourable meeting priuate place appointed discoursed large passed betweene two young gentleman maintaining many good reason haue like allow enterprize although could hardly doe yet regard shee desire power without suspition daily company franckly thus answered heart chosen friend cannot way mislike aduise take order sister shall agree resolution let therefore charge rest make euery thing ready depart hence soone best conuenient meanes may enabled restagnone returned folco hugnetto thought euery houre yeere heare would succeed vpon promise past betweene told plaine termes lady free consent nothing wanted furnishment sudden departing hauing concluded candye harbour entertainment made sale inheritance lay readiest purpose also good house vnder colour venting merchandise abroade bought nimble pinnace fortified good strength preparation waited conuenient wind side ninetta sufficiently acquainted forwardnesse sister desire owne substantially preuailed good voyage sole expectation whereupon night set away opened strong barred chest father whence tooke great store gold costly iewels wherewith escaping secretly house came place louers attended going aboard pinnace windes furtherous without touching night following arriued geneway peril pursuite knit knot holy wedlocke freely enioyed long wished desire whence setting sayle againe well furnished thing wanting passing port port end eight dayes landed candie meeting impeachment way determining spend dayes first prouided themselues faire goodly land countrey beautifull dwelling house city due furnishments belonging family well beseeming worthy gentleman delight else daily recreation inuiting neighbour againe louing manner louers could wish liue ample contentment passing time height felicity crossed sinister accident came passe often wee may obserue like occasion although delight doe especially please v yet breed surfet swell ouergreat abundance restagnone deerely affected faire ninetta free possession without perill loosing grew also bee wearie consequently faile familiar performance formerly passed betweene one day inuited banket hee saw beautifull gentlewoman countrey whose perfection pleasing beyond comparison hee labored painfull pursuite win purpose meeting diuers priuate place grew prodigall expences vpon could closely carried beeing seene obserued ninetta became possessed extreame ielousie hee could doe thing whatsoeuer immediately knowledge fire growing flame patience became extreamely prouoked vrging rough rude speech daily tormenting beyond power sufferance enioying thing much plenty make appeare irkesome loathing v deniall desire whet appetite euen angry spleene ninetta proceede violence newe commenced loue restagnone succession time whether hee enioyed embracement new mistresse yet ninetta sinister report much owne iealous imagination held infallible certaine heereupon fell extreame melancholly melancholly begat implacable fu consequently contemptible disdaine conuerted former kindly loue restagnone cruell bloudie hatred yea strangely reason respect confounded reuenge else speedy death might satisfie wrong shee imagined receiue restagnone minion vpon enquiry meanes shee might best compasse bloody intention grew acquainted graecian woman wonderfully expert compounding poysons shee perswaded gift bounteous promise length shee preuailed deadly water distilled without counsell contrary day restagnone blood somewhat ouerheated little dreamed treason conspired wife caused drinke great draught thereof vnder pretence soueraigne cordiall water powerfull operation thereof next morning restagnone found dead bed death vnderstood folco hugnetto wiues knowing hee came bee thus empoysoned sister seemed bemoane sodaine death apparant shewes mourning could possibly expresse buried honourably suspition ceased fortune infinite fagaries neuer acting disaster closely cunningly discouereth againe came passe within dayes following graecian woman deliuered poyson ninetta another deede damnation apprehended euen action put vpon torture among many horrid villanies committed confessed empoysoning restagnone euery particle thereto appertaining wherupon duke candie without noyse publication setting strong guard night time house folco ninetta lodged sodainly seized vpon examination maintainance desperate reuenge pain endeauour worke meanes duke life might perish fire although iustly deserued attempt prooued effect duke concluded execute iustice heere obserue magdalena beeing beautifull woman yong choisest flower time often bin solicited duke entertaine loue kindnesse whereto meanes would listen giue consent earnestly importuned safety sister life shee tooke hold daily suite priuate told desirous ninettaes life lay power obtaine granting fruition loue apparantly perceiuing ninetta likely liue prostitution chaste honour preferred losse owne life sister concluded let dye rather run disgrace hauing excellent ingenious wit quicke apprehensiue perillous occasion shee intended make trial ouerreaching lasciuious duke wanton purpose yet assured sister life without blemish reputation soliciting altering manner ninettaes death suffering bee consumed fire drowned according custome obserued long time importunity sister magdalena still silence night ninetta conueyed sacke sent manner house folco duke following soone challenge promise magdalena hauing acquainted husband vertuous intention preseruing sister life disappointing duke wicked desire contrary true meaning case ninetta formerly beene aduerse restagnone onely ouerruled likewise iealousie perswaded rash opinion duke already dishonoured magdalena otherwise would haue deliuered ninetta prison mad fury gaue fire vnmanly perswasion nothing quench violent shame life poore magdalena suddenly sacrificed rescue sister diuell anger vnderstandings bright eye thereby abused credit might giuen womanly protestation thing seeme alter bloody purpose hauing slaine magdalena poniard notwithstanding teares humble entreaty hee ran haste ninettaes chamber shee dreaming desperate accident vsed dissembling speech sister quoth wife hath aduised speedily conuey hence fearing renewing duke fury falling againe hand iustice haue barke readily prepared life secured doe desire ninetta fearefull way distrusting saide thankfull allowance sister care curteous tender ready seruice departed thence presently taking farewell sister husband seashore came weakely prouided monies defray charge getting aboard barke directed course themselues knew whether amourous duke disguise hauing long daunced attendance folcoes doore admittance entrance angerly returned backe court protesting seuere reuenge magdalena gaue better satisfaction cleare thus basely abusing morrow morning magdalena found murthered chamber tidings thereof carried duke present search made bloody offendor folco fled gone ninetta bearing deadly hatred hugnetto incensed duke wife supposing guilty magdalenaes death thereto easily perswaded regard immoderate loue slaine gentlewoman went himselfe person attended guard hugnettoes house wife seized prisoner newes strange fame report preuailing sight also hath conducted diuers wretched miserable ending liues gulielmo second king sicilie according sicilian chronicle record two child one sonne named rogero daughter gerbino hauing heard message diuine mistresse knowing also king grandfather past safe conduct king thunis peaceable passage thorough sea wit end vrgent necessitie might best bee done notwithstanding moued setled constancie plighted loue speech deliuered messenger princesse shew himselfe man endued courage departed thence vnto messina made readie two speedie gallies fitting men valiant disposition set away sardignia making full account ship carried princesse must come along coast expectation therein deceiued within dayes ship ouerswiftly winded came sailing neere place attended arriuall whereof gerbino sooner gotten sight animate resolutes company thus spake gentleman men valour heeretofore haue beene reputed perswaded among either formerly haue instantly feele allcommanding power loue without thinke mortall man haue goodnesse vertue dwelling wherefore euer haue bene amorously affected presently haue apprehension thereof shall easily iudge aime true loue loue hath guided comforted manfully assisted yonder ship see commeth gently vnder saile euen offered selfe prize onely iewell esteeme also mighty vnvalewable treasure wonne without difficult labour hazard dangerous fight men vndauntable courage honour victory couet part parcell onely ladie whose sake haue vndertaken armes freely giue rest contained shippe let v set gentleman dearest friend couragiously let v assaile ship see wind fauors v questionlesse good action fortune faile v gerbino needed haue spoken much perswading seize rich booty men messina naturally addicted spoile rapine prince began oration concluded make ship purchase wherefore giuing lowde shout according countrey manner commaunding trumpet sound chearefully rowed amain oares meere despight set vpon ship gallies could come neere charge managing perceyuing speede made towards likely meanes escaping resoluedly stood vppon best defence time slothfull prince come neere ship commanded patrones come except would aduenture fight sarazines thereof aduertised vnderstood also demanded returned answer motion proceeding manner law plighted faith promised king sicily safe passage thorow sea meanes mollested assailed testimony whereof shewed gloue auouching moreouer neyther force otherwise would yeelde deliuer thing aboorde ship gerbino espying gracious mistresse ship decke appearing farre beautifull fame made relation much enflamed formerly bin replyed thus shewed gloue wee haue quoth faulcon heere humbled sight gloue therefore wil deliuer lady prepare selues fight must haue whether hereupon began let flie side dart arrowes stone sent violent sort sling thus continuing fight long great harme either side length gerbino perceyuing small benefite would redound vndertake kinde course tooke smal pinnace purposely brought sardignia setting flaming fire conueyd gallies help close ship sarazines much amazed thereat euidently perceiuing eyther must yeeld dy brought king daughter vpon prow ship greeuously weeping wringing hand calling gerbino let behold resolution slew hir face afterward throwing body sea said take giue thee according bounden duty thy periury hath iustly deserued sight little greeuous prince gerbino madded monstrous cruelty caring became owne life hauing lost hee onely desired liue dreading dart arrowes slinged stone violence el could vse leapt aboord ship despight durst resist behauing like hungerstarued lyon enters among heard beastes tearing carkasses piece teeth pawes extreme fury poor prince sparing like one durst appeare presence bloody slaughter violence fire encreasing ship mariner got wealth possibly could saue suffering sea swallow rest gerbino returned vnto gallies againe nothing proud illgotten victory afterward hauing recouered princess dead body sea enbalmed sighes teares hee returned backe sicilie caused honourably buried little island named vstica face face confronting trapanum king thunis hearing disastrous newes sent ambassador habited sad mourning aged king sicily complaining faith broken accident falne age sodainly incited anger king extreamly offended iniury seeing way whereby deny iustice vrged instantly ambassadours caused gerbino apprehended hee himselfe regard none lord baron would therein assist laboured diuert earnest importunity pronounced sentence death prince commanded haue beheaded presence affecting rather dye without heire thought king void iustice two vnfortunate louers neuer enioying least benefite long wished desire ended liues violent manner three brother isabella slew gentleman secretly loued ghost appeared sleepe shewed place buried body silent manner brought away head putting pot earth flower basile sweet hearbes vsually set watered long teares whereof brother hauing intelligence soone dyed meere conceite sorrow fift nouell wherein plainly proued loue cannot rooted vppe humane power prouidence especially soule hath bene really apprehended nouell madame eliza finished somewhat commended king regard tragicall conclusion philomena enioyned proceede next discourse beeing ouercome much compassion hard fortune noble gerbino beautifull princesse extreme vehement sighe thus spake tale worthy lady extendeth person high birth quality madame eliza gaue relation yet peraduenture may prooue lesse pittifull remember selfe messina lately spoken place accident also happened messina dwelt three yong men brother merchant common profession becoming rich death theyr father liued good fame repute father san gemignano sister named isabella young beautifull well conditioued vpon occasion yet remained vnmaried proper youth gentleman borne pisa named lorenzo trusty factor seruant managing brethren businesse affaire lorenzo comely personage affable excellent behauiour grew gracious eye isabella shee affoorded many respectiue lookes yea kindness common quality lorenzo taking notice obseruing degree time time gaue ouer beauty citie might allure affection fixed heart loue grew mutuall embracing equally respecting one another entertaining kindness occasion gaue leaue long time continued amorous league loue yet cunningly concealed length secret meeting lorenzo isabella ease poore soules loues oppression discouered eldest brother vnknowne thus betrayed man great discretion althogh sight highly displeasing yet notwithstanding kept himselfe till next morning labouring braine might best done vrgent case day come resorted brother told seene time past betweene sister lorenzo many deliberation passed case thus concluded together let proceede patient supportance scandall might ensue sister euill acte yet committed seeming knew loue wary eye still vpon secret walkes awaiting conuenient time without owne preiudice isabellaes knowledge might safely breake stolne loue altogither liking shewing worse countenance lorenzo formerly done imploying conuersing kinde manner fortuned riding three recreate themselues cittie tooke lorenzo company come solitarie place best suited vile purpose ran sodainly vpon lorenzo slew afterward enterred hid body hardly could discouered one returned backe messina gaue forth credible report sent abroad affaire formerly wont euery one verily beleeued knew reason conceite otherwise isabella liuing expectation returne perceiuing stay offensiuely long made many demand brother part sent tarrying quite wonted course importunate speech taking discontentedly one returned frowning answer meaning sister many questioning lorenzo vrgent affaire haue make impatient vpon absence heereafter make demand shall shape reply bee little liking harsh word isabella fell abundance teares whereamong mingled many sighes groanes able ouerthrow far stronger constitution full feare dismay yet way distrusting brethren cruell deede shee durst question silence darke night lay afflicted bed oftentimes would call lorenzo entreating speedy returning againe bene present checkt reproued long absence one night amongst rest growen almost hopelesse euer seeing againe hauing long wept greeuously lamented sens faculty vtterly spent tired could vtter complaint fell trance sleepe dreamed ghost lorenzo appeared vnto torne vnbefitting garment lookes pale meager staring thought thus spake deare loue isabella thou doest nothing torment thy selfe calling accusing ouerlong tarrying thee come therfore let thee know thou canst enioy company day last thou sawest thy brother bloodily murthered acquainting place buried mangled body hee strictly charged call time afterward vanished away yong damosell awaking giuing credite vision sighed wept exceedingly risen morning daring say thing brother resolutely determined go see place formerly appointed onely make triall seemed see sleepe carry likelyhood truth hauing obtained fauour brother ride dayes iourney city company trusty nurse long time attended house knew secret passage loue rode directly designed place couered store dried leaues deeply sunke part ground therabout digged farre found body murthered lorenzo yet little corrupted impaired perceiued truth vision wisedome gouernment much preuailed instruct soule teares spent meerely fruitlesse vaine neither time require long tarrying gladly would shee haue carried whole body secretly bestow honourable enterment exceeded compasse ability wherefore regard could haue yet would possessed part hauing brought keene razor helpe nurse shee diuided head body wrapped vp napkin nurse conueyed lap laide body ground thus vndiscouered departed thence arriued home conuenient time alone themselues chamber washed head ouer ouer teares bestowed infinite kiss thereon long nurse hauing brought large earthen potte wee vse set basile marierom flower sweet hearbes shrouding head silken scarfe put pot couering earth planting diuers rootes excellent basile therin neuer watered either teares rose water water distilled flower orange pot vsed continually sitte either chamber else caried alwaies sighing breathing foorth sad complaint thereto euen beene vttered lorenzo day day continuall exercise meane admiration brother many friend beheld long held mourning manner continuall watering basile putrifaction head buried pot earth grew flourishing odorifferous scented basile could possibly yeeld sweet sauor neighbour noting behauiour obseruing long continuance thereof much bright beauty defaced eye sunke head incessant weeping made many kinde friendly motion vnderstad reason violent oppression could meanes preuaile win discouery nurse faithfull secrecie brother also waxed wearie carriage hauing often reproued without alteration length closely stole away potte basile made infinite wofull lamentation earnestly entreating haue restored againe auouching shee could liue without perceiuing could haue pot againe fell extreame sicknesse occasioned onely ceaselesse weeping neuer vrged haue thing restoring basile pot brother grew greatly amazed thereat shee neuer called ought else beside thereupon desirous ransacke pot bottome hauing emptied earth found scarfe silke wherein head lorenzo wrapped yet much consumed locke haire knew lorenzoes head whereat became confounded amazement fearing least offence might come open publication buried secretly could take notice thereof departed messina went dwell naples isabella cry calling still pot basile vnable giue ouer mourning dyed within dayes thus haue heard hard fare poore lorenzo isabella within long accident came publikely knowne excellent ditty composed thereof beginning thus cruell vnkinde christian robd basiles blisse c beautifull yong virgin named andreana became enamored yong gentleman called gabriello conference together declared dreame another whereupon gabriello fell downe sodainly dead armes shee chambermaide apprehended officer belonging seigneury carrying gabriello lay owne doore potestate offering violence virgin reststing vertuously came vnderstanding father approued innocence daughter compassed deliuerance afterward weary worldly felicity entred religion became nun sixth nouell describing admirable accident fortune mighty preuailing power loue nouell madam philomena graciously related highly pleasing vnto lady oftentimes heard song without knowing made vppon occasion composed king saw tale ended hee commanded pamphilus hee follow due course whereupon spake thus dreame already recounted last nouell doth minister matter make report another tale wherein mention made two seuerall dreames diuined well ensue hapned sooner finished relation party formerly dreampt effect sodainly followed worthy lady sure vnknowne hath bene generall passion men woman liuing see diuers sundry thing sleeping although sleeper seeme certaine awaketh hee iudgeth trueth likelyhood others beyond possibility truth yet notwithstanding many dreames haue bene obserued happen strangely haue come passe hath bene grounded reason men giue great credit thing see sleeping others vsually waking according vnto dreames make construction sadly distasted merrily pleased euen either feare hope contrary wil credit dreame whatsoeuer vntill falne danger formerly saw euidently sleepe meane commend either one alwayes fall true neither time lyars proue true best testifie selues alwayes lyars hath already sufficiently bene manifested discourse madame philomena shall perceiue mine owne next commeth order salute wherefore opinion matter good life performing honest action dreame feared presaging contrary neither good work way hindred likewise matter bad wicked quality although dreames may appeare fauourable v vision flatter v prosperous successe yet let v giue credence vnto best addict mind contrary nature proceed nouell citie brescia liued somtime gentleman named messer negro da ponte cararo among many child daughter called andreana yong beautifull yet vnmarried fortuned shee fell loue neighbour named gabriello comely yong gentleman affable complexion graciously conditioned loue like kindnesse welcommed entertained furtherance chambermaide cunningly carried garden belonging andreanaes father many meeting gabriello solemne vowes mutually passed betweene nothing death could alter affection ceremonious word vsed marriage maried themselues secretly together continued stolne chaste pleasure equall contentment came passe andreana sleeping bed dreamed met gabriello garden embracing louingly together seemed see thing blacke terrible sodainely issued forth body shape therof could comprehend rudely seized vpon gabriello despight vtmost strength incredible force snatched armes sinking earth neuer see one another whereuppon ouercome extremity greefe sorrow presently shee awaked little ioyfull found matter shee feared yet continued doubtfull dreame regard whereof gabriello desirous visite night following laboured diligently hinder comming yet knowing loyall affection toward fearing least grow suspitious matter welcommed garden gathering white damaske rose according nature season length sate downe goodly fountaine stoode midst garden small familiar discourse passing betweene gabriello demanded vpon occasion shee denied comming thither night sodaine vnexpected admonition andreana told regard troublesome dreame wherwith hir soule perplexed precedent night doubt might ensue thereon gabriello hearing began smile affirming especiall note folly giue credit idle dreames oftentimes caused excesse feeding continually obserued meere lie quoth hee superstitious beleefe dreames haue come hither nowe yet much dismayed dreame another mine owne willing acquaint withall thought goodly delightfull forrest noble exercise sportfull hunting became possessed yong hinde verie loueliest pleasing beast euer seene seemed white snow grew short familiar mee meanes would forsake could accept rare kindnesse beast fearing least ill hap might loose put coller gold necke thereof fastned chain gold also held strictly hand hind afterward couched downe mee laying head mildely lap sudden blacke greyhound bitch came rushing v whence could imagine seeming halfe hungerstarued vgly look vpon made full carriere without power resistance putting mouth lefte side bosome griped mainly teeth thought felt heart quite bitten tugged still take wholly away imagined paine anguish felt instantly awaked laying hand vpon side know whether harme befaln finding none smiled mine owne folly making friuolous idle search said like case diuers time haue ill seeming dreames yea much feared yet neuer thing hurtfull followed thereon therefore haue alwaies made lesse account yong maiden still dismayed owne dreame became much afflicted minde shee heard reported gabriello yet giue occasion distast bare best manner could deuise doe albeit spent time much pleasing discourse maintained infinite sweete kiss either side yet still suspitious knew whereof fixing eies oftentimes vpon face throwing strange lookes part garden catch hold blacke vgly sight whereof formerly made description thus continued afflicting feares fortuned gabriello sodainly breathing forth vehement sighe throwing armes fast said helpe deare loue else dye speaking word fell downe vppon ground yong damosell perceiuing drawing lappe weeping saide ala sweete friend paine dost thou feele gabriello answered one word exceeding sweate without ability drawing breath soone gaue vp ghost greeuous strange accident poore andreana loued deerely owne life haue felt loues tormenting affliction easily conceiue relate wringing hand weeping incessantly calling rubbing temple vsing likely meanes reduce life found labour spent vain starke dead indeed euery part body cold ice whereupon wofull extremity knew say garden went weeping infinite feares distraction soule calling chambermaid secret friend stolne meeting told occasion sudden sorow sighed mourned awhile ouer dead body gabriello andreana manner spake maid seeing fortune hath thus bereft loue mine owne life must need hatefull offer violence selfe let v deuise conuenient meanes may preserue mine honor touch scandall conceale secret loue passing betweene v yet honest sort body whose blessed soule hath soone forsaken may honourably enterred whereto mayde thus answered mistresse neuer talke violence self blacke dismall deed haue lost kind company life shall neuer see world immediately sinke downe hell foule place cannot bee receptacle faire soule endued many singular vertues wherefore holde farre better comfort selfe good meanes power feruent prayer fight desperate intruding passion truly vertuous minde ought doe concerning enterrement meanes readily prepared heere garden neuer hath bene seene resorting hither knowne onely selues consent haue let conuey bodye hence leaue apt place may found morrow morning carried owne house friend kindred giue honest buriall andreana although soule extraordinarily sorrowfull teares flowed abundantly eye yet listned attentiuely hir maid counsell allowing first aduice desperation truly good rest thus replied god forbid quoth shold suffer deare louing friend hath alwayes shewed himselfe mee nay much husband sacred solemn vowes passed betweene v put ground basely like dog else left open streete hath sacrifice virgin teares preuaile shall haue kindred haue instantly deuised hard case best done forthwith sent maid chamber diuers elles white damaske lying chest brought spread abroad grasse euen manner winding sheete therein wrapped bodie gabriello faire wrought pillow lying vnder head hauing first teares closed mouth eye placed chaplet flower head couering whole shrowd ouer manner done thus spake maide doore owne house farre hence thither v two may easily carried euen maner haue adorned leauing owne porch may returne back day although sad sight friend yet dyed mine armes well discharged bodie little comfort ended word vttered without infinite teares maid entreated make hast night passed swiftly last remembred ring finger wherewith gabriello solemnly espoused opening shroud againe put finger saying deare louing husband thy soule see teares vnderstanding remaine thy body thus vntimely taken receiue latest guifte thou gauest pledge solemne spotlesse marriage making vp shroud againe conueighing closely garden went along towardes dwelling house thus passed along fortuned met taken guard watch belonging potestate bin late abroad earnest important businesse andreana desiring dead man company thus met withall boldly spake thus know tel selfe offer flight nothing auaile wherefore ready go along seigneurie wil tel truth concerning accident let man among bold lay hand touch yeeld obediently neither take thing body except intend shal accuse respect one daring displease shee went dead bodye seigneurie answere obiections notice heereof giuen potestate arose shee brought foorth hall questioned meanes accident happened beside sent diuers physitians informed whether gentleman poysoned otherwise murthered al affirmed contrary auouching rather impostumation engendred neere heart sodainly breaking occasioned sodaine death potestate hearing perceiuing andreana little nothing faulty matter beauty good carriage kindled villanous lustfull desire towards prouoking immodest motion vpon granting request would release saw perswasions purpose hee sought compasse violence like vertuous valiant virago shee worthily withstood defending honour nobly reproouing many iniurious speech lustfull letcher iustlie deserued morrow morning newes brought father messer negro da ponte cararo greeuing thereat exceedingly accompanied many friend went palace arriued informed matter potestate hee demaunded teares daughter meanes shee brought thither potestate would need accuse first outrage wrong offered rather tarry accusing yet commending yong maiden constancie proceeded say onely proue made motion finding firmly vertuous loue liking addicted hir father pleased forget remembrance former secret husband willingly would accept marriage thus continued talking andreana comming father teares trickling mainly downe cheekes falling feete began manner deare father shall neede make historicall relation either youthfull boldnesse misfortune haue seene knowne rather humblie craue pardon another errour committed without leaue liking accepted man trothplighted husband aboue world intirely affected offence heerein challenge forfeite life good father free pardon onely desire die daughter gracious fauour word signe humility kissed feete messer negro da ponte man well stept yeares milde gentle nature obseruing daughter saide could refraine teares weeping louingly tooke ground speaking thus daughter could haue wished thou hadst taken husbad iudgement bene best fitting thee yet thou didst make election one answerable thine owne good opinion liking haue iust reason therewith offended greatest cause complaint thy seuere concealing slender trust thou didst repose thou hast lost knew neuerthelesse seeing occasion thus come passe accident alreadie ended cannot meanes recalled would gladly haue contented thee making sonne law liued expresse like loue dead turning kindred friend louingly requested would grace gabriello honorable obsequies time kindred friend dead man vppon noise death bruited abroad likewise come pallace yea men woman dwelling citty bodie gabriello beeing laide midst court vpon white damaske shrowde giuen andreana infinite rose sweet flower lying thereon people loue neuer man death bemoaned lamented deliuered court carried buriall like burgesse ordinary citizen pompe beseemed lord baron shoulder noble gentleman especiall honor reuerence within dayes potestate pursuing former motion marriage father mouing daughter wold meanes listen thereto desirous giue contentment deliuered chambermaid religious abbey famous deuotion sanctity afterwardes ended liues faire simonida affecting pasquino walking pleasant garden fortuned pasquino rubbed teeth leafe sage immediately fell downe dead simonida brought bench iustice charged death pasquino rubbed teeth likewise one leaues sage declaring shee saw thereon dyed also manner seauenth nouell whereby giuen vnderstand loue death vse power equally alike well vpon poore meane person rich noble pamphilus hauing ended tale king declaring outward shew compassion regard andreanaes disastrous fortune fixed eye madam emillia gaue apparant signe expressed pleasure next succeeding discourse sufficient vnderstanding thus began faire assembly nouel lately deliuered pamphilus maketh willing report another varying kinde resemblance onely excepted andreana lost louer garden euen shee whome speake brought seate iustice according andreana freed selfe power law yet neither force owne vertue sodaine inopinate death although nature loue according wee haue oftentimes heeretofore maintained make abiding house noblest person yet men woman poore farre inferiour quality alwayes sit reach though enclosed meanest cottage declaring himselfe sometimes powerfull commaunder humble place doth richest imperious palace plainly appeare vnto either great part nouell whereto citie pleadeth title though diuersity discourse talking many seuerall accident haue wandred many part world make answerable owne liking long time since liued city florence young beautifull damosell yet according nature hir condition daughter poore father called name simonida albeit shee supplied better meanes maintaine selfe owne painfull trauell earne bread shee could eate carding spinning employed yet base deiected spirit courage sufficient vertue vnderstand secret solicitings loue distinguish part well deseruing priuate behauiour outward ceremony naturall instinct first tutor thereto wanted second maine vrging motion chip hewed like timber one better birth selfe proper young springall named pasquino whose generous behauiour gracefull action bringing daily wooll spin reason master clothier preuailed vpon liking affection negligent obseruation amorous regard tinder tooke soule flamed selfesame fire making desirous louing acceptance possibly could bee commanding power loue could easily distinguished greater predominance euerie day brought fresh supply woolles found seriously busied hir wheele soule would vent forth many deepe sighes sighes fetch flood teares eye thorough singular good opinion conceyued earnest desire enioy pasquino side leysure gaue leaue least conuersing disease euery way answerable teares stood eye sighes flew abroad ease poore heart afflicting oppression though vnable conceale yet would hee seeme clowd cleanly entreating master worke might nearly performed speed time would permit intermixing infinite praise artificiall spinning affirming withall quilles yearne receiued choisest beauty whole peece workewomen played simonida sure want employment heereupon one soliciting taking delight beeing solicited came passe often accesse bred bolder courage ouermuch bashfulnesse became abandoned yet immodestie passing betweene affection grew better setled interchangeable vowes constant perseuerance death onely disaster else power diuide mutuall delight continuing manner forcible encreasing loues equall flame fortuned pasquino sitting simonida tolde goodly garden whereto hee desirous bring end might safely conuerse together without suspition enuious eye simonida gaue answer wellliking motion acquainting father therewith gaue leaue sunday following dinner go ferch pardon gallo afterwards visit garden modest yong maiden named lagina following profession intimate familiar friend simonida tooke along company came garden appointed pasquino shee found readily expecting comming another friend also called puccino albeit vsually tearmed strambo secret wellwiller lagina whose loue became furthered friendly meeting louer delighting heart chosen mistresse caused walke alone themselues spaciousnesse garden gaue ample liberty puccino lagina one part pasquino simonida another walke made choise long goodly bed sage turning returning bed conference ministred occasion pleased recreate themselues affecting rather continue still part garden one would sit downe sage bed afterward rise walke againe ease wearinesse seemed inuite length pasquino chanced crop leafe sage wherewith rubbed teeth gummes champing betweene also saying better thing world cleanse teeth withall feeding long thus champed sage teeth returning former kinde discoursing countenance began change pale sight failed speech forsooke briefe fell downe dead simonida beheld wringing hand cryed helpe strambo lagina immediately came running finding pasquino onely dead bodie swolne strangely ouerspred foule black spot face handes part else beside strambo cried saying ah wicked maide hast thou poisoned word shrill outcry also heard neighbour dwelling neere garden comming sodainly vppon seeing pasquino lying dead hugely swoln strambo likewise complaining accusing simonida haue poysoned shee making answer standing gastly amazement sens meerely confounded strange vncouth accident loosing whome dearely loued knew excuse selfe therfore euery one verily beleeued strambo vniustly accused poore woful maide thus shee instantly apprehended drowned teares led along potestates palace accusation iustified strambo lagina two men one named atticciato malageuole fellowes companion pasquino came garden also vpon outcry iudge without delay gaue eare busines examined case strictly could meanes comprehend malice appeare towards guiltie man death wherefore pre ence simonida hee desired see dead body place fell downe dead intended haue relate saw accident happen owne speech might sooner condemne whereas case yet remained doubtfull farre beyond comprehension without publication auoid following turbulent multitude departed bench iustice came place pasquinoes body lay swolne like tunne demanding question concerning behauiour walked conference together little admiring manner death hee stood aduisedly considering thereon going bed sage reporting whole precedent history euen original ending better make case vnderstood without least colour ill carriage towardes pasquino according seene euen plucke another leafe sage rubbing teeth therewith champing formerly strambo intimate friend pasquino hauing noted manner vsed sage appearing vtmost refuge either acquit condemne presence iudge smiled thereat mocking deriding whatsoeuer shee saide desiring earnestly sentence death body might consumed fire iust punishment abhominable transgression poore simonida sighing sorrowing deere loues losse perhappes meanly terrified strict infliction torment seuerely vrged followed strambo rest standing dumb still without answering much one word tasting sage fell downe dead bed euen like accident pasquino formerly admirable astonishment present oh poore infortunate louers whose starres inauspicious finish mortall liues feruent loue lesse limitation dayes space censure death happines ensue thereon accident straunge ineuitable within compasse power hope best leaue yet concerning simonida selfe common opinion v remaine liuing true vertue innocency though fortune wise cruell would suffer sinke vnder testimony strambo lagina atticciato malageuole carders wool perhaps meaner condition happier course ordained passe clearly infamous imputation follow pasquino verie manner death speedie expedition iudge standing amazed present companie silent long together vppon better recollection spirit thus spake inconuenience thus hath hapned confounded sens common admiration mine opinion concerneth bed sage auouching either bee venomous dangerously infected neuerthelesse seldom found sage end may offensiue heereafter haue wholly digd vp rootes bee burnt open market place hereupon gardiner presently sent iudge would depart thence saw bed sage digged vp root found true occasion whereby two poore louers lost liues iust middest bed maine roote directed sage growth lay huge mighty toad euen weltring hole full poyson meanes whereof coniecture iudge rest whole bed sage became envenomed occasioning euery leafe thereof deadly taste none hardie approach neere toade made pile wood directly ouer setting flaming fire threw sage therinto consumed together ended suite lawe concerning death pasquino simonida whose body carried church saint paul sad sorrowfull accuser strambo lagina atticciato malageuole buried together one goodlie monument future memory hard fortune ieronimo affecting yong maiden named siluestra constrained earnest importunity mother take iourney paris return home thence againe hee found loue siluestra married secret meanes got entrance house dyed vpon bed lying afterward body carried church receiue buriall likewise died instantly vpon coarse eight nouell wherein againe declared great indiscretion folly think constraine loue according constantly setled instruction concerning vnspeakeable power loue madam emillia sooner concluded nouell madame neiphila king command began speake manner seemeth mee gracious lady people found imagine themselues know else world beside yet indeede doe know nothing presuming thorough arrogant opinion imploy oppose senselesse vnderstanding infallible grounded reason yea attempt course contrary counsell iudgment men also crosse nature diuine ordination saucy ambitious presumption many mighty harmes haue already beginning like ensue vppon boldnesse ground euils regard among naturall thing one lesse subiect take counsell bee wrought contrariety loue whose nature rather run vpon owne rash consumption ruled admonition wisest memory hath inspired self matter incident purpose effectually approue haue already said speake woman would appeare haue wit either indeed appertained title matter also wherein would need shew hir studious iudgement capacity much consequence could deserue meddle withall yet issue fond presuming one instant expelled loue soule owne sonne body doubtlesse planted diuine fauour appointment owne city according true ancient testimony dwelt sometime worthy wealthy merchant named leonardo sighiero wife one onely sonne called ieronimo within short birth leonardo sicke hauing setled al affaire good order departed wretched life better tutor gouernours childe thought fittest let liue mother whole education though schooled among many worthy neighbour child according city vse yong ieronimo growing yeares frequenting dayly company schoolefellowes others hee would often sport rest neighbor much prety pastime found together harmlesse recreation youth grauer iudgements haue often obserued especiall matter receiued original greater effect hath followed thereon many time parent kindred haue bene occasion although perhaps beyond expectation strange extraordinary accident name familiarity passing betweene boyes girles king queene sweet heart sweet heart friend friend husband wife diuers like kind tearmes proouing afterwards true indeede fell yong ieronimo among number pretty damosel daughter men especiall respect others farre inferiour qualitie taylor daughter excelling rest fauour feature albeit father poore ieronimo delighted sport withall title passed betweene euen hearing parent friendes wife husband beginning young affection presaging doubt effectually follow grew familiarity yet way distasted till dayly conuersing together enterchange infinite pretty speech ieronimo felt strange alteration soule enforcing powerfull affliction neuer well company enioyed rest ieronimo absent length noted mother beganne rebuke yea many time gaue threatnings blowes prouing purpose hindering accesse complained tutor like one regard rich thought plant orange vpon blacke thorne spake followeth sonne mine ieronimo yet fourteene year age deeply enamored yong girle named siluestra daughter vnto poore tailor neere dwelling neighbour send company one day perhaps may make wife yet without knowledge questionlesse would death otherwise may pine consume himselfe away see v procure marriage wherefore hold good auoid great inconuenience shold send ieronimo far distance hence remaine factor employed shall sight often meeting vtterly disappointed affection sooner ceasse frustrating hope euer enioying shall haue better meanes match one greater quality tutor like well aduice doubting would take answerable effect therefore calling ieronimo priuate parlor one began manner ieronimo growne indifferent stature almost able take gouernment selfe cannot seeme way inconuenient acquaint deceased father affaire good course came wealth onely sonne heire hee hath bequeathed rich possession mother moity euermore remembred trauaile would seeme fitting well experience traffick merchandize also let see world occurrence mother therfore haue thought expedient iourney hence paris continue fitting time may grant full free opportunity suruey stocke wealth employed make vnderstand factor furtherous affayres beside way make man solid apprehension perfect instruction ciuill course life rather continuing see none lord baron gentleman whereof wee haue great number sufficiently qualified haue learned belongeth worthy marchant leonardo sighiero famous father may returne home againe owne pleasure youth gaue attentiue hearing word returned answer would giue way trauaile hee knew dispose himselfe florence well place sent tutor heard reproued many seuere speech seeing could win answer made returne thereof mother shee storming extreamly thereat yet much denying iourney paris regard violent affection maide gaue bitter harsh language auailing nothing began speake milde gentle straine entreating flattering affable word gouerned case tutor good aduise farre end preuailed yeelded liue paris space yeare time would graunt ended ieronimo gone remain paris loue daily increasing reason absence siluestra vnder faire friendly promise moneth next moneth sending home detained two whole yeares together whereuppon loue growne extremity neither would could abide longer home hee returned hee expected loue siluestra cunning compacting mother tutor found married tentmaker sonne whereat hee vexed greeued beyond measure neuerthelesse seeing case way bee holpen hee stroue beare much patience great wrong heart tormenting greefe would giue leaue doe hauing found place dwelt hee began custome yong louers vse diuers daily walkes door thinking minde remembrance constantly continued intirely fixed case verie strangely altred growne mindfull neuer seene way remember appeared little manifest signes declared contrary ieronimo quickely perceiued albeit without many melanchollie perturbation notwithstanding laboured possible meanes recouer former kindnesse againe finding paine friuouslie employed resolued dye yet compasse speech meanes neere dwelling neighbour verie deare intimate friend came acquainted euery part house preuailed far one euening husband supt neighbour house compassed accesse bed chamber siluestra vsed lodge finding curtaines ready drawne hid himselfe behinde side bed tarried vntlll siluestra husband returned home laide downe bedde take rest husband sences soone ouercome sleepe reason painefull toyling day body exercised much labour desirous haue ease staying vp last put light hearing husband sleepe soundly snoring gaue good euidence thereof layed selfe respectiuely loath way disease sweetly let enioy rest siluestra lay side bed ieronimo hid himselfe behinde curtaines stepping softly darke laying hand gently brest saide deare loue forbeare little sleepe heere thy loyall friend ieronimo yong woman starting amazement would haue cried hee entreated contrary protesting came ill intent onely take latest leaue ala ieronimo quoth idle dayes past gone way vnseemly youth entertaine equality desire well agreed young blood since haue liued forraine country appeared alter former disposition space two whole yeares either grew forgetfull change ayre may change affection best made account mee neuer heard least salutation know married wife regard whereof thought haue embraced chaste honourable resolution minde man husband therefore come hither without loue license like manner desire gone let priuiledge husbandes sound sleeping colour longer continuing heere encourage finde fauour mine hand mine husband shold awake beside danger thereon may follow cannot loose sweet happinesse peacefull life hitherto haue mutually embraced yong man hearing wordes remembring louing kindnesse formerly found secret loue letter hee sent paris priuate intelligence token neuer came receite knowledge cunningly mother tutor carried matter immediately felt heart string break lying downe vpon bed side vttered last word siluestra farewell thou hast kilde kindest heart euer loued woman speaking gaue vp ghost hearing word deliuered entire sighe deepefetcht groane imagine strange consequence following thereon yet mooued much compassion regard former affection silent shee lay indifferent vnable returne answer looking would gone according earnestly entreated perceyued lye still neither word motion came saide kinde ieronimo doest thou depart get thee gone putting forth hand hapned light vpon face felt cold yce whereat maruelling little also continued silence shee iogged felt hand like manner stiffely extended forth body cold hauing life remaining greatly amazing confounding sorow beyond measure shee perplexity could deuise say end resolued try husband would take strange accident thus happen house putting case concerne neighbour awaking first demaunded best bee done man steale neighbour house vnknowne family bed chamber found dead presently replyed thinking case concerned himselfe onely helpe vnexpected extremity take dead body conuey owne house whereby scandall reproach would followe whose house vnfortunately dyed heereupon shee immediately arose lighting candle shewed dead bodie ieronimo protestation euery particular innocencie either knowledge comming thither blame could concerne hee instantly knowing beleeuing made ceremonie putting garment tooke dead bodie vpon shoulder carried mother doore left afterward returned owne house againe day light come dead body found lying porch moued much greefe amazement considering bin seene day perfect health outward appearance neede vrge question mother sorrow vpon straunge accident causing body bee carefully searched without blow bruise wound hurt vppon physitians could giue opinion inward conceyte greefe caused death indeed way otherwise cheefe church dead body carried generally seene people mother friend weeping heauily many like beside beloued euery one time vniuersall mourning honest man whose house dyed spake thus wife disguise thy selfe decent manner go church heare haue laide body ieronimo crowde amongest woman doe like amongst men heare opinion passeth death whether wee shall bee scandalized thereby siluestra become full pitty late quickely condiscended desiring see dead sometime dearly affected life come church matter bee admired aduisedly consider powerfull working loue heart woman prosperous fortune ieronimo could pierce wofull death split sunder ancient spark loue long concealed ember brake foorth furious flame violently surprized hapned house precedent night according wife truly related speech past siluestra ieronimo discourse generally conceiued certaine occasion sodaine death moued great compassion taking yong woman body nouell whereby appeareth ill successe attendeth loue contrarie reason offering iniurie friendship marriage together nouell madam neiphila ended occasioned much compassion whole assembly king wold infringe priuiledge graunted dioneus remaining speake two began thus call minde gentle lady nouell seeing farre entred lamentable accident successelesse loue vrge vnto much commisseration lately reported much rather person speake respectiue quality approueth accident bee cruell whereof wee haue formerly discoursed according people prouence report dwelt sometime iurisdiction two noble knight well possessed castle follower one beeing named messer guiglielmo de rossiglione messer guiglielmo guardastagno regard wer valiant gentleman singularly expert action armes loued together mutually held kinde custom seene tiltes tournament exercise armes going commonly alike wearing garment although castle stood fiue mile distant yet dayly conuersant together louing intimate friend one meane messer guiglielmo de rossiglione wife gallant beautifull lady messer guardastagno forgetting lawes respect loyall friendshippe became ouerfondly enamoured expressing outward meanes lady selfe tooke knowledge thereof dislike seemed rather louingly entertained yet grew forgetfull honour estimation faith friend indiscretion idle loue carried whether sorted effect know husband receiued maner behauiour hee could easily digest thought fitting endure whereuppon league friendly amity long continued began faile strange fashion became conuerted deadly hatred yet hee cunningly concealed bearing outwarde shew constant friendshippe still heart hee vowed death guardastagno nothing wanted meanes might best effected fell bee manner publicke lust tourney proclaimed sound trumpet throughout france wherewith immediately messer guiglielmo rossiglione acquainted messer guardastagno entreating might conferre theron together purpose come visit intended haue hand businesse guardastagno exceeding gladde accident gaue liberty see mistresse sent answer backe messenger morrow night would come sup rossiglione vpon reply proiected himselfe maner kill morrow dinner arming himselfe two seruants solemnly sworne secrecy hee mounted horseback rode mile owne castle lay closely ambushed wood guardastagno must need passe stayed two houres space espyed come riding two attendant vnarmed way distrusting intended treason soone come place resolued deed hee rushed forth ambush hauing sharpe lance readily charged rest ran mainly saying false villaine thou art dead guardastagno hauing nothing wherewith defend himselfe seruants able giue succour pierced quite body lance downe hee fell dead ground men fearing like misfortune befall gallopped mainely backe againe lord castle knowing thus murthered master reason armed disguise martiall time vsually worne messer guiglielmo rossiglione alighting horse hauing keene knife ready drawne hand opened therewith brest dead guardastagno taking foorth heart owne hand wrapped banderole belonging lance commanding one men charge thereof neuer disclose deed mounting horsebacke againe darke night drawing apace returned home castle lady heard guardastagnoes intent suppe night perhaps earnestly desirous see meruailing long tarrying saide husband beleeue sir quoth thinkes somewhat strange messer guiglielmo guardastagno delayes comming long neuer vsed til receiued tidings wife said cannot heere till morrow whereat lady appearing bee displeased concealed selfe vsed word rossiglione leauing lady went kitchin calling cooke deliuered heart saying take heart wilde boare good happe kill day dresse daintiest manner thou canst deuise doe done set table send siluer dish sauce beseeming dainty morsell cooke tooke heart beleeuing otherwise lord saide vsing vtmost skill dressing diuide artificiall small slice made pleasing tasted supper time come rossiglione sate downe table lady hee little appetite eate wicked deed done perplexed soule made sit strangely musing length cook brought dainty dish himselfe setting wife began finde fault lack stomack yet prouoked many faire speech tast cook cunning rare dish lady hauing good appetite indeede first tasted fed afterward heartily thereon shee left little none remaining perceyued eaten said vnto tel madam like delicate kinde meat good faith sir quoth life neuer better pleased trust mee madam answered knight doe verily beleeue greatly wonder thereat like dead loued dearly aliue heard word long sate silent afterward saide pray tell mee sir meate haue made eate muse longer said therein quickly resolue thee thou hast eaten heart messer guiglielmo guardastagno whose loue deare precious thee thou false perfidious disloyall lady pluckt vile body mine owne hand made cooke dresse thy diet poor lady strangely soule afflicted hearing harsh vnpleasing speech teares flowed aboundantly faire eies like tempestuous windes embowelled earth vehement sighes breake mainly heart tedious time silence spake manner lord husband haue done disloyall damnable deede misguided owne wicked iealous opinion iust cause giuen murther worthie noble gentleman protest vnto vppon soule wish bee confounded eternall perdition euer vnchaste bedde allowed fauour might well become honourable friend seeing bodie hath bene made receptacle precious kinde foode heart valiant courteous knight noble guardastagno neuer shall foode heereafter haue entertainment selfe liue wife bloody husband starting vppe table stepping vnto great gazing windowe casement whereof standing wide open behinde violently shee leaped thereat beeing huge heighth distance ground fall onely kill also shiuered bodie many peeces rossiglione perceyuing hee stoode like bodie without soule confounded killing deare friend losse chaste honourable wife owne ounrcredulous conceit vppon conference priuate thoughtes remorsefull acknowledgement heinous offence repentance late gaue eye see though rashnesse would permit consider two extreamities inlarged dulled vnderstanding first grew fearfull friend follower murdered guardastagno also whole countrey prouence regarde people generall loue vnto two maine important motiues detestation horrid acte immediate seuere reuenge succeed thereon hee made prouision best hee could sodaine warning would giue leaue hee fled away secretly night season vnpleasing newes soone spread abroad next morning vnfortunate accident also rossiglions flight regard wherof dead bodyes found brought together well people belonging guardastagno attended lady layed chappell rossigliones castell chambermaide physitians wife going bench iustice accuseth selfe putting imagined dead body chest meanes escapeth hanging theeues stole away chest condemned pay great summe money tenth nouell wherein declared sometime aduenturous accident rather anie reasonable comprehension man may escape manifold perilles especially occurrence loue king concluded nouell remained none dioneus tell last himselfe confessing king commaunding proceede beganne manner many misery vnfortunate loue haue alreadie related hath onely swolne eye weeping also made sicke heart sighing yea gracious lady selfe finde spirit meanly afflicted thereby wherefore whole day hath bene irkesome little glad neere ending better shutting vp altogether would loath make addition sad mournfull matter good nothing onely feede melancholly humor hope faire starres defend tragical discourse thou art fit companion therefore report nouell may minister iouiall kinde argument vnto tale must bee told morrow expiration present king reigne rid v heartgreeuing heereafter know gracious assembly many yeares since liued salerne verie famous physitian named signieur mazzeo della montagna already well entred year would neuerthelesse marrie beautifull young mayden cittie bestowing rich garment gaudie attyres ringes iewelles woman else could way equall hee loued deerely yet aged man neuer remembering vaine idle thing age make vnfitting election iniurious therefore endangering domesticke agreement ought bee sole maine comfort marriage maketh mee therefore misdoubt former tale signiour ricciardo de cinzica dayes calender heere seeme distastefull occasioned woman discontentment vnequall choyses parent commonly blamewoorthie imputation bee layde young woman gladdely would enioy heart haue elected parent looking thorough glass greedie lucre doe ouerthrow owne hope faire fortune child together yet speake vprightly young married wife declared selfe wise chearefull spirit discoraged inequalitie marriage bearing contented browe feare vrging least mislike husband hee side occasion call visite pacients present colledge among fellowdoctours would alwayes bee chearing comforting wife one could hardly affoord bee company one especiall fatall misfortune commonly awaiteth olde men marriage freezing december match flouring may greene desire appeare age beyond possibility performance wanting good store wanton gallant hating see beauty manner betrayed embrace loathed bed make folly seene publike appearance dayly proffer amorous seruices seeming compassionate woman disaster vsually cause iealous suspitions heinous houshold discontentment among diuers faine would bee nibling bayte beautie one named ruggiero de ieroly honourable parentage yet deboshed disordered life neither kindred friend willing take knowledge vtterly gaue ouer dissolute course thoroughout salerne condition caused generall contempt hee accounted better euen theeuing lewde companion doctours wife chambermaide attending notwithstanding vgly deformity ruggiero regarding person imperfection hee compleate wellfeatured youth bestowed affection entirely oftentimes supplie want owne best meanes ruggiero hauing benefite maides kinde loue made hopefull mounting ladder whereby deriue good liking mistresse presuming rather outward comely part anie honest quality might commend mistresse knowing choyse maide made vnable perswasions remooue tooke knowledge ruggieroes priuat resorting hir house meere loue maide many especiall deseruings oftentimes would kinde manner rebuke aduise setled course life counsell might take better effect graced liberall gift one gold others siluer often garment comelier accesse thether bounty like lewde mistaker interpreted assurance affection graceful eye man else could continuance proceeding came passe master doctor mazzeo onely expert physitian likewise skilfull chirurgerie beside hadde pacient cure great misfortune one legges broken piece weaker iudgement hauing formerly dealt withall bone sinewes become fowly putrified tolde party friend legge must bee quite cut else pacient must needes dye yet intended order matter perrill proceede preiudice part bodie case beeing thus resolued pacient friend day time appointed deede done doctor conceyuing except patient sleepily entranced hee could anie meanes endure paine must needes hinder meant distillation hee made artificiall water pacient hath receyued procure kinde dead sleepe endure long space necessity requireth vse thereof full performance worke made sleepy water put glasse wherewith filled almost vp brimme till time came hee vse hee set owne chamberwindowe neuer acquainting one purpose prouided water reason setting drew towards euening returned home pacients messenger brought letter malfy concerning great conflict hapning two noble family wherein diuers dangerously wounded either side without speedy repairing thither would proue losse many liues heereupon cure man leg must need bee prolonged vntill returned backe againe regard manie wounded person worthy friend liberall bountie expected made presently go aboord smal barke forthwith set away towards malfy absence master doctor mazzeo gaue opportunity aduenturous ruggiero visite house gone hope get crownes courtesie mistresse vnder formall colour courting maide closely admitted house diuers neighbour conference mistresse helde pleasing discourse required longer time expected maide roome conceale ruggiero onely bed chamber master lockt none houshold people descry stayed attending mistris till guest tooke leaue gone ruggiero thus remayning alone chamber space three long houres visited neither maide mistris awaited bee set liberty whether feeding salt meat coming thither customary vse drinking maketh men vnable long abstain neuer satisfied excesse two extreams know drink need hee must hauing meanes quenching thirst espied glasse water standing window thinking soueraigne kinde water reserued doctor owne drinking make lusty old year tooke glasse finding water pleasing pallate dranke euery drop sitting downe coffer bed side soone hee fell sound sleepe according powerfull working water sooner neighbour gone maide libertie mistresse vnlocking doore chamber went finding ruggiero sitting fast asleepe began hunch punche entreating softly awake purpose hee neither mooued answered one word whereat patience som prouoked punched rudely angerly said awake shame thou drowsie dullard thou desirous sleeping get thee home thine owne lodging thou art allowed sleep heere ruggiero thus rudely punched fell coffer flat ground appearing respect hee dead body whereat maide fearfully amazed plucking nose yong beard else could deuise yet labour prouing still vaine almost beside wit stamping rauing roome sence reason forsaken violent extreame distraction vpon hearing noise mistris came sodainely chamber affrighted strange accident suspecting ruggiero dead indeed pinched strongly burnt finger candle yet fruitlesse sitting downe began consider aduisedly selfe much honour reputation would endangered heereby husband vulgar opinion come publique notice quoth maide thy fond loue vnruly fellow sway censure monster multitude beleeuing accesse hither onely thee good name honest repute yet vntoucht least taxation rackt tenter infamous iudgement though neuer cleare branded generall condemnation wisedome therefore make noise silence consider selues cleare house dead body helpfull witty deuice shall bee found morning heere may passe without suspition world rash opinion way touch v weeping lamenting laid aside hope liues restoring onely rid body house requires care cunning whereupon maide thus beganne mistresse quoth euening although late next neighbour doore know ioyner trade saw great chest stand seemeth publike sale two three nightes together hath bene thence remooued owner haue lockt inuention else cannot furnish v like help therein lay body whereon bestow two three wound knife leauing house suspected concerning heere streete beside nay rather farre lesse regard husband credit authority moreouer heereof certaine bad disordered quality likely imagined slaine loose companion pilfering busines afterward hid body chest standing fitly purpose darke night also fauouring deed maid counsell past vnder seale allowance mistris thought conuenient hauing affected deerely shee mangle body wound rather let gathered likelyhood villaines strangled conueied body chest away sends maide see whether chest stood still indeede vnlockt wherof little ioyfull helpe mistresse maide tooke ruggiero vpon shoulder bringing doore dillidilegent respect one could discouer chest laide left closing downe lidde according found street farre ioyner dwelt two yong men lombard liuing vppon interest moneyes coueting get much spend little hauing obserued chest stood wanting necessary mooueable houshold yet loath lay mony buying complotted together night steale thence carry home house accordingly finding somewhat heauy therefore imagining matter woorth contained therein chamber wiues lay left without search till next morning laid rest likewise ruggiero slept long drinke digested vertue thereof fully consummated began awake day although naturall sleep broken sences recouerd former power yet notwithstanding remained astonishment braine onely afflict day following also diuers dayes night afterward hauing eies wide open yet discerning thing stretched forth armes euery finding himselfe enclosed chest grew broad awake said himselfe wake sleepe full well remember long since sweetheart chamber thinkes mewed vp chest shold thinke heereof master doctor returned home hathsome inconuenience hapned whereby finding asleepe enforced hide thus surely otherwise cannot bee wherefore best mee lye still listen heare talking chamber continuing thus longer otherwise hee would haue done lying bare chest somwhat vneasie painfull turning diuers time one side often coueting still ease yet could find length thrust backe strongly chest side standing vneuen ground began totter fell downe fall made loud noise woman lying bed standing awaked ouercome feare power speake one word ruggiero also affrighted chest fall perceiuing meanes become open thought better least sinister fortune befall open liberty inclosed vp strictly knew also hoping meet mistresse went groping dark finde either staires doore whereby get forth woman awake heard trampling also iustling doores windowes demaunded ruggiero knowing voyces made answer wherefore called husband lay verie soundly sleeping reason late walking abroad therefore heard noise house made woman much timorous therefore rising beddes opened casement towards streete cry aloude theeues theeues neighbour arose vpon outcry running vp downe place place engirting house others entering mean troublesome noise two lombard awaked seizing vppon poore ruggiero wellneere affrighted wittes strange accident owne ignorance happened thither escape stood gazing without answer time sergeant officer city ordinarily attending magistrate beeing raised tumult vproare come house poore ruggiero committed vnto charge bringing gouernor forthwith called question known wicked life shame al friend kindred could say little himselfe neuer denying taking house therefore desiring finish fortune together desperately confessed came fellonious intent rob gouernor gaue sentence hanged soone newes spread throughout salerne ruggiero apprehended robbing house two vsuring lombardes mistresse doctor chambermaide heard confounded straunge admiration scarsely credited themselues done night rather imagined matter past meerely dreame concerning ruggieroes dying house putting chest likely possible meanes hee could bee man perillous extreamitie short master doctor mazzco returned malfy proceede cure poore man legge calling glasse water left standing owne chamber window found quite empty drop whereat hee raged extreamly neuer like impatience beene noted wife maide another kinde businesse braine dead man strangely come life againe knewe well say last wife thus replyed somewhat angerly sir quoth coyle heere paltry glasse water perhaps hath bene spilt yet neyther v faulty therein water world ala deere wife saide hee might repute common kinde water indeede purposely compound onely procure deadseeming sleepe related whole matter large pacients legge water losse heard word husband presently conceiued water drunke ruggiero sleepily entranced sences verily thought bee dead wherefore saide beleeue sir neuer acquainted v matter would haue procured carefull respect seeing gon skill extendeth make remedy thus master doctor wife conferring together maide went speedily citie vnderstand truly whither condemned man ruggiero would become beeing returned home againe
