alone mistresse chamber thus spake trust mistresse one citie speaketh well ruggiero man condemned dye ought perceiue hath neither kinsman friend wil doe thing left prouost must executed morrow morning moreouer mistresse instruction haue receiued wellneere informe meanes hee came two lombard house true haue heard know loyner whose doore chest stoode wherein put ruggiero contention betweene another man seemeth chest doth belong regard wherof readie quarrell extremly one owing chest trusting ioyner sell would haue pay chest ioyner denieth sale thereof auouching last night stolne doore man contrarying maintaineth solde chest two lombard vsurers able affirme found house present apprehension ruggiero sawe house heereupon ioyner gaue lye neuer sold man robd hee would make manifest face falling calmer speech went together lombardes house euen returned home wherefore mistresse may easily perceiue ruggiero questionlesse carried thither chest found reuiued againe cannot comprehend mistresse vnderstanding apparantly full effect whole businesse manner bene carried reuealed maide husband speech concerning glasse sleepie water onely engine trouble clearly acquitting ruggiero robbery howsoeuer desperate fury make end life contemptible wrongfully accused himselfe notwithstanding hard fortune hath made much infamous dissolute behauiour life yet coulde quaile affection towards loath dye man offence hoping future reformation fell knee mistresse drowned teares earnestly entreated aduise happy course might bee safety poore ruggieroes life mistresse doctor affecting maide dearely plainly perceiuing disastrous fortune whatsoeuer could alter loue condemned ruggiero hoping best heereafter maide selfe willing saue life rather suffer lost without iust cause directed discreet maner better conceyue successe according instructed hir mistris shee fell feete master doctor desiring pardon great error whereby shee ouermuch offended said master doctor manner quoth maid thus proceeded ignorant sir le liuer ruggiero de ieroly notwithstanding imperfection dearely loue hee protesteth like thus hath loue continued yeare beeing gone malfy abse granting apt opportunity conference kinde friend made bolder gaue entrance house yea euen mine owne chamber yet free abuse neyther hee bad though offer thirsty coming thether either salt meat distempered diet vnable fetch wine water reason mistresse sate hall seriouslie talking sister remembred saw viall water standing chamber windowe hee drinking quite set emptie place againe haue heard discontentment said water confesse fault therein liueth iustly without offending one time heartily sory transgression yet much water hard fortune hath followd theron thereby ruggiero danger lose life hope vtterly lost let entreat therefore gentle master first pardon grant permission succour poore condemned friend best meanes deuise doctor heard discourse angry though yet thus answered smile much better bin thy folly punishment falne thy selfe might haue paide thee deserued repentance vpon thy mistress finding thee sleeping go get deliuerance thou canst caution euer heereafter seene house peril thereof shall light thy selfe receyuing answer first entrance attempt mistris aduised hast shee went prison shee preuailed well iaylor hee granted priuate conference ruggiero hauing instructed say prouost purpose escape life went thither prouost admitting presence knowing shee master doctor maid man especially respected citie willing heare message imagining shee sent master sir quoth shee haue apprehended ruggiero de ieroly theefe iudgement death heare pronounced hee wrongfully accused clearly innocent heinous detection entering history declared euery circumstance originall end relating truly louer shee brought master house dranke compounded sleepy water reputed dead laide chest afterward rehearsed speech betweene ioyner laide claime chest giuing vnderstand thereby ruggiero taken lombard house prouost presently gathering truth case easy knowne sent first master doctor mazzeo know whether hee compounded water affirmed bee true vpon occasion prepared ioyner owner chest two lombard seuerally questioned withall appeared euidently lombard steale chest night season carried home owne house end ruggiero brought prison demanded hee lodged night made answer knew well remembred bearing affection chambermaide master doctor mazzea della montagna brought chamber violl water stoode window extreamly thirsty dranke became afterward till awake hee found himselfe enclosed chest house two lombard could say thing prouost heard answer caused repeate ouer diuers time regard pleasing cleared ruggiero crime imposed condemned lombard three hundred ducates bee giuen ruggiero way amends enable marriage doctor mayde whose constancie much commended wrought miracle penitent ruggiero marriage graced great honourable pompe regained intimate loue kindred liued noble condition euen neuer beene disordered man former nouels made lady sad sighe last dioneus much delighted restoring former iocond humor banishing tragicall discourse euer king perceyuing sun neere setting gouernment neere ending many kinde courteous speech excused himselfe lady motiue argument expressed infelicity poore louers hauing finished excuse vp arose taking crowne lawrell owne head lady awaiting whose head pleased next set proued gracious lady fiammetta thus hee spake heere place crowne head knoweth better comfort fayre assembly morrow sorow haue day endured madame fiammetta whose locke haire curled long like golden wiers hanging somwhat downe ouer white delicate shoulder visage round wherein damaske rose lilly contende priority eye head resembling faulcon senger dainty mouth lippes looking like two little rubyes commendable smile thus replyed philostratus gladly accept gift end ye may better remember selfe concerning haue done hitherto commaund generall preparation bee made morrow faire happy fortune hapning louers former cruell vnkinde accident proposition pleasing calling master housholde taking order needfull done shee gaue leaue vnto whole company risen go recreate themselues vntil supper time walked garden beauty whereof banished least thought wearinesse others walked riuer mill farre rest fel exercise fitting fancy vntill heard summons supper hard goodly fountaine according wonted manner supped altogether serued mean contentment risen table fell delight singing dancing philomena led dance queene spake manner philostratus intend varie course heeretofore obserued predecessor euen haue already done authority command song well assured vnfurnished song answerable quality passed nouels desire regard would troubled heereafter discourse vnfortunate loue shall sing song agreeing owne disposition philostratus made answer readie accomplish command without ceremony thus began song chorus teares plainly proue iustly poore heart hath cause greeue vnder trust findes treason loue first saw make sigh distrust neuer enter thought many vertues clearly shind esteemd martyrdome light loue could lay greeue although found liberty lost mine error plainly see without sorrow thus betrayd bee teares c left basest treachery reposed trust could see apparant flatterie fairest shewes make stroue get forth snare found selfe plunged beheld another place cast manifest disgrace teares c felt heart hel heauy woe vtterable curst day houre first saw louely countenance enricht beautie farre beyond set soule fire enflamde part making martyrdome poore hart faith hope basely thus betrayde durst mooue speake affrayde teares c thou canst thou powerfull god loue perceiue ceasselesse sorow voide comfort make moane thee fable desiring end misery death may come speedily dart one fierce stroke quite passing hart cut future fell contending strife happy end made loue life teares c meanes comfort doth remaine ease sharpe affliction death grant may die finish greefe life one blest houre bereft future ioyes come take quickly false friend yet death let thy great power approue died true constant loue teares c happy shall account sighing song beside selfe doe learne sing consider misery may incite lament wrong warned wretched fate least like selfe themselues sigh late learne louers learne ti vniust betrayed repose best trust word contained song manifestly declare torturing affliction poore philostratus felt perhaps beene perceiued lookes lady spake present dance sodaine ensuing darknesse hid crimson blush mounted vp face song ended diuers beside lasting till houre rest drew command queene repaired chamber end fourth day fift day whereon discourse passe vnder gouernement noble lady fiammetta concerning person haue bene successefull loue many hard perillous misfortune induction began sunne dart foorth golden beames madam fiammetta incited sweete singing birdes since breake day sat merrily chanting tree arose bed lady likewise three young gentleman descending downe field walked gentle pace greene grasse vntill sunne risen little higher many pleasant matter conferred together walked seuerall company til length queene finding heate enlarge selfe strongly returned backe castle arriued shee commanded morning walking stomackes bee refreshed wholsome wine also diuers sort banquetting stuffe afterward repaired garden departing thence vntill houre dinner come time master houshold hauing prepared euery thing decent readinesse solemn song sung order queene seated table dined owne liking contentment began continuation former order exercise diuers dance afterward voyces instrument many pretty madrigal roundelayes vppon finishing delight queene gaue leaue take rest minded went sleep others solaced themselues garden midday ouerpast met according wonted manner queene commanded faire fountaine placed seate royall casting eye vpon pamphilus shee bad begin dayes discourse happy successe loue disastrous troublesom accident yeelding thereto humble reuerence thus began many nouels gracious lady offer themselues memory wherewith beginne pleasant day highnesse desire among plenty esteeme one aboue rest may comprehend thereby onely fortunate conclusion wherewith intend begin day also mighty force loue deseruing bee admired reuerenced albeit many scarsely knowing say condemne infinite grosse imputation purpose disproue hope little pleasing chynon falling loue became wise force armes winning faire lady iphigenia sea afterward imprisoned rhodes deliuered one named lysimachus recouered iphigenia againe faire cassandra euen middest mariage fled candye married called home owne dwelling first nouell wherein approued loue oftentimes maketh man wise valiant according ancient annales cypriot sometime liued cyprus noble gentleman commonly called aristippus exceeded countrey good fortune diuers child amongst rest sonne whose birth infortunate rest continually greeued regard hauing compleate perfection beauty good forme manly part surpassing youth age stature yet hee wanted reall ornament soule reason iudgement indeed meere ideot foole better hope expected true name according receyued baptisme galesus neyther laborious paine tutor indulgence faire endeuour parent ingenuity could bee brought ciuility life vnderstanding letter common cariage reasonable creature grosse deformed kinde speech quality also sauouring rather brutish breeding way deriued manly education epithite scorne derision generally gaue name chynon natiue countrey language diuers beside signifieth sot foole termed euery one lost kinde life meane burthen greefe vnto noble father hope already spent future happy recouery gaue command would alwayes haue sorrow sight liue farme owne country village among peazants ploughswaines way distastefull chynon well agreed owne naturall disposition rurall quality grosse behauiour pleased beyond city ciuility chynon liuing thus father countrey village exercising nothing else rurall demeanour delighted aboue chanced vpon day houre noone hee walking ouer field long staffe necke commonly vsed carry entred small thicket reputed goodliest quarter reason month may tree leaues fairely shot forth walked thorow thicket came passe euen good fortune guided came faire meadow euerie side engirt tree one corner thereof stoode goodly fountaine whose current coole cleare harde vppon greene grasse espied beautifull yong damosell seeming bee fast asleepe attired fine loose garment hidde verie little white body onely girdle downward shee ware kirtle made close vnto interwouen delicate silke feete lay two damosel sleeping seruant manner sooner hadde chynon fixed eie vpon stood leaning vppon staffe viewed aduisedly without speaking word mean admiration neuer seene forme woman began feele harsh rurall vnderstanding whereinto neuer till either painfull instruction good meanes vsed honest ciuility power impression strange kinde humour awake informed grosse dull spirite damosell fairest euer liuing man beheld began distinguish part commending tress hir haire imagined gold forehead nose mouth neck armes aboue brest appearing yet onely shewe theselues like two little mountainets fielden clownish lout would need become iudge beauty coueting earnestly soule see eye veiled ouer sound sleepe kept fast enclosed together onely looke hee wished thousand time would awake iudgement excelled woman euer seene doubted whether goddesse strangely metamorphosed folly sensible apprehension common far sodaine knowledge extend could conceiue diuine celestiall thing admired reuerenced humane terrene consideration wherefore gladly contented himselfe tarry til awaked owne accord althogh time stay seemed tedious yet notwithstanding ouercome extraordinary contentment hee power depart thence stood bin glued fast ground indifferent respite time chanced young damosel named iphigenia awaked lifting vp head eye wide open shee saw chynon standing leaning stil staffe whereat meruailing little saide vnto chynon whither wanderest thou dost thou seeke wood chynon onely countenance likewise folly nobility birth wealthy possession father generally knowne throughout countrey made answere demand iphigenia soone beheld eies open began obserue constant regard perswaded soule flowed vnvtterable singularity neuer felt til yong gentlewoman well noting began wax fearfull least stedfast lookes incite rusticity attempt might redound dishonour wherefore awaking woman seruant risen saide farewell chynon leaue thee thine owne good fortune whereto hee presently replyed saying go although gentlewoman refused company dreading acte inciuility yet could deuise way rid til brought owne dwelling taking leaue mannerly hee went directly home father house saying nothing compel liue longer muddy countrey albeit father much offended heereat rest kindred frends yet knowing helpe suffered continue still expecting cause sodaine alteration course life contented highly chynon wounded heart neuer ciuil instruction could get entrance loues piercing dart bright beauty iphigenia mooued much admiration falling one change another father kindred else knew first requested father might habited respected like brother whereto right gladly condiscended frequenting company ciuill youth obseruing also cariage gentleman especially amorously enclined grew beginning short time wonder euery one onely vnderstande first instruction letter also became skilfull euen amongest best exercised philosophie afterward loue iphigenia sole occasion happy alteration harsh clownish voyce conuert selfe mildely also hee became singular musitian could perfectly play instrument beside tooke delight riding managing great horse finding himselfe strong able body exercised kind military discipline wel sea land breefe would seeme tedious repetition al vertues scarsly attained fourth yeare thus falne loue hee became generally knowne bee ciuil wise worthy gentleman aswell vertues enriching minde whatsoeuer beautifie body hardly could equalled throughout whole kingdome cyprus shall say vertuous lady concerning chynon surely nothing else high diuine vertues infused gentle soule enuious fortune bound shut vppe small angle intellect shaken set liberty loue hauing farre potent power fortune quickning reuiuing dull drowsie spirit declared mighty soueraigne authority setting free many faire precious vertues vniustly detayned let world eye behold truly manifest testimony fro whence deliuer spirit subiected power guide afterward highest degree honor although chynon affecting iphigenia failed particular thing yet notwithstanding father aristippus duely considering loue made man whereas better beast endured patiently also aduised therein take course best liked himselfe neuerthelesse chynon refused called galesus naturall name indeede remembring iphigenia tearmed chynon coueting vnder title accomplish issue honest amorous desire made many motion ciphaeus father iphigenia would pleased let enioy marriage ciphaeus told already passed promise gentleman rhodes named pasimondo promise religiously intended performe time come concluded iphigeniaes marriage regard affianced husband sent chynon thus communed owne thought time quoth let diuine mistresse see truly honourably doe affect become man could bee possessed growe glorious common condition mortall man haue loose life aduenture beeing thus resolued preuailed diuers young gentleman friend making faction secretly prepared shippe furnished thing nauall fight setting sodainly forth sea hulling abroad part vessell passe must conuey iphigenia rhodes husband many honor done wer transport thence vnto rhodes imbarked set saile vppon bon viaggio chynon slept businesse earnestly importing set day following ship standing aloft decke cried charge iphigenia saying strike sayles else determine sunke sea enemy chynon nothing danted word prepared stand vpon defence made chynon former speech deliuered answer returned commaund grapling iron bee cast forth tooke fast hold rhodians shippe whether would vessel ioyned close together hee shewing himselfe fierce like lyon tarrying seconded stepped aboord rhodians ship made respect hauing sword ready drawne hand incited vertue vnfaigned loue sayed side manfully men rhodes perceyued casting downe weapon one voice yeelded themselues prisoner whereupon said honest friend neither desire booty hatred occasion departure cyprus thus assaile drawne weapon heereto hath mooued matter highly importing easie graunt enioy present peace desire haue faire iphigenia loue aboue lady liuing could obtain herof father make lawfull wife marriage loue ground instant conquest must vse mortall enemy stand vppon tearmes deliuer mine owne pasimondo must enioy right first vertue loue conquest deliuer therefore depart hence pleasure men rhodes rather constrained thereto free disposition themselues teares eye deliuered iphigenia chynon wo beholding like manner weepe thus spake vnto noble lady way discomfort selfe chynon haue right true title much better doe deserue enioy long continued affection pasimondo way pleade belong promise bringing aboord owne ship gentleman companion gaue kinde welcome without touching thing else belonging rhodians gaue free liberty depart chynon ioyfull obtaining heart desire conquest else world could make hee spent time comforting iphigenia yet sate sadly sighing consulted companion ioyned opinion safest course meanes returne cyprus therefore one consent resolued set saile candye euery one made account especially chynon regard ancient newe combined kindred also intimate friend finde worthy entertainement continue safely iphigenia fortune fauourable chynon granting pleasing conquest shew inconstancy sodainly changed inestimable ioy iocond louer heauy sorow disaster foure houres fully compleated since departure rhodians darke night came vpon sitting conuersing fayre mistris sweetest solace soule wind began blow roughly sea swelled angerly tempest arose impetuously man could see duty great vnexpected distresse warrant themselues perishing accident displeasing poore chynon thinke question vaine demanded seemed godds granted cheefe desire end hee dye greater anguish losing loue life together friend likewise felte selfe affliction especially iphigenia wept greeued beyond measure see ship beaten stormy billowes threatned sinking euery minute impatiently cursed loue chynon greatly blaming desperate boldnesse maintaining violent tempest could neuer happen onely god displeasure would permit haue wife therfore thus punished proud presumption vnauoidable death also life must perish company continuing wofull lamentation mariner labouring vaine violence tempest encreased euery moment expected wracking carried contrary owne knowledge neere vnto isle rhodes way able auoid vtterly ignorant coast safety liues labored land possibly might wherein fortune somewhat furtherous driuing small gulfe sea whereinto little rhodians chynon taken iphigenia newly entred ship knowledge till breake day made heauens looke clearly gaue discouerie within flight shoote together chynon looking forth espying ship left day hee grew exceeding sorowfull fearing followed therefore hee willed mariner get away best endeauour let fortune afterward dispose pleased worse place could come fall like danger mariner employed vtmost paine prooued losse time winde stern waues turbulent still droue contrary way striuing get foorth gulfe whether would driuen land instantly knowne rhodians whereof little ioyful men rhodes landed ran presently neere neighbouring village dwelt diuers worthy gentleman reported arriuall chynon fortune befell sea iphigenia might recouered againe chastisement chynon bold insolence ioyfull good newes tooke many men could village ran immediately sea side chynon newly landed people intending flight neere adioyning forrest defence himselfe iphigenia taken led thence village afterwards chiefe city rhodes sooner arriued pasimondo intended husband iphigenia already heard tydings went complayned senate appointed gentleman rhodes named lysimachus yeare soueraigne magistrate ouer rhodians go well prouided apprehension chynon company committing prison accordingly done manner poore vnfortunate louer chynon lost faire iphigenia hauing short scarsely requited much kisse iphigenia royally welcommed many lord lady rhodes kindely comforted soone forgotte greefe trouble sea remaining company lady gentlewoman vntill day determined mariage earnest entreary diuers rhodian gentleman ship iphigenia liues courteously saued chynon friend liues likewise spared although pasimondo laboured importunately haue put death onely condemned perpetuall imprisonment must thinke greeuous hopelesse deliuerance meane time pasimondo ordering nuptiall preparation fortune seeming repent wrong shee done chynon prepared new accident whereby comfort deep distresse manner relate vnto pasimondo brother yonger yeares iot inferiour vertue whose name hormisda long time case bene question taking wife faire yong gentlewoman rhodes called cassandra lysimachus gouernour loued verie dearly hindred marriage hormisda diuers strange accident pasimondo perceiuing owne nuptials required much cost solemnity hee thought conuenient one day might serue weddinges else would lanch lauish expences therefore concluded brother hormisda marry cassandra time wedded iphigenia heereuppon consulted gentlewoman parent liking motion well determination set downe one day effect duty came hearing lysimachus greatly displeasing saw himselfe vtterly depriued al hope attaine issue desire hormisda receyued cassandra marriage yet wise worthy man hee dissembled distaste began consider apt meanes whereby disappoint marriage found impossible bee done except way rape stealth appear difficult matter regard office authority onely wold seeme dishonest giuing vnfitting example neuerthelesse long deliberation honor gaue way loue resolutely concluded steale away whatsoeuer became nothing wanted conuenient company assist order haue done remembred chynon friend detained prisoner perswaded could haue faithfull friend busines chynon hereupon night following sent chamber alone themselues thus began chynon quoth hee god bountifull bestowing blessing men doe therein wisely make proofe vertues finde firme constant occurrence may happen make worthy valiant spirit best highest merites willing haue certain experience thy vertues heeretofore thou hast shewne within bound limit thy father possession know superabounding perhaps intend present thee occasion important weight consequence first haue heard piercing solicitude loue senselesse creature made thee become man endued reason afterward aduerse fortune againe wearisome imprisonment seemeth desirous make triall whether thy manly courage changed heretofore thou enioyedst matchlesse beautie lost againe short wherefore thy vertue hath bin god neuer giue thee blessing worthy acceptance minded bestow thee respect end thou mayst reassume thy wonted heroicke spirit become couragious euer heeretofore acquaint thee withall large vnderstand noble chynon pasimondo onely glad man thy misfortune diligent sutor thy death maketh hast hee possibly deu se celebrate marriage thy faire mistris would pleade possession prey fortune smiled first bestow afterward frowning took thee must need irkesome thee least thy loue bee perswaded partly collect selfe intended wronged brother hormisda euen selfsame maner marriage day taking faire cassandra onely iewell loue life preuention two notorious iniuries see fortune hath left v meanes vertue courage helpe right hand preparing selues armes opening way thee second rape stealth first absolute possession diuine mistress wherefore thou art desirous recouer thy losse wil onely pronounce liberty thee thinke thou dost little care without dare also assure thee enioy iphigenia thou wilt assist mee mine enterprize follow fortune god let fall power may well imagine chynons dismayed soule little cheared speech therefore without crauing long respit time answer thus replyed lord lysimachus busines cannot haue faster friend self least good hap may betide haue halfe promised therefore command would haue effected mee make doubt courage execution whereon lysimachus made answer know chynon quoth hee three dayes hence marriage bee celebrated house pasimondo hormisda vpon day thou thy friend self others repose especiall trust friendly fauour night enter house middest theyr iouiall feasting seizing two bride beare thence shippe haue lye secret waiting comming kil shall presume impeach v direction gaue great contentment chynon remained stil prison without reuealing word owne friend vntil limited time come vpon wedding day performed great magnificent triumph corner brethren house sung ioy highest key lysimachus ordered thing ought houre dispatch approached neere made diuision three part chynon follower owne friendes well armed vnder outward habites hauing first vsed encouraging speech resolute prosecution enterprize sent one troope secretly port might hindred going aboord ship vrgent necessity require passing two traines pasimondo left one doore house might shut vp fast impeach passage forth chynon third band confederate ascended staires vp hall found bride store lady gentlewoman sitting comely order supper rushing roughly among attendant downe threw table laying hold mistris deliuered hand follower commanding carried aboord ship auoiding inconueniences hurrie amazement beeing house bride weeping lady lamenting seruants confusedly wondering chynon lysimachus friend hauing weapon drawn hand made opposer giue way gayned stair head owne descending stoode pasimondo huge long staffe hand hinder passage downe stayres chynon saluted soundly head cleft twaine hee fell dead feete brother hormisda came rescue sped selfesame manner done diuers beside companion lysimachus chynon either slew outright wounded left house filled bloode teares outcry going together without hinderance brought bride aboord shippe rowed away instantly theyr oares shore full armed people came rescue stolne lady vaine lanched main sayled merrily towardes candye beeing arriued worthily entertained honourable friendes kinsman pacified vnkindnesses betweene mistress hauing accepted lawfull marriage liued meane ioy contentment albeit long troublesom difference rape betweene rhodes cyprus yet end meanes noble friend kindred either side labouring haue discontentment appeased endangering warre betweene kingdomes limited time banishment chynon returned ioyfully iphigenia home cyprus lysimachus beloued cassandra vnto rhodes liuing seuerall country much felicity faire constance liparis fell loue martuccio gomito hearing dead desperately entred barke transported windes susa barbary thence went thunis found liuing made selfe knowne great authority priuy counsellor king married saide constance returned richly home island liparis second nouell wherein declared firme loyaltie true louer fortune doth sometime humble men raise afterward farre higher degree queene perceyued nouell recited pamphilus concluded graced especial commendation shee commaunded madame aemillia take turne next order whereupon thus began thinkes matter equity euery one take delight thing whereby recompence may noted answerable owne affection rather desire walke along path pleasure dwell ceremonious scrupulons affectation shall gladly obey queen day yesterday melancholly king vnderstand noble lady neere sicily small island commonly called liparis wherein long since liued yong damosell named constance born sufficient parentage island dwelt also young man called martuccio gomito comely feature well conditioned vnexpert many vertuous quality affecting constance hearty manner answerable kinde company onely felicity martuccio coueting enioy marriage made intent knowne father vpbraiding pouerty tolde plainly hee haue martuccio greeuing see himselfe thus despised poore made good meanes prouided small barke calling friend thought fit association made solemne vow hee would neuer returne backe liparis vntill rich better condition nature course rouer pirate put thence sea coasting barbarie robbing spoyling hee met greater strength himselfe wherein fortune fauourable became wealthy short felicity alwayes permanent hee follower contenting themselues sufficient rich greedy seeking get happened taken certaine ship sarazins robbed themselues gotten yet resisted stoutly long together though proued losse many liues among sarazen sunke shippe sea tooke thunis imprisoned liued extreamest misery newes came liparis onely one many beside departed thence smal barke martuccio drowned sea man escaped constance heard vnwelcome tydings exceeding full greefe desperate departure wept lamented extraordinarily desiring rather dye liue longer yet shee heart lay violent hand selfe rather end dayes new kinde necessity departing priuately father house shee went port hauen chance found small fisherboate lying distant vessel owner whereof gone shore well furnished mast sailes oares entred putting forth oares beeing somewhat skilfull sayling generally woman island shee well guyded sailes rudder oares quickly farre land soly remained mercy windes thus resolued selfe boat vncharged without guide wold either ouerwhelmed windes split peeces rocke meanes could escape although shee would desire must need drowned determination wrapping mantle head lying downe weeping boat bottome hourely expected finall expiration fell otherwise contrary desperate intention winde turning north blowing gently without disturbing sea iot conducted small boat sort night entering morowes sailing vntill euening came within hundred league thunis strond neere towne called susa young damosell knew whether sea land one accident hapning lifted vp head look neither intended euer doe came passe boate driuen shore poore woman stood sea side washing certaine fisherman net seeing boate comming towards vnder saile without person appearing wondred thereat little close shore thinking fisherman asleepe therein stept boldly looked boate saw body onely poore distressed damosell whose sorowes hauing broght sound sleepe woman gaue many cals could awake length looked strangely poore woman perceyuing habite christian demanded speaking latine possible beeing alone boate arriue manner constance heard speake latine tongue began doubt least contrary wi de turned backe liparis againe starting vp sodainly looke better aduice shee saw selfe land knowing countrey demanded poore woman daughter quoth heere hard susa barbarie constance hearing plainly perceyuing death denied end misery fearing least receiue dishonour barbarous vnkinde country knowing shold become sate downe boates side wringing hand weeping bitterly good woman greatly compassionate case preuailed well gentle speech shee conducted owne poore habitation length vnderstoode meanes shee hapned thither strangely perceyuing fasting shee set homely bread small fish crewse water praying accept poore entertainement meere necessity compelled shewed selfe thankefull constance hearing spake latine language well desired know whereto olde woman thus answered gentlewoman quoth trapanum named carapresa seruant countrey certaine christian fisherman yong maiden albeit full sorow hearing name carapresa conceiued good augury selfe heard name although shee knew occasion moue thus began hope quicken againe yet shee could tell vpon ground desirous death made precious estimation life without declaration selfe countrey entreated good woman euen charity sake take pitty youth help good aduice preuent iniuries might happen solitary wofull condition carapresa hauing heard request like good woman shee left constance poore cottage went hastily leaue net safety done returned backe againe couering constance mantle led susa arriued good woman began manner constance bring thee house worthy sarazin lady whome haue done manie honest seruices according pleased command ancient woman full charity commend thee best may well assured shee gladly entertaine thee vse thee thou wert owne daughter let thy part thy time remaining employ thy vtmost diligence pleasing deseruing gaining grace till heauen shall blesse thee better fortune promised performed sarazine lady well stept yeares vpon commendable speech deliuered carapresa seriously fasten eye constance compassion prouoking teares tooke hand louing manner kissed forehead led house dwelt diuers woman one man exercising themselues seuerall labour working sort silke imbroideries gold siluer sundry excellent art beside short time verie familiar constance pleasing grew behauiour old lady rest beside loued delighted wonderfully little little attained speaking language although verie harsh difficult constance continuing thus old lady seruice susa thought dead lost owne father house fortuned one reigning king thunis named himselfe mariabdela young lord great birth powerfull liued granada pleaded kingdome thunis belonged respect mustred together mighty army came assault king hoping expell newes comming eare martuccio gomito spake barbarian language perfectly hearing reported king thunis made meane preparation owne defence conferred one keeper custody rest taken saying quoth hee could haue meanes speake king pleased allow counsell enstruct course shall assure win honor field guard reported speech master presently acquainted king therewith martuccio sent commanded speake minde whereupon began manner gracious lord time haue frequented countrey haue heedfully obserued militarie discipline vsed fight battailes dependeth vpon archer men imployed warre therefore could bee ordered kinde artillery might fayle enemy campe sufficiently furnished therewith neede make doubt winning battaile whereto king thus replyed doubtlesse acte possible done would giue great hope successefull preuailing sir said martuccio please may bee done quickly resolue let string archer bowes bee made soft gentle heretofore haue formerly vsed next let nockes arrowes prouided receiue pliant gentle string must done secretly enemy may haue knowledge therof least prouide themselues ame manner reason gracious lord thus counsell end archer enemy side haue shot arrowes men like maner followeth vpon meere constraint must gather vp arrowes shoote backe againe long battell endureth doubt men wil like enemy finde themselues much deceiued make vse people arrowes regard nockes narrow receiue boysterous string fall contrary follower pliant string belonging bowes apt enemy great nockt arrowes owne shall haue free vse reseruing plentifull store aduersaries must stand vnfurnished cannot way vse counsell pleased king highly hee prince great vnderstanding gaue order haue accordingly followed thereby valiantly vanquished enemy heereupon martuccio came great grace also consequently rich seated meane place authority worthy commendable action soone spread abroad honor man whome hapned euen fame rare got victory quickly noysed throughout countrey came hearing poore constance martuccio gomito supposed long since dead liuing honourable condition loue formerly bare vnto altogether extinct heart small sparke brake foorth sodaine flame encreased day day hope almost quite dead reuiued againe chearfull manner hauing imparted fortune good olde lady whome dwelt told beside earnest desire see thunis satisfie eye well eares concerning rumor blazed abroad good olde lady commended desire euen bene mother tooke aboord barke sayled thence thunis constance found honourable welcome house kinsman sarazin lady carapresa also went along thither sent abroad citie vnderstand newes martuccio gomito knew certaintie hee liuing great authority king according former report went good old lady desirous let martuccio know faire friend constance come thither see went selfe place abiding spake vnto manner noble martuccio seruant thine house came liparis requireth haue little priuate conference thee durst trust message selfe entreaty come acquaint thee therewith martuccio gaue kinde hearty thankes went along house sooner constance behold shee ready dye conceite ioy vnable containe passion sodainely threw armes necke meere compassion many misfortune also instant solace soule able vtter one word teares trickled abundantly downe cheekes martuccio also seeing faire friend ouercome exceeding admiration stood awhile knowing say till venting forth vehement sighe thus spake deerest loue constance art thou yet liuing tedious long since heard thou wast lost neuer tydinges knowne thee thine owne father house wordes teares standing eye louingly embraced constance recoun ed fortune kindnesse hadde receyued sarazine lady since first houre comming much discourse passing betweene martuccio departed returning king master tolde historie fortune beside loue constance beeing purposely minded gracious liking marry according christian law king much amazed many strange accident sending constance come mouth heard whole relation continued affection martuccio whereuppon hee saide trust faire damosell thou hast dearly deserued thy husband sending costly iewels rich present one halfe gaue martuccio graunting license withall marry according owne mindes martuccio many honor gaue great giftes aged sarazine lady constance liued kindly respected although neede neither euer expected rewarding yet conquered vrgent importunity especially constance could thankfull enough enforced receiue taking leaue weeping sayled backe againe susa within short king licensing departure thence entred small barke carapresa sailing prosperous gale winde vntill arriued liparis entertained generall reioycing marriage sufficiently performed thunis regard diuers christian ceremony wanting nuptials againe honourably solemnized liued many yeares health much happinesse pedro bocamazzo escaping away yong damosell loued named angelina met theeues iourney damosell flying fearfully forrest chance arriueth castle pedro taken theeues happening afterward escape commeth accidentally castle angelina marrying returned home rome third nouell wherein seuerall power loue fortune large approued one whole company much commended nouell reported madam emillia queene perceiued ended turned towards madam eliza commanding continue delightfull exercise whereto shee declaring willing obedience began speak thus courteous lady remember one vnfortunate night happened two louers indued greatest discretion many faire happy dayes afterwardes willing let heare citie rome time past called ladie mistresse world though scarsely good waiting maid dwelt sometime yong gentleman named pedro boccamazzo descended one honorable family rome much enamoured beautifull gentlewoman called angelina daughter one named gigliuozzo saullo whose fortune none fairest yet greatly esteemed among romaine entercourse loue twaine equally enstructed heart soul could hardly iudged feruent affection imputed oppressing passion therefore lesse able support except sure compasse desire plainly made motion might enioy honorable mariage parent friend hearing went conferre blaming ouermuch basenesse farre disgrace himselfe stocke beside aduised father maid neither credit pedro saide case liue hope match wholly despise pedro perceiuing way shut vp wherby none mount ladder hope began waxe weary longer liuing could haue father consent would haue maried despight friend neuerthelesse conceit hammering head maid would bee forward himselfe bring matter full effect letter secret intelligence passing still betweene length vnderstood ready resolution aduenture thorough fortune whatsoeuer concluding sodaine secret flight rome pedro well prouide early morning well mounted horsebacke tooke way leading vnto alagna pedro honest friend reposed especiall trust riding thus thorow countrey hauing leysure accomplish marriage stoode feare pursuite ridden aboue foure league rome still shortning way amorous discoursing fortuned pedro hauing certaine knowledge way following trackt guiding farre left hand rode quite course came last within sight small castle aware yssued twelue villaines angelina sooner espyed pedro could made cry saying help deere loue saue v else shall assayled pedro turning horse expeditiously could giuing spurres neede required mainly gallopped neere adioyning forrest minding following angelina direction way endeauoured hinderance often winding turning passage appeared troublesom thought selfe free furthest round engirt seized made dismount horse questioning whence resoluing therin fell secret consultation saying thus among themselues man friend deadly enemy wee otherwise dispose bereaue hath despight orsini men nature hatefull v hang vp heere one tree agreeing dismall resolution commanded pedro put garment yeelding albeit vnwillingly fell fiue twenty theeues came sodainly rushing vpon cry kill kill spare man surprized pedro desiring nowe shifte owne safetie left standing quaking shirt ranne away mainely defend themselues new crewe perceyuing number farre exceeded followed robbe gotten accounting present purchase pedro perceyued saw none tarrying prey vppon hee put cloathes againe mounting owne horsse gallopped way angelina taken yet could hee descry tracke path much footing horse thought himselfe sufficient securitie beeing rid first seized also rest followed pursuite losse beloued angelina wofull man world wandering one way againe another calling forrest without answere returning daring ride backe againe trauailed stil knowing make arriuall hauing formerly heard sauage rauenous beast commonly liue vnfrequented forrests onely feare loosing owne life also despayred much angelina least lyon woolfe torne body peeces thus rode poore vnfortunate pedro vntill breake day appeared finding meanes get forth forrest still cry calling fayre friend riding many time backeward hee thought hee rode forward vntill hee became weake faint extreame feare lowd calling continuing long without sustenance whole day beeing thus spent vaine darke night sodainly come vppon hee able hold longer hee farre worse case knowing dispose himselfe might best bee done great necessity horse hee alighted tying bridle vnto great tree vppe climbed tree fearing bee deuoured night time wilde beast choosing rather let horsse perish himselfe within moone beganne rise sky appeared bright clcare yet durst hee nod take nap lest fall tree sate still greeuing sighing mourning despairing euer seeing angelina could comforted smallest hopefull perswasion good fortune might befall desolate forrest nothing dismall feares expected likelihood escape life concerning poore affrighted angelina heard knew place refuge flye vnto euen pleased hir horse carry entred farre forest could deuise seeke owne safety therefore euen fared friend pedro manner fall wandering whole night day following one taking one hopefull tracke another calling weeping wringing hir hand greeuously complaining hard fortune length perceyuing pedro came found little path shee lighted great good fortune euen dark night apace drawing followed long til brought within sight small poore cottage whereto rode fast could found therin old man hauing wife rather aged seeing hir without company old man spake thus vnto faire daughter quoth whether wander vnseasonable houre alone place desolate damosell weeping replied shee lost company forest enquired neere shee alagna daughter answered old man way alagna boue sixe league hence shee desired knowe farre shee house might haue reasonable lodging none neere said old man day light giue leaue reach may please good father replied angelina seeing cannot trauaile whether else god sake let remaine heere night daughter answered good old man wee gladly giue entertainement night poore manner see let mee tell withall vp downe wooddes well night day walke company condition rather enimies friend doe v many greeuious displeasure harmes msifortune beeing heere people come seeing loouely faire indeed offer shame iniurie ala see lie power lend helpe succour thought good therefore acquaint heerewith mischance happen afterward complaine v yong maiden seeing time farre spent albeit olde man word much dismay yet thus replyed wil heauen shall defended misfortune mischance happen account matter lesse deseruing grief fall mercy men deuoured wild beast forrest dismounted horse entred homely house supt poorely olde man wife mean cates prouision affoorded supper lay downe hir garment poore pallet aged couple tooke rest well contented therewith albeit could refraine sighing weeping bee thus diuided deare pedro whose life welfare greatly despaired almost day heard great noise people trauailing whereupon sodainly arose ranne garden plot backside poore cottage espying one corner great stacke hay wherein hid selfe end trauelling stranger might readily finde house scarsely fully hidden great company theeues villaines finding doore open rushed cottage looking round booty saw damosel horse stand ready sadled made demand belonged good olde man seeing maiden present immagining shee made shift selfe answered thus gentleman body wife selfe horse seemeth bee escaped owner hee came hither yesternight gaue houseroome heere rather deuoured wolues abroad said principall theeuish crew horse shall regard hath master let owner come claime v searched euery corner poore cottage found prey looked went backe side left iauelins target wherewith vsed commonly trauaile fortuned one subtily suspitious rest thrust iaueline stacke hay place damosell lay hidden missing little killing entred farre iron head pierced quite thorough garment touched left bare brest whereupon shee ready cry fearing wounded considering place lay still spake word disordred company fed young kid flesh brought thither went thence theeuing exercise taking damosel horse along gone good distance good old man beganne thus question wife become quoth hee young gentlewoman came late v yesternight haue seen hir day since arising old woman made answer knew sought finde angelinaes feares well ouerblowne hearing none former noise made better hope departure came forth haystack wherof good old man little ioyfull well escaped seeing broad daylight sayde vnto morning fairely begun well contented bring castle stand two mile halfe hence sure remaine safety must need trauaile thither foote nightwalker happened hither haue taken away horse angelina making little account losse entreated charity sake conduct castle accordingly nd arriued betweene seuen eight clocke castle belonged one orsini called liello di campo di fiore great good fortune wife vertuous religious lady sooner shee looke vpon angelina shee knew immediately entertaining willingly requested know reason thus arriuing shee large related moued lady likewise knew pedro perfectly well much compassion kinsman deare friend husband vnderstanding theeues surprized shee feared slaine among whereupon shee spake thus angelina seeing know become kinsman pedro shall remaine vntill time heare tidings may safety sent backe rome pedro sitting tree ful griefe man could houre midnight bright splendour moone espied twenty wolues soone got sight horse ran engirt round horse perceiued neere drew head strongly backward breaking reines bridle laboured escape away beset euery side vtterly vnable helpe himselfe contended teeth feete owne defence till haled violently ground tearing body peeces left ot bare bone afterward ran ranging thorow forrest sight poore pedro mightily dismayed fearing speed better horse done therefore could deuise best done saw likelihood getting forrest life daylight drawing apace almost dead cold hauing stood quaking long tree length continuall looking euery discerne least glimpse comfort espied great fire seemed halfe mile time broade day descended downe tree yet without much feare tooke way towards fire arriued found company shepheards banquetting curteously saluting tooke pity distresse welcommed kindly tasted cheare indifferently refreshed good fire hee discoursed hard disaster also happened thither desiring know village castle neere thereabout might better manner releeue himselfe shepheards told mile halfe thence castle signior liello di campo di fiore lady residing meane comfort poore pedro requesting one would accompany thither two louing manner ridde feares arriued castle found diuers familiar acquaintance laboured procure meanes damosell might sought forrest lady calling bringing ran caught armes ready swoune conceit ioy neuer could man comforted sight angelina questionlesse ioy iot inferior simpathy firme loue sealed lady castle shee giuen gracious entertainement vnderstood scope bold aduenture shee reproued somewhat sharpely presuming farre without consent parent perceiuing notwithstanding remonstrance continued still constant resolution without inequality either side shee saide selfe matter way offensiue loue loyally inferiour one another birth fortune equally loued allied husband desire honest honourable moreouer know heauen haue theeues intended hang malice name kinred hard fate hath happily escaped life endangered sharpe pointed iaueline yet fairer starres would suffer perish beside haue escaped fury rauenous wild beast apparant signes future comfort recompence former passed misfortune farre therefore hinder appointment heauens turning selfe thus shee proceeded desire ioyne honourable marriage well contented therewith nuptials shall sollemnized husband charge afterward endeauour make peace discontented parent pedro little ioyfull kind offer angelina much maried together castle worthily feasted lady forrest entertainment could permit enioyed first fruit loue within short lady well mounted horsebacke attended honourable traine returned rome lord liello shee preuailed wel pedroes angry parent variance ended loue peace afterward liued louingly together till old age made honourable true mutuall affection formerly done ricciardo manardy found messer lizio da valbonna sate fast asleepe daughter chamber window hauing hand fast shee sleeping manner whereupon ioyned together marriage long loyall loue mutually recompenced fourth nouell declaring discreete prouidence parent care childrens loue owne credit cut inconueniences doe proceede farre madam eliza hauing ended tale heard commendation whole company gaue thereof queene commanded philostratus tell nouell agreeing owne minde smiling thereat thus replyed faire lady haue beene often checkt snapt yester dayes matter argument discoursing tedious offensiue intended make amends vndertake tell tale might put mirthfull humour determined doe relating briefe pleasant nouell way offensiue trust exemplary good note obseruation long since liued romania knight honest gentleman well qualified whose name messer lizio da valbonna fortuned entrance age lady wife called iaquemina daughter choycest goodliest gentlewoman place happy blessing olde yeeres little comfortable thought themselues bound duty circumspect education keeping ouerfrequent company onely agreed best grauity might giue least ill example daughter named catharina making doubt prouident wary respect match mariage answerable liking also young gentleman flourishing estate youthfull time descended family manardy da brettinoro named messer ricciardo oftentimes frequented house messer lizio continuall welcome guest table messer lizio wife making like account euen beene owne sonne young gallant perceiuing maiden beautifull singular behauiour yeeres fit mariage became exceedingly enamoured yet concealed affection closely could couertly caried perceiued grew good liking many time earnest desire haue conference yet still deferred fearing displease till length lighted apt opportunity boldly spake manner faire catharina hope thou wilt let die thy loue signior ricciardo replyed shee suddenly againe hope extend like mercy desire shew answere pleasing messer ricciardo presently saide ala deare loue haue dedicated fairest fortune onely thy seruice remaineth soly thy power dispose best shall please thee appoint time priuate conuersation may yeeld comfort poore afflicted soule catharina standing musing last returned answere signior ricciardo quoth shee see restraint set liberty short kept couersing one hold enterparlance almost miraculous could deuise conuenient meanes admit v familiar freedome without preiudice mine honour least distaste parent doe enstruct aduenture ricciardo hauing considered many wayes meanes thought one fittest therefore thus replyed catharina quoth onely place priuate talking together conceiue gallery ouer father garden winne mother let lodge make meanes climbe ouer wall goodly gazing window may discourse long please trust deare loue answered catharina place conuenient purpose shall heare sweete bird sing especially nightingale haue heard singing night long breake matter mother speede shall heare diuers parting kiss brake conference till next meeting day following towards ending moneth may catharina began complaine mother season ouerhot tedious still lodged mother chamber hinderance sleeping wanting rest would empairing health daughter quoth mother weather yet hot minde may well endure ala mother said shee aged people father doe feele heates youthfull bloud reason farre colder complexion measured younger yeeres know well daughter replyed mother power make weather warme coole thou perhaps wouldst haue season suffered according seuerall quality though last night might seeme hot next ensuing may cooler thy rest better mother quoth catharina cannot summer proceedeth heate encreaseth expectation temperate weather vntill groweth winter againe daughter saide mother wouldest thou haue doe mother quoth shee might stand father good liking would spared garden gallery great deale coole temperate shall heare sweete nightingale sing euery night shee vseth doe many pretty bird beside cannot doe lodging chamber mother louing daughter dearely somewhat ouerfond willing giue contentment promised impart minde father doubting compasse shee requested shee moued matter messer lizio whose age made somewhat froward teasty angerly said wife woman cannot daughter sleepe except shee heare nightingale sing let bed made ouen let cricket make melody catharina heard answere father saw desire disappointed onely could shee take rest night following also complained heate suffering mother take rest made goe angerly husband morning saying husband haue one onely daughter pretend loue right dearely yet carelesse denie request reason matter let lodge garden gallery young bloud compared weake crazie body feele frolicke temper ala shee hardy yet childish yeeres child haue many desire farre differing singing bird rare musicke chiefly nightingale whose sweete note prouoke rest neither art physicke doe euen wife answered messer lizio must mine gouerned daughter well let bed made garden gallerie haue keeping key locke night set libertie euery morning woman woman young wench wily many wanton crochet busie braines v aged sing like lapwing telling v one thing intending another talking nightingale mindes run cockesparrowes seeing wife shee must needes haue minde let yet care mine extend farre keepe chastity vncorrupted credulity abused catharina hauing thus preuailed mother bed made garden gallery sectet intelligence giuen ricciardo preparing meanes accesse window old prouident lizio locke doore bedward giues liberty come forth morning owne lodging neere gallery dead silent time night louers take rest ricciardo hauing prouided ladder rope grapling hooke take hold aboue according occasion vse helpe thereof first mounted ouer garden wall climbde vp gallery window euery whe e italie little round eng ting tarras onely man stand vpon making cleane window otherwise repairing many night manner enioyed meeting entermixing amorous conference infinite kiss kinde embrace window gaue leaue sitting tarras departing alwayes breake day feare discouered excesse delight nurse negligence begetteth ouerpresuming boldnesse afterward proueth sauced repentance came passe ouerfond louers taken ardy owne folly many time met manner night according season growing shorter shorter stolne delight made lesse respectiue requisite aduenture dangerous fortuned amorous pleasure farre transported dulled sences sort continued nightly watching fell fast asleepe hauing hand closed shee one arme folded body thus slept till broade day light old messer lizio continually morning cocke whole house going foorth garden saw daughter ricciardo seated window went againe going wiues chamber saide rise quickly wise shall see made daughter desirous lodge garden gallery perceiue shee loued heare nightingale shee hath caught one hold fast hand possible saide mother daughter catch liue nightingale darke shall see selfe answered messer lizio make haste goe shee putting garment great haste followed husband come gallery doore opened softly going window shewed sate fast asleepe manner hath declared whereupon shee perceiuing ricciardo catharina deceiued would haue made outcry messer lizio spake thus wife loue speake word neither make noyse seeing shee hath loued ricciardo without knowledge haue priuate meeting manner yet free blamefull imputation shall enioy shee ricciardo gentleman well deriued rich possession disparagement v catharina match mariage neither shall dare denie doe regard lawes seuerity climbing vp window ladder rope wherby life forfeited law except daughter please spare remaineth power doe accepting husband yeelding life vp law surely shee suffer loue agreeing together mutuall manner aduenturing dangerously madam iaquemina perceiuing husband spake reasonably offended matter stept aside behinde drawne curtaines vntill awake themselues last ricciardo awaked seeing farre day thought himselfe halfe dead calling catharina saide ala deare loue shall doe haue slept long shall taken word messer lizio stept forth behind curtaines sayingnay signior ricciardo seeing haue found vnbefitting way hither prouide better backe returning ricciardo saw father mother present could deuise doe say sences became strangely confounded yet knowing hainously hee offended strictnesse law challenged falling knee saide ala messer lizio humbly craue mercy confessing selfe well worthy death knowing sharpe rigour law would presume audaciously breake pardon worthy sir loyall vnfeined loue daughter catharina hath beene onely cause transgressing ricciardo replyed messer lizio loue beare thee honest confidence doe repose thee step vp measure pleade thine excuse especially regard daughter blame thee louing vnlawfull way presuming neuerthelesse perceiuing case standeth considering withall youth affection ground thine offence free thee death selfe dishonour thou departest hence thou shalt espouse daughter catharina make thy lawfull wife mariage wipe scandall house poore catharina knee likewise mother notwithstanding bold aduenture made earnest suite husband remit ricciardo right gladly condiscended maine issue hope desire accept catharina mariage whereto shee willing messer lizio presently called confessour house borrowing one wiues ring went gallery ricciardo catharina espoused together little ioy contentment leasure conference parent kindred ricciardo way discontented sudden match applauding highest degree publikely maried againe cathedrall church honourable triumphes performed nuptials liuing long happy prosperity guidotto cremona departing mortall life left daughter iacomino pauia giouanni di seuerino menghino da minghole fell loue young maiden fought h afterward knowne sister giouanni shee giuen mariage menghino fifth nouell wherein may obserued quarrel contention occasioned loue particular discription concerning sincerity loyall friend lady laughing heartily nouell nightingale pleasingly deliuered philostratus saw fully ended queene thus spake trust philostratus though yesterday much oppresse mee melancholy yet haue made amends day wee haue little reason complaine conuerting speech madam neiphila shee commanded succeede discourse willingly yeelded beginning manner seeing pleased philostratus produce nouell romania meane walke iurisdiction concerning say dwelt sometime city fano two lombard one named guidotto cremona iacomino pauia men sufficient entrance yeeres hauing followed warres souldiers youthful time guidotto feeling sicknesse ouermaster hauing sonne kinsman friend might repose trust hee iacomino hauing long conference worldly affaire setled whole estate good order left daughter charge ten yeeres age good enioyed departed life came passe city forenza long time molested tedious warres subiected seruile condition beganne recouer former strength free permission pleased returne possesse former dwelling whereupon iacomino hauing sometime beene inhabitant desirous liue faenza againe conuaying thither good taking also young girle guidotto left hee loued respected owne childe shee grew stature shee beauty vertuous quality none commended throughout whole city faire ciuill honest demeanour incited many amorously affect aboue rest two honest young men good fame repute equally loue addicted iealous others fortune preuenting seuerall hopefull expectation deadly hatred grew suddenly betweene one named giouanni de seuerino menghino da minghole either two young men maide fifteene yeeres old laboured possessed marriage guardian would giue consent thereto wherefore perceiuing honest intended meaning frustrated began busie braines forestall one another craft circumuention iacomino maideseruant belonging house somewhat aged manseruant beside named griuello mirthfull disposition friendly giouanni grew great familiarity found time fit purpose discouered loue requesting furtherance assistance compassing height desire bountifull promise rich rewarding whereto griuello returned answere know sted case master shall sup foorth neighbour house admit entrance offer speake shee neuer stay heare wherefore seruice way may doe good promise performe doe beside shall find conuenient bargaine agreed betweene nothing else remained issue sort end menghino side hauing entred chambermaides acquaintance sped well shee deliuered many message already halfe liking virgin passing promise beside bringing haue conference whensoeuer master absent home thus menghino fauoured one side olde chambermaide giouanni trusty griuello amorous warre foote diligently followed sollicitors within short procurement griuello iacomino inuited neighbour supper company diuers familiar friend wherof intelligence giuen giouanni conclusion passed betweene vpon certaine signale giuen come finde doore standing ready open giue accesse vnto affected mayden appointed night come neither hot louers knowing others intent suspition alike encreasing still made choyce certaine friend associate well armed prouided eithers safer entrance neede require menghino stayed troope neere neighbouring house mayden attending signall would giuen giouanni con orts ambushed somewhat house saw iacomino went foorth supper grinello chambermaide began vary send way till effected seuerall intention whereupon grinello said maketh thee walke thus house doest thou get thee bed thou quoth maide doest thou goe attend master tarry returning home sure thou hast supt long agoe know businesse house thee doe thus meanes one could send away either remained others hinderance grinello remembring himselfe houre appointment giouanni come saide himselfe care whether olde maide present shee disclose thing doe reuenged list hauing made signall went open doore euen giouanni two confederate rushed house finding faire young maiden sitting hall laide hand beare away damosell began resist cry helpe loude shee could olde chambermaide like menghino hearing ranne thither presently friend seeing young damosell brought wellneere house drew sword cry traytors dead men violence offered neither booty base groomes layed lustily would permit passe side vpon mutinous noyse outcry neighbour came foorth house light staues clubbes greatly reprouing outrage yet assisting menghino meanes whereof long time contention menghino recouered mayden giouanni placed peaceably iacominoes house sooner hurlyburly somewhat calmed serieants captaine city came thither apprehended diuers mutiners among menghino giouanni grinello committing immediately prison euery thing pacified iacomino returned home house supper little offended grosse iniury fully informed matter happened apparantly perceiued blame could imposed mayden grew better contented resoluing himselfe inconueniences happen haue married soone possibly could morning come kindred friend either side vnderstanding truth errour committed knowing beside punishment would inflicted prisoner iacomino pressed matter reason equity well might repaired gentle speech entreated regard wrong offered vnruly youthfull people meerely drawne action perswasion friend submitting themselues offendors satisfaction pleased appoint iacomino seene obserued many thing time man sound vnderstanding returned answere gentleman mine owne countrey would forwardly confesse selfe friend must needes fall short seruice euen shall please command plainely without ceremonious complement must agree whatsoeuer request thinking iniured great wrong haue sustained concerning young damosell remaining house shee many haue imagined either cremona pauia borne faentine cirie albeit neither selfe shee euer know yet could learne whose daughter shee wherefore suite make rather duty mine shee natiue owne doe right doe wrong vnto mee gentleman vnderstood mayden borne faenza maruelled thereat thanked iacomino curteous answer desired let know meanes damosell came custody knew borne faenza perceiuing attentiue heare began manner vnderstand worthy gentleman guidotto cremona companion deare friend growing neere death tolde city surprized emperour frederigo thing committed sacke spoile certaine confederate entred house found well furnished good vtterly forsaken dweller onely poore mayden excepted aged two yeeres thereabout hee mounted vp step intent depart house called father word moued compassionately went backe againe brought away thing worth house going thence afterward fano deceasing left good charge conditionally see maried due time required bestow wealth left true although yeeres conuenient mariage yet could neuer find one bestow least thought fitting howbeit listen thereto much respectiuely accident shall happen came passe reporting discourse gentleman company named guillemino da medicina surprizal city present guidotto cremona knew well house ransacked owner whereof also present wherefore taking aside saide bernardino hearest thou iacomino hath related yes wel replyed bernardino remember withall dismall bloody combustion lost little daughter age iacomino spake questionlesse replied guillemino shee must needes young mayden time house whence guidotto bring girle good doe perfectly remember thy house pray thee call minde euer thou sawest scarre marke may reuiue thy former knowledge minde perswades maide thy daughter bernardino musing himselfe remembred vnder left care shee scarre forme little crosse happened byting wolfe small spoyle made wherefore without deferring time stept iacomino yet staied entreated fetch mayden house shee might knowne company whereto right willingly condiscended presented maide soone bernardino beheld began much inwardly moued perfect character mother countenance really figured sweete face onely beauty somewhat excelling yet herewith satisfied desired iacomino pleased lift vp little locke haire depending ouer left eare iacomino presently albeit modest blushing maide bernardino looking aduisedly knew selfe crosse confirmed constantly daughter ouercome excesse ioy made teares trickle downe cheekes proffered embrace kisse maide refusing kindnesse yet shee knew reason turned himselfe iacomino saying deare brother friend maide daughter house guidotto spoyled generall hauocke city thence carried child mine forgotten fury wife mother happy houre becomming father carrying away else perished fire house instantly burnt downe ground mayden hearing word obseruing also man yeeres grauity shee beleeued saide humbly submitted selfe kiss embrace euen instructed thereto instinct nature bernardino instantly sent wife owne mother daughter sonnes kindred acquainted admirable accident gaue gracious kind welcome receiuing iacomino childe legacy guidotto left captaine city wise worthy gentleman heard tydings knowing giouanni prisoner son bernardino naturall brother newly recouered maide bethought himselfe best might qualifie fault committed entring hall among handled matter discreetly louing league peace confirmed betweene giouanni menghino free full consent side faire maide named agatha giuen marriage honourable enlargement dowry grinello rest deliuered prison tumultuous riot iustly deserued menghino agatha wedding worthily sollemnized due honour belonging thereto long time liued faenza highly beloued graciously esteemed guion di procida found familiarly conuersing young damosell loued beene giuen formerly frederigo king sicilie bound stake consumed fire danger neuerthelesse escaped knowne rogiero de oria lord admirall sicilie afterward married damosell sixth nouell wherein manifested loue leade man numberlesse peril escapeth meane difficulty nouell madam neiphila ended proued pleasing lady queene commanded madam pampinea shee prepare take turne next whereto willingly obeying thus shee began many mighty gracious lady preuailing power loue conducting amorous soules infinite trauels inconueniences way auoidable easily foreseene preuented partly already hath beene obserued diuers former nouels related doubt ensue hereafter one comming memory shall acquaint withall good tearmes ischia iland neere naples wherein long since liued faire louely gentlewoman named restituta daughter gentleman isle whose name marino bolgaro proper youth called guion dwelling also neere neighbouring isle called procida loue dearely owne life intimately affected towards sight onely comfort occasion gaue leaue resorted ischia often day time often also night season barque passed procida ischia see nothing else yet behold walles enclosed mistresse thus loue continued equall feruency chanced vpon faire summer day restituta walked alone vpon seashoare going rocke rocke hauing naked knife hand wherewith shee opened oyster shee found among stone seeking small pearles enclosed shelles walke solitary shady faire spring well adioyning thither instant time certaine sicilian young gentleman came naples made retreate perceiuing gentlewoman beautifull shee yet hauing sight silent place alone selfe concluded together make purchase carry thence away indeed notwithstanding outcryes exclaimes bearing perforce aboard barque setting sayle thence arriued calabria grew great contention betweene booty beauty belong pleaded title could grow agreement doubted greater disaster would ensue thereon breaking former league friendship equall conformity consent resolued bestow rich present frederigo king sicilie young iouiall could pleased better gift wherefore sooner landed palermo according determined king commend beauty extraordinarily liked farre beyond loues time empaired health body much distempered ill dyet gaue command vntill able disposition shee must kept goodly house owne erected beautifull garden called cube shee attended pompeous manner grew noyse rumor great ischia rape stealing away restituta chiefest greeuance could knowne meanes guion di procida iniury concerned much stood expectation better tydings ischia hearing course barke taken made ready another follow possible speede flying thus winged mind sea euen minerua vnto scalea calabria searching lost loue euery angle length tolde scale shee carried away certaine sicillian marriners palermo whither guion set sayle immediately diligent search made vnderstood deliuered king giuen strict command keeping place pleasure called cube newes little greeuous almost quite hope onely euer enioying also seeing neuerthelesse loue would let vtterly despaire whereupon sent away barque perceiuing himselfe vnk owne continued time palermo walking many time goodly place pleasure chanced day keeping walke vsed doe fortune fauourable let haue sight window whence also full view exceeding comfort contentment guion obseruing cube seated place small resort approached neere possibly durst haue conference restituta loue set keene edge dullest spirit small aduantage make man aduenturous little time vnseene talke inspired courage witty aduice meanes accesse might much neerer communication concealed discouery scituation place benefit time duly considered night must cloud amorous conclusion therefore much thereof spent thought conuenient returned thither againe prouided grapplingyrons required men clamber made fast vnto hand knee helpe attained top wall whence discending downe garden found maine yard ship whereof shee giuen instruction rearing vp chamber window made meanes ascending thereto shee hauing left open easier entrance cannot denie faire lady hopefull beginning likely haue happy ending true loues fatall misery euen height promised assurance thwarted vnkind preuention manner tell night intended louers meeting proued disastrous dreadfull king first sight restituta highly pleased excelling beauty gaue order eunuch woman costly bathe prepared therein let weare away night next day intended visit restituta royally conducted chamber bathe attended torchlight shee queene none remained behind woman waited guard without watched chamber sooner poore guian aloft window calling softly mistresse beene ouerheard woman darke immediately apprehended guard forthwith brought lord marshall examined auouching restituta elected wife presumed manner closely kept prison till next morning came king presence boldly iustified goodnesse cause restituta likewise sent sooner saw deare loue guian shee ran caught fast necke kissing teares greeuing little hard fortune hereat king grew exceedingly enraged loathing hating much formerly affect hauing himselfe seene strange meanes climbe ouer wall mounted chamber window extreamely impatient could otherwise perswaded meeting thus beene many forthwith sentenced death commanding conueyed thence palermo stript starke naked bound stake backe backe stand full space nine houres see could take knowledge whence afterward consumed fire sentence death much daunt dismay poore louers vnciuill vnsightly manner feare king wrathfull displeasure man durst presume contradict wherefore commanded carried thence palermo bound naked stake open market place eye fire wood brought consume according houre king appointed need make question huge concourse people soone assembled together behold sad wofull spectacle euen whole city palermo men woman men stricken admiration beholding vnequalled beauty faire restituta selfe passion possessed woman seeing guian goodly compleat young man poore infortunate louers themselues stood lookes deiected ground much pittied way holpen rescued awaiting happy houre would come finish shame liues together time tragicall expectation fame publike execution noysed abroade calling people farre neere behold came eare rogiero de oria man much admired valour lord high admirall sicily came himselfe person place appointed death first obserued mayden confessing soule beauty beyond compare looking young man thus saide within himselfe inward endowment mind doe paralell outward perfection body world cannot yeeld compleate man good nature quickly incited compassion especially case almost commanding compassion knocking doore soule doth quicken memory many passed recordations noble admirall aduisedly beholding poore condemned guion conceiued somewhat seene instant vpon perswasion euen diuine vertue tutured tongue saide thy name guion di procida marke quickly misery receiue comfort vpon poore silly question guion began eleuate deiected countenance looking admirall returned answere sir heretofore haue man spake name man must die misfortune quoth admirall hath thus vnkindly crost thee loue answered guion king displeasure admirall would need know whole history large briefly related hauing heard happened turning horse ride away thence guion called saying good lord entreate one fauour possible may replyed admirall see sir quoth guion shortly breathe last grace doe humbly entreate chaste virgin honour loue beyond life miserably bound backe backe face may turned end fire shall finish life looking soule may take flight full felicity admirall smyling saide doe thee perhaps thou mayest long looke thou wilt weary desire looke departure commanded charge execution proceede vntill heard king hee gallopped immediately although hee beheld angerly moued yet spared speake manner sir wherin haue poore young couple offended shamefully burnt palermo king told whereto admirall pursuing still purpose thus replyed beleeue sir true loue offence may termed one albeit deserue death yet farre thee inflict fault doe iustly require punishment doe good turnes equally merit grace requitall knowest thou thou hast dishonourably condemned fire quoth king tell thee answered admirall thou mayest take better knowledge forbeare hereafter ouerviolently transported anger young gentleman sonne landolfo di procida onely brother lord iohn di procida whose meanes thou becamest lord king countrey faire young damosell daughter marino bolgaro whose power extendeth farre preserue thy prerogatiue ischia long since beene outrooted beside two maine motiues challenge iustly grace fauour thee floure pride youth hauing long continued loyall loue together compelled feruency endeared affection wil displease thy maiesty haue offended may termed offence loue louely young people canst thou find thine heart let die thou rather oughtest honour recompence meane reward king heard beleeued certainty admirall told nothing truth appointed onely proceede also exceeding sorrowfull done sending presently haue released stake honourably brought thus enstructed seuerall quality standing duty obliged recompence wrong done respectiue honour caused cloathed royall garment knowing knit vnity soule like marrying sollemnly together bestowing many rich gift present sent honourably attented home ischia much ioy comfort
