receiued liued long great felicity theodoro falling loue violenta daughter master named amarigo shee conceiuing childe condemned hanged leading gallowes beating misusing way happened knowne owne father whereupon hee released afterward enioyed violenta marriage seuenth nouell wherein declared sundry trauels perillous accident occasioned two powerfull commander loue fortune insulting tyrant ouer humaine life greatly lady mind perplexed heard two poore louers danger burned hearing afterward happy deliuerance ioyfull againe vpon concluding nouell queene looked madam lauretta enioyning tell next tale willingly vndertooke doe thus began faire lady time good king william reigned sicily liued within dominion young gentleman named signior amarigo abbot trapani among worldly blessing commonly termed good fortune vnfurnished child therefore hauing neede seruants made prouision best might time certaine gallies geneway pyrates comming easterne part coasting along armenia taken diuers child bought thinking turkes resembling clownish peazants yet one among seemed tractable gentle nature yea affable countenance rest named theodoro growing yeeres albeit liued condition seruant educated among amarigoes child enstructed rather nature accident condition much commended also feature body proued highly pleasing master amarigo made free man imagining turke caused baptized named pedro creating superintendent affaire reposing chiefest trust child signior amarigo grew yeeres stature daughter named violenta goodly beautifull damosell somewhat ouerlong kept marriage father couetousnesse casting eye good liking poore pedro albeit shee loued dearely behauiour pleasing yet maiden modesty forbad reueale till loue long concealed must needes disclose selfe pedro length tooke notice grew forward towards equality affection sight onely happinesse yet fearefull least noted either house maiden selfe yet well obserued meane contentment appeared lesse side honest pedro thus loued together meerely dumbe shewes daring speake though nothing desired find ease oppressing passion fortune euen shee pittied long languishing enstructed find way whereby might better releeue themselues signior amarigo two three mile distance trapani countreyhouse farme whereto wife daughter woman vsed oftentimes make resort sportfull recreation pedro alwayes diligent man thither one time among rest came passe often falleth summer season faire skie became suddenly ouerclouded euen returning home towards trapani threatning storme raine ouertake except made speedier haste pedro young likewise violenta went farre lightly mother company much perhaps prouoked loue feare sudden raine falling paced fast wholly sight many flash lightning dreadfull clappes thunder fell tempestuous shower hayle compelled mother traine shelter themselues poore countreymans cottage pedro violenta hauing refuge ranne likewise poore sheepecoate ouer ruined danger fall head body dwelt neither stood house neere scarcely shelter howbeit necessity enforceth make shift meanest storme encreasing coueting auoide well could sighes drie hemmes often interuented dumbly wont doe willingly could affoord another kind speaking last pedro tooke heart saide would shower would neuer cease might alwayes like could wish answered violenta better place safety wish drew gentle language modest kiss embrace onely ease poore louers soules raine ceased till taken order oftner conuersing absolute plighting faithes together time storme fairely ouer blowne attending way till mother rest come returned trapani wise prouident meanes often conferred priuate together enioyed benefit amorous desire yet free ill surmise suspition louers felicity sildome permanent without one encountring crosse stolne pleasure pedro violenta met sowre sauce farewell shee proued conceiued childe could befall heauier affliction pedro fearing loose life therefore determined immediate flight reuealed purpose violenta heard told plainly fled forthwith shee would kill selfe ala deare loue quoth pedro reason wish tarrying conception doth discouer offence father pity may easily pardon seruant vassall shall punished sinne mine haue mercy content thy selfe pedro replyed violenta take order mine owne offence discreete counsell louing mother blame shall way laide thee much surmise except thou wilt fondly betray thy selfe doe answered pedro constantly maintaine promise depart see proue good word violenta concealed amisse long shee could saw remedy last must needes discouered went priuately mother teares reuealed infirmity humbly crauing pardon furtherance hiding father mother extraordinarily displeased chiding many sharpe angry speech would needes know shee thus offended daughter keepe pedro detection forged tale owne braine farre truth indeede mother verily beleeuing willing preserue daughter shame also fierce anger husband man implacable nature conueyed countreyfarme whither signior amarigo sildome neuer resorted intending vnder shadow sicknesse let lie without least suspition trapani sinne shame neuer closely carried clouded greatest cunning truth hath looplight whereby discouer euen supposeth selfe surest safety day deliuerance time mother friend sworne secrecy businesse signior amarigo hauing beene company gentleman flye hawke riuer vpon sudden vnfortunately albeit alone himselfe stept farme house euen next roome woman heard newborne babe cry whereat maruelling little called wife know young childe cryed house mother amazed strange comming thither neuer vsed doe pittying wofull distresse daughter could longer couered reuealed happened violenta nothing rash beliefe wife made answere impossible daughter conceiued childe neuer obserued least signe loue man whatsoeuer therefore would satisfied truth shee expected fauour else way death mother laboured meanes shee could deuise pacifie husband fury proued vaine thus impatiently incensed drew foorth sword stepping drawne chamber deliuered goodly sonne said vnto either tell father bastard thou shall perish together poore violenta lesse respecting owne life childes forgot sollemne promise made pedro discouered amarigo heard grew desperately enraged hardly could forbeare killing spoken fury enstructed hee mounted horsebacke againe ryding backe trapani disclosed iniury pedro done noble gentleman named signior conrado captaine king ouer city poore pedro could haue intelligence much suspected treachery suddenly apprehended called question stood deniall confessed truly done whereupon within dayes condemned captaine whipt place execution afterward hanged necke signior amarigo would cut one time onely liues two poore louers childes also franticke man violently carried sense compassion euen pedro led whipt death mingled strong poyson cup wine deliuering trusty seruant owne naked rapier withall speaking manner goe carry two present late daughter violenta tell instant houre two seuerall kind death offered vnto one must make choyce either drinke poyson die run body rapier point denie doe shall haled publike market place presently burned sight lewd companion according shee hath worthily deserued thou hast deliuered message take bastard brat lately since borne dash braines walles afterward throw dogges feede father giuen cruell sentence daughter young sonne seruant readier doe euill good went place daughter kept poore condemned pedro haue heard ledde whipt lybbet passing pleased captaines officer guide faire inne time lodged three chiefe person armenia king countrey sent rome ambassadours pope holinesse negociate important businesse neerely concerning king state reposing dayes much wearied iourney highly honoured gentleman trapani especially signior amarigo ambassadours standing chamber window heard wofull lamentation pedro passage pedro naked middle vpward hand bound fast behind well obserued one ambassadours man aged great authority named phineo espied great red spot vppon breast painted procured punishment naturally imprinted flesh woman part terme rose vppon sight hereof suddenly remembred sonne owne stolne fifteene yeeres pyrates seacoast laiazzo neuer hearing tydings afterward vpon consideration compairing sonnes age likelyhood poore wretched man thus conferred owne thought sonne quoth liuing age equall man time redde blemish brest plainely speakes sonne moreouer thus conceiued could remember owne name father armenian language wherefore hee iust opposite window hee called aloud saying theodoro pedro hearing voyce presently lifted vp head phineo speaking armenian saide whence art thou thy father name sergeant reuerence lord ambassadour stayed till pedro returned answer saide armenian borne sonne one phineo brought hither cannot tell phineo hearing knew assuredly sonne lost wherefore teares standing eye conceite ioy downe descended window ambassadours running among sergeant embrace sonne casting owne rich cloake whipt body entreating forbeare proceed till heard command returne withall vnto willingly promised doe already generall rumour dispersed abroade phineo vnderstood occasion pedro thus punished sentenced hanged wherefore accompanied fellow ambassadours attending traine went signior conrado spake thus lord haue sent death slaue free gentleman borne sonne able make amends hath dishonored taking mariage lawfull wife let therefore entreate make stay execution vntill may knowne whether accept husband least pleased offend directly owne law signior conrado heard pedro sonne lord ambassadour wondered thereat little somewhat ashamed fortune errour confessed claime phineo conformable law ought denied going presently councell chamber sending signior amarigo immediately thither acquainting fully case amarigo beleeued daughter child already dead wofullest man world rash proceeding knowing well shee dead scandall would easily wipt away credit wherefore sent poast haste place daughter lay command already executed meanes haue done went speedy errand found signior amarigoes seruant standing violenta cup poyson one hand drawne rapier reproaching herewith foule iniurious speech shee delayed time long would accept one striuing violence make take one hearing master command contrary left returned backe certifying case stood highly pleased amarigo glad newes going ambassadour phineo teares excused himselfe well could seuerity crauing pardon assured theodoro would accept daughter mariage willingly would bestow phineo allowed excuse tollerable saide beside sonne mary daughter let sentence death executed amarigo phineo thus accorded went poore theodoro fearefully looking euery minute die yet ioyfull found father presently moued question theodoro hearing violenta wife would accept ouercome exceeding ioy leapt hell paradise confessing greater felicity could befall violenta selfe well pleased like motion made vnderstand disposition case hearing good hap befalne theodoro like manner must happen whereas long two violent deathes prepared one must needes embrace shee accounted misery beyond woman shee thought selfe aboue happinesse might wife beloued theodoro submitting selfe wholy father disposing mariage agreed betweene celebrated great pompe sollemnity generall feast made citizen young maried couple nourished vp sweete son grew comely childe embassie dispatched rome phineo rest returned thither againe violenta reuerence owne naturall father little proud louely daughter beginning fresh feasting againe continuing whole moneth together within short galley fairely furnished purpose phineo sonne daughter young son went aboard sayling away thence laiazzo afterward liued long much tranquility anastasio gentleman family honesti louing daughter signior paulo trauersario lauishly wasted great part substance without receiuing loue againe perswasion kindred friend went countrey dwelling called chiasso saw knight desperately pursue young damosell slew afterward gaue deuoured hound anastasio inuited friend also dearely loued take part dinner likewise saw damosell torne peeces vnkind loue perceiuing fearing least like ill fortune happen shee accepted anastasio husband eighth nouell declaring loue onely make man prodigall also enemy himselfe moreouer aduenture oftentimes bringeth matter passe wit cunning man neuer comprehend soone madam lauretta held peace madam philomena queenes command began saide louely lady pitty highly commended sexe euen cruelty v seuerely reuenged oftentimes diuine ordination may better know learne likewise shun deadly euill purpose make apparant nouell lesse full compassion delectable rauenna ancient city romania dwelt sometime great number worthy gentleman among speake one especially named anastasio descended family honesti death father vnkle left extraordinarily abounding rich growing yeeres fitting mariage young gallant easily apt enough doe became enamoured beautifull gentlewoman daughter signior paulo trauersario one ancient noble family countrey made doubt meanes industrious endeuour deriue affection againe hee carried himselfe like braue minded gentleman liberall expences honest affable action commonly true note good nature highly commended man howsoeuer fortune became enemy laudable part manhood way friend rather appeared hurtfull cruell vnkind almost meerely sauage shew selfe perhaps pride singular beauty presuming nobility birth blemish ornament woman especially abused harsh vnciuill vsage grew distastefull anastasio vnsufferable long time fruitlesse seruice requited still nothing coy disdain desperate resolution entred brain often minded kill himselfe better thought supplanting furious passion abstained violent act gouerned manly consideration determined hated would require like could wherein became altogether deceiued hope grew dayly decaying yet loue enlarged selfe thus anastasio perseuering still bootelesse affection expences limited within compasse appeared iudgement kindred friend falne mighty consumption body meanes respect many time aduised leaue city rauenna liue place might set moderate stint vpon spending bridle indiscreete course loue onely fuell fed furious fire anastasio held thus long time without lending eare friendly counsell end neerely followed longer able deny promised accomplish request whereupon making extraordinary preparation wer set thence france spaine else distant countrey mounted horsebacke accompanied familiar friend departed rauenna rode country dwelling house owne three foure mile distant cittie called chiasso vpon goodly greene erecting diuers tent pauillions great person make vse time progresse said friend came thither hee determined make abiding returning backe vnto rauenna might come visite againe often pleased came passe beginning may milde serrene season leading much magnificent life euer done inuiting diuers dine day many morrow leaue till supper vpon sodaine falling remembrance cruell mistris hee commanded seruants forbeare company suffer walke alone himselfe awhile occasion priuate meditation wherein would meanes troubled ninth houre day walking solitary alone hauing gone halfe mile distance tent entred groue pinetrees neuer minding dinner time thing else vnkind requitall loue sodainly heard voice woman seeming make mournfull complaint breaking silent consideration made lift vp head know reason noise saw himselfe farre entred groue could imagine hee looked amazedly round little thicket bush briar round engirt spreading tree hee espyed young damosell come running towards naked middle vpward haire disheuelled shoulder faire skinne rent torne briar bramble blood ran trickling downe mainly shee weeping wringing hand cry mercy lowde shee could two fierce bloodhound also followed swiftly teeth tooke hold cruelly bite last mounted lusty blacke courser came gallopping knight sterne angry countenance holding drawne short sword hand giuing vile dreadfull speech threatning euerie minute kill strange vncouth sight bred meane admiration also kinde compassion vnfortunate woman compassion sprung earnest desire deliuer could death full anguish horror seeing himselfe without armes hee ran pluckt vp plant tree handling beene staffe opposed himselfe dogges knight seeing comming cryed manner anastasio put thy selfe opposition referre hound punish wicked woman hath iustly deserued speaking word hound tooke fast hold body staying vntill knight come neerer alighted horse anastasio angry speech spake thus vnto cannot tell thou art albeit thou takest knowledge yet must say meere cowardize knight armed thou art offer kill naked woman make thy dogges thus seize sauage beast therefore beleeue defend farre able anastasio answered knight city thou art well remember thou wast little ladde named guido anastasio thine vnckle became intirely loue woman thou art paulo trauersarioes daughter coy disdaine cruelty heauy fate desperately slew selfe short sword thou beholdest mine hand rash sinfull deede condemned eternall punishment wicked woman reioycing immeasurably mine vnhappie death remained long time aliue mercilesse sinne cruelty taking pleasure oppressing torment dying vnrepentant pride scorne like sentence condemnation pronounced sent place tormented three impartiall iudges imposed infliction v namely shee flye manner mee loued deerely liued must pursue deadly enemy like woman taste loue often ouertake kill sword weapon wherewith slew selfe enioyned therewith open accursed body teare hard frozen heart inwards thou seest doe giue vnto hound feede afterward appointment supreame power reassumeth life againe euen bene dead falling kinde flight houndes still follow without respite intermission euery friday iust houre course way shee suffereth iust punishment inflicted rest dayes appointed vnto place cruelly executed malice dear affectionate frend ordained endlesse enemy pursue manner many yeeres exercised monthes cruelty towards hinder executioner diuine iustice thy interposition vaine seeking crosse appointment supreame power anastasio hauing attentiuely heard discourse haire stoode vpright like porcupine quils soule shaken terror stept back suffer knight ro doe enioyned looking yet milde commisseration poore woman kneeling humbly knight sternly seised two blood hound opened brest weapon drawing foorth heart bowel instantly threw dogges deuoured greedily soone damosell none punishment bene inflicted started vp sodainly running amaine towards sea shore hound swiftly following knight like taken sword mounted horseback anastasio soon lost sight could gesse become heard obserued thing stoode awhile confounded feare pitty like simple silly man hoodwinkt owne passion knowing subtle enemy cunning illusion offering false suggestion sight worke owne end thereby encrease number deceiued seruants forthwith hee perswaded might make good vse woman tormenting iustly imposed knight prosecute thus continue still euery friday wherefore setting good note marke vpon place hee returned backe owne people time hee thought conuenient sent diuers kindred friend rauenna present thus hee spake deare kinsman friend ye haue long importuned mee discontinue ouerdoating loue think find mortall enemy also giue ouer lauish expences wherein confesse selfe prodigall request condiscend prouided wil performe one gracious fauour mee namely friday next signior paulo trauersario wife daughter woman linked linage beside onely shall please appoynt vouchsafe accept dinner heere mee reason thereto moouing mee shall large acquainted withall appeared difficult borghese domenichi owne city perhaps yet name remaineth great reuerend authority dayes well deseruing eternal memory yet vertues commendable quality boast nobility predecessor man well entred yeares best language verie none could like among multiplicity queint discourse remember told v sometime liued florence yong gentleman named frederigo sonne signior philippo alberigho held reputed armes action beseeming gentleman hardly haue equall tuscany frederigo rare matter yong gentleman became enamored gentlewoman named madam giana esteemed time fairest gracious lady florence respect reach lesse honest faire made reckoning whatsoeuer sake least respect owne person frederigo spending thus daily meanes ability could maintaine supply way redounding faculty easily might diminished sort became poore nothing left small poore farme liue vpon silly reuenewes whereof meane scarcely allowed meat drinke yet faire hawke faulcon hardly fellowed expeditious sure flight low ebbe pouerty way quailing loue lady rather setting keener edge thereon saw city life could longer containe coueted abide therefore betooke himselfe poore countrey farme let faulcon get dinner supper patiently supporting penurious estate without suite meanes making one helpe reliefe necessity thus continued extremity came passe husband madam giana fell sicke debility body little hope life remained made last testament ordaining thereby sonne already growne indifferent stature heire land rich wherein hee abounded greatly next vnto chanced die without lawfull heire hee subsistuted wife dearely affected departed life madam giana thus left widow commonly custome city dame summer season shee went house owne countrey somewhat neere poore frederigoes farme liued honest kind contented pouerty hereupon young gentleman sonne taking great delight hound hawkes grew familiarity poore frederigo hauing seene many faire flight faulcon pleased extraordinarily earnestly desired enioy owne yet durst moue motion saw choycely frederigo esteemed within short young gentleman became sicke whereat mother greeued exceedingly hauing therefore loued entirely neuer parting either night day comforting kindly shee could demanding desire thing willing reueale assuring withall within compasse possibility haue youth hearing many time shee made offer vehement protestation performance last thus spake mother quoth doe much may haue frederigoes faulcon perswaded sicknesse soone cease lady hearing sate short musing selfe began consider shee might best doe compasse sonnes desire well shee knew long time frederigo louingly kept suffering euer sight moreouer shee remembred earnest affection beene neuer thinking himselfe happy onely company wherefore shee entred priuate consultation owne thought shall send goe selfe person request faulcon best euer flew onely iewell delight taken longer wish liue world farre voide vnderstanding shall shew selfe rob gentleman sole felicity hauing ioy comfort left like consideration wheeled troubled braine onely tender care loue sonne perswading selfe assuredly faulcon shee would request yet knowing whereon best resolue shee returned answer sonne sate still silent meditation length loue youth preuailed concluded contentation come could shee would send goe selfe person request returne home againe whereupon thus spake sonne comfort thy selfe let languishing thought longer offend thee promise thee first thing doe morrow morning shall iourney faulcon assure thy selfe bring whereat youth ioyed imagined sicknesse began instantly little leaue promised speedy recouery somewhat early next morning lady care sicke son health vp ready betimes taking another gentlewoman onely morning recreation shee walked frederigoes poore countrey farme knowing would little glad see time arriuall chance silly garden backeside house yet conuenient time flight heard madam giana come thither desired haue conference one almost confounded admiration haste minde though vtterly ouerthrowne fortune ala good soule afflicted nothing wherewith honor lady vp downe runnes one way againe another exclaiming disastrous fate like man enraged bereft sens one peny mony neither pawne pledge wherewith procure time hasted would gladly though meane measure expresse honourable respect lady begge nature denied borrow could neighbour needie himselfe last looking round exempted lawes common mother compelled obey power lawes contrary mine owne duty reason ought maintaine request gift certaine make precious account manly equity lesse fortune hath bin extreamly aduerse hath robbed pleasure allowing comfort delight onely poore one faire faulcone bird sonne become straungeiy desirous doe bring comming home feare much extreamity sicknesse nothing ensue thereon losse life wherefore beseech regard loue haue born therby stand way obliged owne true gentle nature hath alwayes declared selfe ready kinde office generally gentleman know pleased giue least let buy shall freely confesse onely meanes sonnes life saued wee shall euer remaine engaged frederigo heard lady request quite power graunt bene seruice dinner stoodlike man meerely dulled sences teares trickling child therefore generally beloued faile either vnfortunate marriage imperfection depending nature want good themselues haue nothing world giuen v regard make vse time employ better haue grow old husband yea dearest nearest friend scarcely looke v fit nothing sit fire kitchin telling tale cat counting pot pannes shelues nay worse rime song made v euen meere contempt age commendation young daintiest morsel fittest referred feed scrappes trencher reuersion spare v tell thee daughter thou couldst make choyce meerer woman city thou mightest safely open thy minde knowes better aduise thee doe remember withall poore part suffer pouerty vnsupplyed make thee partaker blessed pardon euery altar say pater noster aue maria thou maist prosper thy heart desire defended foule sinne shame shee labour friend gallant proper youth perugia yeelded scarcely seated table husband returned backe called let doore shee perceiued shee almost halfe dead feare coueting hide young man husband haue sight shee meanes enrry hard parlour purposed haue supt stood coope hen pen wherein vsed keepe pullen vnder crept shee couered old empty sacke ran let husband come entred house halfe offended sudden returne angerly saide seemes sir shauer meate haue made short supper troth wife quoth haue supt much eaten one bit hapned said woman mary wife quoth tell thus began herculano wife sitting downe table neere vnto v heard one sneeze whereof first made reckoning vntill heard againe second time yea third fourth fifth many whereat little amazed wife must tell entred roome sup herculanoes wife kept doore fast shut v would let v enter indifferent made somewhat offended much heard one sneeze often demanding reason thus sneezed house started table stepping little doore neere staires head necessarily made set thing otherwise would troublesome roome house commonly see like perceiued party hidden wee heard often sneeze sooner opened doore smell brimston came foorth whereof felt least sauour made v likewise cough sneeze way able refraine seeing husband much moued excused matter thus little shee whited certaine linnen smoake brimstone vsuall thing doe set pan spare place offensiue v time herculano espied sneezed almost stifled smell closenesse small roome wherein lay power helpe himselfe still continued coughing sneezing euen heart would haue split twaine foorth pluckt heeles perceiuing matter past saide thanke wife see reason kept v long comming roome let die beare wrong hand wife heard word saw discouery shame without returning either excuse answere foorth doores ran whither know herculano drew dagger would haue slaine still lay sneezing disswaded well respect also mine owne danger law censure deede young man indifferently recouered perswasion neighbour comming closely conueyed house noyse quietly pacified onely meanes flight herculanoes wife disappointed supper know reason soone returning heard whole discourse perceiued woman subiect like infirmity wise themselues shee could though like sinister accident might sometimes crosse gladly wished herculanoes wife excuse might serue acquite blaming others error owne may sometime chance escape discouery cleare v albeit guilty sharpe reprehending manner thus began see husband hansome behauiour holy faire seeming saint like woman durst haue confest sinnes conceiued religious perswasion liues integrity free least scruple taxation woman farre stept yeeres shee giue euill example younger woman sinne beyond sufferance accursed houre borne world selfe likewise lewdly incontinently giuen vniuersall shame slaunder good woman city shall terme woman rather sauage monster woman shape hath shee made open prostitution honesty broken plighted faith husband womanly reputation shee world husband honourable citizen entreating alwayes men else city doe wiues heartbreake must needes good man neither honest man else ought haue pity owne hand teare peeces dragge along good fire market place wherein minion consumed together base ash dispersed abroade winde least pure aire infected remembring owne case poore affrighted friend lay distresse vnder hencoope shee began aduise husband would pleased goe bed night passed apace pedro hauing better eate sleepe desired let haue meate else hee must goe bed empty bellie whereto shee answered husband quoth shee doe make large prouision debard company would wife herculano seeing cannot content selfe one night feeding considering ouerlate make thing ready fortuned certaine husbandman charge pedroes farme house countrey followed affaire husbandry returned home instant night hauing ass laden prouision vsed cityhouse ass vnladen set vp small stable without watering one belike thirsty rest brake loose wandering smelling seeke water happened entry young man lay hidden vnder henpen constrained like carpe lie flat belly coope ouerweighty carry one hand extended forth requisite vrgent shift hap ill fortune rather asse set foote young man finger treading hard paine irkesome enforced cry aloude pedro hearing wondered thereat little knowing cry house tooke candle hand going foorth parlour heard cry louder louder asse remoued foote rather trod firmely hand comming coope driuing thence asse taking old sacke e pyed young man beside painfull anguish felt finger arose vp trembling fearing outrage beside offered pedro knew youth perfectly demanded came thither answer make question humbly entreated charity sake would harme feare quoth pedro offer thee violence onely tel thou camest hither occasion wherin youth fully resolued pedro lesse ioyfull thus finding wife sorrowfull tooke hand brought parlour shee sate trembling quaking knowing say distresse seating himselfe directly holding youth still fast hand thus began oh wife bitter speech vse euen wife herculano maintaining shee shamed woman iustly deserued burned say much selfe heart speake could cruell knowing offence great questionlesse nothing else vrged thereto woman one condition couering owne grosse fault farre inferiour infirmity others peruerse generation meerely false fairest shewes saw offered violence gaue vaunting reproachfull speech holding still young man face meerely vexe despight shee began take heart thus replied doest thou compare wife herculano olde discembling hypocrite yet haue whatsoeuer desireth vseth woman ought fauour could neuer yet find thy hand put case thou keepest good garment allowing goe neatly hosed shod yet well thou knowest meete matter belonging woman euery way necessarily required preseruation houshold quietnesse rite betweene husband wife let worser garmented courser dieted yea debarred pleasure delight might worthy name mother leaue remembrance womanhood behind tell thee plainly pedro woman others subiect desire nature attendeth flesh bloud look thou failest kindnesse towards thinke amisse doe like thee endeauour thou win worthy tile father made mother pedro perceiued wife spoken nothing reason regard ouermuch neglect towards vsing houshold kindnesse ought man wife returned answer well wife quoth confesse fault hereafter labour amend conditionally youth may visite house mine absence get therefore something eate doubtlesse young man thy selfe fell short supper reason soone returning home troth husband saide shee eate one bit thing true loyall wife thee thou wilt like word wife replyed pedro forgotten forgiuen let v supper friend seeing anger well appeased louingly kissed laying cloth set supper shee prouided selfe youth supt together merily one vnkind word passing betweene supper youth sent away friendly manner pedro alwayes afterward louing wife formerly complaint passed either side mutuall ioy houshold contentment ought betweene man wife dioneus hauing ended tale lady returned thankes rather angerly frowned queene knowing gouernment concluded arose taking crowne lawrell placed graciously head madam eliza saying madam turne command eliza hauing receiued honour respect others formerly done enstructed master houshold concerning charge time regiment contentation company thus spake haue long since heard witty word ready answer sudden iests taunt many haue checkt reproued great folly others owne meane commendation pleasing kind argument ministring occasion mirth wit desire discourse morrow shall tend thereto meane person either men woman sudden witty answer haue encountred scorner owne intention layed blame iustly belonged euery one commended queenes appointment sauoured good wit iudgement queene risen discharged till supper time falling seuerall exercise themselues best fancyed supper ended instrument layed queenes consent madam aemillia vndertooke daunce song appointed dioneus began many none proued liking palpably obscene idle sauouring altogether owne wanton disposition length queene looking stearnely commanding sing good one none thus began song eye ye refraine hourely weeping eares depriude sweete attention thought haue lost quiet silent sleeping wit hath robde thee thy rare inuention lacke life motion giuing sencelesse shape true signes liuing eye gazde vpon angell beauty eares heard sweete delicious straines thought sleeping yet performe duty wit tooke springtly pleasure paine shee liue none scanting dead gone wanting dioneus proceeding declared finishing song many sung beside dioneus highly commended part night spent delightfull exercise fitting houre rest walking forth afterward vpon pearled dewe farre supposed conuenient faire familiar conference together according seuerally disposed repetition diuers passed nouels especially pleasing seemed present commendation sunne beeing somewhat higher mounted gaue sensible warmth ayre caused returne backe pallace table readily couered comming strewed sweet hearbes odoriferous flower seating themselues table heat grew violent according queene commanded dinner sung diuers excellent canzonnets went sleepe others played chesse table dioneus madam lauretta sung loueconflict betweene troylus cressida houre neuer befalne wit heard great noyse tumult among houshold seruants kitchin whereupon queene caused master houshold called demaunding noyse might occasion thereof made answere lacisca tindar word discontentment occasion thereof knew whereupon queene commanded sent anger violent speech still continuing come presence demaunded reason discord tindaro offering make answere lacisca somewhat ancient fiercer fiery spirit euen heart would haue leapt mouth turned selfe scornefull frowning countenance said see bold vnmannerly beastly fellow dare presume speake place stand saucy impudence giue better leaue answere turning queene thus shee proceeded madam idle fellow would maintaine signior sicophanto marrying madama dell grazza victory virginity first night auouched contrary shee mother twise faire aduenturing fortune dared affirme beside yong maides simple loose flourishing aprill time meere feare parent great preiudice amourous friend onely abused infinite promise yeare yeare shall haue husband lawes nature reason tyed tarry long rather ought lay hold vpon opportunity fairely friendly offered seldome come maides marriage beside haue heard know married wiues haue played diuers wanton prancks husband yet carried demurely smoothly haue gone free publique detection woodcocke credit thinking yong nouice borne yesterday larisca deliuering speech lady smiled one another knowing say case although queene fiue sixe seuerall time commaunded silence yet earnestnes spleen gaue attention held still euen vntill vttered pleased concluded complaint queene smiling countenance turned towards dioneus saying matter seemeth properly belong therefore dare repose trust nouels day shall ended conclude case definitiue sentence whereto dioneus presently thus replyed madam verdict already giuen without expectation affirme lacisca hath spoken sensibly shee woman good apprehension tindaro puny practise experience licisca heard fell lowd laughter turning selfe tindaro sayde honour day mine thine owne quarrell hath ouerthrowne thee fielde thou yet hath scarsely learned sucke wouldest thou presume know much doe couldst thou imagine mee trewant losse time came hither ignorant creature queene looking verie frowningly strictly enioyned silence shee would haue continued still triumphing humour fearing chastisement disobedience shee tindaro commanded thence allowance day onely silence attention enioyned speaker queene somewhat offended folly former controuersie commanded madame philomena giue beginning dayes nouels dutifull manner shee vndertooke doe seating selfe formall fashion modest gracious gesture thus began knight requested madam oretta ride behinde horsebacke promised tell excellent tale way lady perceiuing discourse idle much worse deliuered entreated let walke foote entertainment good liking honest cistio affayres fully concluded wer thus sent florence parting preparation due readinesse messer geri made sumptuous feast inuiting thereto part honourablest citizen fill good wine afterward serue sparing manner table gentleman might allowed halfe glassefull downsitting seruingman heard great report wine halfe offended could neuer taste thereof tooke great flaggon bottle containing foure fiue gallon least comming therewith vnto cistio saide vnto cistio master cannot haue companie among friend prayes il bottle best wine cistio looking vppon huge flaggon replyed thus honest fellow messer geri neuer sent thee message although seruingman stoutly maintained yet getting answer returned backe therwith master messer geri returned seruant backe againe vnto cistio saying goe assure cistio sent thee hee make thee answeres demaund place else send thee come againe cistio hee auouched maister sent cistio affirming hee seruant asked place else hee send marrie quoth cistio vnto riuer arno runneth florence thou mayest sure fill thy flaggon seruant reported answer messer geri eye vnderstanding beganne open calling see bottle hee carried sooner looked huge flaggon seuerely reprouing sawcinesse seruant hee sayde trust mee cistio told thee nothing trueth neither send thee dishonest message reason yeeld grant sent bottle reasonable competencie soone cistio saw yea mary friend quoth sure thy master sent thee shall haue desire h rt commaunding bottle filled sent away seruant presently following came vnto messer geri spake vnto maner sir would haue imagine huge vile harsh natured man lord marshall vnderstanding made madde composition giue fiue hundred ducates gold condition hee would let lye one night wife thinking base minded giue consent greedy auaritious humour bargaine absolutely agreeed lord marshall prepared fit payment caused many peeces siluer cunningly guilded went currant mony florence called popolines lyen lady contrary knowledge husband closely carried businesse money duely paid cornuted coxcombe afterwards impudent shame chanced generally knowne nothing remaining wilful wittoll losse expected gaine scorne euery place went bishop likewise beeing discreete sober man would seeme take knowledge thereof bare scoffes well setled countenance within short bishop lord marshal alwaies conuersing together came passe vpon saint iohns day rinucci gentleman well knowne vnto v goodly beautifull yong woman delicate language singular spirite dwelling close peter gate lady bishop shew marshall come laying hand vppon shoulder said madam nonna thinke gallant dare aduenture another wager apprehension witty lady word seemed taxe honour else contaminate hearer vnderstanding whereof great plenty whose iudgement might vile speech felt themselues touched quicke one factor broker dishonest businesse brother bishop receiuing owne person shame belonging brother much looking speaking one word together rest day rode away blushing sitting silent answer lady nonna hauing past generall applause queene commanded madame neiphila follow next order instantly thus began although ready wit faire lady doth many time affoord worthy commendable speech according accident happening speaker yet notwithstanding fortune ready helper diuers wayes timorous doth often tippe tongue present reply partie speake much leysure thinke yet inuent purpose let perceiue prety short nouell messer currado gianfiliazzi haue seene knowen liuing alwayes citie estate noble citizen beeing man bountifull magnificent within degree knighthoode continually kept hawkes hound taking meane delight pleasure yeelded neglecting farre serious imployments wherewith present subiect presumeth meddle vpon day hauing kilde faulcon crane neere village called peretola finding young fat sent cooke venetian borne named chichibio command haue prepared supper chichibio resembled indeede plaine simple honest mery fellow hauing drest crane ought bee put spit laide fire well neere fully roasted gaue forth delicate pleasing sauour fortuned young woman dwelling far named brunetta chichibio somewhat enamored entred kitchin feeling excellent smell crane please beyond sauours euer felt entreated chichibio verie earnestly hee would bestow legge thereof whereto chichibio like pleasant companion euermore delighting singing sung answer brunetta faire feata say meate master allowes taster go kitchin go many speech past betweene short end chichibio hee would haue mistresse brunetta angrie cut away one crane legges spit gaue eate afterward fowle serued vp table messer carrado inuited certain stranger friend sup wondering little called chichibio cook demanding become crane legge whereto venetian lyar nature sodainely answered sir crane haue one legge bird messer currado growing verie angry replyed wilt thou tell crane hath one legge neuer see crane chichibio pe sisting resolutely deniall saide beleeue sir haue told nothing truth please wil make good wordes fowles liuing messer currado kinde loue stranger hee inuited supper gaue ouer contestation onely said seeing thou assurest let see thy affirmation truth fowles liuing thing yet neuer saw heard content make proofe thereof morrow morning till shall rest satisfied vpon word finde otherwise expect sound payment thy knauery iustly deserueth make thee remember thy life time contention ceassing night season messer currado though slept well remained still discontented minde arose morning breake day puffing blowing angerly called horse commanding chichibio mount one riding towards riuer earely euery morning ene plenty crane sayde man shall see anon sirra whether thou lyed yesternight chichibio perceiuing master anger yet asswaged stood vpon make good lye knowing rode master fearfully trembling way gladly would haue made escape hee could possible meanes euery side looked behinde espy crane standing legges would haue bin ominous sight come neere riuer chanced see rest vpon banke thereof dozen crane number standing vpon one legge vse sleeping whereupon shewing quickly messer currado said sir selfe may see whether told true yesternight sure crane hath one thigh one leg present apparant witness haue bin good promise messer currado looking crane well vnderstanding knauery man replyed stay little sirra shew thee crane hath two thighes two legges riding somwhat neerer cryed aloud shough shough caused set downe leg fled away made pace winde mounting going vnto chichibio said lying knaue hath crane two leg chichibio wellneere wit end knowing answer hee make euen came sodainly minde said sir perceiue right would haue done much yesternight cryed shough questionlesse crane would haue set legge heere fled away meanes might haue lost supper sodaine vnexpected witty answere comming loggerheaded lout seasonably owne safety pleasing messer currado fell hearty laughter forgetting anger saide chichibio thou hast quit thy selfe well contentment albeit aduise thee teach mee trickes heereafter thus chichibio sodaine merry answer escaped sound beating otherwise master inflicted messer forese da rabatte maister giotto painter profession comming together mugello scornfully reprehended one another deformity body fift nouell whereby may bee obserued speake contemptibly others ought first looke respectiuely owne imperfection soone madame neiphila sate silent lady hauing greatly commended pleasant answer chichibio pamphilus command queene spake manner woorthy lady commeth passe oftentimes like fortune obserued diuers wayes hide vnder vile noted two owne citizen purpose speake fewe word one named messer forese de rabatta man little low person yet deformed body flat face like terrier beagle comparison almost could bee made vgly messer forese riding lofty french trot euerie step ready hoise saddle hearing giotto discreete answer euery ydle question made indeede elegant speaker began peruse surueigh euen foote head vse say perceiuing greatly deformed man could worse opinion without consideration owne mishaping bad rather vnsightly hee scoffing laughing humour hee saide giotto doest thou imagine stranger neuer seene thee happen companie would beleeue thee bee best painter world indeede thou art presently giotto without meditation returned answere signior forese think might beleeue beholding hee could imagine learned b c forese heard knew owne error saw payment returned coine sold ware yong ingenious scholler vnkindly reuiled smitten ignorant father procurement vnlearned vicare afterward attained doubly reuenged notwithstanding whosoeuer cull graine graine defect incident humane race must confesse wee borne knowledge onely heauens illuminating bright radiance wherein consisteth sourse wellspring science little little bestow influence bounty manie please expresse themselues thankfull blessing although grace doth lessen misfortune many ouermighty bee yet sawcie presuming themselues doe bewray ignorance certaine village piccardie liued priest vicar beeing meerely ignorant blocke yet peremptorie presuming spirite though sufficiently discerned yet hee beguiled many thereby vntill last deceyued himselfe due chastisement folly plaine husbandman dwelling village possessed much land liuing verie grosse dull vnderstanding entreaty diuers friend wellwillers something intelligable himselfe became incited rather prouoked send sonne vniuersity paris study fitting scholler end quoth hauing son onely fortune blessing abounding store hee might likewise haue rich minde true treasure indeede aristippus giueth v aduice furnished withall friend perswasions hauing preuailed hee continued space three yeares document attayned going thither meanes happie memory time wherewith young man singularly endued short attained performed greater part study oftentimes commeth passe loue father surmounting affection man made olde farmer desirous see sonne caused sending conuenient speede obedience vrged forward willingnesse thereto good olde man little ioyfull see good condition health encreased much stature since parting thence familiarly told earnestly desired know minde body attained competent equall growth within three foure dayes would put practise helpe silly simple man master vicar must bee questioner poser son wherein priest vnwilling meddle feare discouering owne ignorance passed vnder better opinion deserued farmer beeing imimportunate vicar many wayes beholding durst returne deniall vndertooke formally bene able man indeede see fooles borne fortunate least hope find best successe simplicitie father must meanes abusing schollerly son skreene stand betweene priest ignorance earnest olde man know farre sonne profited schoole note might best take vnderstanding answeres iumping fit vicar vanity warrantable cloake couer knauery appoints one word onely namely nescio wherewith answered demand euident token hee vnderstood nothing thus walking conferring church farmer carefull remember word nescio came passe vpon sodaine young man entred great contentment father prayed master vicar make approbation sonne whether learned hee benefited vniuersity time day salutation past betweene vicar subtle crafty walked along one tomb church pointing finger tombe priest vttered word scholler quis hic est sepultus yong scholler reason erected since departure finding inscription whereby informe answered well hee might nescio immediately father keeping word perfectly memorie grewe verie angerly passionate desiring heare demaunds gaue three foure box care many harsh iniurious speech tearming asse villaine learned thing sonne pacien returned answer plainly perceiued tricke intended malicious treachery priest time might reuenged within short suffragane part vnder priest deputy holding benefice great charge conscience abroad visitation sent word vicar intended preach next sunday hee prepare readinesse bonum commodum hee would haue nothing else dinner heereat master vicar greatly amazed neuer heard word neither could hee finde breuiarie hereupon went yong scholler lately abused cry mercy many impudent shallow excuse desired reueale meaning word vnderstand bonum commodum scholler sober modest countenance made answere bin ouermuch abused neuerthelesse tooke impaciently hee already forgot forgiuen promise comfort extraordinary distraction greefe minde perused suffraganes letter well obseruing blushlesse ignorance priest seeming outward appearance take strangely cryed alowd saying name vertue may man meaning quoth priest maner demand make ala replyed scholler haue one poore asse know loue deerely yet must stew genitories daintily patron haue meat dinner genitories mine asse answered priest passion shall carrie corne mill remedie sayde scholler hath set downe absolute resolution priest considered thereon himselfe remembring yearely reuennewes clearely hee put vp purse ten time farre greater worth asse concluded haue gelded danger soeuer ensue thereon preparing readinesse comming soone suffragan arriued heauily hee complained asse kinde language vnderstanding knew meant answer beeing scholler acquainted whole history laughed heartily priest ignorant folly wishing bold bayard time time might serued likewise ignorant priest vicar grashoppers townes village sometimes haue onely seene partes ationis quod sunt stand ouermuch owne sufficiency grounded soly vpon grammar beware iest withall without medling schollers take iniuries dullard doe least proue infamous disputation madam phillippa accused husband rinaldo de puglie e tooke adulterie yong gentleman named lazar de guazzagliotri caused bee cited iudge deliuered selfe sodaine witty pleasant answer moderated seuere strict statute formerly made woman seuenth nouell wherein declared worth confesse trueth facetious witty excuse madame fiammetta giuen ouer speaking auditory sufficiently applauded schollers honest reuenge queene enioyned philostratus proceede next nouell caused begin thus beleeue lady excellent commendable thing speak well purpose hold matter much greater worth know necessity doth require gentlewoman speake well enstructed onely yeelded hearer mirthfull contentment likewise deliuered danger death word shal heare related citie pirato edict statute lesse blameworthy speake vprightly seuere cruell without making distinction gaue strict command euerie woman burned fire whose husband found acte adultery secret familiar friend one deseruing bee thus abandoned like prostituted body publike sale hire continuance sharpe edict fortuned gentlewoman named phillippa found chamber one night armes yong gentleman city named lazarino de guazzagliotori owne husband called rinaldo de pugliese shee louing young gallant owne life hee compleate perfection euery way deerely addicted sight irkesome rinaldo ouercom extreame rage hee could hardly containe running violent intent kill feare owne life caused forbearance meaning reuenged better way heate spleene fury setting aside respect owne shame would need prosecute rigour deadly edict held lawfull although extended death wife heereupon hauing witness sufficient approoue guiltinesse offence day appointed without desiring counsell went person accuse required iustice gentlewoman high vndauntable spirite haue fixed affection resoluedly loue vppon grounded deliberation concluded quite counsell opinion parent kindred friend appeare court desiring rather dye confessing trueth manly courage denying loue vnto worthy person whose arm chanced taken liue basely exile shame eternall scandall race potestate shee made apparance worthily accompanied men woman aduising deny acte minding perswasions looking iudge constant countenance voyce setled resolue craued know hee demaunded potestate well noting braue carriage singular beautie praiseworthy part word apparantly witnessing heighth minde beganne take compassion doubted least shee would confesse matter enforce pronounce sentence death boldly scorning delayes protraction time demanded accusation madame answered potestate sory tel need must husband see present heere coplainant auouching tooke act adultery another man therefore requireth according rigour statute heere force v pronounce sentence consequently infliction death cannot confesse fact therefore well aduised answer tell truth husband accuseth lady without dismay dread pleasantly thus replied lord true rinaldo husband found night named betweene armes lazarino many time heeretofore hath embraced mee according mutuall loue replighted together deny euer know well enough certaine lawes enacted countrey ought common made consent concerne edict quite contrarie rigorous none poore woman onely able yeeld much better content satisfaction generally remaineth power men moreouer law made woman gaue consent neither called like allow thereof respect may deseruedly termed vniust law preiudice bodie owne soule executioner vnlawfull edict consisteth power please proceede pronounce sentence may please fauour one small request namely would demand husband time whensoeuer tooke delight company euer made curiosity came vnwillingly whereto rinaldo without tarrying potestate mooue question sodainly answered vndoubtedly wife time oftner could request neuer sparing kindnesse put deniall lady continuing former speech thus replyed let demand lord potestate iudge husband owne free confession hath alwaies pleasure without least refusall contradiction doe ouerplus remaining mine owne power whereof need would haue mee cast away dogges fitting pleasure therwith worthy gentleman euen death doore loue husband surfetting hauing neede let lye languishing dye neuer heard examination come woman worth part honourable pratosians lord lady present hearing vrge necessary question cryed aloud together one voice laughed fill lady saide well might departed thence comfortable aduice proceeding potestate edict reputed ouercruell modified interpreted concerne onely offered iniurie husband money meanes rinaldo standing one confounded foolish vnaduised enterprize departed auditorie ladie little ioyfull bee thus freed deliuered fire returned home victorie owne house fresco da celatico counselled aduised neece cesca deserued looked offensiue eye often told forbeare looke eighth nouell iust scorne vnsightly illpleasing surly slut imagine none faire wellfauoured themselues philostratus recounting nouell seemed lady heard found themselues much mooued thereat wanton blood monting vp cheekes plainly appeared end looking strange behauiour could forbeare smiling queene interrupting command attention turning madame aemillia willed follow next puffing blowing bene newly awaked sleepe began manner faire beauty thought hauing wandred great distance hence easily collect together againe obedience yet queene shall report much shorter nouell otherwise perhappes haue done minde beene little neerer home shall tell grosse fault foolish damosell well corrected witty reprehension vnckle shee bin endued much sence haue vnderstood honest man named fresco da celatico good fulsom wench neece folly squemishnes generally called cesta nice francesca although stature sufficient yet none handsomest good hard fauourd countenance nothing nere angelical beauty haue seen yet endued height minde proud opinion selfe appeared custome bred hir rather gift bestowed hir nature thogh none best blame despise men woman yea whosoeuer lookt without consideration self vnsightly ill shaped vgly faced worse hardly found nothing could done time yeilde liking content moreouer waspish nice squemish cam royall court france hatefull contemptible hir whensoeuer went street euery thing stunke noisome neuer thing stop nose men woman met withall whatsoeuer else lookt stinking offensiue let v leaue relation ill condition euery way indeed bad hardly becomming sensible body cannot condemne much chanced vpon day shee comming home house vnckle dwelt declared wonted scuruy scornfull behauiour swelling puffing pouting extreamly humor sat downe vnckle desiring know displeased said francesca may meaning bee solemne festiuall day reason soone returning home coily biting lip brideling head bene man best gelding sprucely thus replyed indeede say true vnckle come home verie earely since day birth neuer saw city pestered vnhandsome people men woman worse high holyday euer obserue walked thorow store streetes could see one proper man woman mishapen vgly creature god made one sory euer borne longer able endure vnpleasing sight wil thinke vnckle anger come home fresco whome stinking quality neece seemed vnsufferable hee could patience endure longer thus short quickely answered francesca people citie men woman odious thy eye offensiue thy nose thou hast often reported bee aduised counsell stay stil home look vpon none thy selfe onely thou shalt sure cannot displease thee shee empty wit pithlesse cane yet thought iudgement exceed salomon could vnderstand lest part hir vnkles meaning stood senselesse sheepe onely replyed would resort part country shee found weakly furnished handsome people heere shee shee would conceiue better selfe euer done signior guido caualcante sodaine witty answer reprehended rash folly certaine florentine gentleman thought scorne flout ninth nouell notably discouering great difference betweene learning ignorance vpon iudicious apprehension queene perceiued madame aemillia discharged nouell none remained speake next onely selfe priuiledge alwayes remembred belonged last began manner faire company haue day disappointed two nouells least whereof intended make vse neuerthelesse shall imagine mee vnfurnished haue left one store conclusion whereof may minister instruction bee reputed ydle impertinent rather materiall consequence better hath day past among v vnderstand faire lady former time long since past cittie many excellent commendable customes whereof vnhappy dayes cannot say poore one remaineth hath beene much encrease wealth couetousnesse onely supplanter good quality whatsoeuer among lawdable friendly obseruations one well deseruing note namely diuers place florence men best house euery quarter sociable neighbourly assemblie together creating company consist certaine number able supply expences day one morrow another thus kinde friendly course daily furnished table rest company oftentimes honour diuers gentleman stranger vpon arriuall citty inuiting assembly many worthiest citizen beside grew customary vse one especially day yeare appointed memory louing meeting would ride triumphally horsebacke thorow cittie sometimes performing tilt tourneyes martiall exercise reserued feastiuall dayes among company one called signior betto bruneleschi earnestly desirous procure signior guido caualcante de caualcanti make one friendly society without great reason ouer beside one best logitians time could yeeld better also absolute naturall philosopher wortby quality little esteemed among honest meeter friendly gentleman singularly well spoken whatsoeuer else commendable man way wanting wealthy withall able returne equall honor found duly deserued man therin could go beyond signior betto notwithstanding long continued importunitie could draw assembly made rest company conceiue solitude guid retiring himselfe alwaies familiar conuersing men prouoked many curious speculation retained part epicurean opinion vulgare iudgement passed speculation tended end onely finde neuer done chanced vpon day signior guido departing church saint michaell dhorta passing along adamari farre saint iohns church euermore customarie walke many goodly marble tombes saide church adayes saint reparata diuers beside entring among collumbes porphiry sepulcher doore church shut signior betto companie came riding reparata espying signior guido among graues tombes said come let v go make iests anger putting spur horse rode apace towards vpon perceiued one said guido thou refusest one society seekest neuer thou hast found tell v wilt thou guido seeing himselfe round engirt sodainly thus replyed gentleman may vse mee owne house please setting hand one tombes somewhat great tooke rising leapt quite ouer side agile sprightly body thus freed went away owne lodging stoode like men amazed strangely looking one vpon another began afterward murmure among themselues guido man without vnderstanding answer made vnto purpose neither sauoured discretion meerely came empty brain place citizen signior guido himselfe little whereto signior betto thus replyed ala gentleman selues void vnderstanding obserued answer made vnto v hee honestly verie word onely notably expresse owne wisedome also deseruedly reprehend v wee obserue thing ought doe graues tombes house dead ordained prepared latest dwelling tolde v moreouer although haue heere life habitation abidings yet like must last house let v know foolish indiscreete vnlearned men worse dead men comparison men equall skill learning therefore wee heere among graues monument may well said farre owne house soone shall possessor regard frailty attending v euery one could presently say signior guido spoken nothing truth much ashamed owne folly shallow estimation made guido desiring neuer meddle grossely thanking signior betto well reforming ignorance much better apprehension fryer onyon promised certaine honest people countrey shew feather phoenix noah arke ed whereof found coales auouched coal wherewith phoenix roasted tenth nouell wherein may obserued palpable abuse many time passe vnder counterfeit cloake religion deliuered nouels dioneus knowing remained relate last day without attending solemne command imposed silence could sufficiently commend witty reprehension guido thus began wise worthy lady although priuiledge haue granted lawfull speake thing best pleasing self yet notwithstanding part meaning varrie matter method whereof haue spoken good purpose therefore following footsteppes entend tell craftily rampiar sodainly raised owne defence religious frier saint anthony order shunned shame two wily companion prepared let offend run large discourse day hath bene vsed apter comple ting nouell well obserue sun yet middest heauen therefore may better forbeare certoldo perhaps know haue heard village vale elsa vnder authority commaund florence although small yet former time hath bin inhabited gentleman people especiall respect religious friar anthony order named friar onyon long time vsed resort thither receiue beneuolent almes charitably affected people simplicity gaue chiefly diuers day year whe bounty deuotion would extend themselues largely season much rather thought good pastor holy life outward appearance carried name much greater matter remained man indeed beside part country yeilded far plentifull abundance onyons tuscany elsewhere kinde foode greatly affected friar men alwaies hungry good appetite friar onyon man litle stature red haire chearfull countenance world afforded crafty companion moreouer albeit little knowledge learning yet prompt ready voluble speech vttering often knew himselfe wel acquainted quality supposed singular rhetoritian excelling cicero quintilian themselues gossip friend deerely affected euery one dwelling part according wonted custome one time went thither month august sunday morning dweller thereabout present heare masse chiefest church aboue rest friar saw time conuenient purpose aduanced himselfe began speake manner gentleman gentlewoman know haue kept commendable custom sending yeerly poore brother lord baron anthony corne prouision lesse according power mean deuotion end blessed anthony carefull ox sheep ass swine pig cattle moreouer haue vsed pay especially haue name registred fraternity duty annually send vnto v collection whereof sent superior namely l abbot therfore god blessing may come noone hither shal heare bel church ring wil make predication shall kisse crosse beside know al deuout seruants lord baron anthony especiall grace fauor wil shew holy goodly relique selfe long since brought holy land beyond sea desire know let tell one feather phoenix arke patriarch noah hauing thus spoken became silent returning backe heare masse hee deliuered like speech among people church two shrewde crafty companion one named iohn de bragoniero biagio pizzino subtile fellowes heard report fry onyons relique althogh intimate friend came thither company yet concluded betweene themselues shew tricke legierdumaine steale feather intelligence friar onyons di ing day castle worthy friend sooner set table away went haste inne fryar frequented determination biagio hold conference friar boy fellow ransackt wallet finde feather carry away future obseruation friar would say vnto people found losse feather could performe promi e fryars boy called guccio balena guccio imbrata others guccio porco knauish lad many bad quality lippo topo cunning painter curious poeticall wit ability describe friar onyon often obserue behauiour would make report among friend boy quoth hath nine rare quality salomon aristotle seneca onely one sufficient torment trouble vertue sens sanctity consider manner man like hauing nine rarity yet voide vertue wit goodnes demaunded friar onyon nine rare condition hee hauing readie heart rime thus answered boyes haue knowne seene heard many lying loytring lazinesse facing filching filthinesse carelesse gracelesse vnthriftinesse boy excelleth ouer beside admirable quality hee hath manie singularity fauour towards faine conceale smile would haue wife euery place commeth yea good house boot regard beard beginneth shew selfe rising thicke haire blacke amiable verily perswaded woman fall loue refuse follow hast run truly notable seruant mee cannot speake one neuer great secrecy sure heare part question demanded standes awe feare displeasure bee sure make first answer yea according thinketh conuenient proceede left friar onyon hauing left seruiceable youth lodging see bodie meddle commodity especially wallet sacred thing therein contained guccio imbrata earnestly affected kitchin bird hop branch branch especially anie chambermaides espyed one hostess female attendant grosse fat trugge low stature ill faced worse formed paire brest like two bumbards smelling loathsomely grease sweate downe shee descended kitchin like kite vpon peece carion boy knaue chuse whither style hauing carelesly left fryar onyons chamber doore open holy thing much neglected although moneth august heate highest predominance yet hee would need sit downe sire began conferre amiable creature called name nuta set close told gentleman atturniship million crownes life time would serue spend beside payed away dayly hauing conuenient imployment moreouer knew speake thing beyond wonder admiration neuer remembring olde tatterd friar cowle snottie greazie good store kitchin stuffe might haue beene boiled also foule slouenly trusse halfe doublet baudied bowsing fat greazie lubbetly sweating drudgery conuent kitchin officer meanest credite describe sweet youth liuely colour naturall perfection body artificiall composure garment neuer came fowlest silk tartaria india vgly vnsightly bee lookt vpon addition neate knauery breech rent betweene legges shooes stocking bin mercilesse massacre gallantest commandador castile though neuer lately bin releast slauery could haue wisht better garment make larger promise nuta protesting entitle onely free inne chamber thraldomes would liue loue partaker present possession succeed future fortune brauadoes though belcht foorth admirable insinuation yet conuerted smoke braggadochio behauiours wise ending began former named two craftie companion seeing guccio porco seriously employed nuta therewith little contented intended labour halfe ended perceiuing contradiction crosse proceeding friar onyons chamber entred finding ready open purpose first thing came hand search wallet opened found small cabinet wrapped great many folding rich taffata hauing vnfolded fine formall key hanging thereat wherwith hauing vnlockt cabinet found faire feather parrot taile supposed bee verie meant shew people certaldo truly dayes hard matter make beleeue thing idle vanity aegypt remoter part yet bin seene tuscany since haue bin great abundance vtter ruine almost italy although might knowne yet inhabitant country generally vnderstoode little nothing pure simplicitie ancient predecessours still continuing seene parrot much heard speech wherefore two crafty consort little ioyfull finding feather tooke thence beecause would leaue cabinet empty espying charcoales lying corner chamber filled wrapping vp againe taffata demure manner found away came feather neither seene suspected one intending heare friar onyon would say vppon losse precious relique finding coales placed insted thereof simple men woman country bin morning masse church heard wonderful feather see noone returned hast house one telling newes another gossip gossip consulting theron made shorter dinner afterward flocked maine troopes castle contending shold first get entrance deuotion see holy feather friar onyon hauing dined reposed litle wine arose table window beholding multitude came see feather assured himselfe good store mony hereupon sent boy guccio imbrata vppon bel ringing come bring wallet much ado soone quarrell ended kitchin amiable chambermaid nuta away went holy commodity sooner arriued belly readie burst drinking water sent church ring bel onely would warme cold water belly likewise make run gaunt greyhound people assembled church together friar onyon neuer distrusting iniurie offered close commodity bin medled withal began predication vttering thousand lie fit purpose came shew feather phoenix hauing first great deuotion finisht confession caused two goodly torch lighted ducking downe head three seuerall time hee would much touch taffata opened much reuerence soone cabinet came seen went hood lowly bowed downe body vttering especial praise phoenix sacred property wonderfull relique couer cabinet lifte vppe saw bee full coales could suspect villaine boy deede knew endued much wit onely hee curst keeping better curst himselfe also reposing trust careles knaue knowing slothfull disobedient negligent void honest vnderstanding grace sodainly without blushing lest losse discerned lifted lookes hand heauen speaking loude euery one might easily heare thus thou omnipotent prouidence euer let thy power praised making fast cabinet againe turning himselfe people lookes expressing admiration proceeded manner lord lady rest worthy auditor vnderstand young sent superiour part sun appeareth first rising receiued charge expresse command seeke much consisted power especiall vertues priuiledges belonging porcellane although boyling thereof bee worth little yet profitable v regard whereof vpon iourney departing venice passing along borgo de grecia proceeded thence horseback realme garbo baldacca till came parione whence without great extremity thirst arriued sardignia trouble repetition many country coasted still past saint george arme truffia buffia country much inhabited great people thence went land lying found store brother religion many beside shunned paine labour onely loue god cared litlte paine trauailes others tooke except benefit arised thereby spend money country without stampe thence went land abruzza men woman goe galoches ouer mountaines make garment swine gut farre thence found people carried bread staues wine satchel parting arriued among mountaines bacchus water run downe deepe fall short time went far found selfe india pastinaca swear holy habit weare body saw serpent flye thing incredible neuer seene would loth lye soone departed thence met maso de saggio great merchant found cracking nut felling cockle retale neuerthelesse al could finde sought therefore passe hence water intended trauaile thither returning back came holy land coole fresh bread sold foure penny hot giuen away nothing found venerable father blame beseech woorthie patriarch ierusalem reuerence due habite weare loue lord baron saint anthony would haue see al holy reliques vnder charge wherof many recount neuer could come conclusion yet leaue discomforted relate first shewed finger holy ghost whole perfect euer next nose cherubin appeared saint france payring naile seraphin one ribbes verbum caro fastened one windowes couered holy garment catholique faith tooke darke chappel shewed diuers beames starre appeared three king east also violl saint michael sweate combatted diuell iawbone dead lazarus many precious thing beside liberall giuing two plaines monte morello vulgare edition chapter del caprezio long laboured search bestowed reliques first gaue one eyetooth santa crux litle violl filled part sound belle hung sumptuous temple salomon next gaue mee feather phoenix noah arke told one woodden patten good saint gerrard de magnavilla vsed weare trauailes gaue long since gerrardo di bousy florence respected much deuotion moreouer gaue coales wherwith phoenix noah roasted thing brought away thence true superiour would neuer suffer mee shew vntill faithfully cer ified whether precious reliques perceyuing sundrie myracles haue wrought letter sufficient credence receyued reuerend patriarch true hath graunted permission shew wold trust one matter moment selfe brought hither must tell feather phoenix conueyed small cabinet casket bent broken coales said phoenix roasted put another casket respect like former many time haue take one another instant hath bin fortune imagining brought casket feather mistooke self brought coales wherein doubtles haue offended certaine order thing ordred diuine direction blessed patron lorde baron saint anthony much rather senight hence feast saint anthony bee solemnized preparation whereof kindle zeale greater feruencie put casket coales hand meaning let see feather fitting season therefore blessed sonnes daughter put bonnet come hither deuotion looke vpon first let tell whosoeuer marked coales signe crosse shal liue yeare happily fire whatsoeuer shall come neere touch hurt singing solemne antheme praise anthony vnveyled casket shewed coales openly simple multitude hauing great admiration reuerence long beheld thronged crouds fryar onyon giuing farre greater offering enteating marke whereupon taking coales hand began marke garment white veyles woman head cross meane extendure affirming coales wasted making great cross still encreased casket often hee made triall manner hauing crossed certaldanes great benefit abuse smiled sodaine dexterious deuise mockery thought haue made scorne dispossessing feather bragoniero pizzino present learned predication hauing heard cunning shift found come cleanly without least detection deliuered admirable protestation faine forsake church least haue burst laughing people parted gone met friar onyon inne closely discouered done deliuering feather againe yeare following yeeld much money coales done nouell affoorded equall pleasing whole companie friar onyons sermon much commended especially long pilgrimage reliques seene brought home afterward queene perceiuing reigne full expiration graciously arose taking crowne owne head placed head dioneus saying high time dioneus taste part charge paine poore woman haue felt vndergone soueraigntie gouernment wherefore king rule v awefull authority ending dominion may yeelde v contentment dioneus thus inuested crowne returned answer make doubt bright beauty many time haue seene good better king among chessemen yet certainty would obedient ought dutie vnto true king grant liberall freedome wherein take delight without choisest desire neuer compleate neuerthelesse meane gouernment shal according mine owne minde causing master houshold called rest wont conference gaue direction al thing fitting time regiment turning lady thus proceeded honest lady haue alreadie discoursed variable deuises many seuerall manner humane industry concerning busines wherewith licisca came acquaint v word haue ministred matter sufficient morrowes conference else stand doubt could haue deuised conuenient theame v talke haue heard saide shee anie neighbour came true virgin husband added moreouer knew others beguiled husbandes cunning crafty manner setting aside first part concerning proofe child conceiue second bee apte intended argument respect seeing licisca hath giuen v good occasion discoursing morow may onely concerne slye cunning deceit woman haue heeretofore vsed satisfying owne appetite beguiling husband without knowledge suspition cleanly escaping argument seemed pleasing lady therefore vrged alteration thereof matter better suting day discoursing whereto thus answered lady know well selues would haue instant argument altered change haue power considering season shielding men woman medling dishonest action lawfull v speake wee please know sad occasion time ouerruleth v iudges haue forsaken venerable bench lawes diuine humane ceasing granting ample license euery one best agreeth conseruation life therefore honesty doe straine themselues little thinking speaking prosecution immodest deede onely familiar blamelesse entercourse cannot deuise conuenient ground least carrieth apparant reason reproofe peril ensue moreouer company hath bin honest since first day meeting instant appeareth iot disgraced thing either said done neither shal hope meanest degree knowing choise vertuous disposition powerfull owne preuailing wanton word cannot misguide wayes terror death selfe dare insinuate distempred thought admit slight shallow iudgements hearing perhaps sometimes talk amorous folly therefore suspitiously imagine faulty else would bee sparing speech wit censure alike sauouring rather owne vile nature would brand others basebred imperfection yet ther another consideration beside som great iniury offered mine honor whereof know acquit yourselues haue bin obedient borne heauy load businesse hauing full consent created mee king would wrest law hand dispose authoritie please forbeare gentle lady friuolous suspitions fit full bad thought haue true vertue shining eye therefore let euery one freely speake minde according humor best pleaseth lady heard made answer bee answerable minde whereupon king gaue leaue dispose themselues till supper time sun yet high regard recounted nouels bin short dioneus went play table another yong gentleman madame eliza hauing withdrawne lady aside thus spake vnto time heere haue often bene desirous let see place somwhat neere hand suppose haue neuer seene called valley lady till could finde conuenient time bring thither sunne continuing still aloft fitteth apter leysure sight sure way discontent lady replyed ready walk thither calling one woman attend set without speaking word men within distance halfe mile arriued valley lady wherinto entred strait passage one side whence issued forth cleare running riuer found saide valley bee goodly pleasant especially season hottest yeare world able yeeld like one said lady since related mee
