plaine valley fo directly round beene formed compasse yet rather resembled workmanship nature made hand man containing circuite somewhat quarter mile enuironed sixe small hils great height stood little palace shaped fashion castle groundplots descending hils mountaines grew lesse lesse variable degree wee obserue entering theater highest part lowest succinctly narrow circle order concerning groundplottes little meadowes sun southward looked full vine oliuetrees almondtrees cherrytrees figgetrees diuers tree beside plentifully bearing fruites could discerne hand bredth losse mountaines whereon northerne windes blow curiously couered small thicket wood oakes ash tree greene straite impossible behold fairer goodly plaine selfe hauing entrance lady came planted tree firre cipresse laurell pine singularly growing formall order artificiall cunning hand planted sun hardly piercing branch top bottome euen highest part course whole field richly spred grasse variety delicate flower nature yeilded plenteous storehouse gaue lesse delight rest smal running brooke descending one vallies diuided two little hils nd fell veine intire rocke selfe fall murmure thereof delightfull heare seeming way descent like quickesiluer weauing selfe artificiall workes arriuing plaine beneath receyued small channell swiftly running midst plaine place stayed shaped selfe lake pond citizen haue orchard garden please make vse commodity pond deeper reach breast man hauing mud soyle bottome thereof shewed like small beaten grauell prety pibble stone intermixed nothing else would sit downe count lay easily might onely bottome thus apparantly seene also plenty fish swimming euery way mind neuer wearied looking water bounded bankes onely side plain medow made appeare sightly arose swelling plenty alwayes superabounded course least uerflow disorderly fell another channell conueying along lower valley ran forth water needfull place lady arriued goodly valley vpon aduised viewing sufficiently commended regard heat day great place tempting pond free sight resolued bathe themselues wherefore sent waiting gentlewoman haue diligent eye way entered least one chance steale vpon seuen stript naked water went hid delicate white body like cleare glasse concealeth damask rose within pond water nothing troubled found much prety pastime together running fish catch hand ouerquicke cunning delighted themselues owne contentment cloathed garment thinking fit time returning backe againe least ouerlong stay might giue offence departed thence easie pace dooing nothing else way went extolling valley lady beyond comparison palace arriued due houre finding three gentleman play left madame pampinea pleasantly thus spake trust gallant day wee haue cunningly beguiled answered dioneus begin first act speake yes truly sir replyed madame pampinea relating large whence came vvhat done beautie place distance thence king vpon hir excellent report desirous see sodainely commaunded supper serued vvas sooner ended three seruants leauing lady walked valley considered one hauing euer bin thought paradise world bathed themselues likewise lady formerlie done reuested returned backe lodging darke night drew apace found lady dauncing song madame fiammetta sung dance ended entertained time discourse onely concerning valley lady vvhereof spake liberally commendation whereupon king called master houshold giuing command morrow dinner readie betimes bedding thence carried desired rest midtime day done variety pleasing wine brought banquetting stuffe dainty fell dauncing pamphilus hauing receyued command begin especial dance king turned himselfe vnto madame eliza speaking thus faire lady haue done much honour day deliuer mee crowne regard wherof night mistresse song let best may please selfe whereunto madam eliza modest blush arising face replyed fulfilled delicate voyce beganne manner song chorvs sung love scape free forth thy holde beleeue truth neuer shall thy falshoode enfolde yong entred first thy fight supposing finde solemne peace threw armes delight fed poorehopes still encrease like tyrant full rancorous hate thou tookst aduantage sought refuge late loue scape free c thus surprized thy snare misfortune thou madst slaue onely borne feede despaires keepe dying liuing graue saw nothing dayly fore mine eye rackes torture could get wise loue scape free c sighes teares vented winde none would heare pittie complaint torment still encreased kinde felt sharpe restraint release last forth hell asswage thy rigour delight thus cruelty dwell loue scape free c thou wilt grant yet kinde release worse seruile band new vaine hope haue bred wherein finde violent feares comfort quite withstands length little mooud pittie nere little death listen swanlike dittie loue scape free forth thy holde beleeue truth neuer shall thy falshood enfolde madame eliza made end song shee sealed vp heartbreaking sigh sate amazedly wandering moanes one among able coniecture reason singing manner king good pleasing temper calling tindaro commaunded bring baggepipe sound whereof danced diuers daunces great part night spent manner gaue ouer departed chamber end sixth day seuenth day assembly met together vnder regiment dioneus discourse directed discouerie policy deceites woman haue vsed beguiling husbandes either respect loue preuention blame scandall escaping without sight knowledge otherwise induction dayes discourse starres departed east onely commonly cal bright lucifer daystar gracing morning gloriously master household risen went prouision valley lady make euerie thing due decent readines according lord ouernight commanded departure long king arose beeing awaked noise carriage made vp two gentleman lady quickly readie soone set towards valley euen sunne rising way went neuer heard many sweete nightingale pretty bird melodiously singing morning keeping company thoroughout iourney arriued valley lady seemed infinit quire delicate nightingale bird purposely made meeting euen giue glad welcome thither diuers time walked valley neuer satisfied viewing one end appeared farre pleasing vnto done precedent day dayes splendour much conforme beauty thereof broken fast excellent wine banquetting stuffe began tune instrument sing therein sweet bird excell valley delicate echo answering note dinner time drew neere table couered vnder spreading tree goodly pond side sate downe orderly king direction dinner saw fish swimme huge shoales pond sometimes gaue occasion talke well gaze dinner ended table withdrawne iocond manner renewed againe hermonious singing diuers place pleasant valley goodly fieldbeds readily furnished according master houshold gaue enstruction enclosed pauillions costly stuffes sometimes brought france disposed licensed king take rest would permitted wonted pastime according mind risen sleepe rest exercise seemed high time prepare talke conference sitting downe turky carpet spred abroad green grasse close place dined king gaue command madam aemillia first begin whereto willingly yeelding obedience expecting silent attention formerly bin obserued thus began iohn lorraine heard one knocke doore night time whereuppon awaked wife monna tessa made beleeue spirit knocked doore arose going together coniure spirit prayer afterwardes heard knocking first nouell reprehending simplicity sottish husband discouering wanton subtilties woman compasse vnlawfull desire gracious lord quoth madame aemillia bene matter highly pleasing mee rather selfe haue begun speake argument hath pleased apoint seeing highnesse pleasure must make passage assurance rest irregular obedience cheefe article shall therefore gracious lady striue speake something may bee aduantageable heereafter regard woman bee fearfull especially spirit sexe haue generally bin timorous although vpon credite know euer could meete tell may diligent obseruation nouell learne wholsome holy prayer auaileable precious power coniure driue away whensoeuer shall presume assault place dwelt sometime florence street saint brancazio woollen weauer named iohn lorrayne man happy art wise thing else beside sauouring somewhat gregorie deede little lesse ideot hee many time made captain woollenweauers quarter belonging santa maria nouella house schoole receptacle meeting assembly diuers petty office beside dignity authority whereof hee supposed himselfe much exalted eleuated aboue common pitch men humour became tractable addicted himselfe oftentimes man easie inclination benefactor holy father santa maria nouella giuing beside charitable almes one paire breech another hood another whole habit reward whereof taught heart many wholsome prayer pater noster vulgar tongue song saint alexis lamentation saint bernard hymne madame matilda many like matter kept charily repeated vsually tending saluation soule man faire louely wife named monna tessa daughter manuccio della cuculia wise well aduised knowing simplicity husband affecting frederigo di neri pegolotti comely yong gentleman fresh floure time euen therefore agreed better together meanes chambermaid frederigo shee met often together countrie farme iohn lorraynes hee neere florence vsed lodge summer time called camerata whether iohn resorted somtimes supper lodge night returning home againe city house next morning yet often would stay longer owne companion frederigo meane man mistress fauor therefore priuate meeting welcome receiued summons assignation night hir husband intent comming thither supped merrily together doubt thing nothing appertaining purpose acquainting well instructing dozen least husband deuout prayer shee make account frederigo either last time meeting indeede first therfore set order conclusion together chambermaide must longer messenger manner shall heare frederigo obserue especially alwayes hee went came owne house stood much higher iohn lorraynes looke vpon vine closely adioyning house stood scull ass head aduanced vpon high pole face thereof looked towards florence might safely come assured signe iohn kept home found doore fast shut softly knocke three seuerall time thereon bee admitted entrance face stood towards fiesola might come signe iohns might medling hauing thus agreed vpon conclusion many merry meeting together one night aboue rest frederigo appointed suppe monna tessa made ready two fat capon drest dainty delicate manner fell vnfortunately iohn whose kue come night came thither late yet frederigo wherewith little offended gaue iohn slight supper lard bacon like coarse prouision kept better guest meane time iohn supper maide mistress direction conueighed two capon boyled egges bread bottle wine folded vp faire cleane table cloth garden passage without entering house shee diuers time supt frederigo willed maide set thing vnder peach tree adioyned field side angry husband vnexpected comming shee got bid tarrie till frederigoes comming tell iohns also take found prepared readie supper iohn gone bed together maide likewise long frederigo came knocking softly doore neere lodging chamber iohn heard noise wife end iohn might haue least scruple suspition seemed fast asleepe frederigo pausing according order directed knockt againe second time iohn wondering thereat much iogd wife litle saide tessa hearest thou nothing thinkes one knocketh doore monna tessa better acquainted knocke plaine honest meaning iohn dissembling shee awaked drowsie dreame saide ala husband dost thou know name blessed ladie affraid spirit haunt countrey house whereof haue often told thee hath many time much dismayed liuing heere alone without thy comfort nay hath bin feare diuers night past soone heard knockes feigne hide selfe bedde ouerhead eares vsually say neuer daring bold looke vntill broad open day arise good wife quoth iohn spirit countrey thou talkest neuer affraid went bed said telucis intemerata many good prayer beside moreouer made signe signe crosse euery corner bed name father son holy ghost doubt need made power haue hurt touch v monna tessa perhaps frederigo might receiue suspition enter distaste anger offence determined arise indeede let couertly vnderstand iohn therefore saide husband beleeue iohn thy counsell good euery one thy word hath wisedome hold best owne safety thou heere wee coniure quite away end may neuer haunt hovse coniure wife quoth iohn meanes bee patient good man quoth tessa enstruct thee haue learned excellent kinde coniuration last weeke went procure pardon fiesola one holy recluse nun indeede iohn indeered sister friend sanctimonius life perceiuing troubled terrified spirit taught wholsome holy prayer protested withall shee often made experiment thereof became recluse found alwayes present helpe yet neuer durst aduenture essay liuing heere selfe alone honest iohn seeing thou art heere go together coniure spirit iohn replyed willing vp went fayre softly doore frederigo stoode still without growne somewhat suspitious long attendance come doore monna tessa said iohn thou must cough spet time shall bid thee well quoth iohn faile immediately beganne prayer manner spirit walkst thus night poore countrey people affright thou hast mistane thy marke ayme head stood right iohn home came therefore thou must packe away haue nothing else say garden get gone vnder peachtree stand alone shalt thou finde two capon drest egges laide mine owne hennes nest bread bottle good wine wrapt vp cloath fine good goblin fare packe say haue share harme iohn night keepes companie sooner ended deuoute coniuring prayer saide husband iohn cough spet iohn accordingly frederigo without hearing witty coniuration spirit himselfe supposed ridde former iealous suspition middst melancholy could hardly refraine laughing iest appeared pleasing iohn cought spet softly said himselfe next thou spetst spet thy teeth woman hauing three seuerall time coniured spirite manner haue already heard returned bed againe husband frederigo came perswaded sup supperlesse directed word monna tessa hir praier went garden foot peachtree found linnen cloth two hot capon bread egges bottle wine carried away went supper better leysure oftentimes afterward vpon meeting frederigo together laughed heartily enchantment honest beleefe silly iohn cannot deny affirme woman turned face ass head towards fiesola country trauailer passing vine hauing long piked staffe necke staffe chance touched head made turne diuers timesabout end faced florence cal frederigoes comming meanes disappointed like maner say monna tessaes prayer coniuring spirit order spirit spirit go thy way come againe day turnd head bed iohn go dore see thou trouble v frederigo departed thence losse lahour supper neighbour mine woman good yeares told one true selfe heard little girle concerning latter accident iohn lorrayne another named iohn de nello dwelt peter gate profession iohn lorrayne wherefore faire lady remaineth owne choice entertain two prayer please together extraordinary vertue strange occurrence haue heeretofore heard vpon doubt may proue experience shall therefore amisse learne hart peraduenture may stand good sted euer chance haue like occasion peronella hid yong man friend louer vnder great brewing fat vpon sodaine returning home husband told hee solde saide fat brought bought carry away peronella replyed shee formerly solde vnto another vnderneath see whether whole sound whereupon come forth vnder caused husband make neate cleane last buryer carried away second nouell wherein declared hard narrow shift distress bee seriously linked loue many time enforced vndergo according owne wit capacitie surprizers driue extremity without much laughter good liking tale madame aemillia listened vnto prayer commended sound soueraigne ended king commaunded philostratus hee follow next order whereupon thus began deare lady deceites vsed men towards sexe especially husband haue bene great many hath sometime happened yet may husband required selfsame kinde need finde fault accident either knowledge thereof afterward hearing reported one rather referre generall publication end immodest men may know finde trueth haue apprehension capacity woman therein iote inferiour cannot redound great benefite one knoweth another cunning subtile himselfe rashly aduenturous deceite maketh doubt sleight trickes whereof dayes argument may giue v occasion speake afterwardes put execution men would minister iust reason punishing themselues beguiling knowing please haue like abilitie owne power mine intent therefore tell woman though meane quality husband vpon sodaine moment owne safety long since liued naples honest meane man take wife fayre lustie young woman named peronella professing trade mason shee carding spinning maintained themselues reasonable condition abating abounding fortune serued came passe certayne young man well obseruing beauty good part peronella became much addicted affection towardes often secret sollicitations found vnkindely entertayned successe proued answerable hope vnindifferencie appearing purpose estate seemed weakest supply made addition strength securer meeting stand cleare matter scandal detection concluded order themselues lazaro peronellaes husband named earely riser euery morning either seeke worke effect vndertaken amorous friend therewith acquainted standing conuenient place hee could see lazaroes departure house yet himselfe way discerned poore lazaro sooner gone presently enters house stood verie solitarie street called auorio many morning thus met together meane delight contentation till one especiall morning among rest lazaro gone forth worke striguario amorous young man named visiting peronella house vpon vrgent occasion lazaro returned backe againe quite contrary former wont keeping foorth day neuer comming home till night finding doore fast lockt hauing knockt softlie twice spake manner himselfe fortune thanke thee albeit thou hast made mee poore yet thou hast bestowed better blessing matching good honest louing wife behold though went early house selfe hath risen cold shut doore preuent entrance theeues might offend v peronella hauing heard husband sayde knowing manner knocke said fearfully striguario ala deare friend shall wee doe little lesse dead woman lazaro husband come backe know say neuer returned order doubtlesse hee saw entred doore safety honour mine creepe vnder brewing fat till haue opened doore know reason soone returning striguario made delaying matter got himselfe closelie vnder fat peronella opening doore husband entetance frowning countenance spake thus vnto meaneth early returning home againe morning seemeth thou intendest nothing day brought backe thy tooles thy hand thine intent shall liue shal haue bread fill belly dooest thou thinke suffer thee pawne gowne poore garment heeretofore thou hast done card spinne night day till haue worne flesh finger yet hardly finde oyle maintaine lampe husband husband one neighbour dwelling v make mockerie tels plainly may ashamed drudge moyle wondering little ble endure thou returnest home thy hand thy hose thou hadst worke day hauing thus spoken fell weeping thus began poore wretched woman vnfortunate houre borne much worse made thy wife could haue proper handsome yong man one would haue maintained mee braue gallantly beast forgoe good cast selfe away beggar thou art none wold haue asse woman liue heart ease iollity haue amorous friend louing paramour yea one two three making husband looke like moone cressent wheron shine sunlike amiable lookes know helpe poore foole liue heere home miserable life daring dreame folly innocent soule heartlesse harmelesse many time sitting sighing selfe lord thinke mettall made haue friend corner aswell others haue flesh blood made brasse iron therefore subiect woman frailty would thou shouldest know husband tell thee good earnest would doe ill could quickely finde friend neede gallant good store knowledge loue dearely haue made large liberall promise golde siluer iewels gay garment would extend least fauour heart suffer neuer daughter mother much thought matter thanke blessed ladie friswid yet thou returnest home againe thou shouldst worke lazaro stoode like wellbeleeuing loggerhead demurely thus answered ala good wife pray bee angry neuer much ill thought know wel enough haue made good proofe thereof morning vnderstand therefore patiently sweet wife went forth work dayly vse little dreaming thinke doe bene holyday wife feast day saint galeone whereon may wise worke reason soone returning neuerthelesse deare wife carelesse houshold prouision though worke yet must haue foode haue prouided moneth wife remembred brewing fat whereof wee haue little vse rather trouble house otherwise met honest friend stayeth without doore haue sold fat ten gigliatoes tarrieth take away husband replied peronella worse offended thou art man walkest euery shouldst experi nced worldly affaire wouldst thou bee simple sell brewing fat ten gigliatoes poore ignorant woman housedoue sildome going doore haue sold already twelue gigliatoes honest man euen little thy comming home came agreed bargaine vnderneath fat see whether sound credulous lazaro heard better contented euer went taried doore saying good man may goe way whereas offered ten gigliatoes fat louing wife hath sold twelue must maintaine shee hath done man departed variance ended peronella saide husband seeing thou art come home luckily helpe lift vp fat man may come foorth two end bargaine together striguario thogh mewed vp vnder tubbe eares open enough hearing witty excuse peronella tooke himselfe free future feare come vnder fat pretending also herd nothing saw lazaro looking round said good woman lazaro stepping forth boldly like man replyed heere wold haue sir thou quoth striguario art thou ask good wife made match fat honest gentleman answered lazaro honest woman husband lacke better maintaine whatsoeuer wife hath done crie mercie sir replyed striguario bargained wife brewing fat finde whole sound vncleane within hard crusted dry soile vpon know well get meanes making cleane haue money heere ready sir quoth peronella take care although match beene made serues husband make cleane yes forsooth sir answered sily lazaro shall haue neate cleane pay mony stripping himselfe shirt lighting candle taking tooles fit purpose fat whelmed ouer within wrought vntill sweated scraping scrubbing poore louers could accomplish wold necessity enforced performe might peronella looking venthole liquor runneth forth meshing seemed instruct husband businesse espying part fat fowlest saying lazaro tickle gentleman paye well worthy haue see thou thy selfe harme good husband warrant thee wife answered lazaro hurt selfe leaning stomacke fat leaue cleansing breefe brewing fat neatly cleansed peronella striguario well pleased money paide honest meaning lazaro discontented friar reynard falling loue gentlewoman wife man good account found meanes become gossip afterward conferring closely chamber husband coming sodainly thither made beleeue came thither end cure godsonne charme dangerous disease wormes third nouell seruing friendly aduertisement married woman monk friar priest may none gossip regard vnauoydable perilles ensuing thereby philostratus told tale couertly concerning lazaros simplicity peronellaes witty policy lady found knot rush laughed little queint manner discoursing vpon conclusion king looking vpon madam eliza willed succeede next willingly granted thus began pleasant lady charme coniuration wherwith madam aemillia laid nightwalking spirit maketh remember nouell another enchantment although carrieth commendation equall yet intend report suteth present purpose cannot sodainly furnisht another answerable thereto nature vnderstand liued stena proper yong man good birth well friended named reynard earnestly affected neere dwelling neighbour beautifull gentlewoman wife man good esteeme hee grew halfe perswaded could without suspition compasse priuate conference reach height amorous desire yet seeing likely meanes wherewith hope shee great childe resolued become godfather childe time brought christening inwardly acquainted husband named credulano familiar entercourses passed betweene reynard kinde offer credulanoes courteous acceptance hee set downe gossippe reynard thus embraced madam agnesiaes gossip prouing onely colourable meanes safer permission speech let vnderstand word mouth long collected lookes behauiour fell way beneficiall albeit agnesia seemed nice scrupulous hearing yet precious care honor came passe within whether seeing labour vainly spent vrgent occasion mouing thereto know reynard would need enter religion whatsoeuer strictnesse austeritie hee found kinde life yet determined perseuere therein whether good ill although within short space thus become religious monke hee seemed forget former loue bare gossip agnesia diuers enormous vanity beside yet let tell successe time tutord againe without respect poore holy habite rather contempt thereof tooke especiall delight wearing garment much richer esteeme yet fauoured monasticall profession appearing respect like courtminion fauourite sprightly poeticall disposition composing verse sonnet canzons singing sundry excellent instrument yet greatly curious company best madame agnesia one former gossip doe trouble selfe talking thus lately conuerted friar holy father reynard longer standing reputed meerely saint life rather much vile hee wretched condition world shame fat foggie nastie abbeylubbers shew full fedde liue cloysters cherry cheekes smooth shining lookes gay gaudy garment far least expression humility walking street like doues highcrested like cockes well cramd gorge nay worse see chamber furnished gallypots electuaries precious vnguents apothecary box filled various confection conserues excellent perfume goodly glass artificiall oyles water beside rundlers small barrel full greeke wine muscatella lachrime christi like precious wine see seeme bee chamber religious men rather apothecary shoppes appertaining druggist grocer perfumer disgrace gowty men know alledge strict fasting feeding grosse meates though neuer li le continuall studying like restraint body freer exercise maketh subiect many infirmity yet one chanceth fall sicke physitian must minister counsell chastity abstinence voluptuous meat discipline body matter appertaining modest religious life concerning plaine vulgar plebeian people holy father perswaded know nothing really belonging sanctimonious life long watching praying discipline fasting themselues able make men look leane wretched pale saint dominicke saint fraunces diuers holy saint beside obserued selfesame religious order constitution carefull successor moreouer example forenamed saint went wel cloathed though three garment one made finest woollen excellent cloath rather coarsest common ordinary colour expell cold onely appear braue gallant deceyuing thereby infinite simple credulous soules whose purse neuerthelesse best paymaster leaue returne wee backe vertuous fryar reynard falling againe former appetite became often visitant gossip agnesia hee learned blushlesse kinde boldnesse durst instant concerning priuie sute euer formerly bin yea euen solicite enioying immodest desire good gentlewoman seeing selfe importunately pursued fryar reynard appearing perhappes sweeter delicare complexion entrance religion set time secret communing answered apt tearmes vse greatly squeamish granting matter demanded friar reynard quoth shee doe godfather vse moue question whereto friar thus replyed madam haue laide holy habite matter easie mee shall seeme eye respect made like another man quite course religious life agnesia biting lip prety smile said faire starres neuer bee vnfriendly gossip would haue consent vnto sinne blessed lady shield mee ghostly father hath often told vtterly vnpardonable feare much confiding mine owne strength gossip gossip answered friar speake like foole feare case wholly friuolous especially motion mooued one selfe vpon repentance grant pardon indulgence presently pray let mee aske one question neerest kinsman son either stood font baptisme husband begot lady made answere husband say true gossip replyed friar yet notwithstanding doth husband boord bed enioy sweet benefit company yes said lady shold lady quoth reynard neere kinsman sonne husband may ye afford mee like fauour agnesia logitian therefore could stand curious answer especially cuningly moued beleeued rather made shew beleeuing godfather said nothing truth thus answered woman gossip knoweth answer strange speech came passe know agreement passed betweene onely might infrindge league gossipship title countenance intent fauour affoorded might stand cleare suspition especiall time appointed amorous combate fought loues field friar reynard came gossip house none present hinder purpose onely nursse attended child indifferent faire proper woman holy brother came thither company friar allowed walke alone sent aside pigeon loft enstruct new kinde pater noster lately deuised holy conuent meane friar reynard agnesia entring hir chamber leading little son hand making fast doore better safety fri r laide holie habit cowle hood booke bead bee respect men sooner thus entred chamber husband credulano come house vnseen staid till chamber doore hee knockt called wife hearing voice ala gossip quoth shall husband knocketh doore perceiue occasion familiar acquaintance reynard stript trusse straite strouses began tremble quake exceedingly heare husband tongue gossip said seeing harme yet hath bin done garment againe wee would haue one excuse serue turne till may open doore woman wit sildome gadding abroad necessitie concerneth home euen agnesia sodainly prouided inuention speake carry selfe extreamitie saide friar get garment quickely cloathed take little godson armes listning wel shall say shape answeres according word refer matter credulano scarsely ended knocking agnesia stepping doore said husband come opened doore going forth chearefull countenance thus spake beleeue husband could haue come happy time yong son sodainly extreamly sicke good fortune would haue louing gossip reynard chanced come questionlesse good prayer religious paynes vtterly lost childe life left credulano credulous name imported seemed ready swoune sodaine conceit ala good wife quoth hapned sit downe sweet husband said wil tell al child sodainly taken swouning wherein vnskilful verily suppose dead knowing doe say good hap gossip reynard came taking childe vp armes said gossip nothing else wormes bellie childe ascending heart must need kill child without question contrary good comfort gossip feare charme sort shall die depart hence shall see son healthfull euer maner charm nature required prayer exorcising two place nurse went vp holye brother pigeon loft exercise deuotion like heere none mother childe must bee present mystery enter hinder operation charme reason making fast chamber doore shall see husband anon childe indifferently recouered armes nurse holy brother returned theyr meditation saith charme would fully effected child beginneth looke chearefull merry deerely credulano loue childe hee verily beleeued wife saide neuer misdoubting treachery lifting vp eye vehement sigh said wife may goe take child armes oh yet good husband quoth case least ouerthrow done stay little go againe bee well call went agnesia againe making doore fast fryar hauing heard passed speech time fitted habite taking childe armes said agnesia gossip methought heard husband voice hee chamber doore yes gossip reynard quoth credulano without agnesia opened doore admitted entrance indeede come sir pray replyed friar heere receiue childe mee great danger euer seeing aliue must take order make image waxe agreeing stature childe placed altar image france whose merires childe thus restored health childe beholding father made signes comming reioycing merrily yong infant vse credulano clasping armes wept conceite ioy kissing infinitely heartily thanking gossip reynard recouery godson friar brotherly companion giuen sufficient enstructions nurse small purse full sister white thred nunne shrift bestowed vpon husband admittance chamber easily heard came also seeing good tearmes holpe make ioyfull conclusion brother saying friar reynard brother haue finished foure iaculatory prayer commanded brother answered reynard haue better breath successe hath prooued happier mine arriuall gossip credulano could accomplish two iaculatory prayer onely appeareth haue preuailed deuout desire childe perfectly cured credulano calling wine good cheare feasted friar iocondly conducting forth house without intermission caused child image waxe made sent placed altar saint france among many like oblation tofano night season locke wife house shee preuailing get entrance againe entreaty could possiblie vse made beleeue throwne selfe well casting great stone well tofano hearing fall stone well perswaded wife indeed came forth house ran welles side meane wife gotte house made fast doore husband gaue many reproachfull speech fourth nouell wherein manifested malice subtilty woman surpasseth art wit man soone king perceyued nouell reported madame eliza finished hee turned himselfe madame lauretta told pleasure begin next whereto yeelded manner loue many thy preuailing force straunge thy foresight admirable thine attempt euer philosopher artist could enstruct wile escape preuentions demonstration sodainly thou teachest thy apt vnderstanding schollers indeede certaine document erudition whatsoeuer weak worth respect thine hath notably appeared remonstrance already past whereto worthy lady wil adde another simple woman taught husband lesson shee neuer learned loue himselfe dwelt sometime arezzo faire village tuscany rich man named tofano enioyed marriage young beautifull woman called oneta without occasion giuen reason knowne himselfe became exceeding iealous wife perceyuing grew much offended thereat tooke great scorne seruile vile slauish condition oftentimes demanded whence iealousie receiued originall hauing neuer seene heard could make answer owne bad humour suggested droue euery day almost death doore feare way needed whether iust scourge grosse folly secret decree ordained fortune fate able distinguish came passe young gallant made meanes enioy fauour discreetly wise iudging worthinesse affection passed farre mutually betweene nothing wanted effect answere word suited time place conuenient order taken best might yet stand free suspition among many euill condition frequent familiar husband tofano tooke great delight drinking held commendable quality alwaies often solicited thereto cheta selfe began like allow feeding humor effectually quaffing carowsing time listed could make bowsie beyonde measure leauing sleeping drunkennesse would alwayes get selfe bed helpe heereof compassed first familiarity friend yea diuers time occasion serued confidently builde husband drunkennesse onely shee aduentured bring friend home owne house also would often go somewhat neere hand abide part night season cheta thus continued amorous course fortuned slye suspitious husband beganne perceiue though shee drunke much yea vntill quite spent gone yet remained fresh sober still therby imagined strange matter fast asleepe wife tooke aduantage drowsinesse mightand forth beeing desirous make experience distrust hee returned home night hauing drunke thing whole day dissembling word behauiour werenotoriously drunke indeede wife constantly beleeuing saide selfe hee neede sleepe drinke getting immediately warme bed going downe staires againe softly went doores vnto friend house formerly vsed shee remained vntill midnight tofano perceiuing wife came bed imagining haue heard doore open shut arose bed calling wife cheta diuers time without answere returned hee went downe staires finding doore closed made fast sure inside got vp window watch returning home wife whence shee came make condition apparantly knowne long stayed till last returned indeede finding doore surely shut shee exceeding sorrowful essaying might get open stregth tofano long suffered vaine approoue thus hee spake cheta cheta thy labour meerely lost heere entrance allowed thee therefore return place whence thou camest thy friend may iudge thy behauiour know nightwalker thou art become woman hearing vnpleasing language began vse humble entreaty desiring charity sake open doore admit entrance bin place ielous suspition might suggest onely visit weak sickly neighbour night long yet capeable sleepe willing sit alone house perswasions serued purpose setled owne opinion town see nightly gading much suspected cheta seeing faire meanes would preuaile shee entred roughe speech threatnings saying thou wilt open doore let come shame thee neuer base man pray thee answered tofano canst thou woman loue inspired sprightly counsell ingeniously enstructing distresse stearnly thus replyed suffer shame thou intendest towards mee drowne selfe heere well doore found dead thy villanous iealousie apparantly knowne beside thy beastly drunkennesse neighbour constantly beleeue thou didst first strangle house afterwardes threw well either thou must flie vpon supposed offence lose thy goodes banishment much fitting thee haue thy head smitten wilfullmurtherer thy wife iudge otherwise wordes mooued tofano iot obstinat determination still persisting therin thus spake neither longer endure base villanie thine mercy heauen commit soul stand wheele witnesse hardhearted murtherer sooner thus spoke night extreamly dark could discerne one another cheta went well finding verie great stone lay loose vpon brim well euen beene layde purpose shee cried aloud saying forgiue faire heauens threw stone downe well night still silent fal great stone made dreadfull noise well hearing windowe thought verily drowned selfe indeede whereupon running downe hastily taking bucket fastened strong cord left doore wide open intending speedily helpe standing close doores entrance could get wels fide within house softly made doore fast inside went vp window tofano stood talking thus dragging bucket well cry calling cheta take hold good cheta saue thy life stood laughing window saying water bee put wine man drinkes hath drunke much already tofano hearing wife thus flout window went back doore finding made fast willed hir grant entrance forgetting gentle language formerly vsed meere mockery derision yet intermixed sighes teares woman saide haue command aloud neighbour heare thus replyed beastly drunken knaue thou art night thou shalt come within doores longer able endure thy base behauour high time thy course life bee publiquely known drunken houres thou returnest home thy house tofano man impatient nature bitter vnto word side neighbour men woman hearing looked forth windowes demaunding reason disquietnesse cheta seeming wept sayde ala good neighbour see vnfitting houres bad man come home house hee hath lyen tauerne day drunke sleeping snorting like swine honest witness long haue suffered beastlinesse yet neyther good counsell often louing admonition worke good wee haue expected wherefore try shame procure amendment haue shut doores vntil drunken fit ouerpast shall stand coole foot tofano vnciuill maner told abroad night vsed neighbour seeing within house beleeuing rather regard well knowne ill quality sharpely reproued gaue grosse speech pittying honest woman continually abused good neighbour quoth see manner man would thinke walk street thus night time late mine owne house dayly drunkard affraid least would haue giuen credit dissembling speech told welles side threw something well know better opinion sildome seene doores although would induce sharper iudgement lay shame vpon wherein hath sinned himselfe neighbour men woman seuerely incensed tofano condemning great fault night committed auouching wife vertuous honest within little noise passing neighbour neighbour length came eares kindred forthwith resorted thither hearing sharpely neighbour reprehended tofano tooke soundly bastanadoed hardly left bone vnbruised afterward went house tooke thing thence belonged hir taking hir also dwelling threatning tofano infliction punishment drunkennesse causlesse iealousie tofano perceyuing curstly handled crooked meanes might vsed regard kindred friend mightie thought much better patiently suffer wrong alreadie done obstinate contending proceed fare worse became suter kindred al might forgotten forgiuen recompence whereof would onely refraine drunkennesse also neuer ielous wife faithfully promised cheta reconciled husband strife ended enioyed friend fauour occasion serued yet discretion noted thus coxcombe foole faine purchase peace notorious wrong sustained iniuries bee offered iealous man clouded habite priest became confess ur owne wife made beleeue deepely loue priest came euery night lay meanes confession iealous husband watched doore house surprize priest came neuer meant amisse company secret friend came ouer toppe house visite foolish husband kept doore fift nouell iust scorne mockery iealous husband idle headed vpon occasion yet haue good reason least suspect iniury madam lauretta hauing ended nouell euery one commended woman fitting tofano kinde iealousie drunkennesse iustly deserued king preuent losse time turned madame fiammetta commaunding follow next whereuppon graciously shee beganne manner noble lady precedent nouell deliuered madame lauretta maketh willing speake another iealous man halfe perswaded whatsoeuer done wiues especially vpon occasion giuen doe well becommeth graue head first instituters lawes diligently obserued thing minde would haue ordained penalty woman appointed owne defence offend iealous husband meere insidiators wiues liues diligent pursuer death lockt vp house weeke long imployed nothing domesticke drudging affayres make desirous high festiuall dayes receiue litle comfort abroad honest recreation pastime husbandman field artizans citie gouernours iudiciall courtes yea lord himselfe rested seauenth day trauailes like manner willed ordained lawes well diuine humane haue regard glory god common good euery one making distinction betweene dayes appointed labour determined rest whereto iealous person case giue consent dayes woman pleasing delightfull vnto ouer command irksome sadde sorrowful lockt vp strictly restrained question wer vrged many good woman liue consume away torturing hel affliction make answere feele best able discouer wherefore conclude proheme present purpose let none ouer rash condemning woman husband iealous without occasion rather commend wit prouidence somtime faire lady liued arimino merchant rich wealth worldly possession hauing beautifull gentlewoman wife became extreamly ielous reason foolish conceit like loued hir dearly found absolutely faire euen imagined althogh deuised best meanes giue content yet others would grow enamored appeared amiable al respect time might tutor affect beside himselfe onely common argument euery bad minded man weake shallow owne vnderstanding ielous humor increasing kept narrow restraint many person condemned death haue enioyed larger libertie imprisonment might bee present feast wedding goe church much seen doore nay durst stand window looke house occasion whatsoeuer mean whereof life seemed tedious offensiue supported impatiently shee knew selfe way faulty seeing husband still persist shamefull course towards studied might best comfort selfe desolate case deuising one meane bee founde wherby might requited kind wear badge shame whereof onely affraid could gain small permission seene window happily might haue obserued one passing street discerning litle parcell loue remembred length next house husband ioyning close together dwelt comely yong proper gentleman whose perfection carried correspondencie desire also considered selfe partition wall chinke cranny might easily made therein one time gaine sight young gentleman finde houre fitting conferre bestow louely fauour pleased accept successe case proued answerable hope thus resolued outrun rest wearisome dayes except frensie iealousie finish husband loathed life walking one roome another thorough euery part house wall escaping without diligent surueying day husband absent home espyed corner secret indifferent cleft wall though yeelded full view side yet plainly perceiued handsome chamber grew halfe perswaded either might chamber philippo neighbouring yong gentleman named else passage guiding thereto chambermaid compassioned case much made obseruance mistress direction found philippoes bed chamber alwayes vsed lodge alone often visiting rift chinke wall especially gentleman throwing little stone flower like thing fell still way walked farre preuailed stepping chinke know whence came shee called softly knowing voyce priuate conference together way displeasing either chinke made little larger yet could easily discerned mouthes might meete kiss together hand folded nothing else performed continuall feare ielous husband feast christmasse drawing neere gentlewoman said husband stood liking would duty fitted solemne time going earely morning vnto church confessed receiue sauiour christian replied iealous asse sinnes haue committed neede confession husband quoth thinke saint knoweth pray subiect sinne woman liuing world sin reuealed priest word enflamed iealousie violently needes must know sinnes committed hauing resolued case made answer hee contented motion alwaies prouided went church vnto owne chappel betimes morning chaplaine confesse priest appointed returne home presently againe woman acute apprehension presently collected whole intention seeming take knowledge thereof replyed would swerue direction appointed day come arose earely prepared answerable owne liking chappell shee went husband appointed iealous husband much earlier risen attended comming hauing ordred matter chaplaine cloathed cowle large hood hanging ouer eye know went sate downe confessor place shee entred chappell calling priest heare confession made answer could intehd would bring another holy brother better leysure hee husband brought seemed respect like confessor himselfe saue onely hood closely veyled shee knew beard said selfe mad world iealousie metamorphose ordinary man priest let alone meane fit lookes appearing haue knowledge downe fell feete conueyed cherry stone mouth trouble speech knowledge thing el thoght himselfe sufficiently fitted course confession declared married wicked iealous husband lead hatefull life neuerthelesse quoth indifferently euen beloued holie fryar euery night commeth lyeth iealous husband heard stabbed like dagger heart greedy couetous desire know would faine haue broke confession got gone perceiuing wisest course questioned wife saying good woman doth husband lodge yes sir quoth possible replyed husband friar lodge dissembling farre fetcht sigh thus answered reuerend sir know skilfull art fryar vseth sure euery doore house flye open soone doth touch moreouer told commeth vnto chamber doore speaketh certaine word himselfe immediately casteth husband dead sleepe vnderstanding bee thus sleepily entranced openeth doore entreth lieth downe euery night faileth iealous coxcomb angerly scratching head wishing wife halfe hangd said mistresse badly done keepe selfe men husband onely shall neuer doe answered shee indeed loue dearely quoth supposed confessor cannot giue absolution sory sir said came hither tell leasings could yet would good fable saintlike men therein quoth hee better surely sory dangerous condition bee vtter losse soule neuerthelesse husband sake owne take paine vse especiall prayer name may perchance greatly auayle purpose send nouice young clearke mine may safely acquaint minde signifie whether haue done good proue helpefull proceed therein ala sir said neuer trouble selfe sending body house husband know extreamly iealous world cannot otherwise perswade commeth thither honest intent shall liue worse fear good woman quoth beleeue certainly haue care case huband shall neuer speake thereof doe sir sayde proceed pray well contented confession thus ended receiuing pennance hee appointed arose feete went heare masse iealous woodcocke testily puffing blowing put religious habite returning home presently house beating braines al way went meanes might best deuie taking wife friar together whereby haue seuerely punished wife come home chappell discerned husband lookes like keepe sory christmasse yet vsed vtmost industry conceale done knew well hauing fully resolued watch street doore next night ensuing person expectation friar comming saide wife haue occasion suppe lodge house night wherefore see streete doore surely made fast inside doore middest staires also chamber doore god name get bed whereto answered done hee appointed afterward saw conuenient time went chink wall making signe shee woont doe phillippo came thither declared morning affayres direction husband giuen furthermore saide certaine depart house sit watch doore without take one come heere therefore climbe ouer house top get gutter window may conferre familiarly together young gentleman dullard lesson quickly taught night come geloso must wee tearme cockebraind husband armes himselfe point browne bill hand sits watch owne doore wife made fast doores especially midst stayres mean come chamber houre serued gentleman aduentured ouer house top found gutter window way conducting chamber leaue amorous conference geloso halfe mad anger first hee lost supper next hauing sitten almost night extreamely cold windie armor much mollesting yet could see friar come day drew neere hee ashamed watch longer conueighed himselfe conuenient place putting armes seeming come place lodging ninth houre found doore open ent ed went vp stayres going dinner wife within according geloso ordred businesse youth came thither seeming nouice sent confessor admitted speake demanded whether shee troubled mollested night passed formerly bin whether partie came woman knew well enough messenger notwithstanding formall disguise made answer party expected came hee come purpose minde otherwise altred albeit changed iote amorous conclusion say vnto geloso continued watch many night afterward hoping surprize friar entrance wife kept still contented quarter according opportunitie serued conclusion geloso beeing longer able endure bootlesse watching ordinary pleasing countenance wife one day demaunded stearne frowning brow secret sinnes shee reuealed ghostly father vpon day shrift woman replyed would tell neyther matter reasonable lawfull doe wicked woman answered geloso knowe well enough euen despight thee euery word thou spakest vnto huswife must know fryar farte loue meanes enchantment lyeth euery night tell else meane cut throate woman immediately made answer true loue fryar quoth geloso didst thou confesse much ghostly father day thou wast shrift sir sayde sure would disclose except hee suffered bee present article beyonde dutie confesse freely say vnto make end quickely wife quoth geloso tell mee friar woman fell hearty laughter saying liketh singularly well wise man suffer himselfe ledde simple woman euen sheepe slaughter horne thou wast wise wisedome became vtterly lost thou felst diuellish frensie iealousie without knowing anie reason beastlike manly humor thou hast eclipsed meane part glory womanly reputation doest thou imagine husband blinded eye head thou art informe thine vnderstanding could haue found priest would need bee confessor knew thee husband man therefore prepared wit accordingly fit thee foolish imagination thou soughtest indeed gaue thee thou hadst beene wise thou makest world beleeue outward apparance thou wouldest neuer haue expressed basenesse minde borrow coulour sanctified cloake thereby vndermine secre thine honest meaning wife wherefore feede thee thy fond suspition free confession tolde thee truely heinously transgressed tell thee loued fryar art thou loue fryar ghostly father though thine owne shame thou madst thy selfe said moreouer doore house keepe selfe shut pleaseth come lie tell husband doore house hath time bin shut thee freely thine owne grant thee entrance thou art friar confest lieth euery night often thou sentst thy yong nouice clearke often truly returne thee word fryar lay iealousie thou hast lost thine vnderstanding thou wilt hardly beleeue ala good man like armed watchman thou satst thine owne doore cold winter night perswading mee poore silly credulous woman vpon vrgent occasion thou must need suppe lodge home remember thy selfe therefore better heereafter become true vnderstanding man thou shouldst bee make thy selfe mocking stocke knoweth thy iealous quality well watchfull ouer thou art sweare true honesty willing thou art suspitious could deceiue thee thou hadst hundred eye nature affords thee two haue pleasure freely yet thou iot wiser credit way impaired wonderfull wise geloso aduisedly considred wholly heard wiues secre confession dreamed doubt beside perceiuing speech hee become scorne al men without returning answer confirmed wife bee wise honest hadde iust occasion iealous indeede hee vtterly forsware counted coxcombes would misguided wherefore hauing thus wisely wonne way owne desire reduced humane temper hope neede clambring ouer house night time like cat walking gutter windowes abuse honestly reformed madame isabella delighting company affected friend named lionello likewise beloued signior lambertuccio time shee entertained lionello shee also visited lambertuccio husband returning home instant shee caused lambertuccio run forth drawne sword hand meanes made excuse sufficient lionello husband sixth nouell wherein manifestly discerned loue driuen narrow straite attempt yet hee accomplish purpose supply wondrously pleasing company reported nouell madame fiammetta euery one applauding woman wisedome done iealous foole husband iustly deserued shee hauing ended king gaue order vnto madame pampinea turne speake whereupon thus began meane store people say though false foolishly loue maketh many wit fall loue vtterly loose vnderstanding mee appeareth ydle opinion already hath beene approued related discourse shall also bee made manifest another mine owne city florence famous good though many bad quality dwelt long since gentlewoman endued choice beauty admirable perfection wife signior beltramo valiant knight man great possession oftentimes commeth passe man cannot alwayes feede one kind bread appetite longing change fared lady named isabella satisfied delight husband grew enamoured young gentleman called lionello compleate person commendable quality albeit fairest fortune yet affection euery way sutable full well know faire lady mindes irreciprocally accorded dilligence wanteth desire execution amorous couple made many solemne protestation vntill bee friended opportunity fortuned time hopefull expectation knight named signior lambertuccio fell likewise loue isabella somewhat vnsightly person vtterly vnpleasing eye grew regardlesse frequent solicitings would accept either token letter hee saw rich great power hee sought compasse intent contrary course threatning scandall disgrace reputation associate bandie best friend knowing manner man able abuse infamous imputation wisely returned hopefull promise though neuer meaning performe onely ladylike flatter foole therewith mile distant florence beltramo castle pleasure lady isabella vsed liue summer doe like possessed day beltramo ridden home hauing sent lionello take aduantage husband absence accordingly went doubting winne long expected signior lambertuccio side meeting beltramo riding castle isabella fit enioy company gallop thither possible speede hee would bee longer delayed scarcely lionello entred castle receiuing direction waiting woman lady chamber lambertuccio gallopped gate woman perceiuing ranne presently acquainted lady comming lambertuccio shee onely sorrowfull woman world nothing bee feared stormes tempest lambertuccio spake lightning thunder lionello lesse affraide shee perswasion crept behind bed hid himselfe contentedly time lambertuccio dismounted courser fastened bridle ring wall waiting woman came guide lady mistresse stood ready staires head graced acceptable welcome yet maruelling much sodaine comming lady quoth met husband vpon way granting mine accesse see come claime long delayed promise time fauourable vttered halfe word beltramo hauing forgot especiall euidence study onely occasion iourney came gallopping backe againe castell court seeing goodly gelding stand fastened could redily imagine owne thereof waiting woman vpon sight master entring court came lady saying master beltramo returned backe newly alighted questionlesse comming vp staires lady isabella ten time worse affrighted hauing two seuerall amourous suters house hoping neither speeding yet credite lying stake either vnexpected returne husband moreouer possible meanes concealing signior lambertuccio gelding stood open court therefore made shrewde presumption vpon least doubtfull question vrged neuerthelesse woman wit alwayes best vpon sudden constraint looking forth window espying husband preparing come vp threw selfe day couch speaking thus earnestly lambertuccio sir euer loued mee would haue faithfully beleeue instant safety owne honour life doe aduise forth draw sword steanre countenance threatning death destruction run downe staires beneath say sweare best fortune although misse thee heere yet sure finde thee else husband offer stay mooue question make answere formerly spake fury beside soone mounted horsebacke haue conference vpon occasion whatsoeuer preuent suspition future intendments lambertuccio sware many terrible oathes obserue direction euery part hauing drawne forth sword grasping naked hand setting worse lookes one businesse euer nature gaue spent much labour vaine failed iot lady iniunction beltramo hauing commanded horse safe custody meeting lambertuccio discending downe staires armed swearing extreamely storming wondring extraordinarily threatning word made offer imbrace vnderstand reason distemper lambertuccio repulsing rudely setting foote stirrup mounted gelding spake nothing else sweare fairest fortune although misse thee heere yet sure find thee else gallopped mainely away beltramo come vp wine chamber hee found cast downe vpon couch weeping full feare greatly discomforted wherefore said vnto hee signior lambertuccio extreamely offended withall threatneth implacable manner lady arising couch going neere bed lionello might better heare returned husband answere husband quoth neuer dreadfully affrighted till young gentleman whence know came running castle rescue pursued signior lambertuccio weapon ready drawne hand ascending vp stayres fortune know found chamber doore standing open finding also working sampler wonderfull feare trembling good madame quoth hee god sake helpe saue life else shall slaine heere chamber hearing pittious cry compassionating desperate case arose worke demaunding whence durst presume boldly bedchamber presently came vp signior lambertuccio also vnciuill sorte tolde swaggering swearing traiterous villaine heereupon stept somewhat stoutly chamber doore hee offered enter woman courage resisted made much enraged mee hee saw mee debarre entrance many terrible vile oathes vowes hee ranne downe stayres againe like manner chaunced meete trust mee deare wife said beltramo behaued selfe well worthily would haue beene notorious scandall v man bee slaine bedchamber signior lambertuccio carryed himselfe dishonestly pursue man outragiously hauing taken castle sanctuary ala wife become poore affrighted gentleman introth sir quoth know somewhere heereabout hee hidden art thou honest friend said plaine meaning beltramo come forth feare thine enemy gone lionello heard forepassed discourse shee deliuered husband beitramo came creeping forth amazedly one fearefully affrighted indeede vnder side bedde beltramo saide quarrell thee furious lambertuccio sir replyed lionello knowledge verily perswadeth either well wit else mistaketh soone saw way somewhat neere castle drew forth sword swearing horrible oath said traitor thou art dead man vpon rough word stayed question occasion mine offending fled fast possibly could confesse selfe indeede ouerbold presuming lady bed chamber yet equalled mercie hath bin onely meanes time sauing life hath done like good lady answered beltramo verie much commend recollect thy dismayed spirite together see thee safely secured hence afterward looke thy selfe well thou canst dinner immediately made ready hauing merrily feasted together bestowed good gelding lionello rode along florence left quietly owne lodging selfesame euening according isabella giuen enstruction lionello conferred lambertuccio agreement passed betweene though rough speech noised abroad set better colour businesse yet al matter cleanly carried beltramo neuer knew queint deceitfull policy wife lodouico discouered mistresse madame beatrix amorously affected cunningly sent egano husband garden respect disguised like selfe friendly lodouico conferred meane afterward lodouico pretending lasciuious allurement mistresse thereby wrong honest master insted beateth egano soundly garden seuenth nouell whereby declared keepe many honest seeming seruants may sometime finde knaue among one proues ouersawcy master sodaine dexterity wit isabella related verie modest manner madame pampinea onely admired company likewise passed generall approbation yet madam philomena king commanded next succeede peremptorily sayde worthy lady deceiued intend tell another tale presently much commended last vnderstand long since dwelt paris florentine gentleman falling decay estate ouerbountifull expences vndertooke degree merchant thriued well trading grew great wealth hauing one onely sonne wife named lodouico sonne partaking somewhat father former height minde way inclineable deale merchandize meaning shopman therefore accompanied gentleman france sundry seruices king among singular good carriage qualites happened meanly esteemed thus continued court chanced certaine knight returning ierusalem hauing visited holy sepulcher comming company lodouico much familiar discourse passed amongst concerning faire woman france england part world bin delicate beauty seene one company constantly auouched woman generally obserued comparable wife egano de galluzzi dwelling bologna name madam beatrix reputed onely faire woman world many rest maintained much hauing bin bologna likewise seene lodouico hearing woman highly commended neuer yet feeling thought amorous inclination became sodainely toucht earnest desire seeing minde could entertaine matter onely trauailing thither see yea continue occasion serued reason iourney vrged father visit ierusalem holy sepulcher much difficulty length obtained leaue iourney towards bologna name anichino lodouico arriued vpon day following hauing vnderstood place abiding good happe see lady window appearing eye farre faire report made heereupon affection became enflamed vowed neuer depart bologna vntill obtained loue deuising meanes might effect hope grew perswaded setting attempt aside could entertained husband seruice vndergo businesse house time might tutor obtaine desire hauing giuen attendant sufficient allowance spare company take knowledge selling horse also notice might discouer grew acquaintance hoste house lay reuealing earnest desire himselfe serue som lord worthy gentleman willing giue entertainment beleeue sir answered hoste seeme worthy haue good seruice indeede know noble gentleman cittie named egano without question accept offer hee keepeth many men verie good deseruing shall haue furtherance therein much may promised performed taking anichino vnto egano farre preuailed friendly protestation good opinion young gentleman anichino without ado accepted eganoes seruice nothing could pleasing benefit dayly beholding heart mistresse acceptable proued seruice egano grew farre loue vndertaking affayres whatsoeuer without aduice direction anichino reposed especiall trust man altogether gouerned fortuned vpon day egano ridden flye hawke riuer anichino remaining behinde home madame beatrix yet taken notice anichinoes loue albeit selfe obseruing faire carriage commendable quality highly pleased haue seeming seruant called play chesse anichino coueting nothing content ca ried himselfe dexteriously game permitted hir still win little ioy gentlewoman friend present spectator behold play taken farewell departed leauing alone yet gaming still anichino breathing forth intire sigh madame beatrix looking merrily said tell anichino art thou angrie see win appeare solemne sigh truly madame answered anichino matter farre greater moment losse infinite game chesse occasion sighed pray thee replyed lady loue thou bearest seruant loue remain thee towards giue reason harty sigh heard himselfe seuerely coninred loue bare loued none else world beside gaue farre hartsicke sigh lady mistresse entreated seriously let know cause two deepe sighes whereto anichino thus replyed madam tell stand greatly feare offending haue told doubt discouery thereof beleeue anichino quoth therein thou neither canst shalt offend moreouer assure thy selfe neuer disclose except may thy consent madame saide hee seeing haue protested solemne promise mee reueale meane secret vnto teares standing eye told heard first report singular perfection instantly becam enamored maine motiue entring seruice humbly entreated might agree good liking would pleased commisserate case grace priuate fauours shee might mercifull yet would vouchsafe let liue lowly condition thinke thankefull duty onely loue singular sweetnesse naturally liuing faire feminine blood iustly art thou worthy praise like occasion thou couldst neuer wonne sighes teares hearty imprecation haue alwayes preuailed thee making thee apt easie amorous desire praise answerable thy great glorious deseruings voice neuer faint pen waxe weary due obsequious performance madam beatrix well obseruing anichino spake giuing credit solemne protestation powerfull preuailing sens manner enchanted sighes flew violently vented stormy tempest little ouerblowne thus spake anichino heart deere affected friend liue hope tell thee truly neuer could gift promise courting vsed lord knight gentleman although haue bin solicited many winne lest grace fauour hand moue affection thou minute time compared long tedious suing hast expressed soueraigne potency thy sweet word thou hast mad thine mine owne beleeue vnfeinedly hold thee worthy loue wherefore kisse freely giue thee make thee promise night shall fully past thou shalt better manner perceiue aduenture chamber houre midnight leaue doore open thou knowest side bed vse rest come thither feare sleep least gentle touch thy hand wake thou shalt see much loue thee kinde kisse two bargaine concluded licensing departure time staying hope heart happinesse till thought euery houre yeare meane egano returned home hawking soone supt weary went bed ladie likewise leauing chamber doore open according promised houre appointed anichino came finding doore easily put entred softly closed againe manner found going bed side lady lay gently touching brest hand found awake perceiuing come according vnto promise shee caught hand fast held strongly turning could towards egano made meanes hee awaked whereupon spake vnto followeth sir yester night would haue fewe speech regard wearinesse early going bed could haue opportunity time place conuenient desire bee resolued among men retained seruice thinke best loyall worthiest enioy loue egano answered thus wife moue question know neuer seruant heeretofore euer shall haue heereafter reposed like trust haue done anichino end motion tell sir quoth iudge self whether haue reason moue question mine opinion euery way equalled concerning anichino iust faithfull could amongest rest husband like water runneth stillest foord deepest euen smooth lookes haue beguiled longer agoe verie day sooner ridden foorth hauking belike purposely tarrying home watching leysure best fitted intent ashamed solicite mee abuse bed mine owne spotlesse honor moreouer prosecuted impious purpose alluring perswasions weake woman willing endure ouer many amorous proofes onely acquaint sawcie immodestie reuenge selfe vppon best may selfe beeing best able pronounce guiltie made promise meete garden presently middenight finde mee sitting vnder pinetree nener meaning vertuous may know deceite falshoode seruant would hane put nightgowne head attire chinnecloath sitting short vvhile vnderneath pinetree insatiate desire faile come may proceede finde occasion egano heard word sodainely hee started bed saying doe foster snake mine owne bosome gramercie wife politicke promise thine beleeue mee meane follow effectually put lady nightgown formall head attire chincloth going presently downe garden expect anichinoes comming pinetree matter grew issue let demand faire lady lamentable condition may imagine poore anichino bee strongly detained heare amorous suite discouered likely draw heauy affliction vndoubredly looked immediate apprehension egano imprisonment publike punishment malapert presumption proued much renowned selfe dealt iustlie deserued frailtie feminine sex much preualent make v wander vertuous course wel onward way madam beatrix whatsoeuer passed betweene anichino know either continue new begunne league time reuenged husband simplicity ouerrashlie giuing credit smooth ly aduise anichino quoth take good cudgell thy hand go garden farre pine formerly thou hadst solicited mee vnto secret meeting way approuing honestie name reuile thy master bitterly thou canst bestowing manie sound blowes thy cudgel yet vrge shame stil mee neuer leaue til thou hast beaten garden teach keepe bed another time apt scholler anichino kind need tuturing word enough ready wit garden go good willow cudgell hand comming neere pinetree found egano disguised like lady arising place sate went chearefull gesture welcome anichino rough stearne manner thus spake vnto wicked shamelesse immodest woman art thou come according thine vnchaste lasciuious promise couldest thou easily credite though tempted thee trie vertue thy continencie would offer damnable wrong worthy master deerely loues reposeth especiall confidence thou art much deceiued shalt finde hate false lifting vp cudgell gaue therewith halfe score good bastinado laying soundly armes shoulder egano feeling smart durst speake one worde fled away fast hee could anichino still following multiplying many iniurious speech epithites strumpet lustfull insatiate woman go thou lewde beast quoth vnworthy title lady wife vnto good natured man mayster reueale thy vngracious inciuility morrow may punish thee little better haue done egano thus well beaten garden walke got within doore went vp chamber againe lady demanding whether anichino came according promise come quoth egano yes wife came deerely cost hee verily taking thee hath beaten extreamly calling hundred whore strumpet reputing thee bee wickedst woman liuing good sadnesse beatrix wondred little would giue thee vile speech intent wrong mee mine honour questioulesse hee saw thee iouiall spirited gracious affable towardes men therefore hee intended make triall thine honest carriage well sir sayde shee twas happy hee tempted mee word let taste proofe deed let thinke brooke word distastably ill deed seeing iust faithfull loyall may lone better respect finde occasion whereto egano thus replyed trust wife thou hast said well drawing hence argument setled perswasion chastest woman liuing wife iust seruant could fellowed neuer discouerie gardennight accident perhaps madame beatrix anichino might subtilly smile thereat secret regard knew else beside honest meaning egano hee neuer much verie least mistrust ill dealing either lady anichino hee loued esteemed farre respectiuely vppon proofe honestie towards hee would could possibly haue done without triall playne pregnant arriguccio berlinghieri became immeasurably ielous wife simonida fastened thred great toe serue signall amorous friend come visite arriguccio findeth fallacie pursueth amorous friend shee causeth maide lye bed returne beateth extreamly cutting away locke haire thinking doone violence wife simonida afterward fetcheth mother brother shame rid finding speech vtterly false reputing bee drunken iealous foole blame disgrace falleth himselfe eight nouell whereby appeareth husband ought well aduised meaneth discouer wrong offered wife except hee himselfe rashly run shame reproach seemed whole assembly madam beatrix dealte somewhat strangely manner beguiling husband affirmed also anichino great cause fear held strongly bed side related amorous temptation king perceyued madame philomena sate silent turned madam neiphila willing supply next place modestly smiling thus began faire lady heauy burthen imposed matter much surmounting capacity vainely imagine content pleasing nouell haue already done singularly reported neuerthelesse must discharge dutie take fortune fals albeit hope finde mercifull know sometime liued citie welthy merchant named arriguccio berlinghieri many merchant haue done fondly imagined make himselfe gentleman marriage might assuredly took wife gentlewoman one much aboue degree element named simonida regard delighted vsuall life merchant often abroad little home whereby shee small benefit company shee grew forward affection young gentleman called signior roberto solicited hir many amorous mean length preuailed win fauor fauour obtained affection gaddes farre beyond al discretion make louers heedelesse priuate conuersations either taken tardy folly else subiected scandalous suspition came passe arriguccio either rumour sensible apprehension receiued intelligence concerning wife simonida grew extraordinarie iealousie refraining trauaile abroad formerly wont doe ceassing verie ordinary affayres addicting care endeauour onely watchfull wife neuer durst sleepe vntill bed meane mollestation thus curbd familiar meeting roberto neuerthelesse hauing long consulted wittes find apte meanes conuersing thereto also earnestlie still solicited shall heare course vndertooke chamber streete side somewhat iuttying ouer obserued disposition husband euery night long fell asleepe beeing falne noyse whatsoeuer could easily wake solemne sound sleeping emboldned farre meete roberto streete doore husband slept softly would open priuate conuerse shee would know certaine houre comming without least suspition hung thred forth chamber window descending downe within compasse robertoes reach street end thereof guided window bed conueyed vnder cloathes shee bed fastned left great toe wherewith roberto sufficiently acquainted thus enstructed withall comming plucke thred husband dead sleep would let go thred come downe slept would hold strongly tarrying would proue vaine could meeting night deuise highly pleasing roberto simonida intelligencer often meeting many time also aduising contrary end quaintest cunning may faile one time fortuned one night simonida sound sleepe arriguccio waking drowsie houre yet come extended forth legge bed found thred feeling hand perceiuing tyed wiues great toe prooued apt tinder kindle iealousie hee suspected treachery indeede much rather thred guided vnder cloathes bed window hanging downe streete warning businesse arriguccio furiously enflamed hee must needes bee resolued apparant doubt therein hee would deceiued softly cut thred wiues toe made fast owne trye successe would ensue thereon long roberto came according hee vsed doe hee pluckt thred arriguccio felt hee tyed fast roberto pulling ouerhardly fell downe window hand vnderstood lesson attend comming hee arriguccio stealing softly bed wife taking sword vnder arme went downe doore see full intent reuenge albeit merchant yet wanted courage boldnesse spirit opening doore without noyse onely wife wont doe roberto waiting entrance perceiued doores vnfashionable opening simonida husband whereupon betooke himselfe flight arriguccio fiercely followed length roberto perceiuing flight auayled enemy still pursued armed also sword arriguccio returned backe vpon one offering offend stood vpon defence darke fought together simonida awaking euen husband went foorth chamber finding thred cut toe coniectured immediately subtle cunning discouered supposing husband pursuite roberto presently arose considering likely ensue thereon called chambermaide ignorant businesse perswasions preuailed lay downe place bed vpon solemne protestation liberall promise make selfe knowne suffer patiently either blowes ill vsage husband shee would recompence bountifull sort haue occasion complaine putting watchlight euery night burned chamber departed thence sate downe close corner house see would end stirre husband comming home fight haue formerly heard continuing betweene roberto arriguccio neighbour hearing clashing sword street arose bed reproued harsh manner respect arriguccio fearing knowne ignorant also aduersary harme yet done either side permitted depart extreamely full anger returned backe againe house come vp bedchamber thus began lewde wicked woman hast thou put light finde thee shall auayle thee well enough finde drab darke groping bed side thinking hee taken hold wife grasped chambermaide beating fist spurning foot al face bloody bruised next knife cut great deal haire giuing villanous speech could deuised swearing would make shame world need make doubt poore maide wept exceedingly good occasion doe albeit many time desired mercy hee would bee cruell yet notwithstanding voyce broken cry impacience extreame rage hindered power distinguishing knowing wiues tongue stranger hauing thus madly beaten cut locke head thus spake wicked woman wife mine sure haue done thee yet although meane beate thee longer goe thy brother shall vnderstand thy dishonest behauiour bring home perceiuing much thou hast abused honour thine owne let deale thee finde occasion thou art companion sooner vttered angry word hee went forth chamber bolting fast outward side meaning keepe safely inclosed house went alone himselfe simonida heard tempestuous conflict perceiuing husband lockt streete doore gone whether pleased vnbolted chamber doore lighted waxe candle went see poore maide found pittifully misused comforted well could brought owne lodging chamber washing face hurt soueraigne water rewarding liberally arriguccioes owne gold held selfe bee sufficiently satisfyed leauing maide lodging returning againe owne chamber made vp bed former manner body lodged therein night hanging vp lampefresh fild oyle clearly lighted deckt selfe decent sort bin bed night taking sowing worke hand either shirt band husband hanging lampe sitting downe stayres head fell worke serious manner shee vndertaken imposed taske side arriguccio trauelled farre house till came last dwelling simonidaes brother hee knockt soundly quickely heard almost speedily let simonidaes brother mother also hearing arriguccioes comming thither late rose bed hauing waxe candle lighted came presently vnderstand cause vnseasonable visitation arriguccio beginning originall matter thred found tyed wiues great toe fight houshold conflict following related euery circumstance better proofe word shewed thred selfe locke supposed wiues haire adding withall might dispose simonida themselues pleased remaine longer house brother simonida exceedingly offended relation regard beleeued truth fury commanded torch lighted preparing part thence arriguccio home house sharpe rehrehension sister mother saw followed weeping first entreating one ouer rash crediting slander rather consider truth thereof aduisedly husband might angry wife vpon occasion hauing outraged made meanes excuse himselfe moreuer said could chuse wonder greatly matter thus come passe good knowledge daugher whole course education faultlesse blamelesse euery deg ee many good word beside proceeding naturall affection mother come house arriguccio entring ascending vp stayres heard simonida sweetly singing working pausing vpon hearing rude trampling shee
