demaunded one angry brother presently answered lewde woman thou art thou shalt know soone enough heere blessed lady v quoth simonida sweet saint france helpe defend dare vse vnseemely speech starting vp meeting staire head kinde brother said louing mother sweet saint charity sake may reason comming hither manner shee set downe againe worke neatly apparrlled without signe outrage offered face vnblemished haire comely ordered differing wholly former speech husband brother maruelled thereat little asswaging somewhat impetuous torrent rage began demaund coole blood ground husband complaint proceeded threatning roughly would confesse truth intirely ane maria quoth simonida crossing selfe ala deare brother know say meane wherein husband bee offended make complaint arriguccio hearing looked like man lost sens well remembred many cruell blowes giuen face beside scratch nailes spurnes foot also cutting haire least shew misusage seene brother likewise briefly told whole effect husband speech shewing thred cruell manner sware hee beate simonida turning husband seeming confounded amazement said husband doe heare would haue supposed owne shame disgrace bad woman selfe cruell curst man either side matter night heere house mee beate mee feele know beleeue sweete heart meerely miracle arriguccio ten time mad minde saying diuell woman wee night goe together bed cut thred thy great toe tyed mine found craftie compact betweene thee thy minnion follow fight street came backe againe beate thee strumpet lock haire selfe cut thy head ala sir quoth haue doe know say lodge house night neither see whole day night till leauing come matter question haue testimony mine owne word say beate cut locke haire head ala sir slander selfe life time neuer strike appoue truth speech doe selfe else heere present looke aduisedly signe blow beating seene easie matter doe either smite much lay hand anger would cost dearer thinke whereas say cut locke haire head either know felt colour like mine mother brother shall witness therein whether without knowledge shall see cut taking head attyre displayed hayre ouer shoulder suffered violence neither seemed bee much vnciuilly rudely handled mother brother saw began murmure arriguccio saying thinke sir tell v strange matter haue done prouing falfe wonder make good rest arriguccio looked wilde confusedly striuing still maintaine accusation seeing euery thing bee flatly durst attempt speake one word simonida tooke aduantage distraction turning brother saide see marke whereat aymeth make doe neuer meante namely acquaint vile quality wretched life leade seeing hee needes haue reueale beare doe vpon compulsion mother brother verily perswaded accident disclosed hath doubtlesse manner happened shall heare true seeming honest man lucklesse houre married stileth himselfe name merchant coueting accounted credited holy outward appearance religious monke demure lookes modestest maide like notorious common drunkard tauerne hunter making luxurius match one one whore againe another hee causeth mee euery night sit tarrying euen sort found sometimes till midnight otherwhiles till broad day light morning questionlesse wounted drunken humour hee hath lyen one sweet consort whose toe found thred finding false hath alwayes onely beat also cut haire head hauing yet recouered sences verily perswaded cannot altered hee performed villany doe aduisedly obserue countenance appeareth yet halfe drunke whatsoeuer hath said concerning make account thereof spake drunkennesse freely forgiue euen good mother kinde brother let mee entreate like mother heard word confidently beleeued daughter began torment selfe anger saying faith body daughter vnkindnesse endured rather let dogge hanged quality may knowne vtterly vnworthy haue good woman wife thou art could haue done taken thee open streete company wanton gallant vnfortunate houre wast thou married base iealous coxecombe quite sense reason thou shouldest subiect foolery hee merchant ealeskinnes orenges bred paltry countrey village taken hoggerubbing clothed sheepessattin clownish startops leather stocking caddy garter whole habite worth three shilling ye must haue afaire gentle woman wife honest fame rich reputation comparing pedegree hee farre vnfit wipe shooes oh deare sonnes would followed counsell permitted math honourable family count guido much mooued seriously pursued would need bestow goodly iewell although shee one choysest beauty florence chaste honest truely vertuous ashamed midnight proclaime common whore better knowledge blessed mother saint iohn would ruled mine aduise law make dearely smart ala sonnes tell home owne house word way likely proue true haue eye obserued vnmannerly behauiour sister hearing hath said noting drunken carriage beside neuer giue ouer long life left man woman none selfe reuenge wrong making publike spectacle drabbing drunkard brother heard obserued occurrence bitter manner railed arriguccio bestowing good bastinado beside concluding thus end quoth one wee pardon shamefull abusing sister thou art notoriom drunkard looke perill thy life haue newes hereafter beleeue vnfainedly impudent rumour happen eares much flying fame thereof thou shalt surely paide fault together home againe went arriguccio stood like one neither life motion knowing whether done true dreamed without vttering word left wife went quietly bed thus wisdome onely preuent imminent perill also made free open passage contentment amourous friend yet dreadlesse distaste suspition husband lydia lady great beauty birth honor wife nicostratus gouernour argo falling loue gentleman named pyrrhus requested true testimony vnfeigned affection performe three seuerall action selfe accomplish imbraced kissed pyrrhus presence nicostratus perswading whatsoeuer saw meerely false ninth nouell wherein declared great lord may sometime deceiued wiues well men meaner condition nouell deliuered madame neiphila seemed pleasing lady could refraine hearty laughter beside much liberality speech albeit king oftentimes vrge silence commanded pamphilus follow next attention admitted pamphilus began order opinion faire lady matter vneasie doubtfull soeuer may seeme man woman affecteth feruently dare boldly attempt effectually accomplish perswasion mine although hath beene sufficiently approued many passed nouels yet notwithstanding shall make much apparent present discourse mine owne wherein haue occasion speake lady fortune fauourable either reason iudgement could giue direction regard would aduise entertaine high imagination minde tracke footstep speake fortune containeth alwayes one disposition neither men eye blinded one manner proceed tale argo ancient citie achaya much renowned precedent king wealth great matter worth liued lieutenant gouernour thereof noble lord named nicostratus albeit hee well stept yeares fortune bestowed marriage great lady lesse bold spirit choisely beautifull nicostratus abounding treasure wealthy possession kept goodly traine seruants horse houndes hawkes else hauing extraordinary felicity kind game singular exercise maintaine health among seruants follower yong gentleman gracefull person excellent speech euery way actiue man could name pyrrhus highly affected nicostratus intimately trusted rest seemed perfection pyrrhus lydia lady named began affect earnestly sort day night shee could take rest deuised meanes compasse hart desire whether obserued inclination towards else would take notice thereof could discerned outward apprehension moued impatiency droue hope dispairing passion wherein finde comfort ease called ancient gentlewoman chamber shee reposed especiall confidence thus spake lesca good turnes fauours thou hast receiued make thee faithfull obedient therefore set locke vppon thy lippes reuealing one whatsoeuer matter shall impart thee except command thee thou perceiuest lesca youthfull apt sprightly recreation rich abounding woman wish haue regard fortune common ordinary fauours yet haue one especiall cause complaint namely inequality mariage husband ouerancient regard youth find selfe highly wronged defeated duty delight woman farre inferiour continuallie cloyed withall vtterly depriued subiect desire deserue taste benefit ample manner hitherto haue liued losse time yet measure may releeued recompenced though fortune mine enemy mariage disproportion condition yet may befriend another nature kindely redeeme iniury done wherefore lesca compleate case rest beside haue resolued vpon priuate friend one worthy namely seruant pyrrhus whose youth carieth correspondency mine constantly haue setled loue well thinke see indeede shall dye except sooner may enioy therefore life well fare respected thee let vnderstand integrity mine affection good mean thou findest expedient done entreating may haue conference shall thereto solicited chambergentlewoman lesca willingly vndertooke lady embassie soone opportunity fauor hauing withdrawne pyrrhus apt commodious place shee deliuered message best manner could deuise pyrrhus hearing little wonder thereat neuer hauing noted matter therefore sodainly conceyued lady onely try whereupon somewhat roundly roughly hee returned answere lesca simple credite message sent lady therefore better aduised thy word admit come yet cannot perswaded soule consented harsh language far differing forme full beuty yet admit againe hart tongue herein relatiues lord master hath farre honoured mee much beyond least part merite mee rather dye way offer disgrace therefore charge thee neuer moue mee matter lesca iot danted stearne word presently saide pyrrhus message lady shall command wil speake thee whensoeuer shee pleaseth receiue discontent thou canst thereby make presumption doubt thou maist deuise found thee senselesse fellow dull shaped vnderstanding leaue thee anger parted carrying backe answer lady sooner heard instantly shee wished selfe dead within dayes conferred againe chamberwoman saying lesca thou knowest well enough oxe falleth first blow axe neither victory vpon silly shallow aduenture wherefore thinke conuenient thou shouldst make another tryall preiudice standeth strictly loyalty choosing houre seemeth commodious soundly possesse tormenting passion bestirre thy wittes tippe thy tongue woman eloquence effect earnestly desire languishing louesicke affliction well bee danger death seuere detriment occasion great losse lesca comforted lady much lay power doe hauing sought pyrrhus found good leysure pleasing humor thus beganne pyrrhus dayes since tolde thee extreame agony thy lady mine onely regarde loue thee come giue thee assurance thereof wherefore beleeue vnfeignedly thy obstinacie continne still like manner day expect shortly heare tydings death part therefore entreat thee comfort long languishing desire thou persist thy harsh opinion stead reputing thee wise fortunate yong man shall confesse thee bee ignoraunt asse glorie thee affected faire worthy lady beyond men else soeuer next tell highly maist thou confesse thy selfe beholding fortune thou duly consider shee hath elected thee sole soueraigne hope crowne honour thy youth sufficieut refuge want necessity thy knowledge like thy selfe make aduantage time thou maist thou wert wise canst thou find one go beyond thee armes horse sumptuous garment gold heaped thee lydia may lady thy loue open thine vnderstanding word returne thine owne soule bee wise thy selfe remember pyrrhus fortune present selfe one cheerefull lookes lappe wide open richest fauours choice quickely made folde vp turn backe let complaint afterward made fellow faire offer prooue miserable wretched begger thorow owne negligence beside else hath formerly bin saide neede loyaltie seruants lady shonld among deare friend kindred seruants ought rathee best may master doest thou imagine thou hadst faire wife mother daughter sister pleasing eye nicostratus would stand nice tearmes duty loyaltie thou doest ladie thou went verie foole rest perswaded assure thy selfe entreaty faire meanes might preuaile force compulsion whatsoeuer ensued thereon woulde winne masterie let v vse commodity vnto belonging would v vse benefit thy fortune beware abusing fauonr yet smile thee take heede least turne backe ouerlate repent thy folly ladie die thy disdaine assured thou canst escape life beside open shame disgrace euer pyrrhus often considered lescaes first message concluded himselfe moued matter hee would returne another kinde answere wholly yeelding content lady prouided might remaine assured concerning intyre truth motion vrged onely trie wherefore thus replyed lesca imagine mee ignorant know certaintie thy former allegation confessing freely thou doest canst yet let mee tell thee withall knowe lord wise iudicious hauing committed affaire care trust neuer blame mee misdoubt least ladie counsell aduice make thee messenger motion therby call fidelitie question cleare doubt assurance well toward wil vndertake performance three thing must needes require case afterward owne seruice command first presence lord master kill faire faulcon dearly hee affecteth second send locke tuft beard puld away vvith owne hand third last hand also pluck one best soundest feth send mee loues true token finde three effectually performed wholly three strict imposition seemed lesca ladie likewise almost beyond compasse possibility neuertheles loue powerfull oratour perswading also aduenturous euen difficult danger gaue courage vndertake sending lesca backe againe full assurance herculean labour moreouer selfe intend adde fourth taske regard strong opinion concerning great wisedome lord maister effected three would permit kisse lord face yet accomplished sort nicostratus himselfe beleeue although apparantly saw well quoth pyrrhus wonder performed assure ladie truelie within short nicostratus made solemne feastiual according yearely vsed doe honour birth day inuiting many lord lady thereto reioycing day soone dinner ended table withdrawne lydia came great hall feast solemnly kept rich costly apparrelled presence pyrrhus whole assemblie going perch whereon faulcone sate wherein husband tooke little delight hauing vntyed shee meant beare fist tooke y beating wal killed nicostratus beholding called aloud vnto saying ala madame haue done making answere turning lord lady dined spake mander ill take reuenge king offended much heart wreake spleene paltry hawke vnderstand worthy lord lady faulcone hath long time robbed delight men meere equitie ought haue wiues continually soone breake day hath appeared husband starting bed make himselfe readie presently horsse faulcon fist ride abroad recreation field forsaken sort see left alone bed discontented despised often vowing selfe bee thus reuenged withheld occasion onely want fit apt time presence person might bee iust iudges wrong conceiue lord lady hearing word beleeuing deed done otherwise entire affection nicostratus according speech sounded compassionately turning towards exceedingly displeased smiling said good sadnesse sir madame lydia hath done well acting iust reuenge vpon hawke bereft husband kinde companie nothing precious louing wife hell liue without lydia sodainly withdrawne chamber much friendly familiar talke conuerted anger nicostratus mirth smiling pyrrhus diligently obserued whole cariage businesse saide himselfe ladie hath begun well proceeding worse successe doubt bring loue happy conclusion lady selfe hauing thus kild hawke long chamber husband conuersing familiarly together began iest hee like manner tickling toying till length played beard found occasion aptly seruing effect second taske imposed pyrrhus taking fast hold small tuft beard gaue sodaine snatch plucked away quite chin whereat nicostratus beeing angerly moued appease distaste pleasantly thus spake lord looke frowningly angry loose haires beard take plucke mee haire head yet iot discontented know iesting manner friendly speech cut contention kepte charily tuft husband beard verie selfesame day shee sent pyrrhus heart chosen friend concerning third matter aduentured droue much serious consideration two shee already well exactly performed notwithstanding like ladie vnconquerable spirit loue enlarged power sodainly conceited course best bee kept case forming attempt manner vpon nicostratus wayted two young gentleman page chamber whose father giuen seruice learne manner honourable courtship quality necessarily required gentleman one nicostratus sate downe dinner supper stood office caruer deliuering meat whereon fed taster attended cup dranke drinke hee brought highly pleasing vnto day lydia called two youth aside among speech serued induction intended policy perswaded mouth yeelded vnsauoury ilpleasing smell whereof lord seemed take dislike wherefore aduised time attended seuerall place much possibly could withdraw head aside breath might noyous vnto withall haue especiall care disclosing one told meere loue acquainted therewith constantly beleeued followed direction aduised loath displease seruice bound obey choosing time fitting purpose nicostratus priuate conference thus began sir obserue behauiour two page wait table yes wife quoth squemishly turn head aside hath often bin minde vnderstand reason seating selfe shee weighty matter tell proceeded manner ala lord shall need question sufficiently resolue therein neuerthelesse haue long concealed would offensiue regard manifestly apparant others haue tasted immagined none selfe longer hide assuredly sir strange vnwonted illsauour continually issuing mouth smelling noysomely wonder tbe occasion former time neuer felt foule breathing come daily conuerse many worthy person seeke meanes rid great annoyance say verie true wife answered nicostratus protest credite feele ill smell neither know cause except haue som corrupted tooth mouth perhaps sir quoth may yet feele sauour others yea offensiuely walking window opened wide mouth nicely shee surueyed either side turning head seeming vnable endure sauour starting shrieking alowd said santa maria sight ala good lord could abide long heere tooth side farre pereeiue onely hollow corrupted also wholly putrified rotten continue still head beleeue truth infect spoile rest neere would therefore counsell let pluckt breede danger like counsell well lydia replyed nicostratus presently intend follow let therefore barber sent vvithout longer delay shall plucke forth instantly sir quoth barber vppon mine honour shall come barber heere ir rotten tooth standeth fairely hand without helpe aduice barber let mee alone plucking forth without putting paine moreouer let tell sir toothdrawers rude cruell performing office heart cannot endure come within compasse currish courtesie neither shall sir ruled faile manner facilitie yet loue duty hath enstructed forbeare least paining vnmannerly barber hauing thus spoken well contented kinde offer instrument brought vsed occasion commanded forth chamber onely lesca euermore kept still company locking fast doore nicostratus seated thought fittest purpose put tanacles mouth catching fast hold one soundest teeth notwithstanding loud cry lesca held strongly forth pluckt hid hauing another tooth readie made hot bloody much corrupted rotten helde tanacles shewed wellneere halfe dead anguish see sir quoth tooth suffered head yeeld foule smell verily beleeuing said albeit hee endured extreame paine still complained harsh violent pulling reioyced yet ridde comforting one side anguish asswaging departed forth chamber mean lesca sent sound tooth pyrrhus wondering little many strange attempt hee vrged much rather thinking performance impossible meere loyall duty lord seeing three notably effected made doubt intire loue towardes sent assurance likewise readinesse seruiceable diligence whensoeuer would command passage aduentures hardly bee vndertaken woman yet held insufficient security grounded perswasion loue except shee performed another owne according shee boldly promised houres seeme dayes dayes multiplicitie yeeres till kisse may giuen receyued presence nicostratus yet hee himselfe auouch contrary madam lydia vpon pretended sicknesse keepeth chamber woman hardly exceeded dissimulation shee wanted wit seeme exquisitely cunning outwarde apparances sicknesse one day dinner shee visited nicostratus none attending pyrrhus onely earnestly entreated mitigation inward affliction felt would helpe guide garden gladly motion graunted nicostratus gently taking one arme pyrrhus conducted garden seating faire floury grasseplot backe leaning pearetree hauing sitten indifferent pyrrhus formerly enstructed direction giuen thus shee spake somewhat faintly pyrrhus haue kinde longing desire vpon sodaine taste peares wherefore climbe vp tree cast downe one two instantly hee aloft tree throwing downe best ripest peares length according premeditated lesson looking downe said forbeare lord see weake feeble condition ladie shaken violent sicknesse madam kinde louing soeuer lord little carefull health ut come forth sicke chamber ruffled tumbled rough manner though dalliance amisse fitten priuate chamber open garden presence seruant yet time place alwaies bee respectiuely considered auoiding ill example better testimonie owne wisedomes euer like selues soone euen heate yet turbulent sicknesse equall loue admit kiss embrace priuate lodginges much conuenient seruants eye see wantonnesse reproued indiscretion publique familiaritie madame lydia sodainely starting turning vnto husband sayde doth pyrrhus prate well wittes franticke madame replyed pyrrhus franticke fond thinke see folly nicostratus wondering word presently answered trust pyrrhus think thou dreamest lord replyed pyrrhus dreame iot neither ladie tree could affoord like kindnesse would peare bee le vppon pyrrhus quoth lydia language goeth beyond vnderstanding seemeth thou knowest thou saist beleeue husband well euer haue bin would climb tree see idle wonder hee talketh continueth thus aboue appeareth hee finde prattle albeit taketh marke amisse heereupon commanded pyrrhus come downe ground pyrrhus quoth tell thou saydst pyrrhus pretending alteration much amazement straungely looking saide know verie well lord answere make fearing least sight hath bin abused error aloft tree seemed manifestly embraced lady though somewhat rudely regard perillous sicknesse yet louingly youthfully yonger day infinite kiss wanton daelliances indeede deserued far priuate place poore opinion descending downe mee thought gaue ouer amorous familiaritie found seated left trust mee pyrrhus answered nicostratus thy tongue wit haue strangely wandred reason reall apprehension neuer stirred hence since thou didst climbe vp tree neither mooued otherwise thou seest v ala lord saide pyrrhus humbly craue pardon presumption reproouing medling owne shal make hereafter better aduised thing soeuer heare see meruaile amazement encreased nicostratus far greater hearing auouch still constantly eene contradiction able alter made rashly sweare say see selfe whether pearetree bee enchanted wonder seene man vp thou wouldst haue v beleeue mounted vp hy safe fro sodaine comming lydia soone forgotten sicknes promised kisse cost aboue twenty beside verie kinde hearty embrace louingly respected entertained pyrrhus nicostratus beholding aloft tree cryed saying wicked woman doest thou meane thou villain pyrrhus darst thou abuse thy lord hath reposed much trust thee descending haste downe againe yet cry still lydia replyed ala lord raile raue sort hee found seated pyrrhus waiting dutiful reuerence euen climbed vp tree yet thought ight deceyued demure formall behauiour made walke vp downe extreamely suming fretting vnto himselfe milder manner qualifie pyrrhus spake thus deny good lord freely confesse euen selfe aboue tree fight falsely deluded apparantly confirmed sort needeth doubt beguiling one suspitious nature case assuredly resoluednothing questioned whether beleefe farre misleade thinke ladie hath alwayes bene wise loyall vertuous would shamefullie wrong yea performe face wherein dare gadge life contrary concerning selfe fit mee argue contest mine owne commendation haue euer knowne sincerity seruice best able speake behalfe rather wold drawne peeces foure wilde horse hee iniurious slaue lord master otherwise must need rest certainely perswaded guile offence false appearance occasioned thee onely world could make otherwise beleeue saw kisse kindely imbrace lady owne eye credited like behauiour sinne neuer conceiued much thought lady side seeming angerly incensed starting faintly vp foot yet supporting selfe tree said appeareth sir haue entertained goodly opinion lewde lasciuiously disposed addicted least desire wantonnesse would bee forgetfull mine owne honour aduenture sight seruant house oh sir woman familiarly affected need learne wit men amourous matter priuate chamber shall better trusted open blabing telltale garden nicostratus verily beleeued said neither would aduenture familiarity face would talke matter rather studyed rarity miracle seene height tree changing againe vp descent lydia containing still collourable kinde impatience angerly frowning vpon nicostratus stearnely saide may haue villanous deceiuing tree shall neuer shame woman therefore pyrrhus runne axe felling ground instant reuenge thy wrong mine doest thou serue worthy lord haue wise husband without consideration suffer eye vnderstanding dazeled foolish imagination beyond possibility although eye apprehend folly seemed truth indeed yet depth setled iudgement world perswade pyrrhus quickely brought axe wing downe tree soone lady saw fall turning selfe nicostratus said haue seene mine honour honesty enemy laid along mine anger past husband freely pardon intreating heartily henceforward presume imagine loue eyther bee altred thus mocked derided nicostratus returned againe lady pyrrhus perhaps although pearetree cut downe could find cunning meanes ouerreach two citizen siena one amed tingoccio mini meucio di tura affected hoth one woman called monna mita one gossip gossip dyed appeared afterward companion according formerly promised doe tolde strange wonder seene world tenth nouell wherein men couertly reprehended make care conscience thing preserue sinne remained none king himselfe last recount nouell hee heard lady complaint indifferently pacified rash felling downe precious pearetree thus beganfaire lady case manifest euery king accounted iust vpright first rather obserue lawes himselfe hath made otherwise ought reputed seruant worthy punishment king fault reprehension king shall well neere constrained fall yesterday enacted law vpon forme discoursing full intent day would vse part priuiledge subiect law speake argument already haue done wherein haue onely performed could wish vpon subiect sutable minde euery nouell variety excellent matter singular illustration delicate eloquence hath flowne vtterly vnable inuent thing notwithstanding curious search braine apt fit purpose paragon meanest already related therefore seeing must need sinne law established selfe tender submission worthy punishment amends else please enioyne mee returned wonted priuiledge say nouell recounted madame eliza fryar godfather gossip agnesia also sottishnesse senese husband hath wrought worthy lady effect forbearing speake wily prancks witty wiues exercise simple husband tell pretty short tale though matter enough worthy crediting yet partly bee pleasing heare sometime liued sienna two popular men one named tingoccio mini meucio de tora men simple vnderstanding dwelling porta salaia two men liued familiar conuersation together expressed cordiall affection seldome walked asunder honest men vse doe frequented church sermon oftentimes hearing misery beatitude world come according merit soules departed life found equall repaiment manifold repetition matter made earnestly desirous know meanes might haue tydings thence confirmation finding endeauours vtterly frustrated made solemne vow promise vnder oath hee first dyed two returne backe againe soone possibly could remaining aliue tell tydings hee desired heare promise thus faithfully made still keeping company wont doe fortuned tingoccio became gossip one named ambrosio anselmino dwelling camporeggio wise called monna mita sweet louely sonne tingoccio often resorting thither consorted companion meucio shegossip woman worthy louing faire comely person tingoccio notwithstanding gossipship betweene moneths minde god child mother meucio also fell sicke disease shee seemed pleasing eye tingoccio gaue meane commendation yet carefully concealed loue themselues one occasion tingoccio kept closely meucio lest hold disgracefull beare amourous affection gossip thought vnfitting bee knowne meucio meaning hee knew well enough tingoccio loued therefore conceiued minde discouered matter quoth iealous gossip admitteth conference himselfe pleaseth may easily make distaste therefore must rest contented loue continuing still kinde tingoccio prooued fortunate businesse hauing better meanes companion preuayling course court mistresse seemed forward effectually meucio plainely perceiued though tedious wearisome yet hoping finde successe length would take notice thing fearing infringe amity betweene tingoccio hope quite supplanted thus one triumphing loues happinesse hoping felicity come lingering sickenesse seazed tingoccio brought low condition length dyed three foure night meucio fast asleepe bed ghoste tingoccio appeared called loude meucio awaking demanded called thy friend tingoccio replied ghoste according former promise made come vision thee tell thee tidings nether world meucio somewhat amazed recollecting manly spirit together boldly said brother friend thou art heartily welcome thought thou hadst beene vtterly lost thing quoth tingoccio lost cannot recouered againe lost could heere thee ala tingoccio replyed meucio meaning would resolued whether thou art among damned soules painefull fire hell torment quoth tingoccio sent thither diuers sinnes mee committed suffer great grieuous paine meucio demaunded particularly punishment inflicted seuerall sinnes committed heere wherein tingoccio fully resolued vpon question hee would haue done made answere meucio cause mass prayer almesdeeds performed said helpefull soules abiding meucio promised see done ghost offering depart meucio remembred tingoccioes gossip monna mita raysing himselfe higher vpon pillowe said memorie informeth friend tingoccio kinde gossip monna mita remained life knew familiar let intreat tell p nishment inflicted wanton sinne committed heere oh brother meucio answered tingoccio soone soule landed one came immediately seemed know mine offence readily heart forthwith commanded depart thence certaine place must weepe sinnes grieuous paine found companion condemned punishment among called minde wanton dalliance passed betweene gossip expecting therefore farre greater affliction yet felt although huge fire exceedingly hot yet conceite feare quaked trembled wondrously one consort perceiuing xtreame agony presently said vnto friend hast thou done v condemned thee thou remblest quakest hot fire oh friend quoth feare greater iudgement grieuous offence mee heretofore committed liued hee demaunded mee offence whereto thus answered chance world godfather child christning afterward grew affectionate child mother indeed kissed twice thrise companyon laughing mocking manner replyed thus goe like asse thou art afraid hereafter punishment inflicted kinde whatsoeuer offence frailty committed especially gossip selfe witnesse day drew cockes began crow dreadfull hearing walking spirit tingoccio said meucio farewell friendly companion may tarry longer thee instantly hee vanished away meucio hauing heard confession friend verily beleeuing truth punishment inflicted future world offence frailty life chiefly gossip began condemne owne folly hauing bin gossip many wiues yet modesty restrained familiar offending therefore sorry grosse ignorance hee made vowe wiser hereafter fryar reynard acquainted kind shrift doubtlesse though gossip agnesia knew needed syllogismes put practise conuerted lustfull knauery comparison kinred moued concerning husband childe himselfe best fruit fryerly confession compasse issue inordinate appetite yet clouded cloake religion hath beene ouerthrow many time gentle blast zephirus began blow sunne grew neere setting wherewith king concluded nouell none remaining thus imployed taking crowne owne head placed madame laurettaes saying madame crowne owne crowne queene company shall henceforth command lady mistresse occasion shall liking contentment v word set downe madame lauretta created queene shee caused master houshold bee called gaue command table prepared pleasant vally conuenient houre formerly beene might better ease returne backe pallace shee tooke order likewise necessary matter bee required time regiment turning selfe whole company began manner dioneus yesternight discourse day concerne deceit wiues husband auoyde taxation spleenitiue desire reuenged like dog bitten biteth againe could command morrow conference touch men treachery towards wiues free fiery humor let generall consideration speake queint beguylings haue heretofore past either woman man man woman one man another opinion yeeld v lesse delight related day haue done thus spoken rose granting liberty goe recreate themselues vntill supper time lady thus owne disposing bared legges feete wash coole current others minded walked greene grasse vnder goodly spreading tree dioneus madame fiammetta sate singing together louewarre betweene arcit palemon thus diuersity disports choice delight much contentment imployed till supper drew neere houre come table couered pond side need question dyet dainty infinite bird sweetly singing musicke world could pleasing beside calme windes fanning face neighbouring hilles free flyes least annoyance made delicate addition pleasure sooner table withdrawne risen fetcht turning vally sunne yet quite set coole euening according queenes appointment soft gentle pace walked homeward deuising thousand occasion well dayes discourse yeelded others owne inuenting beside almost darke night arriued pallace variety choice wine abounding plenty rare banquetting outwore little toile wearinesse long walke charged withall afterward according wonted order instrument brought played fell dancing faire fountaine tindaro intruding sound bagpipe make musicke seeme melodious end queene commanded madame philomena sing whereupon instrument tuned fit purpose thus began song chorus sung whole company wearisome life cannot againe returne vnto place made first mourne nothing know yet feele powerfull fire burning within brest deepe desire first felt vnrest cannot exprest sole good best happinesse thus restrainde comfort wretchednesse let liue content thus painde wearisome life c cannot tell rare delight first enflamde soule gaue command spight find ease day night still liue controule see heare feele kinde blisse yet find forme desire feele blessednesse haue none thinke euer shall wearisome life c tell may hope following dayes haue one poore sight bright sunny rayes dazeling sence orecome quite bequeathd wandring wayes poasted may proue haue smallest grace know proceeds loue liue despisde euery place wearisome life c thinkes milde fauour whisper mine eare bid despaire time appeare quell quite confound consuming care ioy surmount proud feare hope gracious time come length cheare long dismay spirit reassume yonr former strength neuer dread see ioyfull day wearisome life cannot againe returne vnto place made first mourne song gaue occasion whole company imagine new pleasing apprehension loue constrained madame philomena sing manner discourse thereof plainely appeared shee felt shee saw shee much happy like wished rest wherefore song ended queene remembring next day following friday turning selfe graciously thus spake know noble lady likewise noble gentleman morrow day consecrated passion blessed lord sauiour haue forgotten easily cannot deuoutly celebrated madame neiphila queene ceasing pleasant discoursing like saturday following sanctifiing sacred sabboth due regard selfe wherefore desirous imitate precedent good example worthy manner shee began v hold decent necessary asttaine morrow day ensuing recounting pleasant nouels reducing memory done dayes saluation soules holy religious motion made queene commendably allowed assembly therefore humbly taking taking leaue indifferent part night already spent seuerally betooke themselues chamber end seauenth day eight day whereon discourse passe vnder rule gouernment honourable ladie lavretta argument imposed concerning wittie deceyuings haue may put practise wiues husband husband wiues one man towards another induction earely sonday morning aurora shewing selfe bright louely sunnes golden beames beganne appeare toppes neere adioyning mountaines hearbes plant tree thing else verie euidently discerned queene companie come foorth chamber hauing walked vvhile abroad goodly greene meadowes taste sweetnesse fresh wholesome ayrethey returned backe againe palace dutie afterward betweene houres seauen eight went heare masse faire chappell eere hand thence returned lodging dined merrily together fell wonted singing dauncing beeing done pleased license queene first obtained went either rest exercise tooke delight midday heate thereof well ouerpast aire seemed mild temperate according queene commanded seated againe fountaine intent prosecute former pastime madame neiphila charge imposed first speaker day beganne followeth gulfardo made match wager wife gasparuolo obtaining amorous fauour regard summe money first giuen money hee borrowed husband gaue payment case discharging husband debt returne home geneway hee told presence wife payde whole summe charge deliuering husband confessed true albeit greatly first nouell wherein declared woman make sale honestie sometimes ouerreached payment iustly serued seeing fortune gracious lady must giue beginning dayes discoursing nouel thinke expedient duty bindeth therewith well contented deceit woman men haue beene large liberally related tell subtile tricke man woman blame deede thinke deceyte well fitted woman speake contrarie nature commending man condemning woman iustly also shew men well beguile crafty companion least beleeue cunning stand artificiall skill howbeit speake properly matter reported deserueth reproachfull title deceite rather recompence duly returned woman ought chaste honest preserue honour liues without yeelding contamination thereof occasion whatsoeuer yet neuerthelesse regard frailty many time prooue constant yet opinion selleth honestie money deserueth iustly burned whereas contrary falleth offence onely intirc affection powerfull lawes loue beeing aboue resistance equity meriteth pardon especially iudge ouerrigorous long since wee heard philostratus reuealing hapned madam phillippa de prato vpon dangerous edict vnderstand worthy auditor liued sometime millaine almaigne soldiour named gulfardo commendable carriage person faithfull serued matter common among al aignes made iust repayment euery one lent monies grew especiall credit familiar best marchants manie time could ready borrow willing alwaies lend thus continuing cittie millaine fastened affection verie beautifull gentlewoman named mistresse ambrosia wife vnto rich merchant called signior gasparuolo sagastraccio good knowledge respectiuely vsed louing gentlewoman great discretion without least apprehension husband sent vpon day entreate conference enioying fruition loue find ready fulfill whatsoeuer pleased command time would make good promise gentlewoman diuers priuate solicitings resolutely answered ready fulfill request gulfardo prouided two especiall consideration might ensue thereon first faithfull concealing thereof person liuing next knew rich occasion vse two hundred crown businesse important consequence freely bestow many euer commanded gulfardo perceiuing couetousnesse woman notwithstanding doting affection thought intirely honest husband became deepely offended vile answere feruent loue conuerted earnest loathing determining constantlie deceiue make auaritious motion mean wherby effect sent word willing performe request farre greater matter respect onely desired know would pleased haue come see receiue money creature hee acquainted setled purpose onely deere friend kinde companion alwayes vsed keepe company neerest occasion concerned gentlewoman rather disloyall wife vppon answer sent extraordinarily iocond contented returning secret letter wherein signified gasparuolo husband important affaire called geneway vnderstand departure safety might come see also bringing crownes meane gulfardo hauing determined would watched conuenient time went vnto gasparuolo sayde sir haue businesse maine importance shall neede vse two hundred crownes onely desire lend many crownes vpon profite wont take mee time haue made vse shall faile day gasparuolo well contented motion made adoe counted downe crownes departing thence within dayes geneway acording wiues former message giuing gulfardo also intelligence absence safety hee might come see bring two hundred crownes gulfardo taking friend company went visite mistresse ambrosia found expectation arriuall first thing counted downe two hundred crownes deliuering presence friend saide mistresse ambrosia receiue two hundred crownes desire pay vnto husband behalfe returned geneway ambrosia receyued two hundred crownes regarding wherefore gulfardo vsed word shee verily beleeued hee spake manner friend take notice giuing vpon couenant passed betweene whereuppon sayde sir pay husband cause giue sufficient discharge first count ouer selfe see whether summe iust hauing drawne ouer vpon table summe containing truly two hundred crownes wherewith highly contented lockt safe vppe cuppeboord gulfardoes friend gone formerly compacted betweene shee came conuerse familiarly hauing prouided banquet passed afterward oftentimes beside husbande returned home matter element rather requires ignorance knowledge gasparuolo come geneway gulfardo obseruing conuenient time sitting doore wife tooke friend comming gasparuolo said worthy sir two hundred crownes vvhich lent iourny geneway regard could serue turne compasse businesse borrowed vvithin day two presence gentle man friend made repayment wife therefore pray crosse booke gasparuolo turning wife demanded whether beholding witnesse standing also present receyuing durst make deniall thus answered indeede husband receiued two hundred crownes gentleman neuer remembred acquaint therewith since comming home hereafter made receiuer except carried quicker memory saide gasparuolo signior gulfardo finde alwaies honest gentleman readie time doe like farre greater kindnesse depart pleasure feare crossing booke gulfardo went away merily contented ambrosia serued iustly merited paying price owne leudnesse husband couetous intent keepe questionlesse caring many like lustfull match shee coulde make liberally rewarded succeeded minde whereas shewed himselfe wise discreete paying nothing pleasure requiting couetous queane kinde lustie youthfull priest varlungo fell loue pretty woman named monna belcolore compasse amorous desire hee lefte cloake pledge payment subtile sleight afterward made meanes borrow morter hee sent home againe presence husband demaunded haue cloake sent hauing left pawne morter pacifie husband offended shee lend priest morter without pawne sent backe cloake againe albeit greatly second nouell approuing promise kept woman make sale honesty coyne warning also men suffer priest ouer familiar wiues gentleman lady gaue equall commendation gulfardoes queint beguiling millaine gentlewoman ambrosia wishing minde might alwaies serued queene smiling pamphilus commaunded follow next whereupon thus began tell faire lady short nouell continually offensiue v yet way able offend least maner iniurie v better vnderstanding lusty priest aduance standard make publike predication wiues winning ad antage ouer pardon sinne punnishment whensoeuer subiected vnto theyr perswasions euen brought soldane bound captiued alexandria auignon imperious power poore soules cannot exercise considering haue neither heart courage deuoire iust reuenge mother sister daughter friend like spirit rise armes wiues therefore meane tell tale country man wife make laugh conclusion thereof singularity word matter yet benefite may gaine thereby apparant proofe sinamon amorous perswading priest alwayes credited word promise let tell varlungo know bee farre distant hence dwelt youthfull priest lustie gallant proper person especially woman seruice commonly called name sweet sir simon albeit man slender reading yet notwithstanding store latine sentence heart true twice many maimed false saintlike shewes holy speech ghostly admonition hee would preach vnder oake field congregated parishioner together woman lay childebed hee daily comfortable visitant would man house occasion walke abroad carrying alwaies bottle holy water wherewith would sprinkle way peeces halowed candle chrisome cake pleased woman extraordinarily country affoorded another frolicke priest nimble actiue sweet sir simon among many feminine parishioner hansome comely woman yet one pleasing wanton eye rest named monna belcolore wife plaine mecanicke man called bentiuegna del mazzo speake vprightly countrey village yeelded woman fresh louely complexion although admirable beauty yet sweete sir simon thoght saint faine would offering shrine diuers prety pleasing quality sounding cymball playing artificially timbrill singing thereto beene nightingale dancing also dexteriously happy man could dance company enflamed sweet sir simon lost wonted sprightly behauiour walked sullen sad melancholly melted mettall hee could hardly haue sight sonday morning hee heard knew church hee would tickle kyrie sanctus euen hee contended shewe singular skill singing beene good heare asse bray whereas contrary came church masse else quicklie shaken vppe deuotion waited onely presence yet cunning carriage amorous businesse credite owne bentiuegna husband could perceiue neighbor much suspect compasse familiar acquaintance belcolore hee sent sundry gift present day day sometime bunch dainty greene garlicke whereof plenty growing garden manured owne hand better countrey yeelded otherwhiles small basket pea beanes onyons scallion season serued could come place darted amourous wincks glance withbecks nod blush loues priuate ambassadours shee countreybred seeming outward appearance see retorted disdainefully forthwith would absent selfe sweet sir simon laboured still vaine could compasse coueted came passe within time high noone sir simon walking abroad chanced meete bentiuegna driuing asse laden diuers commodity demaunding whither went bentiuegna thus answered troth sir simon going city especiall businesse mine owne carry thing signior bonacorci da ginestreto helpe iudge shall called question concerning patrimony sir simon looking merily said thou doest well bentiuegna make friend sure thou need goe take blessing thee returne againe good successe thou meet laguccio naldino yet tell must bring shooetyes sunday bentiuegna said hee would discharge errand parted driuing asse towards florence began sir simon shrug scratch head thinking fit conuenient time goe visite belcolore make triall fortune wherefore setting aside businesse stayed till came house whereinto entred saide happinesse dwell heere belcolore aboue chamber heard tongue replyed sweet sir simon heartely welcome whether walking question may bee demaunded beleeue dainty ducke answered sir simon come sit thee met thy husband going citie time belcolore descended downe stayres hauing againe giuen welcome sir simon sate downe cleansing colewort seed course chaffe husband prepared departure sir simon hugging armes fetching vehement sigh said belcolore long shall pine languish thy loue sir simon answered behauiour fitting holy man holymen belcolore quoth sir simon made matter others haue affection therefore subiect infirmity santa maria answered belcolore dare priest doe thing talke yes belcolore quoth much better men made best businesse regard restrained marriage true quoth belcolore much medling men wiues touch text belcolore replyed sir simon somewhat aboue capacity talke come namely thy loue ducke doue sir simon thine pray thee mine belcolore obseruing smirking behauiour proper person pretty talke queint insinuating felt motion female frailty yet would withstand long could ouerhasty yeelding sir simon promiseth new paire shoe garter ribband girdle else would request sir simon quoth thing talke fit woman loue mee make choice fulfill motion perhaps shall tell sir simon heate made hasty promise whatsoeuer would desire whereupon thus shee replyed saturday said must goe florence carry home yarne sent spinne amend spinning wheele lend mee ten florines wherewith know alwayes furnished shall redeeme vsurer best peticote wedding gowne well neere lost lacke repaiment without cannot beseene church good place else afterward matter may accomplished ala sweete belcolore answered sir simon neuer beare sum men profession doe seldome carry money beleeue word saturday come faile bring hither oh sir quoth belcolore men quicke promiser slow performer doe thinke vse poore billezza trusted faire word found selfe deceiued sir simon example made scandall world sufficient warning prouided goe make vse friend otherwise moued nay belcolore quoth hope serue word shall better worth consider conueniency time wee priuately alone whereas returning hither againe hinderance may thwart like opportunity neuer obtained sir sir said haue heard resolution fetche florines doe otherwise walke businesse woman word sir simon perceiuing would trust vpon bare word thing done without saluum fac whereas meaning sine custodia thus answered well belcolore seeing dare credit bringing tenne florines according promised day leaue good pawne best cloake lyned quite thorough rich silke made vp choysest manner belcolore looking cloake said much may cloake bee worth much quoth sir simon vpon word belcolore right fine flanders serdge aboue eight dayes since bought thus ready made lotto fripperer payed sixe twenty florines pledge sufficient te possible said shee cost much well sir simon deliuer first lay vp safe saturday fetch redeeme ine owne thing leaue release yourselfe cloake laid vp belcolore sir simon forward affection briefe enioyed hee came departed afterward light tripping cassocke yet thorow la y much frequented place smelling nosegay hee beene wedding countrey went thus lightly without cloake better ease commonly action euill repentance knocketh doore conscience vrgeth guilty remembrance sence sorrow sweet sir simon suruaying ouer vailes offering candle validity yearely benefit comming nothing neere summe scarce halfe sixe twenty florines began repent deed darkenesse although acted daytime considered himselfe honest yet vnsuspected meanes hee might recouer cloake againe went broaker redemption belcolores pawned apparrell yet send florines neither hauing cunning reaching wit especially matter owne aduantage pretending haue dinner lodging inuited friend made vse neighbour boy sending house belcolore request lending stone morter make greenesawce guest hee meate required sawce belcolore suspecting treachery sent stone morter pestell dinner time knew bentiuegna bee home wife spye set purpose hee called clearke vsually attending said take morter pestell beare home belcolore tell sir simon sends home thankes hauing sufficiently serued turne desire likewise send cloake boy left pledge better remembrance would lend without pawne clearke comming house belcolore found sitting dinner husband deliuering pestell morter performed rest sir simon message belcolore hearing cloake demaunded stept vp make answere bentiuegna seeming lookes much offended roughly replyed wife sir simon especiall friend cannot pleasured without pawne protest vpon word could find heart smite thee rise quickely thou wert best send backe cloake warning hereafter whatsoeuer haue poore asse thing else let haue tell master clearke may command belcolore rose grumbling table fetching cloake forth chest stood neere hand roome shee deliuered clearke saying tell sir simon boldly say heard speake make vow selfe shall neuer make vse morter hereafter beat sawcinesse let husband say whatsoeuer speake word performe away went clearke home cloake told sir simon said whereto replyed must make vse morter trust keeping cloake feare goe gage indeed bentiuegna little displeased wiues word hee thought spake iest albeit belcolore angry sir simon would speake till vintage time following sir simon sharpe threatenings soule danger hell fire continuing long hatred holy priest word little terrifie besides daily present sweet new wine roasted chessenuts figges almond vnkindnesse became conuerted former familiarity garment redeemed gaue sonnet would sweetly sing cimbale friendship increased betweene sweet sir simon calandrino bruno buffalmaco painter profession trauelled plaine mugnone finde preciou stone called helitropium calandrino perswaded himselfe haue found returned home house heauily loaden stone wife rebuking absence hee groweth anger shrewdly beateth afterward case debated among friend bruno buffalmaco found meere foolery third nouell iustly reprehending simplicity men much addicted credulitie giue credit euery thing heare pamphilus hauing ended nouell whereat lady laughed exceedingly hardly could giue ouer queene gaue charge madame eliza shee next succeed order scarcely able refraine smyling thus began know gracious lady whether moue hearty laughter briefe nouell mine owne pamphilus lately yet dare assure true pleasant relate best manner owne citie euermore hath contained sort people long since dwelt painter named calandrino simple man yet much adicted matter nouelty man whatsoeuer could part time spent company two painter one called bruno buffalmaco men recreatiue spirit indifferent good capacity often resorting said calandrino tooke delight honest simplicity pleasant order behauiour time likewise dwelt florence yong gentleman singular disposition euery generous witty conceite world yeeld pleasant companion named maso del saggio hauing heard somwhat calandrinos sillinesse determined iest merry manner suggest longing humor nouelties conceit extraordinary nature happening day meete church saint iohn seeing seriously busied beholding rare picture curious carued tabernacle long placed high altar said church considered himselfe fit place opportunity effect hee long time desired hauing imparted minde intimate friend intended deale simple calandrino went neere sate alone making shew saw began consult themselues concerning rare property precious stone whereof maso discoursed exactly beene skilfull lapidarie conference calandrino lent attentiue eare regard matter singular rarity soone calandrino started vp perceiuing loude speaking talked nothing required secret counsell went company onely thing maso desired holding still former argument calandrino would need request know place precious stone found excellent vertues maso made answere berlinzona neere city bascha territory countrey called bengodi vine bound cidges goose sold penny gosling freely giuen boote also high mountaine wholly made parmezane grated cheese whereon dwelt people nothing else make mocharones rauiuolies boyling broth capon afterward hurled whosoeuer catch neere mountaine runneth faire riuer whole streame pure white bastard none euer sold money without one drop water trust sir said calandrino excellent countrey dwell pray tell sir doe capon haue boyld baschanes quoth maso eate haue sir said calandrino time beene countrey answered maso doe demaund haue beene yes man aboue thousand time least farre sir pray quoth calandrino worthy countrey city troth replyed maso mile hardly numbred part vve trauell vvhen vve nightly beddes man dreame right may vpon sudden surely sir said calandrino hence abruzzi yes questionlesse replyed maso vvilling minde trauell seemeth tedious calandrino well noting maso deliuered speech stedfast countenance signe smyling gesture vrge least mislike gaue credit matter apparent manifest truth vpon assured confidence said beleeue sir iourney ouerfarre mee vndertake vvere neerer could affoord goe company onely see hovv make macherones fill belly vvith wee talke sir pray pardon mee aske whether precious stone spake found countrey yes indeed replyed maso two kind found territory great vertue one kind gritty stone settignano montisca vertue place millstone grindstone bee made knede sand vse doe meale make bignesse please respect haue common saying nature maketh common stone montisca millstone plenty millstone slenderly esteemed among v emerald whereof haue whole mountaines farre greater montemorello shine gloriously midnight meanly soeuer account millstone yet drill enchase ring afterward send great soldane haue whatsoeuer demaund kinde precious stone indeede best lapidary call helitropium vertue whereof admirable whosoeuer beareth long keepeth impossible eye discerne walketh meerely inuisible lord sir quoth calandrino stone rare vertue indeede else may man finde helitropium whereto maso thus answered countrey onely doth containe helitropium many time found vpon plaine mugnone bignesse sir quoth calandrino stone coulour helitropium answered maso alwayes one quality bigge others lesse one coulour namely blacke calandrino committing thing respectiue memory pretending called thence especiall affaire departed maso concluding resoluedly himselfe finde precious stone possibly hee could yet intending doe nothing vntill hee acquainted bruno buffalmaco therewith loued dearly went hast seeke without longer trifling time three might bee first men find precious stone spending almost whole morning three met together painting monastery sister faenza serious imployment followed businesse diligently hauing found saluting kinde manner continually vsed doe thus began louing friend pleased follow mine aduise wee three quickely richest men florence information gentleman well deseruing credited plaine mugnone precious stone found whosoeuer carrieth walketh inuisible seene one let v three first men goe finde heare thereof goe assure selues shall finde know discription soone see wee haue hinder v bearing v goe table banker money changer see daily charged plenty gold siluer may take much wee list able descrie v short time shall wee wealthy neuer needing drudge paint muddy walles hitherto haue done many poore profession forced doe bruno buffalmaco hearing began smile looking merily seemed wonder thereat greatly commended counsell calandrino buffalmaco demaunding stone named fortuned calandrino grosse blockish memory quite forgot name stone therefore said neede haue wee name know assured stone vertue let v make adoe setting aside businesse goe seeke found well friend answered bruno say wee may finde meanes two sort quoth calandrino bigge others smaller carry blacke colour therefore mine opinion let v gather stone blacke shall sure finde among without losse time buffalmaco aud bruno liked allowed counsell calandrino seuerall commendation giuen assurance bruno saide doe thinke conuenient time v go weighty businesse sun yet highest degree striketh heate plaine mugnone stone extreamly dryed blackest nowe seeme whitest morning dew falne sunne shineth forth euery stone retaineth true colour moreouer many labourer vvorking plaine businesse seuerally assigned seeing v serious serch may imagine seeke partake v inquisition meanes may chance speed v wee may lose trot amble wherefore consent opinion iumpe mine enterprize onely perfourmed early morning blacke stone distinguisht white festiuall day best none discouer v buffalmaco applauded aduice bruno calandrino lesse concluding together sunday morning next ensuing time three would go seeke stone calandrino verie earnest shold reueale liuing body tolde especiall secret disclosing hee heard concerning countrey bengodi maintaining solemn oath protestation euery part thereof true vppon agreement parted calandrino hardly enioyed anie rest either night day greedie bee possessed stone sonday morning hee called vp companion breake day going forth gall port stayed till came plaine mugnone searched finde strange stone calandrino went stealing two verilie perswaded himselfe borne finde helitropium looking euery side hee reiected stone blacke whereof first filled bosome afterwards pocket tooke large painting apron fastened girdle manner sacke filled full stone likewise yet satisfied spred abroad cloake also full stone hee bound vp carefully feare loosing least buffalmaca bruno well obseruing day growing hardly could reach home dinner time according merrily concluded pretending see calandrino albeit farre become calandrino saide buffalmaco bruno gazing strangely euery hee desirous finde replyed saw long since hard v questionlesse hath giuen v slippe priuilie gone home dinner making starke fooles v hath lefte v picke vp blacke stone vpon parching plaines mugnone well quoth buffalmaco tricke hollowhearted friend protested himselfe v could vvee haue bin sottish credit friuolous perswasions hoping finde stone vertue fruitlesse plain mugnone none would haue beleeued calandrino close hearing wordes seeing whole manner wondering behauiour became constantly perswaded hee onely founde precious stone also store reason neere yet could see therefore walked ioy beyond compasse expression exceedingly proud happy aduenture meane speake one word heauily laden hee steale home faire softly indeede leauing follow would bruno perceiuing intent said buffalmaco remaineth v doe go home well hee reason replyed bruno vaine tarry longer heere solemnly protest calandrino shall make asse neere long since would giue remembrance heele flint stone sticke moneth teach lesson abusing friend hee threw stone hit shrewdly heele therewith one calandrino whatsoeuer saide thus still followed although blow stone painfull yet mended pace wel able regard beeing ouerloaden stone gaue one word way tooke himselfe bee inuisible vtterly vnseene buffalmaco taking vppe another flintstone indifferent heauie sharp said bruno seest thou flint casting smote calandrino iust backe therewith saying oh calandrino bin neere might haue hit backe stone thus way plaine mugnone nothing else pelt stone euen farre port gall threwe downe stone gathered meaning molest done enough already stept vnto port acquainted warder whole matter laughing heartily iest better vpholde would seeme see calandrino passage suffered go sore wearied burthen sweating extreamly without resting himselfe place came home house neere corner milles fortune fauourable course mockery passed along riuers side afterward part city neither met seen regard house dinner calandrino euery minute ready sinke vnder weightie burthen entred owne house great ill luck wife comely honest woman named monna trista standing aloft stayres head somewhat angry long absence seeing come grunting groaning frowningly said thought diuell would neuer let thee come home whole citie haue dined yet wee must remaine without dinner calandrino heard perceiued inuisible wife full rage wroth hee began raile saying ah thou wicked woman art thou thou hast vtterly vndone liue pay thee soundly vp staires ascended small parlour hadde spred burthen stone floore ran wife catching h head throwing feete giuing many spurns cruel blowes shee able mooue either armes legges notwithstanding teares humble submission buffalmaco bruno spent indifferent warder port laughter faire gentle pace followed calandrino home house come doore heard harsh bickering betweene wife seeming newly arriued called alowd calandrino sweate st ping rauing still wife looking forth window entreated ascend vp counter etting greeuous displeasure come roome saw couered ouer stone wife sitting corner haire wellneere torne head face broken blee ing body cruelly beaten side calandrino standing vnbraced vngirded strugling wallowing like quite breath little pausing bruno th spake calandrino may ing matter art thou preparing building thou hast prouided plenty stone sitteth thy poore wife hast thou misvsed behauiours wise honest man calandrino vtterly ouerspent trauaile carrying huge burthen stone also toylesome beating wife much impatient offended high good fortune imagined haue lost could collect spirit together answer one ready word wherefore hee sate fretting like mad man whereupon buffalmaco thus began calandrino thou angry yet thou shouldest haue made mockery v thou hast done leauing v like couple coxcombes plaine mugnone whether thou leddest v thee seeke precious stone called helitropium couldst thou steale home neuer bidding v much farewell vve take euill part thou shouldest abuse two honest neighbour well assure thy selfe last time euer thou shalt serue v calandrino time somewhat better come himselfe humble protestation courtesie returned answer ala good frionds offended case farre otherwise immagine poore vnfortunate man found rare precious stone speake marke well tell truth asked one another first time become hard vvithin distance two yard length perceiuing saw mee still neere alwaies w smiling selfe heare brabble rage proceeding discourse recounted euery accident hapned saide vnto concerning seuerall blowes two flintstone one hurting greeuously heele paining extreamly backe speech vsed laughter notwithstanding hee felt harme yet beeing proud inuisibly beguile nay quoth cannot forbeare tell passed thorow port saw standing warder yet vertue excellent stone vndiscouered beside going along street met many gossip friend familiar acquaintance vsed day lie conuerse drinking together euery tauern yet one spake neyther vsed courtesie salutation vvhich indeede freely forgiue able see end come home mine owne house diuellish accursed woman aloft vppon stayres head much misfortune chanced see regard vnknowne woman cause thing lose vertue respect could haue stild selfe onely happy man florence made miserable therefore iustly beate long able stand mee know reason contrary yet teare thousand peeces may well curse day mariage hinder bereaue inuisible blessednesse buffalmaco bruno hearing made shew verie much meruailing thereat many time maintained calandrino said well neere ready burst laughter considering cofidently stood vpon found wonderful stone lost wiues speaking onely saw rise fury intent beat againe stept betweene affirming woman way offended case rather knowing woman cause thing lose vertue therefore expresly commanded seene presence day vntill made full proofe stone vertue questionles consideration matter auaileable important quite taken especiall happinesse belong part friend acquainted therewith drew plaine vvith companie vvhere tooke much paine serch stone possibly could yet dishonestly would deceiue beare away couetously owne priuate benefit many wise wholesome perswasions constantly credited spake reconciled wife without difficulty falling wonderfull greefe melancholy losse admirable precious stone danger haue dyed within lesse month prouost belonging cathedrall church fiesola fell loue gentlewoman widdow named piccarda hated much loued imagining lay gentlewoman bretheren byshop vnder serued taken bed mayde vgly soule deformed slut fourth nouell wherein declared loue oftentimes powerfull aged men driueth doating redoundeth great disgrace punishment ladie eliza hauing concluded nouell notwithout infinite commendation whole company queen turning lookes madame aemillia gaue expresse signe must need follow next madame eliza whereupon began manner vertuous lady well remember diuers nouels formerly related sufficient hath beene sayde concerning priest religious person carrying shauen crownes luxurious appetite desire one time say much thereto may added beside alreadie spoken wil tel another concerning prouost cathedral church would needes despight vvorld loue gentlewoman whether would therefore due chastisement vnto age folly gaue entertainment iustly deserued vnknowne vnto cittie fieosola mountaine whereof may easily hither discerne hath bene time past great ancient city although day wellneere ruined yet neuerthelesse alwaies yet byshops see albeit wealthiest citie long since neere vnto cathedrall church dwelt gentlewoman widdow commonlie stiled name madame piccarda whose house inheritance small wherewith yet liued contentedly hauing wandering eye wanton desire company two brother gentleman especiall honest gracious disposition gentlewoman yet flourishing condition time ordinarily resort cathedrall church holie zeale religious deuotion prouost place became enamored nothing sight yeelded contentment fond affection forwarded audacious bold carriage hee dared acquaint loue requiring enterchange affection like opinion true farre entred yeares yong lustie proud conceite presuming strangely beyond capacity thinking well abilitie youthfullest gallant world could doe whereas verie deede person vtterly displeasing behauiour immodest scandalous vsuall language sauouring sensualitie fewe none cared company woman seemed respectiue regard outside profession feare least affection alwayes welcome headake fond foolish carriage stil continuing gentlewoman wise vertuously aduised spake thus vnto holy sir loue according protest manifest outward behauiour thanke bound dutie loue likewise loue haue harshe vnsauourie taste vvhich mine way able endure neyther dare entertaine anie kinde soeuer must shall hold mee excused made temper ghostly spirituall father holy priest moreouer yeares haue made honorably aged seuerall weighty consideration ought confirme continency chastity remember withall good sir child year bent wanton appetite shold iustly correct fatherly counsell beautifieth sacred profession beside widdow ign rant requisite thing honestie widdowes wherefore pardon mee holy father manner make motion desire loue mee neither time affect prouoste gaining grace time would giue ouer first repulse pursuing still vnbeseeming importunity many priuate meanes vsed letter token insinuating ambassages yea whensoeuer shee came church neuer ceased wearisome solicitings whereat growing greatly offended perceyuing likelyhood desisting became tyred tedious suite considered selfe might dispatch deserued saw remedy yet shee would attempte anie thing case without acquainting bretheren first therwith hauing tolde much shee importuned prouost also course meant take wherin counselled encouraged within day shee went church wont soone prouost espyed forthwith came according continued course fell amorous courting looking vpon smiling countenance walking aside hearing spent many impertinent speech shee venting foorth manie vehement sighe length returned answer reuerend father haue often heard saide fort castle strongly munited soeuer bee continuall assayling length necessity must surprized comparison may full well allude selfe hauing long time solicited one affable language againe vvith token entisements preuailing power haue broken verie barricado former deliberation yeelded mee vppe prisoner commanded pleasure onely deuoted well may gentle lady imagine answere little welcome prouost shrugging conceyte ioy presently thus replyed thanke madame piccarda tell true held almost miracle could stand vpon long resistance considering neuer fortuned mee anie haue many time saide selfe woman vvere made siluer hardly could worth pennie scarsely one found good allay endure test essay let v breake friuolous conference resolue vpon conclusion may safely meete together worthy sir answered piccard selfe may appoint time whensoeuer please haue husband render account absence presence prouided place pretty prouoste stood musing last saide place madame priuacie owne house ala sir quoth know haue two gentleman brother cotinually friend beside house also great wherefore impossible except could like dumbe man without speaking one word making least noyse beside remaine darkenesse blinde able endure yet without aduenturing albeit neuer come chamber lodging close mine cannot word spoken neuer low whispering manner heare easily madame said prouoste one two night make hard shift sir quoth matter onely remaineth silent suffering already haue heard feare safty let alone madame replyed prouoste bee gouerned direction case let v begin night heart saide shee appointing hee come hee parted shee returned home house heere tell gentlewoman seruant nature old maide indued well featured face instead thereof vgliest countefeit countenance hardly could seene worse wrie mouth huge great lippes foule teeth great blacke monstrous stinking breath eye bleared alwayes running complexion face betweene greene yellow shee spent summer season citie parching countrey vnder hedge beside excellent part shee crooke backt poult footed went like lame mare fetter name ciuta regard flat nose lying low beagle shee called ciutazza notwithstanding deformity yet singuler opinion selfe commonly foule sl t haue regard whereof madame piccarda calling aside thus began ciutazza thou wilt doe one night seruice shall bestow thee faire new smocke ciutazza heard speake new smocke instantly answered madame please bestow new smocke runne thorow fire businesse farre greater danger onely haue power command doe said piccarda vrge thee dangerous action onely lodge bed night man giue courteous entertainement shall reward thee liberally haue especiall care thou speake one word feare thou shouldst heard brother thou knowest lodge neere doe demaund thy smocke madame quoth ciutazza lye sixe men rather one say word shall done night come prouoste also came according appointment euen two brother lodging easily heard entrance piccarda present informed went prouoste without candle making least noise heard piccardaes chamber went bed ciutazza tarrying long mistresse instructed went bed likewise speaking word prouoste imagining haue highly affected fell imbracing kissing ciutazza forward manner intend leaue piccarda performed hot piece businesse referred effecting remainder brother sort compacted betweene faire softly went two brother forth chamber going market place fortune fauourable could wish accomplishing issue intent heat somwhat tedious lord bishop walking abroad late purpose visit brother widdowes house tooke great delight company good schollers endued singular part beside meeting open market place acquainted determination whereof little ioyfull iumping iustly intent come widdowes house passed smal nether court light stood ready welcome thither entring goodly hall store good wine banquetting bishop accepted thankefull manner courteous complement ouerpassed one brother thus spake good lord seeing hath pleased honour poore widdowed sister house presence wee shall thanke liue would intreate one fauour onely see sight shew lord bishop well contented motion brother conducting hand brought sister chamber prouoste bed ciutazza soundly sleeping enfolded armes wearied belike former wantonning whereof age little need courtaines close drawne bed although season exceeding hot hauing lighted torch hand drew open curtaines shewed bishop prouoste close snugging betweene armes ciutazza vpon sudden prouoste awaked seeing great light also many people shame feare daunted hee shrunke downe bed hid head bishop displeased sight vnseemely made discouer head againe see bed withall poore prouoste perceiuing gentlewoman deceite proper hansome person sweetly embracing made confounded shame power vtter one word hauing put cloathes bishop command hee sent vnder sufficient guard pallace suffer due chastisement sinne committed afterward desired know meanes hee became fauoured ciutazza whole historie whereof two brother related large bishop heard discourse highly commended wisedome gentlewoman worthy assistance brother contemning soile hand blood priest rather sought shame hee deserued bishop enioyned pennance repentance forty dayes loue disdaine made weepe nine forty moreouer long durst seene abroad came walke street boyes would point finger saying behold prouoste lay c utazza wearisome life became well neere distracted wit manner honest gentlewoman discharged dutie rid selfe prouosts importunity ciutazza merry night new smocke also labour three pleasant companion plaide merry pranke iudge belonging marquesate ancona florence time sate bench hearing criminall cause fift nouell giuing admonition mannaging publique affaire person ought appointed honest meet sit seate authority sooner madam aemillia finished nouell wherin excellent wisedome piccarda worthily punishing luxurious old prouoste generall commendation whole assembly queene looking philostratus said command next supply place whereto made answere hee ready willing thus began honourable lady merry gentleman lately remembred madame eliza named maso del saggio causeth passeouer intended tale resolued came turne report another concerning two men friendly companion although may appeare somewhat vnpleasing regard little grosse vnmannerly behauiour yet moue merriment without offence maine reason relate vnknowne partly intelligence reuerend predecessours also vnderstanding owne many time haue resorted city florence potestates officer belonging marquesate anconia commonly men lowe spirit liues wretched penurious rather deserued tearmed miser men regard naturall couetousnesse misery iudges would bring also company scribe notary paralelde master seemed like swaines come plough bred vp coblers quality rather schollers student law one time aboue rest among potestates iudges came especiall man pickt purpose named messer niccolao da san lepidio first beholding looked rather like tinker officer authority hansome man among rest deputed heare criminall cause often happeneth citizen although businesse inuiteth iudiciall court yet still resort thither sometimes accidentally fortuned maso del saggio one morning search especiall friend went courthouse obserued manner messer niccolao seated looking like strange fowle lately come forth farre countrey began suruay seriously euen head foot vse say albeit saw gowne furred miniuer also hood necke penne inkehorne hanging girdle one skirt garment longer misshapen sight farre vnfitting man ciuill profession yet spyed one errour extraordinary notable opinion euer seene namely paultry paire breech wickedly made worse worne hanging downe lowe halfe legge euen sate vpon bench yet cut sparingly cloath gaped wide open wheelebarrow might haue full entrance allowed strange sight pleasing leauing search friend scorning haue spectacle alone himselfe hee went vpon another inquisition namely two merry lad like himselfe one called ribi matteuzza men mirthfull disposition therefore fitter company met salutation honest boyes euer kindnesse declare effectually accompanying courthouse shall behold singular spectacle sure neuer yet saw like forthwith went along altogether come court house shewed iudges hansome paire breech hanging base beastly manner yet farre bench heart ake extreamity laughter came neere seat whereon messer niccolao sate plainely perceiued ea e crept vnder withall board whereon set foot rotten broken difficult matter reach pull downe man pleased let fall bare breecht ground cheare vp spirit heart quoth maso longing like mine haue yonder breech good deale lower see may easily done laying head together plotting contriuing seuerall wayes might likelyest compasse intent peculiar appointment vndertake businesse without fayling performed next morning houre assigned met againe finding court well filled people plaintiffes defendant earnestly pleading matteuzzo body could descry cunningly crept vnder bench lay close board whereon iudge placed feete stept maso right hand messer niccolao tooke fast hold gowne like ribi left hand respect answerable oh lord iudge cryed maso aloud humbly intreat charity sake th pilfering knaue escape away hence may haue iustice stealing drawingouer stockeings stoutly denyeth yet mine owne eye beheld deed aboue fifteene dayes since
