first bought mine owne vse worthy lord iudge cryed ribi side doe beleeue saith paltry lying fellow hee knew came hither make complaint male cloakebag stole hee vrgeth occasion paire drawing stockeings deliuered owne hand lordship credit produce witness trecco shoemaker monna grassa souseseller sweepes church santa maria verzaia saw came posting hither maso haling tugging iudge sleeue would suffer heare ribi cryed still iustice like contrary side time clamourous contending iudge willy willing heare either party matteuzzo vpon signe receiued word masoes pleading laide holde broken boord also iudges lowhanging breech plucking strongly fell downe immediately breech onely tyed one poynt hearing board breaking vnderneath maine pulling breech stroue sate make fast poynt broken maso cry eare one side ribi like hee wit end defend himselfe lord quoth maso may bee ashamed doe iustice heare mee wholly lend eare mine aduersary lord said ribi neuer libell preferd court paltry trifling matter therefore must haue iustice time iudge dismounted bench stood ground slouenly breech hanging heeles matteuzzo cunningly stolne away vndiscouered body ribi thinking shamed iudge sufficiently went away protesting would declare cause hearing wiser iudge maso forbearing tugge gowne longer departing said fare well sir worthy magistrate haue regard honour honesty put poore men suite pleasure went seuerall wayes soone gone publike view worshipfull iudge messer niccolao stood ground presence beholder trussed vp breech hee new risen bed better bethinking himselfe matter indifference called two men contended drawing stocking cloakebag one could tell become whereupon rapt kinde iudges oath saying know whether law heere florence make iudge sit bare breecht bench iustice hearing criminall cause whereat chiefe potestate stander laughed heartily within fewe dayes informed especiall friend neuer happened onely testifie vnderstanding florentine ancient constitution customes embrace loue honour honest discreet worthy iudges magistrate whereas contrary much condemne miserable knaues fooles dolt neuer merit haue better entertainment wherefore would best make enquiry party lest worse inconuenience happen bruno buffalmaco steale young brawne calandrino recouery thereof vsed kinde pretented coniuration pilles made ginger strong malmesey instead application gaue two pilles dogges date dowsets confected alloes receiued meanes whereof made beleeue hee robde himselfe feare report theft wife made goe buy another brawne sixt nouell wherein declared easily plaine simple man may made foole dealeth crafty companion philostratus sooner concluded nouell whole assembly laughed heartily thereat queen gaue command madame philomena shee follow next order whereupon thus shee began worthy lady philostratus calling memorie name maso del saggio hath contented another merry nouell concerning manner must intreat remember againe calandrino subtle consort pretty tale meane tell manner reuenged going seeke inusible stone needlesse fresh relation manner people three men calandrino bruno buffalmaco already haue sufficient vnderstanding therefore induction discourse must tell calandrino small countryhouse village somewhat neere florence came marriage wife among cattle poultry kept store hee young boare readie fatted brawne whereof yearly vsed kill one owne prouision alwaies month december wife resorted village house haue brawne killed salted came passe time concerning tale woman somewhat crazie sickly husband vnkinde vsage whereof heard lately calandrino went alone killing boare comming hearing bruno buffalmaco woman could meanes passe away time little merriment went friendlie companion honest iouiall priest dwelling farre calandrinoes countrey house morning boare kilde three went thither calandrino seeing priest companie bad heartily welcome acquaint good husbandry hee shewed house boare hung perceyuing faire fat knowing also calandrino intended salt owne store bruno saide vnto thou art asse calandrino sell thy brawne let v make merrie money let thy wife know otherwise stolne thee theeues continually haunt country house especially scattering village oh mine honest friend answered calandrino counsell followed neither wife easie perswaded wer readiest way make house hell become masterdiuell therefore talke flatly doe albeit laboured earnestly yet proued anie purpose onely desired suppe colde manner denyed parted thence walked way bruno saide buffalmaco shall three night rob brawne yea marry quoth buffalmaco done haue saide bruno alreadie found meanes effect take place last saw let v doe answered buffalmaco sir domine heere make good cheare among selues nimble priest forward best match fully agreed bruno thus spake delicate sir domine art cunning must maine help thou knowest buffalmaco couetous wretch calandrino glad readie drink alwaies men expences let v go take v tauern priest owne honour reputation shall offer make paiment whole reckoning without receiuing farthing whereof little ioyfull shall bring passe rest businesse body house onely himselfe best ease without company bruno propounded accordingly performed calandrino perceyued priest would suffer none pay himselfe dranke freely neede tooke cuppes couragiously one another two three houres night spent parted tauerne calandrino going directly home house instantly bed without supper imagining made fast doore indeede left wide open sleeping soundly without suspition harme intended vnto buffalmaco bruno went supt priest soone supper ended tooke certaine engine better entering calandrinoes house went effect theyr purpose finding doore standing readie open entered tooke brawne carried priest house afterward went bed calandrino well slept wine arose morning descended downe staires finding street doore wide open looked brawne gone enquiring neighbour dwelling neere hee could heare tydings brawne became wofullest man world telling euery one brawne stolne bruno buffalmaco risen morning went visite calandrino heare tooke losse brawne hee sooner sight called teares running downe cheekes sayde ah deare friendes robde brawne bruno stepping closely sayde eare wonderfull thy life time thou canst bee wise answered calandrino speake good earnest speake still earnest replied bruno cry loud thou canst let list beleeue true calandrino stampt fretted exceedingly saying true man god prince countrey tell thee truly brawne stolne say still bid thee answered bruno let world beleeue thee list wouldst thou quoth calandrino haue damne selfe diuell see thou dost credit say would hanged necke true brawne stolne ca possible replyed bruno see thy house yester night wouldst thou beleeue flowne away although flowne avvay quoth calandrino yet certain stolne away weary life dare go home mine owne house regard wife neuer beleeue yet credite sure haue peace tweluemonths space bruno seeming halfe sorrowfull yet supporting still former iesting humor saide trust mee calandrino much blame answered calandrino belike thou vvouldst haue mee blaspheme heauen saint therein tell thee againe bruno last night brawne stolne patient good calandrino replyed buffalmaco thy brawne stolne thee mean enow get againe meanes enow get againe said calandrino would faine heare one likely one let rest go sure calandrino answered buffalmaco thou art verily perswaded theefe came india steale thy brawne thee respect must needes thy neighbour vvhom thou couldst louingly assemble together knowe experiment made vvith bread cheese whereby party hath quickly discouered haue heard quoth bruno experiment helde infallible extendeth onely vnto person gentilitie whereof dwelling heere case stealing brawne doubtfull inuite neither certainty comming confesse say aunswered buffalmaco true matter nerely concerning v done deare friend aduice would haue pilles made ginger compounded best strongest malmsey let ordinary sort people inuited onely mistrusted faile come vtterly ignorant intention besides pilles may well bee hallowed consecrated bread cheese like occasion indeede say true replyed buffalmaco opinion calandrino willing haue try made yes meanes answered calandrino gladly would know hath stolne brawne good word haue halfe comforted already case well quoth bruno take paine go florence prouide thing necessarie secret seruice must bee furnished money effect calandrino forty shilling deliuered bruno presently went florence frend apothecarie bought pound white ginger hee caused make vppe small pilles two beside doggesdates dowsets confected ouer strong aloe yet well moulded sugare rest easily bee knowne spotted gold verie formall physicall manner bought moreouer big flaggon best malmesey returning backe thing calandrino directing order must put friend trust inuite neighbor especially suspect breakfast morning done feast kindnesse come willingly night buffalmaco take order pilles shall haue charge imposed wee bring hither againe morning selfe sake deliuer guest performe whatsoeuer bee sayde done next morning goodly company assembled vnder faire elme church well young florentynes purposely came make themselues merry neighbouring husbandman village bruno begin seruice pils faire cup buffalmaco followed another cup deliuer wine flaggon company beeing set round circle bruno buffalmaco midst bruno thus spake honest friend fit acquaint occasion thus met together place anie thing may seeme offensiue afterward shall make complaint calandrino louing friend heere prefent yesternight newkild fat brawne taken hath done deede yet knoweth none one heere among v must need offend case desiring vnderstand would haue man receiue one pilles afterward drinke wine assuring whosoeuer stole brawne hence cannot able swallow pill wil extreme bitter mouth enforce coughe spet extraordinarily respect notorious shame receiued goodly assembly heere present much better haue brawne confesse priuate honest priest abstaine vrging anie publike proofe euery one present answered well contented eate drinke let shame fall deserued whereupon bruno appointing sit placing calandrino one among began counterfeite exorcisme giuing man pill buffalmaca cup wine came calandrino hee tooke one made dogges date dowsets deliuering hand presently hee put mouth chewed soone tongue tasted bitter aloe began coughe spet extreamly vtterly vnable endure bitternesse noysome smell men receyued pils beganne gaze one vpon another see whose behauiour discouer bruno hauing yet deliuered pils proceeded still businesse seeming heare coughing till one behinde saide meaneth calandrino spetting coughing bruno sodainely turning seeing calandrino cough spet sort saide rest rash honest friend iudging man matter pille may procure coughing wherfore shall receiue another better cleare beleefe concerning hauing put second prepared pill mouth bruno went serue rest guest first exceeding bitter taste made great deale worse teares streamed forth eye bigge cherrystone champing chewing pill hoping would ouercome coughing coughed spette violently grosser manner giue wine helpe buffalmaco bruno whole company perceiuing continued still coughing spetting saide one voyce calandrino theefe himselfe gaue manie grosse speech beside departing home vnto house much displeased angry gone none remained priest bruno buffalmaco thus spake calandrino euer thinke thou wast theefe thy selfe yet thou imputedst thy robbery feare drinke freely thy purse thou hast done many time calandrino yet ended coughing spetting sware many bitter oathes brawne stolne talke long thou wilt quoth buffalmaco thy knauery knowne seene well thou mayst ashamed thy selfe calandrino hearing grew desperately angry incense bruno thus pursued matter heare calandrino speake thee honest earnest man company eate drinke heere among thy neighbour plainly told thou keptst young lad heere thee seruice feeding victual thou couldst spare thou didst send away thy brawne one bought thee foure crownes onely cousen thy poore wife v canst thou yet learne leaue thy mocking scorning thou hast forgotte thou broughtst v plaine mugnone seeke black inuisible stone hauing found thou concealedst thy selfe stealing home inuisibly v making v follow like fooles thee likewise horrible lying oathes periured protestation thou wouldst make v beleeue brawne thou hast cunningly sold ready money stolne thee thy house thou art onely th theefe thy selfe excellent rule art neuer faileth hath plainly thy shame appeared wee well acquainted thy delusion knowing perfectly plainly tell thee mean foold vnknowne thee paine vvee haue taken making singular peece proofe wherefore inflict punishment thee thou shalt bestow honest priest v two couple capon flaggon wine else discouer knauery thine thy wife calandrino perceiuing protestation could winne credit law remaining owne hand purposed deale pleased apparantly saw sighing sorrow nothing auaile moreouer fall wiues tempestuous stormes chiding would bee worse racking torturing gladly therefore gaue money buy two couple capon wine heartily contented likewise hee well deliuered merry priest bruno buffalmaco hauing taken good order salting brawne closely carried florence leauing calandrino complaine losse well requited mocking inuisible stone young gentleman scholler fell loue ladie named helena widdow addicted affection another gentleman one whole night cold winter caused scholler expect comming extreame frost snow reuenge whereof imagined art skill made stand naked top tower space vvhole day hot moneth iuly sunburnt bitten waspes fly seuenth nouell seruing admonition lady gentlewoman mock scorne gentlemenschollers vvhen make meanes loue except intend seeke owne shame disgracing greatly lady commend madame philomenaes nouell laughing heartily poore calandrino yet grieuing withall knauishly cheated onely brawne two couple capon flaggon wine beside whole discourse ended queene commanded madame pampinea follow next nouell presently thus began hapneth oftentimes bright beauty mockery falleth intended vnto another therefore opinion litle wisedom declared vvho taketh delight mocking person must need confesse haue smiled many mockery deceit related excellent nouels haue already ard without due reuenge returned onely last silly calandrino wherefore determination vrge kind compassionate apprehension vpon iust retribution happening gentlewoman citie scorne fell deseruedly vpon selfe remaining mocked perill life let assure diligent attention may redound benefit keepe selues henceforward scorned others shall expresse greater wisedome better warned mishap yet many yeares ouerpast since dwelt florence yong lady descended noble parentage beautifull sprightly courage sufficiently abounding good fortune named madame helena delight vvas liue estate widdowhood desiring match selfe marriage bare affection gallant young gentleman made priuate election hauing excluded amorous care cogitation meanes waitingwoman diuers meeting kinde conference chanced verie time another young gentleman citie called reniero hauing long studied schooles paris returned home florence make sale learning experience many doe vnderstand reason thing also cause effect meruailously fitting gentleman greatly honoured esteemed euery one well courteous carriage towards generall knowledge excellent part liued like familiar citizen nature courtly gentleman albeit choisely respected either estate oftentimes commeth passe endued best iudgement vnderstanding naturall occasion soonest caught intangled snare loue fel scholler reniero inuited solemne feast company especiall friend lady helena attyred blacke garment widowes commonly vse wear likewise guest eye obseruing beauty gracious demeanour seemed iudgement woman compleate perfect neuer seene equall therefore accounted man fortunate vvas worthy embrace armes continuing amorous obseruation time time knowing withall rare excellent thing easily obtained painefull study labour endeauour hee resolued himselfe constantly put practise best part industry onely honour please attaining contentation would mean winne loue compasse thereby heart desire yong lady fixed eye inferiour subiects esteemed selfe aboue ordinary reach capacity could mooue artificially curious woman well know doe looking euery side yet gadding grosse manner ignorant darting glaunces proceeded enflamed affection appearing plainely reniero pretty smile shee said selfe come hither day vaine iudgement faile thinke haue caught woodcocke bill lending cunning looke two queintly caried corner eye gaue kinde perswading apprehension heart guide eye artificial schooletricke shee carryed therewith another consideration wit eye fedde themselues perfection wellneere lost beyond recouery much greater reason account fortune beyond comparison sole master heart loue command witty scholler hauing set aside philosophicall consideration stroue might best vnderstand carriage toward beleeuing beheld pleasing regard hee learned know house shee dwelt passing daily doore diuers time vnder colour serious occasion wherein lady proudly gloried regard reason alleadged seemed affoord lookes good liking led thus hopefull perswasion hee found meanes gaine acquaintance waitingwoman reuealing intire affection desiring worke sort lady seruice might gracious acceptance gentlewoman made willing promise immediately errand lady heard small pride squemishnesse breaking forth scornefull laughter thus spake ancilla named dost thou obserue scholler come lose wit heere studyed long vniuersity paris let v make onely table argument seeing folly soareth high feed dyet hee deserueth yet thou speakest next tell affect doe becommeth carefull mine honour walke vntainted brow lady gentlewoman doe mislike wise maketh shew rather commend ala good lady lackwit little vnderstand faire assembly dangerous case deale schollers next meeting waiting woman shee deliuered message lady command whereof poore reniero ioyfull hee pursued louesuite earnestly began write letter send gift token still receiued yet without answere giue hope onely generall thus shee dallied long end discouered matter secret chosen friend fell suddenly sicke headake onely meere conceit iealousie perceiuing grieuing suspected without cause especially shee esteemed aboue shee intended rid quickely idle disease solicited scholler sent word maide ancilla yet could find conuenient opportunity yeeld assurance hee way distrustfull loue feast christmas neere hand afforded leisure much hopefull formerly passed therefore next night first feasting day pleased walke open court house would soone send place much better beseeming might freely conuerse together scholler onely iocond man world failed time assigned went vnto lady house ancilla ready giue entertainment conducting base court lockt vp fast vntill lady send night shee priuately sent friend also sitting merrily supper told welcome giuen scholler meant vse saying sir consider selfe hot affection beare became fondly iealous word welcome made extraordinarily ioyful desiring see effectually performed appeared protestation heere vnderstand gracious lady according season yeare great snow falne day whole court couered therewith extreame frost vpon holler could boast warme walking teeth quiuered head cold dog could discourteously vsed yet hope enioying loues recompence length made support iniury admirable patience within madame helena said friend walke deare heart chamber secret little window shall shew thee doth droue thee suspition shall heare beside answere giue maide ancilla send comfort coldnesse said went appointed chamber window could easily see heard ancilla also calling forth another windowe saying signior reniero lady wofullest woman world yet cannot come regard one brother came euening visite er held much longer discourse expected whereby constrained inuite sup yet gone shortly hope hee expect comming presently till entreateth genle sufferance poore reniero ouercredulous scholler whose vehement affection madame helena hoodwinkt sight vnderstanding could distrustfull guilt returned answere ancilla say lady bound duty attend good houre leisure without much least preiudicate conceite neuerthelesse entreat let bee soone possibly may miserable walking begininneth againe snow extreamely ancilla making fast caseme went presently bed helena spake thus amorous friend saist thou doest thou thinke loued thou wast afraid neuer walke thus frost snow away went likewise close gazing window spent wanton dalliance together laughing deriding many bitter taunt iests lamentable condition poore reniero court walked hee numberlesse time finding exercise could best deuise compasse warmth manner seate shelter either ease himselfe sitting downe keepe snow falling continually made bestow many curse lady brother long tarrying beleeuing verily house else would long haue admitted entrance therein hope meerely deceiued grew houre midnight helena delighted selfe friend extraordinarily til last thus spake thine opinion amourous scholler dost thou imagine greatest either sense iudgement affection beare cold sufferance able quench violent eat loues extremitie hauing much snow broth helpe beleeue sweet lady quoth friend hee man learned scholler pitty bee thus vngently dealt withall riuall loues enemy cannot allow least compassion resting confidently assured loue alwayes esteeme precious spent long like conference infinite sweet kiss embrace intermixed began againe manner deare loue quoth cast thy cloake thee intend doe night mantle let v step little window see whether flaming fire burned schollers brest daily auouched loue letter yet extinct going window againe looking downe court saw scholler dancing snow cold tune teeth quiuering chattering clapping armes body pleasing melody thinkest thou sweet heart ssaide shee cannot make man daunce without sound taber bagpipe yes beleeue lady quoth plaine perceiue would lothe exercise cunning nay said shee yet delight selues little let v softly descend downe stayres euen farre court doore thou shalt speake word talke heare part quiuering language cannot choose bee passing pleasing v heare chamber went descended downe stayres court doore without opening laide mouth small cranny low soft kinde voyce called name scholler hearing exceeding ioyful beleeuing verily houre deliuerance come entrance admitted vpon heating voyce hee stept close doore saying charity sake good lady let come almost dead cold whereto thus answered mocking manner make doubt deare friend renioero night indifferent colde yet somewhat warmer snowes falling haue heard weather tennetimes extreame paris heere warmer countrey trust exceeding sorrowfull may yet open doore mine vnhappy brother came vnexpected yesternight suppe mee yet gone within short hope shall gladly set open doore made excuse steale little onely cheare small kind comfort long tarrying might lesse offensiue ala sweet madame answered quaking quiuering reniero bee fauourable free forth open court shelter helpe snow falling still exceedingly man might easily halfe buried let within doore wait good leisure ala deare reniero answered helena dare doe doore maketh noyse opening asily heard brother goe vse meanes shortly hee shall get gone dare boldly giue entrance doe good madame replyed reniero let faire fire made ready within may sooner warme selfe strangely benummed colde wellneere past sence feeling possible quoth helena benummed colde plainely perceiue men lye loue letter shew vnder hand fryed flame loue haue written euery letter poore credulous woman often thus deluded beleeuing men write speake passion returne backe brother make doubt dispatch would gladly haue company amourous friend helena stood laughing schollers hard vsage returned vp againe chamber could take iote rest flouting scorning betrayed scholler poore man hee become like swanne coldly chattering teeth together strange new kinde harmony perceiuing himselfe meerely mocked attempted get open doore might passe forth place way able compasse walked vp downe like angry lyon cursing hard quality time discourtesie lady ouertedious length night owne folly simplicity basely abused gulde began heat former affection helena altered violent detestation yea extremity hatred highest degree beating braines ransacking euery corner inuention meanes might best reuenged earnestly desired effect enioy benefit loue embraced betweene armes sad discomfortable night spent selfe break day beginning appeare ancilla waitingwoman according instructed lady went downe opened court doore seeming exceedingly compassionate schollers vnfortunate night sufferance saide vnto ala courteous gentleman vnblessed houre came ladyes brother hither yesternight inflicting much trouble vpon v grieuous time affliction ignorant vertuous iudicious scholler haue inuincible spirit pacience sufficient vnderstanding withall night could affoord another may make sound amends dare sufficiently assure nothing could displeasing lady neither well quieted mind vntill haue made double treble requitall strange vnexpected inconuenience whereof least suspition reniero swelling discontentment yet wisely clouding open apprehension knowing well enough golden speech promise alwaies sauour intemperate spleene would lauishly haue vented foorth therefore modest dissembling manner without least shew anger thus answered good sadnesse ancilla htue endured miserablest night colde frost snow euer poore gentleman suffered know well enough lady fault thereof neither meriteth blamed owne person truely compassionate distresse came farre doore court excuse selfe comfort mee saide well hath failed night another hereafter may fortunately performe hope whereof commend loue duteous seruice else remaineth mine gentle selfe halfe frozen scholler scarcely able walke vpon legges returned home well hee could owne lodging spirit grieuously order eye staring gastly lacke sleepe lay downe bed little rest found himselfe much worse condition meerely taken lame armes legges whereupon inforced send phisitions aduised councell extremity cold receiued immediately made prouision healthes remedie albeit nerues sinewes could hardly extend themselues yet regard yong summer swifly drawing better hope affecting safty great dangerous cold become almost well lusty againe hee vsed seldome seene abroad indifferent concealing intended reuenge secret himselfe yet appearing affectionate madame helena formerly beene came passe within long fortune fauourable iniured scholler prepared new accident wherby might fully effect hart desire lusty yong gallant madame helenaes deare darling delight whose sake dealt inhumanely poore reniero became weary amourous seruice fal liking another lady scorning disdaining former mistresse whereat shee grew exceedingly displeased began languish sighes teares ancilla waitingwoman compassionating perilous condition lady knowing likely meanes whereby conquer oppressing melancholly shee suffered losse heart chosen friend length began consider scholler still walked daily doore formerly hee wont doe might good done fond foolish opinion ouerswayed scholler extraordinarily skilfull art nigromancy could thereby ouerrule heart lost friend hee bee compelled loue againe effectuall manner herewith immediately acquainted lady rashly credulous maide opinionatiue neuer considring scholler experience negromancy hee would thereby haue procured owne successe gaue releefe surmise iouiall comfortable manner entreated kindnes know whether could worke businesse vpon vndertaking effect shee would giue absolute assurance recompence thereof vnfainedly obtaine heart desire ancilla quicke expeditious deliuering message discontented reniero whose soule ready mount body onely conceit ioy chearefully thus said within himselfe gracious fortune highly obliged thee great fauour thou hast blest happy time iustly reuenged wicked woman sought vtter ruine life recompence vnfaigned affection bare returne thy lady quoth saluting first behalfe bid abandon care businesse amourous friend india would make come meere despight heart craue mercy base transgression concerning meanes manner bee done especially owne behalfe impart soone pleaseth faile tell constantly vtmost paine seruice ancilla came iocondly home answere conclusion set downe meeting together santa lucia del prato accordingly performed solemne conference fond affection power ouer shee forgot peril brought life vnnatural night walke disclosed intention loth lose deare friend desiring exercise vtmost height skil large promise manifold fauours whereto scholler thus replyed true madam among study paris learned art negromancy depth whereof skilfull anie scholler whatsoeuer greatly displeasing vnto god made vow neuer vse either selfe anie neuerthelesse loue beare power know vvell denie whatsoeuer please command respect best seruice sure bee seized diuels faile accomplish desire onely hauing power command let tell madame matter easie performed perhaps may rashly imagine especially woman would repeale man loue man vvoman done person vvhom properly concerneth therefore behoueth would haue businesse effected must constant minde without least scruple feare accomplished darke night season vvhich difficulty doe know able vvarrant selfe whether haue courage spirit boldnes aduenture madame helena hot pursuite amorous contentment way gouerned temperate discretion presently thus answered sir loue hath set keene edge vnconquerable affection daunger difficult dare resolutely vndertake recouery hath shamefullie refused kindnesse vvherefore please shew mee vvherein must constant dreadlesse scholler halfe caught right ninnyhammer beake thus replyed madame necessity must make image tin name desire recall haue sent moone full selfe stript starke naked immediately first sleepe seauen time must bathe selfe swift running riuer afterward naked must climbe vp vpon tree else vpon vninhabited house top standing dreadlesse perill turning face north image hand seauen time must speake wordes deliuer writing haue often spoken two goodly lady fairest euer beheld wil appeare vnto graciously saluting demanding would haue performe safely may speake vnto orderly tel desire e careful one man insted another haue vttered mind wil depart may descend againe place leaue g ents uing putte returne house vndoubtedly midst next night following friend wil come teares humbly craue pardon knee beeing neuer able afterward false leaue loue whatsoeuer lady hearing word gaue setled beleefe imagining vnfainedly shee halfe recouered friend already held embraced betweene armes iocond perswasion chearful blood mounted vp hir cheekes thus replyed neuer make doubt sir sufficiently performe whatsoeuer haue said prouided onely place world weighty businesse effected haue farme dairy house neere adioyning vale arno closely bordering vpon riuer beeing moneth iuly conuenientest time yeare bathe bee easier induced thereunto moreouer hard riuers side smal tower turret vninhabited whereinto people sildome enter onely heardsmen flockekeepers ascend vppe helpe wodden ladder tarrasse top saide tower looke beast wandred astray standing solitary place common way resort dare boldly aduenture mount vp inuincible courage wronged lady fearing looke death face al haue prescribed yea much recouer deare lost louer againe value equal owne life reniero perfectly knew dairy farme old smal turret little ioyful heare forward shee vvas shame selfe answered manner madame neuer part country albeit neere city therfore must need ignorant onely farme turret also stand conuenient manner haue described vvorld could yeelde like elsewhere apt sutable purpose wherefore vvith expedition possibly vse make image send also charme verie fairely written let entreate vvhen haue obtayned heart desire able iudge truely loue seruice vnmindfull best leysure performe haue protestation promised shee gaue ha faith without impeach hinderance parting returned home house ouerioyed scholler applauding happy starres furthering faire way reuenge immagining already halfe executed made image due forme wrote old fable insted charme sent lady soone thought time fitting admonition withall moone entering full without longer delay might venter businesse next night following remaine assured repossesse friend afterward better pleasing himselfe went secretly attended onely seruant house trusty frend dwelt somwhat neere turret expect issue ladylike enterprize madam helena accompanied none ancilla walked dairy farme night ensuing pretending take rest sooner formerly vsed doe commanded ancilla go bed referring selfe best liking slept first sleepe according schollers direction departing softly chamber went towards ancient tower standing hard riuer arno looking euery way heedfully hir least spied person perceiuing hir selfe secure could desire putting garment hid small brake bush afterward holding image hir hand seuen time bathd hir body riuer returned back tower scholler night closing vp day hid himselfe among willowes tree grew thick tower saw hir going returning riuer passed thus naked plainly perceyued night obscurity could cloud delicate whitenes hir body made starres themselues gaze amorously euen proud behold bathing like many twinkling taper shewed hir emulation another diana conflict sight caused mind scholler one quenching hatefull spleen towards hir al coueting imbrace piece perfection another thinking purchase fit one cupid soldier seize surprize hir vppon faire aduantage none neere yeild rescue fiery triall temptation able iudge say resistance flesh blood could make opposed sweet enemy well considering greatnes iniury also forgot wanton allurement loue scorning entertaine thought compassion continuing constant resolution let suffer himselfe done helena mounted vp turret turning face towards north repeated idle friuolous word composed nature charme shee receiued scholler afterward soft stealing step hee went old tower tooke away ladder whereby ascended tarras staying listening shee proceeded amorous exorcisme seuen time rehearsed charme image looking still two lady would appeare likenesse long held imprecation feeling greater cold willinglie would haue done breake day began shew selfe halfe despairing lady comming according scholler promised said selfe much misdoubt reniero hath quitted another peece nightseruice vvas lucke bestow haue done respect hee ill aduised reuenge night want three part length cold suffered far superior quality mine albeit sharp morning time night hath bin daylight discouer tarrasse went make descent downe againe finding ladder taken away thinking publike shame ineuitable heart dismayed shee fell downe swoune tarras yet recouering sens afterward greefe sorow exceeded capacity vtterance became fully perswaded proceeded schollers malice repenting vnkinde vsage towards much condemning selfe reposing trust stood bound good reason enemy continuing long extreame affliction surueighing likely meanes whereby might descend tarras whereof wholly disappointed began sighe weepe exceedingly heauy perplexity spirit thus shee complained selfe miserable vnfortunate helena saide thy bretheren kindred neighbour generallie throughout florence shall know thou wast founde heere turret starke naked thine honourable carriage honesty life heeretofore free thought suspition shall novv branded detestation thou wouldst cloud mishappe thine lie excuse rare amongst woman yet reniero wicked scholler knoweth thy priuy compacting stand thousand witness thee shame thee whole city thine honor loued frie lost euer hauing thus consulted selfe many desperate motion entred minde throw selfe headlong tarras till better thought wone possession soule sunne risen shee went euery corner tarras espye lad come abroad beast might send waitingwoman instant scholler lay sleeping vnder bush suddenly awaking saw looke ouer wall likewise espyed whereupon hee said vnto good morrow madame helena lady come yet helena hearing scorning question grieuing hee delude teares lamentation intreated come neere tower desired speake courtesie deny lying groueling vpon brest tarras hide body part thereof might seene head weeping spake thus reniero vpon credit gaue thee ill night rest thou hast well reuenged wrong although wee moneth iuly haue beene plagued extremity colde regard nakednesse euen almost frozen death beside continuall teares lamenting folly perswaded beleeue thy protestation wherein account wellneere miraculous mine eye capable sight therefore pray thee respect loue thou canst pretend beare regard thine owne selfe gentleman scholler punishment thou hast already inflicted vpon may suffi e former iniuries towards thee hold thy selfe reuenged fully also permit garment brought may descend hence without taking afterward although thou wouldst thou canst neuer restore meane mine honour consider thy selfe albeit thou didst inioy company vnhappy night yet thou hast power command time whensoeuer making many diuersities amends one night offence committed content thy selfe good reniero thou art honest gentleman say thou art sufficiently reuenged making dearely confesse mine owne errour neuer exercise thy malice vpon poore weake woman eagle disdaineeh pray yeelding doue therefore meere pitty manhood sake release open shame reproch scholler whose enuious spleene swolne great remembring malicious cruelty exercised beholding weepe make lamentation found fierce conflict thought betweene content pitty little ioy content reuenge hee earnestly desired compasse effectually inflicted yet meere humanity pitty prouoked commisserate lady distressed condition clemency ouerweake withstand rigor thus replied madam helena mine entreaty speake truly neuer knew steepe tear wrap vp word sugar candie cuningly woman know could haue preuailed miserable night wellneere frozen death cold meerly buried snow court hauing anie place rescue shelter complaint would easily ouerrule honor estimation bee precious heretofore seemeth offensiue stand naked conuert perswasions prayer whose armes vvere night imbraced triumphing misery poor trotted court teeth quiuering head beating mine armes body finding compassion let bring thee thy garment let come helpe thee ladder let haue care thine honour thou hast bene prodigall heretofore bestowing hast vnwomanly throwne thy selfe perill onely maintenance thine immodest desire dost thou call come helpe thee doeth belong thou art thine shold help thee distresse call foole thou art try loue beareth thee thy best vnderstanding ioyned deliuer thee sottish detaining thee haue forgot made pastime misery thou didst demand seemed greatest opinion either sottish simplicity loue thou barest liberall courteous desire thee thou wouldst grant request reserue night fauours thy amorous friend thou dost escape hence aliue see againe selfe leaue thee freely vse seruice haue sufficiently payde woman falshood wisemen take warning scorne bee twice deceiued one woman proceed stil thy flattering perswasions terming gentleman scholler thereby win fauor think thy villany toward already sufficiently punished trecherous helena thy blandishment cannot hoodwink eies vnderstanding thou didst outreach thy disloyall promise protestation let tell thee plainely vvhile continued vniuersitie paris neuer attained vnto perfect vnderstanding selfe one miserable night thou diddest enstruct mee admit enclined vnto mercifull compassionate minde yet thou art none whome milde gracious mercy way declare effect end pennance among sauage beast thou art likewise due vengeance ought death whereas among men suffice according thine owne saying wherefore regard neither eagle thou doue rather venomous serpent purpose vtmost hatred ancient enemy thou art make reuenge famous thee ignorant whatsoeuer haue already done vnto thee cannot properly termed reuenge rather chastisement reuenge ought alwayes exceede offence yet farre enough intend reuenge wrong remembred thy monstrous cruelty thy life tooke thee hundred thy selfe farre insufficient killing thee kill vile inhumane beast yea one deserued name woman speake truely art thou better setting aside thy borrowed haire painted beauty yeares leaue thee wrinkled deformed basest beggarly chamberstuffe bee yet thou soughtest death gentleman scholler scorne long since thou didst terme whose life may hereafter beneficiall vnto world million thou art liue like multiplicity age therefore anguish sensible thee learne mocke men apprehension amongst especially schollers preuent thy falling hereafter like extremity thy good lucke escape appeareth thou art verie desirous come downe hither ground best counsell giue thee leape downe headlong breaking thy necke thy fortune faire thy life lothsome quality ending together may sit smile thy deserued destruction haue comfort giue thee boast happinesse teaching thee way ascend tower thy descending downe euen mean thy wit best deuise make mockery say thou hast learned schollership could instruct thee reniero vttered speech miserable lady sighed wept grieuously time running sunne ascending higher higher heard silent thus answered vnkinde cruell man wretched night greeuous thee mine offence appeared great neither youth beautie teares humble intercessious able deriue mercy thee yet let last consideration mooue thee remorse namely reposed new confidence thee whe little reason trust thee discouered integritie soule vnto thee whereby thou didst compasse meanes punish thus deseruedly sinne reposed confidence thee thou couldst maner haue wrought reuenge although thou didst earnestly couet yet rash credulitie thy onely helpe asswage thine anger graciously pardon wherein thou wilt mercifull free fatall tower heere faithfully promise thee forsake false disloyall friend electing thee lord constant loue euer moreouer although thou condemnest beauty greatly esteeming trifle momentary slender continuance yet comparable woman whatsoeuer ignorant reason induce liking thereof yet men vigour youth sure think selfe aged hold especiall delight ordained nature admire honour notwistanding thy cruelty extended mee yet cannot perswaded thou art flinty ironhearted desire miserable death casting selfe headlong downe like desperate madde woman thy face destroy beuty thy letter lyed highly pleasing thine eye take pitty mee charity sake sunne beginneth heate extreamely ouermuch colde vnhappy night mine offence let ouerviolent warmth vtter ruine death scholler onely delight himselfe maintained long discoursing returned answere madame repose confidence good affection towards hope recouering lost wherein merit iot fauour rather sharpe seuere infliction whereas inferre ouerrash credulity gaue onely meanes reuenge ala therein deceiue selfe haue thousand crochet working continually brain wherby entrap wiser creature woman yet veiled vnder cunning cloake loue sauced bitter wormewood hate hapned doth necessity must haue falne another hath pleased happy star fauour mee therein none could prooue eternall scandall disgrace owne deuising made choise regard ease onely content selfe deuises el failed pen preuayling champion would haue written many strange matter concerning dearest reputation haue curst houre conception wisht birth bin abortiue power pen many mighty wherof weake wit haue made experience lesse able vse relation sweare lady best hope reuenge perhappes esteeme great dishonourable vvay compareable vvounding line penne carracter downe infinite infamy yet none guilty true taxation make owne hand immediate instrument teare eye forth head bequeath dayes vnto perpetuall darkenesse concerning lost louer whose sake suffer vnexpected pennance although choise hath proued bad yet still continue affection regard haue another ladie mistresse higher greater desert whome continue euer constant whereas thinke warme beames sunne hot scorching nice bodie endure remember extreame cold caused mee feele intermixe part cold present heat dare assure sun highest heate far temperate feeling disconsolate lady perceiuing schollers wordes sauoured mercy rather couering desperate ending teares streaming downe cheekes thus replied wel sir seeing matter worth whereby deriue compassion yet lady sake haue elected worthy enioy loue farre excelleth mee wisedome vouchsafe pardon mee suffer garment brought wherewith couer nakednesse descend downe tower may stand gentle nature admit beganne reniero laughe heartily perceiuing swiftly day ran course saide vnto beleeue madame helena haue coniured mine endeered ladie mistresse longer able deny wherefore tell garment bring may come downe turret beleeuing promise tolde hid reniero departing tower commanded seruant stirre thence abide still neere none might get entrance till returning charge sooner giuen man hee went house neere neighboring friend dined well afterward laid downe sleepe meane madame helena remaining still tower began comfort selfe little vaine hope yet sighing weeping incessantly seating selfe well shee could small shelter might yeelde least shade expectation schollers returning one weeping againe hoping despairing long tarrying away garment beeing ouerwearied anguish long watching fell little slumbering sunne extreamly hot houre noone already past meerly parched delicate body burnt bare head violently onely seared flesh touched also cleft chinkt strangely beside blister painfull scorchings flesh hindred sleeping help self possible mean waking turret couered lead gaue greater addition torment remoued one place another yeelded mitigation burning heate parched wrinkled flesh extraordinarily euen piece parchment throwne fire recouered againe neuer extended former forme moreouer grieuously payned headake seemed split thousand piece whereat needed great maruaile lead turret exceedingly hot affoorded least defence repose qualifie torment droue still one place another hope ease none found winde stirring whereby asswage sunnes violent scalding keepe away huge swarmes waspes hornet terrible byting flyes vexed extreamely feeding part body rifte chinkt like cranny mortered wall pained like many point pricking needle labouring still hand beate away yet fastned one place afflicted grieuous manner causing curse owne life hir amorous friend scholler promised bring garment yet returned began gaze vpon euery side espy labouring husbandman field might call cry helpe fearing discouer desperate condition fortune therein also aduerse heat extreamity driuen village field causing feede cattle theyr owne house remote shadie valleyes shee could see creature comfort swannes swimming riuer arno wishing selfe thousand time coole extreamity thirst much encreased onely sight thereof vtterly disabled hauing saw beside many place goodly wood fayre coole shade country house dispersed added greater violence hir affliction desire could way accomplished shall say concerning disastrous lady parching beames sunne aboue scalding heat lead beneath hornet flyes euerie way stinging made alteration beautifull bodie checkt controlled precedent night darkenesse metamorphosed rednesse yea blood issuing forth infinite place seemed almost lothsome looke continuing still agonie torment quite voyde hope rather expecting death comfort reniero three houres afternoone ouerpast awaked sleeping remembring madame helena went see estate also send seruant vnto dinner fasted day perceyuing arriuall altogether weake faint wonderously ouerwearied crept knee corner turret calling spake manner reniero thy reuenge exceedeth al manhoode respect thou wast almost frozen court thou hast roasted day long tower yea meerly broyled poore naked bodie beside staruing mee thorough want food drinke mercifull manhood sake come vppe hither inflict mine owne hand strong enough meane ending loathed wearisome life desire beyond comfort else shall honour thee performance thou deny gracious fauour least send vppe glasse water onely moisten mouth teares meerly dried vp able doe extreame violence sunnes burning heate well perceiued scholler weaknesse voyce scorching body sun parching beames shee brought great extremity sight also humble intercession began touch compassion neuertheles thus replied wicked woman hand shalbe mean thy death make vse thine owne thou desirous haue much water shalt thou get asswage thy thirst thou gauest fire comfort freezing thou wast luxurious heat thy immodest desire welneere frozen death extremity cold pray euening may raine downe rosewater thee riuer arno good enough thee little pitty doe take thee thou didst extend compassion miserable woman answered helena heauens bestow beautie mee vvhich others haue admired honoured yet thee vtterly despised cruell art thou sauage beast thus vexe torment mee mercilesse manner greater extreamity couldst thou inflict bin destruction thy kindred lefte one man liuing thy race verily per waded cruelty cannot vsed traitor th subuersion whole cittie tyranny thine roasting thus beames sun suffering body deuoured elies without small mercie giue mee little coole water murtherers permitted haue condemned iustice led execution yea wine also request seeing thou art constant thy pernitious resolue neither thine owne good nature lamentable sufferance able alter thee prepare self death patiently end heauen may mercifull soul reward thee iustly according thy cruelty word ended withdrew selfe towards middest tarras despairing escaping vvith life heates violence onely infinite time beside among grieuous extreamities ready dye drought bemoaning incessantly dolorous condition time day well neere spent night beganne hasten apace scholler immagining afflicted sufficiently tooke garment wrapping vp man cloake went thence lady house found ancilla waitingwoman sitting doore sad disconsolate lady long absence thus spake ancilla thy lady mistris ala sir quoth know thought morning haue found bed vsually wont left yesternight parting place else knowledge neyther imagine become meane discomfort sir say thing ancilla said would thou hadst bin company place punishment thy fault might haue falne vppon thee already hath done beleeue assuredly thou shalt freely escape finger till haue iustly paide thee thy paine teach thee abuse gentleman thou didst hauing thus spoken hee called seruant saying giue garment bid go looke lady seruingman fulfilled master command ancilla hauing receyued lady cloaths knowing perfectly remembring withall bin said waxed doubtfull least slaine hardly refraining exclaiming greete heauie weeping ouercame vppon schollers departing ranne hast garment towardes tower vpon fatall vnfortunate day madame helena chanced clowne countrey peazant belonging farme dairy house hauing two young heyfers wandred astray labouring diligent search finde within schollers departure came seeke wood tower notwithstanding cry calling beast yet heard lady greeuous moanes lamentation wherefore cryed lowd could saying mourneth aloft tower full well knew voyce peazant therefore called vnto sayd maner go quoth pray thee waitingwoman ancilla bid make meanes come vp hither clowne knowing lady sayde madame hath carried vp high woman ancilla hath sought day yet one could euer haue immagined bee looking espyed two side ladder scholler pulled sunder also steppe scattered thereabout placing due order againe bee binding fast withy willowes time ancilla come thither soone shee entred tower could refrain teares complaint beating hand cry madam madam deare lady mistresse ala soone heard tongue ancilla replyed well could saying ah sweet woman heere aloft vppon tarras weepe neyther make noyse quickely bring garment shee heard answer comfortable maner mounted vp ladder peazant made firme strong holding fast safer ascending meanes went vp tarras beholding ladie strange condition resembling humane body rather trunke tree halfe burned lying flat face naked scorched strangely deformed shee beganne teare locke owne hayre rauing raging pittifull manner ladie beene quite dead storming tempest madame helena soone pacified entreating vse silence helpe put garment hauing vnderstood one knew brought cloathes poore peazant attending still seruice shee became better comforted entreating meanes might bee concealed discouery eyther side faithfullie protested poore clowne holpe beare downe lady vppon backe ladder stood conueniently enough descending neither limbes plyable owne vse reason rift smarting ancilla following respectiue lady owne security descending missing step midst ladder fell downe ground quite brake legge fall paine whereof greeuous cried roared extraordinarily euen like lyon desert clowne set lady safe faire green banke returned see waiting woman ayled finding leg quite broken caried also banke seated lady perceiuing mischance hapned expected onely best helpe bee far greater necessity selfe shee lamented exceedingly complaining fortune cruel malice toward thus heaping one misery vpon another neuer ceasing torment especially conclusion shee thought future peril past sun vpon setting poore honest countryman darke night ouertake conducted lady home owne house gaining assistance two brother wife setting waitingwoman chaire thither brought like manner questionles wanted diligence comfortable language pacifie ladyes continuall lamentation good wife led lady hir poore lodging cates feede louingly set conueying afterward owne bed taking good order ancilla carried night time florence preuent ensuing danger reason leg breaking madame helena colour misfortune owne also great mishap woman forged artificiall cunning tale giue formall apparance hir tower perswading poore simple country people straunge accident thunder lightning illusion wicked spirit aduenture hapned physitians beside accident hapning time physicke vtterly vnauoydable extreamities hardly ancilla legge cured vnexpected pennance imposed madame helena vtterly forgot amorous friend thence forward carefully kept selfe fond loues allurement scornfull behauiour wherein disorderly faulty reniero scholler vnderstanding ancilla broken leg reputed punishment sufficient held himselfe satisfyed neither mistresse maide could make great boast night hard entertainment concealed matter else thus wantonheaded lady could finde subiect worke mocking folly learned scholler shee made respect ordinary man neuer remembring men expert cannot say greater part helpe frenzie foolish lady must inioy loose desire negromancy diuelles meanes let therefore faire lady louing admonition detest vnwomanly mocking scorning especiallie schollers two neere dwelling neighbour one beeing named spineloccio tauena zeppa di mino frequenting others company daily together spinelloccio cuckolded friend neighbour happening knowledge zeppa preuailed well wife spinelloccio lockt vp chest reuenged wrong instant neyther complained misfortune eight nouell wherein approued offereth shame disgrace neighbour may receiue like iniury worse manner man greeuous full compassion appeared hard fortune madame helena hauing much discontented wellneere wearied lady hearing recounted iustly inflicted vpon according equity shee deserued vvere moderate commisseration howbeit reputed scholler onely ouerobstinate also strict rigorous seuere wherefore madame pampinea finished hir nouell queene gaue command madame fiammetta follow next discourse whereto shee shewing obedience thus beganne appeareth iudgement faire ladyes schollers cruelty hath much displeased making melancholly time requireth holde therefore conuenient contristed spirit chearfully reuiued matter pleasing delightfull therefore mean report nouell certaine man tooke iniury done much milder manner reuenged wrong moderately furious incensed scholler whereby may comprehend sufficient man ought esteeme serue another sawce offending party caused first taste without coueting stricter reuenge agreeth quality iniury receiued know gracious assembly haue heretofore heard liued long since sienna two young men honest parentage equall condition neither best yet meanest calling city one named spinelloccio tauena tearmed zeppa di mino house neighbouring together streete camollia seldome one walked abroade without others company house allowed equall welcome outward demonstration inward mutuall affection far humane capacity power extend liued loued like two brother beeing wealthy married vnto two beautifull woman came passe spinelloccio often resorting house zeppa well absence abode home beganne glance amorous look zeppaes wife pursued vnneighbourly purpose sort hee stronger perswader belike credulous beleeuing else ouerfeeble resisting priuate imparlance fell action continued close fight long together vnseene vvithout suspition doubt equall ioy contentment whether iust punishment breaking louing league friendship neighbourhood rather fatall infliction euermore attending closest cuckoldry felicity still continuing kinde fortuned day zeppa abiding within door contrary knowledge wife spinelloccio came enquire answering verily supposed gon abroad vppe went together hall bodie hinder intended fell wonted recreation without feare kissing embracing louers vse zeppa seeing spake one word neither made noise kept himselfe closely hidden obserue yssue amorous conflict briefe saw spinelloccio goe wife chamber make doore fast whereat could haue beene angry held part true wisedome knew well enough make crie case otherwise reueale kinde iniury could way make lesse rather giue greater addition shame scandall thought course take wiser consideration entred braine haue wrong fully reuenged yet discreete orderly carriage neighbour knowledge meanes apprehend least signe discontent himselfe blabbe two daungerous euils many notable course wheeled conceit euery one promising fairely ministring meanes formall apparance yet one aboue rest wonne absolute allowance intended prosecute best might resolution kept still close long spinelloccio wife hee gone went chamber found wife amending forme head attyre spinelloccio put disordred fashion wife quoth art thou see husband answered yes wife replied zeppa something else happened sight could wish seene rougher language growing betweene auouching stout denying defending cause ouerweakely manifest proofes eye eare last fell knee weeping incessantly excuse auailing confest long acquaintance spinelloccio humbly entreated forgiue vppon penitent confession submission zeppa thus answered wife inward contrition answerable thy outward seeming sorrow make doubt faithfully thou dost acknowledge thine owne euill dooing thou expectest pardon determine fulfill effectually busines must enioyne thou performe command thee tell spinelloccio morrow morning nine clocke abroad walking must finde apt occasion leaue company come hither visit thee sodainly returne home vpon thy hearing entraunce saue owne credite thee detection thou shalt require enter chest vntill time gone forth againe safety soon chest take key locke vp fast thou hast effected shall acquaint thee rest remaining also must done thee without dread least harme thee malicious meaning perswaded thou canst iustly mislike wife make satisfaction offence committed promised would performe morrow morning houre nine come zeppa spinelloccio walking abroad together spinelloccio remembring promise vnto mistresse clocke telling appointed houre hee saide zeppa dine day especiall friend mine would loath tarry comming therefore holde departure excused answered zeppa time dinner yet farre enough wherefore part soone yea zeppa replied spinelloccio wee haue weighty matter confer dinner require three houres space least therefore behoueth respect due time spinelloccio departed zeppa followed faire softly come house kindly welcommed wife sooner gone vp staires entering chamber doore woman heard husband cough also comming vp staires ala deare spinelloccio quoth shall husband comming vppe shall taken tardie step chest lye downe stirre till haue sent forth againe shall within short spinelloccio little ioyfull good aduice downe chest lay lockt time zeppa entred chamber wife said speaking loud hee chest might heare time go dinner anon sir answered yet ouerearly seeing come hast shall made euery thing ready quickly zeppa sitting downe vpon chest wherein spinelloccio lay little affrighted speaking stil aloud formerly come hither wife quoth shall good companie dine v mine honest kinde neighbour spinelloccio home dineth forth day deare friend meanes wife left home alone giue call window desire come dine v two make merry musicke except come fill vp consort wife timorous yet diligent doe whatsoeuer commanded preuailed wife spinelloccio came quickely much rather husband dined abroad shee come vp chamber zeppa gaue kinde entertainment taking gently hand winking wife betake selfe kitchin see dinner speedily prepared sat conuersing neighbour chamber wife gone shut doore newcome neighbour perceyuing sayde blessed lady defend zeppa meaning haue caused come hither tent loue beare spinelloccio professed loyalty friendshippe zeppa seating downe chest wherein husband inclosed entreating patience thus began kinde louing neighbor aduenture farre anger vouchsafe heare shall tell haue loued still doe loue spinelloccio brother yesterday albeit knoweth found honest trust reposed deserued better recompence euen bold wife selfesame manner hee ought none regard loue beare intend otherwise reuenged kinde offence committed hath bin familiar wife must borrow selfesame courtesie equity cannot deny mee weighing wrong haue sustained wife iniuries alike husband wife let punishment alike also case iuster reuenge woman hearing perceiuing manifolde confirmation thereof protested solemne oath zeppa hir beliefe grew setled thus answered louing neighbor zeppa seeing kinde reuenge meere iustice imposed mee ordained due scourge well breach friendship neighbourhood abuse true loyall wife willing consent alwaies prouided imbarrement loue betweene wife mee albeit haue good reason alledge began quarrell first right wrong woman better consideration great iniury first begun himselfe zeppa reason equity might well hauing euermore carried himselfe like kinde neighbour frend towards without least offer distaste faithfully head perfidious friend thought himselfe sufficiently reuenged consideration promise made bargaine spinelloccioes wife challengeth iewel kind recompence nothing welcom woman heereupon zeppa calling owne wife commanded open chest shee merrily smiling saide well wife haue giuen mee cake insted bread shal lose nothing labour spinelloccio comming forth chest requireth better witte mine tell stood confounded vvith shame either spinelloccio seeing zeppa knowing well enough done woman beholding husband easily heard familiar conference action thereupon deseruedly performed see neighbour dearest closely kept selues zeppa wel pleased motion foure dined louingly together without variance discontentment thence forward woman two husband either husband enioyed two wiues without contention debate extraordinarily brunoes familiarity highly pleasing daily guest dinner supper hee meanly proud enioying company one day sate familiar conference together told bruno wondred little buffalmaco poore vnto himselfe determined returne answere might fitting folly whereupon thus replied beleeue master doctor would impart many people priuate helpes haue maintenance yet dare boldly acquaint therewith manuall trade profession might sit home bread water nothing liuely spirited wee yet sir would haue conceiue wee eyther rob steale vse vnlawfull course onely trauayle corsica whence bring without least preiudice anie thing stand need whatsoeuer wee desire thus maintaine selues well honestly liue mirthfull disposition master doctor hearing discourse beleeuing constantly without instruction deer honest neighbour bruno quoth doctor assure thy selfe vpon soul whatsoeuer thou reuealest shall vnder seale onely selues fie fie master doctor answered bruno pressing importunate sitting smiling signifies empresse seene sir would make forget physicall obseruations argument receits medicine onely heauenly presence word vsed perceiuing forward longing enflame long doctor holding candle bruno perfecting bloody bat ayle cattes rattes could neuer bee wearied companie therefore willing vndergoe office candleholder resolued acquaint minde alone themselues thus began bruno heauen knoweth day creature liuing would gladly thee least word thy mouth hath power commaund mee goe barefooted euen hence farre peretola account labour well employed thy sake wherefore neuer wonder continuall kindnesse towards thee vsing thee domesticke companion embracing thee bosome friend therefore bolder moouing one request vnto thee thou well knowest long since thou diddest acquaint behauiour corsicane rouing company one rare excellent society hath bin earnest longing euer since day night haue enioyed anie rest thinke felicity beyond compare could entertained fellowship among desire mine vpon great occasion thou thy selfe shalt perceiue proue accepted societie let made mocking stocke euer cause come thither one delicate young woman euer anie eye beheld selfe saw aboue yeare since cacauinciglia bestowed intirest affection best vrinall euer gazed would haue giuen tenne faire bologninaes yeeld matter moued yet could meanes compasse therefore flowing faculty soule entreate thee vttermost indeede instruct wayes meanes whereby may hope member thou dooest accomplish may finde effectually performed shall onely thy true loyall friend euer honour thee beside beyond men liuing know thee bee man iudgement deepely informed wellgrounded experience thou seest propper portly comely man fitly legges answerable body lookes amiable louely rosie colour beside doctor physicke profession expedient thinke haue one society haue many commendable quality playing diuers instrument exquisite singing composing rare ditty whereof instantly sing thee one began sing bruno swolne bigge desire laughter hee scarsely power refraine neuerthelesse made best meanes could deuise song ended physition saide bruno thine opinion singing beleeue sir replyed bruno vialles sagginali loose best time contending mirilifficially sweet accent voice heard tell thee truly bruno answered master doctor thou couldst possibility haue beleeued thou hadst heard good sadnes sir said bruno speake truly could quoth doctor sing thee infinite beside time must forbeare let mee informe thee bruno beside compleat perfection thou seest father gentleman althogh dwelt poore country village mother side deriued vallecchio moreouer haue formerly shewn thee haue goodly library bookes yea faire costly garment physitians florence haue like protest thee vpon faith haue one gowne cost readie money almost hundred poundes bagattinoes yet aboue ten yeares old wherefore let preuaile thee good bruno worke rest thy friend may bee one singular society honest trust thou reposest mee bee boldly sick whensoeuer thou wilt paine physicke shall freely thine without payment one single peny bruno hearing importunate word knowing men else beside man word wit saide master doctor snuffe candle pray lend little light hitherward vntil haue finished tailes rat wil answer rat tailes fully finished bruno declaring outward behauiour greatly distasted matter mooued thus answered worthy master doctor courtesy haue already extended towards bountifull fauours promised beside know exceeding great farre beyond compasse merit concerning request albeit respect admired braine wisedome little moment yet appeareth ouermighty mee man liuing world hath like authoritie ouer commaund one poore syllable easily may doe well regarde loue dutie also singular sententious speech able onelie make breake sound setled resolution almost moue mountaines place learned company much faster lincked vnto immooueable affection farre loue admirable quality reason affect endeared manner doe yet enamoured rare beauty haue already related onely motiue sufficient compell indeed must need tell haue much power case perhaps imagine barreth forward readines otherwise needed vrged neuerthelesse hauing solemnly ingaged faith way misdoubting faithfull secrecy shall instruct meanes obserued appeareth plainly furnished plenty bookes rich endowment haue rehersed cannot attaine full period longing desire speake boldly thy minde bruno answered doctour perceiue thou hast perfect knowledge yet neither especiall gift haue secrecy messer gasparino da salicete iudge potestat ouer people forlini made choise mee among infinite dearest friend acquaint secret meane moment faithfull secretary found onely man knew mariage bergamino distrust made say sir answered bruno credit sounder dare better aduenture fidelity meanes worke shall direct haue alwayes noble society captaine two counsellor changed euery six month end christmas next neere drawing buffalmaco shal elected captaine selfe one counsellers already agreed orderly set downe captain may doe much appoint matter himselfe pleaseth wherefore thinke expedient soone possibly may procure acquaintance buffalmaco entreating respectiue courtesie hee man perceyueth wonderfully wise discreete immediatly loue haue best sens richest wearing garment alwayes remembred acquaintance first fully confirmed neuer feare vrge request haue power denie haue already spoken find stand affected vnto verie intirely thus haue begunne businesse leaue deale rest trust kinde friend bruno replyed physitian like aduice exceeding well hee man taketh delight conuerse men skill iudgement haue made way knowing wil thirst long follow mee vnderstand incredible eloquence flowing rare composition musicall ditty may learne meane wisedome matter thus agreed betweene bruno departed thence acquainted buffalmaco euerie circumstance made thinke euerie day yeare vntill might ioyne fooling mayster doctour according owne fancie beeing also desirous side make one corsicane voyage could take manner rest either day night till linked friendship buffalmaco quickely hee compassed wanted costly dinner supper al delicates could deuised entertainement buffalmaco bruno like guest easie inuited rich wine good cheare neuer wanting needed little sending bebecause house familiar owne end physitian espyed opportunitie apt purpose made request buffalmaco formerly hee done bruno whereat buffalmaco sodainly starting looking frowningly bruno extraordinarily incensed clapping hand furiously table sayde sweare great god pasignano hardly refrayne giuing thee blow face make thy nose fall thy heeles vile traitor thou art none beside thy selfe could discouer rare excellent secret vnto famous physitian doctour vvith verie plausible pleasing tearmes excused matter verie artificially protesting another reuealed vnto many wise circumstantiall allegation length hee preuailed farre buffalmaco pacified afterwardes turning kinde manner thus hee beganne master doctour haue liued bologna heere partes v hauing doubt sufficiently vnderstoode carry close mouth meane true charracter taciturnitie questionlesse neuer learned b c foolish ideots blabbing lesson towne much better apprehended rumination surely much deceyued natiuity happened sonday morning sol time lord ascendent ioyned mercurie fierie triplicitie conference haue bruno conceyued himselfe also verie singular physicke onely seemeth study reached higher straine haue learned know verie skilfullie steale men heart yea bereaue verie soules perceyue farre better doe man else liuing knowledge wise witty iudicious meere mercurian eloquence neuer heard physitian interrupting bashfully turned himselfe vnto bruno saying tell thee obserue notable thing speake well frequent company wise thousand meerely blockes dullardes nature could neuer soone comprehend particularity knowledge honest apprehensiue man hath done thou didst search halfe soone indeed expresse quarter ingenuity thee since comming hath prodigally flowne well remember thy word buffalmaco delighted among men wisedome haue fitted vnto owne desire thinkest thou bruno best quoth bruno man liuing world could ah worthy buffalmaco answered physitian wouldst thou haue sayde thou hadst seene bologna neyther great small doctor scholler thought themselues happy company ought debt discharged wittie word whensoeuer spake could set al hearty laughter much pleasure tooke hearing mee departed thence men world could bee sorrowfull desiring nothing remayning among expressed apparantly made humble suite intercession bee cheefe reader physickelecture schollers studying profession could perswaded minde wholly addicted hither enioy good landes inheritance belonging lineally house accordingly performe buffalmaco quoth bruno thine opinion thou wouldst beleeue told thee doctor part skilfull distinguishing vrine asse expert singular man dare boldly maintaine fellow bee found hence gate paris go doe vttermost endeauour thou canst grant request hath made beleeue buffalmaco saide doctor bruno hath spoken nothing truth scarsely knowne heere city part grossewit ed people rather iot iudicious would thou hadst seene among doctor manner wont introth sir replyed buffalmaco much learned euer imagined respect speaking vnto becommeth man excellent wit vnderstanding dare assure without faile wil procure one company promise thus made good chea e fauors kindness done doctor beyond compasse relation whereof made meere mockery flouting face yet wisedome could discerne moreouer promised would giue wife faire countesse di ciuillari onely goodliest creature found whole culattario humane generation doctor demanded countesse oh sir answered buffalmaco great lady one worthy haue issue house world hath iurisdiction command meane people onely euen greatest lord sound trumpet gladlie pay tribute dare boldly affirme whensoeuer shee walketh place yeeldeth hot sensible sauour albeit keepeth close yet euery night shee duely obserueth custome passe owne house bathe feete riuer arno take little sweeter ayre albeit continuall residencie within kingdome laterino seldome walketh abroad goeth attending officer demonstration greatnesse carry rod plummet lead store lord baron euery seene tamagnino della porta meta di sirropa manico di scopa signior squacchera others beside suppose oftentimes daily visitant necessity must remembred care courtesie shall extend farre doe faile enterprize leaue armes maiestick ladie quite forgetting hir cacauinciglia physitian borne brought vp bologna therefore vnderstoode florentine tearmes became fully contented enioy ladie within dayes following painter brought tydings prepared way entertainment societie rouers day come supposed assembly made night following physitian inuited dinner demanding prouision shold make entrance company buffalmaco returned answer whereto hee gaue heedfull attention master doctor must first strongly armed resolution confidence may receyue hindrance also v great harme beside shall heare manner bold constant must procure meanes instant night people soundest sleepe stand vpon one high exalted tomb monument churchyard santa maria nouella fairest gowne haue may appeare honorable condition assembly seated together likewise make good speech already deliuered concerning qualitie profession countesse perceyuing bee woorthie gentleman may haue first honoured bathe afterward knighted owne cost charge must continue stil vpon tombe dreadlesse nightly apparition vision vntill time send better information euery particulare beast blacke horned great stature come fetch perhaps vse gastly noise straunge leapes loftie trickes onely terrifie affright perceiueth cannot daunt hee gently come neere hath done may descend tombe without naming thinking god saintes mount boldly backe stand ready receiue seated crosse armes ouer brest without presuming touch handle beast carry thence softly bring along company time trauaile call heauen saint bee possessed least thought feare must plainely tell either hee cast dangerously throw noysom place therefore know selfe constant courage sprightly bold vndertake aduenture neuer presume may doe v great deale iniurie without gaine benefite selfe rather wrong would sorry happen happen vnto deere friend ala honest buffalmaco answered physitian thou art halfe acquainted yet walke gloues vpon hand long gowne thou perhappes doest imagine mee fainthearted fellow thou didst know haue heeretofore done bologna night time consort went visite pretty wench thou wouldst wonder couragious attempt gentleman one night met young bona roba paltry greenesicknesse baggage scarsely aboue cubite height refused go v willingly gaue kicke bum spurnde crossebowe shoote distance made walke v whether would another time remember hauing company boy went thorow churchyard fryars minor sounding aue maria woman hadde beene buried day yet iotte affraid wherefore neuer distrustfull mee resoluedly builde vpon courage regard honourable entertainment weare scarlet gowne hood wherein receyued graduation obserue reioycing among whole company entertaining man enough create captaine immediatly shall perceiue also case go haue beene regard countesse hauing yet neuer seene deepely enamored mee cannot choose bestow bathe knighthood shee shall haue honour regard well able maintaine therefore referre rest mee neuer misdoubt iniurie mine spoken like gallant replyed buffalmaco feare shall winne credite company carefull pray make mockery v come fayle beast shall sent speake rather cold weather gentleman physitians hardly endure carefull mee quoth doctor thanke applaud faire starres none nice easiefrozen fellowes cold weather familiar dare assure arise night time naturall office whereto men subiect weare warmer defence thin wastcoat ouer shirt finde sufficient coldest weather time bruno buffalmaco taken leaue physitian soone night drew neere vsed many apt excuse wife stealing forth scarlet gowne hood vnseene wherewith clothed time appointed got vpon one marble tombes staying quaking cold awaiting beast come buffalmaco lusty tall man person got vgly masking suite made vse tragedy playes outside black shagged haire wherwith cloathed seemed like strange deformed beare diuels vizard ouer face two gastly horrible horne thus disguised bruno following went behold issue businesse farre new market place closely adioining santa maria nouella hauing espyed master doctor vppon tombe buffalmaco mishapen habite began bound leape carriere snuffling blowing mad raging manner physitian saw haire stood end quaked trembled fearfull woman wishing himselfe home againe house rather behold sight dreadfull come forth earnest desire see wonder related made himselfe coragious possibly could bare formall manner buffalmaco indifferent plaide horsetrickes ramping stamping somewhat strangely seeming become much milder temper went neere tomb whereon physitian stood appeared stay contentedly master doctor trembling quaking still extreamely farre dismayed knew best done either mount beast backe mount end thinking harme could happen mounted second feare hee expelled former descending downe softly tombe mounted beast saying lowde god saint dominicke good angell helpe defend mee seating himselfe well could trembling still exceedingly crossed armes ouer stomacke according lesson giuen buffalmaco shape course milde manner toward santa maria della scala groping finde way darke went farre sister ripole commonly called virgin sanctuary farre thence diuers trench ditch wherein men imployed necessary nightseruices vsed empty countesse di cimillari afterward imployed manuring husbandman ground buffalmaco come neere one stayed breath himselfe awhile catching fast hold one doctours feete raysed somewhat higher back easier discharging burthen pitched head forwardes laystall began make dreadful kinde noise stamping trampling feete passing backe againe santa maria della scala prato dognissanti hee met bruno constrained forsake could refraine lowde laughter together went backe see physitian would behaue himselfe sweetely embrued master doctor seeing himselfe ben abhominable stinking place laboured vtmost endeuou get released thence contended stroue getting forth plunged himselfe pitifully myred head foot sighing sorrowing extraordinarily much foule water ent ed mouth end forced leaue
