hood behinde scr mbling hand foot got landing stinking labyrinth hauing mean home returned house knocking doore length admitted entrance doore scarse made fast againe letting buffalmaco bruno arriued listning doctor bee welcomd home angry wife scolding railing wonderfull impatience gaue hard bitter speech terming vilest man liuing haue bin sir quoth becom nightwalker woman could worse garment serue turne doctor gown scarlet suffer behauiour sufficient content must longing change would thou hadst bin stifled foule filth thy fouler life iustly cast thee behold goodly master doctor leystall maried honest woman must yet go abroad night time insatiatly lusting whore harlot like intemperate speech ceased afflict torment till night almost spent doctor brought sweeter sauour next morning bruno buffalmaco hauing colourd bodyes strange kinde painting resembling blister swelling bruise bin extreamly beaten came physitians house finding newly vp al house yet smelling foule sauour although bin well perfumed admitted garden hee welcommed morning salutation bruno buffalmaco otherwise prouided deliuering stearne angry lookes stamping chafing bruno thus replyed neuer speake faire flattering v moued beyond compasse patience misfortune worlde fall vpon euill death may dye like false perfidious traitor liuing earth must beate braines moue endeared friend onely honor aduancement wee well neere starued death cold like dog breach promise haue bin night extreamly beaten like ass haue beene driuen rome greeuous danger excluding society wee tooke good order admittance honourable entertainment wil credit v behold body let owne eye witness cruell manner haue bin beaten taking aside vnder gallery might discouered ouermuch light opened bosomes shewed painted body sodainly closed vp againe physitian laboured excuse himselfe declaring misfortune large filthy place throwne maketh matter answered buffalmaco would bin throwen bridge arno might haue beene recommended diuell saint tell much good sadnesse quoth doctor neyther commended selfe god saint sayde buffalmaco sure maintaine vntrueth vsed kinde recommendation messenger told v talked god dominicke good angell desired assist affrighted feare trembled like leafe vpon tree knowing indeede thus haue vnfaithfully dealt v neuer man shall doe like againe seeking honour losing negligence master doctor humbly entreated pardon would reuile labouring appease best word could vse fearing least publish great disgrace whereas gaue gracious welcome redoubled farre greater courtesy feasting daily table euermore delighting company thus haue heard two poore painter florence taught master doctor better wit learned bologna cicilian courtezane named madame biancafiore craftie wit policie deceiued young merchant called salabetto money taken ware palermo afterward making shew comming hither againe farre richer merchandise hee brought made meanes borrow great summe money leauing base pawne well requited former cozenage tenth nouell whereby appeareth meet cunning harlot suffer themselues deceiued must sharpen wit make requitall selfesame kinde needlesse question whether nouell related queene diuers passage thereof mooued lady hearty laughter likewise compassionate sighes teares pittying madame helena hard misfortune yet applauding scholler iust reuenge discourse ended dioneus knew office last speaker euery day silence commanded began manner worthy lady matter manifest deceit appeare much pleasing selfesame meanes subtle deceyuer artificially deceiued respect though haue reported singular deceit yet meane tel one may proue pleasing owne much rather woman deceiued great cunning mistris beguiling others equalling excelling former beguiler hath bene obserued heretofore happily day frequent city townes vpon seacoast hauing port benefit venting merchandise merchant vse bring wealthy laden vessel thither vnlade ship great fraught prepared storehouse many place called magazine doganaes charge communalty lord towne city vse whereof receiue yearly gain benefit warehouse deliuer vnder writing owner especiall charge good merchandise price valew soeuer owner magazine ware thus stored vppe doe safely locke vp keyes hauing first registred downe truly good register belonging customehouse merchant may haue iust account rendred right payed customehouse according register either part made sale broker continually attending informed quality merchandise stored likewise merchant appertaine meanes men according good come hand deuise haue exchaunged trucked vented kind dispatch answerable men mind worth commodity many kingdomes country custome obserued palermo sicily likewise doubt adayes store woman faire comely person yet vowed enemy honesty neuerthelesse know held reputed blamelesse woman yeilding bodyes vnto generall vse occasion infinite misfortune men soone espy merchantstranger arriued vvin information booke belonging magazin ware therein stored valew bee owner afterwards amorous action affable speech allure yong merchant take knowledge bee familiar company till get part wealth others nay diuers haue gone farre make portsale ship good person cunningly haue bene shauen barber yet without razor came passe long time since young florentine named niccolo cignano vsually called salabetto imployed factor maister arriued palermo ship stored many woollen cloathes remainder bin sold mart salerno amounting valew aboue fiue hundred florines gold giuen packet customehouse made vp safe warehouse without making shew desiring speedy dispatch delighted view part city men mind continuallie addicted nouelties faire affable yong man easie kindle affection modest eie fortuned courtezane one remembred shauers termed hir selfe madame biancafiore hauing heard somewhat concerning affair beganne dart amorous glance indiscreete youth perceyuing thinking great lady began also grow halfe perswaded comely person pleasing therefore would carrie good fortune somewhat cautelously without imparting mind vnto one would daily passe fro doore obseruing hauing indifferently wounded wanton piercing lookes began vse first tricke trade pretending enflamed affection towards made pine consume away care except might moued pitty whereupon sent one pandoraes vnto perfectly instructed art maquerella many cunning counterfetted sighes teares alwayes ready command told comely person compleate perfection wounded soule mistresse could enioy rest place either day night regard whereof desired aboue thing else meete priuately bathe wordes straightway tooke ring forth pursse humble manner deliuered vnto token mistresse salabetto hauing heard message onely ioyfull man could hauing receyued ring looking aduisedly first kissed put vpon finger answer messenger sayd mistresse biancafiore affected sustained losse thereby regard loued feruently ready commanded time whensoeuer pleased hauing deliuered message mistresse presently returned backe againe let vnderstand bathe meant meet next morrow euening counsell himselfe onely keepe imparted friend whatsoeuer houre meeting come went vnto place appointed bathe belike best agreeing businesse long taried two woman slaues came laden one bearing mattresse fine fustian hir head great basket filled many thing hauing spred mattresse faire chamber couchbed couered delicate white linnen sheet embroidred faire fringe gold laid costly quilt rich silkes artificially wrought gold siluer knot hauing pearles precious stone interwouen among two rich pillowes sildome like bin seene salabetto putting garment entred bath prepared two slaues washed body neatly soone came biancafiore hirselfe attended two woman slaues seeing salabetto bathe making lowly reuerence breathing forth infinite dissembled sighes teares trickling downe cheekes kissing embracing thus spake know man else worlde beside thy selfe could haue power bring hither fire flew thy faire eies thou incompareable louely tuscane melted soule make onely liue thy command hurling light wearing garment came prepared purpose shee stept bathe permitting slaues come neere none selfe must laue body muske compounded sope gillyfloures afterward slaues washed bringing two goodly sheetes softe white yeelding delicate smell rose euen bene made roseleaues one folded salabetto conueyed shoulder vnto prepared bedcouch sweate longer tooke sheet laid gently bed opened basket wherein diuers goodly siluer bottle filled rosewaters others flower orenges water distilled gelsomine muske ambergreece wherewith againe slaues bathed bodyes bed afterward presented variety comfites also precious wine seruing stead little collation salabetto supposed paradise appeared earthly ioy bestowing questionles se slaues seemed million year freely salabetto bestowed fauours hee came exceedingly ioyfull imagined proceeded integrity affection towards thought conuenient time depart thence slaues returned cloathed themselues banquet standing ready prepared wherewith cheared wearye spirit first washed odorifferous w ters parting salabetto quoth whensoeuer thy leysures shal best serue thee repute cheefest happinesse thou wilt accept supper lodging house let instant night thou canst absolutely caught hi beauty flattering behauiour beleeued faithfully intirely beloued heart body whereuppon hee thus answered madame whatsoeuer pleaseth must needes much acceptable vnto mee therefore onely may command seruice night likewise whole employment life onely best study endeauours sooner heare answer returned home owne house decked sumptuous maner also made ready costly supper expecting arriuall satabetto darke night indifferently well entred went thither welcommed wonderfull kindnesse wanting costly wine delicates supper afterward conducted goodly chamber admirable sweete senting sauors might well beseeme prince pallace beheld costly bed rich round roome duly considered constantly perswaded lady infinit wealth although heard diuers flying report concerning life yet hee would credite thing might perhappes beguile yet shee affected thought better manner misfortune could happen hauing spent night want risen morning enflame affection towards preuent opinion might bestowed rich also curiously wrought saying sweet salabetto testimony true affection thee giue thee faithfully vnderstand person onely subiected thine house rich remaineth absolutely thy disposition whatsoeuer hereafter shal happen within compasse power little proud bountifull offer hauing neuer bestowed gift meanes shee would admit many sweet kiss embrace departed thence place merchant vsually frequented resorting time time occasion serued paying one single peny wanton pleasure cunning baytes length caught came passe hauing made sale clothes whereby hee great gaines moneyes iustly payed time appointed biancafiore got intelligence thereof yet one broker salabetto comming one night sup embraced kissed wont doe seemed wonderfully addicted loue euen shee would haue dyed delight armes instantly shee would need bestow two goodly gilt standing cuppes salabetto meanes would receiue formerly bin bountifull aboue value hundred crown yet would take much mite length pressing still token loue bounty courteously denied kindly offered one womenslaues shee cunningly appointed sodainely calling forthwith departed chamber continued pretty absent returned againe weeping throwing selfe downe vpon pallet breathed forth sighes wofull lamentation woman could possibly doe like salabetto amazedly wondering thereat tooke armes weeping also said ala deare loue sodain accident hath befalne vrge lamentable alteration loue hide often entreated manner casting armes necke sighing heart would breake thus replyed ah salabetto onely iewell ioy earth knowe say euen receiued letter messi wherein brother writes although cost sale good whatsoeuer else haue beside must within eight dayes space faile send thousand florin gold else must haue head smitten know meanes procure soone limitation fifteene dayes might serue turne could borrow place command farre greater summe else would sel part land beeing way able furnish soone would died heard dismall tydings vttering word graced cunning dissembled sorrow meant truly indeed salabetto fury amorous flame consumed great part necessary vnderstanding beleeuing counterfetted tear complaint proceed honest meaning soule rashly foolishly thus replied deare biancafiore cannot furnish thousand golden florines able lend fiue hundred sure repayment fifteene dayes wherein highly beholding fortune haue made sale cloathes lyen still hand power could stretch lend fiue florines ala deare heart quoth would want money hide loues loyally make need knowne although furnished thousand florines yet haue alwaies ready three foure hundred kinde office friend thus wronging haue robd boldnes presume vpon offer made salabetto far faster inveigled word said let folly bright biancafiore cause refuse friendly offer case extreme necessity haue ready prepared heartily sory power cannot furnish whole summe catching fast armes thus answered plainly perceiue dearest salabetto loue thou bearest true perfect without expectation requested thou art readie succour vrgent neede faire summe florines sufficiently thine owne much ingaged high deseruing particular acknowledgement euer brother head redeemed thy goodnesse onely heauen beareth record vnwilling beholding kind considring merchant merchant furnish al affair ready monis seeing necessity constraineth make doubt repaiment time appointed shall boldly accept kindnes absolute promise beside wil rather sell house haue breake honest word counterfeit teares still drayning downe cheek salabetto kindly comforting continued hir night expresse himselfe liberall seruant without expecting requesting next morning brought fiue hundred florines receiued laughing heart outward dissembled weeping eies salabetto neuer demanding security onely single promise biancafiore hauing thus receiued fiue hundred florines indiction almanacke began alter whereas salabetto could come see whensoeuer pleased many occasion happened whereby came seuen time yet entrance scarsely admitted neither entertainment affable cheare bountifull former access thither moreouer time repaiment come yea moneth two ouerpast demanded haue money hee could haue nothing word paiment began consider craft cunning wicked woman also owne shallow vnderstanding knowing could make proofe debt selfe listed say hauing neither witnes specialty bill bond shew made folly shamefull durst complaine person receiued aduertisements whereto wold mean listen haue amends publike infamie scorne disgrace made almost weary life much bemoane owne vnhappinesse receiued also diuers letter master make returne florines ouer way banke according vsed nowe could performe matter hereupon error discouered departed small vessell thence making pisa haue done directly naples hee shaped course instant lodged pietro della conigiano treasurer empresse constantinople man great wisedome vnderstanding also ingenious politike especiall fauourer salabetto friendes made presume boldly vrged thereto meere necessity best corrector wandering wit acquaint lamentable misfortune euery particular hapned requesting aid aduice might best weare rest dayes hee neuer meant visit florence conigiano much displeased repetition follie sharply reproued saying thou hast done leudly carying thy selfe loosely spending thy master good carelesly though cannot truly tearme spent rather art meerely cous ned cheated yet thou seest deere rate thou hast purchased pleasure yet vtterly helplesse may one meanes recouered man woonderfull apprehension aduised instantly bee done furnishing also summe money wherewith aduenture second losse hope recouering first againe caused diuers packes well bound vp merchant markes orderly made bought twenty butte barrelles filled oyle pretended commodity shipt salabetto returned palermo hauing giuen packet customehouse entred vnder owne name owner factor ware lockt vp magizine open publication would vent merchandise daily expected also arriued biancafiore hauing heard thereof vnderstanding withall brought merchandise amounting aboue two thousand florin staying also expectation commodity valewing better three thousand beganne consider selfe yet gotten money enough therefore would cast figure farre bigger booty might fairely effect without much imagination least mistrust would repay backe fiue hundred florines winne larger portion two three thousand least hauing thus setled determination sent haue come speake salabetto hauing bene soundly bitten therefore better warranted like ranckling teeth willingly went shewing signe former discontent seeming knew nothing wealth brought gracing louing manner euer done thus spake sure salabetto angry mee restored florines promised day salabetto smiling presently answered beleeue lady quoth little distast euen could haue bin offended plucke heart bestow would yeelde contentment let know vnfainedly much incensed anger great affection beare haue solde better part whole estate conuerting wealthy merchandise haue alreadie brought hither mee valewing aboue two thousand florines stored vp magazine must remaine till another ship come forth westerne part wherein haue much greater aduenture amounting vnto three thousand florines purpose make aboade heere city hath sole possession heart onely regard biancafiore intirely deuoted selfe whatsoeuer else mine hereafter dedicated onely seruice whereto thus replyed trust salabetto whatsoeuer redoundeth thy good benefite cheefest comfort soule regard prize thy loue dearer mine owne life ioyfull thy rerurne hither againe much thy still abiding heere intend liue onely thee soone haue taken order businesse import meane let entreate thee hold excused thy departure hence thou camest sometimes see without thy entrance admitted otherwhiles againe found friendly entertainement formerly bene affoorded indeede aboue rest repaying thy money according promise consider good salabetto great trouble affliction minde regard brother danger important occurrence beside mollestations much distract sens hinder kinde courtesy otherwise would bee extended liberally last consider also difficult thing woman sodainly raise summe thousand golden florines one friend promiseth performeth another protesteth yet hath meaning third sweareth yet proueth false lyar thus vngently vsed breach made betweene best frends liuing hence proceeded defect else made due returne fiue hundred florin sooner departed hence readie many could haue knowne whither send bene long time since could meanes compasse kept still continuall readinesse hoping comming hither againe causing purse brought wherein florines hee deliuered gaue hand prayed count ouer whether many neuer salabettoes heart halfe ioyfull hauing counted found owne fiue hundred florines putting vp pocket saide comfort life full well know whatsoeuer haue saide certaine let v talke falshood friendship casuall accident happening vnexpected haue dealt mee like loyall mistresse heere protest vnsainedly well respect kinde courtesie also constancy mi e affection cannot request hereafter far greater summe supply necessarie occasion power performe shall assuredly finde certaine make proofe thereof whensoeuer please good landed haue established estate city hauing manner renewed wonted amity word farre enough meaning salabetto began againe frequent company expressing former familiarity shewing selfe lauishly bountifull respect done nay many time magnificent manner intending punish notorious trechery towards left open scorne world wounded disgrace quite credit friend hauing day solemnly inuited suppe lodge house night went sad melancholly lookes seeming ouercome extreamity sorrow biancafiore meruayling strange alteration sweetly kissing embracing would need know reason passionate affliction permitting vrge question oftentimes together without returning direct answere quit kind coine owne stampe dissembled sighes began manner ah dearest loue vtterly vndone shippe containing rest mine expected merchandise taken pyrates monago put ransome tenne thousand florines gold part particularly pay one thousand instant vtterly destitute money fiue hundred florines receiued sent hence next daie day following naples buy cloathes likewise sent hither make sale merchandizes magazine time generall vtterance yet come shall make pennyworth penny misfortune greater well knowne heere city find succour important distresse wherfore know say moreouer money speedily sent good carried monago past redemption vtterly biancafiore appearing greatly discontented one verily perswaded pretended losse rather aymed mainest part wealth began consider selfe likeliest course bee taken sauing good carriage monago wherupon thus replied heauen knoweth dearest salabetto thy loue maketh sorrowfull misfortune greeueth see thee way distressed mony lying mee many time haue thou shouldst finde succour selfe onely indeede able helpe thee true friend mine lend fiue hundred florines need make vppe summe borrowed thee demandeth extreme interest abate thing thirty hundred bee forced vse must giue good security part good pawne thee pledge deliuer make vp rest wel salabetto conceiue occasion vrged motion diligent pleasure appeared euidently herselfe lend mony wherof litle ioyful seeming thankful hir told driuen extremity vnreasonable soeuer vsury yet would gladly pay friend security hee would pawne good magazine entering downe name party lent money onely desired keepe keyes warehouse well shew merchandise merchant bee desirous also preserue ill vsing transporting changing redemption found fault honest offer sayde hee shewed himselfe wellmeaning man next morning shee sent broker reposed especiall trust priuately consulted together shee deliuered thousand golden florines caried presently salabetto bond made broker name good remaining salabettoes warehouse composition absolute agreement prefixed time monies repaiment sooner tricke fully accomplished salabetto seeming went redeeme taken good set saile naples towards pietro della canigiano fifteene hundred florines gold whence also sent contentment master florence imployd factor palermo beside owne packes cloathes made repayment likewise canigniano monies furnished last voyage hee indebted stayed awhile canigniano whose counsel thus holpe outreach sicillian courtezane meaning deale merchandise afterward returned florence liued good reputation concerning biancafiore saw salabetto returned againe palermo beganne grow somewhat shed halfe suspecting followed aboue two moneths space perceiued hee came tydings heard shee caused broker breake open magazine casting forth butte barrel shee beleeued bee full good oyles filled seawater hauing small quantity oyle floating toppe onely serue tryall bee made vnbinding packes made vp formall merchantable manner nothing else logges stumpes tree wrapt handsomely hurdle hempe tow onely two cloathes bee briefe whole value two hundred crownes saw obserued cunningly deceiued long shee sorrowed repaying backe fiue hundred florines folly lending thousand vsing prouerbe alwaies hir selfe whosoeuer dealt tuscane neede haue sound sight iudgement remaining contented whither would losse plainly perceyued although liued cheating others yet length mette match soone dioneus ended nouell madame lauretta also knew conclusion regiment come whereupon counsell canigiano past generall commendation wit salabetto lesse applauded fitting effectuall prosecution shee tooke crowne laurell owne head set vpon madame aemilliaes speaking graciously manner madam able say pleasant queene shall haue sure shall enioy faire one let matter therefore honourably carried gouernment may answerable beautifull perfection word sooner deliuered sate downe mounted seate madame aemillia somewhat bashfull much hir created queene heare selfe thus publikely praysed woman desire face appearing like opening damaske rose goodlyest morning deiected lookes vermillion blush vanished away taken order master houshold needefull occasion befitting assembly thus began gracious lady wee behold daily ox haue laboured yoake part day conuenient feeding let forth liberty permitted wander abroad wood see moreouer garden orchard planted variety fairest fruit tree equalled beauty wood forrests plentifull enioying goodly spreading branch consideration whereof remembring many dayes wee haue already spent vnder seueritie lawes imposed shaping discourse forme obseruation opinion onely well become v also proue beneficiall v liue longer vnder restraint like enthralled people desirous liberty wee subiected yoke recouer former strength walking freely wherefore concerning pastime purposed morrow minded vse restriction tye vnto particular ordination rather liberally graunt euery one shall deuise speake argument agreeing owne disposition besides verily perswaded variety matter vttered freely much delightfull restraint one kinde purpose onely thus granted whosoeuer shal succeede gouernment may power preheminence restraine backe againe accustomed lawes hauing thus spoken dispensed longer attendance vntill supper time euery one commended queenes appointment allowing rellish good wit iudgement risen fell exercise pleased lady made nosegay chaplet flower men played instrument singing diuers sweete ditty thus busied vntill supper time beeing come supping beautifull fountaine supper fell singing dauncing end queene imitate order predecessor commanded pamphilus notwithstanding excellent song formerly sung sing one whereunto dutifully obeying thus began song chorus sung love found felicitie ioy thy captiuitie neuer proue thought happy loue comfort abounding hart ioy delight soule spright possesse euery part soueraigne loue thee thy sacred fire fed desire still aspires thy happy thrall bee loue found felicity c song want power relate sweet minde finde blissefull state soueraigne loue thee sad despaire killing care could prepare still thou didst comfort loue found felicity c hate complaine blaspheming thee cruelty sleight coy disdaine soueraigne loue mee thou hast bene kinde others finde thee worse inclinde yet honour thee love found felicitie ioy thy captiuitie neuer proue thought happie loue thus song pamphilus ended whereto rest chorus answered voyces yet euery one particularly according felt louesicke passion made curious construction thereof perhaps needed yet diuining pamphilus intended although transported variety imagination yet none could ariue true meaning indeed wherefore queene perceiuing song fully ended lady also young gentleman willing go take rest commaunded seuerally chamber end eight day ninth day whereon vnder gouernment madame aemillia argument seuerall discourse limitted one peculiar subiect euery one remaineth liberty speak whatsoeuer themselues best pleaseth induction faire aurora whose bright chearefull lookes duskie darke night flyeth vtter enemy already reached high eight heauen conuerting azure colour pretty flowrets beganne spred open leaues madame aemillia risen caused female attendant yong gentleman likewise summoned personall appearance come queen leading way following maiesticke pace walked little wood farre distant palace sooner arriued beheld store wilde beast hindes hare goat like safely secured pursuite huntsman reason violent pestilence reigning stood gazing boldly dreadlesse danger become tame domesticke approaching neerer first one vnto another purposed play gently vvith beganne skippe runne making pastime pretty tripping conceyued great delight beholding beheld sunne exalt selfe thought conuenient return back shrouding themselues vnder tree spreading armes hand full sweete flower odorifferous hearbes gathered walking chanced meete could say nothing else death knew meanes conquer el set absolute determination kill iouiall disposition manner singing dancing prettily pratling length arriued palace found thing readily prepared seruants duly attending hadde reposed themselues awhile would yet sit downe table vntill sung halfe dozen canzonets pleasant another woman men together fell washing hand maister houshold caused sit downe according queene appointed dinner sumptuously serued afterward table withdrawne tooke handes dance roundelay done plaied instrument pleased tooke rest accustomed houre come repaired place discoursing queen looking madam philomena gaue honor beginning first nouell day whereto shee dutifully condiscending began followeth madam francesca widdow pistoya affected two florentine gentleman one named rinuccio palermini alessandro chiarmontesi bearing good eyther ingeniously freed selfe importunate suite one caused lye dead graue fetch thence neither accomplishing enioyned fayled obtaining hoped expectation first nouell approuing chaste honest woman ought rather deny importunate suiters subtile ingenious meanes fall danger scandall slander madame way discontent mee seeing gracious pleasure haue honour breake first staffe freedome faire company according iniunction maiesty liberty best liking argumets wherein dismay speake well enough please well follow obliuious worthy lady full well remember many time hath bene related passed demonstration mighty variable power loue yet cannot perswaded haue bene sufficiently spoken something may bee added bottome neuer diued although sit arguing whole yeare together hath beene alreadie approued louers haue bene led diuers accident onely ineuitable danger death also haue entred verie house dead thence conuey amorous friend purpose acquaint nouell beside haue bene discoursed whereby may onely comprehend power loue also wisedome vsed honest gentlewoman rid selfe two importunate suiters loued owne liking yet neither knowing others affection city pistoya dwelt sometime beautifull gentlewoman widdow two florentine one named rinuccio palermini alessandro chiarmontesi hauing withdrawne themselues pistoya desperately affected one ignorant others intention carrying case closely hoping possessed gentlewoman named madame francesca de lazzari often solicited message troublesomely pestered importunity last lesse aduisedly intended shee granted admittance heare either speake repenting coueting rid matter easie done wittily deuised onely meanes namely moue motion neither would willingly vndertake yet within compasse possibility failing performance shee might haue honest occasion bee free mollestation politike intention thus proiected day deuised peece seruice man buried pistoya churchyard belonging vnto gray friar descended good worthie parentage yet himselfe infamous reputed vilest man liuing onely pistoya throughout whole world beside moreouer liued strange mishapen body face vgly deformed knew would stand gastly affrighted first sight regarde whereof shee considered selfe foule deformitie loathed fellow would greatly auayle determination consulting chambermaid thus spake thou knowest true faithfull seruant trouble affliction minde suffer dayly message letter two florentine rinuccio alessandro hatetheir importunity vtterly vnwilling hear speake yeeld thing desire wherefore free myselfe together haue deuised regard great liberall offer make trial matter assured neuer performe vnknowne thee churchyard gray friar instant morning scannadio vgly fellow named buried liuing also dead men woman child doe yet stand feare gastly dreadfull alwayes personall appearance wherefore first go thou alessandro say thus mistris francesca hath sent tell time come wherein may deserue enioy loue gaine possession person accomplish motion maketh especiall occasion wherewith hereafter shall bee better acquainted neere kinsman must need haue body scannadio buried morning brought house much affraid dead liuing meanes would haue body brought thither respect token vnfeigned loue latest seruice shall euer shee earnestly entreateth night deadest time thereof would go graue scannadio lyeth yet vncouered earth vntill morrow attyring selfe garment euen man himselfe remaine vntill kinsman doe come without speaking one word let take foorth graue bring thence insted scannadio hir house giue gentle welcome disappoint kinsman hope making lord afterward shall plainly appeare say wil much desire hee trifle make deniall boldly tell must refraine place wheresoeuer forbeare send letter message hauing done repaire rinuccio palermini say mistresse francesca ready make acceptance loue prouided one thing sake namely ensuing night midst stillest season thereof go graue scannadio morning buried without making noise speaking one word whatsoeuer shall heare see take forth graue bring home house wher shal know reason strange businesse enioy freely owne euer refuse commaund neuer hereafter see moue suite vnto mee meanes whatsoeuer chambermaide went deliuered seuerall messag mistresse according giuen charge whereunto answered woulde sake onely descend graue also hell pleasure returning answer vnto mistresse france remained expectation issue fond attemptes would sort vnto night come middle houre thereof already past alessandro chiarmontesi hauing put garment doublet hose departed secretly lodging walking towards churchyard scannadio lay graue way went hee became surprized diuers dreadfull conceites imagination questioned himselfe thus beast businesse haue vndertaken whither going know kinsman vnto woman perhappes vnderstanding mine affection crediting matter nothing hath laide politicke traine may murther graue happen life lost yet occasion neuer knowne whereby done know whether secret enemy mine affecting like manner haue deuised stratagem malice mee draw life danger owne good fortune contrary motion ouerswaying suspitions questioned thought another nature let quoth admit case none surmise intended kinsman manner deuised must bring house therefore perswaded couet haue body scannadio either carry thither present rather aime end may coniecture close murthering purposed way acted life time offended maid hath straitly charged whatsoeuer said done vnto speake word pul mine eies teare teeth cut hand mischiefe shall extremity barre speaking side speake shall knowne much sooner perhaps abused admit sustaine iniurie guilty transgression yet perchance shall carried house baser place afterward shall reproue accomplish shee commanded labour vtterly lost perplexed various contradicting opinion willing diuers time turne home backe againe yet violence loue power thereof preuailing sinister argument went graue remouing boordes couering whereinto entred hauing despoiled scannadio garment cloathed himselfe laid hauing first couered graue againe long hee tarryed began bethinke manner man scannadio strange report bene noised onely ra cking dead men graues night season many abhominable villanies committed fearfully assaulted haire stoode end euery member quaked euery minute imagined scannadio rising intent strangle graue feruent affection ouercorning idle feares lying stone still beene dead man indeede remained see end hope contrary side midnight past rinuccio palermini departed lodging hee enioyned heart mistresse hee went along diuers consideration also ran minde concerning occasion possible happen falling hand iustice body scannadio vpon backe condemned sacriledge robbing graues dead either burned otherwise punished might make hatefull best friend meerely shame himselfe many like conceit mollested sufficient alter former determination affection much preuayling made vse consultation rinuccio wilt thou dare deny first request mooued thee gentlewoman thou dearly louest onely meanes whereby gaine assurance gracious fauour vndoubtedly sure die attempt yet accomplish promise went courage graue alessandro hearing arriuall also remouall bords although exceedingly affraid yet lay quietly stil stirred rinuccio beeing graue tooke alessandro feete haling forth mounting vppon backe went thus loden towards house madam francesca passed along street vnseene vnmet alessandro suffered many shrewd rushing punch turning street corner iolting bulkes po sts stalles rinuccio could auoyd regard night wonderfully darke hee could see way went come somewhat neere gentlewoman house standing readie window maide see rinuccio arriue alessandro prouided also apt excuse send thence like couple coxcombes fortuned watchman attending streete apprehension banished man stolne city contrarie order hearing trampling rinuccioes feete directed course heard noise hauing lanthorne light closely couered see intended beating weapon ground demanded go rinuccio knowing voyces time long deliberation let fall alessandro ran away fast leg could carry alessandro risen againe although cloathed scannadioes garment long bigge fledde away also rinuccio madame francesca easily discerned helpe watchman lanthorne rinuccio carried alessandro backe beeing attired garment scannadio whereat meruailed litle also great boldnesse midst meruailing laughed heartily saw one let fall runne away manfully accident pleasing beyond comparison applauding good fortune bee happily deliuered daily mollestation betooke selfe hir chamber maide auouching solemnly questionlesse affected dearely hauing vndertaken straunge imposition verie neere brought finall conclusion rinuccio sadly discontented curssing hard fortune would yet returne home lodging watch gone forth streete came backe place let fall alessandro purposing accomplish rest enterprize finding body remaining fully perswaded watchman possessed thereof hee went away greeuing extreamly alessandro knowing become confounded like griefe sorrow hope thus vtterly ouerthrowne retired thence vnto owne house knowing porter carried next morning graue scannadio found open body alessandro thrown deep ditch neere adioyning people pistoya possessed sundry opinion foolish sort verily beleeuing diuell caried away dead body neuerthelesse louers seuerally made knowne madam francesca done disappointed either excusing himselfe though command bin fully accomplished yet continue fauour towards like wise discreet gentlewoman seeming credit either one discharged selfe honestly cutting answere shee would neuer afterward expect seruice fayled first iniunction madame vsimbalda lady abbesse monastery nu bardie arising hastily night time without candle one daughter nu e bed yong gentleman whereof enuiously accused certaine sister abbesse selfe time bed priest haue put head plaited vayle put priest breech poore nunne perceyued causing abbesse see owne error got selfe absolued freer liberty afterward familiar frend formerly bin second nouell whereby declared whosoeuer desirous reprehend sinne men first examine himselfe guiltie crime time madame philomena sate silent wit francesca freeing selfe could fancie generally commended also contrary bold presumption two amorous suiters reputed loue meerely folly queene gracious admonition gaue way madam eliza follow next presently thus began worthy lady madame francesca deliuered selfe discreetly trouble already hath bin related yong nun helpe fauour fortune also free selfe speaking aduisedly inconuenience sodainly falling well know want none like bold bayard forward checking men misdemeanor themselues nouell approue deserue iustly bee corrected hapned lady abbesse vnder whose gouernement young nunne speake vnderstand gracious auditor lombardie goodly monastery famous holinesse religion among sanctified sister yong gentlewoman endued singular beautie named isabella day kinsman came see grate became enamored young gentleman company likewise beholding admirably beautifull conceyuing pretty glance eye appeared bee silent intelligencers heart meaning grew also affectionately inclined towards mutuall loue continued thus concealed long without great affliction vnto end either circumspect prouident enough gentleman contriued meanes whereby might secretly visite nunne wherewith seemed way discontented visitation twice verie often closely concealed themselues length came passe either owne indiscreete carriage ielous suspition others espied one sister gentleman comming departing yet vnknowne isabella saide sister disclosing two three agreed together reueale lady abbesse named madame vsimbalda holy deuout lady common opinion nunnes whosoeuer else knew concluded isabella deny theyr accusation contriue businesse cunningly ladie abbesse come selfe person take yong gentleman bed nun vppon determination agreed watch nightly turnes meanes wold preuented surprise poore isabella beeing ignorant treachery suspected nothing presuming thus still secret felicitie fearing disaster befall chaunced night yong gentleman entred nun dorter scowts descried intended reuenged part night ouerpast diuied themselues two band one guard isabellaes dorter doore carry newes abbesse knocking close doore saide rise quickely madame vse hast may haue seene man enter sister isabellaes dorter may take bed lady abbesse night company lusty priest bed selfe oftentimes alwayes brought thither chest hearing tidings fearing also lest nunnes hastie knocking doore might cause fly open entrance haue owne shame discouered arose hastily thinking put plaited vaile alwayes walked night season vsed tearme psalter put priest breech vpon head went away hast supposing verily psalter making fast closet doore keye priest discouered away shee went haste sister forward detection poore isabella neuer regarded manner vaile lady abbesse wore head come dorter doore quickly lifted hooke entred found two louers sweetly imbracing yet amazed sudden surprisall durst stirre speake one word young nunne isabella raised forthwith sister according abbesse comanded brought chapterhouse yong gentleman remaining still chamber put garment awaiting see issue businesse verily intending act seuere reuenge betrayer harme done isabella afterward take thence away meaning make amends marriage abbesse seated chapter house nunnes called minded nothing else poore offending sister began giue harsh vile speech neuer transgressor suffered like openly knowne abroad contaminated lewde life action sanctity good renowne whole monastery threatned seuere chastisement poore isabella confounded feare shame way able excuse fault knew answer make standing silent made case compassionable rest euen hardhearted sister betrayed abbesse still continuing harsh speech fortuned isabella raising head deiected hir bosome espied breech head stocking hanging either side sight whereof much encourage boldly said madam let poore offender aduise mend veile afterward say abbesse angry vnderstanding meant frowningly answered saucy companion vaile prating malapert bee chatting already deed haue done answered immodest manner isabella iot danted sterne behauiour againe said good madam let perswade fette vaile right chide long word rest nunnes exalted lookes behold vaile abbesse wore head wherewith isabella finde fault selfe lift vp hand feele perceyued plainly reason isabella speech abbesse saw owne error hereupon rest obserued help cloud palpable shame withall tide began ro turne hir tongue found another manner language former fury poore isabella growing conclusion impossible resist temptation flesh therefore saide let take occasion according offereth selfe predecessor haue done prouident selues take time may hauing sentence alwaies remembrance si non caste tamen caute hauing granted yong nunne isabella free absolution lady abbesse returned backe againe bed priest isabella gentleman sister yet without benefit friend intended prouide themselues soone could enduced thereto good example master simon physitian perswasions bruno buffalmaco third companion named nello made calandrino beleeue conceiued great childe hauing physicke ministred disease got good fatte capon money cured without auy manner deliuerance third nouell discouering simplicity silly witted men easie matter abuse beguile madame eliza concluded nouell euery one company giuen thankes fortune deliuering poore isabella faire young nunne bitter reprehension faulty abbesse also malice enuious sister queene gaue command vnto philostratus next order hee without expecting anie warning began manner faire lady paltry iudge marquisate whereof yesterday made relation hindred mee another nouell concerning silly calandrino wherewith purpose acquaint whatsoeuer hath already bin spoken tended end matter meriment hee companion duly considered nouel shal nown report keepeth within selfesame compasse aimeth also contentment according scope imposed variety haue already heard manner man calandrino likewise rest pleasant companion likewise againe remembred actor present discourse came passe aunt calandrinoes dying left legacy two hundred florines wherewith purposed purchase small farmehouse countrey else enlarge whereof possessed already hee disburse ten thousand florines broker florence vnderstood intended doe worst string purse could stretch higher bruno buffalmaco auncient confederate heard good fortune befalne aduised manner wont allowing much better make merrie money good cheare among lay paltry land whereto would meanes listen ridde himselfe dinner cost loath bee anie charge merry laddes meant leaue sitting one day serious consultation third man companie named nello three lay de braines steep mean wash mouth well calandrino bee cost thereof hauing resolued bee done met togither next morning euen calandrino comming foorth house sundering themselues auoyd suspition yet beeing farre distant nello first met saide vnto good morrow calandrino requited backe agayne salutation nello standing still looked stedfastly face whereat calandrino meruailing sayd nello dost thou behold aduisedly whereunto nello answered saying hast thou felt paine last night past thou lookest nothing well thou didst yesterday calandrino beganinstantly wax doubtfull replyed thus dost thou see alteration face whereby imagine feele paine good faith calandrino quoth nello think thy countenance strangely changed surely proceedeth great cause departed away calandrino mistrustfull scratched head yet felte grieuance going still buffalmaco sodainely enencountred vpon departure nello salutation passing betweene manner admiration demanded ayled truly quoth calandrino well enough mine owne thinking yet notwithstanding met nello euen told countenance much altred possible bee sicke feele paine distaste part buffalmaco answered skilfull iudgement argue nature distemper body sure thou hast daungerous inward impediment thou lookst almost like man halfe dead calandrino began presently shake hee feauer hanging came bruno looking fearefully would vtter word seemed greatly bemoane saying length calandrino art thou man wonderfully art thou changed since last saw thee longer yester day pray thee tell mee dooest thou feele thy health calandrino hearing agreed one opinion beganne verily perswade himselfe sodaine sicknes seised vpon could discerne although hee felt anguish therefore like man much perplexed minde demanded beleeue calandrino answered bruno worthy giue thee counsell thou shouldst returne home presently thy house lay thee downe thy warme bedde couered many cloathes thou canst well endure morrow morning send thy water vnto learned mayster doctor physitian thou knowest man singular skill experience instruct thee presently best course taken haue euer beene thy louing friend faile thee thing lieth power time nello come againe vnto returned home calandrino vnto owne house whereinto entering faintly hee saide wife woman make bed presently ready feele selfe growne extreamely sicke see thou layest cloathes enow vpon thus laide bedde left night returned visite againe verie next morning time made reseruation water sent young damosell vnto maister doctor dwelt olde market place signe muske mellone saide bruno vnto companion abide heere keepe company walke along physitian vnderstand say neede procure come hither calandrino kindely accepted offer saying withall well bruno thou shewst thy selfe friend time necessity pray thee know case stand feele strange alteration within mee far beyond compasse conceite bruno gone physitian made expedition arriued damosell carried water informed master simon whole tricke intended wherefore damosell come hee passed iudgement concerning water said maide go home againe tell calandrino must keepe himselfe warme selfe instantly enstruct quality sicknesse damosell deliuered message accordingly long mayster doctor simon came bruno also company sitting downe bed side calandrino hee began taste pulse within small wife come chamber said obserue well calandrino speake thee nature true friend thou hast disease thou art great child soone calandrino heard word dispairing manner beganne rage cry aloud saying wife ah thou wicked woman long thee thou hast done mischeefe alwayes thou wilt vpon euer railing mee fighting vntill thou hast gotten vnder thee say thou diuellish creature tell thee true woman b ing verie honest ciuill conuersation hearing husband speake foolishly blushing shame hanging downe head bashfull manner without returning answer went forth chamber calandrino continuing still angry humour wringing hand beating vpon brest said wretched man shall shal deliuered child way come world plainly perceyue none dead man wickednesse wife heauen plague many mischiefes desirous finde ease good health heeretofore haue beene would rise bed neuer cease beating vntill broken thousand peeces fortune fauourable helpe mee dangerons agony hang euer get vnder againe make asse hauing mastery ouer mee diuers time hath done bruno buffalmaco nello hearing rauing speech calandrino swolne bigge laughter ribbes would haue burst sunder neuerthelesse abstained well able doctor simon gaped wide laughing one might easily haue pluckt teeth end could tarry longer preparing depart calandrino thanked paine requesting hee would carefull aiding best aduise counsell would vnmindfull honest neighbour calandrino answered phisition would haue torment selfe impatient tempestuous manner perceiue time hasten shall soone perceiue within dayes space health well restored without sense much paine indeed wil cost expences ala sir said calandrino mak spare purse procure may haue safe deliuerance haue two hundred florines lately falne death mine aunt wherewith intended purchase farme countrey take need onely reseruing lying childbed master doctor ala know behaue selfe haue heard grieuous complaint woman case oppressed bitter pang throwes questionlesse bee death except haue greater care good cheere neighbour calandrino replyed doctor simon prouide excellent distilled drinke marueilously pleasing taste soueraigne vertue resolue three morning making whole sound fish newly spawned must haue especiall care afterward prouidently wise least fall like folly againe concerning preparation precious drinke halfe dozen capon fairest fattest must make vse distillation thing shall bee imployed beside may deliuer forty florines one honest friend see necessary bought sent home house concerning businesse make doubt thereof haue distilled morrow doe drinke great glasse full euery morning fresh fasting next heart calandrino highly pleased word returning master doctor infinite thankes referring disposing hauing giuen forty florines bruno money beside buy halfe dozen capon thought himselfe greatly beholding protested requite kindenesse master doctor gone home house made ready bottel excellent hypocrasse sent next day according promise bruno hauing bought capon iunkets sit turne phisitian merry companion fed hartely giuers sake calandrino liked dyet drinke excellently well quaffing large glassefull three morning together afterward master doctor rest came see hauing felt pulse phisition said calandrino thou art sound health man florence thou needest keepe within doores longer walke abroad boldly well childe gone calandrino arose like ioyfull man walked daily street performance affaire belonged euery acquaintance met withall told condition sudden sickenesse rare cure master doctor simon wrought deliuering three dayes space childe without feeling paine bruno buffalmaco nello little iocond meeting well couetous calandrino wife liked folly husband leaue iudgement good woman francesco fortarigo played away buonconuento likewise money francesco aniolliero master running shirt auouching hee robbed caused taken pezants country clothed himselfe master wearing garment mounted horse rode thence sienna leauing aniolliero shirt walked barefooted fourth nouell seruing admonition men taking gamesters drunkard seruice ridiculous word giuen calandrino wife whole company hartily laughed philostratus ceassing madame neiphila pleased queene appoint began speake thus vertuous lady hard vneasie men make good vnderstanding vertue apparant publicarion disgrace folly many would labour vaine curbe idle speech bridle haue manifestly obserued weake wit calandrino needed fantastick circumstance cure strange disease imagined sottish perswasions haue hee lauish tongue accused wife ouermastering maketh remember nouell quite contrary last related namely one man may striue surmount another malice yet sustaine greater harme first aduantage enemy presently declare vnto dwelt sienna many yeeres since two young men equall age bearing name francesco one descended aniollieri likewise fortarigi commonly called aniolliero fortarigo gentleman well deriued although many matter complexion differ much yet notwithstanding varied one bad qualitie namely great neglect father caused frequent conuersation familiar respectiue friend aniolliero goodly faire conditioned young gentleman apparently perceiuing could maintaine himselfe sienna estate liked vpon pension allowed father hearing also marquisate ancona liued pope legate worthy cardinall much indeared good lord friend intended goe visite hoping aduance fortune hauing acquainted father determination concluded haue moment might supply want many moneths would clothed gallantly mounted honourably seeking seruant necessary attend chanced fortarigo hearing thereof came presently aniolliero intreating best manner could let waite seruing man promising dutiful diligent attendance yet demaund wage onely payment ordinary expences aniolliero made answere durst giue entertainment regard insufficiency vnaptnesse seruice great gamester diuers time would beastly drunke whereto fortarigo replyed hee would refraine foule vice addict endeauor wholly please without iust taxation grosse errour making solemne vowes protestation beside conquered aniolliero consent entred vpon iourney arriuing morning buonconuento aniolliero determined dine afterward finding heate vnfit trauaile caused bed prepared wherein laid rest helpe fortarigo gaue charge heates violence ouerpast hee faile call awake aniolliero slept thus bed fortarigo neuer remembring solemne vowes promise went tauerne hauing drunke indifferently finding company fit purpose fell play dice short onely lost money cloathes backe likewise coueting recouer loss againe naked shirt went aniollieros chamber finding yet soundly sleeping tooke money purse returned backe play speeding manner hee hauing one poore penny left aniolliero chancing awake arose made ready without seruant helpe calling fortarigo hearing tydings began immediately imagine become drunke falne asleepe one place often wont doe wherefore determining leaue caused male saddle set horse furnish himselfe honest seruant corsignano hee came pay hoste hee found penny left whereupon well might grew greatly offended raised much trouble house charged hoasts people haue robde threatening haue sent prisoner sienna suddenly entred fortarigo shirt intent haue stolne aniollieroes garment formerly hee money purse seeing ready mount horsebacke hee saide aniolliero shall goe away soone pray sir tarry little honest man comming hither hath doublet engaged eight thirty shilling sure restore back fiue thirty could presently pay downe money speech entred among assured aniolliero fortarigo thiefe robde money shewing also much hee lost dice wherewith aniolliero much mooued angerly reprooued fortarigo feare law would haue offered outrage thretning haue hangd neck else condemned gallies belonging florence mounted horse fortarigo making shew stander aniolliero menaced body said come aniolliero pray thee let v leaue friuilous prating indeede worth button minde matter importance doublet bee againe fiue thirty shilling money may bee tendered downe instant whereas deferre till morrow perhaps hee haue whole eight thirty lent doth pleasure ready another time affoord like courtesie loose three shilling may easily saued aniolliero hearing speake confused manner perceiuing also stood gazing beleeued lookes appeared fortarigo played away master mony dice rather stocke fortarigoes custody angerly answered thou sawcy companion haue doe thy doublet would thou wert hangd playing away money also delaying thus iourney yet boldly thou standest outfacing mee better thy fellow fortarigo held still former behauiour without vsing respect reuerence aniolliero accusation concerne saying wee take aduantage three shilling profit thinkest thou able doe much thee lay much money sake make haste need must haue daylight enough bring v night torreniero come draw thy purse pay money vpon mine honest word may enquire throughout sienna yet find another doublet mine say leaue lyeth pawned eight thirty shilling richly worth fifty sure suffer double endammagement thereby may well imagine aniolliero enraged beyond patience see himselfe robde money ouerborne presumptuous language wherefore without making replication gaue spurre horse rode away towards torreniero fell fortarigo knauish intention aniolliero speedy running followed apace shirt cry still aloude way let haue doublet againe aniolliero riding fast free eares idle importunity fortuned fortarigo espied diuers countrey pezants laboring field businesse aniolliero necessity must passe cryed loude could stay thiefe stop thiefe ride away fast hauing robde prouided prongges pitchforkes spade others like weapon fit husbandry stept way aniolliero beleeuing vndoubtedly robde man pursued shirt stayed apprehended whatsoeuer aniolliero could doe say preuailed thing vnmannerly clownes fortarigo arriued among braued aniolliero impudently saying reason haue spoyle thy life thou traiterous villaine rob spoyle thy master thus high way turning countrey boores much deare friend quoth beholding vnexpected kindnesse behold manner left lodging hauing first playd away money dice deceiuing horse garment also great good lucke thus holpe mee stay poore gentleman bin vndone euer neuer haue found againe aniolliero auouched truth wrong receiued base peazants giuing credite onely fortarigoes lying exclamation tooke horse despoyled wearing apparrell euen bootes legges suffered ride away manner aniolliero left shirt dance barefoote galliard either towards sienna place else thus aniolliero purposing visite cousin cardinal like gallant marquisate ancona returned backe poorly shirt vnto buonconuento durst shame repaire sienna end borrowed money horse fortarigo rode remained inne whence riding corsignano diuers kinsman friend continued long till better furnished father thus may perceiue cunning villanies fortarigo hindred honest intended enterprise aniolliero howbeit fit time place nothing afterward left vnpunished calandrino became extraordinarily enamoured young damosell named nicholetta bruno prepared charme writing auouching constantly soone touched damosell therewith follow whither soeuer hee would haue gone appointed place hee found wife dealt withall according deseruing fift nouell iust reprehension vaineheaded fooles led gouerned idle perswasions nouell reported madame neiphila soone concluded without much laughter commendation whole company queene turned hir selfe towards madam fiammetta enioyning succeed apt order ready sodainly commanded began followeth gentle lady perswaded opinion iudgement mine thing bee spoken pleasingly except conueniently suited apt time place respect lady gentlewoman bent discoursing due election necessarily required therefore vnmindfull meeting heere ayming nothing outweare time generall contentment tye v course pleasure recreation conueniency time place sparing though haue bin nominated oftentimes passed argument yet occasion serue nature variety well considered wee may speake selfesame person againe notwithstanding action calandrino haue beene indifferently canuazed among v yet remembring philostratus long since saide intended nothing matter mirth presume bodlier report another nouell beside already past willing conceale truth cloath circumstantiall maner could make vse contrary name paint poeticall fiction perhaps probable though pleasing wandring truth thing doth much diminish relation delight hearer build boldly forealledged reason tel truly hapned niccholao cornacchini citizen man great wealth among rich possession camerata builded goodly house perfected ready painting compounded bruno buffalmaco bicause worke required helpe owne drew nello calandrino association began proceed businesse chamber two hauing olde moueables bedding table housholdstuffe beside custody old woman kepte house without helpe seruants else son vnto saide niccholao beeing named phillippo resorted thither diuers time one prety damosell company regard vnmarried would abide day two conuey home againe one time among rest chanced brought damosell thither named nicholetta maintained wily companion called magione dwelling hee camaldoli indeed honester beautifull young woman wearing garment great value according quality well spoken commendable carriage comming forth chamber one day couered white veyle haire hung loose shee went wash well middle court bathing also face hand calandrino going chance well water gaue secret salutation kindly returning like courtesie began obserue aduisedly looked like man newly come thither handsomnesse perceyued calandrino threw wanton glance seeing faire louely began finde occasion tarrying returned water associate yet neither knowing daring deliuer one word learn lesson alluring noting affectionate regard bashfulnesse gaue answered boldly like meerly scorning manner breathing forth diuers dissembled sigh among calandrino became foolishly inueigled loue would depart court vntill phillippo standing aboue chamber window called thence calandrino returned backe businesse could nothing else shake head sigh puffe blowe obserued bruno alwayes sitted according folly making meer mockery best behauiour sodainly said calandrino sigh pusse blow man may reason vnwonted quality calandrino immediately answered saying friendly companion bruno one lend little helpe quickely become well enough quoth bruno doth thing offend thee wilt thou reueale thy friend deare bruno said calandrino proper handsome woman house goodliest creature euery eye beheld much fairer queen fairy selfe deeply falne loue mee thou wouldst thinke lesse wonder yet neuer sawe till yet sent fetch water strange case answer bruno take heede calandrino shee bee louely friend phillippo yong master may proue dangerous matter calandrino stood scratching head indifferent sodainly replyed thus trust bruno bee doubted called window immediatly went vp chamber doe care haue god themselues bene beguiled wench better men euer phillippo shall stand feare bruno replied patient calandrino enquire woman wife friend young master phillippo faire perswasions ouerrule matter shee familiar acquaintance mine shall wee doe buffalmaco may know heereof neuer speake hee company buffalmaco quoth calandrino haue feare rather nello neer kinsman wife able vndo quite come hearing thou saist well replyed bruno therefore matter hath neede cleanly carried let tell woman well enough knowne bruno also quality life phillippo acquainted withall reason resorting thither wherefore calandrino going forth roome wrought onely gaine another sight nicholetta bruno reuealed whole history buffalmaco nello concluding together amorous fit foole followed calandrino returned backe againe whispering maner bruno said hast thou seene yes yes bruno answered calandrino ala hath slaine eye better dead man patient said bruno goe see whether woman take proue neuer feare refer businesse vnto bruno descending downe staires found phillippo nicholetta conference together stepping vnto discoursed large manner man calandrino farre falne loue made merry conclusion performed case onely make pastime ot begun loue come backe againe calandrino saide woman whereof told thee therefore wee must worke wisely businesse phillippo perceiue thing water arno hardly serue quench fury wouldst thou haue say thy behalfe compasse meanes speake first quoth calandrino prime place tell wish infi ite bushel blessing make maides mother begetteth child next onely seruice wil command dooest thou vnderstand say sufficiently answered bruno leaue supper time come gaue ouer working descended downe court found phillippo nicholetta readily attending expect beginning amorous behauiour calandrino glanced leering lookes coughing spetting hummes haes yea close secret manner starke blinde sight might verie easily haue perceyued also side returned queint cunning carriage enflamed farre furiously euen hee ready leape himselfe meane phillippo buffalmaco rest present seeming seriouslie consulting together perceiued nothing fantastick behauior according bruno appointed could scarse refraine extremity laughter noted antick trickes calandrino hauing spent indifferent space foppish folly houre parting came without wonderful affliction calandrino going towards florence bruno saide closely calandrino dare assure thee thou hast made consume melt euen like ice warme sunne word thou wouldst bring thy gitterne sit downe v singing amorous song thine owne making beneath businesse court shee would presently leape window vnable tarry thee like thy counsell well bruno answered calandrino shall bring gitterne thither indeed yes case replied bruno musicke matter mighty preuailing ah bruno quoth calandrino thou wouldst credit morning tolde thee sight person wounded perceiued first looke owne shee power conceale selfe could soone haue enflamed affection woman worth beauty shee infinite proper handsome fellowes daily haunt company dainty damosel yet shallow affayres loue able win one wench thousand wit haue extreame follie ill fortune pausing sodainely rapping louers oath two thus proceeded dearest bruno thou shalt see tickle gitterne good sport ensue thereon thou dost obserue iudgement man old seeme could perceiue first view yea shall finde haue leysure consult vpon occasion finde selfe free frolicke io unditie spirit make follow euen fond woman doth child beware saide bruno thou gripe ouerhard kissing bee carefull biting teeth stand thy head like pegges lute yet make comely shew thy faire wide mouth thy cheekes looking like two artificiall rose swelling amiably thy iawes well fild meat calandrino hearing hansome commendation thought himselfe man action already going singing frisking companie liuely bin skin morrow carrying gitterne thither little delight companion hee played sung whole bedrole song addicting himselfe worke day loitering fantastically one gazed window ran gate oftentimes downe court onely haue sight mistresse also cunningly encountred folly direction bruno gaue many beside owne deuising quicken still new occasion bruno plaid ambassador betweene deliuering message calandrino returning answer sometimes absent thence often hapned occasion called would write letter name bring sent giue hope hee desired among kindred yet could vnmindfull manner bruno buffalmaco managing amorous businesse made meere gregory poore calandrino causing somtimes send one pretty peece iuory faire wrought purse costly paire kniues like friendly token bringing backe againe requital counterfetted ring valew bugle bables esteemed matter great moment moreouer diuers close sodain meeting made pay many dinner supper amounting indifferent charge onely careful furtherance louesuit conceale wife hauing worne three foure month space fond friuolous manner without successe hath bene declared calandrino perceiuing worke vndertaken fellowes grew neere vppon finishing would barre longer resorting thither hee began solicite bruno importunately hadde done regard whereof nicholetta one day come thither bruno hauing conferred phillippo ful determination done began calandrino saying honest neighbour friend woman hath made thousand promise graunt thou art desirous haue plainly perceiue hath meaning meerely play nose respect seeing perfidious perfourme one faithfullmade promise thou wilt consent haue shall compelled whether yea marry bruno answered calandrino excellent course indeede could done expedition bruno stood musing awhile himselfe strange stratagem braine afterward said hast thou much corage calandrino handle peece written parchment giue thee yes haue answered calandrino hope needed doubted well saide bruno procure may haue piece virgin parchment brought mee liuing bat reremouse three graines incense hallowed candle leaue effect shal content thee calandrino watched next night following preparation could make onely catch bat taken last broght aliue bruno material appointed taking alone backer chamber hee wrote diuers folly parchment shape strange vnvsuall charracters deliuered calandrino saying bold calandrino build constantly vppon wordes thou canst touch sacred charractred charme immediately follow thee fulfil whatsoeuer thou pleasest command hir wherefore phillippo day walke whither abroad house presume salute manner whatsoeuer touching written line go presently barn hay thou perceiuest neere adioyning onely conuenient place none resort thither shall despight blood follow thee thou hast leaue thee thy valiant victory calandrino stood tiptoe like man newly molded fortune warranted bruno fulfil effectually nello calandrino feared mistrusted hand deepe rest deceite forward also haue performed brunoes direction hee went vnto florence company calandrinoes wife thus hee began cousine thine vnkinde vsage thine husband vnknown beate thee beyond compasse reason brought home stone plain mugnone regard desirous haue thee reuenged thou wilt neuer repute heereafter thy kinsman friend falne loue woman common gender one hired money hath priuate meeting place partly knowne secret appointment made lately credibly giuen vnderstand wherefore walke presently along thou shalt take heat knauery word vttering shee could dissemble inward impatience starting vp halfe franticke fury said notorious villaine darest thou abuse thine honest wife basely sweare blessed saint bridge thou shalt paid coyne thi ownestampe casting light wearing cloake taking yong woman company shee went away nell meane haste bruno seeing comming farre said phillippo sir know done act part according appointment phillippo went immediately roome calandrino consort worke said honest friend haue certaine occasion command mine instant florence worke hard absent vnthankefull away hee departed hid himselfe conuenient place could descryed yet see whatsoeuer calandrino imagined phillippo farre enough descended downe court found nicholetta sitting alone going towards began enter discoursing knowing remained bee done behalfe drew somewhat neere shewed selfe familiar formerly done fauourable meanes touched charmed parchment whibh sooner done vsing kinde language hee went haybarne whither nicholletta followed entred closed barne doore stood gazing hee neuer seene standing stil study bethinking himselfe say began vse affable gesture taking hand made shew shee meant kisse yet reframed though rather life would gladly haue deare calandrino quoth iewell ioy comfort heart many time haue longed thy sweet company enioying according mine owne desire dost thou stand like statue man alla morte rare tune gitterne much melodious accent thy voyce excelling orpheus amphion rauished soule know expresse depth mine affection yet hast thou brought hither onely looke baby mine eye much speake one kinde word bruno buffalmaco hauing hid themselues close behinde philippo heard saw amourous conflict calandrino quickning courage wiping mouth intent kisse wife nello entred barne caused nicholetta get gone presently sheltring self philippo lay scouting enraged woman ranne furiously vpon poore daunted calandrino making pitiful massacre nailes tearing haire head hee meerely looked like infected anatomy fowle loathsome dog quoth must minion leaue mee hungerstarued home olde knaue almost neuer good tooth thy head yet art thou neighing young wench hast thou worke enough home must bee gadding men ground fruites wandring abroad calandrino pittifull perplexity stood like one neither aliue dead daring vse resistance fell knee wife holding vp hand mercy entreating charity sake torment committed harme gentlewoman master wife came intent thither shee fondly imagined wife wife quoth would haue none meddle husband haue right bruno buffalmaco laughed heartily pastime phillippo nicholetta came running haste know reason loude noise pacified woman gentle perswasions aduised calandrino walke wife florence returne worke againe least phillippo hearing hapned reuenged outrage thus poore calandrino miserably misused beaten went home florence wife scoulded raild way beside molestation day night afterward companion phillippo nicholetta making themselues merry misfortune two yong gentleman one named panuccio adriano lodged one night poore inne one went bed hostes daughter mistaking way darke hostes wife lay daughter happened afterward hostes bed told done thinking spake owne companyon discontentment growiug betweene mother perceiuing errour went bed daughter discreete language made generall pacification sixt nouell wherein manifested offence committed ignorantly mistaking ought couered good aduise ciuill discretion calandrino whose mishap many time made whole assembly merry last passing among indifferent commendation vpon generall silence commanded queene gaue order pamphilus hee follow next indeed beginning thus praiseworthy lady name nicoletta fondly affected calandrino putteth mee minde nouell concerning another nicoletta purpose speake ende may obserue sudden wary foresight discreet woman compassed meanes auoyde notorious scandall plaine mugnone neere florence dwelt long since honest meane man kept poore inne ostery trauellers might haue slender entertainement money poore man house affoorded small receit guest lodging necessity knowledge honest poore hoste woman sufficiently faire wife hee also two child one comely young maiden aged fifteene yeares sonne fully yet yeare old sucking mother brest comely youthfull gentleman city became amorously affected damosell resorting thither diuers time hee trauelled way expresse much respect accounting fortune none meanest bee beloued youthfull gallant declared vertuous modest demeanour might deserue best opinion loue grew equall simpathy mutuall contentment expectation effect named panuccio nicholletta heate affection thus encreasing day day panuccio grew exceedingly desirous enioy fruit long continued liking diuers deuises mustred braine might compasse one night lodging father house whereof hee knew euery part parcell doubting effect hee desired yet vndiscouered maide selfe according intention aymed longed put execution hauing imparted mind honest loyall friend named adriano acquainted course loue hyring two horse hauing portmantues behind filled matter moment departed florence great iourney ride hauing spent day time themselues best pleased darke night entred arriued plaine mugnone come part romanio rode directly poore inne knocking doore honest hoste familiar friendly commers opened doore panuccio spake manner good man must request one night lodging thought haue reached farre florence dark night preuenting v see late houre wee come hither signior panuccio answered hoste vnknowne vnfiting poore house entertaining guest neuerthelesse seeing ouertaken vnseasonable houre place neere receite gladly lodge well dismounted horse entred simple inne hauing taken order feeding horse accepted prouision place time afforded requesting hoste suppe tell one small chamber house wherin stood three bed best hoste deuised place two standing walles side third fronting close narrow passage hardly could one step betweene best three bed appointed gentleman therein theyd lay rest sleepe could albeit dissembled formally second bed nicholetta daughter lodged selfe father mother third giue child sucke night time cradle wherein lay stood close bed side childes cry occasion concerning disquiet gentleman panuccio hauing subtily obserued manner went bed space time imagined fast asleepe arose softly stealing bed nicholetta lay downe gently albeit seemed somewhat afraid first yet perceiued shee rather bad welcome shewed selfe way discontented panuccio continued thus maide fortuned cat threw somewhat house noise wherof awaked wife fearing greater harme indeed hapned arose without candle went groping darke towards place shee heard noyse adriano meaning well found occasion also rise naturall necessity making passage darke stumbled childes cradle way woman set vnable passe without remouing place tooke set owne bed side hauing done businesse rose returned bed againe neuer remembring set cradle first found wife hauing found thing throwne downe value moment cared lighting candle rating cat returned backe feeling bed husband lay finding cradle said selfe foolish woman cannot well tell selfe doe instead husband bed going guest stepping little found childes cradle laid selfe downe adriano thinking shee gone right husband adriano yet falne asleepe feeling hostesse bed tooke aduantage faire occasion offered businesse mine heard neither found woman fault matter comming passe strange manner panuccio fearing lest sleepe seazing might disgrace maides reputation taking kinde farewell many kiss sweet imbraces returned againe owne bed meeting cradle way thinking stood hostes bed truely first went backe cradle stept hostes bed indeed awaked vpon entrance albeit slept soundly panuccio supposing laid downe louing friend adriano merrily said hoste protest thee gentleman nicholetta dainty delicate wench worthy good man wife night shee hath giuen mee sweetest entertainement best prince world wish better haue kist kindly hoste hearing newes seemed vnwelcome said first make deuill heere bedde afterward rashly angry well aduised hee said panuccio canst thou make vaunt mounstrous villany thinkest thou heauen hath due vengeance store requite wicked deed darkenesse sleepe yet haue courage sufficient right wrong yet olde thou shalt sure finde amorous panuccio none wisest young men world perceiuing errour sought amend well might haue done queint straine wit carried quicke cleanly manner angerly answered shall find thou darst doe way afraid thy threatnings hostes imagining bed husband said adriano harke husband thinke guest quarrelling together hope doe harme one another adriano laughing outright answered let alone become friend againe fell perhaps dranke much yesternight woman perceiuing husband quarrelled distinguishing voyce adriano knew presently shee wherefore hauing wit desirous cloude error vnaduisedly committed willing consent selfe without returning word presently rose taking cradle child remoued thence daughter bed side although shee light helpe afterward went bed newly awaked called husband vnderstand angry speech past betweene panuccio hoste replyed saying didst thou heare wife brag boast hath lyen night daughter nicholetta husband quoth honest gentleman hee say beleeue manifest lye bed selfe neuer yet closed mine eye together since first houre laid downe vnmannerly done speake little lesse loggerhead doe beleeue proceedeth bibbing swilling yesternight seemeth maketh walke roome sleepe dreaming wonder night season great sinne brake neck teach keepe fairer quarter commeth passe signior panuccio could keepe himselfe owne bed adriano side perceiuing wisely woman excused owne shame daughter backe businesse cunningly begun called panuccio saying haue tolde thee hundred
