time thou art fit lye thine owne lodging shame base imperfection thee rising walking thus nighttime according thy dreames doe wantonly delude thee cause thee forsake thy bed telling nothing lie fable yet auouching manifest truthes assuredly procure meane perill vnto thee come hither keepe thine owne bedde meere shame honest meaning host heard wife adriano confirmed verily perswaded panuccio spake dreame make constantly apparant panuccio growne wiser others example lay talking blundring himselfe euen dreames perturbation minde much molest strange distraction franticke manner hoste perceiuing compassionating case one man anothers tooke shoulder iogging hunching saying awake signior panuccio get gone hence owne bed panuccio yawning stretching limbes vnusuall groanes respiration better could bee hardly dissembled seemed wake traunce calling friend adriano said adriano day thou dost waken may day night replyed adriano fit alike thee arise man shame come thine lodging faining much troubled sleepie arose hoast went adrianoes bed day house risen hoast began smile panuccio mocking idle dreaming talking night falling one merry matter another yet without mislike gentleman hauing house prepared portmantues fastened behind drinking hoast mounted horsebacke roade away towards florence lesse contented manner occasion happened effect sorted afterward course taken continuance begun pleasure nicholetta made mother beleeue panuccio nothing else dreame mother selfe remembring kindely adriano vsed fortune expected halfe minde dreame also waking talano de molese dreamed wolfe rent tore wiues face throate dreame told aduise keep selfe danger refusing doe receiued vvhat followed seuenth nouell whereby indifferent reason concluded dreames alwayes fall leasings conclusion pamphilus nouel wherein woman ready wit time necessity carried deserued commendation queen gaue command madam pampinea next begin manner discourse gracious lady already past among v truth apparition dreames hath partly bin approued whereof many haue made mockery neuerthelesse whatsoeuer hath heeretofore bin sayde purpose acquaint short nouell strange accident happening vnto neighbour mine crediting dreame husband told cannot tell whether knew talano de molese man much honour tooke wife yong gentlewoman named margarita beautifull best yet peeuish scornefull fantasticall disdained good aduice giuen neyther could thing done cause contentment absurd humor highly displeasing husband regard knew helpe constrainedly endure came passe talano wife summerhouse owne country dreamed one night saw wife walking faire wood adioyned neere vnto house thus continued seemed see issue foorth corner said wood great furious wolfe leaping sodainly caught hy face throate drawing downe earth offering drag thence cry helpe recouered wolfe yet hauing face throat pitifully rent torne regard terrifying dreame talano risen morning sate conuersing wife spake thus vnto hir woman although thy froward wilfull nature hath permitted one pleasing day thee since first becam man wife rather life hath bene tedious fearing still mischeefe happen thee yet let mee louing manner aduise thee follow counsell day walke abroad house demanded reason aduice related euery particular dreame adding speech true wife quoth little credit bee giuen dreames neuerthelesse deliuer aduertisement harmes ensue nothing lost shunning auoiding fleering face shaking head replyed harmes thou wishest thou dreamest thou pretendest much pittie care end mischeefes thou dreamest happening vnto mee wouldest thou see effected wherefore well enough looke selfe day time else thou shalt neuer make thy selfe merry misfortune thou wishest vnto well wife answered talano knew well enough thou wouldst say vnsound head soone scratcht gentlest combe beleeue thou pleasest selfe speake true honest meaning soule againe aduise thee keepe within doores day least wise beware thou walke wood bee regard dreame well sir quoth scoffingly shall say followed counsell within selfe fell murmuring perceiue husband cunning colouring must walke day wood hath made compact common queane closely haue company afraide least shold take tardy belike would haue feed among blinde folke worthy bee thought starke foole preuent manifest trechery intended go thither therefore tarry whole day long meet merchandize see pink wherin aduentures secret consultation husband sooner gone forth one doore shee like another yet secretly possibly could deuise doe without delaying went wood wherein hid selfe closely among thickest bush yet could discerne euery way body offer passe shee kept selfe concealment suspecting mysterious matter idle imagination tutord rather danger wolfe brakie thicket sodainly rushed huge dreadfull wolfe hauing found sent mounting vppe grasping throat mouth saw could call heauen mercy thus seised carried lightly away shee bin heauier lambe meanes able cry held fast throate hindred helping selfe wolfe carried thus thence quite strangled certaine shepheards met outcry exclaimes wolfe caused let fall hast away saue owne life notwithstanding harme done throat face shepheards knew caried home house remained long carefully attended physitians chirurgians although expert cunning men yet could perfectly cure throate part face blemished whereas seemed rare creature deformed much vnsightly regard strange alteration ashamed shew selfe place formerly bene seene spent time sorrow mourning repenting insolent scornfull carriage also rash running forth danger vpon foolish iealous surmise beleeuing husband dreames better euer blondello merry maner caused guiotto beguile himselfe good dinner deceit guiotto became cunningly reuenged procuring blondello vnreasonably beaten misused eight nouell whereby plainly appeareth take delight deceiuing others well deserue deceiued themselues generall opinion whole iouiall companie whatsoeuer talano saw sleepe anie dreame rather vision considering euery part thereof fell directly without lest failing silence enioyned queene gaue forth euident demonstration madam lauretta next succeed whereupon thus began iudicious hearer haue day spoken deriued ground proiect nouels argument spoken euen cruell reuendge scholler yesterday discoursed large madame pampinea maketh remember another tale like nature somewhat greeuous sufferer yet cruell measure inflicted madam helena dwelt sometime florence one generally called name guiotto man greatest gourmand grossest feeder euer seene countrey meanes procurement meerly vnable maintaine expences filling belly otherwise sufficient commendable carriage fairely demea ed well discoursing argument yet curious spruce courtier rather frequenter rich men table choice good cheere sildome wanting haue company albeit inuited yet like bold intruder courage bid himselfe welcome time city florence also another man named blondello low stature yet comly formed quicke witted neat brisk butter flye alwaies wearing wrought silke cap head haire staring order tuft flourishing aboue forehead another trencherfly table forenamed guiotto fel morning lent time hee went fishmarket bought two goodly lampreyes messer viero de cherchi espied guiotto comming blondello said meaning cost whereto blondello thus answered yesternight three lampries far fairer fatter whole sturgeon sent vnto messer corso donati sufficient feede diuers gentleman hee hath inuited day dine hee caused buy two beside doest thou intend make one among yes warrant thee replied guiotto thou knowst inuite selfe thither without bidding parting houre dinner time guiotto went house saide messer corso found sitting talking certain neighbor dinner yet ready neither come thither dinner messer corso demaunded guiotto newes whither went sir said guiotto come dine good company wherto messer corso answered welcom friend gone dinner serued none el therat present messer corso guiotto al diet poore dish pea litle piece tunny smal fish fried without dish follow guiotto seeing better fare disapointed expectation longing feed lampries sturgeon haue made ful dinner indeed quick apprehension apparantly perceiued blondello meerly guld knauery litle vex made vow reuenged blondello could compasse occasion afterward many day past fortune meete blondello hauing told iest diuers friend much good merriment made thereat saluted guiotto ceremonious manner saying didst thou like fat lampreyes sturgeon thou fedst house messer corso donati wel sir answered guiotto perhaps eight dayes passe ouer head thou shalt meet pleasing dinner parting away blondello met porter burthenbearer vsually sent errand hyring deliuer message gaue glasse bottle bringing neere halhouse cauicciuli shewed knight called signior phillipo argenti man huge stature stout strong vainglorious fierce sooner mooued anger man quoth guiotto thou must go bottle thy hand say thus sir blondello sent courteously entreateth would enrubinate glasse bottle best claret wine would make merry friend beware lay hand thee may bee easily induced misuse thee businesse disappointed well sir replied porter shal say thing else vnto quoth guiotto go deliuer message thou art returned ile pay thee thy paine porter gone house deliuered message knight man great ciuill breeding furious rash inconsiderate presently conceiued blondello knew well enough sent message meere mockage starting vp fiery lookes said enrubination claret send haue drunken friend let thee go hang selues together stept catch hold porter well warnd quicke nimble escaping returned backe guiotto obserued told answer signior phillippo guiotto little contented paied porter taried place til met blondello said wast thou hall cauicciuli long answered blundello dost thou demand question quoth guiotto signior phillippo hath sought thee yet knowe would haue thee replied blondello wil walke thither presently vnderstand pleasure blondello thus parted guiotto folowed farre behind behold issue angry businesse signior phillippo could catch porter continued much distempred fretting fuming regard could comprehend meaning porter message onely surmized blondello procurement body else done scorne remained thus deeply discontented espied blondello comming towards meeting way stept close gaue cruell blow face causing nose fall bleeding ala sir said blondello wherefore strike signior phillippo catching haire head trampled wrought nightcap dirt cloke also laying many violent blowes said villanous traitor thou art ile teach thee enrubinate claret either thy selfe thy cupping companion child iested withall furious word stroke also beating face hardly leauing haire head dragging along mire spoyling garment able first blow giuen speake word defence himselfe end signior phillippo hauing extreamly beaten many people gathering succour man much misused matter large related manner message sending present greatly reprehend blondello considering knew kinde man phillippo way iested withall blondello teares constantly maintained neuer sent message wine intended least degree tempest mildly calmed blondello thus cruelly beaten durtied gotten home owne house could remember questionles vvas occasioned guiotto dayes passed ouer hurt face indifferently cured blondello beginning walke abroade againe chanced meet guiotto laughing heartily sayde tell blondello doost thou like enrubinating clarret signior phillippo well quoth blondello thou didst sturgeon lampreyes messer corso donaties rhen sayde guiotto let two token continue familiar betweene thee thou wouldst bestow another dinner mee wil enrubinate thy nose bottle claret blondello perceiued cost hee met worser bargaine guiotto got cheare without blowes therefore desired peacefull attonement alwayes abstaining flouting one another two yong gentleman one named melisso borne city laiazzo giosefo antioche trauailed together vnto salomon famous king great britaine one desiring learne whereby compasse winne loue men craued enstructed meanes hee might reclaime headstrong vnruly wife answeres wise king gaue vnto departed away ninth nouell containing excellent admonition couet haue loue men must first learne themselues loue also meanes woman curst selfwilled may reduced ciuill obedience vpon conclusion madame laurettaes nouell none remained succeede next order onely queene selfe priuiledge reserued granted dioneus wherefore smiled folly blondello chearfull countenance thus queene began honourable lady aduised iudgement duly consider order thing shall easily perceyue whole vniuersall multiplicitie woman nature custome lawes ought subiect men yea gouernd discretion euery one desiring enioy peace repose comfort vnder whose charge ought humble patient obedient ouer beside spotlesse honesty crowne honour euery good woman although lawes respect common good thing rather vse custome wonted saying power wherof great worthy reuerenced make v wise case yet nature hath giuen v sufficient demonstration creating body soft delicate yea heart timorous fearefull benigne compassionable strength feeble voyces pleasing motion member sweetly plyant apparant testimony wee haue neede others gouernment denyed whosoeuer hath need helpe bee gouerned meerely reason commandeth bee subiect obedient gouernour haue help gouernours men wherfore intirely subiect giuing due honour reuerence one shall depart rule mine opinion onely worthy grieuous reprehension also seuere chastisement beside exact consideration ouer aboue diuers important reason rather induced nouel madame pampinea lately reported concerning froward wilfull wife talano heauier punishment inflicted husband could deuise doe therefore peremptory sentence woman gracious benigne pleasing doe iustly deserue haue already said rude rough harsh handling nature custome lawes haue commanded make good haue said wil declare vnto counsell aduise giuen salomon wise famous king great britaine wholesome soueraigne medicine cure dangerous disease woman fouly infected counsel notwithstanding woman haue need phisicke would haue imagine meant albeit men haue common prouerbe wit good horse bad horse doe need spurre good wife bad wife wand make stirre saying whosoeuer doth interpret ioin pleasing manner ought shal find al wil affirm lesse true especially morall meaning beyond contradiction woman naturally vnstable easily enclining misgouernment wherefore correct iniquity distemperature outstep tearmes bound womanhood wand hath allowed especiall phisicke like manner support vertue contrary condition shaming sullyed grosse sinne correcting wand may serue walking staffe protect feares forbearing teach longer let mee proceed purpose tell nouell ancient reuerend dayes wherof speake high renowne admirable wisedome salomon king great brittain famous throughout part world answering doubtfull question demaunds whatsoeuer possibly could propounded many resorted remote furthest countreyes heare miraculous knowledge experience yea craue counsell matter greatest importance among rest repaired thither rich yong gentleman honourably descended named melisso came city laiazzo borne dwelt riding towards france passed naples hee ouertooke another yong gentleman natiue antioch named giosefo whose iourney lay way others hauing ridden company dayes together custome commonly obserued among trauellers vnderstand one anothers countrey condition also part occasion call happened giosefo directly telling iourneyed towards wise king salomon desire aduise meanes obserue reclaiming wilfull wife froward selfewilled woman euer liued neither faire perswasions gentle courtesy could manner preuaile withall afterward demaunded melisso know occasion trauell whither trust sir answered melisso natiue laiazzo vexed one great misfortune euen offended another young wealthy well deriued birth allow liberall expences maintaining worthy table house without distinguishing person rancke quality make free commers city place el notwithstanding bounty houourable entertainement cannot meet man loueth respect iourney place doe craue counsell wise king doe whereby might procure men loue thus like two wellmet friendly companion rode together vntill arriued great britaine meanes noble baron attending king brought melisso deliuered minde word whereto king made answere learne loue sooner spoken melisso dismissed king presence giosefo also relating wherefore came thither king replyed onely thus goe goose bridge presently giosefo also dismission king comming forth found melisso attending reuealed manner king answered whereupon consulted together concerning answeres seemed either exceed comprehension else deliuered meere mockery therefore halfe discontented returned homeward againe ridden dayes together came riuer ouer goodly bridge great company horse mule heauily laden manner carauan camel egypt first passe ouer saide bridge gladly stayed permit passe greater number already past ouer one shie skittish mule belike subiect fearefull starting oftentimes see horse haue like ill quality would passe ouer bridge meanes wherefore one muletters tooke good cudgell smote first gently hoping procure passage notwithstanding starting one backeward againe forward sidewayes euery way indeed direct road way would goe grew muletter extreamely angry giuing many cruell stroakes head side flancks part else yet proued purpose melisso giosefo seeing meanes hindred passage called muletter saying foolish fellow doest thou intendest thou kill mule dost thou leade gently likelier course preuaile beating misusing thou dost content selues gentleman answered muletter know horse quality doe mule let mee deale please hauing thus spoken gaue many violent stroke head side hippes euery else made last passe ouer bridge quietly muletter wonne mastery mule melisso giosefo past ouer bridge intended part sudden motion happened minde melisso caused demaund aged man sate crauing almes passenger bridge foot bridge called sir answered old man called goose bridge word giosefo heard hee called minde saying king salomon therefore immediately saide melisso worthy friend partner trauell dare assure counsell giuen king salomon may fall effectall true plainely perceiue knew handle selfewilldwife vntill muletter instruct requesting still enioy others company iourneyed till length came laiazzo giosefo retained melisso still repose long iourney entertained honourable respect courtesie one day giosefo said wife woman gentleman intimate friend hath borne company trauell dyet therfore thou wilt welcome withall would haue ordered dressing according direction melisso perceiuing giosefo would need haue word directed course euer might husband contentment altring iote former disposition rather farre froward tempestuous delighted vexe crosse euery thing quite contrary order appointed giosefo obseruing angerly said vnto tolde friend manner would haue supper drest turning fiercely replyed directed thee supper must shall bee drest haue pleaseth mee care doth dislike thou wouldst haue otherwise goe seeke supper may haue melisso maruelling froward answere rebuked kind manner whereupon giosefo spake thus perceiue wife woman wount beleeue word shal quite alter curst complexion turning melisso thus proceeded noble friend shall try anone whether counsell king salomon bee effectuall pray let offenssiue see rather hold done merriment would hindered doe remember answere muletter gaue v tooke compassion mule worthy friend replyed melisso owne house purpose impeach whatsoeuer doe giosefo hauing prouided good hollywand went chamber wife sate railing despitefully grumbling taking haire head threw feete beating entreamely wand cry cursing next railing lastly fighting biting scratching felt cruell smart blowes resistance serued end fell knee desired mercy charity sake giosefo fought still head armes shoulder side part else pretending heard complaint wearied himselfe wel neere breath briefe neuer felt finger perceiued confessed soone done hee returned melisso said morrow shall see miracle auaileable councell going goose bridge sitting together washed hand supt withdrew lodging poore beaten woman could hardly raise selfe ground yet much adoe threw selfe vpon bed tooke rest could arising early next morning came husband making low courtesie demaunded hee pleased haue dinner smiling heartely thereat melisso tolde mind dinner time came euery thing ready according direction giuen regard highly commended counsell whereof made harsh construction first within melisso gone giosefo returned home owne house hee acquainted wise reuerend man answere king salomon gaue whereto hee receiued reply better truer aduise could possibly giuen well know loue man bountiful banquet bestow respect owne vaineglory kind affection beare learne loue men salomon aduised shall beloued againe thus vnruly wife became mildely reclaimed yong gentleman louing others found fruit reciporall affection iohn de barolo instance request gossip pietro da tresanti made enchantment haue wife become mule came fastening taile gossip pietro saying haue taile spoyled whole enchantment tenth nouell iust reproofe foolish men gouerned ouerlight beleefe nouell reported queene caused little murmuring among lady albeit men laughed heartely thereat growne silent dioneus began manner gracious beauty among many white doues one blacke crow seeme sightly whitest swanne doe like manner among multitude wise men sometimes one much lesse wisedome discretion shall onely increase splendour maiestie maturity also giue addition delight solace regard modest discreet lady selfe much defectiue braine otherwise able making vertues shine gloriously euident apparance mine owne weakenesse esteeme better mee much seeme cloudy obscure consequently ought haue larger scope liberty plainely expressing patiently endured saying absurdly shall speech sauoured absolute wisdome therfore tell tale shall great length whereby may comprehend carefully thing obserued commanded effect matter power enchantment little delayance also ought would haue enchantment hindered yeare already past since dwelt barletta honest man called iohn de barolo poore condition maintenance contented estate prouided himselfe mule carry commodity place place faires market request especially apuglia buying selling nature petty chapman trauelling thus thorow countreyes grew great familiar acquaintance one named himselfe pietro da tresanti following trade life carrying commodity vpon asse signe amitie according countreyes custome neuer tearmed otherwise name gossip pietro alwayes came barletta brought house taking inne entreating friendly best manner could deuise doe side gossip pietro poore hauing one simple habitation village tresanti hardly sufficient handsome young woman wife also asse euermore iohn de barolo came tresanti would bring poore abiding vttermost abilitie entertainement due acknowledgement courtesie afforded barletta came take repose night season gossip pietro could lodge gladly would one silly bed wherein himselfe wife lay iohn de barolo faigne lie little straw small stable close adioyning owne mule asse woman vnderstanding good honest welcome gossip iohn afforded husband came barletta often willing goe lodge honest neighbour called carapresa di giudice leo two gossip might lie together one bed wherewith diuers time acquainted husband meanes would admit one time among rest making motion againe husband friend might lodged better manner gossip iohn thus spake good zita carapresa neuer molest selfe lodge mine owne contentment much rather regard whensoeuer list conuert mule faire young woman giue mee much delight nightseason afterward make mule againe thus neuer without company young woman wondring word beleeuing fable told husband addition beside pietro quoth deare friend thee thou hast often auouched wish instruct thee rare cunning thou maist make mule shalt thou haue asse mule trauell withall thy businesse whereby thy benefit double returne home house thou maist make mee thy wife againe condition gossip pietro indeed coxecombe beleeued also word true yeelding therefore gladly aduise mouing matter gossip iohn teach wonderfull secret would redound greatly benefit iohn began disswade hauing spoken merriment yet perceiuing contradiction would serue preuaile thus began seeing need haue let v rise morrow morning day trauell vse doe shew done onely must doe confesse difficult thing rest fasten taile thou shalt see gossip pietro wife could hardly take rest night long desirous haue deed done therefore drew towards day vp arose calling gossip iohn came presently shirt chamber said know man world would disclose secret therefore earnestly desire willing doe onely must consent doe whatsoeuer say desirous haue done faithfully promised performe whereupon iohn deliuering lighted candle gossip pietro hold hand said marke well doe remember word say carefull whatsoeuer thou hearest seest thou doe speake one word enchantment vtterly ouerthrowne onely wish taile may well set therein consisteth cunning gossip pietro holding candle woman prepared iohn appointed bowed selfe forwardes hand set ground euen stood vpon foure feere first hand touched head face saying heere goodly head mule handling disheueld haire termed goodly mane mule afterwardes touching body armes leg feete gaue apt name part belonging mule nothing else remaining onely forming taile pietro perceiued iohn preparing fasten hauing way misliked former proceeding called saying forbeare gossippe iohn mule shal haue taile contented haue without taile gossip pietro answered iohn hast thou done thou hast mard vnaduised speaking euen worke almost fully finished matter gossip answered pietro like mule better without taile see set manner fond yong woman couetously addicted gayne commodity looking knauish intention gossip iohn began grow greatly offended beast thou art quoth husband hast thou ouerthrowne thine good fortune mine diddest thou euer see mule without taile wouldst thou haue made monster thou art wretchedly poore might haue bin enriched euer secret knowne none selues thou art asse hast defeated made thy friend become thine enemy gossippe iohn began pacifie woman solemne protestation still continuing friendship albeit afterwards desiring mulemaking gossip pietro fel former trading onely asse lesse himselfe hee went gossip iohn faires apuglia neyther euer request haue like peece seruice done although much laughing nouell lady vnderstanding better dioneus intended haue done yet himselfe scarsely smiled nouels ended sunne beginning loose heate queene also knowing full period gouernment come dispossessing herselfe crowne shee placed head pamphilus last honoured dignity wherefore gracious smile thus spake sir meane charge vndergo making amends perhaps fault committed selfe rest haue gone authority may proue prosperous vnto willing create king pamphilus hauing receiued honor chearfull mind thus answered madam sacred vertues beside remaining subiects doubt worke effectually rest haue done shall deserue generall good opinion hauing giuen order master houshold predecessor formerly done euery necessary occasion turned lady expected gracious fauour said bright beauty discretion late soueraigne queene regard ease recreation vnto tyred spirit grant free liberty discoursing whatsoeuer selues best pleased wherefore hauing enioyed time rest opinion best returne wonted law respect would haue euery one speake manner morrow namely men woman haue done thing bountifully magnificently either matter amity otherwise relation worthy argument doubtlesse giue addition best desire free forward inclination good action whereby liues short soeuer bee may perpetuate euerliuing renowne fame mortall body conuerted dust otherwise better bruite beast reason onely distinguishing difference liue perish vtterly respire reigne eternity theame exceedingly pleasing whole company risen permission new king euery one fel wonted recreation best agreed owne disposition vntill houre supper came wherein serued sumptuously risen table began dance among many sweet sonnet enterlaced delicate tune moued admiration king commanded madam neiphila sing song name selfe stood best affected immediatly cleare rare voice thus began song chorus sung companie spring season maides haue best reason dance sing chaplet flower decke vp bower honour spring heard nimph sate alone fountaines side much hard fortune bemone still cride ah pitty distresse findes foe like ficklenesse truth liues men poore soule liue spring season c oh mighty loue permit faithlesse deed iustice punish treason meed vndone periury although loued constantly truth liues men poore soule liue spring season c follow dyans traine loyall maide neuer felt oppressing paine dismaide listened loues alluring wandred assuring truth liues men poore soule liue spring season c adiew former ioyes liued case welcome sad annoies displease let none pitty distresse fell ficklenesse truth liues men ala liue spring season maides haue best reason dance sing chaplet flower decke vp bower honour spring song sweetly sung madame neiphila especially commended king rest lady fully finished king gaue order euerie one repaire chamber great part night already spent end ninth day tenth last day whereon vnder gouernment pamphilus seuerall argument concerne person either way liberality magnificent manner performed worthy action loue fauour friendship honourable occasion induction already began certaine small cloud west blush vermillion tincture east hauing reached full heighth looked like bright burnished gold splendour sun beames drawing neere vnto pamphilus risen caused lady rest honourable companion called assembled concluded together place whither walke morning recreation king ledde way accompanied two noble lady philomena fiammetta rest following deuising talking answering diuers demand day also concerning proposed imposition walked indifferent space time found rayes sunne ouerpiercing returned backe againe pallace fearing haue blood immoderately heated rinsing glass coole cleare running current tooke morning draught walked milde shade garden vntill bee summoned dinner sooner ouerpast slept returned waking mette together againe wonted place according king appointed gaue command vnto madame neiphila shee day begin first nouell humbly accepting thus began florentine knight named signior rogiero de figiouanni became seruant alphonso king spaine owne opinion seemed sleightly respect reward regard whereof notable experiment king gaue manifest testimony defect onely occasioned knight ill fortune bountifully recompencing afterward first nouell wherin may euidently discerned seruants prince great lord many time recompenced rather good fortune vny regard dutifull seruices doe accept worthy lady mean fauour king hath giuen first place speake honourable argument bounty magnificence precious iewell euen sunne beauty ornament bright glory al heauen bounty magnificence crowne vertues shall recount short nouell sufficiently pleasing mine owne opinion hope much dare rely iudgements profitable worthy remembred know among valiant knight long haue liued city one perhappes great merit one named signior rogiero dfigiouanni rich great courage perceiuing due consideration quality belonging life customes obserued among tuscanes answerable expectation agreed disposition valour determined leaue natiue countrey belong seruice time alfonso king spaine whose fame generally noised place excelling prince time respect men well deseruings bountifull requitall paine prouided honorable order horse armes competent train trauelled spaine worthily entertained signior rogiero continuing liuing honorable maner performing many admirable action arm short time made himselfe sufficiently knowne valiant famous man hauing remained indifferent long obseruing diuers behauiours king saw enclined himselfe first one man another bestowing one castle towne another baronnies diuers somwhat indiscreetly giuing away bountifully men merit restraining fauors seeming close fisted parting nothing took diminishing former reputation great mpayring fame wherefore resolued departure thence made suit king might obtaine king grant bestowing one best mule goodliest euer backt gift highly pleasing rogiero regarde long iourny intended ride deliuerd king gaue charge one gentleman compasse conuenient meanes ride thorow country company signior rogiero yet manner perceiue king purposely sent respectiuely obserue whatsoeuer said concerning king gesture smile behauior shaping answer accordingly nexte morning commaud returne backe king gentleman slacke command noting rogieroes departing forth city mounted horseback likewise aud immediatly came company making beleeue iournied towards italy rogiero rode mule king giuen diuersity speech passing three clocke afternoone gentleman said amisse sir hauing fit opportunitie stable horse till heate little ouerpast taking inne horse stable staled except mule mounted againe riding gentleman duely obserued whatsoeuer rogiero spake comming passage small riuer blooke rest beast dranke mule staled riuer signior rogiero seeing clapping hand mule mane hee said wicked beast art thou thou art iust like thy master gaue thee mee gentleman committed word memory many passing rogiero riding along rest day yet none disparagement king rather highly commendation next morning mounted horseback seeming hold still way tuscane gentleman fulfilled king command causing signior rogiero turne back againe willingly yeelded doe come court king made acquainted word rogiero spake mule called presence king shewed gracious countenance demanded compared mule signior rogiero nothing daunted bold constant spirit thus answered sir mad comparison like giue conueniency bestow nothing reason requireth euen mule would stale haue done water much beleeue signior rogiero replyed king haue giuen gift perhaps haue done diuers farre inferiour honour merit happened thorough ignorance knowing valiant knight wellworthy speciall respect rather owne ill fortune would suffer doe whereof guilty truth thereof shall make selfe apparant sir answered rogiero complaine haue receiued gift desiring thereby couetously become richer regard haue yet way acknowledged vertue remaining neuerthelesse allow excuse good reasonable heartely contented behold whatsoeuer please although doe confidently credit without testimony king conducted great hall hee giuen order stood two great chest fast lockt presence lord king thus spake signior rogiero chest mine imperiall crowne scepter royall mound many richest girdle ring plate iewels euen best mine full earth onely chuse one two thou makest election vpon royall word thou shalt enioy hereby shalt thou euidently perceiue hath bin ingreatful deseruings either thine owne bad fortune rogiero seeing king pleasure haue chose one king caused presently opened approuing full earth whereat king smyling said thus vnto see signior rogiero said concerning ill fortune true questionlesse valour desert ought oppose selfe maleuolence know right minded become spaniard giue neither castle dwelling place bestow chest meer despight malicious fortune vniustly tooke away carry home countrey may make apparant testimoney sight wellwillers owne vertuous deseruings bounty signior rogiero humbly receiuing chest thanking maiestie liberall gift returned home ioyfully therewith natiue countrey tuscane ghinotto di tacco tooke lord abbot clugni prisonors cured grieuous disease stomacke afterward set liberty lord abbot hee returned court rome reconciled ghinotto pope boniface made knight lord prior goodly hospitall second nouell wherein declared good men doe sometimes fall bad condition onely occasioned thereto necessity meanes vsed reducing goodnesse againe magnificence royall bounty king alphonso bestowed florentine knight passed whole assembly mean applause king gaue greatest praise al commanded madame eliza take second turne order whereupon thus began faire lady king shewed himselfe magnificently minded expressed liberall bounty man done good honourable seruices termed vertuous deed well done becomming king say heare prelate church shewed himselfe wondrously magnificent one enemy malicious tongue speake ill vndoubtedly answere made action king meerely vertue prelate lesse miracle otherwise greedily couetous woman deadly enemy liberality although euery man naturally desireth reuenge iniuries abuse done vnto yet men church regard dayly preached patience commaund aboue thing else remission sinnes would appeare mighty blemish froward furious men speake reuerend prelate church also concerning munificent bounty one enemy yet became reconciled friend shall perceiue nouell ghinotto di tacco insolent stout robbery became man farre famed banished sienna enemy countes disanta fiore preuailed bold headstrong perswasions towne raticonfani rebelled church rome wherein remaining passenger whatsoeuer trauelling way thereabout robde rifled theeuing companion time whereof speake boniface eight gouerned pope rome lord abbot clugni accounted one richest prelate world came rome either surfeit excesse feeding otherwise stomacke grieuously offended pained phisitians aduised trauell bathe sienna receiue immediate cure respect departure licenced pope set onward thither great pompous cariages horse mule goodly traine without hearing rumour theeuish consort ghinotto di tacco aduertised comming spred scout nettes without missing much one page shut vp abbot traine baggage place narrow restraint could meanes escape done sent one sufficient attendant well accompanyed lord abbot said master name lordship pleased hee might come visite ghinotto castle abbot hearing answered chollerickly would come thither hee nothing say ghinotto meant proceed iourny would faine see durst presume hinder passe rough word messenger thus mildely answered lord quoth arriued place feare force allcontrolling power heauen clearely exempted pope thunder crack malediction interdiction excommunication whatsoeuer else therefore would bee much better pleased ghinotto aduiseth time interparlunce place suddenly round ingirt strongly armed theeues lord abbot perceiuing follower surprized tooke way though impatiently towards castle likewise company carriage dismounted hee conducted ghinotto appointed alone small chamber castle darke vneasie rest traine euery one according ranck quality well lodged castle horse good thing else deliuered secure keeping without least touch iniury preiudice orderly done ghinotto himselfe went lord abbot said lord ghinotto welcome guest requesteth might pleasure tell whither trauelling vpon occasion lord abbot wise man angry distemper moderately qualified reuealed whither went cause going thither ghinotto heard hee departed courteously began consider himselfe might cure abbot yet without bathe commanding good fire kept continually small chamber good attendance next morning came visite againe bringing faire white napkin arme two slice toast fine manchet goodly cleare glasse full purest whitebastard corniglia indeed abbot owne prouision brought thither hee spoke manner lord ghinotto yonger studyed physicke commanded tell best medicine could euer learne disease stomacke prouided lordship especial preparatiue finde comfortable abbot better stomacke eate desire talke although hee somewhat disdainfully yet hee eate vp toastes roundly dranke glasse bastard afterward diuers speech passed betweene one still aduising phisicall manner seeming care little moued many question concerning ghinotto earnestly requesting see speech sauoured abbot discontentment came passion clouded courteous acceptance least signe mislike ring lordship ghinotto intended shortly see parted time returned till next morning like two toastes bread another glasse white bastard brought first continuing course diuers dayes till abbot eaten hungerly pretty store dryed beanes ghinotto purposely yet secretly hidden chamber wherevpon demaunded seeming enioyned pretended master temper found stomacke finde stomacke well enough answered lord abbot could get forth thy master finger haue good food feed medicine haue made soundly stomackt ready starue hunger ghinotto gone hee prepared faire chamber adorning abbot owne rich hanging also plate moueables alwayes vsed seruice costly dinner prouided likewise whereto inuited diuers towne many abbot chiefest follower going againe next morning said lord seeing doe feele stomacke well time come forth infirmary taking hand brought prepared chamber left owne people went giue order dinner seruing might performed magnificent manner lord abbot recreated himselfe owne people recounted course life since hee saw likewise told kindly bin initeated ghinotto dinner time come lord abbot company serued costly viand excellent wine without ghinottoes making himselfe knowne abbot till beene entertained dayes order great hall castle ghinotto caused abbot good furniture bee brought likewise spacious court wheron windowes said court gazed mule horse sumpter euen silliest done ghinotto went abbot demaunded felt stomacke whether would serue venter horse backe yet lord abbot answered found stomacke perfectly recouered body strong enough endure trauell thing well hee deliuered ghinotto hereupon brought hall furniture also people commanding window opned wherat might behold horse said lord let plainely giue vnderstand neither cowardise basenesse minde induced ghinotto di tacco selfe become lurking robber highwayes enemy pope consequently romane court onely saue owne life honour knowing himselfe gentleman cast owne house hauing beside infinite enemy seeme worthy lord although haue cured stomacks disease deale doe others whose good fall power take part please bet rather well contented necessity considered selfe spare proportion thing haue heere answerable owne liking present hall court beneath free spoyle least impairing wherefore giue part take please depart hence abide heere still owne free liberty lord abbot wondred little robber high wayes haue bold liberall spirit appeared pleasing instantly former hatred spleene ghinotto became conuerted cordiall loue kindnes imbracing armes said protest vpon vow made religion win loue man plainely perceiue thee would vndergo far greater iniuries haue receiued thy hand accursed cruell destiny forced thee base kind life blesse thee fairer fortune thus spoken left greater part good returned backe againe rome horse meaner traine durig passed accident pope receiued intelligence lord abbot surprizall little displeasing saw returned demaunded benefit receiued bathe whereto abbot merrily smyling thus replyed holy father met skilfull physitian neerer hand whose experience beyond power bathe perfectly cured discoursed large pope laughing heartely abbot continuing still report moued high magnificent courage demaunded one gracious fauour pope imagining would request matter greater moment freely offered grant whatsoeuer desired holy father answered lord abbot humble suit make would pleased receiue grace fauor ghinotto di tacco physitian among vertuous men deseruing haue especial account made neuer met wih equall honour honesty whatsoeuer iniury impute greater infortune way deserueth charged withall wretched condition pleased alter bestow better meanes maintenance liue like worthy man lesse make doubt short time hee appeare pleasing holinesse best iudgement thinke pope magnanimious spirit one highly affected men vertue hearing commendable motion made abbot returned answere willing grant desired sending letter safe conduct comming thither ghinotto receiuing assurance court rome came thither immediatly great ioy lord abbot pope finding man valor worth vpon reconciliation remitted former error creating knight lord prior chiefest hospitall rome office liued long time loyall seruant church honest thankefull friend lord abbot clugny mithridanes enuying life liberality nathan trauelling thither setled resolution kill chaunceth conferre nathan vnknowne instructed vvhat manner might best performe bloody deede according hee gaue direction hee meeteth small thicket woode knowing man taught take away life confounded shame hee acknowledgeth horrible intention becommeth loyall friend third nouell shewing excellent liuely demonstration especiall honourable vertue perseuering dwelling truly noble soule cannot violenced confounded politicke attemptes malice enuy appeared whole assembly heard matter meruaile lord abbot performe magnificent action admiration ceasing silence king commanded philostratus follow next forthwith thus began honourable lady bounty magnificense alphonso king spaine great indeede done lord abbot clugny thing perhaps neuer heard seeme lesse meruailous heare one man expression great liberality another man earnestly desired kill bee secretly disposed giue life bin lost would haue taken purpose acquaint withall short nouell certaine least faith may bee giuen report certaine genewayes men resorting remote part country cathaya liued somtime gentleman rich beyond comparison named nathan hauing liuing adioyning great common rodeway whereby men trauayled east west like west vnto east hauing mean passage bountifull chearfull disposition willing make knowen experience summoned together many master mason carpenter erected short time one greatest goodliest beautifull house manner prince pallace euer seene quarter mouables kinde furnishment befitting house outward apparance hee caused plentifully stored onely receiue entertaine honor gentleman trauailers whatsoener occasion passe way vnprouided also number seruants might continuallie giue attendance commers goer two fifty seuerall gate standing alway wide open ouer great golden carracters written welcome welcome gaue free admission commers whatsoeuer honourable order obserued estated custom perseuered long onely east part also west euery acquainted fame renown already well stept yeares yet wearie therefore great charge liberality fortuned rumor noble hospitality came eare another gallant gentleman named mithridanes liuing countrey farre gentleman knowing lesse wealthy nathan enuiously repining vertue liberality determined mind dim obscure others bright splendor making himselfe farre famous hauing built palace answerable nathans like winding gate welcom inscription beganne extend immeasurable courtesy vnto dispoted visite short hee grew famous infinite place chanced day mithridanes sate alone within goodly court pallace poore woman entred one gate crauing almes returned againe second gate comming also second almes continuing sostill dozen time thirteenth returning mithridanes saide good woman goe come often still serued vvith almes old woman heard word said liberality nathan honourable wonderfull haue past two thirty gate palace euen euery one receyued almes without knowledgement taken either follower heere haue past thirteene gate acknowledged taken farewell house neuer meane visit word shee departed thence neuer came thither againe mithridanes pondered speech hee waxed much discontented taking word olde woman extoll renowne nathan darken ecclipse glorie whereupon said himselfe wretched man shall attaine height liberality performe wonder nathan doth seeking surmount cannot come neere meanest vndoubtedly spend endeauour vaine except rid world seeing age make end must need hand furious bloody determination without reuealing intent one mounted horsebacke attendant company three dayes iourney arriued nathan dwelt gaue order men make shew beeing seruants way acknowledge prouide selues conuenient lodging vntill heard tydings euening manner alone himselfe neere palace nathan met solitarily walking pompous apparrell whereby bee distinguished meaner man knew neyther heard relation description demanded knew nathan nathan chearfull countenance thus replyed faire syr man part knoweth better shew nathan therefore pleased bring mithridanes said therein great kindnesse albeit possible would bee neyther knowne seene nathan quoth also sufficiently seeing haue goe along dismounting horse walked nathan diuersly discoursing vntill came pallace one seruants taking mithridanes horse nathan rounded fellow care giue warning throughout house reuealing gentleman nathan accordingly performed sooner within pallace conducted mithridanes goodly chamber wher none yet seene appointed attend reuerently yea himselfe greatly honor loth leaue company thus mithridanes conuersed desired know albeit respected much yeares introth sir answered nathan one meanest seruants nathan childhood haue made selfe thus olde seruice yet neuer hath bestowed aduancement mee see respect howsoeuer men may commend yet haue reason word gaue hope mithridanes little counsell might securely put execution wicked determination nathan likewise demaunded humble manner whence also businesse inuiting thither offering vtmost aide counsell soeuer consisted power mithridanes sat indifferent meditating thoghts would returne answer last concluding repose confidence regard pretended discontentmet many circumstantial perswasions first fidelity next constancie lastly counsell assistance declared truly cause comming thither reason vrging thereto nathan hearing word detestable deliberation mithridanes became quite changed yet wisely making outward appearance thereof bold courage setled countenance thus replyed mithridanes thy father noble gentleman vertuous quality inferiour none see thou desirest degenerate hauing vndertaken bold high enterprise meane liberall bountifull men greatly commend enuy thou bearest vertue nathan many men world wretched miserable would become good conformable determination thou hast disclosed mee haue sealed vp secretly soule wherein better giue thee counsell especiall helpe furtherance course would haue thee obserue followeth thus word window looke forth sheweth thee smal wood thicket tree litle quarter mile distance hence whereto nathan vsually walketh euery morning continueth time long enough maist thou easily meet whatsoeuer thou intendest thou kilst thou maist safety returne home vnto thine owne abiding take way guided thee thither another lying left hand directing speedily wood much haunted rather free resort surest visiting thine owne countrey dismall deed done mithridanes receyued instruction nathan departed hee secretly gaue intelligence men likewise lodged welcom stranger house place stay next morning night passed ouer nathan risen heart altred iot counsel giuen mithridanes much lesse changed anie part thereof alone himselfe walked wood place appointed death mithridanes also risen taking bow sword weapon none mounted horsbacke came wood somewhat farre hee espyed nathan walking creature dismounting horse resolued would kill onely see also heare speake stepping roughly taking hold bonnet head face turned sayde old man thou must dye whereunto nathan made answer thus belike haue deserued mithridanes heard speake looked aduisedly face knew immediatly man entertained louingly conuersed familiarly counselled faithfully ouercomming former fury harsh nature became meerly confounded shame throwing downe drawne sword held readily prepared deede prostrated himselfe nathans foot teares spake manner manifestly know louing father admired bounty liberalitie considering industrious prouidence made meanes comming hither prodigally bestow life haue right vnto although willing part high supreame power carefull dutie selfe euen instant needfull opened eye better vnderstanding infernall enuy closed vp therefore looke much haue bin forward pleasure much shame punishment confesse heinous transgression hath iustly deserued take therefore please reuenge thinke iustice answerable sin nathan louingly raised mithridanes ground kissing cheeke tenderly embracing said sonne thou needest aske much lesse obtaine pardon enterprise thine thou canst yet terme good bad thou soughtest bereaue life hatred thou barest onely couering reputed woorthier man take assurance beleeue constantly man liuing loue honour thee considering greatnesse thy minde consisteth heaping vp money wretched miserable worldling make onely felicity contending bounty spend thine didst hold shame kil thereby make thy selfe much worthily famous matter wondred regard emperor greatest king hadde neuer made extendure dominion consequently renowne art killing yet one man onely thou wouldst haue done infinite number burning whole country making desolate huge townes city onely enlarge dominion spreading fame wherfore increasing thine owne renowne thou wast desirous death matter nouelty therefore deseruing lesse meruaile seeing men slaine daily one purpose mithridanes excusing maleuolent deliberation rather commending honest defence nathan made behalfe proceeded farre discoursing tel plainely wondrously amaze durst come fatall appointed place himselfe hauing exactly plotted contriued owne death whereunto nathan returned aunswere would haue thee mithridanes wonder counsel determination since age hath made mee maister mine owne resolued doe wherein thou hast begun follow neuer came man mee content could thing demanded thy fortune come life saw thee desirous haue resolued immediately bestow thee much rather thou shouldst onely man euer departed hence without enioying whatsoeuer hee demanded end thou mightst assuredly haue gaue thee aduice least enioying mine thou shouldest chance loose thine owne haue vse full fourescore yeares consummation delight pleasure well know according course nature fare men generally thing else cannot bee long must leaue mee wherefore hold much better giue away freely haue alwayes done good treasure bee curious keeping suffer taken whether nature small gift time make vp full summe hundred yeares miserable stand beholding foure fiue vexation take intreate thee thou wilt haue neuer met man thy selfe desire perhaps shall finde request longer keepe worse wil esteemed grow contemptible take pray thee mithridanes exceedingly confounded shame bashfully sayde fortune forefend take away thing precious life haue vile thought lately rather would diminish one day thereof could wish time might amply enlarge forthwith aunswered nathan saying wouldst thou thou couldst shorten thine owne dayes onely lengthen mine thou wouldest haue thee yet neuer vnto man namely robbe thee enrich selfe enstruct thee much better course thou wilt aduised mee lusty young thou art thou shalt dwell heere house called name nathan aged spent yeares thou seest goe liue thy house bee called name mithridanes name place shall illustrate thy glorie liue contentedly without least thought enuie deare father answered mithridanes knew well howe direct mine owne action doe alwayes haue done would gladly accept liberall offer plainlie perceiue best endeauours must remayne darkened bright renowne nathan neuer seeke impayre another cannot mean increase selfe haue worthily taught liue contented owne condition many like louing speech passed according nathan instantly requested mithridanes returned back pallace many dayes highly honored respected comforting counselling perseuer alwayes honourable determination end mithridanes could abide longer necessary occasion called home departed thence men hauing found good experience hee could neuer goe beyond nathan liberality signior gentile de carisendi come modena took gentlewoman named madam catharina forth graue wherin buried dead act regard former honest affection said gentlewoman madame catharina remaining afterward deliuered goodly sonne signior gentile deliuered owne husband named signior nicoluccio caccianimico yong infant fourth nouell wherein shewne true loue hath alwayes bin still occasion many great worthy courtesy iudgment honorable assembly reputed wonderfull man bountifull giue away owne life hatefull enemy respect passed generall affirmation nathan vertue liberallity exceeded alphonso king spain especially abbot clugny euery one deliuered opinion king turning himselfe madame lauretta gaue signe well instructed vnderstanding next order whereto gladly yeelding began manner youthfull lady discourse already past haue worthy magnificent yea reaching height glorious splendour thinkes remaineth matter v yet speake whereby enlarge famous argument manner ought except lay hold action loue wherein neuer want subiect faire spacious field walke wherefore well behalfe one aduancement whereto instant age inclined purpose acquaint generous magnificent act amourous gentleman shall duely considered perhaps appeare equall rest least may passe currant men may giue away treasure forgiue mighty iniuries lay downe life selfe honour renowne farre greater operation signe life appeared remained reputed euen iudgement best phisitians whereof wanted attendance verily dead opinion parent neerest kinred time deliuerance yet farre infant within wanted much perfect creature made lesse mourning next church also vault belonging ancestor gaue buriall speedily tydings comming hearing signior gentile one endeared friend although liued could neuer gracious fauour yet sudden death greatly grieue whereupon discoursed sort himselfe deare madame catharina little sorry thy death although thy lifetime scarcely worthy one kind looke yet dead thou canst prohibite may robbe thee kisse sooner hee spoke word beeing night taking order none might know departure hee mounted horsebacke accompanied onely one seruant stayed till hee came vault lady buried opened instrument conuenient purpose descended downe vault kneeled downe beere whereon lay wearing garment according vsuall manner teares trickling mainly downe cheekes bestowed infinite sweet kiss commonly see men desire neuer contented still presume aduantages especially loue entirely fared gentile minded get gone satisfied oblation kiss would need yet step backe againe saying touch yuory gentile himselfe helping relate whole history grieued lamented afterward gaue hearty thankes humbly requesting regard loue formerly borne house might finde vsage varying honour selfe husband day come find entertainment mine owne sister yet good deed haue night done doth well deserue courteous requitall respect would haue deny one fauour presume craue whereto lady louingly replyed willing grant prouided honest power whereto signior gentile thus answered madame parent kindred friend generally throughout bologna doe verily thinke dead wherefore one make inquisition regard fauour desire abide secretly mother vntill time returne modena shall speedily occasion moue motion aymeth end presence chiefest person city may make gladsome present husband lady knowing selfe highly beholding knight custome meane obserue city haue vouchsafed honour presence poore homely dinner mine welcome persian manner shewing iewell aboue thing else world euer haue respectiuely esteemed doe craue fauourable resolue vpon conditionall promise none remoue place whatsoeuer shall said done vntill haue fully deliuered minde euery one bound himselfe solemne promise perform appointed table voided also carpet laid knight sitting downe lady thus began worthy gentleman lady true faithfull seruant wherof moued question tooke cold street parent kindred friend making account threw forth thing vile vnprofitable neuerthelesse hath care cost haue rescued death griping power meere charitable disposition honest affection caused beare body full terror affrighting haue caused become thus louely see may apparantly withall gentleman quoth varry former opinion especially signior nicoluccio caccianimico lady good right mine man else iust title lay claime sate silent without answering one word expecting intended selfe hath done mine owne mother hauing thus spoken turned lady saying madame discharge promise made deliuering husband franke free giuen lady child armes returned place sate downe againe nicoluccio hitherto haue done wherefore wil giue assurance perform businesse mean enioyne shall speedier heare better answer wil confirme mine oath wonderfully pleased mistresse maquerella heare reply comfortable hope therefore desired lady tel hir wold haue done listen wel answerd madam dianora matter would haue effect without wals city month ianuarie nexte ensuing prouide garden fairely furnished kind fragrant flower flourishing month may yeelde better able accomplish imposition command neuer hereafter solicite either thee whatsoeuer importune afterward hitherto haue concealed secret conspiring husband friend lay dishonest suite open world may receiue punishment accordingly offering wrong gentleman wife signior ansaldo heard demand offer beside thereuppon made although seemed easie matter thing meerly impossible done considered aduisedly made motion end onely bereaue hope euer enioy earnestly hee desired neuerthelesse would giue vtterly ouer would need approue could done lady beheld fruites flower heard many thinges recounted wonderfully growing garden began repent rash promise made yet notwithstanding repentance woman couetous see rarity accompanied diuers lady gentlewoman went see garden hauing commended much admiration returned home againe sorrowfull woman euer liued considering tyed selfe enioying garden excessiue grew griefe affliction could clouded concealed husband tooke notice would need vnderstand occasion thereof long lady regard shame modesty sate without returning answer end constrained disclosd whol history first signior gilberto waxed exceeding angry considered withall pure honest intention wife wisely pacified former distemper saide dianora part wise honest woman lend eare ambassages immodest nature much lesse compound make agreement honesty person vnder condition whatsoeuer perswasions heart listeneth allurement eare haue greater power many imagine nothing vneasie difficult louers iudgement appeareth possible ill didst thou therefore first listen worse afterward contract know purity thy soule wil yeelde disoblige thee thy promise perhaps wise man else would mooued thereto onely feare magitian seeing signior ansaldo displeased thou makest mockage violent wrong v shal neuer able recouer wherefore would haue thee go signior ansaldo thou canst meanes obtaine safekeeping thy honour ful discharge thy promise shal eternall fame thee crowne victorious conquest must need otherwise lend thy body onely thy wil action committed constraint wherein way guilty halfe pardonable necessity madame dianora hearing husband word wept exceedingly auouched shee deserued especiall grace therefore would rather dye doe neuerthelesse wil husband haue therefore wil gaue consent next morning breake day dianora arose attiring selfe meanest garment two seruingmen waiting woman following went lodging signior ansaldo hearing madam dianora come visite greatly meruailed risen called magitian saying come go see effect follow vpon thine art come presence without base inordinate appetite humble reuerence embracing honestly taking goodly chamber faire fire readilie prepared causing sit downe sayde vnto followeth madam humbly intreat resolue affection haue long time borne yet stil deserue recompence would pleased tel truly occasion instant comming hither thus attended dianora blushing modest shame teares trickling mainly faire cheekes thus answered signior ansaldo loue beare care faithfull promise made onely command husband respecting paynes trauels inordinate loue owne reputation honor mine hath caused come hither vertue command ready onely fulfill pleasure far consent selfe signior ansaldo abashed first hee began confounded admiration heard lady speake strange manner much moued liberall command husband began alter inflamed heate honourable respect compassion returning answer noble lady god forbid haue sayd villainlike soile honour take vnvsuall compassion vnchaste appetite therefore may remaine heere long please condition mine owne naturall borne sister likewise may depart freely conditionally behalfe render thankes husband thinke conuenient great bounty towards accounting euer heereafter loyall brother faithfull seruant dianora hauing well obserued answer heart ready mount mouth vvith ioy said world could neuer make mee beleeue considering honourable minde honesty would happen otherwise hath expecting bee bountifully rewarded surely matter beyond capacity king permitted disputation long looking madam fiammetta commanded report nouel make end controuersie without delaying thus began alwaies noble lady hold fit decent assembly euery one ought speake succinctly plainly obscure vnderstanding concerning matter spoken haue cause disputation dispute much better become colledges schollers among v hardly manage distaues sampler therefore doe intend relate something peraduenture might appeare doubtfull forbeare seeing difference hath bin spoken alreadie vse difficult discourse speake one man meane ranke quality valiant vertuous king without impeach blemish honor make doubt haue often heard report king charls aged first name reason magnificent enterprise also glorious victory obtaind king manfred ghibellines expulsed foorth florence guelphes returned thither againe occasion ancient knight named signior neri degli vberti forsaking city family great store wealth woulde liue vnder obedience awful power command king charles coueting solitary place might finish remainder dayes peace went castello da mare bow shoote distance dwelling house hee bought parcel ground plentifully stored variety tree bearing oliues chesnuts orenges lemon pomcitrons excellent frutages wherewith countrey flourisheth abundantly built faire commodious house planted close pleasant garden middst whereof great plenty water according men vse like case wel prouided made goodly pond forthwith kinde fish swimming daily care endeuour tend garden encrease fishpond fortuned king charles summer time pleasure recreation went repose himselfe certayne dayes castello de mare hauing heard report beautie singularitie signiour neries garden hee grew desirous see vnderstoode whome belonged entred consideration himselfe hee ancient knight maintaining contrarie faction wherefore thought fit goe familiar manner trayne attending wherupon sent word wold come visit foure gentleman onely companie meaning sup garden next night ensuing newes welcome signior neri took order costly maner thing bee done entertaining king ioyfully beautifull garden king suruayed house likewise commended beyond comparison table placed pond side washed hand therin sat table commanding count sir guy de montforte one came company sitte downe signior neri side three traine hee commaunded attend seruice signior neri giuen order wanted exquisite viandes excellent wine performed decent manner without least noise disturbance wherein king tooke little delight feeding thus contented manner facying solitude place sodainly entred garden two yong damosel aged fifteene yeares haire resembling wyars gold curiously curled hauing chaplet made like prouinciall crownes heades delicate face expressing rather angel mortall creature appearance admired beauty vndergarments costly silke yet white finest snow framed girdle vpward close body spreading largely downward like extendure pauillion descending foot first came sight caried shoulder couple fishing netts held fast lefthand right carryed long staffe following left shoulder fryingpan vnder arme small faggot woodde treuit hand hand pot oyle also brand fire flaming sooner king behold greatly wondered without vttering one word attended listen wold say yong damosel come king modest bashfull gesture performed humble reuerence going place entrance pond held treuit set downe ground thing also taking staffe damosell carried went pond water whereof reached high bosomes one seruants signior neri presently kindled fire setting treuit ouer putting oyle fryingpanne held vppon treuit awaiting vntill damosel cast vppe fish one beate place staffe assured fish resort hadde lodged net conueniently quickly caught great store fish king high contentment obserued behauiour respectiuely fish throwne vp seruant aliue tooke best fairest brought table skipt mounted king count guy de montfort father leaping table pond againe others king pleasing humour voluntarily threw backe damosel iesting sporting manner till seruant drest diuers exquisite order serued table according signior neri ordained damosel saw fish seruice performed perceiued fished sufficiently came forth water garment wet hanging close euen hid part body hauing taken thing againe first brought saluting king like humility returned home mansion house king count likewise also attending gentleman hauing duely considered behauior damosel commended extraordinarily beauty faire feature perfection nature gloriously shining beyond rest king boundlesse praise giuen hauing obserued going water equall carriage comming forth gracious demeanor departing yet neither knowing whence felt affection violently flamed grew amourous desire knowing pleased choisely resembled one another thing dwelt long enough vpon thought turned selfe signior neri demanded damosel sir answered neri daughter brought world one birth twinnes one named geneuera faire isotta amiable king began againe commend gaue aduise get married wherein excused himselfe alleadging wanted power doe time instant seruice remaining brought table except fruit cheese two damosel returned againe attyred goodly roabes carnation sattin formed turkish fashion carrying two fayre siluer dish hand filled diuers delicate fruies season afforded setting table king done retyred little backeward sweet melodious voyces sung ditty beginning manner loue presumeth place let one sing loues disgrace sweet pleasing seemed song king tooke small delight heare behold damosel euen hirarchies angel descended heauens sing sooner song ended humbly knee craued fauour king departing although departure greatly grieuing yet outward appearance seemed willing grant supper concluded king company remounted horsebacke thankefully departing signior neri king returned lodging concealing closely affection himselfe whatsoeuer important affaire happened yet could forget beauty gracious behauiour geneuera faire whose sake loued sister likewise became linked vehement maner power think thing else pretending vrgent occasion fell great familiarity signior neri visiting often goodly garden onely see faire daughter geneuera adamant drew thither felt amourous assault exceed power longer sufferance resolued determinately himselfe vnprouided better meanes take away father onely sister also discouering loue intent count guy de montforte worthy vertuous lord meet counseller king deliuered mind manner gracious lord wonder little speech much greater admiratio el subiect like regard haue knowne time infancy euen instant houre alwayes carriage bee one could neuer perceiue youthfull dayes loue haue greatest meanes assaile oppressing passion nouell strange heare said old called aged growne amorous surely seemeth miracle appertained reprehend case know well enough could say considering haue yet armour backe kiugdome newly conquered among nation knowne full falsehood breach treason meane motiues care needfull respect hauing wone little leisure rest selfe serious affaire giue way idle suggestion loue beleeue sir act becomming magnanimious king rather giddy folly young braine moreouer say mislike intend take two virgines knight hath giuen entertainment house beyond ability testifie much honoured suffered haue sight meerely almost naked manner witnessing thereby constant faith reposed beleeuing verily iust king rauenous woolfe haue soone forgot rape violent action done king manfred harmelesse lady made onely way entrance kingdome treason euer committed worthy eternall punishment take away hath highly honoured chiefest hope consolation said men doe peraduenture thinke sufficient excuse say regard hee ghihelline imagine iustice king get possession manner whatsoeuer ought vse sort let tell sir worthy victory conquer king manfred farre famous victory man con uer himselfe therfore ordained correct vice men learne first subdue selfe brideling inordinate appetite set foule blemish faire fame honour preserue spotlesse word pierced heart king deepely much afflicted knew true wherefore ventred vehement sigh thus replyed beleeue noble count enemy strong soeuer hold weake easie vanquished skilfull warre man may learne conquere owne appetite shall find laborious taske requiring inestimable strength courage word haue toucht quicke becommeth let effectually perceiue within compasse dayes haue learned conquer others ignorant expressing like power vpon selfe hauing thus spoken within dayes king returned naples determined well free like ensuing follie also recompence signior neri great kindnesse shewne although difficult thing let another enioy rather desired himselfe haue two damosel married daughter signior neri euen owne consent father gaue geneuera faire signior maffeo da palizzi isotta amiable signior gulielmo della magna two noble knight honourable baron thus giuen marriage sad mourning departed thence apuglia following worthy honourable action well ouercame subiects yet ought deny reiect thing shall make forgetfull himselfe true honour madame fiammetta come end nouell great magnificence king charles much commended howbeit company affecting ghibelline faction otherwise minded madame pampinea order giuen king began manner man good vnderstanding honourable lady maintaine haue said victorious charles except cannot wish well memory hath instantly king runne tilt seemed goodly person eye neuer satisfied beholding grew enamoured fell extremity affection towards feastiuall ended dwelling house father impossible thinke thing else onely loue fixed person height tormented case knowledge owne condition meane humble degree whereby confessed could hope successefull issue proud loue neuerthelesse would refraine affecting king taking note kindnesse perceiuable meanes must need regardles procured wary obseruation affliction greater intollerable whereon came passe earnest loue encreasing one melancholly conceit taking hold another faire maide could beare burden griefe longer fell languishing sickenesse consuming away daily euident appearance euen snow melteth warme beames sunne father mother much dismayed displeased haplesse accident applying continuall comfort phisicke best skill remayning phisitions sought possible meanes wayes giue succour proued effect regard choyce could sort none desper ate end desirous liue longer fortuned parent offering whatsoeuer remained power performe sudden apprehension entred minde wit might possible done dyed would first haue king know manner stood affected wherefore one day entreated father gentleman named manutio de arezza might permitted come see manutio time held excellent musitian voyce singing exquisite skill playing instrument highly fauour king piero made almost daily vse heare sing play tender louing father conceiued immediately shee desirous heare playing singing comfortable body languishing sickenesse whereupon sent presently gentleman came accordingly comforted lisana kind courteous speech played dexteriously lute purposely hee brought likewise sung diuers excellent ditty insted intended consolation maid nothing else encrease fire flame afterward requested haue conference manutio alone euery one gone forth chamber spake vnto manner manutio haue made choyce thee faithfull guardian especial secret hoping first al thou wilt neuer reueale liuing body onely shall bid thee n xt helpe much possibly thou canst onely hope relyeth thee know dearest friend manutio solemne festiuall day soueraigne lord king honoured exaltation noble exercise tilt turney braue behauiour kindled sparke soule since brake forth violent flame brought weake condition thou seest knowing confessing farre vnbeseeming loue aime ambitiously king vnable controule least manner diminish haue made choyce onely best remedy namely dye willing doe true shall trauaile latest iourney endlesse torment affliction soule except haue vnderstanding thereof knowing giue intelligence oft conuenient order thee doe therefore commit last office friend thy trust desiring thee refuse performance thereof thou hast done let vnderstand saith may dye contentedly disburdened heauy oppression onely comfort parting spirit ceased teares flowing forth abundantly manutio little wonder maides great spirit desperate resolution moued exceeding commiseration suddenly conceiued honectly might discharge duty whereupon returned answer lisana engage faith thee thou shalt find firme constant die rather deceiue thee greatly doe commend thy high attempt fixing thy affection potent king wherein offer thee vtmost assistance make doubt thou wouldest good comfort deale sort three dayes fully past bring newes content thee loath loose least time goe presently lisana yong maiden againe entreated care diligence promising comfort selfe well could commending good fortune manutio gone hee went gentleman named mico de sienna one best poet composing verse part yeelded like request mico made ensuing dittie song sung hearing king piero behalfe louesicke lisana goe loue tell torment endure say soueraigne lord must die except come comfort procure tell may feele heaued hand great loue call thee goe see soueraigne doth abide say extremity thou hast firm affection tryed die sole desire liue may spire haue fortune thereby dignified onely sight would lend life grant great loue mine anguish beguile goe loue tell torment c since first houre loue enthralled neuer heart tell griefe thought speake thought alwayes free yet hopefull thought doe find poore reliefe gnat mount eagle ayre ala scorne full well know bred prey base low aloft look make flight faire yet sight would lend life grant great loue mine anguish beguile goe loue tell torment c sight shall denyed tell plaine high triumphall day procurd death launce honour hath slaine instantly bereaue breath speake could durst bold make ayre acquainted woe ala lookt high iustly deserue death controld yet mercy sight would lend life grant great loue mine anguish beguile goe loue tell torment endure say soueraigne lord must die except come comfort procure tell may feele line contained ditty manutio fitted noates moouing singularly musicall euery word sensible motion life king yet risen table commanded vse lute voyce seemed happy opportunity manutio sing dittie purposely done deuised hee deliuered excellent manner voice instrument concording extraordinary pleasing person presence seemed rather statue liuing men strangely wrapt admiration king himselfe farre beyond rest transported rare kinde alteration manutio ended song king demanded whence song came neuer heard gracious lord answered manutio must needes seeme straunge maiesty fully three dayes since inuented made set note king asked concerned sir quoth manutio dare disclose onely selfe answer made king much desirous risen table tooke bedchamber manutio related large according trust reposed wherwith king wonderfully well pleased greatly commending courage maide said virgin valiant spirit well deserue haue case commiserated commanded also goe sent comfort promise day euening would faile come see manutio contented carry glad tydings lisana without staying place taking lute also went apothecary house speaking alone maide told done afterward sung song excellent manner done wherein lisana conceiued ioy contentment euen moment obserued apparant signes violence fit forsooke health began get vpper hand without suffering one house know least meanes suspect comforted selfe till euening expectation soueraignes arriuall piero prince liberall benigne nature hauing afterward diuers time considered matter manutio reuealed knowing also yong maiden bee beautifull vertuous much moued pitty extremitie mounting horse backe euening seeming rode marryed gracious lord answered bernardo yet shee marryed neither likely bee regard shee hath long tedious sickenesse since dinner time indifferently eased former violent paine could discerne like alteration long king vnderstood immediately reason sudden alteration said good faith bernardo world would sustaine great maine imperfection losse thy faire daughter wherefore goe selfe person visite
