hand loued aboue thing else world although bashfull blush mounted vp cheekes yet heart seazed rapture pleasure thought selfe translated paradise well could thus replyed great king opposing feeble strength burden ouerponderous weight became occasion grieuous sickenesse hope violence thereof almost already kild onely soueraigne mercy doubtlesse cause speedy deliuerance king best vnderstand well palliated answere lisana much commend regard high aduenturing againe greatly condemne fortune making happy birth stayed good giuen many comfortable speech returned backe court humanity king reputed great honour apothecary daughter owne mind receiued much ioy contentment thereby euer wife could haue owne husband assisted better hope within short became recouered farre beautifull common iudgment euer lisana perfect health king consulted queene meete recompence gratifie withall louing affecting feruent manner vpon day determined king mounting horsebacke accompanied many cheefest lord baron rode apothecary house walking beautifull garden hee called bernardo daughter lisana meane space queene also came thither royally attended lady lisana admitted company expressed themselues gracious soone king queene cald lisana king spake manner faire virgin extraordinary loue bare v calleth great honour v respect royall desire one meanes requite kinde loue opinion chiest honour extend sufficient yeares marriage would grace v much accept husband intend bestow beside grant v nowithstanding whatsoeuer else shall call v knight without coueting thing else great fauour one kisse thinke bestow nicely king grant rather begges lisana whose lookes dyed vermillian tincture rather conuerted pure maiden blush reputing king desire owne low humbled voyce thus answered lord certaine beene publikely knowne none highnes might serue fixe loue haue termed foole fooles perhaps beleeuing forgetfull selfe ignorant mine owne condition much lesse god witness know secret heart euen instant loues fire tooke hold yeelding affection knew king selfe daughter poore bernardo apothecary likewise farre vnfitting ambitious loues presuming sure maiestie doth know much better able expresse one becommeth amourous according duty election appetite shapeth course whose lawes strength made many resistance preuailing presumed loue euer shall doe maiestie royall soueraigne must needes confesse soone felt selfe thus wholly conquered louing resolued euer make mine owne therefore onely willing accept husband shall please appoint befitting honor degree haue liue flaming fire obedience shall sacrifice selfe absolute conformity mine owne stile name knight know lawfull king soueraigne ignorant farre vnfitting word vse also kisse request requitall loue two wil neuer giue consent without queenes gracious fauour license first granted neuerthelesse admirable benignity vsed royall selfe vertuous queene heauen shower downe boundlesse grace exceedeth merit ceased speaking dutifull manner answer lisana pleased queene exceedingly finding wise faire king informed instantly called father mother knowing would well pleased whatsoeuer called proper yong gentleman somewhat poore named perdicano putting certaine ring hand refused receiue caused espouse lisana whome king gaue immediately besides chaines iewels inestimable valew deliuered queene bride ceffala calatabelotta two great territory abounding diuers wealthy possession saying perdicano wee giue thee dowry marriage beautifull maid greater gift bestow thee hereafter shal perceiue thy loue kindnesse ended word hee turned lisana saying heere doe freely giue ouer fruit affection towards thanking former loue taking head betweene hand kissed faire forhead vsuall custome time perdicano father mother lisana selfe likewise extraordinarily ioyfull fortunate marriage returned humble hearty thankes king queene many credible author doe affirme king kept promise made lisana long liued alwaies termed himselfe name knight al action chiualry vndertaken neuer carried deuise receiued still diuers like worthy deed onely win heart subiects gaue occasion whole world beside renowne fame succeeding posterity whereto wretched time declaring notwithstanding frownes fortune diuersity occurrence contrary accident happening yet loue frendship ought preciously preserued among men time madam philomena command king madam pampinea bee admired neither deserueth halfe commendation one man doth good another least expected power yet performed respect haue extolled king piero appearing meanly meritorious iudgements make doubt much pleased action equal duly considered shal paralell greatest king wherefore purpose tell nouel concerning honorable curtesie two worthy friend time octauius caesar yet named augustus office called triumueri gouerned romane empire dwelt rome gentleman named publius quintus fuluius man singular vnderstanding hauing one son called titus quintus fuluius towardly yeares apprehension sent athens learne philosophy letter familiar commendation noble athenian gentleman named chremes ancient friend long acquaintance gentleman lodged titus owne house companion son named gisippus studying together vnder tutoring philosopher called aristippus two yong gentleman liuing thus one citty house schoole bred betweene brotherhoode amity could seuered one another accident death could either enioy content together company endued gentle spirit hauing begun study together arose degree glorious height philosophy much admired fame commendation manner liued meane comfort chremes hardly distinguishing one son thus schollers continued space three yeares ending wherof hapneth al thing else chremes died whereat young gentleman conceiued hearty griefe bin common father could kinred chremes discerne two need comfort losse touched equally chanced within month kinred gisippus came ee titus auised marriage yong gentlewoman singular beauty deriued noble house athens named sophronia aged fifteen year mariage drawing neere gisippus day intreated titus walk along thither yet seene comming house sitting midst betweene titus making himselfe considerator beauty especially friend behalfe began obserue iudicially euery part seemed pleasing eie giuing al priuat praise yet answerable due deseruing becam enflamed affection neuer louer could bee violentlie surprized sodainly doth beauty beguile best sens sate indifferent returned home lodging titus alone chamber began bethink himselfe whose perfection powerfully pleased entred consideration fiercer felt desire enflamed vnable quench reasonable perswasions hee vented foorth infinite sighes thus questioned himselfe vnhappie titus thou art whether doost thou transport thine vnderstanding loue hope dooest thou know well honourable fauours thou hast receiued chremes house also intire amity betweene thee gisippus vnto faire sophronia affianced friend thou shouldst holde like reuerent respect shee thy true borne sister darest thou presume fancie whether shall beguiling loue allure thee vaine immaging hope carrie thee open eye thy better vnderstanding acknowledge thy selfe bee miserable man giue way reason bridle thine temperate appetite reforme irregulare desire guide thy fancy place better direction resist thy wanton lasciuio beginning master thy selfe thou hast opportunity thou aimest neyther reasonable honest thou wert assured preuaile vpon pursuite yet thou oughtst auoide thou hast regard true friendship duty therein iustly required wilt thou titus fly inordinate affection thou wilt reputed man sensible iudgement thus discoursed himselfe remembring sophronia conuerting former allegation quite contrarie sense vtter detestation guided idle appetite thus began againe lawes loue greater force whatsoeuer breake band friendship euen also diuine consequence many time hath bin noted father affect daughter brother sister step mother son law matter far monstrous see one friend loue wife another case happening continually moreouer yong youth wholly subiected passion loue reasonable bard fitting pleasing loue honest thing belong men year maturity troubled withall couet none onely wherein loue directer beauty sophronia worthy generall loue yongman loue man liuing iustly reproue shold loue affianced gisippus matter ought loue woma woman created occasion bee loued fortune sinned case directing frends affection rather ought loued perfection challenge gisippus vnderstanding affect may better contented rather like crosse entercourses often mockt himselfe falling contrary againe contrary another kind alteration wasting consuming himselfe day night following many afterward til lost feeding sleepe debility body constrained keepe bed gisippus diuers dayes noted melancholly disposition falling extreamitie sicknesse sorry behold meanes inuentions could deuise vse hee questioned cause straunge alteration essayed euerie way hee might best comfort neuer ceassing demaunde reason become thus sad sickely titus infinite importuning still answered idle friuolous excuse farre truth indeede meane affliction friend able vse contradiction length sighes teares thus replyed gisippus god wel pleased could gladly yeild dye continue longer wretched life considering fortune hath brought mee extremity proofe made constancie vertue finde conquered eternall confusion shame best hope shal shortly requited haue iustice deserued namely death thousand time welcome loathed life remembrance base deiection courage longer conceale thee without blushing shame well contented let thee know began hee recount whole occasion straunge conflict maine battaile hee priuate thought confessing got victory causing die hourely loue sophronia affirming withall due acknowledgement greatly hee transgressed lawes friendship thought penance sufficient onely death willingly expected euery houre heart would gladly bid welcome gisippus hearing discourse seeing titus bitterly wept agony mouing affliction sat indifferent sad pensiue wounded affection sophronia yet wellgouerned temperate manner without long delaying hee concluded himselfe life friend ought accounted much deare loue hee could beare vnto sophronia resolution teares titus forcing eye flow forth like two fountaines thus replyed titus thou hadst neede comfort plainly see thou hast would iustly complaine thee selfe man hath violated friendship keeping thine extreamitie long time concealed mee hath beene ouertedious thee endure although might seeme thee dishonest case therefore kept knowledge thy friend yet plainly tell thee dishonest course league amitie deserue concealment honestest nature leauing impertinent wandrings let v come much greater necessitie thou doest earnestly loue faire sophronia betroathed affianced matter maruaile rather much abashed thou couldst intyrely affect knowing beautifull nobility minde able sustaine passion thing pleasing fullest excellence looke reasonably thou fanciest sophronia vniustly thou complainest thy fortune ordaining wife although thou doest speake expresly opinion thou mightst honesty loue others mine thou art wise haue alwayes held thee tell truely vpon thy faith could fortune better guide thou oughtest thankfull bestowing enioyed although thy loue neuer honest yet would better affect himselfe thee thou canst like manner looke thou doest account thy friend constant euer reason warrant case cannot remember since first entrance friendship euer enioyed thing much thine mine affaire equall course otherwise could subsist must kept manner thing perticularly appertaine thy right therein absolute mine know thou maist esteeme friendship thing concerning selfe plead priuiledge aboue thine true sophronia affianced loue dearely daily expecting nuptials shall celebrated seeing thou doest feruently affect better able iudge perfection remaining excellent creature doe assure thy selfe beleeue constantly shall come bed wife onely thine therefore leaue despairing thought shake cloudy disposition reassume thy former iouiall spirit comfort else content thee expectation happy houre iust requitall thy long louing worthy friendship haue alwayes valued equall mine owne life titus hearing answer gisippus looke much sweet hope desired gaue pleasure much duty reason affronted shame setting eye du consideration greater liberality gisippus farre greater vnreasonable appeared disgrace hee vnmannerly accept wherefore vnable refrain teares strength weaknesse would giue leaue thus replyed gisippus thy bounty firme friendship suffereth see apparantly part ought done god forbid receiue mine haue adiudged thine true respect birth desert thought wife fit doe thou else imagine euer haue beene granted thee vse freely therefore thine owne election gracious fauour wherewith haue blessed thee leaue consume away teares mourning garment appointed man vnworthy happinesse either shall conquer disaster wil crowne else vanquish free paine whereto gisippus presently thus answered worthy titus amity would giue much licence contend selfe pleasing thee thing desire could also induce thee therein directed onely end whereat aime resolued pursue regard let perswasions preuaile thee thereto coniure thee faith friend suffer vse mine authority extendeth mine owne honour thy good haue sophronia bee onely thine know sufficiently farre force loue doe extend power ignorant also twice many time haue brought louers vnfortunate end see thee neere farre gone thou art able turne backe againe yet conquer thine owne teares proceeding extremity thou wilt left vanquished sinking vnder burthen loues tyrannicall oppression turne next follow thee therefore reason loue thee yet thy life deare regard mine owne depending thereon stand neerer thereto obliged cause sophronia must shal thine thou canst find conforme thy fancy albeit easily conuert liking another wife neuer haue like friend againe shall hereby content thee selfe yet perhaps matter easily done expresse liberality therein wiues found like difficultie true faithfull friend able recouer another wife though neuer worthy friend rather chuse change doe say loose giuing thee loose selfe change make good tenne time better preserue thee selfe end therefore prayer perswasions haue power thee earnestly entreat thee freeing thy selfe affliction thou wilt one instant make v truely comforted dispose thy selfe liuing hope embrace happinesse feruent loue thou bearest sophronia hath iustly deserued although titus confounded shame yeeld consent sophronia accepted wife vsed many obstinate resistance yet notwithstanding loue pleading one side powerfully gisippus earnestly perswading thus answered gisippus know say neither behaue selfe election concerning fitting mine contentment pleasing thee thy importunate perswasion seeing thy liberality great surmounteth reason shame yeeld obedience thy noble nature yet let remaine thine assurance doe receiue grace thine man sufficiently vnderstanding enioy thee onely doe affect also doe hold life thee grant greatest god patrones mine vnexpected felicitie honor due respect may hereafter make apparantly knowne highly acknowledge thy wonderfull fauour mercifull could selfe abridging circumstance answered gisippus easier bringing matter full effect hold onely way vnknowne thee much discourse kindred belonging sophronia matrimoniall coniunction fully agreed therefore shall flye say accept thee wife great scandall would arise thereby make much trouble among friend could greatly displeasing way make thine rather stand feare forsake peremptory sort kinred friend bestow vtterly lost without possible meanes recouery preuention therefore sinister accident thinke best thy opinion iumpe mine still pursue busines already haue begun hauing thee alwaies company dearest friend onely associate nuptials performed friend secret manner night cunningly enough contriue thou shalt haue maiden honour bed euen thine owne wife afterward apt time place publiquely make knowne done take well iocond frowne waxe offended deed done ouerlate recalled perforce must rest contented may well imagine aduise little pleasing titus wherupon gisippus receiued home sophronia house publike intention make wife according custome obserued titus perfectly recouered present feast ceremonially obserued night come lady gentlewoman conducted sophronia bridechamber lest husband bed departed away chamber wherein titus vsed lodge ioyned close gisippus easier accesse time whensoeuer pleased gisippus alone bridechamber preparing comming bed extinguishing light went softly titus willing goe bed wife titus hearing ouercome shame feare became repentant denyed goe gisippus true intyre friend indeed confirming word action little lingring dispute sent bride soone bed taking sophronia gently hand softly moued vsuall question namely willing wife beleeuing verily gisippus modestly answered sir haue chosen husband reason requires willing wife word costly ring gisippus vsed daily weare put vpon finger saying ring confesse selfe husband bind euer spouse wife kind marriage obserued dayes continued night neuer suspecting gisippus thus marriage consumated betweene titus sophronia albeit friend either side thought otherwise time publius father titus departed mortall life letter came athens speed returne rome take order occasion concerning wherefore concluded gisippus departure taking sophronia thither easie matter done vntil first known occasion bin caried among wherupon calling one day chamber told entirely past titus confirmed substantially direct passage betweene themselues exceeded possibility denyall moued much admiration looking discontentedly heauily weeping lamenting greatly complaining gisippus wronging vnkindly noyse made house shee went father also mother shee declared whole trecherie much friend wronged gisippus auouching selfe wife titus gisippus supposed newes highly displeasing father sophronia hir kinred also gisippus made great complaint senate dangerous trouble commotion arising daily betweene drawing gisippus sophronia harsh report generally reputed onely worthy bitter reproofe also seuerest punishment neuerthelesse hee maintained publikely done auouching act honour honestie wherewith sophronias friend reason bee offended rather take thankfull part hauing married man farre greater worth respect himselfe could side titus hearing vnciuill acclamation became much moued prouoked knowing custome obserued among greekes much hurried away rumour threatnings lesse finde answered finde shew themselues onely humble enough rather base men courage resolued himselfe braueries longer endured without bold manly answere hauing romane heart also athenian vnderstanding politique perswasions caused kinred gisippus sophronia assembled temple himselfe comming thither accompanied none gisippus onely began deliuer minde manner following oration vttered titus quintus fuluius hearing athenian kinred friend gisippus sophronia many philosopher doe hold opinion action performed mortall men doe proceed disposing ordination immortall god whereupon doe maintaine thing done neuer done proceed necessity howbeit doe hold necessity onely referred thing done opinion considered mature iudgment doe manifestly approue reprehend thing irreuocable doe nothing else shew themselues wiser god beleeue perpetuall reason void error doe dispose gouerne v action respect foolish beastlike thing presumptuously checke controule operation may easily consider likewise iustly deserue condigne punishment suffer themselues transported temerarious manner notorious transgression vnderstand guiltie common fame speake truely concerning marriage selfe sophronia imagined giuen gisippus neuer remember ordained eternitie shee mine wife gisippus instant made manifest full effect kinde speaking concerning diuine prouidence intention god may seeme difficult matter many somewhat hard bee vnderstood content presuppose meddle thing onely stay selfe humane reason nature speech shall enforced doe two thing quite contrary naturall disposition one speake somewhat praise commendation selfe iustly blame condemne men seeming estimation one doe intend swerue iot truth necessitie present case question doth onely require also command must pardon say complaint doe proceed rather furie reason continuall murmuring rather seditious slander backebite condemne gisippus owne free noble disposition hee gaue wife election made wherein account highly praiseworthy reason inducing mee thereunto first hath performed friend ought doe second regard hath dealt wisely haue intention display present sacred law amitie requireth acted one friend towards another shall suffice mee onely informe league friendship farre stronger bond bloud kinred confirmed v election either first true loyall perpetuall friend whereas kinred commeth onely fortune chance therefore gisippus affected life beneuolence ordained friend confesse selfe none ought wonder thereat regard matter meruaile let v come second reason wherein farre greater instance shew hath occasion shewen himselfe much wise haue done plainely appeareth haue feeling diuine prouidence much lesse knowledge effect friendship say foresight councell deliberation gaue sophronia gisippus yong gentleman philosopher gisippus likewise hath giuen yong gentleman philosopher himselfe discretion gaue athenian gift gisippus romaine noble honest man gisippus one noble race lesse honest himselfe iudgement hath bestowed rich young man gisippus hath giuen one farre richer wisedome gaue one onely loued also one desire know gisippus gaue vnto aboue felicitie else yea owne life entirely loued desired proofe haue said true infallible deede deserueth bee much commended let bee duely considered point point young man philosopher gisippus yeares face study without seeking proofe doth sufficiently testifie one selfesame age mine like quality course haue wee liued studied together true hee athenian romaine glory two city bee disputed let mee tell citie francke free hee tributarie citie say citie chiefe lady mistresse whole world hee citie subiect mine statue predecessor annales recorde infinite triumph quintij brought home romane capitole yeares cannot eate glory name liue flourish posteritie modest shame make silent wealth possession minde truely thinkes strange sorrie would haue knoweth doth perhaps may say doe much complain sophronia wife titus manner whereby done made wife secretly theft parent kinred friend called thereto much aduertised thereof gentleman miraculous thing heeretofore hath oftentimes happened therefore noueltie cannot count vnto many haue beene father haue made choice husband haue fled away louers strange country first friend wiues haue sooner made testimonie marriage belly ceremony due matrimonie publication thereof tongue meere necessity constraint hath forced parent yeeld consent hath happened sophronia shew giuen gisippus discreetly honestly orderly others also may say shee married belonged marrie complaint foolish womanish proceeding verie little consideration day fortune make vse nouell inconsiderate meanes whereby bring matter determined effect offend cobler rather scholler hath ended businesse mine either priuate publique end well made well may take order cobler bee indiscreet hee meddle matter mine yet ought courtesie thanke hee like mauner gisippus hath married sophronia well foolish superfluous finde fault manner hee vsed marriage mislike course case beware hereafter yet thanke worse neuerthelesse vnderstand sought fraud deceit onely witte opportunitie whereby way sullie honestie cleere nobilitie bloud person sophronia although secret made wife yet came enemie take perforce like rauisher wronged virginitie blemish noble title despising alliance feruently enflamed bright beauty incited also vnparalleld vertues shaped course knowing well enough tooke ordinarie way wiuing mouing question neuer winne consent fearing lest would take rome conneigh sight iewell much esteemed reason presume vse secret cunning openly made knowne vnto gisippus disposed himselfe thereunto vvhich otherwise hee neuer determined haue done contracting marriage mee shee consenting name moreouer albeit earnestly affected sought procure vnion like louer true husband would immodestly touch till first selfe testifie word becomming wedlocke ring also espoused demanding shee would accept mee husband shee answered mee full consent wherein may seeme shee deceiued way blamed demanding great euill great offence great iniurie committed friend gisippus mee louer sophronia secretly become wife titus quintus fuluius cause like spy watch threaten daily intended teare piece could doe hee giuen man vilest condition villaine slaue vvhat prison fetter torment sufficient fact leauing friuolous matter let v come discourse moment better beseeming attention time come may longer continue heere publius father dead must need returne rome wherefore minded take sophronia thither mee willing acquaint therewith also else haue said otherwise still beene concealed take good part wise rest well contented done considering intention eyther deceiue otherwise wrong could haue basely left made scorne hauing power stay mee heere god neuer permitte couragious romane euer conceiue vile degenerate thought sophronia ordination god force humane lawes laudable consent friend gisippus also powerfull command loue mine perchance imagining selues wiser god men whatsoeuer may thinke ill brutishly beast condemne working two kind would offensiue mee one detaining sophronia mee haue power pleaseth mee bitter threatnings gisippus deare friend duty obliged case vnreasonablie soeuer carrie selues intend time presse rather let mee counsell like friend cease hatred disdaine suffer sophronia deliuered mee may depart contentedly kinsman absent remaine friend assuring whether done shall please displease purpose proceed otherwise take gisippus along mee come rome take sure order fetch hence iustice mine euen meere despight shall feele sound experience powerfull iust indignation wronged romanes titus thus concluded oration arose sterne discontented countenance tooke gisippus hand plainly declaring made small account rest temple shaking head rather menaced wise seemed care tarried gone considering partly reason alleadged titus partly terrified latest speech became induced like well alliance amitie common consent concluded much better accept titus kinsman seeing gisippus made manifest refusall thereof lose kinred one procure hatred wherefore went seeke titus said vnto well contented sophronia bee wife hee deare louing kinsman gisippus remaine much respected friend embracing one another making solemne feast like case necessarilie required departed presently sending sophronia making vertue necessity conuerted loue short time titus effectuall manner formerly shee done gisippus sent away rome receiued welcommed great honour gisippus remaining still athens small regard eyther owne friend long meanes sundry troublesome citizen partiality happening among common people banished athens hee also familie condemned perpetuall exile tempestuous time gisippus become onely wretchedly poore wandred abroad common begger miserable condition trauelled rome try titus would take acknowledgement vnderstanding liuing one respected among romanes great commander senator enquired place hee dwelt going neere house stayed long till titus came home yet daring manifest himselfe speake word regard poore miserable estate stroue haue see end hee might acknowledge call name notwithstanding titus passed without either speech looking gisippus perceiued making full account least would remember regard former courtesy done confounded griefe desperate thought hee departed thence neuer meaning see regard night hauing eaten nothing day prouided one penny buy food wandred knew whether desiring rather die liue hee came last old ruinous part city ouerspred brier bush seldome resorted vnto finding hollow caue vault entred meaning weare away comfortlesse night laying himselfe downe hard ground almost starke naked without warme garment ouerwearied weeping last fell sleepe fortuned two men beene abroad night committing theft robbery together somwhat earlie morning came caue intending share diuide booty difference happening betweene hee stronger person slew went away whole purchase gisippus hauing heard seene manner accident little ioyfull found way death without laying violent hand himselfe life loathsome desire die wherfore would budge place taried long till sergeant officer iustice information deede came thither well attended furiously ledde gisippus thence prison examined concerning bloudy fact plainly confessed hee himselfe committed murder afterward would depart caue purposely stayed apprehension truely toucht compunction foule offence vpon peremptorie confession marcus varro praetor gaue sentence crucified crosse vsuall manner death dayes titus chancing come time praetorium aduisedly beholding face condemned man hee sate vpon bench knew bee gysippus little wondring strange accident pouertie estate occasion bring thither especially questioning life tribunall iustice soule earnestly thirsting possible meanes helpe defend course could taken safetie life accusing himselfe excuse cleare crime hee stept iudgement bench crouding throng barre called praetor manner marcus varro recall thy sentence giuen condemned man sent away hee truely guiltlesse innocent one bloudie blow haue offended god killing wretched man serieants found morning slaine wherefore noble praetor let innocent man bloud shed onely mine haue offended marcus varro stood like man confounded admiration sorrie whole assistant seene heard yet hee could honour desist must need done would performe lawes seuere iniunction sending condemned isippus backe againe presence titus thus spake becamest thou madly incensed without torment inflicted thee confesse offence thee neuer committed art thou wearie thy life thou chargest thy selfe falsly person last night murdered man caue another voluntarily also doth confesse guiltinesse gisippus lifting vp eye perceiuing titus conceiued immediately done onely deliuerance one remembred sufficiently would vngratefull former kindness receiued wherefore teares flowing abundantly cheekes said iudge varro none murdered man wherefore commiserate case noble gentleman titus speakes late safety life titus side said noble praetor man thou seest stranger heere found without weapon fast asleepe dead body thou mayst easily perceiue meerely miserable condition wherein hath made desperate would make mine offence occasion death absolue send crosse none haue deserued die fact varro amazed obserue earnest instance stroue excuse halfe perswaded soule guiltlesse starting vp full intent acquaint yong man stood obserued hard pleading either side crowded barre named publius ambustus fellow lewd life vtterly hope debauched fortune knowne among romaine notorious theefe verily committed murder well knew conscience none guilty crime wherewith wilfully charged himselfe therefore truely toucht remorse stept marcus varro saying honourable praetor mine owne horrid abominable action haue induced thus intrude selfe clearing strict contention betweene two person questionlesse god greater power hath tormented wretched soule compunctually solicited cannot chuse make open confession sinne therefore doe apparantly publish neither men guilty offence wherewith wilfully chargeth himselfe villaine morning murdered man caue one greater honesty selfe seeing poore man lie sleeping diuiding stolne booty betweene v slew companyon would sole possessor noble lord titus reason thus accuse himselfe man base quality let deliuered inflict sentence death octauius caesar tydings brought rare accident commanding al three brought would need vnderstand whole history euery particular happened substantially related whereupon octauius pleased three two noble friendes innocent third openly reuealing truth titus tooke home friend gisippus sharpely reproued distrust respecting nothing onely particular benefit haue banished true amity vtmost confines whole earth sent perpetuall exile loue wealth affinity kindred could haue made gisippus feele euen intyrest part soule feruent compassion teares sighes titus efficacy plainely appeared make consent faire elected spouse dearely esteemed become wife companion onely precious league amity lawes threatnings feares onely correcting abuse iniquity maleuolent course preposterous age could proceed iust cause coplaint end aimeth matter nature commeth memory tel history perhaps may seeme somewhat long altogether resolued make generall voyage ouer sea vnderstood saladine worthy prince soldan babylon concluded himselfe would person goe see preparation christian potentate made warre hee might better prouide himselfe hauing setled thing orderly aegypt busines making outward appearance purposed pilgrimage mecha set onward iourney habited like merchant attended onely two noble wisest baschaes three waiting seruants visited many christian prouinces riding thorow lombardie passe mountaines fortuned iourneying millaine pauia day farre spent night hastened speedily met gentleman named signior thorella distria dwelling pauia men hawkes hound went house seated singular place riuer ticinum signior thorello seeing men making towardes presently imagined gentlestrangers hee desired respect honor wherefore saladine demanding one thorelloes men farre pauia whether might reach thither houre would admit entrance citty thorello would suffer seruant returne answer replyed thus himselfe sir quoth cannot reach pauia night abridge entraunce beseech sir answered saladine fauour v much stranger part tell v may well lodged shal sir said thorello gladly euen instant sir met determined mind send one seruants somewhat neere pauia businesse concerning selfe shall go along conduct place well entertayned stepping best discretion amongst men gaue order bee done sent himselfe making hast farre neerer way caused supper prepared worthy manner table couered garden thing good readinesse sate downe doore attend comming guest seruingman discoursing gentleman diuers occasion guided vnvsuall passage could discerne brought master house soone thorello saw arriued went forth meet assuring hearty welcome saladine man accute vnderstanding well perceiue knight thorello misdoubted going met hee haue inuited therefore would denied entertaining house made choise kinde honourable course caused returne answer gentle sir courtesie one man another deserue condemning may iustly complaine meeting v vpon way haue shortened kindnesse way able deserue wee constrained accept taking bee mirrour courtesie thorello knight ingenious apprehension wel languaged replyed thus gentleman courtesie seeing terme rereceiue regard iustly belonging face sufficiently informe mee matter slender account assuredly pauia could haue lodging deseruing termed good therefore let bee displeasing haue little gone forth common rode way haue entertainment somewhat bettered many trauaylers easily induced hauing thus spoken people house shewed themselues seruiceable manner gentleman taking horse dismounted thorello himselfe conducted three gentleman three seuerall faire chamber costly maner prepared boot pluckt faire napkin manchets lay ready delicate wine refresh wearied spirit much prety conference entercoursed til supper time inuited thence saladine spake latine tongue readily meanes better vnderstoode thorello seemed iudgement bee gracious compleate best spoken gentleman euer met iourney appeared also side signiour thorello guest men great merit worthy much esteeme could vse towards wherefore highly distast friend night keepe company himselfe better prouided entertainment hee intended morrow recompence larger amends dinner heereupon hauing instructed one men hee intended sent pauia farre kept doore shut wife named madam adialetta woman singularly wise noble spirit needing little direction especially knew husband minde walking garden thorello desired vnderstand whence whereto saladine thus answered sir wee cyprian marchants comming cyprus trauailing paris affaire importance trust syr replyed thorello could heartily wish countrey would yeeld gentleman cyprus affordeth marchants falling one discourse vnto another supper serued looke howe best themselues pleased sate table neede make doubt respected honourable order soone table withdrawne thorello knowing might weary brought againe chamber committing good rest himselfe went bed soone seruant sent pauia deliuered message lady like woman ordinary disposition rather truely royall sent thorelloes seruants city make preparation feast indeed lighted torch somewhat late inuited greatest noblest person citie roomes hanged richest ar clothes golde worke veluets silkes rich adornment manner husband commanded answerable owne worthy mind way learne manner entertaine stranger morrow morning gentleman arose mounting horsebacke signior thorello called hawkes hound brought riuer shewed two three faire flight saladine desiring know fayrest hostery pauia thorello answered gentleman wil shew selfe regard haue occasion ride thither beleeuing better contented rode directly vnto pauia arriuing nine clocke thinking guided best inne brought owne house aboue fifty worthiest citizen stood ready welcome gentleman imbracing lighted horsses saladine associate perceiuing guessed indeede saladine sayd beleeue worthy thorello answerable demand much yesternight much could desire deserue wherefore might wel sooner discharged v let v trauaile iourney noble gentleman replyed thorello mine eye seeme lesse courtesie met yesternight thanke fortune straited necessity vrged acceptance poore country house morning shall account selfe much beholding like worthy gentleman answer kindnes kindnes refuse take homely dinner saladine friend conquerd potent perswasions already dismounted horse saw deniall meerly vaine therefore thankfully able report washed seated table dinner serued magnificent sort emperor bin could haue bin sumptuously serued although saladine baschaes noble lord wonted see matter admiration yet could lesse rather exceeded maruaile considering qualitie knight knew bee citizen prince great lord dinner ended diuers familiar conference passing amongst exceeding hot gentleman pauia pleased thorello appoint went repose themselues awhile keeping company three guest brought goodly chamber would faile least scruple courtesie conceale richest iewell sent lady wife yet seene lady extraordinary beauty tall stature sumptuously attired hauing two sweet sonnes resembling angel came waiting graciously saluted guest comming arose hauing receiued hir great reuerence seated midst kindly cherishing two child gracious language past eyther side demanded whence answered kind done husband afterward modest smiling countenance sayd worthy gentleman let weake womanish discretion appeare distastable desiring craue one especiall fauour namely refuse disdaine small gift wherewith purpose present considering first woman according simple faculty able bestow silly gift would pleased respect person giuer quality quantity gift causing brought two goodly gown robe made persian manner one lyned thorough cloth gold costlyest fur fashion citizen marchants vse weare rather beseeming lord greatest account three light vnderwearing cassock mandillions carnatian sattin richly imbroidred gold pearles lined thorow white taffata presenting gift sayd desire gentleman receiue meane trifle see husband weares like beside baschaes halfe astonyed admiration magnificent minde signiour thorello would forget least part courtesie towardes greatly doubted seeing beauty rich garment least discouered thorello neuerthelesse one
