honourably see knight doeth soldane babylon able endure comming one much lesse many wee see preparing make head v beholding refusall acceptation one minde thorello much kinde language bin intercoursed betweene saladine attendant mounted horsebacke signiour thorello number honourable friend number hundred horsse accompanied great distance citie although greeued saladine exceedingly leaue company thorello dearely affected necessity controlleth power lawes whatsoeuer must need diuide yet requesting returne agayne way possibly might granted saladine promised performe well gentleman quoth thorello parting know neither desire whether marchants remember kindnesse heauenly power commend saladine hauing taken leaue thorello returned answer sir may one day hereafter happen shal let see marchandises better confirmation beleefe profession thus parted signior thorello friend saladine company verily determined heighth minde spared life warre expected concluded requite thorello lesse courtesie hee already declared conferring long baschaes beauteous lady forgetting courteous action gracing deserued commendation laborious paine surueyed westerne part tooke shipping returned alexandria sufficiently informed preparation made owne defence signior thorello come backe againe pauia consulted priuat thought many time three trauailers came farre short knowing truth till experience hee became better informed time come christian make passage wonderfull great preparation place performed signiour thorello notwithstanding teares intreaties wife determined one woorthy honourable voyage hauing made prouision ready nothing wanting mounting horsebacke go take shipping wife intirely affected thus hee spake madame goe thou seest famous voyage well mine honour also benefite soule goodes possession commit thy vertuous care certaine returning backe againe regard thousand accident may happen countrey goe vnto desire onely one fauour thee whatsoeuer daunger shall befall mee namely certaine tydings shall brought mee death stay longer thy second marriage one yeare one month one day begin day departing thee lady wept exceedingly thus answered ala sir know carry selfe extremity greefe leaue life surmount fortitude sorrow whatsoeuer shall happen certainty either life death liue dye wife signiour thorello make obsequies memory onely madame replyed husband ouerrash promising thing albeit well assured much consisteth thy strength make question thy performance consider withall deare heart thou art yong woman beautifull great parentage way thereto inferior blessing fortune thy vertues many vniuersally divulged knowen respect make doubt diuers sundrie great lord gentleman least rumor death noysed make suite thee thy parent brother whose violent solicitings wouldst thou neuer resolutely make resistance yet thou canst able defend thy selfe whether thou wilt thou must yeeld please reason would tie thee limited time one day minute longer adalietta sweetly hugging armes melting selfe kiss sighes teares face said well sir much able kinde louing imposition shall bee compelled contrary yet rest thus constantly assured breake charge much thought praying euer heartily heauenly power direct course home againe prefixed date else shall liue continual languishing knitting vp woful parting embracing kissing either infinit time lady tooke ring finger giuing husband said chaunce die see againe remember looke receiuing ring bidding rest friend farewell mounted horsebacke rode away wel attended come vnto geneway company boorded galley dayes arriued acre ioyned themselues christian army wherein happened verie dangerous mortality time sharpe visitation cause vnknowne whence proceeded whether thorough industrie rather good fortune saladine wellneere rest christian escaped death surprized prisoner without blow strucken sundred imprisoned diuers townes citties amongest number prisoner signior thorelloes chaunce one walked bond alexandria vnknowne fearing least discouered constrained thereto meerly necessity hee shewed himselfe condition faulconer wherein excellently experienced mean profession made knowne saladine hee deliuered prison created soldans faulconer thorello soldane called name christian neyther knowing sadly remembred departure pauia deuising practising many time might escape thence could compasse possible meanes wherefore certaine ambassadours beeing sent genewayes redeeme diuers cittizens detained prisoner ready returne home againe purposed write wife liuing wold repaire soone could desiring still continued rememberance limited time close cunning meanes hee wrote letter earnestly intreating one ambassador knew perfectly made outward apparance thereof deale sort letter might deliuered handes abbot di san pietro ni ciel doro indeede vnckle thorello remayned faulconers condition fortuned vppon day saladine conuersing hawkes thorello chanced smile vsed kinde gesture motion lippes saladine house pauia heedfully obserued note instantly remembred signior thorello began eye respectiuely perswading himselfe man therefore falling former kinde discoursing tell mee christian quoth saladine countryman art thou west sir answered signiour thorello country lombard borne citty called pauia poore man poore condition soone saladine heard word becomming assured doubted saide within himselfe god haue giuen time wherein may make knowne man thankefully accepted kinde courtesie cannot easily forget without saying thing else causing guardrobe set open tooke thither sayde christian obserue well garment quicken thy remembrance telling mee truly whether thou hast seene signiour thorello looked aduisedly espyed two especiall garment wife giuen one strange merchant yet durst credit possibly could neuerthelesse said sir doe know true two doe resemble two robe wont weare selfe like giuen three merchant happened visite poore house could saladine containe longer embracing ioyfully armes said signior thorello distria one three merchant wife gaue roabes time come giue credible intelligence merchandise promised departing time told would come length thorello glad bashfull together glad entertained guest bashfully ashamed welcome exceeded bountifull manner thorello replyed saladine seeing god haue sent happily account selfe soly lord priuate man able expresse counterchanges courtesie saladine commanding cloathed royall garment brought presence greatest lord hauing spoken liberally due commendation commanded honour himselfe expected grace fauour euery one immediatly aboue rest two baschaes accompanied saladine house greatnesse pompe glory suddenly throwne signior thorello made halfe forget matter lomberdie much rather doubt letter safely come hand vncle tell campe army christian day saladine made surprizall prouinciall gentleman dead buried signior thorello de dignes man honourable great esteeme respect signior thorello distria knowne throughout army nobility valour whosoeuer heard signior thorello dead beleeued thorello distria dignes thorello distriaes vnknowne surprizall thraldome made also passe assured truth beside many italian returning home carrying report credible audaciously presumptuous auouched vpon oathes onely saw dead present buriall likewise rumour comming eare wife likewise kinred procured great grieuous mourning among happened heare thereof guertedious time would require relate large publique griefe sorrow continuall lamentation wife within moneths became tormented new marriage solicitings halfe sighed first greatest person lomberdie making motion daily followed furthered owne brother friend still drowned teares returned denyall till end contradiction could preuaile satisfie parent importunate pursuer constrained reueale charge imposed husband shee vowed infallibly keepe till time would wise consent wooing second wedding adalietta proceeded manner pauia chanced day signior thorello espied man alexandria saw geneway ambassadours set thence towards geneway gallies causing sent demaunded successe voyage gallies arriued geneway whereto returned answere lord gallies made fatall voyage already well knowne creete dwelling drew neere sicilie suddenly arose dangerous northwestwinde droue v quickesands barbarie man escaped life onely selfe excepted wracke two brother perished signior thorello giuing credit man word true indeed remembring also time limitted wife drew neere expiring within dayes newes possibly sent thither life wife would questionlesse marryed againe fell deepe conceited melancholly food sleepe forsooke whereupon kept bed setting downe peremptory resolution death saladine dearely loued heard thereof came haste see hauing many earnest perswasions entreaty vnderstood cause melancholly sickenesse seuerely reproued could sooner acquaint therewith many kind comfortable speech gaue constant assurance minded would order businesse pauia time appointed wife reuealed also manner thorello verily beleeued soldanes promise often heard possibility performance others effected much diuers time elsewhere whereupon began comfort himselfe soliciting soldan earnestly might accomplished saladine sent one sorcerer whose skill formerly made experience take direct course signior thorello carryed one night pauia bed magitian vndertooke doe gentleman ease must first possessed entraunced dead sleep saladine thus assured deed full effecting came againe thorello finding setled pauia possibly might accomplished determined time else expectation death said vnto followeth signior thorello true affection loue wife misdoubt marriage man protest vnto supreme power deserue reprehension manner whatsoeuer ladyes euer haue seene onely woman whose carriage vertues ciuile speaking setting aside beauty fading flowre deserueth graciously respected much affected highest degree meane fauour god seeing fortune directed course happily hither short long time haue liue might reigne equally together lingdomes vnder subiection grace may granted yet seeing stand mainly vpon perill life pauia againe limitted time chiefest comfort therewith acquainted intended haue conueighed thither yea euen owne house honourable order vertues doe iustly merit regard cannot conueniently performed haue already informed necessity case vrgently commandeth accept may best accomplished great saladine answered thorella effect without word haue already sufficiently warranted gracious disposition towards farre beyond requitall remayning word onely enough comfort case either dying liuing regard haue taken order departure hence desire haue done possible expedition morrow last day absent saladine protested done euening great hall pallace commanded rich costly bedde set vp mattras formed alexandrian manner veluet cloth gold quilt counterpoint couerings sumptuously imbroydered orient pearles precious stone supposed inestimable value two rarely wroug pillowes best beseemed stately bedde curtaines vallans euery way equall pompe done commanded thorello indifferently recouered attyred one owne sumptuous saracine roabes fairest richest euer seene head maiesticall turbant manner owne wearing houre appearing somewhat late many best baschaes went chamber thorello sitting downe teares thus spake signior thorello houre sundering neere cannot beare company regard businesse goe meanes admit take leaue chamber therefore purposely come doe bid farewell let entreat loue friendship confirmed betweene v mindfull take order affaire fully finished lombardie may enioy sight mutuall solace satisfaction mindes diuided vrgent hast till may granted let want visitation kind letter commanding thereby whatsoeuer possibly done assuring selfe man liuing command doe signior thorello could forbeare weeping much hindred therby answered word could possibly forget gracious fauours extraordinary benefit vsed towards would accomplish whatsoeuer hee commaunded according heauen enable hereupon saladine embracing kissing forehead said god goe guard perill departing chamber weeping baschaes hauing likewise taken leaue thorello followed saladine hall whereas bedde stood readily prepared waxed late magitian also attending dispatch phisitian went potion thorello perswading way friendship onely strengthen great weaknes drank thereby immediately entraunced presently sleeping saladines command laid sumptuous costly bed whereon stood imperiall crowne infinite value appearing description engrauen saladine sent madame adalietta wife thorello finger also hee put ring wherein enchased admirable carbuncle seemed like flaming torche value thereof bee estimated likewise hee laid rich sword girdle hanger furniture seldome seene like hee laid iewell pillow sumptuouslie embelished pearles precious stone might haue beseemed greatest monarch world weare last either side hee set two great basons pure gold full double ducates many cord orient pearles ring girdle costly iewells ouertedious bee recounted kissing hee lay bedde commanded magitian dispatch gone instantly bedde thorello presence saladine inuisibly carried thence sate conferring baschaes bed signior thorello rich iewells transported set church san pietro ciel ore pauia according request soundly sleeping placed directly high altar afterward bell rung mattines sexton entring church light hand hee beheld light greater splendor suddenly espied sumptuous bedde standing smitten admiration hee ranne away also fearefully abbot monkes mette thus running cloyster became amazed demanded reason ranne haste sexton told quoth abbot thou art childe newcome hither easilie affrighted holy church spirit haue power walke god saint peter wee hope stronger v wherefore turne backe v let v see cause thy feare hauing lighted many torch abbot monkes entred sexton church beheld wonderfull riche bedde knight lying fast asleepe stood amazement daring approach neere bedde whereon lay costly iewells chanced signior thorello awaked breathed forth vehement sigh monkes abbot seeing stirre ranne away feare cry aloud god peter defend v time thorello opened eye looking round perceiued hee place saladines promise whereof hee little ioyfull wherefore sitting vp bedde particularly obseruing thing albeit knew sufficiently magnificence saladine yet appeared far greater imagined largely thereof hee could doe yet without ceremony seeing flight monkes hearing cry perceiuing reason called abbot name desiring afraid nephew thorello abbot heard hee ten time worse affrighted publique fame hee beene many moneths dead buried receiuing true argument better assurance hearing still call name blessing himselfe signe crosse hee went somewhat neerer bed thorello said louing vncle religious holy father wherof afraid louing nephew newly returned beyond sea abbot seeing beard grown long habit arabian fashion yet collect resemblance former countenance better perswaded tooke hand saying sonne thou art happily returned yet man citie doth verily beleeue thee bee dead therefore doe much wonder feare moreouer dare assure thee thy wife adalietta conquered controuling command threatnings kinred much owne minde morning married new husband marriage feast solemnly prepared honour second nuptialls thorello arising bedde gaue gracious salutation abbot monkes intreating earnestly word might spoken returne vntill compleated important businesse afterward hauing safely secured bedde rich iewells fully acquainted abbot passed fortune whereof immeasurably ioyfully hauing satisfied concerning new elected husband thorello said vnto abbot vnckle rumour returne would gladly see wiues behauior new briding feast although men religion seldome seene iouiall meeting yet sake doe order matter arabian strange may guest vnder prorection wherto abbot gladly condescended morning sent bridegroom aduertised stranger newly arriued intented dine gentleman accepted thankefull manner dinner time came thorello strange disguise went abbot bridegroomes house lookt admiration guest knowne suspected one abbot reported sarracine sent soldane ambassage king france thorello seated bytable directly opposite new bride hee much delighted looke easily collected sad countenance shee scarcely well pleased new nuptialls likewise beheld often regard knowlege took bushiness beard strangeness habit firm beleefe death maine preuentio time thorello thought conuenient approue farre falne remembrance took ring gaue departure calling young page waited none bride said italian faire youth goe bride saluting tell custome obserued country stranger heere sitteth new married bride shee signe hee welcome feast sendeth cup wherein drinketh selfe full best wine stranger hath drunke much pleaseth bride pledgeth rest page deliuered message bride woman honourable disposition reputing noble gentleman testifie presence acceptable shee commanded faire cuppe gold stood directlie bee neately washed filled excellent wine caused bee carried stranger done thorello hauing drunke heartie draught bride conueyed ring cuppe person could perceiue hauing left small store wine couered cuppe sent againe bride receiued graciously honour stranger country custome dranke vp rest wine espying ring shee tooke forth vndescried knowing ring shee gaue signior thorello parting fixed eye often often thought stranger cheerfull bloud mounting vp cheek returning againe remembrance heart howsoeuer thus disguised husband like one bacchus froes vp furiously started throwing downe table cried aloud lord husband truely lord thorello running table sate without regard rich thereon threw likewise clasping armes necke hung mainly weeping sobbing kissing could taken company shewed moderation excesse passion till thorello spake entreated patient extremity ouerdangerous thus solemnitie much troubled euery one glad ioyfull recouery famous worthy knight intreated vouchsafe silence related fortune time departure instant houre concluding withall hee way offended new bridegroome vpon constant report death deserued blame making election wife bridegroome albeit countenance somewhat cloudie see hope thus disappointed yet granted freely adalietto thorellos wife equitie hee could iustly lay claime also resigned crown ring lately receiued new spouse put finger found cup crowne set vpon head honor sent great saladine triumphant manner left new bridegroom abiding repayred home thorellos house pompe magnificence neuer like seene pauia citizen esteeming miracle happily recouered signior thorello againe part iewells gaue beene cost marriage feasting vncle abbot beside bountie bestowed monkes sent messenger saladine letter whole successe confessing himselfe euer obliged seruant liuing many yeeres wife adalietta vsing greater curtesies stranger euer done manner ended trouble signior thorello affliction dearely affected lady due recompence honest ready courtesy many striue outward shew doe like although sufficiently able doe performe basely rather redoundeth shame honour therefore merit ensue thereon onely disgrace iustly follow let lay blame vpon themselues marquesse saluzzo named gualtiero constrained importunate solliciting lord inferiour people ioyne himselfe marriage tooke woman according owne liking called grizelda daughter poore countriman named ianiculo two child pretended secretly murdered afterward grown yeres stature making shew taking marriage another wife worthy high degree calling made seeming publique liking owne daughter expulsing wife grizelda poorely finding incomparable patience dearely hee receiued fauour againe brought home owne pallace child hee caused respectiuely honoured despight aduerse enemy tenth nouell set downe example warning wealthie men haue care marrying themselues likewise poore meane woman patient fortune obedient husband qvestionlesse king nouell much exceed rest length proued pleasing whole assembly past generall approbation till dioneus merry iesting humour said plaine honest simple man stood holding candle see setting mule tayle deserued two pennyworth praise applauding signior thorello knowing himselfe bee left last speaker thus began milde modest lady ought perceiue contrary day dedicated none king soldanes great potentate fauour inferiour meaner person therefore would loth disranke selfe rest purpose speake lord marquesse matter great magnificence rather humble nature sorted honest end yet aduise immitate perhaps cannot well digest nouell concerneth thus begin great since among lord marquess saluzzo greatest worthiest man al young noble lord named gualtiero hauing neyther wife childe spent time nothing else hawking hunting minde marriage enioy benefit child wherein many repute wiser distastfull subiects often earnestly solicited match himselfe wife end hee might decease without heire left destitute succeeding lord offering themselues prouide one well descended father mother confirm hope also yeeld high contentment whereto lord marquess thus answered worthie friend would constraine thing wherewith neuer intent meddle considering difficult case meet woman agree man condition great number daily happen contrarie worst rest wretched miserable prooues life man bound liue wife fit saying learn vnderstand custome quality child behauiour father mother prouide mee wife meere argument folly neither shall comprehend either secret inclination parent meane father much lesse complexion mother admitte within compasse power know yet frequent sight obserued euery day daughter doe resemble neither father mother naturally gouerned owne instinct desirous haue fettered chain wedlocke contented grant request would haue complaint made selfe matter happen answerable expectation make mine owne eye elector see others sight giuing assurance shall make choice honoured respected lady mistresse ensue detriment much haue displeased take wife request mine owne noble men answered well satisfied prouided tooke wife indifferent space time beauty manner wellseeming vertues poore countriemans daughter dwelling farre distant village appeared pleasing lord marquesse gaue full perswasion hee lead comfortable life therefore without search inquisition absolutely resolued marry hauing conferred father agreed daughter wife whereupon marquesse made generall conuocation conuocation lord baron especiall friend part dominion assembled together hee spake vnto manner followeth honourable friend appeared pleasing yet thinke minde dispose selfe take wife thereto condescended yeeld contentment particular desire selfe let mee remember solemne made promise full consent honor obey whosoeuer soueraigne lady mistresse shall elect make wife time come exacting performance promise look must constantly keepe haue made choyce yong virgine answerable mine owne heart liking dwelling farre hence intend make wife within day haue brought home pallace let care diligence extend farre see feast may sumptuous entertainment bee honourable end may receiue much contentment promise performed shall perceiue doe choice lord rest wondrously ioyfull heare well inclined expressing lesse shout iocund suffrage protesting cordially welcommed pompe maiestie honoured liege ladie soueraigne afterward made preparation princely magnificent feast marquesse like marriage extraordinary state qualitie inuiting kinred friend acquaintance part prouinces hee made also readie riche costly garment shaped body comely young gentlewoman knew equall proportion stature hee hade made election appointed nuptiall day come lord marque nine clocke morning mounted horsebacke rest came attend honourably hauing thing due readinesse said lord time v goe fetch bride hee rode traine poore village whereas shee dwelt hee come father house hee saw maiden returning hastily well shee beene fetch paile water shee set downe stood accompanied maiden see passage lord marquesse traine gualtiero called name grizelda asked father bashfully answered humble courtesie saying gracious lord hee house marquesse dismounted horse commanding euery one attend alone hee entred poore cottage found maides father named ianiculo said vnto god speed good father come espouse thy daughter grizelda first haue demand make vtter thy presence hee turned maide saide faire grizelda make wife doe best endeauour please thing shall doe say also gentle humble patient diuers like question whereto still answered would neere heauen grace enable presently tooke hand led forth poore homely house presence company owne hand took meane wearing garment smocke cloathed robe state purposely brought thither plaiting haire ouer shoulder hee placed crowne gold head whereat euery one standing amazed wondring little hee said grizelda wilt thou haue thy husband modestly blushing kneeling ground answered yes gracious lord accept poore maiden wife yes grizelda quoth hee holy kisse confirme thee wife espoused mounting milkewhite palfray brought thither shee thus honourably conducted pallace concerning marriage feast triumphes performed lesse pompe beene daughter king france young bride apparantly declared garment minde behauior quite changed indeed shee shame speake otherwise rare creature person perfection onely shee absolute beautie sweetely amiable gracious goodlie daughter poore ianiculo countrie shepheardesse rather noble lord whereat euery one wondred formerly knowne beside shee obedient husband feruent dutifull office patient without least prouoking hee held himselfe much contented onely happy man world like manner towards subiects lord husband shewed selfe alwayes benigne gracious one lookt better loued honouring voluntarily praying heauens health dignity wellfa long continuance speaking quite contrary former opinion marquesse honourably worthily shewne selfe singular wise man election wife else world would haue done iudgement might fall farre short discerning great precious vertues veiled vnder homely habite obscured poore countrey cottage briefe short time onely marquisate selfe neighbouring prouinces round common talke rare course life deuotion charity good action else quite quailing sinister instruction husband receiued marriage foure fiue yeeres birth daughter shee conceiued child againe limitted houre deliuerance goodly sonne little liking marquesse afterward strange humour entred braine namely long continued experience course intollerable quality would needes make proofe faire wiues patience first began prouoke iniurious speech shewing fierce frowning lookes intimating people grew displeased regard wiues base birth education much rather likely bring child blood better beggers murmured daughter already borne word grizelda heard without alteration countenance least distemperature appearing action said honourable gracious lord dispose thinke best owne dignity contentment shall therewith well pleased knowes selfe farre inferiour meanest people much lesse worthy honour whereto liked aduance answere welcome marquesse apparantly perceiuing hereby dignity whereto hee exalted particular fauours beside could infect pride coynesse disdaine long hauing told plaine open speech subiects could endure late borne daughter called trusty seruant hauing instructed doe sent grizelda alone looking sadde much perplexed mind saide madame except intend loose mine owne life must accomplish lord hath strictly enioyned take yong daughter must breaking abruptly lady hearing word noting frowning lookes remembring also marquesse himselfe formerly said presently imagined commanded seruant kill childe suddenly therefore tooke cradle hauing sweetly kissed bestowne blessing albeit heart throbbed inward affection mother without alteration countenance tenderly laid seruants armes said friend take doe thy lord mine hath commanded thee leaue rude place bird sauage beast may deuoure except haue seruant departing child reporting marquesse lady said wondered incomparable constancy sent seruant bologna honourable lady kinsewoman requesting without reuealing whose child see nobly carefully educated time conuenient afterward child againe deliuered princely sonne nothing could ioyfull marquesse yet sufficient farre ruder language lookes expressing harsh intention said vnto grizelda though thou pleasest wonderfully birth princely boy yet subiects therewith contented blunder abroad maliciously grandchild ianiculo poore countrey pezant dead gone must soueraigne lord master make stand feare expulsion preuent must rid childe well send thee away hence may take another wife pleasing grizelda patient sufferent soule hearing said returned answere gracious honourable lord satisfie please owne royall minde neuer vse respect nothing precious pleasing mee may agree good liking within noble marquesse like manner daughter sent seruant sonne seeming sent haue slaine conueighed nursed bologna company sweete sister whereat lady shewed discontentment kinde formerly done daughter meane maruell marquesse protested soule like woman world beside heedfull obseruation louing carefull child prizing dearely owne life rash opinion might haue perswaded carnall affection caring many shee might thus easily rid knew truely vertuous mother wisely liable endure seuerest imposition subiects beleeuing caused child bee slaine blamed greatly thought cruell man highly compassionate lady case shee came company gentlewoman mourned deceassed child would answere nothing else could pleasing father begot within certaine yeares birth child marquesse purposed himselfe make last finall proofe faire grizeldaes patience said neere could longer endure keepe grizelda hi wife confessing done foolishly according young giddie braine rash marriage wherfore would send pope purchase dispensation repudiate grizelda take another wife wherein although greatly reproued yet told plainely must needes lady hearing newes thinking must returne againe poore father house perhaps old occupation keeping sheepe yonger dayes done vnderstanding withall another woman must enioy shee dearely loued honoured may well thinke worthy lady patience put maine proofe indeede neuerthelesse inuincible true vertuous courage outstood iniuries fortune constantly settle soule beare vndaunted countenance behauiour time prefixed purpose counterfeit letter came marquesse sent rome caused publikely read hearing subiects pope dispensed leaue grizelda marry another wife wherefore sending immediatly presence thus spake woman concession sent pope hath dispensed make choyce another wife free selfe thee predecessor haue beene nobleman great lord country thou daughter poore countrey clowne blood mine notoriously imbased marriage thee intend haue thee longer wife returne thee home thy father house rich dowry thou broughtest wil take another wife already contracted better beseeming birth farre contenting pleasing people lady hearing word without much paine difficulty restrayned teares quite contrary naturall inclination woman thus answered great marquesse neuer empty discretion alwayes acknowledge base humble condition could manner sute high blood nobility euer acknowledged proceed heauen merit mine onely fauour lent pleased recall backe againe ought pleased bee restored ring wherewith espoused humility deliuer command carry home marriage dowry brought need treasurer repay neither new purse carry much lesse sumpter laden noble lord neuer memory tooke starke naked shall seeme sightly body hath borne two child gotten must againe seene naked willingly must depart hence naked humbly beg excellency recompence virginity brought blamelesse much thought may haue one wedding smock onely conceale shame nakednesse depart rich enough marquesse whose heart wept bloody teares eye would likewise gladly haue yeelded naturall tribute couered dissembled angry countenance starting vp said goe giue smocke onely send gadding present entreated let haue petticote might said wife thirteene yeares sent away poorely smocke perswasions preuailed naked smocke without hose shooes bareheaded much cloth necke great griefe mourning saw went home old father house good man neuer beleeuing marquesse would long keepe daughter wife rather expected daily happened safely laid vp garment whereof marquesse despoyled morning espoused wherefore deliuered fell father houshold businesse according formerly done sustayning great vnconquerable spirit cruell assault enemy fortune time suted owne disposition marquesse made publiquely knowne subsects meant ioyne marriage daughter one count panago causing preparation made sumptuous wedding sent grizelda come thus spake wife haue made new election arriue within dayes first comming would haue honourably entertained thou knowest haue woman house decke vp chamber set requisite thing due order befitting solemne feast therefore sent thee knowing better partes prouision good house set euery thing order thou shalt thinke necessary inuite lady gentlewoman thou wilt giue welcome euen thou wert lady house marriage ended returne home thy father againe although word pierced like wounding dagger heart poore noble patient grizelda vnable forget vnequald loue bare marquesse though dignitie former fortune easily slipt remembrance yet neuerthelesse thus answered gracious lord glad doe seruice wherein shall find mee willing ready poore garment came father house although shee turned smocke began sweep make cleane chamber rubbe stooles bench hall ordered thing kitchin worst maide al house neuer ceasing giuing ouer till thing due decent order best beseemed case done marquesse hauing inuited lady countrey present great feast marriage day came grizelda gowne countrey gray gaue welcome honourable manner graced cheerefull countenance gualtiero marquesse caused two child nobly nourished bologna neere kinswoman married one count panago daughter aged twelue yeares old somewhat also son sixe seuen sent gentleman expresly kindred haue come visite saluzza bringing daughter sonne attended honourable manner publishing euery came along young virgin knowne none himselfe wife marquesse onely cause comming gentleman slacke execution trust reposed hauing made conuenient preparation kindred sonne daughter worthy company attending arriued saluzza dinner time wanted resort neighbouring part round see comming lord marquess new spouse lord lady ioyfully entertained comming great hall table readily couered grizelda homely country habite humbled selfe saying gracious welcome new elected spouse lord marquesse lady present earnestly importuned gualtiero vaine grizelda might either shut vp chamber else lend wearing garment formerly owne poorely seene among stranger seated table waited seruiceably yong virgin obserued euery one spared say marquesse made excellent change aboue grizelda commend brother likewise young yet knowing sister marquesse sufficiently satisfied soule seene much desired concerning patience wife many hart grieuing trial neuer noated much alter countenance absolutely perswaded proceeded want vnderstanding knew singularly wise thought high time free afflicting oppression giue assurance ought haue wherefore commanding presence openly assembled friend smiling said thinkst thou grizelda new chosen spouse lord quoth like exceeding well wise faire verely thinke make doubt shall liue onely happy man world humbly entreat honor haue power preuaile would giue cutting vnkind language wife cannot thinke armed patience indeed support wel regard much yonger also delicate breeding education whereas brought vp continual toile trauaile marquesse perceyued grizelda beleeued verily yong daughter wife answered honest modest manner commanded sit downe saide grizelda fitte time thou shouldst taste fruite thy long admired patience haue thought cruell harsh vnciuill natured length obserue haue done nothing basely vnaduisedly worke premeditated enstructing thee married wife let know whosoeuer take keepe wife hath begotten perpetuall ioy happinesse long haue day liue thee matter whereof stoode greatly feare marriage thought would neuer happen vnknown thee many kind first proofe gaue thee harsh vnpleasing speech drawing discontentment thee either lookes word behauiour rather comfort soule desired succeedings afterward one minute purpose giue thee consolation bereft thee many tempestuous stormes make sweet restauration thy former sower sufferinges faire dearly affected grizelda shee thou supposest new elected spouse glad cheerfull hart imbrace thine owne daughter also brother beeing thy child mine common opinion vulgar multitude imagined command long since slaine thy honourable lord husband doth loue thee farre aboue woman else world giuing thee iustly deserued praise commendation man liuing hath like wife haue sweetly kissing infinitely hugging ioyfully armes teares streaming like newletloose riuers downe faire face disaster could force hee brought seated daughter little amazed rare alteration shee hauing zeale affection kissed embraced else present clearely resolued former doubt long deluded lady arose iocondly table attending grizelda chamber signe successefull augury follow tooke poor contemptible rag put costly robe lady marchionesse vsed weare afterward waited hall againe true soueraigne lady mistresse lesse poorest garment reioycing new restored mother happy recouery noble son daughter festiuall continued many month euery one thought marquesse noble wise prince though somewhat sharpe vnsufferable seuere experience made wife aboue al reputed grizelda wise patient vertuous lady count panago within day returned backe bologna lord marque fetching home old ianiculo country drudgery liue father law princely palace gaue honorable maintenance wherein hee long continued ended day afterward matched daughter noble marriage grizelda liuing long time together highest honor possibly could saide contrary poore country cottage may yeeld diuine excellent spirit stately royall mansion breed bring vppe worthy hogrubbers hold soueraignty ouer men beside grizelda without wet eye imboldned valiant inuincible courage suffer sharpe rigor neuer like heard proofes made marquesse perhaps might haue met another would haue quitted contrary kinde thrusting forth doores smocke could haue found better succor somewhere else rather walke nakedly cold street dioneus hauing thus ended nouel lady deliuering seuerall iudgements according owne fancy holding one conceite others leaning contrary one blaming thing another commending king lifting eye heauen seeing sun begin fallow rising euening starre without arising seat spake followeth discreet lady perswaded know sufficiently sense vnderstanding v mortal consisteth onely think preseruing memory thing past knowledge present one kuow foresee future occasion worthily thought wise common capacity morrow fifteene dayes since departed city florence come hither pastime comfort conseruation liues support health auoyding melanchollies griefes anguish beheld daylie city since pestilentiall visitation beganne wherein iudgement haue done well honestly albeit light nouels perhaps attractiue little wantonnes say iouiall feasting good cheare singing dancing may seeme matter inciting inciuility especially weake shallow vnderstandings haue neither seene heard knowne acte word whatsoeuer else either part iustly deseruing blamed bin honest sweete hermonious concord might well beseeme communitie brother sister assuredly well regard v hath much contented therefore least ouerlong consuetude something take life might conuerted bad construction country demourance many dayes captious conceit may wrest ill imagination minde like seeing v hath honor remaineth still fitting v returne thither whence came much rather sociable meeting already hath wonne knowledge many dweller v grow increase might make purposed pastime offensiue v respect allow aduise wil keepe crowne till departing hence intend shalbe morrow determine otherwise man ready make resignation many imagination passed amongst lady likewise men yet end reputed king counsell bee best wisest concluding thought conuenient whervpon hee called master housholde conferred businesse belonging next morning gaue company leaue rise lady rest risen fel one kinde recreation others fancy serued euen done supper time came dispatcht louing manner began play instrument sing dance madame lauretta leading dance king commaunded madame fiammetta sing song pleasantly began manner song chorus sung rest company loue free iealousie lady liuing lesse heartgreeuing liud happily gallant youth faire friend woman could content vertues prize valour hardiment wit carriage purest eloquence could free woman impatience vaunt wise one faire flower power yet boast trueth loue free iealousie c behold woman wise killes quite fearing false sirquedrie fire begin flame others desire misguide aim bereaues secure delight onely fond mistrust vniust thus comfort hourely hot cold loue free c friend found like faith manly minde know mistrust slaine fresh griefes still grow sight allure thinke none true none sure would rob golden gaine loe thus dye iealousie losse depend loue free c let aduise lady loue brauely bold wrong scorne controld one chance finde winkes word smile crafty kinde seeking onely mine protest best make know scarsly wise loue free iealousie know lady liuing could haue lesse heartgreeuing liue happily soone madam fiammetta ended song dioneus sate smiling said truly madam may v great courtesie expresse selfe plainly v least thorow ignorance possession may imposed selfe remaine offended song past diuers sung beside drawing welneere midnight king command went bed new day appeared world awaked sleepe maste houshold hauing sent away carriage returned vnder conduct discreet king florence three gentleman left seven lady church santa maria nouella whence went first hauing parted kinde salutation gentleman went whether themselues best pleased lady repaired home house end tenth last day
